verses.text: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
verses.source_translation: Itihleh sibungas Gah deꞌ paguh tentang Yesus Kristus, Onak Topaꞌ.

verses.text: As it is written in the prophets, “Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you:
verses.source_translation: Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh mulai kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nulis nabi Yesaya daang buk-e noꞌuh-e, “In Topaꞌ, ‘Ningaꞌ mey! Okuꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait Kuꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ Muꞌu, saꞌ-e sidia olan saꞌan Muꞌu.’

verses.text: the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!’”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ luꞌow-luꞌow-e sina deꞌ padang pasil, in-e, ‘Sidia olan saꞌan Topaꞌ, nongon olan saꞌan-E.’ ”

verses.text: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis inoh, wat noh leh Yohanes Pembaptis nog deꞌ padang pasil tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat nyeꞌ moꞌ baptis saꞌ Topaꞌ ngapun dosa muꞌ!” In Yohanes.

verses.text: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌ propinsi Yudea duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Yerusalem odi ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Yohanes, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngakuꞌ suaꞌ dosa-e.  Yohanes moꞌ baptis odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ sungi Yordan.

verses.text: John was clothed with camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes pakai jubah bulun unta duoh soot kupuang kulit, yohmoꞌ pinguman-e kadis duoh piꞌin bonyih.

verses.text: He preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ magah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ gah deꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih ayuh-E soꞌ okuꞌ, yaꞌ nog mokuaꞌ okuꞌ.  Nyuduk bukaꞌ tolin kasut-E tuang doiꞌ geh nyam kuꞌ patut.

verses.text: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ baptis ingan pakai piꞌin, pak-e Iyoh yaꞌ baptis ingan pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: In those days, Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Yesus nog soꞌ kota Nazaret deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ propinsi Galilea, Yohanes moꞌ baptis Iyoh daang Sungi Yordan.

verses.text: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ maꞌad soꞌ piꞌin keꞌ doyoh, Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ longit tibukaꞌ, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ muun map deꞌ tun Yesus mun manuk asang mun-e.

verses.text: A voice came out of the sky, “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ sina soꞌ longit deꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu leh Onak deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Kuꞌ, deꞌ odaꞌ kila Kuꞌ munuas.”

verses.text: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.
verses.source_translation: Takal moꞌ mokuaꞌ baptis, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus deꞌ padang pasil.

verses.text: He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ pat puluꞌ onu, Laja Muat munua moꞌ suba-E.  Topat Yoh loꞌo inoh bogoꞌ binatang deꞌ ogiꞌ bisa-e duoh deꞌ gaus loꞌo danoꞌ, malaikat-malaikat moꞌ nog tulung-E.

verses.text: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of God’s Kingdom,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yohanes Pembaptis moꞌ obuah takap, Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ propinsi Galilea magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and God’s Kingdom is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ nog takal Topaꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ mulai militah jadin Laja.  Togan leh olan deꞌ jaꞌat nyeꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Gah deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ!”

verses.text: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ponu nunaꞌ bingon donu Galilea, Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Simon duoh madih-e Andreas ngijaling ikian, dop-e inoh leh kiloja odop-e deꞌ duwoh.

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ! Deꞌ dioꞌ ingan kiloja kalik ikian, pak-e adin Okuꞌ ngajal odaꞌ ingan kalik manusia saꞌ-a nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.
verses.source_translation: Simon duoh Andreas lasuꞌ togan jaling-e yohmoꞌ odi nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ lanyut pimonu-e, Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yakobus duoh Yohanes.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh onak Zebedeus.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh kiloja nopung jaling-e daang olud.

verses.text: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mogan odop-e deꞌ duwoh, odop-e deꞌ duwoh lasuꞌ togan samaꞌ-a duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja saꞌan-e daang olud, yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog kota Kapernaum.  Takal-e moꞌ nog onu simayang ulang Yahudi deꞌ nang nyaꞌa onu Sabat, Yesus molot kaang topat simayang agama Yahudi yohmoꞌ mulai ngajal.

verses.text: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan ningaꞌ wat Iyoh ngajal, dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-E tok diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai yaꞌ nyakal-e, idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ pingajal gulu-gulu agama Yahudi.

verses.text: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua, molot kaang boli simayang agama ulang Yahudi, yohmoꞌ nang bogan-e,

verses.text: saying, “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”
verses.source_translation: “Oi Yesus ulang Nazaret, oni nai Ingan kaso koꞌih? Podo Ingan yaꞌ katuab koꞌih? Puꞌan kuꞌ osi Ingan, Ingan leh deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ pait Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nang muat munua inoh, “Maꞌ bidaluag! Buu luah soꞌ nyaꞌa itih!”

verses.text: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.
verses.source_translation: Muat munua inoh moꞌ ulih-ulih guyang gusuak gonan nyaꞌa inoh, muat munua nang bogan-e daang-e buu luah.

verses.text: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ obuaꞌ ilan-e, yohmoꞌ bisikian duoh dingan-e deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, in-e, “Oni deꞌ wat itih? Nyaꞌa itih ngajal pakai punuaꞌ kuasa.  Iyoh sina tuduꞌ muat munua odaꞌ buu luah, muat munua moꞌ lasuꞌ luah!”

verses.text: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.
verses.source_translation: Gah inoh moꞌ popah katiꞌ-kanih keꞌ suaꞌ propinsi Galilea.

verses.text: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu soꞌ topat simayang agama Yahudi inoh, yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ boli Simon duoh Andreas.  Yakobus duoh Yohanes suwaꞌ odi duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e molot kaang boli, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang tua Simon deꞌ dayung monam modud, yoh guling deꞌ topat boꞌos-e.

verses.text: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she served them.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ odi sinok tua Simon inoh yohmoꞌ kagong tongan-e tulung odaꞌ mokat, onam-e moꞌ lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ mokat, yohmoꞌ nguliaꞌ pinguman saꞌan ayua odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ toban ulang-ulang deꞌ monam duoh deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua nog tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: All the city was gathered together at the door.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nog tikuluk deꞌ bolot tiban-e.

verses.text: He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn’t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ bipasia-pasia onam tiboꞌi-e mokuaꞌ duoh kasig muat munua soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa, pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e odaꞌ muat munua sina, dop-e muat munua puꞌan osi Yesus inoh.

verses.text: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place, and prayed there.
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e takal onu aluaꞌ bosow, Yesus moꞌ mokat boꞌos yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ sopaꞌ kota deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa daꞌ-e.  Danoꞌ Yesus bidoa.

verses.text: Simon and those who were with him followed after him;
verses.source_translation: Simon duoh ayua dingan-e moꞌ odi kalik Yesus.

verses.text: and they found him, and told him, “Everyone is looking for you.”
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tapod Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa bolipotak kalik Ingan.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Let’s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi keꞌ topat deꞌ bokon deꞌ sinok-sinok soꞌ katiꞌ, saꞌ Okuꞌ tanon geh Gah deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ danoꞌ.  Dop-e inoh leh ngan Okuꞌ nog.”

verses.text: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.
verses.source_translation: Yesus ponu kodak suaꞌ propinsi Galilea, Yoh ngajal nyaꞌa Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ topat-topat simayang agama Yahudi duoh kasig muat munua soꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, “If you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ bijakit nog tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh mitiaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Simoꞌ Ingan laꞌan, Ingan tapod odaꞌ okuꞌ mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, “I want to. Be made clean.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ tok-tok masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e.  Iyoh moꞌ tomaꞌ gonan nyaꞌa inoh daang-e in-e, “Laꞌan Kuꞌ, mokuaꞌ leh!”

verses.text: When he had said this, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh onam kulit-e deꞌ bijakit lasuꞌ musuap yohmoꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: He strictly warned him, and immediately sent him out,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ iyoh buu duoh ulih-ulih jaman-e, in-E,

verses.text: and said to him, “See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”
verses.source_translation: “Maꞌ muꞌu tanon tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a, pak-e odi leh tuduꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi saꞌ-a pilisa muꞌu, tok mokuaꞌ ke doh keh muꞌu.  Mokuaꞌ inoh nyeꞌ simoliah binatang saꞌan Topaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon Musa, deꞌ jadin bukti tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ dop-e muꞌu moꞌ bonal-bonal mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places: and they came to him from everywhere.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam inoh odi katiꞌ kanih diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ silita tanon wat Yesus odaꞌ iyoh mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam kulit-e.  Yesus moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai molot bitanga odop-e daang kota.  Iyoh moꞌ jok-e loꞌo deꞌ sopaꞌ kota deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa loꞌo daꞌ-a, pak-e nyaꞌa diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ nog soꞌ niꞌ-soꞌ niꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

chapters.text: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. As it is written in the prophets, “Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you: the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!’” John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins. All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins. John was clothed with camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey. He preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen. I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.” In those days, Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan. Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove. A voice came out of the sky, “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.” Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness. He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him. Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of God’s Kingdom, and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and God’s Kingdom is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.” Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen. Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.” Immediately they left their nets, and followed him. Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets. Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him. They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught. They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes. Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out, saying, “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!” Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”  The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him. They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!” The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area. Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John. Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her. He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she served them. At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons. All the city was gathered together at the door. He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn’t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him. Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place, and prayed there. Simon and those who were with him followed after him; and they found him, and told him, “Everyone is looking for you.” He said to them, “Let’s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.” He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons. A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, “If you want to, you can make me clean.” Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, “I want to. Be made clean.” When he had said this, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean. He strictly warned him, and immediately sent him out, and said to him, “See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.” But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places: and they came to him from everywhere.

verses.text: When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was in the house.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus odi lagiꞌ keꞌ Kapernaum.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ ngojit gah nang Iyoh ogiꞌ deꞌ boli.

verses.text: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nog ngubun-E, mulai soꞌ bolot tiban nog aang boli punuaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa.  Yesus moꞌ tanon Gah soꞌ Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh.

verses.text: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.
verses.source_translation: Takal-E aluaꞌ sina, nog pat naꞌan nyaꞌa tawiak niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ kobos gonan-e, yoh toban tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.
verses.source_translation: Saai nyaꞌa sikiya bogoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ pat inoh diꞌ-e tapod molot bitapod duoh Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ toban maꞌad keꞌ bungan boli, yoh moꞌ nglibuang bungan totok Yesus mujuag.  Yoh moꞌ pimuun nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus baya topat guling-e.

verses.text: Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup-sukup bisayaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh, in-e, “Dosa-dosa muꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun.”

verses.text: But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama ulang Yahudi deꞌ guluꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ in-e daang otin-e,

verses.text: “Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.source_translation: “Puus manah Yoh nyamah odop-E duoh Topaꞌ! Jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ tapod ngapun dosa nyaꞌa neh.”

verses.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them, “Why do you reason these things in your hearts?
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh Yesus lasuꞌ puꞌan daang otin-E, oni deꞌ pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Oni nai ingan bipikil deꞌ in inoh daang otin ingan?

verses.text: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?’
verses.source_translation: Ki deꞌ sonang dooꞌ, tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh nang, ‘Dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun’ keh, ‘Mokat, nyeꞌ moꞌ toban topat guling muꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu’?

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic—
verses.source_translation: Pak-e saꞌ ingan puꞌan-e, daang dunia itih Onak Manusia ogiꞌ kuasa-E ngapun dosa manusia.” Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh,

verses.text: “I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.”
verses.source_translation: “Mokat nyeꞌ moꞌ toban topat guling muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ buu motas!”

verses.text: He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ mokat daang-e lasuꞌ mit topat guling-e.  Yohmoꞌ buu luah, takal inoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh.  Yoh ngan-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ilan-e, yohmoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ daang-e in-e, “Mulan toꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih!”

verses.text: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ pang donu Galilea.  Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ ngajal-e.

verses.text: As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he arose and followed him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ ponu danoꞌ, Yoh ningaꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang nagih suke deꞌ adon Lewi onak Alfeus, guluꞌ deꞌ topat nyaꞌa bayal suke saꞌan kerajaan Romawi.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ!” Lewi moꞌ mokat mujuag yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E man deꞌ boli Lewi, bogoꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ tukang nagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang nyaꞌa ulang bidosa suwaꞌ man samah-samah duoh ayua odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus .

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, “Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi ningaꞌ Yesus suwaꞌ man duoh ulang-ulang pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang ulang deꞌ bidosa inoh.  Yoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, “Oni nai gulu muꞌ suwaꞌ man duoh tukang pinagih suke duoh ulang deꞌ bidosa inoh?”

verses.text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ sehat diꞌ-e pilelu doktol, jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ monam.  Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ nog mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal, pak-e okuꞌ nog mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.”

verses.text: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ onu-e takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis duoh gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi puasa.  Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ Yesus yohmo bisikian, “Oni nai pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis duoh gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi puasa, pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Ingan diꞌ-e puasa?”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can’t fast.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e pakai nang silita, “Moꞌ nyaꞌa biluman kawin, podo tamu-tamu-e diꞌ-e man? Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ kawin aluaꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, totu nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ aluaꞌ man.

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ takal-e nyaꞌa toban nyaꞌa deꞌ kawin inoh toban buu.  Takal inoh leh diꞌ nyaꞌa tiyaꞌ man-nuak.

verses.text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nopung bojuh deꞌ oma pakai kain deꞌ baꞌuh.  Dop-e moꞌ-e kain topung deꞌ baꞌuh inoh bikinyot yoh moꞌ notak bojuh deꞌ moꞌ oma, totak-e moꞌ bitamah ayuh.

verses.text: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.”
verses.source_translation: Watnoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa ngisiꞌ piꞌin anggul deꞌ baꞌuh daang topat deꞌ moꞌ oma, dop-e piꞌin anggul deꞌ baꞌuh muab, topat-e deꞌ oma inoh moꞌ totak.  Luban-e soꞌ duwoh-e tibuang.  Totu leh piꞌin anggul deꞌ baꞌuh, nyaꞌa naꞌ daang topat deꞌ baꞌuh geh!” In Yesus.

verses.text: He was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.
verses.source_translation: Takal Onu Sabat, Yesus ponu duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E ngilusuꞌ umoh gandum.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ pilai, yohmoꞌ tuk kiluang gandum yoh moꞌ man-e.

verses.text: The Pharisees said to him, “Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”
verses.source_translation: Ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ningaꞌ, oni nai pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌon nai-e daang Onu Sabat?”

verses.text: He said to them, “Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry—he, and those who were with him?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ keh ingan basa daang Kitab? Oni deꞌ nai Daud noꞌuh-e? Takal iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e pilai doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ man-e.

verses.text: How he entered into God’s house at the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the show bread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Abyatar deꞌ jadin pimipin deꞌ paling ayuh-e, Daud molot kaang topat nyaꞌa nyomah Topaꞌ.  Yoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e moꞌ man kueh deꞌ ngin nyaꞌa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, nunaꞌ atulan agama otoꞌ jok-e pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ soꞌon man kueh inoh.”

verses.text: He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Topaꞌ nai Onu Sabat saꞌan manusia, idoh diꞌ-e manusia saꞌan onu Sabat.

verses.text: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.source_translation: Onak Manusia leh deꞌ notu oni deꞌ soꞌon duoh oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon nyaꞌa nai-e daang Onu Sabat.”

chapters.text: When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was in the house. Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them. Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him. When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.” But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts, “Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?” Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them, “Why do you reason these things in your hearts?   Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?’   But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic—  “I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.”  He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!” He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them. As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he arose and followed him. He was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him. The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, “Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?” When Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.” John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don’t fast?” Jesus said to them, “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can’t fast.   But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.   No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.   No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.” He was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain. The Pharisees said to him, “Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?” He said to them, “Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry—he, and those who were with him?   How he entered into God’s house at the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the show bread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?” He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.   Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”

verses.text: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ topat simayang agama Yahudi.  Danoꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa.

verses.text: They watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi deꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus, simoꞌ Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa inoh mokuaꞌ daang Onu Sabat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tapod yaꞌ nyalah-E.

verses.text: He said to the man who had his hand withered, “Stand up.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa inoh, “Got mokat mujuag katiꞌ, keꞌ sulung jowin koꞌih!”

verses.text: He said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?” But they were silent.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Moꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan agama otoꞌ, oni deꞌ patut otoꞌ nai daang Onu Sabat? Nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh keh, nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat? Tulung nyaꞌa odaꞌ idip keh nyeꞌ ngabos-e?” Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo jaꞌ-e.

verses.text: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.”  He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.
verses.source_translation: Yesus ningaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ daang-e tiwas, duoh kila-E susah, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ kolas otin-e.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa inoh, “Suual tongan muꞌ.” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ suual tongan-e, yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi buu soꞌ topat simayang inoh, yoh moꞌ biloneng duoh ulang Yahudi deꞌ nuaꞌ Laja Herodes ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea,
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ buu keꞌ pang Donu Galilea.  Yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌ propinsi Galilea duoh soꞌ propinsi Yudea bitunaꞌ duoh-E.

verses.text: from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ kota Yerusalem, soꞌ Idumea soꞌ polad Sungi Yordan, soꞌ kota Tirus, duoh kota Sidon.  Suaꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ nog dop-e yoh moꞌ ngojit suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus.

verses.text: He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn’t press on him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sidia olud saꞌan odop-E, dop-e nyaꞌa sikiya bogoꞌ, saꞌ Yoh diꞌ-e pisiat odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bitodod-todod duoh Yoh.

verses.text: For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ odaꞌ-E, yoh ngan suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam bitodod-todod ngan-e yaꞌ odi sinok Yesus, saꞌ-e tapod tomaꞌ-E.

verses.text: The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, “You are the Son of God!”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ molot muat munua daang gonan-e, takal-e ningaꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ nyuduk bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus daang-e nang bogan-e, “Ingan Onak Topaꞌ!”

verses.text: He sternly warned them that they should not make him known.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus isin-isin jaman muat munua inoh tanon nang Iyoh Onak Topaꞌ.

verses.text: He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus maꞌad keꞌ tun punguꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ ngijaꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ yaꞌ pilih-E, saꞌ-a odi tuduꞌ odop-E danoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ pilih simoong duwoh naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ sobot nang rasul-rasul-E.  Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ pilih ingan, sa' ingan suwaꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, saꞌ Kuꞌ pait ingan odaꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ponai kasig pibuu muat munua.”

verses.text: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter);
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ mutiꞌ leh adon-adon nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E: Simon deꞌ sobot Yesus geh nang Petrus,

verses.text: James the son of Zebedee; and John, the brother of James, (whom he called Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder);
verses.source_translation: Yakobus duoh Yohanes, odop-e deꞌ duwoh itih onak Zebedeus.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh itih, Yesus biladon nang Boanerges loti-e “Nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ Dudu.”

verses.text: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh Andreas, Filipus, Bartolomeus, Matius, Tomas, Yakobus onak Alfeus, Tadeus, Simon soꞌ uluk ulang Yahudi deꞌ bijuang odaꞌ Israel bebas soꞌ kerajaan Romawi,

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. Then he came into a house.
verses.source_translation: duoh Yudas Iskariot, nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui daꞌ-E.

verses.text: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus paliꞌ ke boli.  Pak-e nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog tikuluk lagiꞌ ngubun Iyoh, yoh ngan Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E diꞌ supot man.

verses.text: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him: for they said, “He is insane.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh itih moꞌ bakoꞌ!” Takal madih ayua-e moꞌ ngojit gah inoh, yoh moꞌ odi mit-E.

verses.text: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebul,” and, “By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.”
verses.source_translation: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ nog soꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh itih obuah nguasa odaꞌ Beelzebul! Laja suaꞌ muat munua inoh leh deꞌ ngin kuasa daꞌ-E, ngan-e kasig muat munua.”

verses.text: He summoned them, and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Wat ki Laja Muat munua ponai yaꞌ kasig Laja Muat munua?”

verses.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.source_translation: Yesus lanyut sina-E pakai nang silita, in-E, “Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ negeli deꞌ diꞌ layat-e tilukum daang-e silalu bikaꞌi si odop-e idoh diꞌ-e taan tuui.

verses.text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
verses.source_translation: Lawang boꞌon deꞌ silalu bikiing bilawan tipan odop-e idoh diꞌ-e taan tuui.

verses.text: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can’t stand, but has an end.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ Laja Muat munua bilawan si odop-e wat ki wat-e yaꞌ taan tuui? Iyoh pasti obuaꞌ mutuab.

verses.text: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder, unless he first binds the strong man; and then he will plunder his house.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ taan molot kaang boli nyaꞌa deꞌ dolas duoh mit halta-e, simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e pasung dioꞌ.  Takal-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ pasung-e ke yoh tapod mit halta-e.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, all sins of the descendants of man will be forgiven, including their blasphemies with which they may blaspheme;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ dosa deꞌ nai nyaꞌa duoh sina deꞌ jaꞌat aluaꞌ tapod obuah ngapun.

verses.text: but whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e sina deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ pijaꞌat Iyang Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ Topaꞌ tapod ngapun-e.  Dosa inoh moꞌ lokat nah-nah.”

verses.text: —because they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus tanon deꞌ in inoh, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang Yesus obuah nguasa Laja Muat munua.

verses.text: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh, sinoꞌ duoh madih Yesus nog yaꞌ bitapod duoh-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon deꞌ sopaꞌ, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mogan Yesus.

verses.text: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him, “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog guluꞌ sinok Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ sinoꞌ duoh madih Ingan kajon deꞌ sopaꞌ.  Yoh yaꞌ bitapod duoh Ingan.”

verses.text: He answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Osi sinoꞌ Kuꞌ? Osi madih Kuꞌ?”

verses.text: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ gulu' sinok odop-E, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Deꞌ mutiꞌ leh sinoꞌ duoh madih Kuꞌ!

verses.text: For whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oni' deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, deꞌ munoꞌ leh sinoꞌ duoh madih Kuꞌ.”

chapters.text: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered. They watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him. He said to the man who had his hand withered, “Stand up.” He said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?” But they were silent. When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.”  He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other. The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him. Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea, from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him. He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn’t press on him. For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him. The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, “You are the Son of God!” He sternly warned them that they should not make him known. He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him. He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach, and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter); James the son of Zebedee; and John, the brother of James, (whom he called Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder); Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot; and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. Then he came into a house. The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread. When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him: for they said, “He is insane.” The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebul,” and, “By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.” He summoned them, and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?   If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.   If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.   If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can’t stand, but has an end.   But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder, unless he first binds the strong man; and then he will plunder his house.   Most certainly I tell you, all sins of the descendants of man will be forgiven, including their blasphemies with which they may blaspheme;   but whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation.”  —because they said, “He has an unclean spirit.” His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him. A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him, “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.” He answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?” Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!   For whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.”

verses.text: Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea, and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea.
verses.source_translation: Yesus paliꞌ ngajal lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bingon Donu Galilea.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ bogoꞌ nog ngubun-E.  Iyoh odi guluꞌ kaang olud deꞌ ogiꞌ daang donu.  Pak-e nyaꞌa bogoꞌ mujuag deꞌ doyoh bingon donu.

verses.text: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ oni' deꞌ ngajal Yesus pakai nang silita, Iyoh moꞌ silita in-E,

verses.text: “Listen! Behold, the farmer went out to sow,
verses.source_translation: “Ngojit dioꞌ! Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odi dabul biniaꞌ.

verses.text: and as he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e dabul biniaꞌ-e, ogiꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ olan, yohmoꞌ nog manuk lasuꞌ man kabuaꞌ-e.

verses.text: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tun tanaꞌ deꞌ bibatuh, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ tumuꞌ dop-e tanaꞌ-e lidiaꞌ.

verses.text: When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal onu moꞌ putiak, tumuꞌ pimuluah inoh moꞌ pisok yoh moꞌ kobos layuꞌ, dop-e aat-e diꞌ-e tuluap kaang tanaꞌ.

verses.text: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ siak duh deꞌ bilojaꞌ.  Takal-e tumuꞌ, duh deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ molut-e yoh moꞌ diꞌ-e ponai mokat tumuꞌ duoh bibuaꞌ.

verses.text: Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some produced thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh.  Yoh moꞌ tumuꞌ yoh moꞌ bibuaꞌ, ogiꞌ deꞌ taluh puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ nuam puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ silatus sidoh bogoꞌ.”

verses.text: He said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ mokuaꞌ nang silita inoh, Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Osi deꞌ ogiꞌ kojit-e saꞌ-e ngojit-e!”

verses.text: When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ buu duam Yesus sadiꞌ-e, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E baya simoong duwoh naꞌan rasul-E moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, oni loti silita deꞌ nang-E inoh.

verses.text: He said to them, “To you is given the mystery of God’s Kingdom, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-E, “Tuduꞌ ingan Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tentang oni wat Iyoh militah jadin Laja.  Pak-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Okuꞌ tanon pakai nang silita.

verses.text: that ‘seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.’”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ nai wat inoh saꞌ-e jadi kodaꞌ daang Kitab, deꞌ in-e, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ telus ningaꞌ, pak-e diꞌ-e ngiloti oni-oni-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ telus ngojit, pak-e diꞌ-e ngiloti oni-oni-e.  Simoꞌ-e ngiloti-e, yoh togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat, yohmoꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.’ ”

verses.text: He said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti silita deꞌ nang Kuꞌ tiꞌ-e, silita deꞌ bokon tuang idoh geh diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e.

verses.text: The farmer sows the word.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon loti silita deꞌ nang Kuꞌ tiꞌ-e: Nyaꞌa deꞌ dabul biniaꞌ, iyoh leh deꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang magah Pingunang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes, and takes away the word which has been sown in them.
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ olan iyoh leh deꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ, pak-e Laja Muat munua lasuꞌ mit Pingunang Topaꞌ deꞌ tuang-e ngojit-e .

verses.text: These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ bibatuh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ tilimaꞌ daang otin deꞌ doon.

verses.text: They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh diꞌ-e tumuꞌ daang otin osuap-e, yoh moꞌ diꞌ-e taan tuui, takal idip-e susah jolaꞌ iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ totaꞌ lojaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ,

verses.text: and the cares of this age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
verses.source_translation: pak-e yoh bigaduh natong pingidip-e, suka yaꞌ kaya, ngilipuang suaꞌ-suaꞌ oni' daang dunia.  Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh moꞌ obuah molut, yohmoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ.

verses.text: Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times.”
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ tumuꞌ daang otin osuap-e, yoh moꞌ bibuaꞌ.  Ogiꞌ deꞌ bibuaꞌ taluh puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ deꞌ nuam puluꞌ sidoh bogoꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ silatus sidoh bogoꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket  or under a bed? Isn’t it put on a stand?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ lanyut silita-E lagi', “Doiꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tung lapu yohmoꞌ ngilokuab-e pakai bona yoh moꞌ suan deꞌ libuaꞌ topat boꞌos-e.  Pasti nyaꞌa tung lapu, yohmoꞌ kajuag deꞌ topat deꞌ bigatung, saꞌ-e odaꞌ tana' jawaꞌ.

verses.text: For there is nothing hidden, except that it should be made known; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai kilin-e adin, tiaꞌ tuang ponai geh nyaꞌa kilin-e.  Oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e adin, tiaꞌ tuang ponai geh nyaꞌa puꞌan-e.

verses.text: If any man has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ ogiꞌ kojit-e, saꞌ-e ngojit bonal-bonal.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Ngojit bonal-bonal-e, pingajal deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan! Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyeꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, wat inoh leh wat Topaꞌ duoh odop nyeꞌ, makin lobih soꞌ inoh.

verses.text: For whoever has, to him will more be given, and he who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e osi deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e, yoh yaꞌ soꞌon lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ oniꞌ, sit oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e, yaꞌ obuah mit geh.”

verses.text: He said, “God’s Kingdom is as if a man should cast seed on the earth,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngajal lagiꞌ pakai silita ngan-e tanon oni wat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dabul biniaꞌ-e deꞌ umoh-e.

verses.text: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, though he doesn’t know how.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu ngalom iyoh boꞌos, onu jawaꞌ yoh moꞌ mokat bo'os, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ biniaꞌ-e moꞌ tumuꞌ luah suk-e bitamah bigatung, pak-e diꞌ-e puꞌan oni wat tumuꞌ-e inoh bitamah ayuh.

verses.text: For the earth bears fruit: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.
verses.source_translation: Tanaꞌ umoh inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ biniaꞌ inoh tumuꞌ nog-e bibuaꞌ, sibungas-e bisuat, yoh moꞌ bisalaꞌ yoh moꞌ jadin buaꞌ-e.

verses.text: But when the fruit is ripe, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ gandum inoh moꞌ masak, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ umoh inoh moꞌ ngutuam-e, dop-e moꞌ nog onu-e yaꞌ ngutuam.”

verses.text: He said, “How will we liken God’s Kingdom? Or with what parable will we illustrate it?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Samah kodaꞌ oni otoꞌ yaꞌ baning Topaꞌ deꞌ militah jadin Laja? Silita oni ngan toꞌ tanon-e?

verses.text: It’s like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, though it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth,
verses.source_translation: Takal Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja, inoh samah kodaꞌ silita itih: Luang sabih deꞌ sukup alus kiluang-e soꞌ luang pimuluah deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia.

verses.text: yet when it is sown, grows up, and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal-e tumuꞌ, yoh moꞌ jadin koyuh deꞌ ayuh soꞌ pimuluah kuduas deꞌ bokon.  Yoh moꞌ bidaꞌan ayuh, bogoꞌ manuk deꞌ bisolin daꞌ-a.”

verses.text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh leh Yesus ngajal nyaꞌa pakai bogoꞌ silita kodaꞌ inoh, deꞌ tapod nyaꞌa ngiloti-e.

verses.text: Without a parable he didn’t speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.
verses.source_translation: Yesus silalu ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ pakai nang silita.  Pak-e takal-E jok-e duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh tanon susuaꞌ loti pingunang-E tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side.”
verses.source_translation: Takal ngumi inoh geh, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ motas keꞌ polad donu.”

verses.text: Leaving the multitude, they took him with them, even as he was, in the boat. Other small boats were also with him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ muun kaang olud, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ suwaꞌ muat duoh-E niꞌ olud.  Yoh moꞌ togan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ pakai olud deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: A big wind storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so much that the boat was already filled.
verses.source_translation: Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e tuui bilakat, sobak libut moꞌ nog.  Piꞌin gilumang moꞌ molot kaang olud-e, olud-e moꞌ tadoꞌ-e yaꞌ kuuam.

verses.text: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are dying?”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Yesus boꞌos deꞌ tun tilam deꞌ butut olud.  Yohmoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E guyang odaꞌ mokat.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Gulu! Doh diꞌ Ingan tolu nang otoꞌ yaꞌ kobos kuuam?”

verses.text: He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mokat, Yoh moꞌ nang sobak libut duoh sina tuduꞌ donu inoh in-E, “Loꞌo! Maꞌ tiyaꞌ bilayaꞌ!” Sobak duoh gilumang moꞌ lasuꞌ loꞌo.

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni nai ingan tolu? Oni nai ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ?”

verses.text: They were greatly afraid, and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup tolu-e, yoh moꞌ in-e tipan odop-e, “Osi sibonal-e Yoh itih, sape sobak libut, gilumang tuang tunuak geh tuduꞌ sina-E?”

chapters.text: Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea, and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea. He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,  “Listen! Behold, the farmer went out to sow,   and as he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.   Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.   When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.   Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.   Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some produced thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.” He said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.” When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables. He said to them, “To you is given the mystery of God’s Kingdom, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,   that ‘seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.’” He said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?   The farmer sows the word.   The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes, and takes away the word which has been sown in them.   These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.   They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.   Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,   and the cares of this age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.   Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times.” He said to them, “Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket  or under a bed? Isn’t it put on a stand?   For there is nothing hidden, except that it should be made known; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.   If any man has ears to hear, let him hear.” He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.   For whoever has, to him will more be given, and he who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.” He said, “God’s Kingdom is as if a man should cast seed on the earth,   and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, though he doesn’t know how.   For the earth bears fruit: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.   But when the fruit is ripe, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.” He said, “How will we liken God’s Kingdom? Or with what parable will we illustrate it?   It’s like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, though it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth,   yet when it is sown, grows up, and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow.” With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it. Without a parable he didn’t speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything. On that day, when evening had come, he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side.” Leaving the multitude, they took him with them, even as he was, in the boat. Other small boats were also with him. A big wind storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so much that the boat was already filled. He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are dying?” He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” The wind ceased, and there was a great calm. He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?” They were greatly afraid, and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

verses.text: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ polad Donu Galilea, topat ulang Gerasa loꞌo.

verses.text: When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus maꞌad soꞌ aang olud, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ totaꞌ kubul odi tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains,
verses.source_translation: Dali inoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa tapod yaꞌ mokos-e bial-e pakai late.

verses.text: because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the fetters broken in pieces. Nobody had the strength to tame him.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ nyaꞌa pasung tongan poꞌon-e, pak-e late ngan nyaꞌa pasung-e obuaꞌ motod-e, bosi deꞌ poꞌon-e tuang mugat-e geh.  Dali inoh sikiya dolas doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ taan yaꞌ pasung-e.

verses.text: Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh singonu singalom motak moliꞌ deꞌ totaꞌ kubul, deꞌ punguꞌ-punguꞌ simadi-e nang bogan-e daang-e mupuꞌ gonan-e pakai batuh.

verses.text: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ juuaꞌ geh iyoh ningaꞌ takal Yesus nog, yoh moꞌ bikoduh tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ nyomah Yesus nog jowin-e sium tanaꞌ.

verses.text: and crying out with a loud voice, he said, “What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don’t torment me.”
verses.source_translation: Daang-e nang bogan-e, “Yesus Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh kuasa-E, oni wat Muꞌu yaꞌ duoh okuꞌ? Daang adon Topaꞌ, okuꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Ingan maꞌ yaꞌ kanam okuꞌ!”

verses.text: For he said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan-e in inoh, dop-e Yesus sina tuduꞌ muat munua, “Luah leh soꞌ nyaꞌa itih!”

verses.text: He asked him, “What is your name?” He said to him, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Osi adon muꞌu?” Muat munua daang gonan nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-E, “Adon kuꞌ Legion, dop-e koꞌih bogoꞌ.”

verses.text: He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
verses.source_translation: Paliꞌ-paliꞌ iyoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, saꞌ-E diꞌ-e kasig muat munua luah soꞌ topat inoh.

verses.text: Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding.
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, bogoꞌ oyuaꞌ deꞌ kalik man-e deꞌ tilipang punguꞌ.

verses.text: All the demons begged him, saying, “Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them.”
verses.source_translation: Muat munua moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, “Odaꞌ leh koꞌih molot kaang gonan oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.”

verses.text: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned in the sea.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ muat munua deꞌ munoꞌ luah soꞌ gonan dali inoh yohmoꞌ molot daang gonan kaban oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Suaꞌ oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bitabum soꞌ tilipang punguꞌ, kaang donu yohmoꞌ kobos longod.  Oyuaꞌ deꞌ kobos inoh kulang lobih ogiꞌ duwoh libu polong.

verses.text: Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened.
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh buu keꞌ kota, keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok ngan-e tanon gah inoh.  Nyaꞌa moꞌ nog ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ magah-a inoh.

verses.text: They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ dali deꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua inoh guluꞌ, yoh moꞌ pakai pimakai-e daang-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bakoꞌ.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

verses.text: Those who saw it declared to them what happened to him who was possessed by demons, and about the pigs.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ dali inoh duoh kaban oyuaꞌ inoh, moꞌ silita oni deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ-a.

verses.text: They began to beg him to depart from their region.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Gerasa inoh moꞌ ulih-ulih mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus buu soꞌ topat inoh.

verses.text: As he was entering into the boat, he who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ muat kaang olud, dali deꞌ mokuaꞌ obuah bikalui muat munua inoh mitiaꞌ odop-e yaꞌ suwaꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He didn’t allow him, but said to him, “Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus jaman-e, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Paliꞌ negeh, tanon tuduꞌ madih ayua muꞌ, oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu duoh tanon nang Topaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.”

verses.text: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.
verses.source_translation: Dali inoh moꞌ buu, yohmoꞌ odi magah keꞌ topat deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang, “Simoong Kota”.  Danoꞌ iyoh moꞌ silita oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ silita-e.

verses.text: When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea.
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E paliꞌ motas Donu Galilea pakai olud.  Takal Yesus moꞌ nog polad donu, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ bitodod-todod odi ngumaꞌ Iyoh.

verses.text: Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet,
verses.source_translation: Pimipin topat simayang agama Yahudi deꞌ adon Yairus nog tuduꞌ Yesus.  Takal yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin-E.

verses.text: and begged him much, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.”
verses.source_translation: Daang-e in-e, “Tok-tok kuꞌ mitiaꞌ tulung tuduꞌ Ingan, odi keꞌ boli kuꞌ dioꞌ, tomaꞌ gonan onak dayung kuꞌ deꞌ bonaꞌ, saꞌ-e mokuaꞌ, duoh diꞌ-e kobos.”

verses.text: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ odi duoh Yairus.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ odi siuah-siuah-e bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus daang-e bitodod-todod, soꞌ boit soꞌ toꞌuh-E.

verses.text: A certain woman, who had an issue of blood for twelve years,
verses.source_translation: Daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ obuah onam bubuꞌ, onam nog koꞌis-e deꞌ lika yoh noman-e, moꞌ simoong duwoh sowaꞌ tuui-e.

verses.text: and had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse,
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ puas yoh ngubat-e sape nog obuaꞌ halta benda-e, pak-e aluaꞌ geh diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ.  Makin onu makin bitamah bonaꞌ.

verses.text: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes.
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ ngojit oni' deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, yoh moꞌ odi sinok Yesus soꞌ dug-E.

verses.text: For she said, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ in-e daang otin-e, “Simoꞌ kuꞌ tapod tomaꞌ jubah-E, okuꞌ pasti mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh yoh tomaꞌ jubah Yesus, onam koꞌis-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd, and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh Yesus ngoon ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah soꞌ odop-E.  Yesus moꞌ kumiat tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ Yoh moꞌ sikian in-E, “Osi deꞌ tomaꞌ jubah Kuꞌ?”

verses.text: His disciples said to him, “You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ in-e, “Idoh keh Ingan ningaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ bitodod-todod? Oni nai Ingan sikian osi deꞌ tomaꞌ odop Ingan.”

verses.text: He looked around to see her who had done this thing.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ katiꞌ-kanih osi deꞌ tomaꞌ odop-E.

verses.text: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ kimotol tolu takal-e moꞌ puꞌan nang odop-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ, yoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug daang jowin-e sium tanaꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus, yoh moꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ tomaꞌ jubah Yesus.

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ dayung inoh, “Luban muꞌu bisayaꞌ punuaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu moꞌ mokuaꞌ, paliꞌ leh daang otin deꞌ bidanah.  Muꞌu moꞌ tok-tok mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ sina, kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ boli Yairus moꞌ nog tanon in-e, “Onak dayung ingan moꞌ kobos, dusah tiyaꞌ nyeꞌ nyusah Gulu neh!”

verses.text: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Don’t be afraid, only believe.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e piduli oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Maꞌ tolu, bisayaꞌ negeh!”

verses.text: He allowed no one to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ ponu, Yoh jaman nyaꞌa niꞌ naꞌan tuang diꞌ soꞌon geh nunaꞌ Odop-E, jok-e odaꞌ Petrus, Yakobus duoh madih-e Yohanes.

verses.text: He came to the synagogue ruler’s house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog boli Yairus, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ siꞌian nang puas bogan-e.

verses.text: When he had entered in, he said to them, “Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus molot, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni nai ingan kiak kaung siꞌian deꞌ in inoh neh? Onak opot itih idoh diꞌ-e kobos, iyoh jok-e boꞌos.”

verses.text: They ridiculed him. But he, having put them all out, took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ towoh Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ luah.  Yesus moꞌ toban sinoꞌ samaꞌ onak opot inoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E molot kaang bilit-e.

verses.text: Taking the child by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha cumi!”  which means, being interpreted, “Girl, I tell you, get up!”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ kagong tongan onak dayung Yairus inoh, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Talita kum,” loti-e “Oi onak dayung, Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu mokat!”

verses.text: Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh onak dayung inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokat mujuag, yoh moꞌ ponu.  Takal inoh umul-e simoong duwoh sowaꞌ.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ sukup doon-e daang-e ilan-e.

verses.text: He strictly ordered them that no one should know this, and commanded that something should be given to her to eat.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ isin-isin jaman odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e.  Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ngin odaꞌ onak opot inoh man.”

chapters.text: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes. When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs. He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains, because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the fetters broken in pieces. Nobody had the strength to tame him. Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones. When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him, and crying out with a loud voice, he said, “What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don’t torment me.” For he said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”  He asked him, “What is your name?” He said to him, “My name is Legion, for we are many.” He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country. Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding. All the demons begged him, saying, “Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them.” At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned in the sea. Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened. They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid. Those who saw it declared to them what happened to him who was possessed by demons, and about the pigs. They began to beg him to depart from their region. As he was entering into the boat, he who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him. He didn’t allow him, but said to him, “Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.” He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled. When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea. Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet, and begged him much, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.” He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides. A certain woman, who had an issue of blood for twelve years, and had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse, having heard the things concerning Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes. For she said, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.” Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction. Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd, and asked, “Who touched my clothes?” His disciples said to him, “You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’” He looked around to see her who had done this thing. But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth. He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.” While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler’s house saying, “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?” But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Don’t be afraid, only believe.” He allowed no one to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James. He came to the synagogue ruler’s house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing. When he had entered in, he said to them, “Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep.” They ridiculed him. But he, having put them all out, took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying. Taking the child by the hand, he said to her, “Talitha cumi!”  which means, being interpreted, “Girl, I tell you, get up!”  Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement. He strictly ordered them that no one should know this, and commanded that something should be given to her to eat.

verses.text: He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ boli Yairus, Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E paliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ-E Nazaret, kupuaꞌ asal-E.

verses.text: When the Sabbath had come, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying, “Where did this man get these things?” and, “What is the wisdom that is given to this man, that such mighty works come about by his hands?
verses.source_translation: Takal Onu Sabat, Iyoh moꞌ mulai ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ boli topat simayang agama Yahudi.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-E moꞌ sukup ilan-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Soꞌ ki soꞌ-E soꞌon ilmu deꞌ masam-masam? Kuasa deꞌ oni wat-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daꞌ-A? Oni wat-e ngan-E ponai nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa?

verses.text: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” They were offended at him.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ puꞌan otoꞌ, Yoh itih onak tukang koyuh.  Sinoꞌ-E Maria, duoh kudu-kudu sudiꞌ-E deꞌ dali, Yakobus, Yoses, Yudas duoh Simon.  Sudiꞌ-E deꞌ dayung tuang ogiꞌ geh datiꞌ.” Noh leh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e tilimaꞌ Iyoh danoꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Daki-daki sijaꞌ-e nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ nabi, pak-e jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ-e duoh madih ayua duoh sikiaꞌ sudiꞌ-e deꞌ diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ-e.”

verses.text: He could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people, and healed them.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ, Iyoh diꞌ-e dapod nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, jok-e kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ tomaꞌ-E deꞌ odaꞌ-E mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

verses.text: He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sukup ilan-e, oni nai nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ-E diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-E.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ponu ngajal nyaꞌa keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: He called to himself the twelve, and began to send them out two by two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mogan simoong duwoh naꞌan rasul-E.  Iyoh moꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e saꞌ-e ponai kasig muat munua, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi ngaꞌ duwoh-duwoh.

verses.text: He commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a staff only: no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse,
verses.source_translation: Iyoh sibaya tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jaman toban balang-balang deꞌ yaꞌ pakai-e kodaꞌ onyad, duit, duoh bek.  Jok nyeꞌ soꞌon toban sikuud.

verses.text: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.
verses.source_translation: Jok nyeꞌ pakai silipal duoh bojuh deꞌ polong nyeꞌ sijaꞌ-e.

verses.text: He said to them, “Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan nog deꞌ kota, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa tilimaꞌ ingan loꞌo deꞌ boli-e, nyeꞌ moꞌ ngilumon danoꞌ nog ingan buu paliꞌ soꞌ kota inoh.

verses.text: Whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony against them. Assuredly, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ topat soꞌ ingan odi, diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ ingan duoh doliaꞌ-e ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan, nyeꞌ moꞌ buu daang nyeꞌ nguguah lopu tana' soꞌ lupaꞌ poꞌon ingan, saꞌ-e jadin tanda Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngukum odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.”

verses.text: They went out and preached that people should repent.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e mokuaꞌ ngojit sibaya Yesus, keꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan rasul-E moꞌ bilakat ponu, tanon tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod-e, odaꞌ togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat duoh paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E.
