verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Koꞌih moꞌ togan suaꞌ oniꞌ ngan koꞌih nunaꞌ Ingan.”

verses.text: Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ togan boli-e, atou madih ayua-e, atou pingoma-e, atou onak-e, atou umoh-e ngan-e nunaꞌ okuꞌ duoh magah Gah deꞌ Paguh,

verses.text: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.
verses.source_translation: daang idip-e deꞌ dunia itih geh yoh yaꞌ soꞌon silatus sidoh bogoꞌ boli-e, madih ayua-e, pingoma-e, onak-e duoh umoh-e, duoh susah jolaꞌ tuang ogiꞌ geh.  Pak-e tiaꞌ ijoꞌ deꞌ Dunia deꞌ Baꞌuh, iyoh yaꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But many who are first will be last; and the last first.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ adin yaꞌ ponai sunih, nyaꞌa deꞌ sunih adin yaꞌ ponai dioꞌ.”

verses.text: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him.
verses.source_translation: Daang pimonu Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nuju Yerusalem, Yesus ponu dioꞌ nuaꞌ jowin.  Suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bigaduh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ suwaꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ dug-e tuang tolu geh.  Mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus ngijaꞌ lagiꞌ soꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E odaꞌ odi okon soꞌ-o, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e sinok nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Yesus moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ oni wat nyaꞌa yaꞌ duoh odop-E.

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Otoꞌ yaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem, danih nyaꞌa yaꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ Onak Manusia tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi.  Yoh moꞌ yaꞌ ngukum ngabos Okuꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngine Okuꞌ, yoh yaꞌ ngujaꞌ, pijolaꞌ, duoh ngabos Okuꞌ.  Pak-e mokuaꞌ taluh onu Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ idip.”

verses.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.”
verses.source_translation: Yakobus duoh Yohanes, onak-onak Zebedeus moꞌ odi sinok Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ koꞌih tuduꞌ Ingan, odaꞌ Ingan nai-e.”

verses.text: He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e?”

verses.text: They said to him, “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Takal Ingan militah jadin Laja deꞌ ayuh odaꞌ leh koꞌih guluꞌ, niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ toꞌuh, niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ boit Ingan.”

verses.text: But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan.  Podo ingan moꞌ siap tilimaꞌ susah jolaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah Okuꞌ? Podo ingan taan yaꞌ obuah pijolaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah Okuꞌ?”

verses.text: They said to him, “We are able.” Jesus said to them, “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with;
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ nyawot lagiꞌ, “Koꞌih taan.” Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Tok ingan yaꞌ kiꞌan susah jolaꞌ duoh obuah pijolaꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah Okuꞌ.

verses.text: but to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ doiꞌ hak Kuꞌ, yaꞌ notap osi deꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh duoh osi deꞌ nuaꞌ boit Kuꞌ.  Inoh Topaꞌ sidia saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nyok-E.”

verses.text: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.
verses.source_translation: Takal simoong pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh, yoh moꞌ malah tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: Jesus summoned them, and said to them, “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ mogan suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yohmoꞌ in-e, “Pimipin-pimipin dunia militah layat-e pakai paksa duoh pijolaꞌ.

verses.text: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan diꞌ soꞌon wat inoh! Osi deꞌ yaꞌ jadin pimipin deꞌ soꞌ ingan, iyoh halus jadin pilayan.

verses.text: Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.
verses.source_translation: Duoh osi deꞌ yaꞌ jadin ulang timogah, iyoh sidia jadin kuli saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Onak Manusia nog idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa layan odop-E, pak-e Yoh yaꞌ layan duoh ngin asong-E ngan-e nyilamat nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.”

verses.text: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nog keꞌ Kota Yerikho.  Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu luah soꞌ Kota inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ siuah-siuah nunaꞌ-E.  Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ deꞌ tukang mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ deꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ bingon olan deꞌ adon Bartimeus onak Timeus.

verses.text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.source_translation: Takal Bartimeus moꞌ ngojit nang Yesus deꞌ soꞌ Nazaret ponu ngilusuꞌ odop-e, iyoh moꞌ nang bogan-e mitiaꞌ masiꞌ, “Yesus onak sukun Laja Daud! Masiꞌ leh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”

verses.text: Many rebuked him, that he should be quiet, but he cried out much more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ malah daꞌ-a daang-e odaꞌ yoh loꞌo, pak-e yoh makin dolas nang bogan-e, “Yesus onak sukun Laja Daud! Masiꞌ leh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”

verses.text: Jesus stood still, and said, “Call him.” They called the blind man, saying to him, “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ loꞌo daang-e sina, “Mogan odaꞌ iyoh odi katiꞌ!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh simadi-e sina tuduꞌ-e, “Notod negeh kila muꞌ, mokat likas-e, Yesus mogan muꞌu!”

verses.text: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ bukaꞌ jubah-e, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mujuag, iyoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man said to him, “Rabboni, that I may see again.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Oni deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu, okuꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ boton kuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.”  Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus on the way.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Dop-e muꞌu bisayaꞌ, muꞌu mokuaꞌ.Paliꞌ leh.” Takal inoh geh yoh lasuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus daang pimonuꞌ-E.

chapters.text: He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them. Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?” He answered, “What did Moses command you?” They said, “Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.” But Jesus said to them, “For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.   But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.  For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,   and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.   What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”  In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter. He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.   If a woman herself divorces her husband, and marries another, she commits adultery.” They were bringing to him little children, that he should touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them. But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said to them, “Allow the little children to come to me! Don’t forbid them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.   Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.” He took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands on them. As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him, “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?” Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one—God.   You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not give false testimony,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’” He said to him, “Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth.” Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross.” But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions. Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!” The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again, “Children, how hard is it for those who trust in riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!   It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.” They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him, “Then who can be saved?” Jesus, looking at them, said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.” Peter began to tell him, “Behold, we have left all, and have followed you.” Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,   but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.   But many who are first will be last; and the last first.” They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him.  “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.   They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.” James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.” He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?” They said to him, “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory.” But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?” They said to him, “We are able.” Jesus said to them, “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with;   but to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.” When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John. Jesus summoned them, and said to them, “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.   But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.   Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.   For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.” They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road. When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!” Many rebuked him, that he should be quiet, but he cried out much more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!” Jesus stood still, and said, “Call him.” They called the blind man, saying to him, “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!” He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus. Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man said to him, “Rabboni, that I may see again.” Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.”  Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus on the way.

verses.text: When they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ yaꞌ nog Yerusalem, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betfage duoh kupuaꞌ Betania.  Soꞌ duoh kupuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ deꞌ tilipang Punguꞌ Zaitun.  Takal-e danoꞌ, Yesus odaꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E ponu dioꞌ.

verses.text: and said to them, “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ sibaya tuduꞌ-e in-E, “Odi leh keꞌ kupuaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ nuaꞌ jowin toꞌ inoh.  Takal muꞌ molot kanoꞌ, muꞌu ningaꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ polong keledai deꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ deꞌ obuah mokos, deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa muat daꞌ-e.  Nyeꞌ moꞌ nukas-e, nyeꞌ moꞌ toban katiꞌ.

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa sikian-e, oni nai muꞌ mit keledai inoh? Nyeꞌ tanon tuduꞌ-e, ‘Gulu pilelu keledai itih, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh yaꞌ lasuꞌ paliꞌ-e.’ ”

verses.text: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ-e moꞌ odi.  Yoh moꞌ tapod ogiꞌ niꞌ polong onak keledai deꞌ mokos nyaꞌa deꞌ jowin boli-e sinok olan.  Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ nukas tolin-e.

verses.text: Some of those who stood there asked them, “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ mujuag sinok topat inoh moꞌ sikian-e, “Oni nai ingan nukas keledai inoh neh?”

verses.text: They said to them just as Jesus had said, and they let them go.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ nyawot nunaꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus tuduꞌ-e, yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ moꞌ tanah odaꞌ iyoh toban-e.

verses.text: They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ toban keledai inoh tuduꞌ Yesus.  Iyoh moꞌ nopas tun dug keledai inoh pakai jubah-e.  Yesus moꞌ nyikoh guluꞌ deꞌ tun-e.

verses.text: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nopas olan deꞌ yaꞌ ngilusuꞌ Yesus pakai jubah-e.  Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nopas olan pakai dowon-dowon koyuh deꞌ mit-e soꞌ kobon-e.

verses.text: Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out, “Hosanna!  Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ nuaꞌ jowin duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ nuaꞌ dug-e moꞌ nang bobaꞌ-e, “Mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ siluga! Obuah bilokat Iyoh deꞌ nog daang adon Topaꞌ!

verses.text: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.source_translation: Obuah bilokat leh Onak sukun Laja Daud itih, deꞌ yaꞌ militah otoꞌ odaꞌ paguh! Mudi leh Topaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ siluga!”

verses.text: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus nog keꞌ Yerusalem, Iyoh moꞌ molot keꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.  Iyoh ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ inoh, dop-e onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan moꞌ odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania.

verses.text: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu soꞌ Betania odi keꞌ Yerusalem, Yesus noman toꞌin-e pilai.

verses.text: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ juuaꞌ Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ tongon ara deꞌ bidonom dowon-e.  Iyoh moꞌ odi keꞌ puꞌun-e, podo-podo-e ogiꞌ buaꞌ-e.  Pak-e takal Yesus moꞌ nog libuaꞌ-e Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ jok-e ogiꞌ dowon-e sijaꞌ-e, dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e musim tongon ara inoh bibuaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus told it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!”  and his disciples heard it.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ ngojit Yesus sina in-e tuduꞌ tongon ara inoh, “Mulai soꞌ adin doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ man buaꞌ soꞌ tongon muꞌ!”

verses.text: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables, and the seats of those who sold the doves.
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nog keꞌ Yerusalem.  Iyoh moꞌ molot keꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ kasig nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua danoꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ ngibolui mija topat nyaꞌa nukal duit duoh mija topat nyaꞌa jua manuk asang.

verses.text: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ jaman osi sijaꞌ-e diꞌ soꞌon toban balang deꞌ yaꞌ jua-e ngilusuꞌ awah boli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: He taught, saying to them, “Isn’t it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’ But you have made it a den of robbers!”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa danoꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab deꞌ in-e, ‘Boli kuꞌ nyaꞌa sobot nang   boli topat bidoa saꞌan suaꞌ bangsa.’ Pak-e ingan odaꞌ jadin topat pinoku bisukan.”

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi moꞌ ngojit sina Yesus inoh, yoh moꞌ kalik olan ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.  Pak-e yoh tolu tuduꞌ Yesus dop-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sonang duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Yesus.

verses.text: When evening came, he went out of the city.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E buu soꞌ kota inoh.

verses.text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ pagi-e takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E ponu ngilusuꞌ tongon ara inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ tongon ara inoh moꞌ kobos pisok nog aat-e.

verses.text: Peter, remembering, said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.”
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ natong oniꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus sumia-e yoh moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, ningaꞌ mey tongon ara deꞌ obuah nyupah Ingan sumia-e moꞌ pisok.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Bisayaꞌ negeh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ!

verses.text: For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn’t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ sina tuduꞌ dolod itih, ‘Bilalih leh duoh obuah tolan kaang laut,’ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan inoh yaꞌ jadi, asal ingan diꞌ ingan bigaduh duoh totap bisayaꞌ nang oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal jadi.

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ muꞌ daang doa muꞌ, bisayaꞌ negeh nang muꞌu moꞌ soꞌon-e, muꞌu pasti yaꞌ soꞌon-e.

verses.text: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone; so that your Father, who is in heaven, may also forgive you your transgressions.
verses.source_translation: Siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e takal muꞌu bidoa, simoꞌ muꞌ natong muꞌu ogiꞌ monam otin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, muꞌu halus ngapun dioꞌ salah-e, saꞌ Samaꞌ muꞌ deꞌ siluga ngapun-E geh muꞌu.

verses.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e simoꞌ muꞌ diꞌ ngapun salah nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, Samaꞌ muꞌ deꞌ siluga tuang doliaꞌ-e geh ngapun dosa muꞌ.”

verses.text: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem.  Takal Yesus ponu-ponu deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, pimipin-pimipin agama duoh gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi duoh pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon bitapod duoh Yesus.

verses.text: and they began saying to him, “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Osi deꞌ odaꞌ Muꞌu nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ? Osi deꞌ ngin tugas tuduꞌ Muꞌu nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ?”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tuang yaꞌ sikian geh tuduꞌ ingan.  Simoꞌ ingan tapod nyawot, Okuꞌ tuang tanon Kuꞌ geh osi deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ.

verses.text: The baptism of John—was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ odaꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis baptis nyaꞌa? Manusia keh Topaꞌ?”

verses.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we should say, ‘From heaven;’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biloneng si odop-e, “Moꞌ toꞌ nang ‘Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ’, Iyoh pasti nang ‘Oni nai diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yohanes?’

verses.text: If we should say, ‘From men’”—they feared the people, for all held John to really be a prophet.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e idoh geh diꞌ otoꞌ ponai nang ‘Manusia deꞌ odaꞌ.’ ” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in inoh saai yoh tolu deꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yaꞌ malah tuduꞌ odop-e, dop-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ nang Yohanes inoh nabi.

verses.text: They answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said to them, “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E, “Koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e.” Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ tanon osi Nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.”

chapters.text: When they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples, and said to them, “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.   If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.” They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him. Some of those who stood there asked them, “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?” They said to them just as Jesus had said, and they let them go. They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it. Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road. Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out, “Hosanna!  Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!” Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve. The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry. Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs. Jesus told it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!”  and his disciples heard it. They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables, and the seats of those who sold the doves. He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple. He taught, saying to them, “Isn’t it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’ But you have made it a den of robbers!” The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching. When evening came, he went out of the city. As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots. Peter, remembering, said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.” Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.   For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn’t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.   Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.   Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone; so that your Father, who is in heaven, may also forgive you your transgressions.   But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.” They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him, and they began saying to him, “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?” Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.   The baptism of John—was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”  They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we should say, ‘From heaven;’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’ If we should say, ‘From men’”—they feared the people, for all held John to really be a prophet. They answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said to them, “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

verses.text: He began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the wine press, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.
verses.source_translation: Yesus mulai sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, gulu-gulu agama, duoh pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ bokon pakai nang silita, in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nai kobon anggul, yoh moꞌ ngijuam-e, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ nai lubang topat nyaꞌa misiat piꞌin buaꞌ anggul.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ nai pangal topat nyaꞌa jaga kobon, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nyewa kobon-e, odop-e moꞌ buu keꞌ negeli deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e nog musim ngutuam buaꞌ anggul, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e odaꞌ odi mit duman soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon-e.

verses.text: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon inoh moꞌ takap kuli deꞌ pait nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon.  Yoh moꞌ bipupuꞌ duoh-e, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh.

verses.text: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e deꞌ bokon, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mupuꞌ bak-e yohmoꞌ kasig odaꞌ buu, daang-e makiꞌ-mutaꞌ-e.

verses.text: Again he sent another; and they killed him; and many others, beating some, and killing some.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e deꞌ bokon, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngabos-e.  Watnoh geh yoh duoh kuli-e deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ pait-e deꞌ bokon.  Ogiꞌ deꞌ mupuꞌ-e, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ ngabos-e.

verses.text: Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.source_translation: Adin moꞌ doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ yaꞌ pait nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh, duam onak odop-e deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-e jaꞌ-e.  Yoh moꞌ in-e daang pikil-e, ‘Paguh okuꞌ odaꞌ onak odop kuꞌ deꞌ odi, saꞌ-e pimodo daꞌ-e.’

verses.text: But those farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon ningaꞌ onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog, yoh moꞌ sina tipan odop-e, in-e, ‘Ningaꞌ onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon itih! Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ kakuꞌ suaꞌ kobon itih, takal samaꞌ-e kobos.  Jaꞌ toꞌ ngabos-e saꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon itih.’

verses.text: They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap duoh ngabos onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh, yoh moꞌ tolan todang-e keꞌ sopaꞌ kobon.”

verses.text: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.
verses.source_translation: Yesus mokuaꞌ silita, yohmoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh? Pasti odop-e sadiꞌ-e deꞌ yaꞌ nog ngabos nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon-e inoh.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ nyewa.

verses.text: Haven’t you even read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner.
verses.source_translation: Pasti moꞌ ogiꞌ ingan basa daang Kitab deꞌ in-e, ‘Batuh deꞌ tolan tukang boli, moꞌ jadin batuh deꞌ sukup biguna-e.

verses.text: This was from the Lord, it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
verses.source_translation: Itih leh oniꞌ deꞌ nai Topaꞌ, deꞌ sukup otoꞌ ilan-e.’ ”

verses.text: They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him, and went away.
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin Yahudi deꞌ ngojit silita inoh moꞌ kagaꞌ odop-e yaꞌ takap Yesus, dop-e silita deꞌ nang Yesus inoh nados odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu tuduꞌ nyaꞌa' deꞌ bogoꞌ, inoh leh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu togan Yesus.

verses.text: They sent some of the Pharisees and the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ayua pimipin Yahudi moꞌ odaꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nuaꞌ Laja Herodes odi tuduꞌ Yesus ngan-e odaꞌ Yesus yaꞌ nang sina deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod nyalah Yesus.

verses.text: When they had come, they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don’t defer to anyone; for you aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Gulu, koꞌih puꞌan nang Ingan tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal duoh diꞌ Ingan piduli oni in sina nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Ingan diꞌ Ingan tolu, bait tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah, bait tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e timogah, pak-e Ingan suang-suang in Ingan ngajal wat ki wat manusia idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.  Adin, suba tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, moꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan agama otoꞌ, soꞌon kedoh keh otoꞌ bayal suke tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh? Halus keh idoh otoꞌ bayal-e?”

verses.text: Shall we give, or shall we not give?” But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus puꞌan nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ paguh.  Iyoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni nai ingan siaji ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ nang sina deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal? Suba bitanga tuduꞌ Okuꞌ niꞌ kiping duit pilak!”

verses.text: They brought it. He said to them, “Whose is this image and inscription?” They said to him, “Caesar’s.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ-E.  Yesus moꞌ sikian in-E, “Gamal duoh adon osi deꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gamal duoh adon Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” They marveled greatly at him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ-e wat inoh, oni deꞌ kakuꞌ laja, ngin tuduꞌ laja.  Oni deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup ilan-e.

verses.text: There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying,
verses.source_translation: Uluk ulang Saduki iyoh leh uluk ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tapod paliꞌ idip.  Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus.Yoh bisikian tuduꞌ Yesus, in-e,

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us, ‘If a man’s brother dies, and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother.’
verses.source_translation: “Gulu, Musa nulis atulan itih saꞌan otoꞌ: ‘Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ dali deꞌ moꞌ kawin, yoh moꞌ kobos, pak-e yoh doiꞌ onak-e, yohmoꞌ madih-e deꞌ dali deꞌ bokon mit bokas sowon-e, odaꞌ jadin sowon odop-e, saꞌ-e ogiꞌ onak saꞌan bonon-e deꞌ moꞌ kobos.’

verses.text: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sikiaꞌ-sudiꞌ juꞌ madih odop-e deꞌ dali.  Madih-e deꞌ pinuan kawin, yoh moꞌ dioꞌ kobos ngan-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e.

verses.text: The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise;
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh madih-e deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e mit bokas sowon-e inoh odaꞌ jadin sowon-e, yoh tuang dioꞌ kobos geh ngan-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e.  Wat noh geh, madih-e deꞌ keꞌ taluh-e,

verses.text: and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died.
verses.source_translation: telus nog madih-e deꞌ ke' juꞌ-e, wat inoh geh yoh kobos ngan-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung inoh tuang kobos geh.

verses.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.”
verses.source_translation: Takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip, dayung inoh jadin sowon osi? Dop-e soꞌ juꞌ madih odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kawin duoh-e.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Isn’t this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Pikil ingan moꞌ salah.  Ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan Kitab duoh kuasa Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos mokat paliꞌ idip, doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ kawin, suaꞌ nyaꞌa idip kodaꞌ malaikat deꞌ siluga.

verses.text: But about the dead, that they are raised; haven’t you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
verses.source_translation: Tentang nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos mokat paliꞌ idip, podo doiꞌ sidoh ingan basa daang buk deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, takal Topaꞌ bitanga odop-E tuduꞌ Musa soꞌ totaꞌ lojaꞌ deꞌ biduduꞌ opui daꞌ-e? Topaꞌ in-e, ‘Okuꞌ leh Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ Abraham, Ishak duoh Yakub,’

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh idoh diꞌ-e Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos, pak-e Iyoh Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip.  Ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e!”

verses.text: One of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together. Knowing that he had answered them well, asked him, “Which commandment is the greatest of all?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ bikalah duoh uluk ulang Saduki, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi suwaꞌ ngojit-e.  Yoh ningaꞌ Yesus nyawot oni deꞌ sikian odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup bonal-e.  Gulu agama Yahudi inoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Ki pilitah deꞌ paling penting soꞌ susuaꞌ pilitah soꞌ Topaꞌ?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “The greatest is, ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Pilitah deꞌ paling penting keꞌ niꞌ-e iyoh leh: ‘Ngojit leh ingan oi ulang Israel! Topaꞌ otoꞌ jok-e niꞌ.

verses.text: you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.
verses.source_translation: Ngibalaꞌ leh Topaꞌ daang suaꞌ otin muꞌ, suaꞌ asong muꞌ, suaꞌ pikil-kila muꞌ, duoh suaꞌ tenaga muꞌ.’

verses.text: The second is like this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
verses.source_translation: Pilitah deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e iyoh leh: ‘Ngibalaꞌ leh siodop muꞌ manusia, samah kodaꞌ muꞌu ngibalaꞌ odop muꞌ.  Doiꞌ pilitah deꞌ bokon deꞌ paling penting soꞌ pilitah deꞌ duwoh itih.’ ”

verses.text: The scribe said to him, “Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he,
verses.source_translation: Gulu agama Yahudi inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Bonal manah oniꞌ deꞌ nang Ingan, pak Gulu-e! Iyoh jok-e niꞌ, doiꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.source_translation: Manusia halus ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ daang suaꞌ otin-e, pakai suaꞌ pikil kila-e, duoh suaꞌ tenaga-e, duoh halus ngibalaꞌ si odop-e manusia, samah kodaꞌ iyoh ngibalaꞌ odop-e sadiꞌ-e.  Itih lobih paguh soꞌ binatang deꞌ ngabos nyeꞌ ngan nyeꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, duoh deꞌ bokon-bokon-e deꞌ ngin nyeꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from God’s Kingdom.” No one dared ask him any question after that.
verses.source_translation: Yesus ningaꞌ gulu agama ulang Yahudi inoh sikiya ponai nyawot sina-E, Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Muꞌu moꞌ siap yaꞌ tilimaꞌ Topaꞌ militah daang idip muꞌ.” Mokuaꞌ inoh suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ puus sikian oni-oni-e tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus responded, as he taught in the temple, “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, Yesus moꞌ in-E, “Oni wat gulu-gulu agama ulang Yahudi tapod tanon nang Laja Pinyilamat soꞌ onak sukun Laja Daud?

verses.text: For David himself said in the Holy Spirit, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’
verses.source_translation: Noꞌuh-e Laja Daud sibonal-e obuah nutuan Iyang Topaꞌ yohmoꞌ in-e, ‘Topaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tuan kuꞌ: guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh Kuꞌ saꞌ Muꞌ militah jadin Laja, nog kuꞌ odaꞌ musuh-musuh Muꞌ tunuak tuduꞌ Muꞌu.’

verses.text: Therefore David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?”  The common people heard him gladly.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e Daud sobot nang Laja Pinyilamat inoh Tuan-e, jadin Iyoh nak-e jok-e onak sukun Daud, Iyoh pasti lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ Daud.” Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ sukup sonang-e ngojit pingajal Yesus.

verses.text: In his teaching he said to them, “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and to get greetings in the marketplaces,
verses.source_translation: Yesus tanon geh tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ gaya gulu-gulu agama deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh suka ponu pakai jubah deꞌ omu, yoh magah nang odop-e ulang timogah, duoh suka odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi odop-e deꞌ pasal.

verses.text: and the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts:
verses.source_translation: Iyoh suka guluꞌ deꞌ topat-topat nuaꞌ jowin daang topat simayang agama Yahudi, duoh deꞌ topat-topat nyaꞌa man ayuh.

verses.text: those who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh suka nipu sinoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ janda duoh mit lomin boli-e.  Iyoh suka bidoa tuui-tuui deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa ngan-e magah nang odop-e paguh .  Tiaꞌ ijoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ lobih baat ukum deꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus guluꞌ ngaduap topat nyaꞌa ngin duit tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, Yesus ningaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kibalot duit-e daang kutak inoh.  Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya kibalot duit-e lobih bogoꞌ.

verses.text: A poor widow came, and she cast in two small brass coins, which equal a quadrans coin.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh sinoꞌ janda deꞌ botak suwaꞌ odi, iyoh kibalot duwoh kiping duit tibaga deꞌ mulah loga-e.

verses.text: He called his disciples to himself, and said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, this poor widow gave more than all those who are giving into the treasury,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mogan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Iyoh moꞌ sina, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Duit deꞌ kibalot sinoꞌ janda inoh lobih ayuh loga-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: for they all gave out of their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, gave all that she had to live on.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon ngin soꞌ lobih-e.  Pak-e sinoꞌ janda inoh bial yoh botak, iyoh ngin suaꞌ duit-e deꞌ ogiꞌ.  Dop-e duam inoh jaꞌ-e duit-e deꞌ ogiꞌ.”

chapters.text: He began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the wine press, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.   When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.   They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.   Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.   Again he sent another; and they killed him; and many others, beating some, and killing some.   Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’   But those farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’   They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.   What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.   Haven’t you even read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner.  This was from the Lord, it is marvelous in our eyes’?” They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him, and went away. They sent some of the Pharisees and the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words. When they had come, they asked him, “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don’t defer to anyone; for you aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not? Shall we give, or shall we not give?” But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it.” They brought it. He said to them, “Whose is this image and inscription?” They said to him, “Caesar’s.” Jesus answered them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” They marveled greatly at him. There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying, “Teacher, Moses wrote to us, ‘If a man’s brother dies, and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother.’ There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring. The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise; and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died. In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.” Jesus answered them, “Isn’t this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?   For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.   But about the dead, that they are raised; haven’t you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?  He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken.” One of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together. Knowing that he had answered them well, asked him, “Which commandment is the greatest of all?” Jesus answered, “The greatest is, ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:   you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.   The second is like this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.” The scribe said to him, “Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he, and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.” When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from God’s Kingdom.” No one dared ask him any question after that. Jesus responded, as he taught in the temple, “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?   For David himself said in the Holy Spirit, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’  Therefore David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?”  The common people heard him gladly. In his teaching he said to them, “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and to get greetings in the marketplaces,   and the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts:   those who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation.” Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much. A poor widow came, and she cast in two small brass coins, which equal a quadrans coin. He called his disciples to himself, and said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, this poor widow gave more than all those who are giving into the treasury,   for they all gave out of their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, gave all that she had to live on.”

verses.text: As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus luah soꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, suba ningaꞌ! Batuh-batuh Boli Topaꞌ inoh sangon manah! Wat inoh geh duoh sinung-sinung-e!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Suba ingan ningaꞌ batuh-batuh duoh sinung-sinung deꞌ sangon inoh.  Ogiꞌ onu takal-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan itih yaꞌ asul.  Niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ Boli Topaꞌ inoh deꞌ yaꞌ wat-wat-e geh, suaꞌ-e yaꞌ obuah pilubuh.”

verses.text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ odi keꞌ Punguꞌ Zaitun, Yoh moꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ ngaduap Boli Topaꞌ.  Petrus, Yakobus, Yohanes duoh Andreas moꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus, ngan-e yaꞌ sikian sadiꞌ-e tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian in-e, “Tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih siniaꞌ soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi? Oni tanda-tanda suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ jadi, saꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e?”

verses.text: Jesus, answering, began to tell them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Silalu jaga-jaga, maꞌ sape ingan obuah nipu odaꞌ nyaꞌa pakai pingajal deꞌ salah!

verses.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he!’ and will lead many astray.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog pakai adon Okuꞌ yohmoꞌ sina nang, ‘Okuꞌ leh Laja Pinyilamat’, yoh moꞌ nipu nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan ngojit sowoꞌ polang duoh gah-gah polang, maꞌ yaꞌ tolu.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi.  Pak-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kiamat.

verses.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.source_translation: Bangsa deꞌ niꞌ yaꞌ nyelang bangsa deꞌ bokon.  Negli deꞌ niꞌ yaꞌ lawan negli deꞌ bokon.  Daki-daki-e yaꞌ ogiꞌ topat deꞌ tiguyang tigusuak, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ sibolok.  Pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadin puꞌun nyaꞌa yaꞌ mulai jolaꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ-e deꞌ yaꞌ jadi.  Samah kodaꞌ dayung bitiiaꞌ deꞌ mulai noman toꞌin-e monam yaꞌ milaꞌ.

verses.text: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan masim-masim ati-ati! Nyaꞌa yaꞌ takap ingan duoh toban keꞌ Pengadilan Agama Yahudi.  Yoh yaꞌ pijolaꞌ ingan deꞌ topat-topat simayang agama Yahudi.  Yoh toban ingan ngaduap piayuh-piayuh duoh laja-laja.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah ingan, dop-e ingan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Inoh leh onu-e saꞌ ingan tapod magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.
verses.source_translation: Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh halus lobih dioꞌ nyeꞌ magah-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ bangsa takal onu kiamat aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog.

verses.text: When they lead you away and deliver you up, don’t be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan obuah takap duoh obuah toban keꞌ topat nyaꞌa bilituang, maꞌ bigaduh oni in sina deꞌ yaꞌ nang ingan.  Pak-e tanon negeh oni in deꞌ tanon Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan takal inoh.  Sibonal-e idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop ingan deꞌ tanon in inoh, Iyang Topaꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan tanon-e.

verses.text: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh yaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin madih-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa ngabos-e.  Samaꞌ ngin onak-e deꞌ nyaꞌa odaꞌ ngabos-e.  Wat noh geh onak-e ngin pingoma-e, odaꞌ nyaꞌa ngabos-e.

verses.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end, the same will be saved.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan dop-e ingan jadin pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ taan naan nog piobuaꞌ idip-e yoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ silamat.”

verses.text: But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains,
verses.source_translation: “Ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ sisiꞌ nyaꞌa daꞌ-a duoh oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa kobos tulah deꞌ yaꞌ mujuag daang Boli Topaꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ kaꞌis-e, topat deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon yoh molot daang-e.  (Nyaꞌa deꞌ basa itih halus bonal-bonal ngiloti hal itih.) Takal inoh ulang-ulang deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ propinsi Yudea halus bikoduh buu keꞌ dolod-dolod.

verses.text: and let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ tun bungan boli-e, maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ muun kalik oniꞌ kaang boli, lasuꞌ negeh bikoduh buu.

verses.text: Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ kiloja deꞌ umoh-e, maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ moliꞌ mit pimakai-e.

verses.text: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!
verses.source_translation: Takal onu inoh, todah mun sinoꞌ-sinoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ balut duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ siduaꞌ onak-e.

verses.text: Pray that your flight won’t be in the winter.
verses.source_translation: Bidoa leh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, saꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e nog takal musim modud.

verses.text: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e takal inoh nyaꞌa yaꞌ sukup jolaꞌ-e, deꞌ doiꞌ onu nyaꞌa obuah-e, mulai soꞌ sibungas Topaꞌ nai dunia nog adin.  Susah jolaꞌ inoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ obuah dunia.

verses.text: Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ Topaꞌ diꞌ-e sagot onu jolaꞌ inoh, doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ taan bitaan idip.  Pak-e Topaꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E odaꞌ nunaꞌ odop-E, yoh ngan-e sagot onu-e.

verses.text: Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ don’t believe it.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh, simoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nang, ‘Ningaꞌ Laja Pinyilamat ogiꞌ datiꞌ, ogiꞌ danih,’ maꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ odop-e Laja Pinyilamat duoh nabi-nabi pibulaꞌ yaꞌ nog.  Iyoh bogoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa ngan-e yaꞌ nipu nyaꞌa, nog nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ pilih-E, tadoꞌ-tadoꞌ-e yaꞌ obuah nipu geh.

verses.text: But you watch. “Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.
verses.source_translation: Jadin maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ bisayaꞌ, suaꞌ-e moꞌ dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi.”

verses.text: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,
verses.source_translation: “Pak-e takal-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ onu-onu nyaꞌa jolaꞌ inoh, boton onu yaꞌ mopung, bulan diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ jawaꞌ.

verses.text: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.
verses.source_translation: Bitang-bitang obuaꞌ luluh duoh kuasa-kuasa deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ longit obuaꞌ tiguyang.

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh nyaꞌa yaꞌ ningaꞌ Onak Manusia nog deꞌ abun pakai kuasa-e deꞌ ayuh duoh jawaꞌ-e deꞌ telang.

verses.text: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ malaikat-malaikat odi nguluk nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih-e odaꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e, deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ suaꞌ tun dunia itih, soꞌ nyuang bumi nog tubon longit.

verses.text: “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and produces its leaves, you know that the summer is near;
verses.source_translation: Bilajal leh soꞌ silita tongon ara.  Takal daꞌan-daꞌan-e moꞌ dodot duoh mulai ngilotad, onu moꞌ yaꞌ logaꞌ.

verses.text: even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh moꞌ ingan ningaꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ tanda-tanda deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tiꞌ-e, inoh loti-e moꞌ sinok onu-e.  Duam-e yaꞌ nog.

verses.text: Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.
verses.source_translation: Ngojit bonal-bonal-e! Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ yaꞌ jadi takal nyaꞌa deꞌ idip adin aluaꞌ diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e kobos.

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
verses.source_translation: Longit duoh tanaꞌ yaꞌ musuap, pak-e pingunang Kuꞌ totap ogiꞌ silamaꞌ-lamaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
verses.source_translation: “Pak-e siniaꞌ onu-e duoh siniaꞌ takal-e yaꞌ jadi doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan, malaikat deꞌ siluga tuang doh geh diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.  Pak-e jok-e Samaꞌ deꞌ siluga deꞌ puꞌan.  Onak-E tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.

verses.text: Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don’t know when the time is.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ duoh silalu jaga-jaga! Dop-e ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan siniaꞌ takal-e.

verses.text: “It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.
verses.source_translation: Onak Manusia yaꞌ nog samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ buu togan boli-e.  Takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e buu, yoh moꞌ bikutung kiloja tuduꞌ kuli-kuli-e odaꞌ ngatul boli-e.  Yoh sibaya tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga tiban-e, maꞌ sape yoh yaꞌ komut kiloja-e nog nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli paliꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh ke yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ topat deꞌ juuaꞌ.

verses.text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan nyeꞌ silalu jaga singonu singalom, dop-e diꞌ ingan puꞌan siniaꞌ takal-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli inoh yaꞌ nog.  An onu ngumi, an tuluap ngalom, an suam-suam pagi, an takal boton onu moꞌ tumuꞌ.

verses.text: lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.
verses.source_translation: Saꞌ-e simoꞌ iyoh tang-tang nog, maꞌ sape iyoh nog ningaꞌ ingan aluaꞌ boꞌos.

verses.text: What I tell you, I tell all: Watch.”
verses.source_translation: Oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, Kuꞌ tanon geh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa: Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ duoh silalu jaga-jaga!”

chapters.text: As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!” Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.” As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately, “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?” Jesus, answering, began to tell them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.   For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he!’ and will lead many astray.  “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.   For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.   But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.   The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.   When they lead you away and deliver you up, don’t be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.  “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.   You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end, the same will be saved.   But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains,   and let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.   Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.   But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!   Pray that your flight won’t be in the winter.   For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.   Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.   Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ don’t believe it.   For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.   But you watch. “Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.   But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,   the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.  Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.   Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.  “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and produces its leaves, you know that the summer is near;   even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.   Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.   Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.   But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.   Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don’t know when the time is.   “It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.   Watch therefore, for you don’t know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;   lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.   What I tell you, I tell all: Watch.”

verses.text: It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him.
verses.source_translation: Duwoh onu lagiꞌ ulang Yahudi yaꞌ nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah duoh nyamut Onu Ayuh Kueh deꞌ doiꞌ Ragi-e.  Pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi yaꞌ takap duoh yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: For they said, “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot among the people.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ bipokat diꞌ-e takap Yesus daang onu ayuh, in odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ sape oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai otoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ nang liuak daluag-e.”

verses.text: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard—very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head.
verses.source_translation: Yesus aluaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania, iyoh moꞌ odi boli Simon, nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ bijakit.  Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ julah-e man, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung nog toban niꞌ jobul inyuaꞌ wangi deꞌ maal loga-e, duoh jobul-e tuang maal geh.  Yoh moꞌ mugat tunguaꞌ jobul inoh yohmoꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ inoh deꞌ tun bak Yesus.

verses.text: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying, “Why has this ointment been wasted?
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ malah, daang-e sina tipan odop-e, “Nai oni saꞌat inyuaꞌ deꞌ maal wat inoh?

verses.text: For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii,  and given to the poor.” They grumbled against her.
verses.source_translation: Lobih paguh nyeꞌ jua negeh inyuaꞌ wangi inoh! Loga-e samah duoh gaji nyaꞌa kiloja deꞌ niꞌ sowaꞌ.  Duit-e tapod nyeꞌ bikutung tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sotok!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ malah tuduꞌ dayung inoh.

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tanah negeh! Doiꞌ nyeꞌ jolaꞌ malah tuduꞌ-e.  Iyoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ paling paguh-e saꞌan Okuꞌ.

verses.text: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ sotok, silalu ogiꞌ sinok ingan, siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e ingan tapod tulung-e.  Pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ silamaꞌ-lamaꞌ-e yaꞌ duoh ingan.

verses.text: She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.
verses.source_translation: Dayung itih moꞌ nai oni deꞌ tapod yoh nai-e tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh moꞌ dioꞌ ngiyuaꞌ gonan-Kuꞌ takal Kuꞌ aluaꞌ idip.  Inoh samah geh iyoh ngiyuaꞌ todang Kuꞌ takal Kuꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.”
verses.source_translation: Natong bonal-bonal-e! Daki sijaꞌ-e nyaꞌa magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Okuꞌ deꞌ tun dunia itih, wat inoh geh nyaꞌa silita oni deꞌ moꞌ nai dayung itih.  Saꞌ nyaꞌa silalu natong oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ Okuꞌ adin.”

verses.text: Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, that he might deliver him to them.
verses.source_translation: Yudas Iskariot, niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh, moꞌ odi tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh ngan-e yaꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup doon-e ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e, yoh moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngin duit tuduꞌ Yudas.  Yudas moꞌ kalik wat olan ngan-e yaꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?”
verses.source_translation: Takal onu keꞌ niꞌ-e nyaꞌa nyamut Onu Ayuh Kueh deꞌ doiꞌ Ragi-e, daang onu inoh nyaꞌa mulai simoliah domba ngan-e yaꞌ nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, daki topat soꞌ otoꞌ yaꞌ man nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah? Saꞌ koꞌih sidia pinguman deꞌ topat inoh.”

verses.text: He sent two of his disciples, and said to them, “Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ pait duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e yohmoꞌ sibaya tuduꞌ-e, “Odi kaang kota.  Danih ingan yaꞌ bitapod duoh niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ toban kobuk deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ piꞌin, nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu bitunaꞌ duoh-e.

verses.text: and wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.source_translation: Takal iyoh molot kaang boli, nyeꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli, ‘Gulu sikian daki aluang boli topat Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yaꞌ man nyamut Onu Ayuh Paskah?’

verses.text: He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli inoh moꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, ogiꞌ niꞌ aluang deꞌ longah deꞌ ayuh, deꞌ moꞌ suaꞌ-e siap oniꞌ daang-e.  Danoꞌ leh ingan sidia pinguman ngan toꞌ nyamut Paskah.”

verses.text: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh ngojit sibaya Yesus, yoh moꞌ odi molot kaang kota.  Danoꞌ yoh bitapod duoh nyaꞌa, bonal-bonal samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sidia pinguman ngan-e nyamut Onu ayuh Paskah danoꞌ.

verses.text: When it was evening he came with the twelve.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ ngalom, Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan moꞌ odi keꞌ boli inoh.

verses.text: As they sat and were eating, Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me—he who eats with me.”
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ julah-e man, Yesus moꞌ sina, “Natong bonal-bonal-e! Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ tuduꞌ musuh-musuh Kuꞌ.  Odop-e ogiꞌ man samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one, “Surely not I?” And another said, “Surely not I?”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e ngojit sina Yesus inoh, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ susah kila-e.  Yoh moꞌ masim-masim sina nang, “Okuꞌ keh idoh, Gulu?”

verses.text: He answered them, “It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ odop-e datiꞌ, soꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ itih, deꞌ man niꞌ pingian samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.

verses.text: For the Son of Man goes, even as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.source_translation: Onak Manusia tok yaꞌ kobos, nunaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nyelah Iyoh yaꞌ tulah idip-e.  Lobih paguh moꞌ-e yoh diꞌ-e obuah milaꞌ daang dunia itih.”

verses.text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said, “Take, eat. This is my body.”
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ man, Yesus moꞌ mit kueh, yohmoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ nyipiak kutung tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E daang-e in-e, “Mit nyeꞌ moꞌ man-e, itih gonan Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ mit sakil deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin anggul daang-e, yoh moꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E nuak soꞌ sakil inoh.

verses.text: He said to them, “This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ sina lagi, “Itih doyaꞌ Kuꞌ, doyaꞌ deꞌ nogap janyi Topaꞌ duoh manusia, doyaꞌ deꞌ soyang saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it anew in God’s Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Natong bonal-bonal-e! Tok idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ nuak piꞌin soꞌ buaꞌ anggul nog onu Okuꞌ nuak soꞌ buaꞌ anggul deꞌ baꞌuh takal Topaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja.”

verses.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngilagu mudi Topaꞌ yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ Punguꞌ Zaitun.

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.source_translation: Takal-e aluaꞌ daang olan, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Suaꞌ ingan yaꞌ buu togan Okuꞌ, dop-e ogiꞌ deꞌ nulis daang Kitab, ‘Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga koming domba-e, yoh moꞌ koming domba-e yaꞌ buu katiꞌ kanih.’

verses.text: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ idip, Okuꞌ yaꞌ dioꞌ kajon ingan deꞌ Galilea.”

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “Although all will be offended, yet I will not.”
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ in-e nyawot Yesus, “Okuꞌ idoh! Simoꞌ nyaꞌa buu togan Ingan, okuꞌ totap idoh!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Most certainly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot Petrus, in-E, “Natong bonal-bonal-e! Ngalom itih geh takal babang siuak aluaꞌ diꞌ-e bitadu duwoh sidoh, muꞌu moꞌ taluh sidoh sukan nang odop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: But he spoke all the more, “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.” They all said the same thing.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus isin-isin in-e, “Simoꞌ okuꞌ tipaksa suwaꞌ kobos duoh Ingan, idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ sukan nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ piluh Ingan.” Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon tuang inoh geh in-e.

verses.text: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, “Sit here, while I pray.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ topat deꞌ adon Getsemani.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Guluꞌ datiꞌ dioꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi bidoa.”

verses.text: He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngijaꞌ Petrus, Yakobus duoh Yohanes odi duoh odop-E.  Yesus sikiya nyam kila-E tolu, otin-e ulih-ulih susah.

verses.text: He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ taluh inoh, “Ulih-ulih nyam susah otin Kuꞌ sape yaꞌ kobos nyam Kuꞌ odaꞌ-e.  Loꞌo kajon datiꞌ maꞌ yaꞌ boꞌos!”

verses.text: He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ponu muaꞌ juꞌan-e soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug nog jowin-E obuah tanaꞌ, ngan-e bidoa.  Daang doa-E, Iyoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, moꞌ-e tapod saꞌ susah jolaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah odop-E.

verses.text: He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh bidoa in-e, “Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ! Suaꞌ oniꞌ tapod Ingan nai-e.  Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Ingan odaꞌ Okuꞌ lopas soꞌ susah jolaꞌ itih.  Pak-e nai negeh kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Ingan, idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you watch one hour?
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ bidoa Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ taluh naꞌan inoh.  Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ boꞌos, yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Simon Petrus, “Simon, boꞌos yeh muꞌu neh? Idoh diꞌ muꞌ taan nijon boton muꞌ niꞌ jam negeh?”

verses.text: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, in-e, “Silalu jaga-jaga duoh bidoa, saꞌ diꞌ ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.  Otin kila ingan laꞌan-e yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e gonan ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e taan.”

verses.text: Again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ odi lagiꞌ muaꞌ juꞌan-e soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ bidoa samah kodaꞌ in deꞌ tiꞌ-e.

verses.text: Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn’t know what to answer him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ bidoa, Yesus paliꞌ lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ boꞌos, dop-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ taan nijon boton-e.  Takal Yesus guyang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ puꞌan oni in-e yaꞌ nyawot Yesus.

verses.text: He came the third time, and said to them, “Sleep on now, and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ taluh sidoh-e.  Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Aluaꞌ boꞌos keh ingan? Moh tiyaꞌ! Ningaꞌ Onak Manusia obuah nyelah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.

verses.text: Arise, let us be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”
verses.source_translation: Mokat tiyaꞌ, jaꞌ toꞌ buu.  Ningaꞌ! Nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ moꞌ nog!”

verses.text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came—and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ sina, tang-tang mun Yudas nog.  Yudas itih niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus.  Yudas nog samah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ toban podang duoh pakung.  Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, gulu-gulu agama duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon deꞌ pait odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ odi saꞌ-e takap Yesus.

verses.text: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I will kiss, that is he. Seize him, and lead him away safely.”
verses.source_translation: Yudas, nyaꞌa deꞌ nyelah Yesus, moꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ sium kuꞌ tiaꞌ inoh leh odop-E.  Takap Iyoh nyeꞌ moꞌ ngawal toban buu.”

verses.text: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, “Rabbi! Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yudas nog yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ in-e “Gulu!” Yoh moꞌ sium Yesus.

verses.text: They laid their hands on him, and seized him.
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ lasuꞌ takap-E yohmoꞌ bikagong duoh-E.

verses.text: But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus nyitak podang-e, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ kawiang podang-e nyopaꞌ kuli pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ paling ayuh.  Kojit-e moꞌ lasuꞌ sopial.

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ nog takap odop-E, “Baꞌ ingan nang Okuꞌ pinyamun? Ingan nog sape toban podang, toban pakung ngan ingan takap Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.”
verses.source_translation: Tibilang konu Okuꞌ samah-samah ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jowin ingan, pak-e doiꞌ nak ingan takap Okuꞌ danoꞌ.  Pak-e adin takap leh Okuꞌ, saꞌ-e bonal-bonal samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab.”

verses.text: They all left him, and fled.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh suaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E bikoduh buu togan Iyoh.
