verses.text: A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself over his naked body. The young men grabbed him,
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan onak mudaꞌ deꞌ jok-e bisabuak kain ngan-e nutu gonan-e bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus.  Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nyonguam takap-e.

verses.text: but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.
verses.source_translation: Kain deꞌ gonan-e moꞌ lusut yoh moꞌ bikoduh buu sitagual.

verses.text: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.
Peter had followed him from a distance, until he came into the court of the high priest. He was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.
Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witnesses against Jesus to put him to death, and found none.
For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony didn’t agree with each other.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokat nang sina pibulaꞌ-e ngan-e nyalah Yesus, pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e niꞌ in.

verses.text: Some stood up, and gave false testimony against him, saying,
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mujuag nang sina pibulaꞌ napo Yesus in-e,

verses.text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’”
verses.source_translation: “Koꞌih moꞌ ngojit Yoh itih sina, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ pilubuh Boli Topaꞌ itih deꞌ obuah nai tongan manusia.  Daang taluh onu Okuꞌ yaꞌ kajuag deꞌ baꞌuh deꞌ diꞌ-e tongan manusia deꞌ nai.’ ”

verses.text: Even so, their testimony did not agree.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e niꞌ in.

verses.text: The high priest stood up in the middle, and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?”
verses.source_translation: Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh mokat mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Idoh diꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ nyawot sina nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ napo Muꞌu neh?”

verses.text: But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus loꞌo jaꞌ-e, diꞌ-e nyawot-e.  Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh sikian niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ in-e, “Podo Muꞌu yeh Laja Pinyilamat Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah toꞌ?”

verses.text: Jesus said, “I am. You will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of the sky.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Bonal, Okuꞌ leh Odop-E.  Suaꞌ ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ Onak Manusia guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh Topaꞌ deꞌ Ayuh Kuasa-E.  Yohmoꞌ ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh yaꞌ nog daang abun!”

verses.text: The high priest tore his clothes, and said, “What further need have we of witnesses?
verses.source_translation: Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh inoh moꞌ notak pimakai-e, yoh in-e, “Dusah tiyaꞌ toꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon neh!

verses.text: You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” They all condemned him to be worthy of death.
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ ngojit sina-E deꞌ nguyat Topaꞌ.  Oni wat otoꞌ yaꞌ duoh Iyoh itih?” Yohmoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ situju Yesus halus obuah ukum ngabos.

verses.text: Some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to tell him, “Prophesy!” The officers struck him with the palms of their hands.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa mulai ngujaꞌ-E.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kuab jowin Yesus yoh moꞌ bibokut duoh-E daang-e in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Suba sobot, osi deꞌ bokut Muꞌu tih?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga danoꞌ suwaꞌ bitapal duoh-E.

verses.text: As Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the maids of the high priest came,
verses.source_translation: Takal Petrus aluaꞌ ogiꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ limang boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kuli-e deꞌ dayung nog kanoꞌ.

verses.text: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him, and said, “You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e ningaꞌ Petrus guluꞌ ngunuh kibangoh gonan-e sinok opui, yoh moꞌ bonal-bonal ngibotoh jowin Petrus.  Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Bah idoh diꞌ-e ingan itih deꞌ silalu nunaꞌ Yesus ulang Nazaret inoh neh?”

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know, nor understand what you are saying.” He went out on the porch, and the rooster crowed.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e yoh moꞌ sukan-e.  Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ nang muꞌ inoh.” Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ buu keꞌ limang deꞌ sinok tiban pagal boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh.  Takal inoh geh babang siuak bitadu.

verses.text: The maid saw him, and began again to tell those who stood by, “This is one of them.”
verses.source_translation: Takal kuli deꞌ dayung inoh ningaꞌ Petrus lagiꞌ, yoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Iyoh itih ulang deꞌ silalu bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus.”

verses.text: But he again denied it. After a little while again those who stood by said to Peter, “You truly are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus aluaꞌ geh sukan-e.  Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e tuui mokuaꞌ inoh, nyaꞌa danoꞌ in-e lagiꞌ tuduꞌ Petrus, “Diꞌ muꞌ tiyaꞌ ponai sukan-e.  Muꞌu pasti soꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ dop-e muꞌu ulang Galilea.”

verses.text: But he began to curse, and to swear, “I don’t know this man of whom you speak!”
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ sina bisupah in-e, “Doiꞌ kuꞌ piluh osi deꞌ nang ingan inoh neh! Asal kuꞌ pibulaꞌ, tanah saꞌ Topaꞌ ngukum okuꞌ!”

verses.text: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” When he thought about that, he wept.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh babang siuak bitadu keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e.  Petrus moꞌ gos nyam-e natong sina Yesus deꞌ dioꞌ, deꞌ in-E, “Aluaꞌ diꞌ babang siuak bitadu duwoh sidoh, muꞌu moꞌ taluh sidoh sukan nang odop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ.” Mokuaꞌ inoh kila Petrus moꞌ ngilobuꞌ yohmoꞌ siꞌian.

chapters.text: It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him. For they said, “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot among the people.” While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard—very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head. But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying, “Why has this ointment been wasted? For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii,  and given to the poor.” They grumbled against her. But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.   For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.   She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.   Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.” Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, that he might deliver him to them. They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him. On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?” He sent two of his disciples, and said to them, “Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him,   and wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’   He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there.” His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover. When it was evening he came with the twelve. As they sat and were eating, Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me—he who eats with me.” They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one, “Surely not I?” And another said, “Surely not I?” He answered them, “It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.   For the Son of Man goes, even as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.” As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said, “Take, eat. This is my body.” He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it. He said to them, “This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.   Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it anew in God’s Kingdom.” When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives. Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’  However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”  But Peter said to him, “Although all will be offended, yet I will not.” Jesus said to him, “Most certainly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”  But he spoke all the more, “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.” They all said the same thing. They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, “Sit here, while I pray.” He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed. He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch.” He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him. He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire.”  He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you watch one hour?   Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.” Again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words. Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn’t know what to answer him. He came the third time, and said to them, “Sleep on now, and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.   Arise, let us be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”  Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came—and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders. Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I will kiss, that is he. Seize him, and lead him away safely.” When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, “Rabbi! Rabbi!” and kissed him. They laid their hands on him, and seized him. But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear. Jesus answered them, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?   I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn’t arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.” They all left him, and fled. A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself over his naked body. The young men grabbed him, but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked. They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him. Peter had followed him from a distance, until he came into the court of the high priest. He was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire. Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witnesses against Jesus to put him to death, and found none. For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony didn’t agree with each other. Some stood up, and gave false testimony against him, saying, “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’” Even so, their testimony did not agree. The high priest stood up in the middle, and asked Jesus, “Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?” But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?” Jesus said, “I am. You will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of the sky.” The high priest tore his clothes, and said, “What further need have we of witnesses? You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” They all condemned him to be worthy of death. Some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to tell him, “Prophesy!” The officers struck him with the palms of their hands. As Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the maids of the high priest came, and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him, and said, “You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!” But he denied it, saying, “I neither know, nor understand what you are saying.” He went out on the porch, and the rooster crowed. The maid saw him, and began again to tell those who stood by, “This is one of them.” But he again denied it. After a little while again those who stood by said to Peter, “You truly are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it.” But he began to curse, and to swear, “I don’t know this man of whom you speak!” The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” When he thought about that, he wept.

verses.text: Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.
verses.source_translation: Suam-suam pagi ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon baya gulu-gulu agama Yahudi, suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ sipakat.  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokos Yesus, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ matak Yesus toban tuduꞌ gubelnul deꞌ propinsi Yudea deꞌ adon Pilatus.

verses.text: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered, “So you say.”
verses.source_translation: Gubelnul Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Podo tok Muꞌu laja ulang Yahudi?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Muꞌu deꞌ sobot nang inoh.”

verses.text: The chief priests accused him of many things.
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ nuduh nang Yoh bogoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Pilatus sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ngojit, bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Muꞌu.  Oni nai diꞌ muꞌ nyawot-e?”

verses.text: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e niꞌ doiꞌ geh sina-e deꞌ nyawot Yesus, yoh ngan Pilatus ilan-e.

verses.text: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ adat-e bilang Onu Ayuh Paskah, Pilatus pilopas niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah jel nunaꞌ deꞌ pilih nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: There was one called Barabbas, bound with his fellow insurgents, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Barabas.  Iyoh obuah jel samah-samah duoh ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan kerajaan Romawi, dop-e ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa takal nyaꞌa nai liuak daluag-e.

verses.text: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ tikuluk danoꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Pilatus odaꞌ pilopas niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ jel, nunaꞌ adat-e.

verses.text: Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Podo ingan mitiaꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ pilopas laja ulang Yahudi inoh saꞌan ingan?”

verses.text: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Pilatus moꞌ puꞌan pimipin-pimipin agama ulang Yahudi deꞌ ayuh deꞌ munoꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e, dop-e yoh siniaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ kibangoh kila nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odaꞌ pilopas Barabas saꞌan odop-e.

verses.text: Pilate again asked them, “What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?”
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ-e wat inoh, oni wat kuꞌ yaꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang ingan laja ulang Yahudi inoh?”

verses.text: They cried out again, “Crucify him!”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina daang-e nang bogan-e, “Masak Iyoh tun salip!”

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they cried out exceedingly, “Crucify him!”
verses.source_translation: Pilatus sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pak-e oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai-E?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ makin dolas nang bogan-e, “Masak Iyoh tun salip!”

verses.text: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ pilopas Barabas, saꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa tiyaꞌ nang liuak daluag-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-sidadu-e pijolaꞌ Yesus duoh masak tun salip.

verses.text: The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort.
verses.source_translation: Sidadu-sidadu Roma moꞌ toban Yesus kaang boli topat gubelnul militah.  Yoh moꞌ mogan suaꞌ sidadu deꞌ bokon odaꞌ tikuluk danoꞌ.

verses.text: They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.
verses.source_translation: Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ pasang jubah walna ungu tuduꞌ Yesus, duoh naꞌ mahkota deꞌ nai-e pakai daꞌan koyuh deꞌ bilojaꞌ deꞌ bak Yesus.

verses.text: They began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ mudi Yesus, daang-e in-e, “Idip laja ulang Yahudi!”

verses.text: They struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him.
verses.source_translation: Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ makung bak Yesus pakai sikuud, ogiꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ ngujaꞌ Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: When they had mocked him, they took the purple off him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e mokuaꞌ adoh-adoh wat-e duoh Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bukaꞌ jubah-E deꞌ walna ungu inoh, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ pasang bojuh odop Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ toban buu ngan-e yaꞌ nyalip-E.

verses.text: They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e deꞌ lopot olan, sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paksa niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon odaꞌ golong salip Yesus.  Simon itih tuang-e nog soꞌ kupuaꞌ yaꞌ molot keꞌ kota.  Iyoh nyaꞌa soꞌ Kirene, samaꞌ Aleksander duoh Rufus.

verses.text: They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, “The place of a skull.”
verses.source_translation: Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ topat deꞌ adon Golgota, loti-e, “Topat Tikuluak.”

verses.text: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn’t take it.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ danoꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ ngin piꞌin anggul deꞌ sapul-e duoh potok koyuh deꞌ sobot-e nang Mur, deꞌ tapod odaꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e sikiya noman gonan-e monam, pak-e Yesus doliaꞌ-e nuak-e.

verses.text: Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mabak pasak deꞌ tongan poꞌon Yesus deꞌ tun koyuh salip.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikutung pimakai Yesus pakai ngundi, saꞌ-e puꞌan osi deꞌ soꞌon bojuh-E duoh osi deꞌ soꞌon jubah-E.

verses.text: It was the third hour,  and they crucified him.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa nyalip Yesus inoh takal pukul piliꞌi pagi.

verses.text: The superscription of his accusation was written over him, “THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ tun salip-E ogiꞌ tulis deꞌ nopia nyaꞌa, ngan-e sobot luban nyaꞌa nyalip Yesus deꞌ in-e, “Laja ulang Yahudi.”

verses.text: With him they crucified two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinyamun deꞌ obuah nyalip bibaya-baya duoh Yesus.  Niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E, niꞌ naꞌan nuaꞌ boit-E.

verses.text: The Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was counted with transgressors.”
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ obuah Yesus inoh, moꞌ bonal-bonal jadi samah duoh deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab, deꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa moꞌ nang Iyoh samah duoh ulang jaꞌat.”

verses.text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads, and saying, “Ha! You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days,
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngilusuꞌ topat inoh moꞌ adoh-adoh in-e duoh Yesus, daang-e kuting bak-e, yohmoꞌ in-e, “No mey-e, patut Muꞌu nang odop Muꞌ yaꞌ pilubuh Boli Topaꞌ, duoh yaꞌ paliꞌ kajuag baꞌuh daang taluh onu

verses.text: save yourself, and come down from the cross!”
verses.source_translation: Suba muun soꞌ tun salip, nyilamat odop Muꞌ!”

verses.text: Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said, “He saved others. He can’t save himself.
verses.source_translation: Watnoh geh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi suwaꞌ geh adoh-adoh in-e duoh Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tipan odop-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Iyoh nyilamat-e, pak-e Iyoh diꞌ-e taan nyilamat Odop-E sadiꞌ-e!

verses.text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him.”  Those who were crucified with him also insulted him.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ Iyoh tok-tok Laja Pinyilamat ulang Israel, tanah saꞌ-e muun soꞌ salip, saꞌ otoꞌ ningaꞌ-E, otoꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ.” Wat inoh geh pinyamun deꞌ suwaꞌ obuah nyalip samah-samah duoh Yesus, suwaꞌ geh adoh-adoh in-e duoh Yesus.

verses.text: When the sixth hour  had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.source_translation: Takal uun onu pukul simoong duwoh, suaꞌ pulou moꞌ mopung, nog pukul taluh ngumi.

verses.text: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is, being interpreted, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
verses.source_translation: Takal pukul taluh ngumi inoh Yesus moꞌ nang bogan-e, in-E, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabakhtani?” Deꞌ loti-e, “Topaꞌ Kuꞌ, Topaꞌ Kuꞌ, oni nai Ingan togan Okuꞌ?”

verses.text: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he is calling Elijah.”
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa danoꞌ ngojit Yesus nang bogan-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Ngojit, Iyoh mogan adon nabi Elia!”

verses.text: One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi mit lumut deꞌ nyolap piꞌin, yoh moꞌ suad daang piꞌin anggul deꞌ masuam, yoh moꞌ naꞌ deꞌ tubon tisuk koyuh ngan-e nyog deꞌ bobaꞌ Yesus, daang-e sina, “Jaꞌ toꞌ kajon-e! Toꞌ ningaꞌ-e podo nabi Elia nog pimuun Iyoh soꞌ tun salip.”

verses.text: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nang bogan-e lagiꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh asong-e moꞌ doiꞌ.

verses.text: The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh tabial daang Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ totak jadin duwoh amal soꞌ somu nog douꞌ.

verses.text: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”
verses.source_translation: Takal piayuh sidadu Roma deꞌ mujuag deꞌ jowin salip Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ pingobos-E deꞌ wat inoh, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Tok bonal Nyaꞌa itih Onak Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh bala dayung deꞌ suwaꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa nyalip Yesus soꞌ juuaꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Maria Magdalena, Salome, baya Maria sinoꞌ Yakobus deꞌ mudaꞌ duoh Yoses.

verses.text: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and served him; and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Dayung-dayung deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus takal-e deꞌ Galilea ngan-e tulung-E.  Bogoꞌ geh dayung-dayung deꞌ bokon deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ deꞌ suwaꞌ nog keꞌ Yerusalem samah-samah duoh Yesus.

verses.text: When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for God’s Kingdom, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom Yusuf soꞌ kupuaꞌ Arimatea nog.Yusuf itih suwaꞌ jadin ayua soꞌ Pengadilan Agama Yahudi deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-e.  Yoh itih tuang suwaꞌ geh kajon Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja.  Onu inoh, nyaꞌa moꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ nyamut Onu Sabat.  Inoh leh ngan-e yoh maksa-e jaꞌ-e odop-e odi ngaduap Pilatus, yohmoꞌ mitiaꞌ todang Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngubul-e.

verses.text: Pilate marveled if he were already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he had been dead long.
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ ilan-e takal-e ngojit Yesus moꞌ kobos.  Iyoh moꞌ mogan piayuh sidadu ngan-e yaꞌ sikian podo Yesus moꞌ bonal-bonal kobos.

verses.text: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ ngojit soꞌ piayuh sidadu inoh nang Yesus moꞌ kobos, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ Yusuf mit todang Yesus.

verses.text: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
verses.source_translation: Yusuf moꞌ milih kain mopuꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ molut todang.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ pimuun todang Yesus, yoh moꞌ molut-e, yoh moꞌ naꞌ daang kubul gua.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh pigulai batuh deꞌ ayuh ngan-e kuab kubul gua inoh.

verses.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ogiꞌ Maria Magdalena duoh Maria sinoꞌ Yoses suwaꞌ ningaꞌ topat nyaꞌa piguling todang Yesus.

chapters.text: Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate. Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered, “So you say.” The chief priests accused him of many things. Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!” But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled. Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they asked of him. There was one called Barabbas, bound with his fellow insurgents, men who in the insurrection had committed murder. The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them. Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?” For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up. But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead. Pilate again asked them, “What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?” They cried out again, “Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they cried out exceedingly, “Crucify him!” Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified. The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort. They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him. They began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!” They struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him. When they had mocked him, they took the purple off him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him. They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross. They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, “The place of a skull.” They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn’t take it. Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take. It was the third hour,  and they crucified him. The superscription of his accusation was written over him, “THE KING OF THE JEWS.” With him they crucified two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left. The Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was counted with transgressors.”  Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads, and saying, “Ha! You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save yourself, and come down from the cross!” Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said, “He saved others. He can’t save himself. Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him.”  Those who were crucified with him also insulted him. When the sixth hour  had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.  At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is, being interpreted, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”  Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he is calling Elijah.” One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down.” Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit. The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom. When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!” There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome; who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and served him; and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem. When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath, Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for God’s Kingdom, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body. Pilate marveled if he were already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he had been dead long. When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph. He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb. Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.

verses.text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.
verses.source_translation: Takal mokuaꞌ onu Sabat, Maria Magdalena, Salome, duoh Maria sinoꞌ Yakobus odi milih inyuaꞌ wangi deꞌ yaꞌ toban-e keꞌ kubul gua, ngan-e yaꞌ nginyuaꞌ todang Yesus.

verses.text: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.
verses.source_translation: Daang puꞌun minggu inoh, suam-suam pagi takal boton onu moꞌ tumuꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul gua.

verses.text: They were saying among themselves, “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?”
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ lopot olan yoh moꞌ bisikian si odop-e, “Osi deꞌ taan gulai batuh deꞌ kuab kubul gua saꞌan otoꞌ?”

verses.text: for it was very big. Looking up, they saw that the stone was rolled back.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal-e moꞌ sinok kubul gua inoh, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ batuh deꞌ sukup ayuh inoh moꞌ tigulai.

verses.text: Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were amazed.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ molot kaang kubul gua inoh, yoh moꞌ gogoh takal-e ningaꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan onak mudaꞌ deꞌ pakai bojuh mopuꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: He said to them, “Don’t be amazed. You seek Jesus, the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen. He is not here. Behold, the place where they laid him!
verses.source_translation: Onak mudaꞌ inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ tolu! Okuꞌ puꞌan nang ingan kalik Yesus ulang Nazaret deꞌ moꞌ obuah nyalib inoh.  Iyoh moꞌ doiꞌ datiꞌ! Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip! Ningaꞌ itih topat nyaꞌa posan todang-E.

verses.text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he said to you.’”
verses.source_translation: Buu paliꞌ adin, tanon gah itih tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E baya Petrus.  In nyeꞌ tanon tuduꞌ-e, ‘Yesus dioꞌ odi kajon ingan deꞌ Galilea.  Danih leh ingan yaꞌ bitapod duoh Iyoh kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ-e tanon-E.’ ”

verses.text: They went out, and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come on them. They said nothing to anyone; for they were afraid.
verses.source_translation: Daang kila deꞌ gogoh duoh sukup tolu-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh luah togan kubul gua inoh.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tanon oni-oni-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod-e deꞌ olan dop-e yoh tolu.  Yesus bitanga Odop-E tuduꞌ Maria Magdalena

verses.text: Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip, suam-suam pagi deꞌ puꞌun minggu inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bitanga odop-E, sibungas-e tuduꞌ Maria Magdalena.  Iyoh itih leh deꞌ ogiꞌ onu Yesus kasig juꞌ muat munua soꞌ gonan-e.

verses.text: She went and told those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Maria Magdalena moꞌ odi tanon tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ siꞌian, dop-e yoh aluaꞌ susah otin-e.

verses.text: When they heard that he was alive, and had been seen by her, they disbelieved.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit soꞌ Maria Magdalena nang yoh kilin Yesus paliꞌ mokat idip, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: After these things he was revealed in another form to two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ bitanga Odop-E tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E, pak-e okon mun jowin-E, takal odop-e deꞌ duwoh daang pimonu-e soꞌ Yerusalem odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: They went away and told it to the rest. They didn’t believe them, either.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ dingan-dingan-e yohmoꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kilin-e.  Pak-e ayua dingan-e tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: Afterward he was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they didn’t believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sadiꞌ-e lasuꞌ bitapod duoh simoong niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ julah-e man.  Yesus moꞌ ngalah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ liꞌiang bak-e duoh doliaꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon nang odop-e moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus takal-e paliꞌ idip.

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into all the world, and preach the Good News to the whole creation.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, in-E, “Kodak leh nog tubon longit nyeꞌ moꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who disbelieves will be condemned.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh obuah baptis iyoh yaꞌ silamat.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngukum.

verses.text: These signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new languages;
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa.  Ingan tapod kasig muat munua daang adon Okuꞌ, ponai nang sina deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh ingan bilajal-e.

verses.text: they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will in no way hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam ingan kagian dipoh duoh nuak lasun doiꞌ geh oni-oni wat ingan odaꞌ-e.  Moꞌ nyam ingan tomaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam, iyoh tapod mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: So then the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e mokuaꞌ sina duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Topaꞌ Yesus moꞌ tipa'ad keꞌ siluga.  Danih Iyoh moꞌ militah samah-samah duoh Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ siluga.

verses.text: They went out, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ odi niꞌ pulou-pulou tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Odop Topaꞌ tuang suwaꞌ geh kiloja samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh ngin-e geh kuasa tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e nai bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, saꞌ-e jadin tanda nang gah deꞌ tanon-e inoh bonal-bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.     GAH DEꞌ PAGUH DEꞌ TANON LUKAS

chapters.text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, that they might come and anoint him. Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen. They were saying among themselves, “Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?” for it was very big. Looking up, they saw that the stone was rolled back. Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were amazed. He said to them, “Don’t be amazed. You seek Jesus, the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen. He is not here. Behold, the place where they laid him! But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he said to you.’” They went out, and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come on them. They said nothing to anyone; for they were afraid.  Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons. She went and told those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept. When they heard that he was alive, and had been seen by her, they disbelieved. After these things he was revealed in another form to two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country. They went away and told it to the rest. They didn’t believe them, either. Afterward he was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they didn’t believe those who had seen him after he had risen. He said to them, “Go into all the world, and preach the Good News to the whole creation.   He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who disbelieves will be condemned.   These signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new languages;   they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will in no way hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.” So then the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God. They went out, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.

verses.text: Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,
verses.source_translation: Pinajoh Tuduꞌ ingan Teofilius, Noꞌuh-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ suba nulis silita pingidip Yesus, nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi daang uluk otoꞌ.

verses.text: even as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word delivered them to us,
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nulis silita inoh samah kodaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon nyaꞌa deꞌ tok-tok ogiꞌ kilin duoh magah oni deꞌ soꞌ sibungas-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi.

verses.text: it seemed good to me also, having traced the course of all things accurately from the first, to write to you in order, most excellent Theophilus;
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh okuꞌ moꞌ tiluti silita inoh tiꞌ-e soꞌ sibungas-e, okuꞌ kila paguh okuꞌ nulis buk-e saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: that you might know the certainty concerning the things in which you were instructed.
verses.source_translation: Saꞌ ingan puꞌan, oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ obuah tanon duoh deꞌ obuah ngajal suaꞌ-e inoh tok-tok bonal jadi.

verses.text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the priestly division of Abijah. He had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.source_translation: Takal Herodes jadi laja deꞌ propinsi Yudea, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ adon-e Zakharia soꞌ uluk Abia.  Sowon-e onak-sukun Harun deꞌ adon-e Elisabet.

verses.text: They were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Idip Zakharia duwoh sowon-e nyonang otin Topaꞌ, sobab odop-e deꞌ duwoh silalu idip nunaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e sobab Elisabet manang yomoꞌ soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ sikiya nyoma.

verses.text: Now while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his division,
verses.source_translation: Takal nog onu-e uluk Abia soꞌon tugas, watinoh geh Zakharia nai kiloja-e daang Boli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to enter into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ takal-e nguni kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa pimipin agama Yahudi nai-e Zakharia deꞌ soꞌon, yoh deꞌ nyouh kinamai daang Boli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: The whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e nyouh kinamai, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bidoa deꞌ sopaꞌ.

verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ogiꞌ malaikat Topaꞌ bitanga odop-e tuduꞌ Zakharia.  Iyoh mujuag deꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh mija soꞌ topat-e nyouh kinamai.

verses.text: Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Zakharia ningaꞌ malaikat inoh, iyoh moꞌ gogoh simadi-e tolu.

verses.text: But the angel said to him, “Don’t be afraid, Zacharias, because your request has been heard, and your wife, Elizabeth, will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e malaikat inoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Maꞌ tolu, Zakharia! Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ ngojit doamuꞌ, sowonmuꞌ Elisabet yaꞌ milaꞌ onak dali, yomoꞌ muꞌu halus biladon onak inoh Yohanes.

verses.text: You will have joy and gladness; and many will rejoice at his birth.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu baya suaꞌ nyaꞌa suwaꞌ doon takal onak inoh limokah tieꞌ sodiꞌ neh.

verses.text: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and he will drink no wine nor strong drink. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh timogah deꞌ boton Topaꞌ, iyoh idoh diꞌ-e nuak pingunuak deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mabuk, soꞌ daang toꞌin sinoꞌ-e geh iyoh moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: He will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord, their God.
verses.source_translation: Yoh yaꞌ toban bogoꞌ ulang Israel paliꞌ saꞌan nunaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ militah idip-e.

verses.text: He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, ‘to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,’ and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to prepare a people prepared for the Lord.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ nyidia nyaꞌa saꞌan tilimaꞌ Topaꞌ duoh Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e saꞌ-a ponai kiloja kodaꞌ nabi Elia, deꞌ ponai nai samaꞌ duoh onak bidamai, yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e taat iyoh toban paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.  Watinoh wat-e iyoh sidia umat kaꞌan Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Zacharias said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ in Zakharia tuduꞌ malaikat inoh, “Oniwat kuꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ nang ingan inoh yaꞌ bonal jadi? Oni tanda-e? Sobab okuꞌ duoh sowonkuꞌ moꞌ nyoma.”

verses.text: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. I was sent to speak to you, and to bring you this good news.
verses.source_translation: Malaikat inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ itih Gabriel.  Okuꞌ itih utusan Topaꞌ kaꞌan tanon gah deꞌ paguh itih tuduꞌ muꞌu.

verses.text: Behold, you will be silent and not able to speak, until the day that these things will happen, because you didn’t believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their proper time.”
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ nang kuꞌ itih totap jadi takal onu-e, pak-e sobab muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ, muꞌu bebeꞌ nog suaꞌ-suaꞌ sinakuꞌ itih tok-tok jadi.”

verses.text: The people were waiting for Zacharias, and they marveled that he delayed in the temple.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ kajon Zakharia, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ilan oni ngan Zakharia tian oni daang Boli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: When he came out, he could not speak to them, and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple. He continued making signs to them, and remained mute.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e luah, iyoh diꞌ-e ponai sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yomoꞌ tanon tanda pakai tongan-e.  Takal inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan nang iyoh ogiꞌ kilin tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: When the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his house.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu kiloja-e moꞌ obuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: After these days Elizabeth, his wife, conceived, and she hid herself five months, saying,
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ-e tui soꞌ inoh, Elisabet moꞌ bitiiaꞌ.  Limoh bulan iyoh diꞌ-e luah soꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: “Thus has the Lord done to me in the days in which he looked at me, to take away my reproach among men.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ tulung okuꞌ, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tiaꞌ dasaꞌ deꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.”

verses.text: Now in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,
verses.source_translation: Takal tiiaꞌ Elisabet moꞌ nuam bulan, Topaꞌ odaꞌ malaikat deꞌ adon-e Gabriel odi keꞌ Nazaret, kota deꞌ propinsi Galilea.

verses.text: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man whose name was Joseph, of David’s house. The virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.source_translation: Gabriel odi tuduꞌ dayung bujang tiboon, deꞌ adon-e Maria.  Maria inoh moꞌ bitunang duoh dali deꞌ adon-e Yusuf onak-sukun laja Daud.

verses.text: Having come in, the angel said to her, “Rejoice, you highly favored one! The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women!”
verses.source_translation: Malaikat inoh nog tuduꞌ Maria yoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Salam, muꞌu deꞌ obuah bilokat deꞌ jok-e saꞌan muꞌu soꞌ Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ bisamah duoh muꞌu!”

verses.text: But when she saw him, she was greatly troubled at the saying, and considered what kind of salutation this might be.
verses.source_translation: Maria moꞌ gogoh sijaꞌ-e ngojit sina malaikat inoh, yoh moꞌ sina daang otin-e oni loti salam inoh.

verses.text: The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
verses.source_translation: Inohleh sobab-e malaikat moꞌ sina in-e, “Maꞌ muꞌ tolu Maria, sobab Topaꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ muꞌu.

verses.text: Behold, you will conceive in your womb, and give birth to a son, and will call his name ‘Jesus.’
verses.source_translation: Ngojit nyeꞌ! Muꞌu totap yaꞌ bitiiaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh milaꞌ onak dali deꞌ halus muꞌ biladon Yesus.

verses.text: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father, David,
verses.source_translation: Yoh yaꞌ jadi piayuh timogah duoh yaꞌ obuah sobot Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bigatung-e.  Topaꞌ yaꞌ pakat yoh jadi Laja kodaꞌ Daud sumuk babai-E.

verses.text: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever. There will be no end to his Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh deꞌ yaꞌ militah jadin Laja tun bangsa Israel deꞌ sitelus-e, diꞌ-e ponai obuaꞌ.”

verses.text: Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, seeing I am a virgin?”
verses.source_translation: In Maria tuduꞌ malaikat inoh, “Pak-e okuꞌ tih dayung bujang tiboon, oni wat-e ngan neh ponai jadi watinoh?”

verses.text: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore also the holy one who is born from you will be called the Son of God.
verses.source_translation: Malaikat inoh moꞌ nyawot Maria in-e, “Iyang Topaꞌ muun tuduꞌ muꞌu, kuasa Topaꞌ inohleh deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu bitiiaꞌ inoh ngan Onak Kudus deꞌ yaꞌ muꞌu milaꞌ inoh obuah sobot Onak Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Behold, Elizabeth, your relative, also has conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month with her who was called barren.
verses.source_translation: Puꞌan muꞌ kedoh, Elisabet, madihmuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nyoma, deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bitiiaꞌ noꞌuh-e sobab yoh manang, adin moꞌ bitiiaꞌ nuam bulan.

verses.text: For nothing spoken by God is impossible.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ dapod nai-e.”

verses.text: Mary said, “Behold, the servant of the Lord; let it be done to me according to your word.” The angel departed from her.
verses.source_translation: Maria moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ itih kuli Topaꞌ tanahleh saꞌ-e jadi tuduꞌ okuꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ nang ingan noh.” Mokuaꞌ noh malaikat moꞌ buu togan Maria.

verses.text: Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah,
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh, Maria moꞌ bigaut-biguaꞌ odi keꞌ kota deꞌ sinok dolod-dolod deꞌ propinsi Yudea.

verses.text: and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ iyoh molot keꞌ boli Zakharia, yomoꞌ ngin salam tuduꞌ Elisabet.

verses.text: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.source_translation: Takal Elisabet ngojit salam soꞌ Maria, onak daang toꞌin-e moꞌ kimilit, yomoꞌ Elisabet punuaꞌ daang Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: She called out with a loud voice, and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
verses.source_translation: Elisabet moꞌ nang sina dolas-dolas-e, “Obuah bilokat muꞌu soꞌ suaꞌ dayung deꞌ bokon! Obuah bilokat onakmuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ limokah!

verses.text: Why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verses.source_translation: Bituah manah okuꞌ itih ngan sinoꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ kuꞌ nog tuduꞌ okuꞌ.

verses.text: For behold, when the voice of your greeting came into my ears, the baby leaped in my womb for joy!
verses.source_translation: Takal okuꞌ ngojit salam muꞌu, onak daang toꞌin kuꞌ lasuꞌ kimilit doon.

verses.text: Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord!”
verses.source_translation: Doonleh muꞌu Maria, sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ inoh tok yaꞌ jadi.”

verses.text: Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Maria moꞌ sina in-e, “Otinkuꞌ mudi Topaꞌ,

verses.text: My spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior,
verses.source_translation: duoh kilakuꞌ sonang sobab Topaꞌ Pinyilamat okuꞌ.

verses.text: for he has looked at the humble state of his servant. For behold, from now on, all generations will call me blessed.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh natong okuꞌ, kuli-E deꞌ hina itih! Soꞌ adin suaꞌ-suaꞌ binua nang okuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling sonang-e.

verses.text: For he who is mighty has done great things for me. Holy is his name.
verses.source_translation: Sobab Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bikuasa duoh deꞌ moꞌ nai bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ayuh tuduꞌ okuꞌ.  Kudusleh adon-E!

verses.text: His mercy is for generations of generations on those who fear him.
verses.source_translation: Duoh Topaꞌ silalu masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip tolu tuduꞌ Iyoh.

verses.text: He has shown strength with his arm. He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh bitanga kuasa pakai tongan-E, Yoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ samuh otin-e buu katiꞌ-kanih.

verses.text: He has put down princes from their thrones. And has exalted the lowly.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ pilabuꞌ laja-laja deꞌ militah, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ hina, Iyoh kakat-e.

verses.text: He has filled the hungry with good things. He has sent the rich away empty.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ pilai Iyoh odaꞌ busuah, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya Iyoh odaꞌ buꞌu boloh-boloh-e.

verses.text: He has given help to Israel, his servant, that he might remember mercy,
As he spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and his offspring forever.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh tulung Israel kuli-E sobab Iyoh natong janyi-e tuduꞌ sumuk babai toꞌ.  Topaꞌ natong janyi-e, Iyoh masiꞌ tuduꞌ Abraham baya otoꞌ onak sukun-e nog sitelus-e.”

verses.text: Mary stayed with her about three months, and then returned to her house.
verses.source_translation: Kulang lobih taluh bulan Maria loꞌo duoh Elisabet, ke iyoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: Now the time that Elizabeth should give birth was fulfilled, and she gave birth to a son.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ nog onu Elisabet yaꞌ milaꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ milaꞌ onak dali.

verses.text: Her neighbors and her relatives heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy towards her, and they rejoiced with her.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua-e baya dingan-e moꞌ suwaꞌ sonang kila-e, takal-e moh klingah gah Topaꞌ sukup paguh otin tuduꞌ Elisabet.

verses.text: On the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
verses.source_translation: Takal onak kueꞌ inoh moih onu umul-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog yaꞌ bisunat-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ biladon-e Zakharia kodaꞌ adon samaꞌ-a,

verses.text: His mother answered, “Not so; but he will be called John.”
verses.source_translation: pak-e sinoꞌ-e nang, “Idoh! Adon-e Yohanes.”

verses.text: They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in-e, “Doiꞌ nak ogiꞌ madih ayuamuꞌ deꞌ adon inoh.”

verses.text: They made signs to his father, what he would have him called.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin tanda tuduꞌ Zakharia ngan-e yaꞌ sikian adon onak-e.

verses.text: He asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, “His name is John.” They all marveled.
verses.source_translation: Zakharia moꞌ mitiaꞌ batuh, iyoh moꞌ nulis deꞌ tun-e, “Adon-e Yohanes.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ilan-e.

verses.text: His mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue freed, and he spoke, blessing God.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh Zakharia moꞌ lasuꞌ ponai paliꞌ sina yoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Fear came on all who lived around them, and all these sayings were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo sinoꞌ iyoh moꞌ tolu, ngojit duoh ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi, gah inoh suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa ngojit-e nog suaꞌ dolod-dolod deꞌ propinsi Yudea.

verses.text: All who heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, “What then will this child be?” The hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit gah inoh moꞌ sina daang otin-e, “Yaꞌ jadi oni onak-e inoh tiaꞌ ijoꞌ?” Sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ bisamah duoh-o.

verses.text: His father, Zacharias, was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,
verses.source_translation: Zakharia, samaꞌ onak kueꞌ inoh punuaꞌ daang Iyang Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ tanon sibaya soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: “Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, for he has visited and redeemed his people;
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ bangsa Israel! Sobab Iyoh moꞌ nog tulung duoh pilopas umat-E.

verses.text: and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moh ngin pinyilamat deꞌ bikuasa tuduꞌ otoꞌ soꞌ onak-sukun laja Daud, kuli-E.

verses.text: (as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets who have been from of old),
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin pinyilamat inoh kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi-E, pakai nabi-nabi deꞌ obuah pilih-E noꞌuh-e,

verses.text: salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all who hate us;
verses.source_translation: kaꞌan pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ musoh baya soꞌ kuasa nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ otoꞌ.

verses.text: to show mercy towards our fathers, to remember his holy covenant,
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e bitanga nyayang-E tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ nai samah kodaꞌ janyi-E deꞌ kudus.

verses.text: the oath which he swore to Abraham, our father,
to grant to us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, should serve him without fear,
verses.source_translation: Sobab Iyoh moꞌ bijanyi duoh bisupah tuduꞌ Abraham sumuk babai otoꞌ, yomoꞌ bijanyi pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ musoh toꞌ, saꞌ otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tolu tiaꞌ takal toꞌ simayang tuduꞌ-E,

verses.text: In holiness and righteousness before him all the days of our life.
verses.source_translation: duoh saꞌ otoꞌ idip bonal duoh nyonang otin-E niꞌ umul idip toꞌ.”

verses.text: And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High, for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways,
verses.source_translation: Zakharia moꞌ sina tuduꞌ onak-e, “Onakkuꞌ, muꞌu yaꞌ obuah sobot nyaꞌa nang nabi Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bigatung deꞌ yaꞌ dioꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ sidia olan kaꞌan Topaꞌ,

verses.text: to give knowledge of salvation to his people by the remission of their sins,
verses.source_translation: kaꞌan tanon tuduꞌ umat-E, nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ obuah nyilamat sobab Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun dosa-e.

verses.text: because of the tender mercy of our God, whereby the dawn from on high will visit us,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ otoꞌ paguh otin-e baya pinyayang; Iyoh nog nyilamat otoꞌ kodaꞌ boton onu deꞌ mokat deꞌ siliꞌ jawaꞌ,

verses.text: to shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death; to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nog toban jawaꞌ-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang mopung baya tolu yaꞌ kobos.  Topaꞌ kayak otoꞌ saꞌ otoꞌ idip bidamai duoh-E.”

verses.text: The child was growing, and becoming strong in spirit, and was in the desert until the day of his public appearance to Israel.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ mokat bujang yomoꞌ pikil-e moꞌ tuꞌuh daang Topaꞌ.  Iyoh loꞌo deꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e, ngan-e yaꞌ kajon onu-e yaꞌ odi nai kiloja-e deꞌ uluk bangsa Israel.

chapters.text: Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us, even as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word delivered them to us, it seemed good to me also, having traced the course of all things accurately from the first, to write to you in order, most excellent Theophilus; that you might know the certainty concerning the things in which you were instructed. There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the priestly division of Abijah. He had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth. They were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord. But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years. Now while he executed the priest’s office before God in the order of his division, according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to enter into the temple of the Lord and burn incense. The whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense. An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense. Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him. But the angel said to him, “Don’t be afraid, Zacharias, because your request has been heard, and your wife, Elizabeth, will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John. You will have joy and gladness; and many will rejoice at his birth. For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and he will drink no wine nor strong drink. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb. He will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord, their God. He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, ‘to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,’ and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to prepare a people prepared for the Lord.” Zacharias said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.” The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. I was sent to speak to you, and to bring you this good news. Behold, you will be silent and not able to speak, until the day that these things will happen, because you didn’t believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their proper time.” The people were waiting for Zacharias, and they marveled that he delayed in the temple. When he came out, he could not speak to them, and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple. He continued making signs to them, and remained mute. When the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his house. After these days Elizabeth, his wife, conceived, and she hid herself five months, saying, “Thus has the Lord done to me in the days in which he looked at me, to take away my reproach among men.” Now in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee, named Nazareth, to a virgin pledged to be married to a man whose name was Joseph, of David’s house. The virgin’s name was Mary. Having come in, the angel said to her, “Rejoice, you highly favored one! The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women!” But when she saw him, she was greatly troubled at the saying, and considered what kind of salutation this might be. The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God. Behold, you will conceive in your womb, and give birth to a son, and will call his name ‘Jesus.’ He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father, David, and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever. There will be no end to his Kingdom.” Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, seeing I am a virgin?” The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore also the holy one who is born from you will be called the Son of God. Behold, Elizabeth, your relative, also has conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month with her who was called barren. For nothing spoken by God is impossible.” Mary said, “Behold, the servant of the Lord; let it be done to me according to your word.” The angel departed from her. Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah, and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth. When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit. She called out with a loud voice, and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb! Why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me? For behold, when the voice of your greeting came into my ears, the baby leaped in my womb for joy! Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord!” Mary said, “My soul magnifies the Lord. My spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior, for he has looked at the humble state of his servant. For behold, from now on, all generations will call me blessed. For he who is mighty has done great things for me. Holy is his name. His mercy is for generations of generations on those who fear him. He has shown strength with his arm. He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts. He has put down princes from their thrones. And has exalted the lowly. He has filled the hungry with good things. He has sent the rich away empty. He has given help to Israel, his servant, that he might remember mercy, As he spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and his offspring forever.” Mary stayed with her about three months, and then returned to her house. Now the time that Elizabeth should give birth was fulfilled, and she gave birth to a son. Her neighbors and her relatives heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy towards her, and they rejoiced with her. On the eighth day, they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of his father. His mother answered, “Not so; but he will be called John.” They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.” They made signs to his father, what he would have him called. He asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, “His name is John.” They all marveled. His mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue freed, and he spoke, blessing God. Fear came on all who lived around them, and all these sayings were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea. All who heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, “What then will this child be?” The hand of the Lord was with him. His father, Zacharias, was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying, “Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, for he has visited and redeemed his people; and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David (as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets who have been from of old), salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all who hate us; to show mercy towards our fathers, to remember his holy covenant, the oath which he swore to Abraham, our father, to grant to us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, should serve him without fear, In holiness and righteousness before him all the days of our life. And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High, for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways, to give knowledge of salvation to his people by the remission of their sins, because of the tender mercy of our God, whereby the dawn from on high will visit us, to shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death; to guide our feet into the way of peace.” The child was growing, and becoming strong in spirit, and was in the desert until the day of his public appearance to Israel.

verses.text: Now in those days, a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be enrolled.
verses.source_translation: Kila-kila nuam bulan mokuaꞌ Yohanes obuah milaꞌ, takal inoh Kaisar Agustus ngin pilitah tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kerajaan Roma odi daftal odop-e deꞌ kupuaꞌ sumuk babai-e, ngan-e yaꞌ ngituang nyaꞌa.

verses.text: This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.source_translation: Inohleh ituang nyaꞌa deꞌ sibungas-e deꞌ nai Kirenius takal-e jadi gubenul deꞌ Siria.

verses.text: All went to enroll themselves, everyone to his own city.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ paliꞌ takal inoh, suaꞌ-a paliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ sumuk babai-e ngan-e yaꞌ daftal odop-e masim-masim.

verses.text: Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to David’s city, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David;
verses.source_translation: Yusuf tuang watinoh geh odi soꞌ Nazaret deꞌ Galilea keꞌ Betlehem deꞌ Yudea, topat laja Daud obuah milaꞌ, sobab Yusuf onak-sukun Daud.

verses.text: to enroll himself with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him as wife, being pregnant.
verses.source_translation: Yusuf daftal odop-e baya Maria tunang-e deꞌ bitiiaꞌ.

verses.text: While they were there, the day had come for her to give birth.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yusuf duoh Maria deꞌ Betlehem, Maria moꞌ nog onu-e yaꞌ milaꞌ.

verses.text: She gave birth to her firstborn son. She wrapped him in bands of cloth, and laid him in a feeding trough, because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.source_translation: Maria milaꞌ onak pinuan-e deꞌ dali.  Yoh moꞌ molut-e pakai kain lapin, yomoꞌ piguling onak-e noh deꞌ daang dulang binatang deꞌ topas-e pakai duh sai-e boli-boli soꞌo yaꞌ ngilumon obuaꞌ punuaꞌ.

verses.text: There were shepherds in the same country staying in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ kota Betlehem ngan onu moꞌ ngalom ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala ngilumon deꞌ padang nguan domba deꞌ kidip-e.

verses.text: Behold, an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.
verses.source_translation: Tang-tang niꞌ naꞌan malaikat Topaꞌ bitanga odop-e, sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, jawaꞌ sijaꞌ-a soꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ ting odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

verses.text: The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be to all the people.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e malaikat inoh moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ tolu, Sobab Okuꞌ nog tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh kaꞌan ingan, Gah deꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa sonang.”

verses.text: For there is born to you today, in David’s city, a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Onu itih moꞌ obuah milaꞌ kaꞌan ingan Pinyilamat manusia deꞌ kota laja Daud.  Yoh iyohleh Piayuh, Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: This is the sign to you: you will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a feeding trough.”
verses.source_translation: Itihleh tanda-e, “Ingan odi kalik Kuweꞌ deꞌ obuah molut kai kain lapin, deꞌ piguling-e deꞌ topat pinguman binatang.”

verses.text: Suddenly, there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army praising God, and saying,
verses.source_translation: Tang-tang malaikat inoh baya bogoꞌ sidadu malaikat deꞌ bokon, mudi Topaꞌ in-e,

verses.text: “Glory to God in the highest, on earth peace, good will toward men.”
verses.source_translation: “Mudileh Topaꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ paling bigatung! Baya deꞌ tun tanaꞌ, sonangleh idip manusia deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ!”

verses.text: When the angels went away from them into the sky, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem, now, and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh malaikat deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌu togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ sulga.  Kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba sina siodop-e, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ keꞌ Betlehem ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ danih, deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ.”

verses.text: They came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the baby was lying in the feeding trough.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nguan domba lasuꞌ odi.  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh dapod Maria duoh Yusuf baya kuweꞌ-e deꞌ piguling-e deꞌ topat pinguman binatang.

verses.text: When they saw it, they publicized widely the saying which was spoken to them about this child.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ Kuweꞌ inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ silita Kuweꞌ Yusuf duoh Maria tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ nang malaikat tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan takal-e ngojit silita kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba inoh.

verses.text: But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Maria nak daang kila-e, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ bipikil.

verses.text: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, just as it was told them.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan gembala deꞌ nguan domba inoh paliꞌ keꞌ padang topat-e nguan binatang simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ sulga, sobab suaꞌ oni deꞌ ngojit-e, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e bonal-bonal kodaꞌ deꞌ nang malaikat.

verses.text: When eight days were fulfilled for the circumcision of the child, his name was called Jesus, which was given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.source_translation: Takal umul kuweꞌ Maria moꞌ moih onu, yoh moꞌ odi bisunat-E.  Pingoma-E moꞌ biladon kuweꞌ-e inoh Yesus, sobab adon inoh deꞌ tanon malaikat tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-E takal aluaꞌ diꞌ bitiiaꞌ-a.

verses.text: When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord
verses.source_translation: Nog onu-e Yusuf duoh Maria nai upacara kibisig kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ milaꞌ kodaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa.  Takal inoh geh Yusuf duoh Maria toban onak-E keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem kaꞌan ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”),
verses.source_translation: Sobab deꞌ daang plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa in-e, “Tibilang onak pinuan nyaꞌa deꞌ dali halus nyeꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.”
verses.source_translation: Kaꞌan upacara kibisig, odop-e duoh inoh ngin kulban tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ toban duwoh polong manuk, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu daang pilitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, “Nyouhleh duwoh polong manuk gugul atou duwoh polong manuk merpati.”

verses.text: Behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh deꞌ Yerusalem ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon-e Simeon.  Simeon nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh, nyaꞌa deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Iyang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh-e.  Iyoh silalu bialap Laja deꞌ Janyi Topaꞌ nog nyilamat bangsa Israel.

verses.text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.source_translation: Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Simeon, nang Simeon diꞌ-e dioꞌ kobos ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ningaꞌ Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: He came in the Spirit into the temple. When the parents brought in the child, Jesus, that they might do concerning him according to the custom of the law,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nutuan Simeon odaꞌ molot keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.  Takal inoh pingoma-E toban Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ isoꞌ inoh, ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu ukum agama Yahudi.

verses.text: then he received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simeon pakuaꞌ Yesus.  Simeon moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ in-e,

verses.text: “Now you are releasing your servant, Master, according to your word, in peace;
verses.source_translation: “Topaꞌ, tanahleh adin okuꞌ kobos daang kila deꞌ sonang, sobab Ingan moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ.

verses.text: for my eyes have seen your salvation,
verses.source_translation: Sobab pakai botonkuꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Pinyilamat deꞌ soꞌ Ingan.

verses.text: which you have prepared before the face of all peoples;
verses.source_translation: Pinyilamat kaꞌan suaꞌ bangsa, Ingan moꞌ sidia-e.

verses.text: a light for revelation to the nations, and the glory of your people Israel.”
verses.source_translation: Pinyilamat inoh kodaꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ kaꞌan bangsa-bangsa deꞌ bokon, iyohleh jawaꞌ deꞌ ngin adon deꞌ paguh kaꞌan umat Ingan, Israel.”

verses.text: Joseph and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yusuf duoh Maria ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Simeon yoh moꞌ ilan-e.

verses.text: and Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, “Behold, this child is set for the falling and the rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which is spoken against.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Simeon bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ blokat Yusuf duoh Maria.  Simeon sina tuduꞌ Maria, “Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih onak itih kaꞌan ngukum duoh nyilamat bogoꞌ ulang Israel.  Yoh kodaꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ nulak-E.

verses.text: Yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul, that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh, nyaꞌa yaꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nyikon daang kila nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Yomoꞌ yaꞌ nog onu-e otinmuꞌ monam kodaꞌ obuah ngamuk kai asual deꞌ lojaꞌ.”

verses.text: There was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh niꞌ nabi, odop-e dayung deꞌ moꞌ nyoma, umul-e moꞌ moih puluꞌ pat sowaꞌ, adon-e Hana.

verses.text: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn’t depart from the temple, worshiping with fastings and petitions night and day.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh onak Fanuel soꞌ suku Asyer.  Moꞌ juꞌ sowaꞌ bonon-e doiꞌ, Hana jadin jana.  Hana diꞌ-e buu soꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, pak-e bilang konu singonu singalom simayang, bidoa, baya puasa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who were looking for redemption in Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Takal Simeon aluaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Maria duoh Yusuf, Hana odi tuduꞌ Yesus, yoh mudi Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ Hana silalu silita Yesus obuah milaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon onu Topaꞌ pilopas ulang Israel soꞌ Roma.

verses.text: When they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ pingoma Yesus nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ halus-e yoh nai-e, nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Nazaret deꞌ Galilea.

verses.text: The child was growing, and was becoming strong in spirit, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.
verses.source_translation: Onak inoh moꞌ bitamah ayuh, dolas.  Yoh bijak, Yoh moꞌ obuah nyayang odaꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: His parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover.
verses.source_translation: Bilang Sowaꞌ pingoma Yesus odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut Onu Paskah.

verses.text: When he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast,
