verses.source_translation: Takal umul Yesus simoong duwoh sowaꞌ, Yesus nunaꞌ pingoma-E odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut Onu Paskah inoh kodaꞌ deꞌ silalu-e.

verses.text: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn’t know it,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ nyamut Onu Paskah inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ, pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e paliꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yoh aluaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, pingoma-E diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.

verses.text: but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day’s journey, and they looked for him among their relatives and acquaintances.
verses.source_translation: Pingoma-E baꞌ-a nang Yesus ponu bibaya duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Takal moꞌ niꞌ onu-onu pimonu-e, pingoma-e moꞌ kalik Yesus deꞌ uluk madih ayua-e, deꞌ uluk dingan-dingan-e deꞌ ponu bibaya duoh odop-e.

verses.text: When they didn’t find him, they returned to Jerusalem, looking for him.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e diꞌ-e dapod-e, pingoma-e moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem kalik Yesus.

verses.text: After three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the middle of the teachers, both listening to them, and asking them questions.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ taluh onu pingoma-e kalik Yesus, pingoma-E moꞌ dapod-E deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.  Yesus guluꞌ, ngojit simadi-e sikian tuduꞌ gulu agama Yahudi.

verses.text: All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit sina-E moꞌ ilan-e sobab Yoh bijak, Yoh moꞌ nyawot pinyikian gulu agama suaꞌ-e bonal.

verses.text: When they saw him, they were astonished, and his mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us this way? Behold, your father and I were anxiously looking for you.”
verses.source_translation: Pingoma-E tuang ilan-e geh ningaꞌ Yesus, sinoꞌ-e moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-E, “Oni ngan muꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih tuduꞌ koꞌih neh? Koꞌih bigaduh kalik Muꞌu!”

verses.text: He said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Oni ngan Ingan kalik Okuꞌ? Idoh keh diꞌ Ingan puꞌan-e, Okuꞌ halus ogiꞌ daang Boli Samaꞌ Kuꞌ?”

verses.text: They didn’t understand the saying which he spoke to them.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e pingoma-E diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus.

verses.text: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth. He was subject to them, and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ duoh pingoma-e keꞌ Nazaret.  Yoh silalu nulut pingunang pingoma-E.  Suaꞌ hal inoh sinoꞌ-E nyikon daang kila-e.

verses.text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.
verses.source_translation: Yesus bitamah ayuh, bitamah bijak duoh nyonang Topaꞌ baya manusia.

chapters.text: Now in those days, a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be enrolled. This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria. All went to enroll themselves, everyone to his own city. Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to David’s city, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David; to enroll himself with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him as wife, being pregnant. While they were there, the day had come for her to give birth. She gave birth to her firstborn son. She wrapped him in bands of cloth, and laid him in a feeding trough, because there was no room for them in the inn. There were shepherds in the same country staying in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock. Behold, an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified. The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be to all the people. For there is born to you today, in David’s city, a Savior, who is Christ the Lord. This is the sign to you: you will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a feeding trough.” Suddenly, there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army praising God, and saying, “Glory to God in the highest, on earth peace, good will toward men.” When the angels went away from them into the sky, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem, now, and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.” They came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the baby was lying in the feeding trough. When they saw it, they publicized widely the saying which was spoken to them about this child. All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds. But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart. The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, just as it was told them. When eight days were fulfilled for the circumcision of the child, his name was called Jesus, which was given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb. When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”), and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.” Behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him. It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ. He came in the Spirit into the temple. When the parents brought in the child, Jesus, that they might do concerning him according to the custom of the law, then he received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said, “Now you are releasing your servant, Master, according to your word, in peace; for my eyes have seen your salvation, which you have prepared before the face of all peoples; a light for revelation to the nations, and the glory of your people Israel.” Joseph and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him, and Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, “Behold, this child is set for the falling and the rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which is spoken against. Yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul, that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.” There was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity, and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn’t depart from the temple, worshiping with fastings and petitions night and day. Coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who were looking for redemption in Jerusalem. When they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth. The child was growing, and was becoming strong in spirit, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him. His parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover. When he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast, and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn’t know it, but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day’s journey, and they looked for him among their relatives and acquaintances. When they didn’t find him, they returned to Jerusalem, looking for him. After three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the middle of the teachers, both listening to them, and asking them questions. All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers. When they saw him, they were astonished, and his mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us this way? Behold, your father and I were anxiously looking for you.” He said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?” They didn’t understand the saying which he spoke to them. And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth. He was subject to them, and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart. And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.

verses.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.source_translation: Daang sowaꞌ ke simoong limoh Kaisar Tiberius militah Roma, sowaꞌ inoh Pontius Pilatus jadi gubenul deꞌ propinsi Yudea, duoh Herodes laja deꞌ militah deꞌ propinsi Galilea.  Watnoh geh Filipus, madih soꞌ Herodes militah deꞌ propinsi Iturea duoh Trakhonitis, Lisanias iohleh laja deꞌ propinsi Abilene.

verses.text: in the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness.
verses.source_translation: Takal sowaꞌ inoh geh Hanas duoh Kayafas jadi pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ paling ayuh-e, duoh Topaꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yohanes, onak Zakharia.  Takal inoh Yohanes ogiꞌ deꞌ padang pasil deꞌ sukup ayuh-e.

verses.text: He came into all the region around the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for remission of sins.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes odi keꞌ suaꞌ daerah deꞌ sungi Yordan yoh moꞌ tanon saꞌ suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ duoh obuah baptis saꞌ Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.

verses.text: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.
verses.source_translation: Kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk deꞌ nulis Nabi Yesaya noꞌuh-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang bogan-e dolas-dolas deꞌ padang pasil, sidia leh olan kaꞌan Topaꞌ, pilataleh olan kaꞌan-E.

verses.text: Every valley will be filled. Every mountain and hill will be brought low. The crooked will become straight, and the rough ways smooth.
verses.source_translation: Nimok nyeꞌ suaꞌ baluah, suaꞌ dolod, suaꞌ punguꞌ obuah pilata.  Olan deꞌ bidikoꞌ bidiyuah obuah nongon, duoh deꞌ muguꞌ moluak obuah pilata.

verses.text: All flesh will see God’s salvation.’”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dunia yaꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ nyilamat manusia!”

verses.text: He said therefore to the multitudes who went out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa odi tuduꞌ Yohanes saꞌ-e obuah baptis.  Yohanes moꞌ sina in-e, “Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat! Maꞌ ingan pikil ponai lopas soꞌ ukum Topaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog, moꞌ ingan jok ngan obuah baptis sijaꞌ-a.

verses.text: Therefore produce fruits worthy of repentance, and don’t begin to say among yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father;’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones!
verses.source_translation: Jadi bitanga leh pakai pingunai pingidipmuꞌ deꞌ paguh, saꞌ-e jadi bukti muꞌu moꞌ bonal-bonal paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ! Maꞌ ingan bipikil nang ingan diꞌ-e obuah ukum sai Abraham sumuk babai ingan! Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ ponai nai onak-sukun kaꞌan Abraham soꞌ batuh-batuh itih!

verses.text: Even now the ax also lies at the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.”
verses.source_translation: Ukum Topaꞌ samah kodaꞌ kapak deꞌ moꞌ sidia kaꞌan nobong tongon koyuh baya banang-banang-e deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ paguh, duoh yaꞌ obuah timalong kaang opui.”

verses.text: The multitudes asked him, “What then must we do?”
verses.source_translation: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Jadi oni mey deꞌ halus koꞌih nai neh?”

verses.text: He answered them, “He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none. He who has food, let him do likewise.”
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Moꞌ ingan ogiꞌ bojuh duwoh, nginleh niꞌ bojuh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ bojuh-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ pinguman-e, kutungleh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilai.”

verses.text: Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what must we do?”
verses.source_translation: Pinagih-pinagih suke tuang nog tuduꞌ Yohanes saꞌ-a baptis odop-e, yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, koꞌih halus nai oni?”

verses.text: He said to them, “Collect no more than that which is appointed to you.”
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Maꞌ ingan nagih sikiya bogoꞌ soꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notap plitah.”

verses.text: Soldiers also asked him, saying, “What about us? What must we do?” He said to them, “Extort from no one by violence, neither accuse anyone wrongfully. Be content with your wages.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh sidadu sikian tuduꞌ Yohanes, “Oniwat koꞌih neh? Oni deꞌ halus koꞌih nai?” Yohanes moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ kai paksa duoh ngegap saꞌ nyaꞌa ngin duit duꞌ ingan duoh napo nyaꞌa nang nai kiloja diꞌ bonal, pak-e sukupleh duoh pah ingan.”

verses.text: As the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether perhaps he was the Christ,
verses.source_translation: Sobab pingunai Yohanes takal inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon duoh bialap janyi Topaꞌ mulai bisikien, podo Yohanes inoh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ deꞌ kajon manusia.

verses.text: John answered them all, “I indeed baptize you with water, but he comes who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to loosen. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and fire,
verses.source_translation: Inohleh sobab-e Yohanes sina tuduꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Okuꞌ baptis ingan pakai piꞌin, pak-e ogiꞌ lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ okuꞌ.  Bukaꞌ tolin kasut-E sijaꞌ-e diꞌ kuꞌ layak.  Yoh yaꞌ baptis ingan pakai Iyang Topaꞌ duoh opui.

verses.text: whose fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor, and will gather the wheat into his barn; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ tongan-E ogiꞌ tapan kaꞌan napan suaꞌ podi-E nog-e bisig.  Podi Yoh nguluk-E deꞌ daang basal, pak-e suaꞌ oping-e Yoh nyouh-e deꞌ opui deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai pulaꞌ!”

verses.text: Then with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people,
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh Yohanes ngin bogoꞌ buaꞌ ajal deꞌ bokon takal yoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.

verses.text: but Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias, his brother’s  wife, and for all the evil things which Herod had done,
verses.source_translation: Yohanes ngalah geh laja Herodes, sai-e mit Herodias, sowon madih-e jadi sowon-e duoh suaꞌ pingunai-e deꞌ bokon deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: added this also to them all, that he shut up John in prison.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Herodes kibalot Yohanes keꞌ daang jel inohleh pingunai-e deꞌ lobih jaꞌat soꞌ pingunai jaꞌat-e deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus also had been baptized, and was praying. The sky was opened,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yohanes aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah jel yoh moꞌ baptis nyaꞌa bogoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ obuah baptis geh.  Takal Yesus bidoa, longit tibukaꞌ,

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form like a dove on him; and a voice came out of the sky, saying “You are my beloved Son. In you I am well pleased.”
verses.source_translation: yomoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ muun keꞌ tun-E kodaꞌ manuk merpati.  Yoh moꞌ klingah sina Topaꞌ deꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu leh Onak Kuꞌ deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ nyonang otin Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus himself, when he began to teach, was about thirty years old, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.source_translation: Takal umul Yesus taluh puluꞌ sowaꞌ Yoh mulai kiloja.  Nyaꞌa pikil nang, Yesus iyohleh onak Yusuf, onak Eli,

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.source_translation: onak Matat, onak Lewi, onak Malkhi, onak Yanai, onak Yusuf,

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.source_translation: onak Matica, onak Amos, onak Nahum, onak Hesli, onak Nagai,

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah,
verses.source_translation: onak Maat, onak Matica, onak Simei, onak Yosekh, onak Yoda,

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.source_translation: onak Yohanan, onak Resa, onak Zerubabel, onak Sealtiel, onak Neri,

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,
verses.source_translation: onak Malkhi, onak Adi, onak Kosam, onak Elmadam, onak Er,

verses.text: the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.source_translation: onak Yesua, onak Eliezer, onak Yorim, onak Matat, onak Lewi,

verses.text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,
verses.source_translation: onak Simeon, onak Yehuda, onak Yusuf, onak Yonam, onak Elyakim,

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.source_translation: onak Melea, onak Mina, onak Matata, onak Natan, onak Daud,

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
verses.source_translation: onak Isai, onak Obed, onak Boas, onak Salmon, onak Nahason,

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Aram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.source_translation: onak Aminadab, onak Admin, onak Arni, onak Hezron, onak Peres, onak Yehuda,

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.source_translation: onak Yakub, onak Ishak, onak Abraham, onak Terah, onak Nahor,

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.source_translation: onak Serug, onak Rehu, onak Peleg, onak Eber, onak Salmon,

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.source_translation: onak Kenan, onak Arpakhsad, onak Sem, onak Nuh, onak Lamekh,

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.source_translation: onak Metusalah, onak Henokh, onak Yared, onak Mahalaleel, onak Kenan,

verses.text: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.source_translation: onak Enos, onak Set, onak Adam, onak Topaꞌ.

chapters.text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene, in the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness. He came into all the region around the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for remission of sins. As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight. Every valley will be filled. Every mountain and hill will be brought low. The crooked will become straight, and the rough ways smooth. All flesh will see God’s salvation.’” He said therefore to the multitudes who went out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come? Therefore produce fruits worthy of repentance, and don’t begin to say among yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father;’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones! Even now the ax also lies at the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.” The multitudes asked him, “What then must we do?” He answered them, “He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none. He who has food, let him do likewise.” Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what must we do?” He said to them, “Collect no more than that which is appointed to you.” Soldiers also asked him, saying, “What about us? What must we do?” He said to them, “Extort from no one by violence, neither accuse anyone wrongfully. Be content with your wages.” As the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether perhaps he was the Christ, John answered them all, “I indeed baptize you with water, but he comes who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to loosen. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and fire, whose fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor, and will gather the wheat into his barn; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.” Then with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people, but Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias, his brother’s  wife, and for all the evil things which Herod had done, added this also to them all, that he shut up John in prison. Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus also had been baptized, and was praying. The sky was opened, and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form like a dove on him; and a voice came out of the sky, saying “You are my beloved Son. In you I am well pleased.” Jesus himself, when he began to teach, was about thirty years old, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph, the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai, the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah, the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri, the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er, the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim, the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David, the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon, the son of Amminadab, the son of Aram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah, the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor, the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah, the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech, the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan, the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.

verses.text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness
verses.source_translation: Yesus deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ buu soꞌ sungi Yordan, yomoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ mipin Yesus keꞌ padang pasil deꞌ ayuh.

verses.text: for forty days, being tempted by the devil. He ate nothing in those days. Afterward, when they were completed, he was hungry.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ Yesus obuah suba odaꞌ Muot laja munua pat puluꞌ onu pat puluꞌ ngalom, deꞌ tian-tian inoh Yoh diꞌ-e man nog Yoh sukup pilai-e.

verses.text: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
verses.source_translation: Muot moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Muꞌu tih kan Onak Topaꞌ, odaꞌleh batuh itih jadi pinguman!”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Manusia nak-e idip soꞌ pinguman sijaꞌ-a.’”

verses.text: The devil, leading him up on a high mountain, showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.source_translation: Muot moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ topat deꞌ bigatung, mun oni deꞌ diep sijaꞌ Muot moꞌ bitanga suaꞌ daerah kerajaan deꞌ dunia.

verses.text: The devil said to him, “I will give you all this authority, and their glory, for it has been delivered to me; and I give it to whomever I want.
verses.source_translation: Muot moꞌ in-e, “Suaꞌ kuasa kerajaan duoh halta inoh okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Muꞌu, sobab suaꞌ-e itih moꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ, yomoꞌ okuꞌ soꞌon ngin suat simun-e tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ kuꞌ suka.

verses.text: If you therefore will worship before me, it will all be yours.”
verses.source_translation: Asal muꞌu nyomah okuꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin suaꞌ-e tuduꞌ muꞌu.”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Get behind me Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Jok-e Topaꞌ patut nyeꞌ nyomah-a, layanleh Yoh sijaꞌ-a.’ ”

verses.text: He led him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, cast yourself down from here,
verses.source_translation: Muot moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ Yerusalem duoh keꞌ tun bungan Boli Topaꞌ.  Muot moꞌ in-e, “Muꞌu tih kan Onak Topaꞌ, bitabumleh soꞌ itih!

verses.text: for it is written, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you;’
verses.source_translation: Sobab daang Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Topaꞌ odaꞌ malaikat-malaikat-E jaga Ingan.

verses.text: and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, lest perhaps you dash your foot against a stone.’”
verses.source_translation: Malaikat deꞌ munoꞌ Nyamut Muꞌu kai tongan-e saꞌ poꞌon Muꞌu diꞌ-e obuah batuh.’”

verses.text: Jesus answering, said to him, “It has been said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Daang Kitab deꞌ moꞌ nulis Musa, ‘Maꞌ yaꞌ suba Topaꞌ muꞌ!’ ”

verses.text: When the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until another time.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ Muot suba Yesus kai masam-masam wat-e, yoh moꞌ buu togan-E yoh moꞌ kajon onu-e deꞌ bitotok.

verses.text: Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and news about him spread through all the surrounding area.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus paliꞌ keꞌ Galilea punuaꞌ daꞌ kuasa Iyang Topaꞌ.  Gah Yesus moꞌ timogah katiꞌ-kanih deꞌ suaꞌ Galilea.

verses.text: He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
verses.source_translation: Yesus ngajal deꞌ boli-boli topat simayang, yomoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi-E.

verses.text: He came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. He entered, as was his custom, into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.
verses.source_translation: Yesus odi keꞌ Nazaret topat soꞌ Yoh ayuh.  Daang Onu Sabat kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e Yoh odi keꞌ boli topat simayang, Yoh mujuag ngan-e yaꞌ basa Kitab.

verses.text: The book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. He opened the book, and found the place where it was written,
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa ngin buk deꞌ nulis nabi Yesaya tuduꞌ Yesus, takal Yoh bukaꞌ buk inoh yoh dapod ayat itih yomoꞌ basa-e,

verses.text: “The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the broken hearted, to proclaim release to the captives, recovering of sight to the blind, to deliver those who are crushed,
verses.source_translation: “Iyang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Okuꞌ, sobab Yoh moꞌ pilih Okuꞌ, odaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag.  Yoh moꞌ ngutus Okuꞌ kaꞌan tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah tawan yaꞌ obuah pilopas, nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ duoh kaꞌan pilopas nyaꞌa soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bongis.

verses.text: and to proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.”
verses.source_translation: Duoh tanon nang moꞌ nog onu-e Topaꞌ nai oni deꞌ paguh kaꞌan umat-e.”

verses.text: He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ kuab kitab inoh, Yoh moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jugan kitab inoh, Yoh moꞌ guluꞌ yaꞌ ngajal.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang boli topat simayang ngiduang-E.

verses.text: He began to tell them, “Today, this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Onu itih ayat-ayat itih moꞌ jadi takal ingan ngojit-e.”

verses.text: All testified about him, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth, and they said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
verses.source_translation: Pingunang Yesus suaꞌ-e paguh, yoh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus suaꞌ-e bonal duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadi ilan, yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Oni ngan-e ponai nang oni watinoh, Yoh kan jok-e onak Yusuf?”

verses.text: He said to them, “Doubtless you will tell me this parable, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.’”
verses.source_translation: Inohleh ngan Yesus in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Totap ingan yaꞌ nguyat Okuꞌ nang, ‘Doktol, odaꞌleh odop Ingan mokuaꞌ! Naileh datiꞌ geh deꞌ topat soꞌ muꞌ obuah milaꞌ, kodaꞌ suaꞌ deꞌ ngojit koꞌih deꞌ nai Ingan deꞌ Kapernaum!’ ”

verses.text: He said, “Most certainly I tell you, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Doiꞌ nabi deꞌ obuah nabiꞌ deꞌ kupuaꞌ soꞌo obuah milaꞌ.

verses.text: But truly I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up three years and six months, when a great famine came over all the land.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ngojitleh joman nabi Elia, takal logaꞌ taluh sowaꞌ nuam bulan, deꞌ suaꞌ negli doiꞌ pinguman nyaꞌa obuaꞌ pilai miliap.  Takal inoh bogoꞌ jana-jana deꞌ Israel.

verses.text: Elijah was sent to none of them, except to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ diꞌ-e odaꞌ Elia odi tuduꞌ jana-jana Israel, pak-e odaꞌ odi jok-e tuduꞌ niꞌ jana deꞌ Sarfat deꞌ Sidon.

verses.text: There were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed, except Naaman, the Syrian.”
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh joman nabi Elisa ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Israel obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah, pak-e doiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ, jok-e Naaman nyaꞌa soꞌ negli Siria inoh.”

verses.text: They were all filled with wrath in the synagogue, as they heard these things.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ boli topat simayang inoh, sukup-sukup tiwas takal-e ngojit hal inoh.

verses.text: They rose up, threw him out of the city, and led him to the brow of the hill that their city was built on, that they might throw him off the cliff.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mujuag yomoꞌ kasig duoh toban Yesus kai paksa keꞌ sopaꞌ kota, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ bingon gilongung dolod sobab kota odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ bung dolod, ngan-e yaꞌ tulak Yesus kaang gilongung.

verses.text: But he, passing through the middle of them, went his way.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus ponu deꞌ osah odop-e deꞌ munoh Yoh moꞌ buu.

verses.text: He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. He was teaching them on the Sabbath day,
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus odi keꞌ kota Kapernaum deꞌ Galilea, danoꞌ Yoh ngajal nyaꞌa daang Onu Sabat.

verses.text: and they were astonished at his teaching, for his word was with authority.
verses.source_translation: Buaꞌ ajal duoh sina Yesus punuaꞌ daꞌ kuasa, inoh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bidongo ngojit-e.

verses.text: In the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ boli topat simayang ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e, yoh moꞌ nang bogan-e,

verses.text: saying, “Ah! what have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”
verses.source_translation: “Yesus ulang Nazaret, oni Ingan nog yaꞌ kaso koꞌih? Podo Ingan nog yaꞌ ngukum koꞌih? Puꞌan kuꞌ osi Ingan neh Ingan utusan deꞌ kudus soꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!”  When the demon had thrown him down in the middle of them, he came out of him, having done him no harm.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nang munua inoh, “Loꞌo! Luahleh soꞌ nyaꞌa itih!” In Yesus tuduꞌ munua inoh.  Munua inoh moꞌ paꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ molot-e daang gonan-e deꞌ jowin suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yomoꞌ munua inoh luah soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa inoh pak-e diꞌ-e kanam-e.

verses.text: Amazement came on all, and they spoke together, one with another, saying, “What is this word? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa ilan-e, yomoꞌ sina siodop-e, “Kuasa oni deꞌ ogiꞌ daang sina Nyaꞌa itih, ngan munua nunaꞌ pingunang-e?”

verses.text: News about him went out into every place of the surrounding region.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Gah oni deꞌ nai Yesus katiꞌ-kanih nyaꞌa ngojit-e deꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ sinok-sinok inoh.

verses.text: He rose up from the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was afflicted with a great fever, and they begged him for her.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ buꞌu soꞌ boli topat simayang, Yesus odi keꞌ boli Simon.  Madih ayua Simon tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang tua Simon deꞌ dayung modud, duoh tulung odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: He stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her. Immediately she rose up and served them.
verses.source_translation: Yesus odi keꞌ topat boꞌos tua Simon.  Yoh odaꞌ modud-e mokuaꞌ.  Yomoꞌ tua Simon lasuꞌ mokat nai pinguman kaꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: When the sun was setting, all those who had any sick with various diseases brought them to him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ puꞌun ngumi, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota inoh toban madih ayua-e deꞌ obuah masam-masam onam.  Yesus moꞌ gan tongan-e keꞌ masim-masim odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Demons also came out of many, crying out, and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” Rebuking them, he didn’t allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.source_translation: Munua moꞌ luah soꞌ gonan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, simadi-e nang bogan-e, “Inganleh Onak Topaꞌ!” Pak-e Yesus jaman munua deꞌ munoꞌ sina, sobab munua puꞌan nang Yesus Iyohleh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: When it was day, he departed and went into an uninhabited place, and the multitudes looked for him, and came to him, and held on to him, so that he wouldn’t go away from them.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ siliꞌ jawaꞌ, Yesus ponu keꞌ niꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e doiꞌ manah nyaꞌa daꞌ-e.  Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa mulai kalik-E, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tapod-E, yoh moꞌ jaman Yesus buu.

verses.text: But he said to them, “I must preach the good news of God’s Kingdom to the other cities also. For this reason I have been sent.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ halus odi tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ kota-kota deꞌ bokon, tanon oni wat-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ militah jadin Laja, sobab inohleh Okuꞌ keꞌ dunia.”

verses.text: He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh Yesus tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ daang boli topat simayang deꞌ suaꞌ kota deꞌ Yudea.

chapters.text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness for forty days, being tempted by the devil. He ate nothing in those days. Afterward, when they were completed, he was hungry. The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.” Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’” The devil, leading him up on a high mountain, showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time. The devil said to him, “I will give you all this authority, and their glory, for it has been delivered to me; and I give it to whomever I want. If you therefore will worship before me, it will all be yours.” Jesus answered him, “Get behind me Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’” He led him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, cast yourself down from here, for it is written, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you;’ and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, lest perhaps you dash your foot against a stone.’” Jesus answering, said to him, “It has been said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’” When the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until another time. Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and news about him spread through all the surrounding area. He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all. He came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. He entered, as was his custom, into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read. The book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. He opened the book, and found the place where it was written,  “The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the broken hearted, to proclaim release to the captives, recovering of sight to the blind, to deliver those who are crushed,  and to proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.” He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him. He began to tell them, “Today, this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.” All testified about him, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth, and they said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?” He said to them, “Doubtless you will tell me this parable, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.’” He said, “Most certainly I tell you, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.   But truly I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up three years and six months, when a great famine came over all the land.   Elijah was sent to none of them, except to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.   There were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed, except Naaman, the Syrian.” They were all filled with wrath in the synagogue, as they heard these things. They rose up, threw him out of the city, and led him to the brow of the hill that their city was built on, that they might throw him off the cliff. But he, passing through the middle of them, went his way. He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. He was teaching them on the Sabbath day, and they were astonished at his teaching, for his word was with authority. In the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Ah! what have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!” Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!”  When the demon had thrown him down in the middle of them, he came out of him, having done him no harm. Amazement came on all, and they spoke together, one with another, saying, “What is this word? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!” News about him went out into every place of the surrounding region. He rose up from the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was afflicted with a great fever, and they begged him for her. He stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her. Immediately she rose up and served them. When the sun was setting, all those who had any sick with various diseases brought them to him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them. Demons also came out of many, crying out, and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” Rebuking them, he didn’t allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ. When it was day, he departed and went into an uninhabited place, and the multitudes looked for him, and came to him, and held on to him, so that he wouldn’t go away from them. But he said to them, “I must preach the good news of God’s Kingdom to the other cities also. For this reason I have been sent.” He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.

verses.text: Now while the multitude pressed on him and heard the word of God, he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus deꞌ bingon Donu Genezaret Deꞌ ayuh, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa bikuluk yomoꞌ bitodod-todod ngan-e yaꞌ ngojit pingunang Topaꞌ soꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets.
verses.source_translation: Yesus ningaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh olud deꞌ bingon donu inoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa daang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ mokuaꞌ paliꞌ kalik ikian yomoꞌ mamiaꞌ jaling-e.

verses.text: He entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ olud deꞌ kakuꞌ Simon.  Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ Simon bikayuh olud-e keꞌ topat deꞌ botang juuaꞌ sit soꞌ bingon donu yoh moꞌ guluꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ soꞌ daang olud.

verses.text: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep, and let down your nets for a catch.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ ngajal Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Bikayuhleh oludmuꞌ keꞌ topat deꞌ tuluap suba lagiꞌ ngijaling ikian.”

verses.text: Simon answered him, “Master, we worked all night, and took nothing; but at your word I will let down the net.”
verses.source_translation: Simon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu, koꞌih moh kiloja lolah posah niꞌ ngalom-ngalom, pak-e doiꞌ manah ikian deꞌ soꞌon koꞌih, nyam-e Ingan deꞌ odaꞌ, okuꞌ nai-e, okuꞌ suba lagiꞌ ngijaling.”

verses.text: When they had done this, they caught a great multitude of fish, and their net was breaking.
verses.source_translation: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai oni deꞌ nang Yesus yomoꞌ bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ obuah jaling-e nog jaling-e yaꞌ totak.

verses.text: They beckoned to their partners in the other boat, that they should come and help them. They came, and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simon moꞌ mogan dingan-dingan-e deꞌ pakai olud deꞌ bokon.  Dingan-dingan-e moꞌ nog yomoꞌ ngisiꞌ soꞌ duwoh olud-e nog punuaꞌ duoh odaꞌ olud-e yaꞌ kuom.

verses.text: But Simon Peter, when he saw it, fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh, Simon moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus, yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Toganleh okuꞌ sobab okuꞌ itih nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.”

verses.text: For he was amazed, and all who were with him, at the catch of fish which they had caught;
verses.source_translation: Simon duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ olud inoh moꞌ ilan ningaꞌ bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ soꞌon-e.

verses.text: and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will be catching people alive.”
verses.source_translation: Watnoh geh dingan-dingan Simon, Yakobus duoh Yohanes onak Zebedeus.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Maꞌ tolu! Soꞌ adin muꞌu idoh tiaꞌ kalik ikian pak-e kalik manusia odaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: When they had brought their boats to land, they left everything, and followed him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Simon duoh dingan-dingan-e nalik olud-e keꞌ bingon donu yomoꞌ togan suaꞌ kiloja-e, yomoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: While he was in one of the cities, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and begged him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Yesus odi keꞌ niꞌ kota.  Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah.  Yomoꞌ takal ningaꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ jowin Yesus simadi-e nang, “Nyam Ingan laꞌan odaꞌleh okuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onamkuꞌ.”

verses.text: He stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, “I want to. Be made clean.” Immediately the leprosy left him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ tomaꞌ-e semadiꞌ-e sina, “Laꞌan Kuꞌ mokuaꞌ leh.” Takal inoh geh onam-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: He commanded him to tell no one, “But go your way, and show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing according to what Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus jaman nyaꞌa inoh kilakal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Sus odi tuduꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi mitiaꞌ saꞌ-e ningaꞌ muꞌu moh bonal-bonal mokuaꞌ.  Yomoꞌ odileh ngin kulban kodaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa bukti muꞌu moꞌ bonal mokuaꞌ soꞌ onammuꞌ.”

verses.text: But the report concerning him spread much more, and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa moꞌ klingah gah Yesus katiꞌ-kanih, sobab inohleh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog ngojit duoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

verses.text: But he withdrew himself into the desert, and prayed.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e Yesus odi bidoa keꞌ topat deꞌ doiꞌ manah nyaꞌa-e.

verses.text: On one of those days, he was teaching; and there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every village of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was with him to heal them.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Yesus ngajal ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi guluꞌ danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog soꞌ Yerusalem, soꞌ kota-kota deꞌ Galilea duoh Yudea.  Kuasa Topaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ monam ponai mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa nog toban niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan guling deꞌ tun amuak.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suba toban nyaꞌa inoh keꞌ daang boli saꞌ tapod gan deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus.

verses.text: Not finding a way to bring him in because of the multitude, they went up to the housetop, and let him down through the tiles with his cot into the middle before Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai toban molot.  Inohleh ngan-e odop-e munoꞌ paꞌad nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan inoh keꞌ tun bungan boli deꞌ ilow-e lata.  Yomoꞌ odop-e munoꞌ bukaꞌ ilow-e duoh pimuun nyaꞌa inoh baya amuak-e deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus deꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh.

verses.text: Seeing their faith, he said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lobih bisayaꞌ, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam palah inoh, “Dosamuꞌ moh obuah ngapun madih Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this that speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”
verses.source_translation: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi moꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, “Nyaꞌa itih bilani nguyat Topaꞌ, jok-e Topaꞌ sijaꞌ-e deꞌ ponai ngapun dosa!”

verses.text: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, answered them, “Why are you reasoning so in your hearts?
verses.source_translation: Yesus puꞌan pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Duoh lasuꞌ sina, “Oni ngan ingan pikil deꞌ watinoh daang otin ingan?

verses.text: Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you;’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk?’
verses.source_translation: Ki deꞌ lobih sonang, nang dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun atou nang mokatleh duoh ponuleh!

verses.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins” (he said to the paralyzed man), “I tell you, arise, and take up your cot, and go to your house.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e puꞌan muꞌ kedoh deꞌ bumi itih Okuꞌ Onak Manusia ogiꞌ kuasa kaꞌan ngapun dosa.” Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan inoh, “Mokat tunuk amuakmuꞌ sus paliꞌ.”

verses.text: Immediately he rose up before them, and took up that which he was laying on, and departed to his house, glorifying God.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa inoh lasuꞌ ganguk mun-e mokat deꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ tunuk amuak-e, duoh paliꞌ simadi mudi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Amazement took hold on all, and they glorified God. They were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh ilan-e simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ.  Duoh daang kila tolu nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Ilan kuꞌ nyam-e ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ moh jadi onu itih!”

verses.text: After these things he went out, and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office, and said to him, “Follow me!”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus luah Yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pinagih suke deꞌ, adon-e Lewi, deꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ boli suke.  Yesus sina tuduꞌ-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: He left everything, and rose up and followed him.
verses.source_translation: Lewi moꞌ mujuag togan kiloja-e, yoh moꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Levi made a great feast for him in his house. There was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Lewi nyamut Yesus yoh moꞌ ngunang pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon saꞌ-e suwaꞌ man samah-samah duoh odop-e.

verses.text: Their scribes and the Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi diꞌ-e sonang, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, “Oni ngan ingan suaꞌ man duoh pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa?”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ sehat diꞌ-e pilelu doktol jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ monam sijaꞌ-e.

verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh Okuꞌ nog nak-e mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal odaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa saꞌ-e paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: They said to him, “Why do John’s disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Pinunaꞌ Yohanes duoh pinunaꞌ ulang Farisi silalu puasa duoh bidoa.  Pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Muꞌ man duoh nuak.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast, while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ odi keꞌ boli topat biluman totu idoh diꞌ-e puasa sobab tunang deꞌ dali aluaꞌ bisamah-samah duoh odop-e.

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast in those days.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal tunang deꞌ dali inoh obuah mit soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Takal inohleh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puasa.”

verses.text: He also told a parable to them. “No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old garment, or else he will tear the new, and also the piece from the new will not match the old.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ perumpamaan itih, “Doiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nopung bojuh oma-e kai kain bojuh baꞌuh.  Sobab nyam yoh nai watnoh bojuh baꞌuh inoh totap totak.  Duoh kain bojuh deꞌ baꞌuh inoh geh idoh diꞌ-e bitotok duoh bojuh deꞌ oma.

verses.text: No one puts new wine into old wine skins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and it will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ duwan piꞌin angul baꞌuh keꞌ daang topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit deꞌ oma.  Sobab piꞌin angul baꞌuh inoh tapod yaꞌ odaꞌ topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit inoh totak, jadi piꞌin angul-e soyang duoh topat piꞌin soꞌ kulit inoh lusak.

verses.text: But new wine must be put into fresh wine skins, and both are preserved.
verses.source_translation: Piꞌin angul deꞌ baꞌuh halus daang topat piꞌin deꞌ soꞌ kulit deꞌ baꞌuh geh.

verses.text: No man having drunk old wine immediately desires new, for he says, ‘The old is better.’”
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa laꞌan nuak piꞌin angul deꞌ baꞌuh mokuaꞌ nuak piꞌin angul deꞌ oma, sobab piꞌin angul deꞌ oma inoh lobih masog in-e.”

chapters.text: Now while the multitude pressed on him and heard the word of God, he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret. He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets. He entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat. When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep, and let down your nets for a catch.” Simon answered him, “Master, we worked all night, and took nothing; but at your word I will let down the net.” When they had done this, they caught a great multitude of fish, and their net was breaking. They beckoned to their partners in the other boat, that they should come and help them. They came, and filled both boats, so that they began to sink. But Simon Peter, when he saw it, fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord.” For he was amazed, and all who were with him, at the catch of fish which they had caught; and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will be catching people alive.” When they had brought their boats to land, they left everything, and followed him. While he was in one of the cities, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and begged him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.” He stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, “I want to. Be made clean.” Immediately the leprosy left him. He commanded him to tell no one, “But go your way, and show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing according to what Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.” But the report concerning him spread much more, and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities. But he withdrew himself into the desert, and prayed. On one of those days, he was teaching; and there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every village of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was with him to heal them. Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus. Not finding a way to bring him in because of the multitude, they went up to the housetop, and let him down through the tiles with his cot into the middle before Jesus. Seeing their faith, he said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.” The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this that speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?” But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, answered them, “Why are you reasoning so in your hearts?   Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you;’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk?’   But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins” (he said to the paralyzed man), “I tell you, arise, and take up your cot, and go to your house.” Immediately he rose up before them, and took up that which he was laying on, and departed to his house, glorifying God. Amazement took hold on all, and they glorified God. They were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today.” After these things he went out, and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office, and said to him, “Follow me!” He left everything, and rose up and followed him. Levi made a great feast for him in his house. There was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them. Their scribes and the Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?” Jesus answered them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.   I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”  They said to him, “Why do John’s disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?” He said to them, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast, while the bridegroom is with them?   But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast in those days.” He also told a parable to them. “No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old garment, or else he will tear the new, and also the piece from the new will not match the old.   No one puts new wine into old wine skins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and it will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.   But new wine must be put into fresh wine skins, and both are preserved.   No man having drunk old wine immediately desires new, for he says, ‘The old is better.’”

verses.text: Now on the second Sabbath after the first, he was going through the grain fields. His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu Sabat Yesus ngilusuꞌ kobon gandum, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ tuk buaꞌ gandum deꞌ munoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ gisik gandum inoh deꞌ tongan-e ngan-e yaꞌ man isin-e.

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day?”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi moꞌ ngalah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Oni nai ingan diꞌ nunaꞌ ukum daang agama otoꞌ, ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaman nyaꞌa nai-e daang onu Sabat!”

verses.text: Jesus, answering them, said, “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry, he, and those who were with him;
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ keh ingan basa silita oni deꞌ nai Daud takal yoh duoh ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ-e pilai?

verses.text: how he entered into God’s house, and took and ate the show bread, and gave also to those who were with him, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone?”
verses.source_translation: Yoh molot kaang Boli Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ mit pinguman deꞌ moꞌ ngin nyaꞌa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ man-e.  Mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ ngin geh pinguman inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e odaꞌ man-e, nak-e diꞌ-e puꞌan nang ukum daang agama otoꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ soꞌon man pinguman inoh.”

verses.text: He said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ Onak Manusia deꞌ bikuasa kaꞌan notu oni deꞌ soꞌon duoh deꞌ diꞌ soꞌon nyaꞌa nai daang onu Sabat.”

verses.text: It also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and taught. There was a man there, and his right hand was withered.
verses.source_translation: Daang onu Sabat deꞌ bokon lagiꞌ Yesus molot keꞌ daang boli topat simayang Yoh moꞌ ngajal danoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tongan toꞌuh-e.

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi, ogiꞌ geh ulang Farisi danoꞌ ngite-e yaꞌ kalik salah Yesus saꞌ-e ogiꞌ alasan ngan-e nyalah Yesus.  Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon podo Yesus yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos noh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ daang onu Sabat.

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise up, and stand in the middle.” He arose and stood.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tongan-e kobos niꞌ kawa noh, “Mujuag katiꞌ got.” Nyaꞌa noh moꞌ mokat mujuag odi tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Daang agama otoꞌ oni deꞌ soꞌon nyeꞌ nai-e daang onu Sabat, nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh atou nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat? Nyilamat nyaꞌa keh kanam nyaꞌa?”

verses.text: He looked around at them all, and said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did, and his hand was restored as sound as the other.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ-suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos tongan-e inoh, “Jugan tonganmuꞌ.” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ jugan tongan-e, tongan-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

verses.text: But they were filled with rage, and talked with one another about what they might do to Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sukup tiwas, yoh moꞌ biloneng sitipan odop-e, oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: In these days, he went out to the mountain to pray, and he continued all night in prayer to God.
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ-e tuwi soꞌ noh Yesus maꞌad keꞌ punguꞌ soꞌ-e yaꞌ bidoa.  Danoꞌ Yoh niꞌ ngalom-ngalom bidoa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ .

verses.text: When it was day, he called his disciples, and from them he chose twelve, whom he also named apostles:
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ jawaꞌ Yoh mogan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ pilih simoong duwoh naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yesus biladon simoong duwoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E noh rasul.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ iyohleh,

verses.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, his brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew;
verses.source_translation: Simon deꞌ Yesus mogan Petrus, Andreas madih Simon, Yakobus, Yohanes, Filipus, Bartolomeus,

verses.text: Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot;
verses.source_translation: Matius, Tomas, Yakobus onak Alfeus, Simon panglima soꞌ Zelot,

verses.text: Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.
verses.source_translation: Yudas onak Yakobus, yomoꞌ Yudas Iskariot deꞌ ngin Yesus deꞌ musoh-E.

verses.text: He came down with them, and stood on a level place, with a crowd of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases;
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ muun soꞌ punguꞌ inoh bibaya duoh ayua rasul-rasul, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo mujuag deꞌ topat deꞌ lata.  Danoꞌ bogoꞌ geh pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon, bogoꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog soꞌ kota Yerusalem, duoh bogoꞌ geh soꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ propinsi Yudea, kota-kota Tirus, Sidon deꞌ bingon laut.

verses.text: as well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and they were being healed.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi kanoꞌ yaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, danoꞌ geh Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ onam odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ.  Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e suaꞌ geh odi kanoꞌ tuang mokuaꞌ geh.

verses.text: All the multitude sought to touch him, for power came out of him and healed them all.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ tomaꞌ Yesus sobab ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah so-E deꞌ ponai odaꞌ onam tiboꞌi nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said, “Blessed are you who are poor, God’s Kingdom is yours.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngiduang pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Sonangleh ingan deꞌ botak kolag sobab Topaꞌ leh deꞌ jadi Laja ingan.

verses.text: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
verses.source_translation: Sonangleh ingan deꞌ pilai adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ inganleh deꞌ busuah! Sonangleh ingan deꞌ siꞌian adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ inganleh deꞌ towoh!

verses.text: Blessed are you when men shall hate you, and when they shall exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.
verses.source_translation: Sonangleh ingan simoꞌo nyaꞌa buꞌui deꞌ ingan, nyaꞌa doliaꞌ bisapul duoh ingan, obuah nguyat odaꞌ nyaꞌa, obuah pijaꞌat odaꞌ nyaꞌa sobab ingan nunaꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia!

verses.text: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven, for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.
verses.source_translation: Sonangleh ingan deꞌ obuah nai watinoh geh odaꞌ nyaꞌa, sobab ayuh pah deꞌ moh sidia daang sulga.  Natong nyeꞌ nabi-nabi joman noꞌuh-e obuah nyusah geh odaꞌ sumuk babai nyaꞌa Yahudi.

verses.text: “But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e binasaleh ingan deꞌ kaya adin sobab ingan moꞌ blasa kiꞌan sonang!

verses.text: Woe to you, you who are full now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.
verses.source_translation: Binasaleh ingan deꞌ busuah adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ ingan deꞌ yaꞌ pilai! Binasaleh ingan deꞌ towoh adin sobab tiaꞌ ijoꞌ ingan deꞌ yaꞌ siꞌian!

verses.text: Woe, when men speak well of you, for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.
verses.source_translation: Binasaleh ingan deꞌ obuah mudi suaꞌ nyaꞌa sobab watinoh geh sumuk babai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mudi nabi-nabi palsu joman noꞌuh-e.”

verses.text: “But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,
verses.source_translation: “Pak-e tuduꞌ ingan deꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ adin Okuꞌ ngin sibaya itih: Ngibalaleh nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ ingan, naileh oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.
verses.source_translation: Mitiaꞌ Topaꞌ bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ lika nyupah ingan, bidoa kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don’t withhold your coat also.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌo nyaꞌa napal paningmuꞌ deꞌ nuwaꞌ boit nginleh biaꞌ paningmuꞌ deꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh.  Nyam nyaꞌa mit jubah muꞌ ngin tuduꞌ-e baya bojuhmuꞌ.

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and don’t ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.
verses.source_translation: Nyam nyaꞌa mitiaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ muꞌu nginleh inoh tuduꞌ-e, nyam basa-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mit nyaꞌa soꞌ muꞌu maꞌ jolaꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ-e.

verses.text: “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.
verses.source_translation: Naileh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa oniꞌ deꞌ suka muꞌu yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nai tuduꞌ odopmuꞌ.

verses.text: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
verses.source_translation: Nyam ingan ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan sijaꞌ-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi? Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa ngibalaꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ ngibalaꞌ odop-e!

verses.text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
verses.source_translation: Nyam ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai paguh duꞌ ingan sijaꞌ-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi! Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa tuang nai watnoh geh.

verses.text: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.
verses.source_translation: Nyam ingan ngin nyam duit jok-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod gati-e, patut keh ingan obuah mudi? Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa tuang ngin nyam duit tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa geh, yoh moꞌ paliꞌ mitiaꞌ-e!

verses.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ watnoh neh! Nyanyang nyeꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ ingan neh, nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ-e.  Asal ingan ngin nyam maꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ gati-e.  Nyam ingan nai watnoh, pah ingan ayuh, ingan moꞌ jadi onak-onak Topaꞌ deꞌ paling Bigatung.  Sobab Topaꞌ paguh geh otin-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ bisukul duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: “Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.
verses.source_translation: Ingan halus masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa kodaꞌ Samaꞌ ingan deꞌ sulga tuang masiꞌ geh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.”

verses.text: Don’t judge, and you won’t be judged. Don’t condemn, and you won’t be condemned. Set free, and you will be set free.
verses.source_translation: “Maꞌ sibalang nyalah nyaꞌa saꞌ odop ingan diꞌ ngan obuah nyalah odaꞌ Topaꞌ.  Maꞌ lika ngukum nyaꞌa, saꞌ Topaꞌ diꞌ-e ngukum ingan.  Ngin apun tuduꞌ nyaꞌa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin apun tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.”
verses.source_translation: Ngin oniꞌ deꞌ plelu nyaꞌa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin geh tuduꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ ngin deꞌ sukup-sukup bogoꞌ-e, obuaꞌ punuaꞌ mipil deꞌ moꞌ obuah nginyon kaꞌan muꞌu sobab oni kiang muꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, kiang inoh geh Topaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu.”

verses.text: He spoke a parable to them. “Can the blind guide the blind? Won’t they both fall into a pit?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e ngan-e yaꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Dapod keh nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ kayak nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ? Doh diꞌ-e soꞌ duwoh odop-e labuꞌ keꞌ lubang neh?

verses.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ murid deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ gulu-e, asal murid inoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ bilajal ke yoh ponai jadi samah kodaꞌ gulu-e.

verses.text: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?
verses.source_translation: Oni ingan ponai ningaꞌ lonas daang boton madih ingan pak-e botang koyuh daang boton odop ingan diꞌ ingan ngoon-e?

verses.text: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don’t see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye.
verses.source_translation: Oniwat ngan ingan ponai tanon tuduꞌ madih ingan, ‘Tiꞌ kuꞌ kadi lonas soꞌ botonmu,’ daang boton odop ingan sijaꞌ-e ogiꞌ botang koyuh deꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin-e? Maꞌ lika pibulaꞌ kadi dioꞌ botang koyuh deꞌ ogiꞌ daang boton odopmuꞌ.  Ke muꞌu tapod ningaꞌ, mokuaꞌ noh tapod kadi lonas soꞌ boton madihmuꞌ.”

verses.text: For there is no good tree that produces rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that produces good fruit.
verses.source_translation: “Tongon jojak deꞌ paguh idoh diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.  Watnoh geh tongon jojak deꞌ jaꞌat diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don’t gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa puꞌan tongon jojak soꞌ buaꞌ-e, totaꞌ lojaꞌ diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ ara, bikolam diꞌ-e bibuaꞌ buaꞌ angul.

verses.text: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh sobab otin-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat sobab otin-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.  Sobab oniꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa kai bobaꞌ-e inoh, luah soꞌ otin-e.”

verses.text: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do the things which I say?
verses.source_translation: “Doiꞌ guna-e ingan mogan Okuꞌ pimipin, pak-e diꞌ ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ tanonkuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan!

verses.text: Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin soto nyaꞌa deꞌ nog duꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ ngojit pingunangKuꞌ duoh nai-e.

verses.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngan-e kajuag boli-e, yoh kaliah tanaꞌ nai lubang tuluap-tuluap-e nog-e dapod batuh, yoh moꞌ kajuag tiang tun batuh inoh.  Takal ogiꞌ ubaꞌ, yoh moꞌ ubaꞌ obuah boli inoh, biguyut bigogos idoh geh, sobab boli noh togap.

verses.text: But he who hears, and doesn’t do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunangkuꞌ, yoh moꞌ idoh diꞌ-e nai kodaꞌ oni deꞌ nang kuꞌ, yoh noh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajuag boli-e deꞌ tanaꞌ pak-e lubang deꞌ nai-e ladas diꞌ-e nog batuh.  Nyam ubaꞌ nog, boli-e inoh lasuꞌ patuab lubuh, sobab boli-e inoh goyua.”

chapters.text: Now on the second Sabbath after the first, he was going through the grain fields. His disciples plucked the heads of grain and ate, rubbing them in their hands. But some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day?” Jesus, answering them, said, “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry, he, and those who were with him;   how he entered into God’s house, and took and ate the show bread, and gave also to those who were with him, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone?” He said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.” It also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and taught. There was a man there, and his right hand was withered. The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him. But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise up, and stand in the middle.” He arose and stood. Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?” He looked around at them all, and said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did, and his hand was restored as sound as the other. But they were filled with rage, and talked with one another about what they might do to Jesus. In these days, he went out to the mountain to pray, and he continued all night in prayer to God. When it was day, he called his disciples, and from them he chose twelve, whom he also named apostles: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, his brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot; Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor. He came down with them, and stood on a level place, with a crowd of his disciples, and a great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases; as well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and they were being healed. All the multitude sought to touch him, for power came out of him and healed them all. He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said, “Blessed are you who are poor, God’s Kingdom is yours.  Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.  Blessed are you when men shall hate you, and when they shall exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.   Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven, for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.  “But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.  Woe to you, you who are full now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.  Woe, when men speak well of you, for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.  “But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,   bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.   To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don’t withhold your coat also.   Give to everyone who asks you, and don’t ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.  “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.   If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.   If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.   If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.   But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.  “Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.  Don’t judge, and you won’t be judged. Don’t condemn, and you won’t be condemned. Set free, and you will be set free.  “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.” He spoke a parable to them. “Can the blind guide the blind? Won’t they both fall into a pit?   A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.   Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?   Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don’t see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye.   For there is no good tree that produces rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that produces good fruit.   For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don’t gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.   The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.  “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do the things which I say?   Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like.   He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.   But he who hears, and doesn’t do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”

verses.text: After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ Kapernaum.

verses.text: A certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ panglima Roma deꞌ nyayang kuli-e.  Kuli-e inoh monam, sinok-sinok-e yaꞌ kobos.

verses.text: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant.
