verses.source_translation: Takal panglima inoh ngojit gah Yesus, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin ulang Yahudi odi tuduꞌ Yesus, odaꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus odi duoh odaꞌ kuli-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy for you to do this for him,
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog duꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ tulung saꞌ Yesus tulung panglima inoh.  In nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ duꞌ Yesus, “Panglima itih patut Ingan tulung-e,

verses.text: for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”
verses.source_translation: sobab iyoh ngibalaꞌ bangsa otoꞌ, yoh moꞌ nai boli topat simayang kaꞌan koꞌih.”

verses.text: Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him, “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi bisamah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.  Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog boli panglima inoh, panglima inoh odaꞌ dingan-dingan-e odi tanon deꞌ Yesus, “Dusah nak lolah posah odi keꞌ bolikuꞌ.  Okuꞌ diꞌ patut tlimaꞌ Ingan deꞌ boli okuꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore I didn’t even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.source_translation: Inohleh sobab-e okuꞌ jaꞌ-e diꞌ bilani bidapod duoh Ingan.  Jadi sobot sijaꞌ-e nang mokuaꞌ, kulikuꞌ totap lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ nunaꞌ geh tuduꞌ plitah nyaꞌa deꞌ somu, duoh deꞌ douꞌ okuꞌ, sidadu-sidadu totu yoh lasuꞌ nunaꞌ plitahkuꞌ.  Nyam okuꞌ sobot odaꞌ, ‘Buu,’ yoh buu geh duoh nyam okuꞌ sobot tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, ‘Got katiꞌ,’ yoh nog geh, duoh nyam kuꞌ sobot tuduꞌ kuli okuꞌ, ‘Nai itih,’ yoh moꞌ nai-e.”

verses.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ilan ngojit-e.  Yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ Iyoh, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Bisayaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh deꞌ kakuꞌ panglima itih aluaꞌ doiꞌ geh Kuꞌ tapod deꞌ ulang Israel!”

verses.text: Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well.
verses.source_translation: Takal pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ obuah odaꞌ panglima inoh odi tuduꞌ Yesus inoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ kuli inoh moh mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: Soon afterwards, he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ-e tuwi soꞌ inoh, Yesus odi keꞌ kota Nain.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ odi bisamah-samah duoh-E.

verses.text: Now when he came near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ nog sinok tiban gerbang kota, nyaꞌa katod todang deꞌ sopaꞌ kota.  Deꞌ kobos inoh onak dali, onak sinoꞌ jana deꞌ jok-e niꞌ, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota inoh nunaꞌ sinoꞌ nyaꞌa noh.

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her, “Don’t cry.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ sinoꞌ nyaꞌa noh, Yoh moꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e Yoh moꞌ nang, “Maꞌ siꞌian!”

verses.text: He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said, “Young man, I tell you, arise!”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ odi sinok todang noh Yoh moꞌ tomaꞌ ponam-e, tukang tawiak noh moꞌ loꞌo.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Onak bujang mokat mey!”

verses.text: He who was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother.
verses.source_translation: Onak bujang deꞌ moꞌ kobos inoh moꞌ mokat guluꞌ yoh moꞌ sina, mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-e.

verses.text: Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has visited his people!”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa obuaꞌ tolu yoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nang, “Niꞌ naꞌan nabi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ nog deꞌ uluk otoꞌ! Topaꞌ moh nog nyilamat umat-e!”

verses.text: This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea, and in all the surrounding region.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ Yudea duoh kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok noh moꞌ ngojit gah Yesus.

verses.text: The disciples of John told him about all these things.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yohanes tanon tuduꞌ Yohanes suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus.  Yohanes moꞌ mogan duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e.

verses.text: John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?”
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ odi sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ingan keh nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, podo koꞌih kajon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon?”

verses.text: When the men had come to him, they said, “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’”
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yohanes inoh odi tuduꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ nang, “Yohanes Pembaptis odaꞌ koꞌih sikian tuduꞌ Ingan, podo Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog kodaꞌ deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, podo koꞌih kajon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon?”

verses.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight.
verses.source_translation: Pas takal inoh geh, Yesus odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, duoh pibuu munua Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.
verses.source_translation: Jadi Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Paliꞌleh tuduꞌ Yohanes tanon oni deꞌ ngojit ingan duoh oni deꞌ kilin ingan, nyaꞌa butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ, nyaꞌa gilagan ponai ponu, nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah ponai mokuaꞌ, nyaꞌa bongam ponai klingah, nyaꞌa kobos ponai paliꞌ idip duoh Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ obuah tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag.

verses.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”
verses.source_translation: Sonangleh nyaꞌa deꞌ totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: When John’s messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh pinunaꞌ Yohanes moꞌ buu, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ in-e, “Noꞌuh-e ingan odi keꞌ padang pasil idoh diꞌ-e kaꞌan ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sasou kila-e kodaꞌ duh deꞌ obuah yup sobak.

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.
verses.source_translation: Duoh odi kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ kai pimakai paguh baya idip sonang idoh diꞌ-e deꞌ padang pasil, nyaꞌa deꞌ watinoh iyoh loꞌo deꞌ istana!

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.source_translation: Ingan itih luah yaꞌ odi ningaꞌ nabi.  Bonal deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan! Pak-e sibonal-e nyaꞌa itih lobih ayuh lagiꞌ soꞌ nabi.

verses.text: This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.source_translation: Sobab Yohanes inoh deꞌ obuah sobot daang ayat Kitab, In Topaꞌ, ‘Itihleh nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ Kuꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ Muꞌu, Saꞌ yoh bukaꞌ olan kaꞌan Muꞌu!’ In Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in God’s Kingdom is greater than he.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Natong nyeꞌ deꞌ dunia itih doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ paling isit soꞌ umat Topaꞌ, lobih ayuh soꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis.”

verses.text: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John’s baptism.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa baya pinagih-pinagih suke ngojit pingunang Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ulang Farisi duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi inoh doliaꞌ-e tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.

verses.text: “To what then will I liken the people of this generation? What are they like?
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ baning nyaꞌa joman itih kodaꞌ oni?

verses.text: They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call to one another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned, and you didn’t weep.’
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ nai koduk-e deꞌ pasal, niꞌ uluk nang bogan-e tuduꞌ uluk deꞌ bokon, ‘Koꞌih mamak lagu deꞌ sonang kaꞌan ingan pak-e ingan doliaꞌ ngan gogo! Koꞌih ngilagu saꞌan nyaꞌa kobos pak-e idoh geh diꞌ ingan siꞌian!’

verses.text: For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.source_translation: Ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ duoh Yohanes Pembaptis samah kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ pasal inoh.  Takal Yohanes Pembaptis nog, iyoh puasa diꞌ-e nuak angul, ingan nang, ‘Munua molot daang gonan-e!’

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.source_translation: Duoh Onak Manusia nog Iyoh man nuak, ingan nang, ‘Ningaꞌ Nyaꞌa noh! Jolua, pimabuk, bidingan duoh pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa!’

verses.text: Wisdom is justified by all her children.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e bijak Topaꞌ tonga soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tlimaꞌ ajal-E.”

verses.text: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee’s house, and sat at the table.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan ulang Farisi, adon-e Simon, ngijaꞌ Yesus odi man.  Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ boli-e Yoh moꞌ man.

verses.text: Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ dayung adoh.  Takal yoh ngojit Yesus man deꞌ boli ulang Farisi inoh, yoh moꞌ odi kanoꞌ toban niꞌ jobul deꞌ isiꞌ-e inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ maal.

verses.text: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.source_translation: Yoh mujuag deꞌ punuaꞌ Yesus sinok poꞌon-E, daang-e siꞌian deꞌ poꞌon Yesus bisaꞌ sijaꞌ-a odaꞌ piꞌin boton-e.  Mokuaꞌ noh yoh ngisuꞌ poꞌon Yesus pakai buak-e yomoꞌ sium-e, yoh moꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ lona inoh daꞌ-e.

verses.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself, “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Simon deꞌ ngunang Yesus ningaꞌ hal inoh, yoh sina daang otin-e, “Nyam basa nyaꞌa itih nabi oni nai diꞌ-e puꞌan ngan dayung deꞌ tomaꞌ odop-E inoh, dayung adoh!”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.”  He said, “Teacher, say on.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina duꞌ Simon, “Simon ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanonkuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu!” “Iyoh Gulu, tanon sijaꞌ-a,” in Simon.

verses.text: “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bilutang tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin nyam duit-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ niꞌ tang-e limoh latus duit pilak, nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ tang-e limoh puluꞌ duit pilak.

verses.text: When they couldn’t pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?”
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e diꞌ-e taan bayal tang-e noh, yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ duit noh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ odaꞌ bayal-e.  Osi leh deꞌ soꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa inoh deꞌ lobih ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nyam duit tuduꞌ-e noh?”

verses.text: Simon answered, “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.” He said to him, “You have judged correctly.”
verses.source_translation: Simon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ kila nyaꞌa deꞌ paling bogoꞌ tang-e inoh.” Yesus moꞌ nang, “Bonal oni deꞌ nang muꞌu noh.”

verses.text: Turning to the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngiduang dayung noh yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon, “Muꞌu ningaꞌ dayung itih? Okuꞌ nog keꞌ bolimuꞌ, doiꞌ muꞌu ngin piꞌin kaꞌan mamiaꞌ poꞌonkuꞌ, pak-e dayung tih mamiaꞌ poꞌon Kuꞌ kai piꞌin boton-e, yoh moꞌ ngisuꞌ pakai buak-e.

verses.text: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ nyamut Okuꞌ kai sium, pak-e dayung itih diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ sium poꞌon Kuꞌ, soꞌ ngan Kuꞌ nog katiꞌ.

verses.text: You didn’t anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ deꞌ bakKuꞌ, pak-e dayung tih moh duwan inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ poꞌon Kuꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Dosa-e deꞌ bogoꞌ noh moh obuah ngapun! Dop-e iyoh moꞌ bogoꞌ geh ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nang dosa odop-e isit, yoh diꞌ-e plelu bogoꞌ obuah ngapun jadi yoh isit geh ngibalaꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina duꞌ dayung noh, “Dosa-dosamuꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun.”

verses.text: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ bisamah-samah guluꞌ man duoh Yesus, sina sitipan odop-e, “Osi nyaꞌa itih ngan-e dapod ngapun dosa nyaꞌa?”

verses.text: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus sina duꞌ dayung noh, “Ngan muꞌu moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, muꞌu obuah nyilamat.  Paliꞌleh toban otin deꞌ sonang.”

chapters.text: After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum. A certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death. When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant. When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy for you to do this for him, for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.” Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him, “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof. Therefore I didn’t even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed. For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.” When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.” Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well. Soon afterwards, he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him. Now when he came near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her. When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her, “Don’t cry.” He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said, “Young man, I tell you, arise!” He who was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother. Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us!” and, “God has visited his people!” This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea, and in all the surrounding region. The disciples of John told him about all these things. John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?” When the men had come to him, they said, “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’” In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight. Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.   Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.” When John’s messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John, “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?   But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.   But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.   This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’  “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in God’s Kingdom is greater than he.” When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John’s baptism. But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.   “To what then will I liken the people of this generation? What are they like?   They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call to one another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned, and you didn’t weep.’   For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’   The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’   Wisdom is justified by all her children.” One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee’s house, and sat at the table. Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment. Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment. Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself, “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.” Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.”  He said, “Teacher, say on.”  “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.   When they couldn’t pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?” Simon answered, “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.” He said to him, “You have judged correctly.” Turning to the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.   You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.   You didn’t anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.   Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little.”  He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.” Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?” He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”

verses.text: Soon afterwards, he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of God’s Kingdom. With him were the twelve,
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ tui mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus ponu soꞌ kota keꞌ kota duoh kupuaꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ kaꞌan odi tanon gah deꞌ paguh oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.  Soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-E bisamah-samah duoh Iyoh.

verses.text: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
verses.source_translation: Mun noh geh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan dayung deꞌ Yesus odaꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua duoh onam-e deꞌ bokon.  Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ Maria geh, deꞌ nyaꞌa sobot Magdalena deꞌ juꞌ munua luah soꞌ ang gonan-e;

verses.text: and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions.
verses.source_translation: Yohana sowon Khuza, iyohleh pingulus daang istana Herodes; Susana baya bogoꞌ dayung deꞌ bokon tulung Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E kai duit odop-e masim-masim.

verses.text: When a great multitude came together, and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ telus nog tuduꞌ Yesus soꞌ kudu-kudu kota, takal inoh moꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa bikuluk.  Yesus moꞌ silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai perumpamaan itih in-e,

verses.text: “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.
verses.source_translation: “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa bilumoh, yoh dabul biniaꞌ deꞌ umoh-e.  Takal-e nabul, ogiꞌ biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ olan.  Biniaꞌ-e inoh obuah ngunyak odaꞌ nyaꞌa duoh obuah man odaꞌ manuk nog obuaꞌ-e.

verses.text: Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ bibatuh-batuh.  Takal tuang-e yaꞌ tumuꞌ, yomoꞌ layuꞌ sobab tanaꞌ-e bodoh.

verses.text: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ daang totaꞌ lojaꞌ.  Totaꞌ lojaꞌ inoh tumuꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh biniaꞌ inoh.  Yomoꞌ ngapit-e nog-e kobos.

verses.text: Other fell into the good ground, and grew, and produced one hundred times as much fruit.” As he said these things, he called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh, biniaꞌ noh moꞌ tumuꞌ duoh bibuaꞌ silatus kali lipat.” Mokuaꞌ ngin perumpamaan inoh, Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ngojit nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e, oni deꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih.”

verses.text: Then his disciples asked him, “What does this parable mean?”
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E lasuꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus oni loti soꞌ perumpamaan inoh.

verses.text: He said, “To you it is given to know the mysteries of God’s Kingdom, but to the rest in parables; that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’
verses.source_translation: Yesus lasuꞌ nyawot, “Tuduꞌ ingan moꞌ obuah tanon gah deꞌ paguh oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja, pak-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Kuꞌ tanon kai perumpamaan, saꞌ-e nyam basa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kilin-e; duoh nyam basa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti-e geh.

verses.text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
verses.source_translation: Itih loti perumpamaan inoh, biniaꞌ inoh Pingunang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ bingon olan inohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngojit; pak-e takal Muot nog, yoh mit Pingunang Topaꞌ soꞌ otin nyaꞌa inoh.  Saꞌ nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e obuah nyilamat.

verses.text: Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ bibatuh iyohleh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh, yoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ daang otin-e sonang; pak-e Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh diꞌ-e tumuꞌ biaꞌat daang otin-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ niꞌ tiliaꞌ-e geh, pak-e takal pingisuba nog, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ uun totaꞌ lojaꞌ iyohleh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ inoh, yoh tumuꞌ duoh biaꞌat; pak-e yoh bigaduh duoh idip-e, yoh yaꞌ idip mewah duoh sonang deꞌ dunia itih.  Suaꞌ-e inohleh deꞌ odaꞌ odop-e munoꞌ ngapit nog diꞌ-e ponai bibuaꞌ masak.

verses.text: Those in the good ground, these are those who with an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and produce fruit with perseverance.
verses.source_translation: Biniaꞌ deꞌ labuꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ paguh inoh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ nyikon daang otin-e deꞌ sukup paguh nog bibuaꞌ.”

verses.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container, or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.
verses.source_translation: “Doiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tung lapu kadis yomoꞌ kuab kai bona, atou yoh gan-e deꞌ libuaꞌ katel; pak-e lapu kadis inoh iyoh gan-e deꞌ tun pak, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot dapod ningaꞌ jawaꞌ-e.

verses.text: For nothing is hidden, that will not be revealed; nor anything secret, that will not be known and come to light.
verses.source_translation: Sobab suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah suan totap yaꞌ obuah tanon, duoh oni deꞌ diꞌ-e tonga adin yaꞌ obuah kilin.

verses.text: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.”
verses.source_translation: Jadi, ngojit nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e! Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ nang Kuꞌ, Topaꞌ odaꞌ yoh sukup lobih ngiloti lagiꞌ; pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ, bial yoh pikil nang odop-e ngiloti sit, Topaꞌ yaꞌ nai yoh diꞌ-e ngiloti oni-oni.”

verses.text: His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.
verses.source_translation: Sinoꞌ Yesus duoh madih-madih-E yaꞌ odi tuduꞌ-E, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bitapod duoh-E sobab nyaꞌa sikiya bogoꞌ.

verses.text: Some people told him, “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Yesus nang, “Sinoꞌ duoh madih ayua Muꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ sopaꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ bitapod duoh ingan.”

verses.text: But he answered them, “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God, and do it.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ duoh nai-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh sinoꞌ duoh madih ayua Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: Now on one of those days, he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E maꞌad keꞌ olud.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi keꞌ polad donu.” Lasuꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ ponu.

verses.text: But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop deꞌ munoꞌ bilayal Yesus boꞌos.  Tang-tang sobak libut nog deꞌ donu inoh, piꞌin mulai molot kaang olud-e duoh olud duam-e yaꞌ kuom.

verses.text: They came to him, and awoke him, saying, “Master, master, we are dying!” He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm.
verses.source_translation: Lasuꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odi guyang Yesus.  In nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Gulu, Gulu! Yaꞌ kobos otoꞌ neh!” Yesus mokat yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sina dolas-dolas-e, “Loꞌo!” Sobak duoh gilumang inoh lasuꞌ loꞌo takal inoh geh.

verses.text: He said to them, “Where is your faith?” Being afraid they marveled, saying to one another, “Who is this then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus lasuꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E noh, “Maꞌ tolu! Ingan halus bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.” Odop deꞌ-e munoꞌ ilan duoh daang kila tolu tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ in-e sitipan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sibonal-e nyaꞌa itih ngan sobak duoh gilumang nunaꞌ pingunang-e!”

verses.text: They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nyamung bilayal nog keꞌ daerah nyaꞌa Gerasa deꞌ polad Donu Galilea.

verses.text: When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn’t live in a house, but in the tombs.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus muun keꞌ doyoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ soꞌ kota deꞌ ogiꞌ munua daang gonan-e nog tuduꞌ Yesus.  Moꞌ tui yoh diꞌ kai pimakai-e duoh doliaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli, iyoh jok laꞌan loꞌo deꞌ kubul.

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e ningaꞌ Yesus, iyoh nang bogan-e lasuꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus duoh sina, “Oni ulusan Ingan duoh okuꞌ Yesus Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ paling Bigatung-e! Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tulung duꞌ Ingan saꞌ Ingan maꞌ nyiksa okuꞌ.”

verses.text: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bonds apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.
verses.source_translation: Yoh sina in noh sobab Yesus odaꞌ munua inoh luah soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munua molot daang gonan-e.  Moꞌ silalu manah munua nguasa gonan-e, duoh takal tongan poꞌon-e obuah ngilate duoh nyaꞌa jaga yoh bonal-bonal, pak-e yoh dapod motod late soꞌ tongan poꞌon-e; yomoꞌ munua toban buꞌu keꞌ topat deꞌ otug-otug-e.

verses.text: Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” for many demons had entered into him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Osi adonmuꞌ?” “Adon koꞌih Legion,” in nyaꞌa inoh nyawot-e, sobab moꞌ bogoꞌ manah munua molot nguasa gonan-e.

verses.text: They begged him that he would not command them to go into the abyss.
verses.source_translation: Munua deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus diꞌ-e kasig odop deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang lubang deꞌ sukup tuluap-e.

verses.text: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain, and they begged him that he would allow them to enter into those. He allowed them.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ sinok topat noh ogiꞌ bogoꞌ oyuaꞌ kalik man-e deꞌ tilipang dolod.  Munua moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus saꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ tanah munua deꞌ munoꞌ molot daang oyuaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: The demons came out of the man, and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake, and were drowned.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ munua deꞌ munoꞌ luah soꞌ nyaꞌa noh yomoꞌ molot kaang oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yomoꞌ oyuaꞌ-oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bikoduh buu keꞌ bingon gilongung yomoꞌ bitabum kaang donu.  Susuaꞌ oyua-e kobos longod.

verses.text: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikoduh buu mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ moh.  Yoh moꞌ kilakal hal inoh deꞌ kota Gerasa duoh deꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinoꞌ noh.

verses.text: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
verses.source_translation: Lasuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ngumaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ moh.  Odop deꞌ munoꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yesus, danoꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua guluꞌ sinoꞌ poꞌon Yesus, daang yoh moꞌ ogiꞌ pimakai-e duoh pimikil-e moh paguh.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

verses.text: Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga oyuaꞌ inoh ti-e ningaꞌ hal inoh yoh kilakal oni wat-e ngan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot munua inoh ponai mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daerah Gerasa duoh kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok inoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus buu soꞌ kanoꞌ, sobab susuaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup-sukup tolu-e.  Yomoꞌ Yesus maꞌad keꞌ olud yaꞌ buu.

verses.text: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ munua inoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus saꞌ yoh suwaꞌ duoh-E.  Pak-e Yesus odaꞌ yoh paliꞌ in-e,

verses.text: “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.” He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.
verses.source_translation: “Paliꞌleh duoh tanon oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.” Lasuꞌ nyaꞌa noh buu odi tanon keꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kota-e, oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: When Jesus returned, the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus paliꞌ soꞌ polad donu, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nyamut Yesus sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tui ngati-ngati Iyoh nog.

verses.text: Behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus’ feet, and begged him to come into his house,
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ nog niꞌ naꞌan pimipin boli topat simayang deꞌ adon-e Yairus.  Iyoh bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus duoh mitiaꞌ saꞌ Yesus odi keꞌ boli-e,

verses.text: for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him.
verses.source_translation: sobab onak tomoꞌ-e deꞌ dayung deꞌ umul-e simoong duwoh sowaꞌ yaꞌ kobos.  Takal Yesus ponu yaꞌ odi keꞌ boli Yairus, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bitodod-todod kililing Yesus.

verses.text: A woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her living on physicians, and could not be healed by any,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ uluk odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ moꞌ simoong duwoh sowaꞌ obuah onam bubuꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ kabuaꞌ susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ odop-e kaꞌan bilubat tuduꞌ doktol, pak-e doiꞌ deꞌ dapod odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: came behind him, and touched the fringe of his cloak, and immediately the flow of her blood stopped.
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ odi sinok Yesus soꞌ dug-e, mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ makaꞌ jubah-e.  Takal inoh geh onam bubuꞌ dayung noh moꞌ lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian deꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi deꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Suaꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ-e.  Yomoꞌ Petrus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kililing Ingan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitodod-todod sinok ingan!”

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Pak-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ puꞌan inoh, sobab ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ luah soꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and falling down before him declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh ngoon pingunai-e moh moꞌ obuah puꞌan.  Jadi yoh moꞌ nog daang-e bigegeg yomoꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ silita tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa oni sobab iyoh makaꞌ Yesus; duoh takal iyoh tomaꞌ Yesus pinyakit-e lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ dayung inoh, “Madih Kuꞌ, sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, muꞌu mokuaꞌ.  Buu leh toban otin deꞌ sonang.”

verses.text: While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house came, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t trouble the Teacher.”
verses.source_translation: Ngan Yesus aluaꞌ sina, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa nog soꞌ boli Yairus.  Yoh sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Onak ingan moh moꞌ doiꞌ, maꞌ tiyaꞌ nyusah gulu.”

verses.text: But Jesus hearing it, answered him, “Don’t be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ngojit hal inoh, Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yairus, “Maꞌ tolu, bisayaꞌ sijaꞌ-e, onakmuꞌ totap mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: When he came to the house, he didn’t allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus nog deꞌ boli Yairus, Yoh joman nyaꞌa molot nunaꞌ odop-E; jok-e Petrus, Yohanes, Yakobus duoh sinoꞌ samaꞌ onak opot inoh sijaꞌ-e deꞌ soꞌon molot.

verses.text: All were weeping and mourning her, but he said, “Don’t weep. She isn’t dead, but sleeping.”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa siꞌian sobab onak opot inoh moꞌ kobos.  Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ ingan siꞌian.  Onak opot inoh idoh diꞌ-e kobos neh, yoh jok-e boꞌos sijaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: They were ridiculing him, knowing that she was dead.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ towoh Yesus, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan onak dayung inoh moh moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying, “Child, arise!”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ kagong tongan onak opot inoh Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Mokat mey!”

verses.text: Her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately. He commanded that something be given to her to eat.
verses.source_translation: Onak opot inoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ, duoh takal inoh geh yoh lasuꞌ mokat.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ maꞌan onak opot inoh.

verses.text: Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them to tell no one what had been done.
verses.source_translation: Pingoma onak opot noh moꞌ ilan-e.  Pak-e Yesus jaman odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

chapters.text: Soon afterwards, he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of God’s Kingdom. With him were the twelve, and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out; and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions. When a great multitude came together, and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable.  “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.   Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.   Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.   Other fell into the good ground, and grew, and produced one hundred times as much fruit.” As he said these things, he called out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!” Then his disciples asked him, “What does this parable mean?” He said, “To you it is given to know the mysteries of God’s Kingdom, but to the rest in parables; that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’  Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.   Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.   Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.   That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.   Those in the good ground, these are those who with an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and produce fruit with perseverance.  “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container, or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.   For nothing is hidden, that will not be revealed; nor anything secret, that will not be known and come to light.   Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.” His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd. Some people told him, “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.” But he answered them, “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God, and do it.” Now on one of those days, he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out. But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water. They came to him, and awoke him, saying, “Master, master, we are dying!” He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm. He said to them, “Where is your faith?” Being afraid they marveled, saying to one another, “Who is this then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?” They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee. When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn’t live in a house, but in the tombs. When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!” For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bonds apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert. Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” for many demons had entered into him. They begged him that he would not command them to go into the abyss. Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain, and they begged him that he would allow them to enter into those. He allowed them. The demons came out of the man, and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake, and were drowned. When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country. People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid. Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed. All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned. But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,  “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.” He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him. When Jesus returned, the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him. Behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus’ feet, and begged him to come into his house, for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him. A woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years, who had spent all her living on physicians, and could not be healed by any, came behind him, and touched the fringe of his cloak, and immediately the flow of her blood stopped. Jesus said, “Who touched me?” When all denied it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’” But Jesus said, “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.” When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and falling down before him declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately. He said to her, “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.” While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house came, saying to him, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t trouble the Teacher.” But Jesus hearing it, answered him, “Don’t be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.” When he came to the house, he didn’t allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother. All were weeping and mourning her, but he said, “Don’t weep. She isn’t dead, but sleeping.” They were ridiculing him, knowing that she was dead. But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying, “Child, arise!” Her spirit returned, and she rose up immediately. He commanded that something be given to her to eat. Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them to tell no one what had been done.

verses.text: He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mogan ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-e, Iyoh moꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ pibuu munua duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

verses.text: He sent them out to preach God’s Kingdom and to heal the sick.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E odi saꞌ-a odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam mokuaꞌ duoh tanon oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.

verses.text: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey—neither staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats each.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ponu, “Maꞌ toban oni-oni daang pimonu ingan; maꞌ toban sikuud; maꞌ toban duit; maꞌ toban sikabiat; maꞌ toban onyad ingan; duoh maꞌ toban pimakai ingan deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.
verses.source_translation: Daki sijaꞌ-e ingan obuah tilimaꞌ, danoꞌ soꞌ ingan loꞌo nog ingan buu soꞌ topat inoh.

verses.text: As many as don’t receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”
verses.source_translation: Daki soꞌ ingan diꞌ-e obuah tilimaꞌ, asal ingan buꞌu soꞌ kanoꞌ ingan nguguah debu soꞌ poꞌon ingan, saꞌ jadi tanda tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.”

verses.text: They departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News, and healing everywhere.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh duoh odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daki sijaꞌ-e mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead,
verses.source_translation: Takal Herodes mipin deꞌ daerah Galilea, iyoh klingah gah mukjizat deꞌ nai Yesus.  Iyoh moꞌ bigaduh kila-e, sobab ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nang Yesus inoh Yohanes Pembaptis deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.

verses.text: and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa nang nabi Elia deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.  Duoh ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nang in-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nabi-nabi deꞌ noꞌuh-e idip lagiꞌ.

verses.text: Herod said, “John I beheaded, but who is this, about whom I hear such things?” He sought to see him.
verses.source_translation: Herodes moꞌ in-e, “Tiep okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa notok tunguaꞌ Yohanes.  Jadi osi bih Yesus itih neh? Moꞌ bogoꞌ kuꞌ klingah gah-e.” Mokuaꞌ noh Herodes bonal-bonal yaꞌ bidapod duoh Yesus.

verses.text: The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them, and withdrew apart to a desert region of a city called Bethsaida.
verses.source_translation: Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Yesus oni deꞌ moꞌ nai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngijaꞌ pinunaꞌ sijaꞌ-a odi keꞌ kota deꞌ adon Betsaida.

verses.text: But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, and spoke to them of God’s Kingdom, and he cured those who needed healing.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan topat soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ inoh moꞌ nusud Yesus.  Takal nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog Iyoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e sijaꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ silita oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja; duoh nai odaꞌ nyaꞌa monam mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: The day began to wear away; and the twelve came, and said to him, “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms, and lodge, and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.”
verses.source_translation: Takal onu yaꞌ ngumi, keꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ ti-e odi tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Paguh Ingan odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ buu keꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ deꞌ sinok katiꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌon pinguman duoh topat-e ngilumon, sobab topat itih doiꞌ oni-oni daꞌ-e.”

verses.text: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e in Yesus nyawot pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Ingan deꞌ halus ngin pinguman tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ.” Pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ nang in-e, “Deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ koꞌih itih jok-e limoh kueh baya duwoh polong ikian.  Koꞌih halus odi milih deꞌ baꞌuh lagiꞌ keꞌ sukup kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kiang-kiang itih.”

verses.text: For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab danoꞌ ogiꞌ kila-kila-e limoh libu naꞌan dali.  Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina in-e duoh pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ bikuluk, kila-kila limoh puluꞌ naꞌan daang niꞌ uluk.”

verses.text: They did so, and made them all sit down.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yomoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ.

verses.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ mit limoh kueh baya duwoh polong ikian, Iyoh moꞌ pakat keꞌ longit.  Iyoh moꞌ bisukul.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ kueh-e.  Yoh moꞌ ngin deꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, saꞌ-e kutung tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: They ate, and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ limoh libu naꞌan inoh man nog-e busuah.  Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ simoong duwoh bakul kuban pinguman deꞌ diꞌ-e obuah man.

verses.text: As he was praying alone, the disciples were with him, and he asked them, “Who do the multitudes say that I am?”
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus bidoa sadiꞌ-E.  Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e ogiꞌ geh danoꞌ.  Yomoꞌ Yesus sikian tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi in nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ nang Okuꞌ itih.”

verses.text: They answered, “‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang Yohanes Pembaptis; ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa nang Elia; duoh ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang nabi-nabi deꞌ noꞌuh-e deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip.”

verses.text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi Okuꞌ tih?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Inganleh Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: But he warned them, and commanded them to tell this to no one,
verses.source_translation: Ngojit hal inoh Yesus moꞌ jaman pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ Onak Manusia totap halus susah jolaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e obuah tilimaꞌ odaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi.  Yomoꞌ obuah ngabos, pak-e daang onu keꞌ taluh-e paliꞌ idip.”

verses.text: He said to all, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ in sina-E tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi deꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, halus sidia lawan oni deꞌ nang kila-e; sidia susah jolaꞌ bilang konu daang idip-e, yomoꞌ sitelus-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake, the same will save it.
verses.source_translation: Sobab osi deꞌ nyayang idip-e sonang deꞌ dunia itih, iyoh idoh diꞌ-e idip sitelus-e.  Pak-e osi deꞌ togan idip sonang-e deꞌ dunia itih nog-e kobos ngan-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh yaꞌ idip sitelus-e.

verses.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ guna-e nyaꞌa kakuꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ daang dunia itih pak-e odop-e diꞌ-e idip sitelus-e duoh pilugi odop-e!

verses.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa dasaꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ duoh pingunangkuꞌ deꞌ dunia itih, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia dasaꞌ geh yaꞌ ngakuꞌ nyaꞌa inoh takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog daang kuasa Kuꞌ, duoh daang kuasa Samaꞌ baya kuasa malaikat-malaikat deꞌ kudus.

verses.text: But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here, who will in no way taste of death, until they see God’s Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ogiꞌ ingan deꞌ mujuag datiꞌ adin totap yaꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

verses.text: About eight days after these sayings, he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray.
verses.source_translation: Kila-kila moih onu takal Yesus mokuaꞌ ngajal, Iyoh moꞌ ngijaꞌ Petrus, Yohanes duoh Yakobus maꞌad keꞌ bung dolod; sobab Yesus yaꞌ bidoa.

verses.text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.
verses.source_translation: Takal-E bidoa, jowin duoh pimakai Yesus moꞌ bilubah jawaꞌ sijaꞌ-e.

verses.text: Behold, two men were talking with him, who were Moses and Elijah,
verses.source_translation: Tang-tang tonga duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa nog sina tuduꞌ Yesus, deꞌ sina inoh Musa duoh Elia.

verses.text: who appeared in glory, and spoke of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e duwoh inoh daang jawaꞌ geh, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus oniwat Yesus yaꞌ kobos deꞌ Yerusalem, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah notu Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Petrus duoh dingan-dingan-e loloꞌ boꞌos.  Ngan-e moꞌ ngooh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus daang jawaꞌ sijaꞌ, yomoꞌ ningaꞌ geh nabi Musa duoh nabi Elia mujuag sinoꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: As they were parting from him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he said.
verses.source_translation: Takal Musa duoh Elia yaꞌ buu togan Yesus, Petrus moꞌ sina in-e, “Gulu, paguh manah nyam-e ngan otoꞌ datiꞌ neh, koꞌih yaꞌ nai taluh galang.  Niꞌ kaꞌan Ingan, niꞌ kaꞌan Musa, niꞌ kaꞌan Elia.” Pak-e Petrus diꞌ-e pikil dioꞌ oni deꞌ nang-e takal yoh sina.

verses.text: While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.
verses.source_translation: Takal Petrus sina, ogiꞌ abun nog nutu odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Takal obuah nutu odaꞌ abun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

verses.text: A voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ sina luah soꞌ aang abun inoh in-e, “Itihleh Onak deꞌ moꞌ notu Kuꞌ! Ngojit nyeꞌ oni deꞌ nang-E!”

verses.text: When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.
verses.source_translation: Takal sina inoh ti-e moꞌ aam in-e doiꞌ, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus tiep sadiꞌ-sadiꞌ-e.  Tui pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e kilakal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon suaꞌ oni deꞌ ningaꞌ-e danoꞌ.

verses.text: On the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a great multitude met him.
verses.source_translation: Onu deꞌ nikan-e takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ muun soꞌ bung dolod ogiꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog yaꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus.

verses.text: Behold, a man from the crowd called out, saying, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ ayua deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh nang bogan-e in-e, “Gulu! Mitiaꞌ tulung ningaꞌ onakkuꞌ itih, sobab onakkuꞌ itih jok-jok-e niꞌ geh.

verses.text: Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams, and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely.
verses.source_translation: Takal munua molot daang gonan-e, yoh moꞌ lika nang bogan duoh guyang-gusuaꞌ gonan-e sape luah loyang soꞌ bobaꞌ-e, sape mun jolaꞌ-e odaꞌ-e nak munua inoh laꞌan buu soꞌ-e.

verses.text: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn’t.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ tulung tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ ingan odaꞌ kasig munua inoh pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod kasig-e.”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Tok boꞌow mun suaꞌ ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh deꞌ kolas otin-e! Moꞌ sukup tuui okuꞌ sabal duoh loꞌo daang uluk ingan.  Pak-e ingan idoh bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Toban onakmuꞌ katiꞌ.”

verses.text: While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.source_translation: Takal onak opot inoh sinok Yesus, munua inoh moꞌ paꞌan-e deꞌ tanaꞌ yoh moꞌ guyang gusuaꞌ-e pak-e Yesus kasig munua inoh, onak opot inoh mokuaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ onak pot inoh deꞌ samaꞌ-e.

verses.text: They were all astonished at the majesty of God. But while all were marveling at all the things which Jesus did, he said to his disciples,
verses.source_translation: Ningaꞌ hal inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa obuaꞌ ilan ngan-e ningaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ.  Takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh aluaꞌ ilan oni deꞌ nai Yesus, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E,

verses.text: “Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.”
verses.source_translation: “Ngojit nyeꞌ moꞌ nyikon daang otin ingan sina Kuꞌ itih, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia yaꞌ obuah ngin keꞌ tongan nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: But they didn’t understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, sobab Topaꞌ sukan loti-e saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu geh sikian loti-e tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: There arose an argument among them about which of them was the greatest.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ onu takal inoh pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ bikaꞌi-bikalah sitipan odop-e ngan yaꞌ puꞌan osi deꞌ paling ayuh.

verses.text: Jesus, perceiving the reasoning of their hearts, took a little child, and set him by his side,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ puꞌan pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, sobab inohleh Iyoh moꞌ mit onak opot gan deꞌ sinok odop-E.

verses.text: and said to them, “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. Whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For whoever is least among you all, this one will be great.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi deꞌ nyamut onak opot itih daang adon Okuꞌ, iyoh nyamut Okuꞌ geh.  Osi deꞌ yaꞌ nyamut Okuꞌ, iyoh nyamut geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ ngutus Okuꞌ katiꞌ.  Sobab osi deꞌ paling isit-e soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ, iyohleh deꞌ paling ayuh-e.”

verses.text: John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow with us.”
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, koꞌih ningaꞌ nyaꞌa kasig munua pakai adon Ingan, yomoꞌ koꞌih moꞌ jaman-e, sobab iyoh diꞌ-e nuwaꞌ otoꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Don’t forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-E, “Maꞌ jaman-e, sobab moꞌ nyam basa nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ lawan ingan loti-e iyoh nuwaꞌ ingan.”

verses.text: It came to pass, when the days were near that he should be taken up, he intently set his face to go to Jerusalem,
verses.source_translation: Takal moꞌ yaꞌ sinok onu-e Yesus yaꞌ maꞌad keꞌ sulga, Yoh moꞌ daang otin-e totap yaꞌ ponu odi keꞌ Yerusalem.

verses.text: and sent messengers before his face. They went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, so as to prepare for him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Yesus moꞌ odaꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa ponu dioꞌ soꞌ Odop-E.  Nyaꞌa munoꞌ moꞌ odi, yomoꞌ nog kupuaꞌ deꞌ daerah Samaria saꞌ-a nyidia suaꞌ oniꞌ kaꞌan Yesus.

verses.text: They didn’t receive him, because he was traveling with his face set towards Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kupuaꞌ Samaria tiꞌ-e doliaꞌ-e nyamut Yesus sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang Yesus yaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem.

verses.text: When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky, and destroy them, just as Elijah did?”
verses.source_translation: Takal pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ adon Yakobus duoh Yohanes moꞌ puꞌan hal inoh, yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Gulu tanahleh koꞌih odaꞌ opui muun soꞌ longit saꞌ nyouh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ!”

verses.text: But he turned and rebuked them, “You don’t know of what kind of spirit you are.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ kumiat, Yoh moꞌ ngalah pinunaꞌ-E inoh.

verses.text: For the Son of Man didn’t come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.” They went to another village.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kupuaꞌ deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: As they went on the way, a certain man said to him, “I want to follow you wherever you go, Lord.”
verses.source_translation: Daang pimonu Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e odi keꞌ Yerusalem, deꞌ lopot olan ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Ingan kaki sijaꞌ-e Ingan odi!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Musang ogiꞌ topat-e loꞌo duoh manuk ogiꞌ solin-e pak-e Okuꞌ Onak Manusia doiꞌ soꞌ topat saꞌan Kuꞌ guling.”

verses.text: He said to another, “Follow me!” But he said, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ!” Pak-e nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Gulu, kajon okuꞌ yaꞌ ngubul samaꞌkuꞌ dioꞌ.”

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce God’s Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Tanah saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ ngubul nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.  Pak-e muꞌu, ponu odi kaki sijaꞌ-e tanon gah nang Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

verses.text: Another also said, “I want to follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those who are at my house.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon sina in-e, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Ingan, pak-e okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ madih ayuakuꞌ nang okuꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ Ingan.”

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for God’s Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ gituang-e nyakul pak-e iyoh poyaꞌ-poyaꞌ kumiat keꞌ bilakang oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e doiꞌ guna-e, watinoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ pak-e iyoh aluaꞌ natong pingidip oma-e iyoh idoh diꞌ-e dapod jadi umat Topaꞌ.”

chapters.text: He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases. He sent them out to preach God’s Kingdom and to heal the sick. He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey—neither staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats each.   Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.   As many as don’t receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.” They departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News, and healing everywhere. Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead, and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again. Herod said, “John I beheaded, but who is this, about whom I hear such things?” He sought to see him. The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them, and withdrew apart to a desert region of a city called Bethsaida. But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, and spoke to them of God’s Kingdom, and he cured those who needed healing. The day began to wear away; and the twelve came, and said to him, “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms, and lodge, and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.” But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.” For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.” They did so, and made them all sit down. He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude. They ate, and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over. As he was praying alone, the disciples were with him, and he asked them, “Who do the multitudes say that I am?” They answered, “‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.” He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “The Christ of God.” But he warned them, and commanded them to tell this to no one, saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.” He said to all, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.   For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake, the same will save it.   For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?   For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.   But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here, who will in no way taste of death, until they see God’s Kingdom.”  About eight days after these sayings, he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray. As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling. Behold, two men were talking with him, who were Moses and Elijah, who appeared in glory, and spoke of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem. Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him. As they were parting from him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he said. While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud. A voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!” When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen. On the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a great multitude met him. Behold, a man from the crowd called out, saying, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child. Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams, and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely. I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn’t.” Jesus answered, “Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.” While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father. They were all astonished at the majesty of God. But while all were marveling at all the things which Jesus did, he said to his disciples,  “Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.” But they didn’t understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying. There arose an argument among them about which of them was the greatest. Jesus, perceiving the reasoning of their hearts, took a little child, and set him by his side, and said to them, “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. Whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For whoever is least among you all, this one will be great.” John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow with us.” Jesus said to him, “Don’t forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.” It came to pass, when the days were near that he should be taken up, he intently set his face to go to Jerusalem, and sent messengers before his face. They went, and entered into a village of the Samaritans, so as to prepare for him. They didn’t receive him, because he was traveling with his face set towards Jerusalem. When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky, and destroy them, just as Elijah did?” But he turned and rebuked them, “You don’t know of what kind of spirit you are.   For the Son of Man didn’t come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.” They went to another village. As they went on the way, a certain man said to him, “I want to follow you wherever you go, Lord.” Jesus said to him, “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.” He said to another, “Follow me!” But he said, “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.” But Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce God’s Kingdom.” Another also said, “I want to follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those who are at my house.” But Jesus said to him, “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for God’s Kingdom.”

verses.text: Now after these things, the Lord also appointed seventy others, and sent them two by two ahead of him into every city and place, where he was about to come.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ soꞌ inoh Yesus pilih juꞌ puluꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ bokon, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ odi ngak duwoh-duwoh naꞌan, dioꞌ soꞌ odop-E keꞌ suaꞌ kota duoh topat deꞌ bokon soꞌ Yesus yaꞌ odi.

verses.text: Then he said to them, “The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, that he may send out laborers into his harvest.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ponu Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai perumpamaan,   “Bogoꞌ podi deꞌ moꞌ siap nyeꞌ yaꞌ ngutuam-e, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam diꞌ bogoꞌ.  Sobab inoh mitiaꞌleh tuduꞌ Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ umoh, saꞌ-e odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa odi ngutuam podi.

verses.text: Go your ways. Behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.
verses.source_translation: Sus odi, Okuꞌ pait ingan kodaꞌ onak domba keꞌ uluk kosuang deꞌ gaus.”

verses.text: Carry no purse, nor wallet, nor sandals. Greet no one on the way.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ponu, “Maꞌ toban lopet, onyad atou kasut; yomoꞌ maꞌ nosaꞌ sina sikiya tui duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ olan.

verses.text: Into whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa ingan molot keꞌ boli nyaꞌa sobotleh dioꞌ, ‘Topaꞌ bilokat ingan daang boli itih.’

verses.text: If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa-e danoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ patut tilimaꞌ bilokat inoh, sina inoh totap jadi tuduꞌ-e.  Pak-e nyam basa-e idoh, sina inoh paliꞌ tuduꞌ odop ingan.

verses.text: Remain in that same house, eating and drinking the things they give, for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Don’t go from house to house.
verses.source_translation: Loꞌo daang boli inoh man nuak sijaꞌ-e oni deꞌ ngin nyaꞌa tuduꞌ ingan; sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja patut soꞌon pah-e.  Maꞌ yaꞌ bilalih katiꞌ-kanih topat ingan loꞌo neh.

verses.text: Into whatever city you enter, and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam ingan molot daang kupuaꞌ, duoh nyam nyaꞌa moꞌ tilimaꞌ ingan danoꞌ, man oni sijaꞌ-e pinguman deꞌ nguliaꞌ nyaꞌa tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Heal the sick who are therein, and tell them, ‘God’s Kingdom has come near to you.’
verses.source_translation: Duoh odaꞌleh nyaꞌa deꞌ monam danoꞌ mokuaꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ tanon nang, ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ nog jadin Laja daang idip ingan.’

verses.text: But into whatever city you enter, and they don’t receive you, go out into its streets and say,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyam basa-e ingan molot keꞌ kupuaꞌ, nyaꞌa danoꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ ingan, odileh keꞌ olan laya daang kupuaꞌ inoh yomoꞌ tanon nang,

verses.text: ‘Even the dust from your city that clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that God’s Kingdom has come near to you.’
verses.source_translation: ‘Debu kota ingan deꞌ lokat deꞌ poꞌon koꞌih, koꞌih nupap saꞌ-e luluh deꞌ sulung jowin ingan saꞌ jadin tanda ingan yaꞌ obuah ukum.  Pak-e natong nyeꞌ Topaꞌ moh nog jadin Laja daang idip ingan.’

verses.text: I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan daang Onu Kiamat nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Sodom lobih jangan ukum-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kota itih.”

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.source_translation: “Binasaleh ingan nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Khorazim duoh ingan nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Betsaida! Sobab nyam basa-e deꞌ kota Tirus duoh deꞌ kota Sidon ogiꞌ mukjizat-mukjizat kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ ingan, moꞌ tui odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyesal duoh bitobat.

verses.text: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal Onu Kiamat, kota Tirus duoh kota Sidon obuah ukum pak-e ukum inoh lobih jangan soꞌ ukum deꞌ obuah ingan.

verses.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades.
verses.source_translation: Ingan nyaꞌa soꞌ kota Kapernaum, ingan pikil Topaꞌ yaꞌ paꞌad ingan keꞌ sulga saꞌ-e ingan obuah nabiꞌ.  Idoh! Pak-e ingan obuah pimuun kaang neraka!”

verses.text: Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever rejects you rejects me. Whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Osi deꞌ ngojit ingan, iyoh ngojit Okuꞌ.  Osi deꞌ nulak ingan, iyoh nulak Okuꞌ.  Osi deꞌ nulak Okuꞌ, iyoh nulak geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: The seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh juꞌ puluꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh paliꞌ soꞌ pimonu-e daang toban otin-e deꞌ sonang yomoꞌ tanon nang, “Gulu, bogoꞌ munua nulut geh deꞌ koꞌih sobab pakai adon Ingan.”

verses.text: He said to them, “I saw Satan having fallen like lightning from heaven.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Noꞌuh-e Okuꞌ kilin Muot, Laja munua, labuꞌ kodaꞌ kijat soꞌ longit.

verses.text: Behold, I give you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. Nothing will in any way hurt you.
verses.source_translation: Ngojit nyeꞌ! Sibonal-e Okuꞌ moꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan monang soꞌ kuasa Muot duoh munua.  Musoh itih kodaꞌ dipoh duoh liangotis deꞌ bibisa, pak-e oni sijaꞌ-e doiꞌ deꞌ dapod kanam ingan.

verses.text: Nevertheless, don’t rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e maꞌ yaꞌ sikiya doon manah-manah sobab munua nulut deꞌ ingan, pak-e doonleh ingan sobab ogiꞌ adon ingan obuah nulis deꞌ sulga.”

verses.text: In that same hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said, “I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh doonleh Yesus daang Iyang Topaꞌ, Yoh moꞌ bidoa in-e, “Okuꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Ingan, Samaꞌ, Topaꞌ deꞌ militah tun longit duoh bumi, sobab suaꞌ-e inoh Ingan sukan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bijak duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai; pak-e Ingan tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai.  Samaꞌ, inohleh deꞌ nyonang otin Ingan.

verses.text: Turning to the disciples, he said, “All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ moꞌ ngin Samaꞌ Kuꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Onak-E.  Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ piluh Onak, nyam diꞌ-e Samaꞌ-e sijaꞌ-a.  Doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ piluh Samaꞌ, nyam diꞌ-e Onak-e sijaꞌ-a, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, deꞌ Onak inoh laꞌan tanon daꞌ-e.”
