verses.text: Turning to the disciples, he said privately, “Blessed are the eyes which see the things that you see,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus kumiat yomoꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sijaꞌ-a, “Sonangleh ingan deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moh jadi adin.

verses.text: for I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab bogoꞌ nabi duoh laja deꞌ noꞌuh yaꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ ingan, pak-e diꞌ-e ningaꞌ-e duoh yaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngojit ingan, pak-e diꞌ-e ngojit-e.”

verses.text: Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying, “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ onu takal inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi mujuag ngan-e yaꞌ suba Yesus.  Yoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, oni deꞌ nai kuꞌ saꞌ kuꞌ ponai tapod Idip sitelus-e duoh Topaꞌ?”

verses.text: He said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you read it?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot, in-e, “Oni deꞌ basa ingan daang buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa? Oni deꞌ pikil ingan daang-e?”

verses.text: He answered, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.source_translation: Gulu agama Yahudi moꞌ nyawot nang in-e, “Deꞌ daang buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa deꞌ basa koꞌih in-e, ‘Ngibalaꞌ leh Topaꞌ, sipunuaꞌ otin muꞌ, sipunuaꞌ jiwa muꞌ, suaꞌ tenaga muꞌ, sipunuaꞌ pikil muꞌ, yomoꞌ ngibalaꞌ leh siodop muꞌ manusia kodaꞌ muꞌu ngibalaꞌ odop muꞌ!’”

verses.text: He said to him, “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Bonal oni deꞌ nang ingan noh neh, naileh watinoh geh saꞌ ingan idip.”

verses.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, asked Jesus, “Who is my neighbor?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ngan-e yaꞌ ngibonal odop-e, yoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Osi mey siodopkuꞌ manusia?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot pakai perumpamaan, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali soꞌ Yahudi ponu soꞌ kota Yerusalem muun keꞌ kota Yerikho.  Daang pimonu-e yoh moꞌ obuah lapok, tolah kan-e suaꞌ-suaꞌ obuah mit, yoh moꞌ obuah pijolaꞌ geh, sape yoh nog obuaꞌ yaꞌ doiꞌ asong-e.  Yoh moꞌ tanah-e polong-polong-e deꞌ pang olan.

verses.text: By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin agama Yahudi ponu deꞌ olan inoh.  Ningaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh pak-e yoh nonan-e sijaꞌ-a soꞌ pang olan.

verses.text: In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh ogiꞌ lagiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ suku Lewi ngilusuꞌ olan inoh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ-a, pak-e nonan-e soꞌ pang olan.

verses.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he traveled, came where he was. When he saw him, he was moved with compassion,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh moꞌ ogiꞌ lagiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ Samaria daang pimonu-e ngilusuꞌ olan inoh geh, takal-e ningaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, masiꞌ nyam-e tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: came to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. He set him on his own animal, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ odi sinok nyaꞌa noh, yoh moꞌ lap kinaman-e kai angul, mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ buwah inyuaꞌ deꞌ kinaman-e, ke yoh moꞌ molut kinaman-kinaman-e.  Yoh moꞌ tunuk paꞌad keꞌ tun keledai-e yoh moꞌ toban keꞌ boli topat nyaꞌa ngilumon, yoh moꞌ bina-e.

verses.text: On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, and gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. Whatever you spend beyond that, I will repay you when I return.’
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ pagi-e yoh moꞌ ngin duwoh kiping duit pilak tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ topat soꞌ nyaꞌa ngilumon.  Yoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan bina yoh tih, simoꞌo duit tih kulang takal kuꞌ paliꞌ lagiꞌ katiꞌ okuꞌ gati-e.’”

verses.text: Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?”
verses.source_translation: Nyuang-nyuang silita Yesus, yoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ gulu agama Yahudi in-e, “Osi mey deꞌ soꞌ taluh naꞌan nyaꞌa noh deꞌ bonal-bonal nyayang nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah lapok inoh?”

verses.text: He said, “He who showed mercy on him.” Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.”
verses.source_translation: Gulu agama Yahudi inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah lapok noh tiꞌ-e leh.” Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Bonal, odileh nai kodaꞌ watinoh geh!”

verses.text: As they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E daang pimonu-e odi keꞌ Yerusalem, yomoꞌ nog keꞌ niꞌ kupuaꞌ.  Ogiꞌ dayung deꞌ adon Marta odaꞌ Yesus nosaꞌ deꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his word.
verses.source_translation: Marta inoh ogiꞌ sudiꞌ-e deꞌ dayung deꞌ adon-e Maria.  Maria inoh guluꞌ sinoꞌ poꞌon Yesus ngan-e ngojit pingunang-E.

verses.text: But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came up to him, and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister left me to serve alone? Ask her therefore to help me.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal inoh Marta sikiya bogoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ boli-e.  Iyoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ sina in-e, “Gulu, idoh keh diꞌ Ingan masiꞌ ningaꞌ okuꞌ itih, nai oniꞌ sadiꞌ-sadiꞌkuꞌ? Suba odaꞌ Maria tulung okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Marta, Marta, muꞌu sikiya bigaduh duoh nyusah odopmuꞌ nai oniꞌ masam-masam.

verses.text: but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her.”
verses.source_translation: Tolah niꞌ geh deꞌ plelu nyeꞌ nai-e deꞌ biguna.  Maria moꞌ pilih oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ ponai mit soꞌ-o.”

chapters.text: Now after these things, the Lord also appointed seventy others, and sent them two by two ahead of him into every city and place, where he was about to come. Then he said to them, “The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, that he may send out laborers into his harvest.   Go your ways. Behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.   Carry no purse, nor wallet, nor sandals. Greet no one on the way.   Into whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’   If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.   Remain in that same house, eating and drinking the things they give, for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Don’t go from house to house.   Into whatever city you enter, and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you.   Heal the sick who are therein, and tell them, ‘God’s Kingdom has come near to you.’   But into whatever city you enter, and they don’t receive you, go out into its streets and say,   ‘Even the dust from your city that clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that God’s Kingdom has come near to you.’   I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.  “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.   But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.   You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades.   Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever rejects you rejects me. Whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.” The seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!” He said to them, “I saw Satan having fallen like lightning from heaven.   Behold, I give you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. Nothing will in any way hurt you.   Nevertheless, don’t rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.” In that same hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said, “I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.” Turning to the disciples, he said, “All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.” Turning to the disciples, he said privately, “Blessed are the eyes which see the things that you see,   for I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.” Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying, “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?” He said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you read it?”  He answered, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself.” He said to him, “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.” But he, desiring to justify himself, asked Jesus, “Who is my neighbor?” Jesus answered, “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.   By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.   In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.   But a certain Samaritan, as he traveled, came where he was. When he saw him, he was moved with compassion,   came to him, and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. He set him on his own animal, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.   On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, and gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. Whatever you spend beyond that, I will repay you when I return.’   Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?” He said, “He who showed mercy on him.” Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.” As they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house. She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his word. But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came up to him, and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister left me to serve alone? Ask her therefore to help me.” Jesus answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things,   but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her.”

verses.text: When he finished praying in a certain place, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ onu takal inoh Yesus odi bidoa keꞌ niꞌ topat.  Mokuaꞌ bidoa, niꞌ soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E sina tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, suba ngajal koꞌih bidoa kodaꞌ Yohanes ngajal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bidoa.”

verses.text: He said to them, “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyam ingan bidoa, nang leh in tih, ‘Topaꞌ Samaꞌ koꞌih deꞌ sulga, Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nyomah adon Ingan deꞌ kudus.  Nogleh duoh jadileh Laja koꞌih daang dunia itih.

verses.text: Give us day by day our daily bread.
verses.source_translation: Ngin pinguman tuduꞌ koꞌih, deꞌ sukup bilang konu.

verses.text: Forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us.  Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.’”
verses.source_translation: Ngapunleh dosa koꞌih, sobab koꞌih ngapun suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai salah tuduꞌ koꞌih.  Maꞌleh tanah koꞌih odaꞌ idoh bisayaꞌ takal koꞌih obuah suba.’”

verses.text: He said to them, “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight, and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina in-e lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Nyam basa niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan odi keꞌ boli dingan ingan tuluap ngalom duoh sina, ‘Dapod yeh muꞌu ngin dioꞌ taluh kuehmuꞌ neh?

verses.text: for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him,’
verses.source_translation: Sobab dingankuꞌ deꞌ daang pimonu-e, baꞌuh sijaꞌ nosaꞌ deꞌ boli.  Duoh okuꞌ doiꞌ pinguman kaꞌan iyoh!’

verses.text: and he from within will answer and say, ‘Don’t bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can’t get up and give it to you’?
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa dingan deꞌ muꞌu odi keꞌ boli-e inoh ti-e nyawot in-e soꞌ daang boli-e, ‘Maꞌ nyusah okuꞌ! Tiban moꞌ ngobot duoh okuꞌ baya onak-onakkuꞌ moꞌ boꞌos.  Okuꞌ diꞌ dapod mokat duoh ngin oni-oni tuduꞌ muꞌu.’”

verses.text: I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyamung sina in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Sajaꞌ ingan inoh dingan-e, iyoh diꞌ-e laꞌan mokat duoh ngin oniꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.  Pak-e sobab ingan inoh diꞌ ngan puꞌan dasaꞌ kaꞌan mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ-e telus, yoh moꞌ mokat geh duoh ngin oni deꞌ plelu ingan.

verses.text: “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.
verses.source_translation: Jadi Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Mitiaꞌleh, saꞌ ingan obuah ngin, kalikleh, saꞌ ingan soꞌon, netekleh, saꞌ tiban obuah bukaꞌ kaꞌan ingan.

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.
verses.source_translation: Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ mitiaꞌ iyoh tilimaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ kalik totap soꞌon, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ netek tiban obuah bukaꞌ.

verses.text: “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won’t give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan samaꞌ deꞌ ngin dipoh deꞌ onak-e takal onak-e mitiaꞌ ikian,

verses.text: Or if he asks for an egg, he won’t give him a scorpion, will he?
verses.source_translation: atou ngin liangotis, nyam basa onak-e mitiaꞌ tuluah!

verses.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”
verses.source_translation: Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat, pak-e ingan tuong puꞌan geh oni deꞌ paguh kaꞌan onak-onak ingan.  Lobih lagiꞌ Samaꞌ ingan deꞌ sulga! Iyoh yaꞌ ngin Iyang-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ-e!”

verses.text: He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the multitudes marveled.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ onu takal Yesus kasig munua luah soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bebeꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ munua inoh luah, nyaꞌa inoh dapod sina, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ilan-e.

verses.text: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa nang, “Iyoh ponai kasig munua sobab kai kuasa Beelzebul, laja suaꞌ munua inoh.”

verses.text: Others, testing him, sought from him a sign from heaven.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus nai mukjizat podo Yoh inoh tok nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. A house divided against itself falls.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus puꞌan pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyam basa-e niꞌ negara nyaꞌa deꞌ daang-e bitomi totap negara inoh asul watinoh geh nyam basa daang niꞌ lawang boꞌon nyaꞌa deꞌ daang noh bitomi deꞌ sitipan odop-e pasti lawang boꞌon inoh patuab.

verses.text: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh daang kerajaan Muot, nyam munua buꞌui tuduꞌ sitipan odop-e, totap kerajaan inoh patuab, watinoh geh diꞌ-e molot akal nyam ingan napo Okuꞌ kasig munua pakai kuasa Beelzebul.

verses.text: But if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore will they be your judges.
verses.source_translation: Sobab Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ kasig munua pakai kuasa   Topaꞌ, Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ tanon nang ingan salah sobab ingan napo Okuꞌ kasig munua pakai kuasa Beelzebul.

verses.text: But if I by God’s finger cast out demons, then God’s Kingdom has come to you.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ kasig munua daang kuasa Topaꞌ, inohleh tanda Topaꞌ moꞌ mulai militah jadin Laja deꞌ uun ingan.

verses.text: “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own dwelling, his goods are safe.
verses.source_translation: Beelzebul laja munua inoh, kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dolas, senjata-e lekap kaꞌan-e jaga boli-e saꞌ-e silamat.

verses.text: But when someone stronger attacks him and overcomes him, he takes from him his whole armor in which he trusted, and divides his plunder.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih dolas soꞌ iyoh odi nyelang, yoh totap alah odaꞌ Kuꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh mit suaꞌ senjata deꞌ kakuꞌ-e duoh toban halta-e buu.

verses.text: “He that is not with me is against me. He who doesn’t gather with me scatters.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e nuwaꞌ Okuꞌ, loti-e yoh bakang Okuꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e kiloja duoh Okuꞌ, loti-e yoh kiloja lawan Okuꞌ!”

verses.text: The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest, and finding none, he says, ‘I will turn back to my house from which I came out.’
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Nyam basa munua luah soꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa, munua inoh ngilayou keꞌ topat-topat deꞌ bokon sape nog topat deꞌ bodoh ngan kalik topat-e loꞌo, pak-e nyam iyoh diꞌ-e dapod-e, sobab inohleh iyoh sina in-e, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli deꞌ moh ogiꞌ onukuꞌ loꞌo daꞌ-e!’

verses.text: When he returns, he finds it swept and put in order.
verses.source_translation: Takal iyoh nog danih, yoh dapod boli inoh bisig duoh tiatul.

verses.text: Then he goes, and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh yomoꞌ odi duoh toban juꞌ munua deꞌ bokon deꞌ lobih jaꞌat soꞌ iyoh.  Yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot keꞌ aang gonan nyaꞌa inoh yoh moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ.  Duoh piobuaꞌ-e nyaꞌa inoh jadi lobih jolaꞌ idip soꞌ deꞌ sibungas-e.”

verses.text: It came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts which nursed you!”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ Yesus sina watinoh tiꞌ-e, niꞌ naꞌan dayung soꞌ odop-e deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Obuah bilokatleh sinoꞌ deꞌ milaꞌ Ingan!”

verses.text: But he said, “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus nyawot-e, “Lobih obuah bilokat lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunang Topaꞌ duoh nai-e!”

verses.text: When the multitudes were gathering together to him, he began to say, “This is an evil generation. It seeks after a sign. No sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah, the prophet.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bitodod-todod sinok Yesus, Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman itih iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat.  Ingan mitiaꞌ niꞌ keajaiban soꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ ingan dapod bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e ingan diꞌ-e kan obuah ngin keajaiban inoh, jok-e mukjizat soꞌ Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nabi Yunus sijaꞌ-a.

verses.text: For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will also the Son of Man be to this generation.
verses.source_translation: Oni deꞌ jadi tuduꞌ nabi Yunus iyohleh keajaiban kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kota Niniwe, watinoh geh Onak Manusia yaꞌ jadi keajaiban kaꞌan ingan nyaꞌa joman itih.

verses.text: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and will condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.
verses.source_translation: Takal Onu kiamat, latu negli Syeba yaꞌ mokat nyalah ingan nyaꞌa joman itih.  Sobab joman noꞌuh-e latu inoh nog soꞌ tubon bumi kaꞌan ngojit ajal Laja Salomo deꞌ bijak.  Pak-e datiꞌ adin ogiꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ Laja Salomo pak-e doliaꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ!

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.
verses.source_translation: Takal Onu Kiamat, ulang Niniwe yaꞌ bangkit nyalah ingan nyaꞌa joman itih, sobab joman noꞌuh-e nyaꞌa Niniwe inoh moh bitobat soꞌ dosa-dosa-e takal Yunus kotbah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pak-e deꞌ datiꞌ adin ogiꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ Yunus pak-e ingan doliaꞌ ingan bitobat.”

verses.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina, “Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kidip lapu kadis yomoꞌ suan atou kuab kai bona.  Totu yoh gan lapu inoh deꞌ topat deꞌ dapod nyaꞌa ningaꞌ jawaꞌ-e.

verses.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.
verses.source_translation: Boton iyohleh lapu kadis kaꞌan gonan.  Nyam botonmuꞌ paguh, suaꞌ gonanmuꞌ telang-binelang.  Pak-e nyam botonmuꞌ jaꞌat, suaꞌ gonanmuꞌ jadi mopung-pipiat.

verses.text: Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn’t darkness.
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh, tauꞌ-tauꞌ, maꞌ sape telang deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ muꞌu inoh jadi mopung.

verses.text: If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light.”
verses.source_translation: Nyam suaꞌ gonanmuꞌ telang, duoh diꞌ-e sit pun deꞌ mopung, idipmuꞌ inoh telang-binelang kodaꞌ jawaꞌ lapu deꞌ sukup telang.”

verses.text: Now as he spoke, a certain Pharisee asked him to dine with him. He went in, and sat at the table.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ sina, niꞌ naꞌan ulang Farisi ngijaꞌ Yoh man keꞌ boli-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi man keꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed himself before dinner.
verses.source_translation: Ulang Farisi inoh ilan ningaꞌ Yesus diꞌ-e mamiaꞌ togan-e takal-e yaꞌ man, kodaꞌ atulan ukum Yahudi.

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh Topaꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ-e, “Ingan ulang Farisi samah kodaꞌ pingian deꞌ bisig sopaꞌ-e sijaꞌ, pak-e nuwaꞌ daang otin odop ingan punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat duoh pinganguak.

verses.text: You foolish ones, didn’t he who made the outside make the inside also?
verses.source_translation: Ingan budua! Topaꞌ deꞌ nai nuwaꞌ sopaꞌ-e baya nai nuwaꞌ aang-e!

verses.text: But give for gifts to the needy those things which are within, and behold, all things will be clean to you.
verses.source_translation: Mulah otinleh ngin halta ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, ke ingan samah kodaꞌ pingian deꞌ bisig bait nuwaꞌ sopaꞌ duoh aang-e deꞌ boton Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, but you bypass justice and God’s love. You ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e binasaleh ingan, ulang-ulang Farisi! Ingan diꞌ-e piduli oniꞌ deꞌ lobih penting.  Ingan nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ bayal persepuluhan soꞌ pimuluah, pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan adil tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon duoh ingan diꞌ-e ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ.  Paduhal suaꞌ-e inoh halus ingan nai-e.

verses.text: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues, and the greetings in the marketplaces.
verses.source_translation: Binasaleh ingan ulang Farisi! Ingan liga guluꞌ deꞌ topat-topat deꞌ suka obuah nabiꞌ daang boli topat simayang, duoh saji ingan odi keꞌ pasal-pasal saꞌ odop ingan obuah nabiꞌ.

verses.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like hidden graves, and the men who walk over them don’t know it.”
verses.source_translation: Binasaleh ingan! Ingan kodaꞌ kubul deꞌ doiꞌ tanda-e, deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa bokon ngunyak pak-e nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.”

verses.text: One of the lawyers answered him, “Teacher, in saying this you insult us also.”
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ soꞌ gulu agama Yahudi sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, daang pingunang Ingan inoh tiꞌ-e Ingan nguyat koꞌih geh.”

verses.text: He said, “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load men with burdens that are difficult to carry, and you yourselves won’t even lift one finger to help carry those burdens.
verses.source_translation: Yesus nyawot, “Binasa geh, ingan gulu-gulu agama Yahudi! Ingan gan pelatulan deꞌ lolah duoh baat, pak-e odop ingan sit doh geh laꞌan tulung nyaꞌa nai-e.

verses.text: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
verses.source_translation: Binasaleh ingan! Ingan nai kubul deꞌ paguh-paguh kaꞌan nabi-nabi, pak-e sumuk babai odop ingan geh deꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ noꞌuh-e.

verses.text: So you testify and consent to the works of your fathers. For they killed them, and you build their tombs.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e watinoh, odop ingan deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang ingan nyokong oni deꞌ nai sumuk babai ingan.  Sobab sumuk babai ingan deꞌ ngabos nabi-nabi deꞌ munoꞌ noꞌuh-e neh, duoh adin ingan nai kubul deꞌ paguh-paguh saꞌan kuab dosa sumuk babai ingan deꞌ noꞌuh-e.

verses.text: Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles; and some of them they will kill and persecute,
verses.source_translation: Inoh sobab-e Topaꞌ sina daang bijak-e, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngutus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nabi-nabi duoh rasul Kuꞌ, pak-e ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngabos duoh ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nyiksa!’

verses.text: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa joman itih sobab suaꞌ nabi-nabi moh obuah ngabos soꞌ sibungas dunia obuah nai.

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary.’ Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ Habel nog Zakharia, Zakharia inoh deꞌ obuah ngabos deꞌ osah Mezbah duoh Boli Topaꞌ.  Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman adin yaꞌ obuah ukum sobab, sumuk babai ingan moꞌ ngabos suaꞌ nabi inoh.

verses.text: Woe to you lawyers! For you took away the key of knowledge. You didn’t enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in, you hindered.”
verses.source_translation: Binasaleh ingan gulu-gulu agama Yahudi! Kusi kaꞌan bukaꞌ tiban deꞌ odaꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ bonal ogiꞌ deꞌ ingan pak-e ingan doliaꞌ molot keꞌ daang kaꞌan kalik oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ lolah posah yaꞌ molot keꞌ daang-e ingan jaman-e.”

verses.text: As he said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly angry, and to draw many things out of him;
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus yaꞌ buu soꞌ topat inoh, gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi inoh malah tuduꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngasang Yesus saꞌ-e laꞌan sina bogoꞌ.

verses.text: lying in wait for him, and seeking to catch him in something he might say, that they might accuse him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tluti bonal-bonal sina-E, ngan-e yaꞌ kalik pingunang Yesus deꞌ salah.

chapters.text: When he finished praying in a certain place, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.” He said to them, “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.  Give us day by day our daily bread.  Forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us.  Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.’” He said to them, “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight, and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,   for a friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him,’   and he from within will answer and say, ‘Don’t bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can’t get up and give it to you’?   I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.  “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.   For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.  “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won’t give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?   Or if he asks for an egg, he won’t give him a scorpion, will he?   If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?” He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the multitudes marveled. But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.” Others, testing him, sought from him a sign from heaven. But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. A house divided against itself falls.   If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.   But if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore will they be your judges.   But if I by God’s finger cast out demons, then God’s Kingdom has come to you.  “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own dwelling, his goods are safe.   But when someone stronger attacks him and overcomes him, he takes from him his whole armor in which he trusted, and divides his plunder.   “He that is not with me is against me. He who doesn’t gather with me scatters.   The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest, and finding none, he says, ‘I will turn back to my house from which I came out.’   When he returns, he finds it swept and put in order.   Then he goes, and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.” It came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts which nursed you!” But he said, “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.” When the multitudes were gathering together to him, he began to say, “This is an evil generation. It seeks after a sign. No sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah, the prophet.   For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will also the Son of Man be to this generation.   The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and will condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.   The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.  “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light.   The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.   Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn’t darkness.   If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light.” Now as he spoke, a certain Pharisee asked him to dine with him. He went in, and sat at the table. When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed himself before dinner. The Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.   You foolish ones, didn’t he who made the outside make the inside also?   But give for gifts to the needy those things which are within, and behold, all things will be clean to you.   But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, but you bypass justice and God’s love. You ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.   Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues, and the greetings in the marketplaces.   Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like hidden graves, and the men who walk over them don’t know it.” One of the lawyers answered him, “Teacher, in saying this you insult us also.” He said, “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load men with burdens that are difficult to carry, and you yourselves won’t even lift one finger to help carry those burdens.   Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.   So you testify and consent to the works of your fathers. For they killed them, and you build their tombs.   Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles; and some of them they will kill and persecute,   that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;   from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary.’ Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation.   Woe to you lawyers! For you took away the key of knowledge. You didn’t enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in, you hindered.”  As he said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly angry, and to draw many things out of him; lying in wait for him, and seeking to catch him in something he might say, that they might accuse him.

verses.text: Meanwhile, when a multitude of many thousands had gathered together, so much so that they trampled on each other, he began to tell his disciples first of all, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.source_translation: Takal bilibu-libu nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bitodod-todod bikuluk.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E in-e, “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Farisi sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ liga pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ, jaꞌ ingan samah kodaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: But there is nothing covered up, that will not be revealed, nor hidden, that will not be known.
verses.source_translation: Oni deꞌ obuah nutu adin yaꞌ tibukaꞌ, duoh oniꞌ deꞌ obuah suan totap nyaꞌa yaꞌ puꞌan.

verses.text: Therefore whatever you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. What you have spoken in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.
verses.source_translation: Sobab oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nutu ingan, sijakaꞌ-jakaꞌ-e totap puꞌan nyaꞌa geh duoh oni deꞌ bikayas ingan daang bilit, totap nyaꞌa deꞌ sopaꞌ puꞌan-e geh.

verses.text: “I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ: Ingan dingan-dingan Kuꞌ, maꞌ ingan tolu tuduꞌ manusia deꞌ jok-e ponai ngabos gonan nyeꞌ sijaꞌ-e, jok-e inoh, doiꞌ yoh ponai nai oni deꞌ lobih soꞌ noh.

verses.text: But I will warn you whom you should fear. Fear him, who after he has killed, has power to cast into Gehenna. Yes, I tell you, fear him.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, tuduꞌ osi ingan patut tolu.  Toluleh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, sobab mokuaꞌ ngabos, Iyoh ogiꞌ kuasa kaꞌan tolan nyaꞌa kaang neraka, inoh Nyaꞌa deꞌ patut muꞌu tolu daꞌ-E.

verses.text: “Aren’t five sparrows sold for two assaria coins? Not one of them is forgotten by God.
verses.source_translation: Idoh keh ingan puꞌan nang, manuk piit limoh polong loga-e duwoh kiping pilak deꞌ diꞌ-e sikiya biloga? Sungu-e kiang inoh niꞌ polong idoh geh diꞌ-e Topaꞌ komut-e.

verses.text: But the very hairs of your head are all counted. Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.
verses.source_translation: Baya buak deꞌ bak ingan tuang obuah ngituang geh suaꞌ-suaꞌ-e, sobab inoh maꞌ tolu, ingan lobih biloga soꞌ manuk piit deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: “I tell you, everyone who confesses me before men, him will the Son of Man also confess before the angels of God;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nang odop-e jadi pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia, tuang ngakuꞌ geh iyoh jadi pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin malaikat-malaikat Topaꞌ.

verses.text: but he who denies me in the presence of men will be denied in the presence of the angels of God.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ odop-e jadi pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, iyoh tuang idoh diꞌ-e obuah ngakuꞌ jadi pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin malaikat-malaikat Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but those who blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pijaꞌat Onak Manusia, iyoh obuah ngapun, pak-e osi deꞌ nguyat Iyang Topaꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e obuah ngapun.

verses.text: When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, don’t be anxious how or what you will answer, or what you will say;
verses.source_translation: Nyam nyaꞌa toban ingan kaꞌan obuah ngadel keꞌ boli topat simayang atou deꞌ jowin plitah, maꞌ ingan bigaduh oni deꞌ yaꞌ nang ingan ngan ingan yaꞌ bela odop ingan.

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what you must say.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab takal inoh Iyang Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngajal ingan oni in oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nang ingan.”

verses.text: One of the multitude said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, sina tuduꞌ madihku saꞌ-e kutung halta deꞌ supiah pingoma koꞌih.”

verses.text: But he said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or an arbitrator over you?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e in Yesus nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ idoh diꞌ-e hakim atou nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang kutung halta saꞌan muꞌu!”

verses.text: He said to them, “Beware! Keep yourselves from covetousness, for a man’s life doesn’t consist of the abundance of the things which he possesses.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ in Yesus lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ jaꞌ muꞌu jadi nyaꞌa deꞌ pinganguak, sobab idip manusia idoh diꞌ-e jok-e soꞌ halta sijaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: He spoke a parable to them, saying, “The ground of a certain rich man produced abundantly.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ perumpamaan in-e, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal kaya, bogoꞌ hasil soꞌ umoh-e.

verses.text: He reasoned within himself, saying, ‘What will I do, because I don’t have room to store my crops?’
verses.source_translation: Sidagal kaya inoh sina daang otin-e, ‘Bogoꞌ hasil gandum soꞌ umohkuꞌ, pak-e topat soꞌ kuꞌ yaꞌ nyikon-e diꞌ-e sukup.’

verses.text: He said, ‘This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns, and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ in-e, ‘Itih deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ neh, okuꞌ yaꞌ pilubuh basal-basalkuꞌ mokuaꞌ inoh okuꞌ yaꞌ nai lobih ayuh soꞌ kuꞌ yaꞌ nyikon gandum duoh balang-balangkuꞌ.

verses.text: I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take your ease, eat, drink, be merry.”’
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ odopkuꞌ: Utung manah okuꞌ bogoꞌ balang, bitugung-tugung kaꞌan bisowaꞌ-sowaꞌ.  Jadi okuꞌ loꞌo tiaꞌ, man, nuak duoh bisonang-sonang sijaꞌ-e.’

verses.text: “But God said to him, ‘You foolish one, tonight your soul is required of you. The things which you have prepared—whose will they be?’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e in Pingunang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-e, ‘Muꞌu nyaꞌa deꞌ budua, ngalom itih muꞌu yaꞌ kobos, jadi kaꞌan osi halta deꞌ nguluk muꞌ noh?’

verses.text: So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”
verses.source_translation: Wat inohleh deꞌ jadi tuduꞌ tiap-tiap nyaꞌa deꞌ nguluk halta saꞌan odop-e, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e kaya deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor yet for your body, what you will wear.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Sobab inoh Okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ ingan, maꞌ bigaduh duoh idipmuꞌ, oni deꞌ yaꞌ man muꞌ, oni deꞌ yaꞌ pakai muꞌ.

verses.text: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.
verses.source_translation: Sobab idip lobih penting soꞌ pinguman duoh gonan lobih penting soꞌ pimakai.

verses.text: Consider the ravens: they don’t sow, they don’t reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!
verses.source_translation: Suba ningaꞌ manuk kakuang deꞌ diꞌ-e bipuluah diꞌ-e ngutuam yomoꞌ doiꞌ geh basal-e, pak-e Topaꞌ ngin man daꞌ-e.  Ingan juuaꞌ lobih biloga soꞌ manuk-manuk inoh.

verses.text: Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ bigaduh, sobab sit doiꞌ geh umul nyaꞌa ponai bitamah takal iyoh bigaduh.

verses.text: If then you aren’t able to do even the least things, why are you anxious about the rest?
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa ingan diꞌ ngan ponai namah sit geh umul ingan, nai oni ingan bigaduh duoh oniꞌ deꞌ bokon!

verses.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.source_translation: Suba ningaꞌ bunga deꞌ tumuꞌ deꞌ tolun deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai nyiꞌit ngan-e nai pimakai-e.  Pak-e Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Laja Salomo deꞌ bonal-bonal kaya doiꞌ geh iyoh kai pimakai deꞌ lobih sangon soꞌ bunga-bunga inoh!

verses.text: But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?
verses.source_translation: Jadi nyam basa bunga deꞌ tolun onu itih ogiꞌ, tiaꞌ pagi obuah nyouh, pak-e Topaꞌ nai bunga inoh lobih paguh.  Watinoh geh ingan totu Topaꞌ ngin pimakai deꞌ ingan! Oni nai ingan idoh bisayaꞌ?

verses.text: Don’t seek what you will eat or what you will drink; neither be anxious.
verses.source_translation: Jadi maꞌ lika pikil oni deꞌ yaꞌ man ingan atou oni deꞌ yaꞌ nuak ingan duoh maꞌ bigaduh otin ingan.

verses.text: For the nations of the world seek after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need these things.
verses.source_translation: Sobab suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, pak-e Samaꞌ ingan puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ plelu ingan.

verses.text: But seek God’s Kingdom, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e idipleh nunaꞌ plitah Topaꞌ daang idip ingan, ke suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ plelu ingan Topaꞌ ngin-e.”

verses.text: Don’t be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.
verses.source_translation: “Maꞌ tolu ingan uluk deꞌ isit, sobab Samaꞌ ingan iyohleh Laja deꞌ sonang blokat ingan.

verses.text: Sell that which you have, and give gifts to the needy. Make for yourselves purses which don’t grow old, a treasure in the heavens that doesn’t fail, where no thief approaches, neither moth destroys.
verses.source_translation: Jualeh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ ingan, duoh nginleh duit-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag jadi nyam-e watinoh ingan moꞌ nyikon halta ingan deꞌ sulga, inohleh topat halta deꞌ diꞌ ponai lusak nah-nah.  Halta inoh diꞌ ponai moyap sobab pinoku diꞌ-e ponai mit-e duoh gilogot diꞌ-e dapod pilusak-e.

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.source_translation: Sobab daki soꞌ haltamuꞌ, danoꞌ geh soꞌ otinmuꞌ!”

verses.text: “Let your waist be dressed and your lamps burning.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Silaluleh odaꞌ odop ingan sidia saꞌan melayani Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Be like men watching for their lord, when he returns from the marriage feast; that, when he comes and knocks, they may immediately open to him.
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ kuli deꞌ siap sidia kajon toke paliꞌ soꞌ topat nyaꞌa biluman, saꞌ-a nyam basa iyoh nog duoh netek tiban, lasuꞌ nyeꞌ bukaꞌ tiban saꞌan-e.

verses.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord will find watching when he comes. Most certainly I tell you, that he will dress himself, and make them recline, and will come and serve them.
verses.source_translation: Obuah bilokatleh kuli-kuli deꞌ moꞌ siap sidia takal toke-e nog.  Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Toke inoh siap yaꞌ layan kuli-kuli-e inoh yomoꞌ odaꞌ guluꞌ, yomoꞌ ngin man tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: They will be blessed if he comes in the second or third watch, and finds them so.
verses.source_translation: Kuli-kuli deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ lobih obuah bilokat lagiꞌ nyam basa toke-e paliꞌ tuluap ngalom atou suam pagi dapod odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ siap sidia.

verses.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e natong nyeꞌ, nyam basa-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli puꞌan pukul kudu pinoku yaꞌ nog, idoh diꞌ iyoh tanah odaꞌ pinoku molot kaang boli-e.

verses.text: Therefore be ready also, for the Son of Man is coming in an hour that you don’t expect him.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh muꞌu tuang siap sidia geh, sobab Okuꞌ Onak Manusia yaꞌ nog daang onu deꞌ diꞌ muꞌu sakaꞌ-a.”

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everybody?”
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ sikian in-e, “Gulu, podo koꞌih sijaꞌ-e deꞌ ngajal Ingan daang perumpamaan itih atou suaꞌ nyaꞌa?”

verses.text: The Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the right times?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Jadileh kuli deꞌ setia duoh bijak! Sobab kuli deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh, nyam toke-e yaꞌ buu toke-e pakat jadi pimipin kaꞌan suaꞌ kuli-e, yoh deꞌ ngin man tuduꞌ kuli-kuli-e deꞌ bokon takal sukup jam-e.

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord will find doing so when he comes.
verses.source_translation: Obuah bilokat kuli-e takal toke-e nog ningaꞌ kuli-e nai kiloja-e!

verses.text: Truly I tell you, that he will set him over all that he has.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Totu toke inoh yaꞌ paꞌad pakat-e jadi pigawas kaꞌan suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e.

verses.text: But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My lord delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyam basa kuli inoh jaꞌat yomoꞌ sina daang otin-e, ‘Tokekuꞌ diꞌ-e nog-nog’, iyoh moꞌ mosut kuli-kuli deꞌ bokon duoh man nuak nog-e mabuk,

verses.text: then the lord of that servant will come in a day when he isn’t expecting him, and in an hour that he doesn’t know, and will cut him in two, and place his portion with the unfaithful.
verses.source_translation: nyam toke-e nog daang onu deꞌ diꞌ-e sakaꞌ-a, kuli inoh obuah ngabos, nasib-e samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e setia tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: That servant, who knew his lord’s will, and didn’t prepare, nor do what he wanted, will be beaten with many stripes,
verses.source_translation: Kuli deꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ odaꞌ toke-e nai, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e nai-e, iyoh obuah posut ulih-ulih-e.

verses.text: but he who didn’t know, and did things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. To whomever much is given, of him will much be required; and to whom much was entrusted, of him more will be asked.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e kuli deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oni deꞌ suka toke-e duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ salah obuah posut kudu-kudu sidoh-e sijaꞌ-a.  Sobab Topaꞌ ngalap bogoꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moh tilimaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ, duoh ngalap lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ sukup bogoꞌ lagiꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: “I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus sina lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog toban opui keꞌ bumi, pak-e Okuꞌ alap opui moꞌ biduduꞌ.

verses.text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ susah jolaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ Kuꞌ obuah dioꞌ.  Otinkuꞌ susah nyam natong oni deꞌ yaꞌ obuah odopkuꞌ neh.

verses.text: Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ ingan sakaꞌ nang Okuꞌ nog toban damai keꞌ bumi! Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan Okuꞌ itih nog yaꞌ toban kaꞌi kalah.

verses.text: For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
verses.source_translation: Sobab soꞌ adin ogiꞌ limoh naꞌan bikaꞌi-bikalah daang niꞌ lawang boꞌon.  Taluh lawan duwoh, duwoh lawan taluh.

verses.text: They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bikaꞌi-bikalah, samaꞌ bikaꞌi duoh onak-e deꞌ dali, yomoꞌ sinoꞌ bikaꞌi duoh onak deꞌ dayung, iban deꞌ dayung bikaꞌi duoh tua deꞌ dayung.”

verses.text: He said to the multitudes also, “When you see a cloud rising from the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it happens.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Nyam ingan kilin longit mopung, lasuꞌ ingan nang, ‘Onu itih yaꞌ ijan’.  Yomoꞌ tok-tok-e ijan.

verses.text: When a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be a scorching heat,’ and it happens.
verses.source_translation: Nyam ingan ngoon sobak, ingan nang, ‘Onu itih yaꞌ putiak’, yomoꞌ tok-tok-e putiak.

verses.text: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don’t interpret this time?
verses.source_translation: Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ lika pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ! Oni deꞌ jadi deꞌ bumi duoh longit ingan puꞌan tanda-e.  Pak-e keajaiban deꞌ moh nai Kuꞌ joman itih idoh ingan puꞌan-e?”

verses.text: Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.source_translation: “Odop ingan sipatut-e puꞌan oni deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: For when you are going with your adversary before the magistrate, try diligently on the way to be released from him, lest perhaps he drag you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
verses.source_translation: Sobab, nyam ingan duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan ingan odi tuduꞌ plitah, daang pimonu ingan subaleh bidamai saꞌ-e diꞌ-e toban ingan tuduꞌ hakim, yomoꞌ hakim moꞌ tod ingan tuduꞌ sidadu, sidadu inoh kibalot ingan daang jel.

verses.text: I tell you, you will by no means get out of there, until you have paid the very last penny.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Idoh ingan ponai luah soꞌ kanoꞌ, nyam basa aluaꞌ diꞌ ingan bayal dena ingan nog obuaꞌ-e.”

chapters.text: Meanwhile, when a multitude of many thousands had gathered together, so much so that they trampled on each other, he began to tell his disciples first of all, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.   But there is nothing covered up, that will not be revealed, nor hidden, that will not be known.   Therefore whatever you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. What you have spoken in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.  “I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.   But I will warn you whom you should fear. Fear him, who after he has killed, has power to cast into Gehenna. Yes, I tell you, fear him.  “Aren’t five sparrows sold for two assaria coins? Not one of them is forgotten by God.   But the very hairs of your head are all counted. Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.  “I tell you, everyone who confesses me before men, him will the Son of Man also confess before the angels of God;   but he who denies me in the presence of men will be denied in the presence of the angels of God.   Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but those who blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.   When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, don’t be anxious how or what you will answer, or what you will say;   for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what you must say.” One of the multitude said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.” But he said to him, “Man, who made me a judge or an arbitrator over you?” He said to them, “Beware! Keep yourselves from covetousness, for a man’s life doesn’t consist of the abundance of the things which he possesses.” He spoke a parable to them, saying, “The ground of a certain rich man produced abundantly.   He reasoned within himself, saying, ‘What will I do, because I don’t have room to store my crops?’   He said, ‘This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns, and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.   I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take your ease, eat, drink, be merry.”’  “But God said to him, ‘You foolish one, tonight your soul is required of you. The things which you have prepared—whose will they be?’   So is he who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.” He said to his disciples, “Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor yet for your body, what you will wear.   Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.   Consider the ravens: they don’t sow, they don’t reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!   Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?   If then you aren’t able to do even the least things, why are you anxious about the rest?   Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.   But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?   Don’t seek what you will eat or what you will drink; neither be anxious.   For the nations of the world seek after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need these things.   But seek God’s Kingdom, and all these things will be added to you.   Don’t be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.   Sell that which you have, and give gifts to the needy. Make for yourselves purses which don’t grow old, a treasure in the heavens that doesn’t fail, where no thief approaches, neither moth destroys.   For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.   “Let your waist be dressed and your lamps burning.   Be like men watching for their lord, when he returns from the marriage feast; that, when he comes and knocks, they may immediately open to him.   Blessed are those servants, whom the lord will find watching when he comes. Most certainly I tell you, that he will dress himself, and make them recline, and will come and serve them.   They will be blessed if he comes in the second or third watch, and finds them so.   But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not allowed his house to be broken into.   Therefore be ready also, for the Son of Man is coming in an hour that you don’t expect him.” Peter said to him, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everybody?” The Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the right times?   Blessed is that servant whom his lord will find doing so when he comes.   Truly I tell you, that he will set him over all that he has.   But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My lord delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken,   then the lord of that servant will come in a day when he isn’t expecting him, and in an hour that he doesn’t know, and will cut him in two, and place his portion with the unfaithful.   That servant, who knew his lord’s will, and didn’t prepare, nor do what he wanted, will be beaten with many stripes,   but he who didn’t know, and did things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. To whomever much is given, of him will much be required; and to whom much was entrusted, of him more will be asked.   “I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.   But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!   Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division.   For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.   They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”   He said to the multitudes also, “When you see a cloud rising from the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it happens.   When a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be a scorching heat,’ and it happens.   You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don’t interpret this time?   Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?   For when you are going with your adversary before the magistrate, try diligently on the way to be released from him, lest perhaps he drag you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.   I tell you, you will by no means get out of there, until you have paid the very last penny.”

verses.text: Now there were some present at the same time who told him about the Galileans, whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ ngajal ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon gah deꞌ Yesus nang, “Kudu-kudu onu takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa soꞌ Galilea deꞌ obuah ngabos odaꞌ Pilatus, takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngin kulban tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?
verses.source_translation: Ngojit gah inoh, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, “Ngan ulang Galilea obuah ngabos watinoh, podo ingan moꞌ pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ lobih bidosa soꞌ nyaꞌa Galilea deꞌ bokon?

verses.text: I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.
verses.source_translation: Idoh! Natong nyeꞌ suaꞌ ingan tuang kobos geh nyam suaꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Or those eighteen, on whom the tower in Siloam fell, and killed them; do you think that they were worse offenders than all the men who dwell in Jerusalem?
verses.source_translation: Idoh keh diꞌ ingan natong-e, takal simoong moih naꞌan nyaꞌa kobos obuah nyonug boli deꞌ bigatung deꞌ Siloam? Podo ingan bipikil nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ lobih bidosa soꞌ ulang Yerusalem deꞌ bokon?

verses.text: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.”
verses.source_translation: Idoh! Kuꞌ tanon baꞌuh tuduꞌ ingan natong nyeꞌ suaꞌ ingan tuang kobos geh nyam suaꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: He spoke this parable. “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it, and found none.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ biasa-e bibuaꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ puluah-a deꞌ kobon angul-e, niꞌ onu takal-e odi kalik buaꞌ-e, niꞌ buaꞌ doiꞌ geh yoh soꞌon-e.

verses.text: He said to the vine dresser, ‘Behold, these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and found none. Cut it down. Why does it waste the soil?’
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ sina duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kobon-e, ‘Ningaꞌ, moꞌ taluh sowaꞌ tiaꞌ kuꞌ odi kalik buaꞌ tongon koyuh itih pak-e niꞌ buaꞌ doiꞌ geh kuꞌ soꞌon-e.  Nobong negeh tongon koyuh noh neh! Sobab doiꞌ manah guna-e iyoh idip!’

verses.text: He answered, ‘Lord, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it, and fertilize it.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Maꞌ dioꞌ doh tanah saꞌ-e idip daang niꞌ sowaꞌ itih, saꞌ kuꞌ suba nyakul tanaꞌ deꞌ puꞌun-e yomoꞌ dabul abok daꞌ-a,

verses.text: If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.’”
verses.source_translation: osi puꞌan sowaꞌ baꞌuh podo-e bibuaꞌ.  Pak-e nyam idoh, ke nyeꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ nobong-e.’”

verses.text: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.
verses.source_translation: Takal Onu Sabat, Yesus ngajal daang boli topat simayang.

verses.text: Behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and she was bent over, and could in no way straighten herself up.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ dayung deꞌ monam simoong moih sowaꞌ, iyoh mudug diꞌ-e ponai mujuag tongon sobab daang gonan-e ogiꞌ munua.

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her, and said to her, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ-e, Iyoh mogan-e duoh sina tuduꞌ-e, “Adin Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ soꞌ onammuꞌ!”

verses.text: He laid his hands on her, and immediately she stood up straight, and glorified God.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus gan tongan-e deꞌ dayung inoh, yoh lasuꞌ mujuag tongon mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, yomoꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude, “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!”
verses.source_translation: Pimipin boli topat simayang inoh moꞌ tiwas tuduꞌ oni deꞌ nai Yesus sobab Iyoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ daang Onu Sabat.  Sobab inoh pimipin inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, “Niꞌ minggu ogiꞌ nuam onu deꞌ soꞌon otoꞌ kiloja daꞌ-a.  Nogleh daang onu-onu deꞌ munoꞌ nyam ingan laꞌan mokuaꞌ, maꞌ nog daang Onu Sabat!”

verses.text: Therefore the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina, “Pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ sijaꞌ ingan itih! Sobab daang Onu Sabat ingan pilopas binatang deꞌ kidip ingan soꞌ topat-e ngan-e ingan toban luah saꞌ-e man nuak.

verses.text: Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ datiꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung soꞌ onak-sukun Abraham, deꞌ moh simoong moih sowaꞌ ogiꞌ Muot daang gonan-e.  Idoh keh iyoh dapod obuah pilopas soꞌ Muot daang Onu Sabat?”

verses.text: As he said these things, all his adversaries were disappointed, and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang Yesus inoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e suka daꞌ-E jadi dasaꞌ, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon sonang ningaꞌ oni deꞌ nai Yesus maꞌ mun konaꞌ-e.

verses.text: He said, “What is God’s Kingdom like? To what shall I compare it?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian in-e, “Oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja? Yomoꞌ samah kodaꞌ oni Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan?

verses.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and put in his own garden. It grew, and became a large tree, and the birds of the sky live in its branches.”
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja samah kodaꞌ luang deꞌ alus deꞌ obuah mit odaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan yomoꞌ puluah deꞌ umoh-e, luang inoh tumuꞌ jadi tongon koyuh yomoꞌ manuk nai solin-e deꞌ sokap-sokap-e.”

verses.text: Again he said, “To what shall I compare God’s Kingdom?
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ Yesus sikian in-e, “Oniwat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja? Yomoꞌ samah kodaꞌ oni, Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan?

verses.text: It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures  of flour, until it was all leavened.”
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja samah kodaꞌ lagi deꞌ isit deꞌ obuah kaluꞌ duoh tepong deꞌ kiang oni nog-e komang.”

verses.text: He went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and traveling on to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Daang pimonu-E keꞌ Yerusalem, Yesus ngilusuꞌ kota-kota duoh kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ simadi-e ngajal.

verses.text: One said to him, “Lord, are they few who are saved?” He said to them,
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, podo sit-e geh keh nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ koꞌih tih deꞌ yaꞌ obuah nyilamat?”

verses.text: “Strive to enter in by the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will seek to enter in, and will not be able.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Natong nyeꞌ! Ingan halus kagaꞌ odop ingan molot soꞌ tiban deꞌ koꞌot sobab bogoꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ kagaꞌ odop-e molot pak-e diꞌ-e dapod!

verses.text: When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside, and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’ then he will answer and tell you, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’
verses.source_translation: Nyam nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli kuab tiban-e, ingan mujuag deꞌ sopaꞌ simadi netek-netek tiban, ingan nang, ‘Tulung, bukaꞌ leh tiban kaꞌan koꞌih!’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Osi ingan, idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ piluh ingan neh!’

verses.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.source_translation: Duoh ingan moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Koꞌih moh man nuaꞌ bisamah duoh ingan yomoꞌ Ingan moh ngajal geh deꞌ olan-olan deꞌ kota koꞌih!’

verses.text: He will say, ‘I tell you, I don’t know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.’
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli yaꞌ nang in-e, ‘Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ pilih ingan neh! Buu leh soꞌ katiꞌ ingan deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat!’

verses.text: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets, in God’s Kingdom, and yourselves being thrown outside.
verses.source_translation: Takal ingan ningaꞌ Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja deꞌ nyuang joman.  Abraham, Ishak yoh moꞌ Yakub baya suaꞌ nabi sonang, pak-e ingan siꞌien, duoh jolaꞌ sobab ingan diꞌ ingan dapod suaꞌ!

verses.text: They will come from the east, west, north, and south, and will sit down in God’s Kingdom.
verses.source_translation: Takal joman inoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ nog soꞌ suaꞌ topat deꞌ bumi, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ doꞌon.

verses.text: Behold, there are some who are last who will be first, and there are some who are first who will be last.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab, osi deꞌ nang odop-e bigatung yoh obuah pimuun, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pimuun odop-e yoh obuah pakat.”

verses.text: On that same day, some Pharisees came, saying to him, “Get out of here, and go away, for Herod wants to kill you.”
verses.source_translation: Takal onu inoh geh, ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi odi tuduꞌ Yesus yomoꞌ sina, “Maꞌ loꞌo datiꞌ! Buu leh keꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, sobab Herodes yaꞌ ngabos Ingan.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Odi tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat duoh diꞌ-e biguna inoh, ‘Duom kudu-kudu onu sijaꞌ-a Kuꞌ dapod nai kiloja Kuꞌ kasig munua duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, pak-e yaꞌ nog onu-e okuꞌ yaꞌ mokuaꞌ nai kiloja Kuꞌ’ inoh.

verses.text: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can’t be that a prophet would perish outside of Jerusalem.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ halus nyamung pimonu Kuꞌ onu itih, tiaꞌ pagi duoh baton-e sobab diꞌ-e patut nabi obuah ngabos deꞌ sopaꞌ kota Yerusalem.

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!
verses.source_translation: Ulang Yerusalem, ulang Yerusalem! Nabi obuaꞌ ingan ngabos! Nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ odi tuduꞌ ingan, ingan nyokad pakai batuh nog-e kobos! Moh kudu sidoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ nguluk suaꞌ ingan kodaꞌ sinoꞌ siuak ngukuap onak-e deꞌ libuaꞌ ilad-e, pak-e ingan doliaꞌ ngan!

verses.text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh ngan Topaꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ lagiꞌ loꞌo bisamah duoh ingan.  Soꞌ adin ingan diꞌ-e tiaꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ lagiꞌ nog ingan sina, ‘Obuah bilokatleh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog daang adon Topaꞌ!’”

chapters.text: Now there were some present at the same time who told him about the Galileans, whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices. Jesus answered them, “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?   I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.   Or those eighteen, on whom the tower in Siloam fell, and killed them; do you think that they were worse offenders than all the men who dwell in Jerusalem?   I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.” He spoke this parable. “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it, and found none.   He said to the vine dresser, ‘Behold, these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and found none. Cut it down. Why does it waste the soil?’   He answered, ‘Lord, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it, and fertilize it.   If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.’” He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day. Behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and she was bent over, and could in no way straighten herself up. When Jesus saw her, he called her, and said to her, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.” He laid his hands on her, and immediately she stood up straight, and glorified God. The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude, “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!” Therefore the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?   Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”  As he said these things, all his adversaries were disappointed, and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him. He said, “What is God’s Kingdom like? To what shall I compare it?   It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and put in his own garden. It grew, and became a large tree, and the birds of the sky live in its branches.” Again he said, “To what shall I compare God’s Kingdom?   It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures  of flour, until it was all leavened.” He went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and traveling on to Jerusalem. One said to him, “Lord, are they few who are saved?” He said to them,  “Strive to enter in by the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will seek to enter in, and will not be able.   When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside, and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’ then he will answer and tell you, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’   Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’   He will say, ‘I tell you, I don’t know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.’   There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets, in God’s Kingdom, and yourselves being thrown outside.   They will come from the east, west, north, and south, and will sit down in God’s Kingdom.   Behold, there are some who are last who will be first, and there are some who are first who will be last.” On that same day, some Pharisees came, saying to him, “Get out of here, and go away, for Herod wants to kill you.” He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.   Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can’t be that a prophet would perish outside of Jerusalem.’  “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!   Behold, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”

verses.text: When he went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees on a Sabbath to eat bread, they were watching him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Onu Sabat Yesus odi man deꞌ boli niꞌ naꞌan pimipin ulang Farisi, danoꞌ ogiꞌ ulang Farisi deꞌ bokon duoh gulu-gulu agama tiluti Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ kalik salah-E.

verses.text: Behold, a certain man who had dropsy was in front of him.
verses.source_translation: Tang-tang nogleh niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ monam, deꞌ poꞌon duoh tongan-e bokak.

verses.text: Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus sikian tuduꞌ gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Nunaꞌ ukum agama otoꞌ soꞌon kedoh otoꞌ odaꞌ mokuaꞌ nyaꞌa daang Onu Sabat?”

verses.text: But they were silent. He took him, and healed him, and let him go.
verses.source_translation: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Farisi loꞌo sijaꞌ-e Yesus moꞌ tomaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh duoh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ, Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ buu.

verses.text: He answered them, “Which of you, if your son or an ox fell into a well, wouldn’t immediately pull him out on a Sabbath day?”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, “Nyam basa onak ingan atou onak lembu ingan deꞌ labuꞌ daang lubang takal Onu Sabat, totu ingan lasuꞌ nalik piluah soꞌ daang lubang takal Onu Sabat inoh geh!”

verses.text: They couldn’t answer him regarding these things.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ ponai nang oni-oni takal ngojit pingunang Yesus inoh.

verses.text: He spoke a parable to those who were invited, when he noticed how they chose the best seats, and said to them,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ tamu-tamu deꞌ pilih topat-topat deꞌ paguh sobab inohleh Yoh ngin ajal itih tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,

verses.text: “When you are invited by anyone to a marriage feast, don’t sit in the best seat, since perhaps someone more honorable than you might be invited by him,
verses.source_translation: “Nyam ingan obuah ngunang odi keꞌ topat biluman maꞌleh guluꞌ deꞌ topat piayuh, jak-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ lobih penting lagiꞌ soꞌ muꞌu obuah ngunang,

verses.text: and he who invited both of you would come and tell you, ‘Make room for this person.’ Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.
verses.source_translation: yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli deꞌ ngunang muꞌu inoh odi tuduꞌ muꞌu yomoꞌ sina, ‘Topat itih moꞌ obuah sidia kaꞌan nyaꞌa inoh,’ daang kolaꞌ muꞌ odi guluꞌ deꞌ topat deꞌ bokon deꞌ punuaꞌ.

verses.text: But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may tell you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌo muꞌu obuah ngunang guluꞌ leh deꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, podo-podo nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli nog yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ muꞌu, ‘Dingan odileh guluꞌ keꞌ jowin,’ danoꞌ leh muꞌu obuah nabiꞌ deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab osi deꞌ pakat odop-e, yoh yaꞌ obuah pimuun, osi deꞌ pimuun odop-e yoh yaꞌ obuah pakat.”

verses.text: He also said to the one who had invited him, “When you make a dinner or a supper, don’t call your friends, nor your brothers, nor your kinsmen, nor rich neighbors, or perhaps they might also return the favor, and pay you back.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngunang Odop-E, “Simoꞌo muꞌu yaꞌ biluman, maꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ jok muꞌ ngunang dingan-dingan, sikiaꞌ sudiꞌ, madih ayuamuꞌ atou nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya deꞌ sinok bolimuꞌ, sobab nyam odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ biluman odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod paliꞌ ngunang muꞌu.

verses.text: But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ biluman ngunang leh ulang-ulang deꞌ sotok ulang-ulang deꞌ cacat, nyaꞌa deꞌ gilagan duoh nyaꞌa butaꞌ.

verses.text: and you will be blessed, because they don’t have the resources to repay you. For you will be repaid in the resurrection of the righteous.”
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu totu obuah bilokat sobab nyaꞌa inoh tiꞌ-e diꞌ-e dapod balas pingunai paguhmuꞌ.  Pingunai paguhmuꞌ inoh Topaꞌ deꞌ balas, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ ajal Topaꞌ paliꞌ idip.”

verses.text: When one of those who sat at the table with him heard these things, he said to him, “Blessed is he who will feast in God’s Kingdom!”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ suaꞌ man danoꞌ ngojit sina Yesus inoh ti-e, yoh moꞌ sina, “Utung manah nyaꞌa deꞌ man bisamah duoh Topaꞌ takal Yoh nog jadin Laja.”

verses.text: But he said to him, “A certain man made a great supper, and he invited many people.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa biluman yomoꞌ ngijaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog man.
