verses.text: He sent out his servant at supper time to tell those who were invited, ‘Come, for everything is ready now.’
verses.source_translation: Takal yaꞌ mulai pesta nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ odaꞌ kuli odi tuduꞌ tamu duoh sina, ‘Jaꞌ mey suaꞌ-e moꞌ siap.’

verses.text: They all as one began to make excuses. “The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please have me excused.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e masim-masim odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ masam idaꞌ in alasan-e, yoh ngan-e diꞌ-e dapod odi, nyaꞌa deꞌ keꞌ niꞌ-e nang, ‘Okuꞌ ogiꞌ milih tanaꞌ yomoꞌ okuꞌ halus odi ningaꞌ-e, maꞌap yoh.’

verses.text: “Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I must go try them out. Please have me excused.’
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e nang, ‘Okuꞌ baꞌuh geh moꞌ milih limoh pasang klobow dali duoh okuꞌ yaꞌ odi ningaꞌ-e podo klobow inoh ponai kiloja.’

verses.text: “Another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I can’t come.’
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ nang, ‘Okuꞌ baꞌuh sijaꞌ-e kawin, inohleh ngan kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ dapod odi.’

verses.text: “That servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in the poor, maimed, blind, and lame.’
verses.source_translation: Kuli inoh paliꞌ yomoꞌ tanon tuduꞌ toke-e oni ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e odi.  Toke-e moꞌ tiwas yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ kuli-e, ‘Laju nyeꞌ odi keꞌ olan, keꞌ lolong duoh keꞌ pasal kota itih duoh toban nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, nyaꞌa deꞌ cacat, nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ duoh gilagan.’

verses.text: “The servant said, ‘Lord, it is done as you commanded, and there is still room.’
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh kuli inoh moꞌ nang, ‘Suaꞌ oni deꞌ odaꞌ ingan moꞌ nai kuꞌ pak-e topat aluaꞌ bogoꞌ.’

verses.text: “The lord said to the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ toke-e noh sina lagiꞌ, ‘Odileh keꞌ olan-olan laya duoh lolong-lolong deꞌ sopaꞌ kota duoh odaꞌleh nyaꞌa nog saꞌ-e kanuaꞌ bolikuꞌ.

verses.text: For I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste of my supper.’”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Niꞌ naꞌan doiꞌ geh soꞌ deꞌ tamu-tamu deꞌ obuah ngunang inoh dapod man pinguman deꞌ pesta Kuꞌ itih.’”

verses.text: Now great multitudes were going with him. He turned and said to them,
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ponu bibaya duoh Yesus, Yesus moꞌ kumiat duoh sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ,

verses.text: “If anyone comes to me, and doesn’t disregard his own father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he can’t be my disciple.
verses.source_translation: “Nyam nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ lobih ngibalaꞌ sinoꞌ-e, samaꞌ-e, sowon-e, onak-onak-e madih ayua-e baya asong odop-e, yoh doh diꞌ-e dapod jadi pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ.

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t bear his own cross, and come after me, can’t be my disciple.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ-e sidia susah jolaꞌ duoh nunaꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ-e dapod jadi pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ.

verses.text: For which of you, desiring to build a tower, doesn’t first sit down and count the cost, to see if he has enough to complete it?
verses.source_translation: Nyam niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan yaꞌ kajuag niꞌ boli deꞌ bigatung, totu yoh guluꞌ ngituang dioꞌ biaya-e saꞌ-e puꞌan podo duit-e sukup kaꞌan pijadi boli inoh atou idoh.

verses.text: Or perhaps, when he has laid a foundation, and is not able to finish, everyone who sees begins to mock him,
verses.source_translation: Sobab nyam basa yoh diꞌ-e dapod pijadi-e paduhal pondasi-e moh obuah nai suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ pingunai noh pasti towoh.

verses.text: saying, ‘This man began to build, and wasn’t able to finish.’
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina, ‘Adia nyaꞌa itih moꞌ kajuag pak-e diꞌ-e dapod pijadi-e.’

verses.text: Or what king, as he goes to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?
verses.source_translation: Nyam niꞌ naꞌan laja kakuꞌ simoong libu sidadu yaꞌ bipolang duoh laja deꞌ bokon deꞌ kakuꞌ duwoh puluꞌ libu sidadu, totu laja inoh guluꞌ pikil dioꞌ podo iyoh taan kedoh yaꞌ lawan musoh-e inoh.

verses.text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sends an envoy, and asks for conditions of peace.
verses.source_translation: Nyam yoh puꞌan nang odop-e diꞌ-e taan, totu takal musoh-e aluaꞌ juuaꞌ iyoh moꞌ pait kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa saꞌan bidamai.”

verses.text: So therefore whoever of you who doesn’t renounce all that he has, he can’t be my disciple.
verses.source_translation: Piobuaꞌ-e Yesus sina, “Watinoh geh suaꞌ ingan.  Niꞌ naꞌan pun doiꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ dapod jadi pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ nyam basa ingan diꞌ ngan posan susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ ingan.”

verses.text: Salt is good, but if the salt becomes flat and tasteless, with what do you season it?
verses.source_translation: “Galuaꞌ inoh paguh saꞌan pinguman, pak-e moꞌ nyam galuaꞌ inoh moꞌ doiꞌ sap-e idoh toꞌ dapod odaꞌ pidiaꞌ lagiꞌ!

verses.text: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile. It is thrown out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ tiaꞌ guna-e, bait inoh kaꞌan umoh duoh jadi abok, jadin saꞌat sijaꞌ-e.  Osi deꞌ ogiꞌ kojit ngojit nyeꞌ!”

chapters.text: When he went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees on a Sabbath to eat bread, they were watching him. Behold, a certain man who had dropsy was in front of him. Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?” But they were silent. He took him, and healed him, and let him go. He answered them, “Which of you, if your son or an ox fell into a well, wouldn’t immediately pull him out on a Sabbath day?” They couldn’t answer him regarding these things. He spoke a parable to those who were invited, when he noticed how they chose the best seats, and said to them,  “When you are invited by anyone to a marriage feast, don’t sit in the best seat, since perhaps someone more honorable than you might be invited by him,   and he who invited both of you would come and tell you, ‘Make room for this person.’ Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.   But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may tell you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.   For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.” He also said to the one who had invited him, “When you make a dinner or a supper, don’t call your friends, nor your brothers, nor your kinsmen, nor rich neighbors, or perhaps they might also return the favor, and pay you back.   But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;   and you will be blessed, because they don’t have the resources to repay you. For you will be repaid in the resurrection of the righteous.”  When one of those who sat at the table with him heard these things, he said to him, “Blessed is he who will feast in God’s Kingdom!” But he said to him, “A certain man made a great supper, and he invited many people.   He sent out his servant at supper time to tell those who were invited, ‘Come, for everything is ready now.’   They all as one began to make excuses. “The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please have me excused.’  “Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I must go try them out. Please have me excused.’  “Another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I can’t come.’   “That servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in the poor, maimed, blind, and lame.’  “The servant said, ‘Lord, it is done as you commanded, and there is still room.’  “The lord said to the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.   For I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste of my supper.’” Now great multitudes were going with him. He turned and said to them,  “If anyone comes to me, and doesn’t disregard his own father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he can’t be my disciple.   Whoever doesn’t bear his own cross, and come after me, can’t be my disciple.   For which of you, desiring to build a tower, doesn’t first sit down and count the cost, to see if he has enough to complete it?   Or perhaps, when he has laid a foundation, and is not able to finish, everyone who sees begins to mock him,   saying, ‘This man began to build, and wasn’t able to finish.’   Or what king, as he goes to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?   Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sends an envoy, and asks for conditions of peace.   So therefore whoever of you who doesn’t renounce all that he has, he can’t be my disciple.   Salt is good, but if the salt becomes flat and tasteless, with what do you season it?   It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile. It is thrown out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

verses.text: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him.
verses.source_translation: Ayua ngan pinagih suke duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa nog tuduꞌ Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngojit pingunang-E.

verses.text: The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, “This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab inohleh ulang Farisi duoh gulu agama Yahudi bigotub-bigonom in-e, “Ningaꞌ Nyaꞌa noh tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa baya man duoh-o!”

verses.text: He told them this parable.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ,

verses.text: “Which of you men, if you had one hundred sheep, and lost one of them, wouldn’t leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after the one that was lost, until he found it?
verses.source_translation: “Nyam basa niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan datiꞌ ogiꞌ silatus polong domba, yomoꞌ moyap niꞌ polong, totu ingan togan deꞌ pliꞌi puluꞌ pliꞌi polong domba inoh deꞌ padang duh, ngan ingan yaꞌ odi kalik deꞌ niꞌ polong deꞌ moyap inoh nog ngan dapod-e.

verses.text: When he has found it, he carries it on his shoulders, rejoicing.
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa ingan moꞌ dapod domba deꞌ moyap inoh, totu otin ngan moꞌ munuas, ingan moꞌ golong-e,

verses.text: When he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’
verses.source_translation: Toban paliꞌ keꞌ boli.  Mokuaꞌ inoh ingan moꞌ mogan madih ayua duoh dingan-dingan ngan, ingan moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Doon mey duoh okuꞌ, sobab dombakuꞌ deꞌ moyap itih moꞌ dapodkuꞌ!’

verses.text: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Watinoh geh lobih ayuh doon deꞌ jadi deꞌ sulga takal ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa bitobat, soꞌ pliꞌi puluꞌ pliꞌi naꞌan deꞌ paguh deꞌ diꞌ-e plelu bitobat.”

verses.text: Or what woman, if she had ten drachma coins, if she lost one drachma coin, wouldn’t light a lamp, sweep the house, and seek diligently until she found it?
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in neh, “Samah geh kodaꞌ nyam basa ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dayung deꞌ kakuꞌ duit simoong kiping pilak yomoꞌ moyap niꞌ kiping pilak.  Totu iyoh kidip lapu yomoꞌ mipis boli-e daang kalik-e nog iyoh dapod duit inoh.

verses.text: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost.’
verses.source_translation: Takal iyoh dapod-e, yomoꞌ mogan madih ayua-e duoh dingan-dingan-e, yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Doon mey duoh okuꞌ sobab niꞌ kiping pilak duitkuꞌ deꞌ moyap moꞌ dapodkuꞌ.’

verses.text: Even so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Malaikat Topaꞌ doon kila-e sobab ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa moꞌ bitobat.”

verses.text: He said, “A certain man had two sons.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan samaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ duwoh naꞌan onak dali.

verses.text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of your property.’ He divided his livelihood between them.
verses.source_translation: Onak-e deꞌ sibusuꞌ moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Maꞌ, ngin duman halta tuduꞌ okuꞌ soꞌ halta deꞌ kakuꞌ ingan.’ Yomoꞌ samaꞌ-e inoh moꞌ kutung binuoh kaꞌan onak-e deꞌ duwoh inoh.

verses.text: Not many days after, the younger son gathered all of this together and traveled into a far country. There he wasted his property with riotous living.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu onu onak-e deꞌ sibusuꞌ inoh moꞌ jua susuaꞌ halta duman-e, yomoꞌ odi keꞌ pulow deꞌ sukup juaꞌ-e.  Danoꞌ iyoh idip bual saꞌat sayou duit-e inoh duoh idip suat simun-e nog-e obuaꞌ halta inoh.

verses.text: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.source_translation: Takal duit-e moꞌ obuaꞌ suaꞌ-e, pas takal inoh deꞌ pulow inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa miliap, iyoh tuang doiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ man-e yomoꞌ pilai sobab iyoh moꞌ botak kolag.

verses.text: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ iyoh odi kiloja tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pulow inoh, nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ odaꞌ iyoh jaga oyuaꞌ deꞌ umoh-e.

verses.text: He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.
verses.source_translation: Sobab iyoh moꞌ sukup pilai-e, yoh moꞌ yaꞌ man nyak oyuaꞌ ngan-e ngisiꞌ toꞌin-e.  Sungu-e sukup pilai-e, doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa ngin pinguman tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: But when he came to himself he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough to spare, and I’m dying with hunger!
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ bigoꞌon tiaꞌ, yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuli duoh samaꞌkuꞌ bitugung pinguman-e, pak-e okuꞌ datiꞌ yaꞌ miliap!’

verses.text: I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ samaꞌkuꞌ, yomoꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Samaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ bidosa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya ingan.

verses.text: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.”’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ patut obuah sobot onak ingan.  Odaꞌ sijaꞌ-a okuꞌ itih jadi kuli ingan.’

verses.text: “He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli samaꞌ-e.  Daang pimonu keꞌ boli-e, soꞌ juuaꞌ samaꞌ-e moꞌ kilin-e, samaꞌ-a moꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ-e.  Yomoꞌ bikoduh tuduꞌ-e simadi-e dokuop baya sium-e.

verses.text: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
verses.source_translation: Onak-e inoh moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Samaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ bidosa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya ingan.  Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ patut obuah sobot onak ingan.’

verses.text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e samaꞌ-e inoh moꞌ mogan kuli-kuli-e yomoꞌ sina in-e, ‘Katiꞌ laju-e likas-e! Mit pimakai deꞌ paling paguh-e soꞌ tuduꞌ-e, yomoꞌ soꞌ sisin deꞌ tlinyu-e, duoh soꞌ kasut deꞌ poꞌon-e.

verses.text: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let us eat, and celebrate;
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh odi mit onak sapi deꞌ paling gomuꞌ tutuꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ simoliah-e.  Saꞌ otoꞌ man lami-lami simadi otoꞌ bisukul.

verses.text: for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ They began to celebrate.
verses.source_translation: Sobab onakkuꞌ itih samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, deꞌ moh paliꞌ idip; samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap, deꞌ moh paliꞌ lagiꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e munoꞌ moꞌ man simadi-e bisukul.’

verses.text: “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal inoh onak-e deꞌ pinuan ogiꞌ deꞌ umoh-e, takal iyoh paliꞌ, ngan-e moh sinok boli-e, iyoh moꞌ ngojit sowoꞌ lagu duoh sowoꞌ nyaꞌa bitanaꞌ.

verses.text: He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ mogan niꞌ naꞌan kuli-e, yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, ‘Oni deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ in inoh?’

verses.text: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’
verses.source_translation: Kuli inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Sudiꞌ ingan moꞌ paliꞌ! Samaꞌ ingan moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih simoliah onak sapi deꞌ gomuꞌ tutuꞌ, sobab sudiꞌ ingan paliꞌ daang silamat!’

verses.text: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.
verses.source_translation: Onak deꞌ pinuan inoh moꞌ malah nyam kila-e, yomoꞌ doliaꞌ-e molot kaang boli-e.  Samaꞌ-a inoh moꞌ luah odi tuduꞌ-e tanon odaꞌ molot kaang boli-e.

verses.text: But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e iyoh nyawot samaꞌ-e in-e, ‘Moꞌ bisowaꞌ-sowaꞌ okuꞌ kiloja lolah posah kaꞌan ingan, doiꞌ onukuꞌ lawan sina ingan.  Oni deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ? Niꞌ onak koming tuang doiꞌ geh ingan ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ man duoh dingan-dingankuꞌ neh!

verses.text: But when this your son came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e onak ingan deꞌ sibusuꞌ inoh moꞌ bual halta ingan duoh dayung adoh, pak-e takal iyoh paliꞌ ingan moꞌ simoliah onak sapi deꞌ gomuꞌ tutuꞌ kaꞌan-e!’

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ-a moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Onakkuꞌ, muꞌu ali-ali ogiꞌ duoh okuꞌ datiꞌ.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ okuꞌ tuang kakuꞌ muꞌu geh.

verses.text: But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e otoꞌ patut doon duoh munuas, sobab sudiꞌmuꞌ itih samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, deꞌ moh paliꞌ idip, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap, deꞌ moh paliꞌ lagiꞌ.’ ”

chapters.text: Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him. The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, “This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.” He told them this parable.  “Which of you men, if you had one hundred sheep, and lost one of them, wouldn’t leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after the one that was lost, until he found it?   When he has found it, he carries it on his shoulders, rejoicing.   When he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’   I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.   Or what woman, if she had ten drachma coins, if she lost one drachma coin, wouldn’t light a lamp, sweep the house, and seek diligently until she found it?   When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost.’   Even so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting.” He said, “A certain man had two sons.   The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of your property.’ He divided his livelihood between them.   Not many days after, the younger son gathered all of this together and traveled into a far country. There he wasted his property with riotous living.   When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.   He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.   He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.   But when he came to himself he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough to spare, and I’m dying with hunger!   I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight.   I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.”’  “He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.   The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’  “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet.   Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let us eat, and celebrate;   for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ They began to celebrate.  “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.   He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.   He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’   But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.   But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.   But when this your son came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’  “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.   But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’”

verses.text: He also said to his disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal.  Iyoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e odaꞌ ngulus halta-e.  Sidagal inoh ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e daꞌ-e saꞌat sayou duit-e.

verses.text: He called him, and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e daꞌ-e inoh, yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Okuꞌ moh ngojit silita oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai muꞌu sobab inoh muꞌu yaꞌ obuah piloꞌo soꞌ kilojamuꞌ, pak-e muꞌu halus lapol suaꞌ haltakuꞌ deꞌ ngulus muꞌ.’

verses.text: “The manager said within himself, ‘What will I do, seeing that my lord is taking away the management position from me? I don’t have strength to dig. I am ashamed to beg.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ bipikil, ‘Oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ toke yaꞌ piloꞌo okuꞌ, yaꞌ nyakul kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ taꞌan, yaꞌ jadi tukang mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ kuꞌ dasaꞌ.

verses.text: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.’
verses.source_translation: Puꞌan kuꞌ oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ takal kuꞌ obuah piloꞌo neh, okuꞌ halus bogoꞌ dingan deꞌ laꞌan tlimaꞌ okuꞌ odaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli-e.’

verses.text: Calling each one of his lord’s debtors to him, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my lord?’
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ mogan osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bilutang tuduꞌ toke-e, yoh moꞌ mogan nyaꞌa deꞌ keꞌ niꞌ-e, yoh sikian tuduꞌ-e, ‘Kudu tang muꞌ tuduꞌ tokekuꞌ?’

verses.text: He said, ‘A hundred batos of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Silatus bona inyuaꞌ zaitun.’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Itih sulat tang muꞌ, guluꞌ mey nulis limoh puluꞌ bona.’

verses.text: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred cors of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ke duwoh-e, ‘Timuꞌ kudu tang muꞌ?’ Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Silatus kalung gandum.’ Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus duit inoh sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Itih sulat tang muꞌ nulis moih puluꞌ kalung negeh.’

verses.text: “His lord commended the dishonest manager because he had done wisely, for the children of this world are, in their own generation, wiser than the children of the light.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ takal sidagal inoh puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus halta-e inoh, yoh moꞌ mudi-e nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus halta-e inoh bijak.” Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ samung sina-e inoh, “Sobab biasa-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip-e nunaꞌ dunia itih lobih bogoꞌ wat akal-e ngulus idip daang dunia soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang jawaꞌ.”

verses.text: I tell you, make for yourselves friends by means of unrighteous mammon, so that when you fail, they may receive you into the eternal tents.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Ngojit nyeꞌ! Kalikleh dingan ingan kai duit deꞌ soꞌon ingan soꞌ dunia itih, saꞌ takal duit ingan deꞌ dunia itih moꞌ diꞌ-e tiꞌaꞌ biguna, ingan tapod idip duoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much. He who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod nyeꞌ alap odaꞌ ngulus kiloja deꞌ isit, yoh tuang dapod geh nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ-e odaꞌ ngulus kiloja deꞌ ayuh duoh penting.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e jujul ngulus kiloja deꞌ isit, kiloja deꞌ ayuh duoh penting idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ jujul ngulus-e.

verses.text: If therefore you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa-e nyaꞌa diꞌ-e dapod bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ngulus halta deꞌ isit daang dunia, lobih lagiꞌ Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ ngulus halta sulga deꞌ ayuh.

verses.text: If you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?
verses.source_translation: Duoh nyam basa-e balang deꞌ kakuꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon diꞌ ingan ponai jaga-e, totu Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ngin oniꞌ deꞌ patut ingan kakuꞌ.

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. You aren’t able to serve God and Mammon.”
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ ogiꞌ kuli ponai kiloja tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan toke.  Nyam basa-e watinoh totap ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan toke deꞌ buꞌui kuli-e daꞌ-a, kuli inoh lobih nulut deꞌ toke deꞌ niꞌ soꞌ toke-e deꞌ nikan.  Watinoh geh ingan, doiꞌ ogiꞌ ingan ponai kiloja kaꞌan Topaꞌ nyam basa ingan aluaꞌ kalik halta dunia.”

verses.text: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they scoffed at him.
verses.source_translation: Ulang Farisi moꞌ ngojit suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yomoꞌ towoh-e, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bakoꞌ duit.

verses.text: He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e in Yesus sina tuduꞌ ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Inganleh nyaꞌa deꞌ liga pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ bonal deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ pak-e Topaꞌ puꞌan isiꞌ otin ingan sobab oniꞌ deꞌ obuah mudi odaꞌ manusia inohleh deꞌ buꞌui Topaꞌ daꞌ-a.

verses.text: The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the Good News of God’s Kingdom is preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.
verses.source_translation: Buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk-buk deꞌ nulis nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon, ingan nunaꞌ buaꞌ ajal-e nog joman Yohanes Pembaptis.  Soꞌ joman iyohleh, Gah deꞌ Paguh oniꞌ wat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja obuah tanon.  Duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa bonal-bonal suba ngan-e yaꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tiny stroke of a pen in the law to fall.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam-e watnoh lobih sonang kaꞌan Topaꞌ kasuap longit duoh bumi soꞌ sit ukum Topaꞌ tikadi.

verses.text: Everyone who divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery. He who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.
verses.source_translation: Dali deꞌ posan sowon-e yomoꞌ kawin duoh dayung deꞌ bokon yoh inoh biamai.  Dali deꞌ kawin duoh dayung deꞌ moꞌ biposan yoh tuang biamai geh.”

verses.text: “Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngajal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kai perumpamaan itih, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidagal ali-ali pakai pimakai deꞌ maal duoh man pinguman paguh bilang konu.

verses.text: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was taken to his gate, full of sores,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ boꞌon tiban boli sidagal inoh, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag adon-e Lazarus deꞌ gonan-e punuaꞌ odaꞌ pinonaꞌ deꞌ buꞌuh.

verses.text: and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.
verses.source_translation: Lazarus sukup pilai-e, yoh bialap ogiꞌ puluh pinguman labuꞌ soꞌ mija sidagal inoh ngan-e kadu-kadu-e man sisaꞌ-e.  Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh kosuang nog kanoꞌ odi silaꞌian pinonaꞌ deꞌ gonan-e.

verses.text: The beggar died, and he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.
verses.source_translation: Lazarus moꞌ kobos, mokuaꞌ inoh malaikat toban tuduꞌ Abraham deꞌ topat deꞌ paling paguh.  Sidagal inoh tuang kobos geh yomoꞌ obuah ngubul.

verses.text: In Hades, he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his bosom.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ daang neraka, sidagal inoh sukup susah jolaꞌ.  Takal iyoh inoh moꞌ bigalong keꞌ somu, soꞌ juuaꞌ yoh moꞌ kilin Lazarus guluꞌ sinoꞌ Abraham deꞌ topat paling paguh-e.

verses.text: He cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue! For I am in anguish in this flame.’
verses.source_translation: Sidagal inoh moꞌ nang bogan-e tuduꞌ Abraham, ‘O samaꞌkuꞌ Abraham! Masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ! Odaꞌleh Lazarus suad tilinyu-e keꞌ daang piꞌin duoh natiag-e saꞌ-e misaꞌ jolaꞌkuꞌ sobab okuꞌ datiꞌ sukup nyam jolaꞌ-e daang opui datiꞌ.’

verses.text: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your good things, and Lazarus, in the same way, bad things. But here he is now comforted, and you are in anguish.
verses.source_translation: Abraham moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Onakkuꞌ natong nyeꞌ muꞌu moꞌ puas tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh takal muꞌ aluaꞌ idip, pak-e Lazarus mala sijaꞌ-e tlimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, iyoh ngan-e adin yoh lagi deꞌ kiꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ paguh muꞌu lagiꞌ deꞌ kiꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ jolaꞌ.

verses.text: Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that no one may cross over from there to us.’
verses.source_translation: Duoh ogiꞌ gilongung geh deꞌ sukup ayuh-e deꞌ osah otoꞌ, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ katiꞌ diꞌ-e dapod odi kanoꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod odi katiꞌ.’

verses.text: “He said, ‘I ask you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father’s house;
verses.source_translation: Sidagal inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Nyam-e watinoh tulungleh odaꞌleh Lazarus odi keꞌ boli pingomakuꞌ.

verses.text: for I have five brothers, that he may testify to them, so they won’t also come into this place of torment.’
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ limoh naꞌan madihkuꞌ danoꞌ, odaꞌleh Lazarus tanon gah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e diꞌ suaꞌ molot tuduꞌ okuꞌ daang topat obuah nyiksa itih.’

verses.text: “But Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Abraham moꞌ nyawot in-e, ‘Kan-e moꞌ ogiꞌ buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk-buk deꞌ nulis nabi-nabi, tanahleh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit duoh nunaꞌ oni deꞌ nang daang buk-buk inoh.’

verses.text: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e sidagal inoh nyawot-e, ‘Inoh jaꞌa idoh diꞌ-e sukup neh, pak-e moꞌ nyam-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip baꞌuh duoh nog tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ keꞌ yoh laꞌan bitobat.’

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘If they don’t listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if one rises from the dead.’”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Abraham moh nyawot-e, ‘Moꞌ nyam plitah Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa duoh nabi-nabi yoh doliaꞌ-e ngojit duoh nunaꞌ-e lobih lagiꞌ moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip deꞌ tanon, yoh totap idoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.’ ”

chapters.text: He also said to his disciples, “There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.   He called him, and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’   “The manager said within himself, ‘What will I do, seeing that my lord is taking away the management position from me? I don’t have strength to dig. I am ashamed to beg.   I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.’   Calling each one of his lord’s debtors to him, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my lord?’   He said, ‘A hundred batos of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’   Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred cors of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’  “His lord commended the dishonest manager because he had done wisely, for the children of this world are, in their own generation, wiser than the children of the light.   I tell you, make for yourselves friends by means of unrighteous mammon, so that when you fail, they may receive you into the eternal tents.   He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much. He who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.   If therefore you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?   If you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?   No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. You aren’t able to serve God and Mammon.” The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they scoffed at him. He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.   The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the Good News of God’s Kingdom is preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.   But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tiny stroke of a pen in the law to fall.   Everyone who divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery. He who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.   “Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.   A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was taken to his gate, full of sores,   and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.   The beggar died, and he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.   In Hades, he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his bosom.   He cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue! For I am in anguish in this flame.’  “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your good things, and Lazarus, in the same way, bad things. But here he is now comforted, and you are in anguish.   Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that no one may cross over from there to us.’  “He said, ‘I ask you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father’s house;   for I have five brothers, that he may testify to them, so they won’t also come into this place of torment.’  “But Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.’  “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’  “He said to him, ‘If they don’t listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if one rises from the dead.’”

verses.text: He said to the disciples, “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to him through whom they come!
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa nai dosa totap ogiꞌ.  Pak-e binasaleh nyaꞌa deꞌ singaji-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nai dosa!

verses.text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.
verses.source_translation: Lobih paguh lagiꞌ nyeꞌ gutan batuh deꞌ ayuh deꞌ tunguaꞌ-a, mokuaꞌ inoh timalong daang laut soꞌ yoh yaꞌ toban niꞌ naꞌan negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ pikil-e tuꞌuh daang Topaꞌ nai dosa-e.

verses.text: Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.
verses.source_translation: Jadin, tauꞌ-tauꞌ saꞌ ingan diꞌ-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh! Moꞌ nyam ogiꞌ madihmuꞌ deꞌ nai dosa, ngalah nyeꞌ.  Nyam basa iyoh moꞌ jook-e, ngin apun tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: If he sins against you seven times in the day, and seven times returns, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa-e daang niꞌ onu, juꞌ sidoh madihmuꞌ nai salah-e tuduꞌ muꞌu, yomoꞌ bilang-e nai salah-e yoh mitiaꞌ apun tuduꞌ muꞌu, apunleh iyoh.”

verses.text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, tulungleh koꞌih saꞌ koꞌih lobih bisayaꞌ.”

verses.text: The Lord said, “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyam ingan ogiꞌ bisayaꞌ ingan motiꞌ luang sabih negeh, sina sijaꞌ-a tuduꞌ tongon koyuh inoh, ‘Numut odopmuꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ jug odopmuꞌ deꞌ laut.’ Totap iyoh lasuꞌ nunaꞌ sinamuꞌ.”

verses.text: But who is there among you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say, when he comes in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down at the table,’
verses.source_translation: “Nyam basa soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ ogiꞌ kuli deꞌ tukang nyakul deꞌ toyaꞌ kobon ingan keh, mokuaꞌ jaga koming ingan keh, asal kuli inoh paliꞌ nog boli podo ingan moꞌ lasuꞌ ngijaꞌ man?

verses.text: and will not rather tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me, while I eat and drink. Afterward you shall eat and drink’?
verses.source_translation: Totu idoh! Totap ingan odaꞌ iyoh gati pimakai-e mokuaꞌ inoh ingan odaꞌ iyoh nai pinguman kaꞌan ingan duoh nguan ingan nog mokuaꞌ man, keꞌ ingan odaꞌ yoh man.

verses.text: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.
verses.source_translation: Kuli inoh diꞌ-e jolaꞌ obuah mudi sobab iyoh moꞌ nunaꞌ plitah toke-e.

verses.text: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.’”
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh ingan.  Nyam ingan moꞌ nai suaꞌ-suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ patut ingan nai-e, ingan moꞌ nang sijaꞌ-a, ‘Koꞌih itih madas kuli sijaꞌ-a, koꞌih jok koꞌih nai kiloja deꞌ patut koꞌih nai-e sijaꞌ-a.’ ”

verses.text: As he was on his way to Jerusalem, he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee.
verses.source_translation: Daang pimonu-e keꞌ kota Yerusalem, Yesus ngilusuꞌ baꞌat propinsi Samaria duoh propinsi Galilea.

verses.text: As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, who stood at a distance.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e molot deꞌ niꞌ kupuaꞌ yomoꞌ ogiꞌ simoong naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah onam kulit deꞌ sukup palah odi tuduꞌ-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mujuag muaꞌ juꞌan-e

verses.text: They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
verses.source_translation: yomoꞌ sina dolas-dolas-e, “Yesus! Gulu! Masiꞌleh tuduꞌ koꞌih!”

verses.text: When he saw them, he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” As they went, they were cleansed.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus kilin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ nang in-e, “Sus odi, bitanga odop ingan tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi.” Daang pimonu-e deꞌ olan onam-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice.
verses.source_translation: Takal niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngoon onam-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus daang-e sina dolas-dolas-e mudi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh deꞌ jowin Yesus iyoh bikunyug ngan-e bisukul tuduꞌ-E.  Nyaꞌa inoh ulang Samaria.

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Weren’t the ten cleansed? But where are the nine?
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e simoong naꞌan deꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, ki soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pliꞌi naꞌan?

verses.text: Were there none found who returned to give glory to God, except this stranger?”
verses.source_translation: Jok-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tih sijaꞌ-e deꞌ paliꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Mokat mey nyeꞌ moꞌ buu.  Sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: Being asked by the Pharisees when God’s Kingdom would come, he answered them, “God’s Kingdom doesn’t come with observation;
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, nang siniaꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog jadin Laja.  Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Topaꞌ militah jadin laja idoh diꞌ-e mulai soꞌ tanda-tanda deꞌ dapod nyaꞌa kilin-e.

verses.text: neither will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, God’s Kingdom is within you.”
verses.source_translation: Jadi doiꞌ guna-e, nyaꞌa nang, ‘Jaꞌ otoꞌ odi ningaꞌ-e, itih odop-e atou ningaꞌ nih odop-e!’ Sobab Topaꞌ moh moꞌ militah jadin laja deꞌ uluk ingan deꞌ dunia itih.”

verses.text: He said to the disciples, “The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Yaꞌ nog onu-e ingan ngati Okuꞌ Onak Manusia, yaꞌ militah jadin Laja pak-e ingan diꞌ ngan ponai kilin-e.

verses.text: They will tell you, ‘Look, here!’ or ‘Look, there!’ Don’t go away, nor follow after them,
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ sodiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu, ‘Ningaꞌ danih soꞌo neh, ningaꞌ datiꞌ soꞌo neh!’ Pak-e maꞌ ingan yaꞌ luah kalik-e.

verses.text: for as the lightning, when it flashes out of the one part under the sky, shines to the other part under the sky; so will the Son of Man be in his day.
verses.source_translation: Sobab samah kodaꞌ jawaꞌ kijat deꞌ longit, munoh geh tieꞌ ijoꞌ takal Okuꞌ Onak Manusia yaꞌ nog lagiꞌ baꞌuh.

verses.text: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ totap halus dioꞌ yaꞌ ngoon susah jolaꞌ duoh obuah nulak odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman adin.

verses.text: As it was in the days of Noah, even so will it be also in the days of the Son of Man.
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip deꞌ joman nabi Nuh noꞌuh-e, watinoh geh deꞌ yaꞌ jadi takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog.

verses.text: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.
verses.source_translation: Manusia bidu man nuak, bidu kalik sowon bonon-e, nog onu-e takal Nuh molot daang kapal-e yomoꞌ nog kilamu deꞌ sukup tui-e moꞌ lasuꞌ plongod suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Likewise, even as it was in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;
verses.source_translation: Samah geh kodaꞌ joman Lot noꞌuh-e nyaꞌa bidu man nuak, bidu bijua, bidu bilumoh yomoꞌ nai boli-e.

verses.text: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky, and destroyed them all.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e onu Lot buu soꞌ Sodom, onu inoh geh opui muun baya batuh deꞌ biduduꞌ labuꞌ soꞌ longit ngasul odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh doiꞌ nyaꞌa sakaꞌ siniaꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog duoh tang-tang bitanga odop Kuꞌ.

verses.text: In that day, he who will be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ awah, maꞌ molot lagiꞌ yaꞌ mit balang daang boli.  Watinoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ motak keꞌ umoh, maꞌ moliꞌ keꞌ kupuaꞌ.

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.source_translation: Natong nyeꞌ oni deꞌ obuah sowon Lot!

verses.text: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.
verses.source_translation: Sobab osi deꞌ nyayang idip-e sonang deꞌ dunia itih, idip-e tibuang.  Pak-e osi deꞌ togan idip sonang-e deꞌ dunia itih nog-e kobos ngan-e nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh dapod idip sitelus-e.

verses.text: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. The one will be taken, and the other will be left.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ngalom inoh duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ boꞌos daang niꞌ tilam, niꞌ naꞌan obuah mit toban buu, niꞌ naꞌan obuah supiah.

verses.text: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.”
verses.source_translation: Duwoh naꞌan dayung deꞌ poh podi, niꞌ naꞌan obuah toban buu, niꞌ naꞌan obuah supiah.

verses.text: They, answering, asked him, “Where, Lord?” He said to them, “Where the body is, there will the vultures also be gathered together.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus sikian tuduꞌ-E, “Daki soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi neh Gulu?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Daki soꞌ ogiꞌ todang, danoꞌ soꞌ ogiꞌ manuk deꞌ man todang.”

chapters.text: He said to the disciples, “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to him through whom they come!   It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.   Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.   If he sins against you seven times in the day, and seven times returns, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.” The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.” The Lord said, “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.   But who is there among you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say, when he comes in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down at the table,’   and will not rather tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me, while I eat and drink. Afterward you shall eat and drink’?   Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.   Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.’”  As he was on his way to Jerusalem, he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee. As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, who stood at a distance. They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!” When he saw them, he said to them, “Go and show yourselves to the priests.” As they went, they were cleansed. One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice. He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan. Jesus answered, “Weren’t the ten cleansed? But where are the nine?   Were there none found who returned to give glory to God, except this stranger?” Then he said to him, “Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.” Being asked by the Pharisees when God’s Kingdom would come, he answered them, “God’s Kingdom doesn’t come with observation;   neither will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, God’s Kingdom is within you.” He said to the disciples, “The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.   They will tell you, ‘Look, here!’ or ‘Look, there!’ Don’t go away, nor follow after them,   for as the lightning, when it flashes out of the one part under the sky, shines to the other part under the sky; so will the Son of Man be in his day.   But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.   As it was in the days of Noah, even so will it be also in the days of the Son of Man.   They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.   Likewise, even as it was in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;   but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky, and destroyed them all.   It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.   In that day, he who will be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.   Remember Lot’s wife!   Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.   I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. The one will be taken, and the other will be left.   There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.”   They, answering, asked him, “Where, Lord?” He said to them, “Where the body is, there will the vultures also be gathered together.”

verses.text: He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mala bidoa duoh diꞌ-e buꞌon-e.

verses.text: saying, “There was a judge in a certain city who didn’t fear God, and didn’t respect man.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus, “Daang niꞌ kota ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan hakim idip deꞌ diꞌ-e nulut tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa tuong idoh geh yoh piduli-e.

verses.text: A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, ‘Defend me from my adversary!’
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ geh niꞌ naꞌan jana deꞌ odi telus tuduꞌ hakim noh yomoꞌ in neh, ‘Suba tulungleh nuwaꞌ okuꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ pilugi okuꞌ inoh.’

verses.text: He wouldn’t for a while, but afterward he said to himself, ‘Though I neither fear God, nor respect man,
verses.source_translation: Sukup tui hakim inoh doliaꞌ-e yaꞌ tulung jana inoh, pak-e mokuaꞌ noh hakim noh moꞌ bipikil, ‘Daang kuꞌ idip diꞌ kuꞌ nulut tuduꞌ Topaꞌ yomoꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa tuong idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ piduli,

verses.text: yet because this widow bothers me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.’”
verses.source_translation: pak-e ngan jana noh kaꞌ-kaꞌ odi bikidok okuꞌ, paguh kuꞌ tulung-e negeh, saꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ nog nusah okuꞌ.’”

verses.text: The Lord said, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Suba ingan tiluti oniꞌ deꞌ nang hakim deꞌ diꞌ-e adil noh!

verses.text: Won’t God avenge his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?
verses.source_translation: Nyam hakim noh ponai tulung jana inoh, lobih lagiꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ pilih-E, deꞌ bidoa singonu singalom tuduꞌ-e.  Iyoh diꞌ-e kajon tui saꞌan nyawot doa nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Topaꞌ totap lasuꞌ tulung odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang suaꞌ oniꞌ.  Nyam basa-e, Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog baꞌuh, aluaꞌ ogiꞌ kedoh keh Okuꞌ dapod nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ daang dunia itih?”

verses.text: He spoke also this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nang idip odop-e bonal deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ duoh lobih paguh soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon:

verses.text: “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.
verses.source_translation: “Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa odi bidoa keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.  Niꞌ naꞌan noh ulang Farisi yoh moꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nikan-e lagiꞌ pinagih suke.

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: ‘God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortionists, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.
verses.source_translation: Ulang Farisi noh mujuag sadiꞌ-e yoh moꞌ bidoa in-e, ‘O Topaꞌ tilimaꞌ kasih tuduꞌ Ingan, sobab okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, deꞌ pinganguak, pingakal, duoh biamai.  Okuꞌ bisukul okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ kodaꞌ pinagih suke inoh.

verses.text: I fast twice a week. I give tithes of all that I get.’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ puasa duwoh sidoh daang niꞌ minggu, simoong-bigien soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ soꞌon kuꞌ, kuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Ingan.’

verses.text: But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn’t even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e pinagih suke inoh mujuag juuaꞌ, kan-e diꞌ-e bilani bigalong keꞌ longit, simadi-e modug-modug soduaꞌ-e sobab yoh moꞌ ngoon nang odop-e bidosa simadi-e bidoa in neh, ‘O Topaꞌ masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ ulang bidosa itih!’

verses.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Takal pinagih suke itih paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e yohleh deꞌ obuah tlimaꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ nak-e ulang Farisi inoh.  Sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ lika kakat odop-e yoh obuah pimuun pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ pimuun odop-e yoh obuah pakat daꞌ bigatung.”

verses.text: They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh nogleh kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa toban onak opot tuduꞌ Yesus, saꞌ Iyoh tomaꞌ ngin bilokat tuduꞌ-e.  Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus kilin-e, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus summoned them, saying, “Allow the little children to come to me, and don’t hinder them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ mogan onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Tanah saꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ odi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ! Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ jaman-e neh, sobab nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Most certainly, I tell you, whoever doesn’t receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nulut pilitah Topaꞌ daang idip-e samah kodaꞌ onak opot deꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e nulut pilitah pingoma-e, yohleh sijaꞌ deꞌ dapod jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: A certain ruler asked him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ pimipin Yahudi sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu deꞌ paguh, oni deꞌ patut kuꞌ nai saꞌ kuꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ sitelus-e?”

verses.text: Jesus asked him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one—God.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in neh, “Oni ngan muꞌ nang Okuꞌ deꞌ paguh? Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ neh.

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘Don’t commit adultery,’ ‘Don’t murder,’ ‘Don’t steal,’ ‘Don’t give false testimony,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’”
verses.source_translation: Totu muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan plitah-plitah Topaꞌ: ‘Maꞌ biamai, maꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa, maꞌ noku, maꞌ sina pibulaꞌ, yomoꞌ nulut leh tuduꞌ pingomamuꞌ.’”

verses.text: He said, “I have observed all these things from my youth up.”
verses.source_translation: In nyaꞌa inoh nyawot-e, “Suaꞌ-suaꞌ plitah deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ kuꞌ soꞌ kuꞌ isit geh.”

verses.text: When Jesus heard these things, he said to him, “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor. You will have treasure in heaven. Come, follow me.”
verses.source_translation: Ngojit yoh nyawot in noh Yesus moꞌ in neh, “Aluaꞌ ogiꞌ duom niꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ plelu muꞌ nai: Jualeh suaꞌ haltamuꞌ mokuaꞌ noh ngin duit-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, yomoꞌ muꞌu soꞌon halta daang sulga, mokuaꞌ inoh odileh katiꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.
verses.source_translation: Takal pimipin Yahudi noh ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ susah otin-e sobab yoh sukup kaya-e.

verses.text: Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ pimipin Yahudi inoh susah otin-e, Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ in, “Lolah posah saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ biduit yaꞌ jadin ayua umat Topaꞌ!

verses.text: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Sonang dooꞌ niꞌ polong unta molot kaang lubang tuos soꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ biduit yaꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Those who heard it said, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh moꞌ lasuꞌ in-e, “Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh doiꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod silamat?”

verses.text: But he said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot, “Oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e molot akal saꞌan otoꞌ manusia, molot akal saꞌan Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Peter said, “Look, we have left everything, and followed you.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ sina, “Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ koꞌih moꞌ obuaꞌ togan koꞌih ngan koꞌih nunaꞌ Ingan.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for God’s Kingdom’s sake,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Osi mun ingan deꞌ togan boli-e, sowon-e, madih ayua-e, pingoma-e, duoh onak opot-e saꞌ Topaꞌ dapod militah idip-e,

verses.text: who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.”
verses.source_translation: nyaꞌa deꞌ togan suaꞌ-e inoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ daang joman deꞌ adin, duoh deꞌ joman deꞌ yaꞌ nog baꞌuh yoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ idip deꞌ sitelus-e.”

verses.text: He took the twelve aside, and said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mogan ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E yomoꞌ sina, “Adin otoꞌ yaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem, suaꞌ deꞌ nutaꞌ ayua nabi daang tulis-e suaꞌ-e yaꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ Onak Manusia.

verses.text: For he will be delivered up to the Gentiles, will be mocked, treated shamefully, and spit on.
verses.source_translation: Sobab danih Okuꞌ Onak Manusia obuah nyelah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngatiaꞌ obuah ngine duoh obuah ngujaꞌ.

verses.text: They will scourge and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pijolaꞌ duoh ngabos Okuꞌ, pak-e onu ke taluh-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ idip.”

verses.text: They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn’t understand the things that were said.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus idoh diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh sobab loti-e obuah suꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ inohleh sobab yoh diꞌ puꞌan loti-e.

verses.text: As he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moh yaꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerikho, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ guluꞌ simadi-e mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ deꞌ pang olan.

verses.text: Hearing a multitude going by, he asked what this meant.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ngilusuꞌ olan inoh, yoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, “Oni deꞌ in inoh neh?”

verses.text: They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa danoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ Yesus soꞌ Nazaret ngilusuꞌ katiꞌ.”

verses.text: He cried out, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nang bogan-e in-e, “Yesus onak-sukun laja Daud masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”

verses.text: Those who led the way rebuked him, that he should be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ ponu moꞌ ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh joman bidaluag, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh makin-e dolas nang bogan-e, “Yesus onak-sukun laja Daud masiꞌleh tuduꞌ okuꞌ!”

verses.text: Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ loꞌo yoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh tuduꞌ odop-E.  Takal-e moꞌ nog sinok, Yesus moꞌ sikian-e,

verses.text: “What do you want me to do?” He said, “Lord, that I may see again.”
verses.source_translation: “Oni deꞌ laꞌan muꞌu odaꞌ Okuꞌ nai?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Gulu odaꞌleh okuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ mey sobab muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu mokuaꞌ.”

verses.text: Immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God. All the people, when they saw it, praised God.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ yomoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus simadi-e mudi Topaꞌ, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh suwaꞌ geh mudi Topaꞌ.

chapters.text: He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up, saying, “There was a judge in a certain city who didn’t fear God, and didn’t respect man.   A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, ‘Defend me from my adversary!’   He wouldn’t for a while, but afterward he said to himself, ‘Though I neither fear God, nor respect man,   yet because this widow bothers me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.’” The Lord said, “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.   Won’t God avenge his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?   I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?” He spoke also this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others.  “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.   The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: ‘God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortionists, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.   I fast twice a week. I give tithes of all that I get.’   But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn’t even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’   I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.” They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them. Jesus summoned them, saying, “Allow the little children to come to me, and don’t hinder them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.   Most certainly, I tell you, whoever doesn’t receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.” A certain ruler asked him, saying, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?” Jesus asked him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one—God.   You know the commandments: ‘Don’t commit adultery,’ ‘Don’t murder,’ ‘Don’t steal,’ ‘Don’t give false testimony,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’” He said, “I have observed all these things from my youth up.” When Jesus heard these things, he said to him, “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor. You will have treasure in heaven. Come, follow me.” But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich. Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!   For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.” Those who heard it said, “Then who can be saved?” But he said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.” Peter said, “Look, we have left everything, and followed you.” He said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for God’s Kingdom’s sake,   who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.” He took the twelve aside, and said to them, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.   For he will be delivered up to the Gentiles, will be mocked, treated shamefully, and spit on.   They will scourge and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.” They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn’t understand the things that were said. As he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging. Hearing a multitude going by, he asked what this meant. They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by. He cried out, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!” Those who led the way rebuked him, that he should be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!” Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,  “What do you want me to do?” He said, “Lord, that I may see again.” Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.”  Immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God. All the people, when they saw it, praised God.

verses.text: He entered and was passing through Jericho.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E nog keꞌ kota Yerikho, Yomoꞌ nyamung pimonu-e ngilusuꞌ kota inoh.

verses.text: There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ kota inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin pinagih suke deꞌ kaya.  Adon-e Zakheus.

verses.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, and couldn’t because of the crowd, because he was short.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ ningaꞌ oni mun nyaꞌa deꞌ adon-e Yesus inoh, pak-e ngan juag-e kodoꞌ yomoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai kilin-e sobab nyaꞌa sikiya lami.

verses.text: He ran on ahead, and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was going to pass that way.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ bikoduh pilowan nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ nyikoh tongon koyuh ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus deꞌ yaꞌ ngilusuꞌ kanoꞌ.

verses.text: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ nog deꞌ libuaꞌ tongon koyuh inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bigalong keꞌ somu yomoꞌ sina, “Zakheus, muun mey! Onu itih Okuꞌ halus ngilumon deꞌ boli muꞌu.”

verses.text: He hurried, came down, and received him joyfully.
verses.source_translation: Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus inoh Zakheus moꞌ lasuꞌ doon kila-e, yomoꞌ lasuꞌ muun soꞌ tongon koyuh inoh yomoꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying, “He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ hal inoh lasuꞌ bigonom, “Bah Nyaꞌa itih oni nai-e odi ngilumon keꞌ boli nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa inoh neh.”

verses.text: Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Zakheus deꞌ boli-e yomoꞌ mokat mujuag yomoꞌ in-e, “Gulu, okuꞌ yaꞌ kutung binuoh haltakuꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak kolag, yomoꞌ nyam basa okuꞌ ogiꞌ ngakal nyaꞌa, okuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ-e pat sidoh soꞌ deꞌ ngakal Kuꞌ!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Daang onu itih muꞌu baya madih ayuamuꞌ obuah nyilamat sobab muꞌu tuong onak-sukun Abraham geh.

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog keꞌ dunia kaꞌan kalik duoh nyilamat nyaꞌa deꞌ moyap.”

verses.text: As they heard these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that God’s Kingdom would be revealed immediately.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok soꞌ kota Yerusalem bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sakaꞌ nang takal Yesus nog keꞌ Yerusalem, Yoh lasuꞌ militah jadin Laja danoꞌ duoh pilopas negli Israel soꞌ penjajahan Roma.  Sobab inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan, in-e,

verses.text: He said therefore, “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.
verses.source_translation: “Ogiꞌ onak-sukun laja deꞌ odi keꞌ pulow deꞌ juuaꞌ saꞌ-e obuah pakat jadi laja deꞌ pulow-e odop-e.  Mokuaꞌ tilimaꞌ pakat-e inoh ke iyoh paliꞌ.

verses.text: He called ten servants of his, and gave them ten mina coins,  and told them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’
verses.source_translation: Takal-e yaꞌ ponu yomoꞌ mogan simoong naꞌan kuli-e, yomoꞌ ngin kiping duit mas tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, ‘Kai leh duit itih kaꞌan modal ingan bidagang nog okuꞌ paliꞌ.’

verses.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, ‘We don’t want this man to reign over us.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa daang negli-e noh obuaꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ iyoh, takal-e moꞌ ponu nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui daꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pait kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa saꞌ-e tanon nang, ‘Koꞌih doliaꞌ koꞌih odaꞌ nyaꞌa itih jadin laja koꞌih.’

verses.text: “When he had come back again, having received the kingdom, he commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by conducting business.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e iyoh totap obuah pakat jadin laja.  Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ negli-e.  Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ mogan kuli-e deꞌ simoong inoh ngan-e yaꞌ puꞌan utung soꞌ duit deꞌ moꞌ ngin-e tuduꞌ kuli-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas.’
verses.source_translation: Kuli-e deꞌ ke niꞌ-e moꞌ in-e, ‘Laja niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ inoh moh moꞌ bitamah jadin simoong kiping.’

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’
verses.source_translation: ‘Paguh,’ in laja inoh, ‘Muꞌu kuli deꞌ paguh, sobab daang oniꞌ deꞌ isit jaꞌ-e muꞌu ponai nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e, sobab inohleh muꞌu yaꞌ militah tun simoong kota.’

verses.text: “The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas.’
verses.source_translation: Kuli ke duwoh-e moꞌ in-e geh, ‘Niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ moh moꞌ bitamah jadin limoh kiping.’

verses.text: “So he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’
verses.source_translation: ‘Muꞌu yaꞌ militah tun limoh kota,’ in laja inoh.

verses.text: Another came, saying, ‘Lord, behold, your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief,
verses.source_translation: Kuli ke taluh-e moꞌ in-e, ‘Itihleh niꞌ kiping duit mas deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ okuꞌ, nyikonkuꞌ daang sapu tongan.

verses.text: for I feared you, because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn’t lay down, and reap that which you didn’t sow.’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tolu deꞌ ingan sobab ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ kolas, ingan mit oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e kakuꞌ ingan, duoh ingan ngutuam koyuh deꞌ diꞌ ingan puluah-e.’

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up that which I didn’t lay down, and reaping that which I didn’t sow.
verses.source_translation: Laja inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Muꞌu kuli deꞌ jaꞌat.  Kuꞌ yaꞌ ngukum muꞌu samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang odopmuꞌ.  Muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan okuꞌ kolas, deꞌ mit oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e kakuꞌ okuꞌ mokuaꞌ inoh ngutuam oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puluah-e.

verses.text: Then why didn’t you deposit my money in the bank, and at my coming, I might have earned interest on it?’
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, oni ngan muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ nyikon duitkuꞌ inoh deꞌ beng? Saꞌ takal kuꞌ paliꞌ, okuꞌ tapod mit duit noh baya bunga-e geh.’

verses.text: He said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him, and give it to him who has the ten minas.’
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh laja inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mujuag sinok-e, ‘Mit niꞌ kiping duit maskuꞌ soꞌ kuli deꞌ jaꞌat inoh, nyeꞌ moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ kuli deꞌ soꞌon simoong kiping inoh.’

verses.text: “They said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Tung iyoh kan moꞌ ogiꞌ simoong kiping.’

verses.text: ‘For I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.
verses.source_translation: Laja inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Osi deꞌ dapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ isit tuduꞌ-e, iyoh dapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bogoꞌ tuduꞌ-e, pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e nyeꞌ dapod bisayaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ isit tuduꞌ-e oni deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ odop-e bial isit totap obuah mit suaꞌ-e.

verses.text: But bring those enemies of mine who didn’t want me to reign over them here, and kill them before me.’”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin tobanleh katiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ okuꞌ, deꞌ doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ okuꞌ jadin laja saꞌan odop-e.  Mokuaꞌ inoh ngabos leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ sulung jowinkuꞌ!’ ”

verses.text: Having said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ takal-e mokuaꞌ nang sina-E, Yesus moꞌ nyamung pimonu-e keꞌ Yerusalem.

verses.text: When he came near to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ kupuaꞌ Betfage duoh Betania deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun, Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ-e dioꞌ ponu,

verses.text: saying, “Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, which no man had ever sat upon. Untie it, and bring it.
verses.source_translation: in-E, “Odileh keꞌ kupuaꞌ inoh.  Takal ingan moꞌ nog deꞌ kupuaꞌ noh, ingan yaꞌ dapod niꞌ polong keledai deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu-e nyaꞌa muat daꞌ-e deꞌ obuah mokos sinok boli nyaꞌa.  Pilopasleh bokos-e inoh soꞌ tiang tobanleh katiꞌ.

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’”
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sikian tuduꞌ ingan, ‘Oniꞌ ngan ingan pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang-e neh?’ Tanon daꞌ-e nang Gulu pilelu-e.”

verses.text: Those who were sent went away, and found things just as he had told them.
verses.source_translation: Ke duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh moꞌ odi, yomoꞌ dapod suaꞌ oniꞌ danoꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e.

verses.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Oni nai ingan pilopas tolin keledai inoh soꞌ tiang-e neh?”

verses.text: They said, “The Lord needs it.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Gulu pilelu-e.”

verses.text: They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh ti-e moꞌ toban keledai inoh tuduꞌ Yesus, yomoꞌ nopas dug keledai inoh pakai jubah-e yomoꞌ tulung paꞌad Yesus keꞌ tun-e.

verses.text: As he went, they spread their cloaks on the road.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ takal Yesus moꞌ ponu simadi-E maꞌad deꞌ tun keledai inoh, nyaꞌa bogoꞌ moꞌ nopas olan pakai jubah-e.

verses.text: As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog Yerusalem deꞌ olan muun deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun, susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu nunaꞌ Iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ daang munuas-e nang bogan-e mudi Topaꞌ saꞌan susuaꞌ mukjizat deꞌ moꞌ kilin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: saying, “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord!  Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!”
verses.source_translation: In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Obuah bilokatleh Laja itih deꞌ nog daang adon Topaꞌ! Sonang-moꞌon daang sulga duoh mudileh Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees from the multitude said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi deꞌ suaꞌ duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ sina duoh Yesus, “Gulu odaꞌleh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌmuꞌ inoh saꞌ diꞌ-e sina in tih.”

verses.text: He answered them, “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Moꞌ nyam pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌKuꞌ diꞌ-e nang bogan-e, batuh-batuh deꞌ munoꞌ, deꞌ olan itih deꞌ yaꞌ nang bogan in tih geh.”

verses.text: When he came near, he saw the city and wept over it,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ yaꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerusalem, Iyoh ningaꞌ kota inoh, Iyoh moꞌ siꞌien ningaꞌ-e.

verses.text: saying, “If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Todah manah mun ingan deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota itih.  Sukup paguh-e moꞌ nyam ingan puꞌan oniꞌ wat ingan yaꞌ bidamai duoh Topaꞌ pak-e adin ingan diꞌ ngan ponai ngiloti-e!

verses.text: For the days will come on you, when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, surround you, hem you in on every side,
