verses.source_translation: Sobab yaꞌ nog onu-e musoh yaꞌ nog kapung ingan nunaꞌ sinung kota ingan boit-touh mun neh ngan neh yaꞌ nyelang ingan.

verses.text: and will dash you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone on another, because you didn’t know the time of your visitation.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngasul kota baya soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo daang-e, yomoꞌ niꞌ kiluang batuh idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ tanah-e bisusun deꞌ tun batuh deꞌ bokon, sobab ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan siniaꞌ totok-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog nyilamat ingan.”

verses.text: He entered into the temple, and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus molot deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ yoh moꞌ kasig nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua danoꞌ.

verses.text: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’  but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Daang Kitab deꞌ nulis deꞌ in tih, ‘Boli Kuꞌ iyohleh topat nyaꞌa bidoa,’ pak-e ingan pakai topat kaꞌan ngakal nipu nyaꞌa.”

verses.text: He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him.
verses.source_translation: Bilang konu Yesus ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi baya nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah adon-e deꞌ uluk ulang Israel kagaꞌ oni wat-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus,

verses.text: They couldn’t find what they might do, for all the people hung on to every word that he said.
verses.source_translation: pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oniwat gaya-e, sobab nyaꞌa bogoꞌ sonang yaꞌ ngojit oni deꞌ nang Yesus.

chapters.text: He entered and was passing through Jericho. There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich. He was trying to see who Jesus was, and couldn’t because of the crowd, because he was short. He ran on ahead, and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was going to pass that way. When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”  He hurried, came down, and received him joyfully. When they saw it, they all murmured, saying, “He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.” Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.” Jesus said to him, “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.   For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.”  As they heard these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that God’s Kingdom would be revealed immediately. He said therefore, “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.   He called ten servants of his, and gave them ten mina coins,  and told them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’   But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, ‘We don’t want this man to reign over us.’  “When he had come back again, having received the kingdom, he commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by conducting business.   The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas.’  “He said to him, ‘Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’   “The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas.’   “So he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’   Another came, saying, ‘Lord, behold, your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief,   for I feared you, because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn’t lay down, and reap that which you didn’t sow.’  “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up that which I didn’t lay down, and reaping that which I didn’t sow.   Then why didn’t you deposit my money in the bank, and at my coming, I might have earned interest on it?’   He said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him, and give it to him who has the ten minas.’  “They said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’   ‘For I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.   But bring those enemies of mine who didn’t want me to reign over them here, and kill them before me.’” Having said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem. When he came near to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples, saying, “Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, which no man had ever sat upon. Untie it, and bring it.   If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’” Those who were sent went away, and found things just as he had told them. As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?” They said, “The Lord needs it.” They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them. As he went, they spread their cloaks on the road. As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen, saying, “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord!  Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!” Some of the Pharisees from the multitude said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!” He answered them, “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out.” When he came near, he saw the city and wept over it, saying, “If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.   For the days will come on you, when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, surround you, hem you in on every side,   and will dash you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone on another, because you didn’t know the time of your visitation.” He entered into the temple, and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it, saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’  but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”  He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him. They couldn’t find what they might do, for all the people hung on to every word that he said.

verses.text: On one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, the priests and scribes came to him with the elders.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ngajal duoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.  Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi nog,

verses.text: They asked him, “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?”
verses.source_translation: yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Suba tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, osi deꞌ ngin hak duoh daang adon osi muꞌu nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ?”

verses.text: He answered them, “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tuong ogiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ sikian Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, suba tanon tuduꞌ Okuꞌ:

verses.text: the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?”
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ ngin hak tuduꞌ Yohanes Pembaptis nyaꞌa? Topaꞌ keh soꞌ odop Yohanes?”

verses.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biloneng, “Nyam basa otoꞌ nang soꞌ Topaꞌ, totu Iyoh nang ‘Oni nai ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yohanes?’

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyam basa otoꞌ nang, ‘Soꞌ odop Yohanes,’ totu suaꞌ nyaꞌa nyokad otoꞌ pakai batuh, sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Yohanes inoh nabi.”

verses.text: They answered that they didn’t know where it was from.
verses.source_translation: Jadi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan neh.”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tuong doliaꞌ Kuꞌ geh tanon soꞌ ki Okuꞌ soꞌon hak duoh daang adon osi, ngan Kuꞌ nai suaꞌ onik deꞌ munoꞌ.”

verses.text: He began to tell the people this parable. “A  man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan In-e, “Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ kobon angul-e iyoh moꞌ sewa kobon-e inoh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, odop-e moꞌ odi loꞌo sukup tui-e keꞌ pulow deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.
verses.source_translation: Takal moꞌ nog onu-e ngutuam angul, nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ pait kuli-e, daꞌ odi mit duman yoh soꞌ ayua deꞌ soꞌ-e sewa kobon-e.  Pak-e ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ makung pijolaꞌ kuli inoh yomoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh-boloh-e.

verses.text: He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh, moꞌ pait lagiꞌ kuli-e deꞌ bokon, pak-e kuli inoh obuah pakung pijolaꞌ geh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ manguk-nyupah-e yomoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ boloh-boloh-e.

verses.text: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ odaꞌ kuli-e deꞌ ke taluh-e.  Pak-e kuli-e inoh tuong obuah geh pakung pijolaꞌ nog-e kinaman simadi nyaꞌa munoꞌ matak toban luah soꞌ kobon inoh.

verses.text: The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’
verses.source_translation: Nyuang-nyuang-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai kuꞌ yoh? Kuꞌ pait onak odopkuꞌ deꞌ sukupkuꞌ ngibala-e, podo odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ laꞌan tunuak tuduꞌ-e.’

verses.text: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ nyewa kobon inoh ningaꞌ onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog, yomoꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, in-e, ‘Ningaꞌ! Deꞌ nog inoh onak odop nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon, iyoh deꞌ yaꞌ kakuꞌ kobon itih takal samaꞌ-e doiꞌ, jaꞌ toꞌ ngabos-e saꞌ kobon itih jadin kakuꞌ otoꞌ.’

verses.text: They threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ matak onak nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh toban keꞌ sopaꞌ kobon yomoꞌ ngabos-e.” Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, oni deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ?

verses.text: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.” When they heard it, they said, “May it never be!”
verses.source_translation: Totu nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ kobon inoh nog yomoꞌ ngabos ayua deꞌ nyewa kobon-e inoh, yomoꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon daꞌ sewa-e.” Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nai ayua deꞌ sewa kobon inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nang in tuduꞌ Yesus, “Maꞌ boꞌow-e daꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ watnoh jadi neh!”

verses.text: But he looked at them, and said, “Then what is this that is written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the chief cornerstone?’
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ simadi-e sikian, “Oni mey loti ayat daang Kitab deꞌ in neh: ‘Batuh deꞌ nang tukang-tukang boli moꞌ doiꞌ guna-e iyohleh batuh deꞌ jadin batuh deꞌ sukup biguna-e kaꞌan kajuag boli.’”

verses.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces,  but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tun batuh inoh totap iyoh asul, duoh osi deꞌ obuah nyonug odaꞌ batuh inoh totap iyoh asul lumuk.”

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people—for they knew he had spoken this parable against them.
verses.source_translation: Gulu-gulu agama Yahudi duoh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh puꞌan-e nang perumpamaan Yesus inoh obuah odop-e, sobab inohleh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ takap Yesus takal inoh geh pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: They watched him, and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.
verses.source_translation: Jadin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngite.  Odop deꞌ munoꞌ pait nyaꞌa deꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ paguh ngan-e ngite-e yomoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh bogoꞌ sikian oniꞌ deꞌ Yesus ngan kalik salah-e saꞌ-e ponai takap duoh toban tuduꞌ gubenul.

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina in neh, “Gulu, puꞌan koꞌih nang buak sina duoh ajal Ingan suaꞌ-e bonal, Ingan diꞌ ngan pilih-pilih nyaꞌa, Ingan ngajal nunaꞌ oni deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ kaꞌan manusia.

verses.text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
verses.source_translation: Jadi, suba Ingan tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, podo daang agama otoꞌ soꞌon kedoh keh otoꞌ bayal suke tuduꞌ Kaisar?”

verses.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why do you test me?
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ puꞌan pikil jaꞌat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yomoꞌ in-e,

verses.text: Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”  They answered, “Caesar’s.”
verses.source_translation: “Suba bitanga niꞌ kiping duit pilak tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, gamal duoh adon osi itih?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Kaisar!”

verses.text: He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Kaisar ngin tuduꞌ Kaisar, pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: They weren’t able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer, and were silent.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e ponai kalik salah Yesus deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo bidongo simadi-e ilan oni deꞌ nang Yesus.

verses.text: Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Saduki odi tuduꞌ Yesus.  (Uluk ulang Saduki iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos idoh tiaꞌ diꞌ-e ponai paliꞌ idip.) Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus,

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up children for his brother.
verses.source_translation: “Gulu, Musa nulis plitah saꞌan otoꞌ in tih in-e neh, ‘Moꞌ nyam ogiꞌ sowon nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos bonon-e yoh moꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e, madih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh halus mit dayung inoh jadin sowon-e saꞌ-e ogiꞌ onak-sukun soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh ti-e.’

verses.text: There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ juꞌ naꞌan sikiaꞌ sudiꞌ.  Deꞌ pinuan kawin, pak-e aluaꞌ doiꞌ onak-e iyoh moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh sudiꞌ-e kawin duoh ipal-e pak-e iyoh kobos geh, doiꞌ onak-e.

verses.text: The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died.
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh deꞌ obuah sudiꞌ-e deꞌ nomol taluh nog ke juꞌ-e.

verses.text: Afterward the woman also died.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung inoh tuong kobos geh.

verses.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ juꞌ madih odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kawin duoh dayung inoh.  Moꞌ nyam-e watinoh, osi mun-e soꞌ juꞌ naꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ jadin bonon dayung inoh, takal onu nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip?”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The children of this age marry, and are given in marriage.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang dunia suaꞌ-e kawin.

verses.text: But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e daang dunia deꞌ yaꞌ nog dali duoh dayung deꞌ ngakuꞌ deꞌ boton Topaꞌ kaꞌan-e paliꞌ idip baꞌuh idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ-e kawin.

verses.text: For they can’t die any more, for they are like the angels, and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ malaikat diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai kobos, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi onak Topaꞌ.  Sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip baꞌuh.

verses.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
verses.source_translation: Odop Musa deꞌ tanon nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip baꞌuh, daang silita Musa opui biduduꞌ daang totaꞌ duh, iyoh sobot nang Topaꞌ iyohleh Topaꞌ deꞌ obuah nyomah odaꞌ Abraham, Ishak duoh Yakub,

verses.text: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”
verses.source_translation: sobab idoh diꞌ-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, sobab kaꞌan Topaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ-e idip.”

verses.text: Some of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you speak well.”
verses.source_translation: Ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus noh, kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu-gulu agama Yahudi nang, “Bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang Ingan inoh neh.”

verses.text: They didn’t dare to ask him any more questions.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiaꞌ blani sikian oni-oni tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He said to them, “Why do they say that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni ngan nyaꞌa ponai nang Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inoh onak-sukun laja Daud?

verses.text: David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,
verses.source_translation: Sobab odop Daud deꞌ sina daang buk Mazmur nang, ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tuankuꞌ: Guluꞌ leh deꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh-Ku

verses.text: until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’
verses.source_translation: nog Okuꞌ monang tun musohmuꞌ.’

verses.text: “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”
verses.source_translation: Jadi, Daud nang Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inohleh Tuan-e.  Watki wat-e Iyoh ponai soꞌ onak-sukun Daud?”

verses.text: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ ngojit Yesus sina, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E,

verses.text: “Beware of those scribes who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts;
verses.source_translation: “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ maꞌ kodaꞌ gulu-gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ suka ponu katiꞌ-kanih pakai jubah deꞌ omu ngan-e yaꞌ blagah odop-e, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pasal nabiꞌ-e, duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suka guluꞌ deꞌ topat saꞌan piayuh deꞌ boli topat simayang duoh topat nyaꞌa bluman.

verses.text: who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ konyat ngakal jana-jana yomoꞌ mit halta-e.  Ngan-e nutu pingunai-e inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bidoa omu-omu-e, pak-e inoh pibulaꞌ jaꞌ-e.  Sobab inohleh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ totap yaꞌ obuah ngukum lobih baat lagiꞌ!”

chapters.text: On one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, the priests and scribes came to him with the elders. They asked him, “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?” He answered them, “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:   the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?” They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’ But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.” They answered that they didn’t know where it was from. Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.” He began to tell the people this parable. “A  man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.   At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.   He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.   He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.   The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’  “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’   They threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?   He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.” When they heard it, they said, “May it never be!” But he looked at them, and said, “Then what is this that is written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the chief cornerstone?’  Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces,  but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.” The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people—for they knew he had spoken this parable against them. They watched him, and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor. They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?” But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why do you test me?   Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”  They answered, “Caesar’s.” He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” They weren’t able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer, and were silent. Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection. They asked him, “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up children for his brother. There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless. The second took her as wife, and he died childless. The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died. Afterward the woman also died. Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.” Jesus said to them, “The children of this age marry, and are given in marriage.   But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage.   For they can’t die any more, for they are like the angels, and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.   But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’   Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.” Some of the scribes answered, “Teacher, you speak well.” They didn’t dare to ask him any more questions. He said to them, “Why do they say that the Christ is David’s son?   David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,  until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.”’   “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?” In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,  “Beware of those scribes who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts;   who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these will receive greater condemnation.”

verses.text: He looked up, and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ Iyoh ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya suad duit kaang poti persembahan.

verses.text: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ geh niꞌ naꞌan jana deꞌ botak kolag kibalot duwoh kiping duit tibaga.

verses.text: He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them,
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Jana inoh suad duit-e lobih bogoꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: for all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab suaꞌ nyaꞌa ngin sit soꞌ halta-e deꞌ bogoꞌ, pak-e jana itih sungu-e botak kolag iyoh ngin suaꞌ-suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e.”

verses.text: As some were talking about the temple and how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts, he said,
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa kilakal sitipan odop-e simadi-e mudi Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa pakai sinung batuh deꞌ paguh duoh balang-balang persembahan Topaꞌ.  Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ,

verses.text: “As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.”
verses.source_translation: “Tieꞌ sodiꞌ, suaꞌ oni deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan itih obuah pilubuh, niꞌ kiluang batuh tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ lokat bisusun duoh dingan-e, suaꞌ-suaꞌ obuaꞌ posik-polai katiꞌ-kanih.”

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, so when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?”
verses.source_translation: Odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu siniaꞌ hal inoh yaꞌ jadi? Duoh oni tanda-e moꞌ nog onu-e hal inoh yaꞌ jadi?”

verses.text: He said, “Watch out that you don’t get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don’t follow them.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Tauꞌ-tauꞌ nyeꞌ, maꞌ ingan obuah mogo.  Sobab bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog pakai adon Okuꞌ duoh nang: ‘Okuꞌ leh odop-E neh’ duoh ‘Moꞌ yaꞌ nog onu-e tiyaꞌ.’ Pak-e maꞌleh ingan nunaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: When you hear of wars and disturbances, don’t be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won’t come immediately.”
verses.source_translation: Asal ingan ngojit nyaꞌa bogoꞌ bipolang yomoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa blawan, maꞌ ingan gogoh sobab suaꞌ inoh totap yaꞌ dioꞌ jadi, pak-e takal inoh idoh diꞌ-e lasuꞌ Onu Kiamat.”

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ nyamung sina-e in-e, “Yaꞌ ogiꞌ polang, suku deꞌ niꞌ lawan suku deꞌ bokon duoh negara deꞌ niꞌ lawan negara deꞌ bokon,

verses.text: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.
verses.source_translation: duoh tieꞌ sodiꞌ-e, daki-daki sijaꞌ-e yaꞌ jadi gempa bumi deꞌ dolas, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa miliap duoh obuah pinyakit deꞌ bijakit.  Yaꞌ jadi oniꞌ deꞌ saluh-saluh deꞌ tolu nyaꞌa daꞌ-a duoh tanda-tanda dahsyat deꞌ longit.

verses.text: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal suaꞌ hal inoh aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi ingan obuah takap nyaꞌa nyiksa ingan, ingan obuah ngadel deꞌ boli topat simayang yomoꞌ kibalot ingan kaang jel, ingan moꞌ obuah toban keꞌ jowin laja-laja duoh pinguasa sobab ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: It will turn out as a testimony for you.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu inohleh ingan tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer,
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ bigaduh duoh oni in sina deꞌ halus ingan nang takal ingan obuah ngadel.

verses.text: for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.
verses.source_translation: Sobab Okuꞌ moꞌ ngin bijak tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan ponai nang sina deꞌ diꞌ musoh ingan ponai nyawot-e.

verses.text: You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.
verses.source_translation: Ingan yaꞌ obuah nyelah tuduꞌ musoh odaꞌ pingoma ngan, odaꞌ madih ayua ngan, odaꞌ dingan-dingan ngan, kudu naꞌan soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngabos odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake.
verses.source_translation: Ingan yaꞌ obuah buꞌui sobab ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: And not a hair of your head will perish.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ponai ngabos polong ingan pak-e sibonal-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai yaꞌ nai oni-oni-e tuduꞌ ingan.  Niꞌ kiluang geh buak deꞌ bak ingan diꞌ-e moyap!

verses.text: “By your endurance you will win your lives.
verses.source_translation: Asal ingan taan sabal ngadap suaꞌ-e inoh ingan yaꞌ soꞌon idip deꞌ sitelus-e.”

verses.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.
verses.source_translation: “Nyam ingan ningaꞌ Yerusalem obuah kapung odaꞌ sidadu, ingan moꞌ puꞌan nang patuab lubuh-e moh sinok,

verses.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the middle of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ propinsi Yudea totap lasuꞌ bikoduh buꞌu keꞌ dolod.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota halus buꞌu luah soꞌ kota, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kupuaꞌ maꞌ molot daang kota.

verses.text: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
verses.source_translation: Sobab onu inohleh onu bangsa itih obuah ukum, saꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis odaꞌ nabi-nabi jadi.

verses.text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.
verses.source_translation: Masiꞌ manah nyeꞌ ningaꞌ dayung-dayung deꞌ bitiiaꞌ duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ siduaꞌ onak-e takal inoh.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jolaꞌ sobab lolah posah saꞌan-e bikoduh buꞌu.  Susuaꞌ nyaꞌa daang kota inoh yaꞌ sukup jolaꞌ-e takal bangsa itih obuah ngukum.

verses.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ bangsa Israel yaꞌ obuah ngabos pakai podang, duoh bogoꞌ geh deꞌ yaꞌ obuah takap duoh obuah toban keꞌ negli-negli bangsa deꞌ bokon, duoh bangsa-bangsa inoh yaꞌ militah kota Yerusalem nog onu deꞌ moh moꞌ notap Topaꞌ saꞌan bangsa-bangsa inoh.”

verses.text: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves;
verses.source_translation: “Tiaꞌ sodiꞌ ogiꞌ tanda deꞌ saluh-saluh wat-e yaꞌ tonga deꞌ boton onu, bitang duoh bulan.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia yaꞌ tolu duoh ilan ngojit doong duoh gilumang laut deꞌ dolas

verses.text: men fainting for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa obuaꞌ yaꞌ kobos-kobos nyam-e tolu tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadi deꞌ tun dunia tih, sobab deꞌ tun auu longit obuaꞌ yaꞌ tiguyang-tikusuok.

verses.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa kilin Okuꞌ Onak Manusia nog daang abun duoh punuaꞌ odaꞌ kuasa baya jawaꞌ deꞌ sukup telang.

verses.text: But when these things begin to happen, look up, and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”
verses.source_translation: Asal suaꞌ inoh moꞌ jadi, mokatleh nyeꞌ moꞌ pakat jowinmuꞌ, maꞌ tolu sobab diꞌ-e tiaꞌ tui Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog nyilamat muꞌu.”

verses.text: He told them a parable. “See the fig tree, and all the trees.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus moꞌ ngin perumpamaan, “Suba ningaꞌ tongon dunuk atou tongon koyuh oni sijaꞌ-e,

verses.text: When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.
verses.source_translation: asal ingan moh ningaꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ tuang-e bisuat ingan puꞌan nang yaꞌ nog musim buaꞌ.

verses.text: Even so you also, when you see these things happening, know that God’s Kingdom is near.
verses.source_translation: Watinoh geh moꞌ nyam ingan moꞌ kilin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ inoh ti-e jadi, ingan moꞌ puꞌan nang onu-e Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja moꞌ sinok.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all things are accomplished.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip joman itih aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kobos takal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tok-tok yaꞌ jadi.”

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.
verses.source_translation: “Longit duoh bumi yaꞌ musuap-moyap pak-e sina Kuꞌ itih diꞌ-e yaꞌ ponai musuap-moyap.

verses.text: “So be careful, or your hearts will be loaded down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day will come on you suddenly.
verses.source_translation: Natong nyeꞌ! Maꞌ sikiya pikil idip ingan duoh nuak mabuk jaꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan siap takal onu inoh tang-tang nog.

verses.text: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.
verses.source_translation: Sobab onu inoh nog saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa samah kodaꞌ binatang tang-tang obuah jolat.

verses.text: Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.source_translation: Natong nyeꞌ! Duoh silaluleh bidoa saꞌ ingan taꞌan ngadap suaꞌ-e inoh duoh saꞌ ingan diꞌ-e dasaꞌ duoh munuas takal ingan nyamut Okuꞌ Onak Manusia.”

verses.text: Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet.
verses.source_translation: Bilang konu-e daang minggu inoh Yesus ngajal deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ onu ngalom-e iyoh odi ngilumon deꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun.

verses.text: All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.
verses.source_translation: Suam-suam pagi bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog Boli Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngojit pingunang-E.

chapters.text: He looked up, and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury. He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins. He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them,   for all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.” As some were talking about the temple and how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts, he said,  “As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.” They asked him, “Teacher, so when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?” He said, “Watch out that you don’t get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don’t follow them.   When you hear of wars and disturbances, don’t be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won’t come immediately.” Then he said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.   There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.   But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.   It will turn out as a testimony for you.   Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer,   for I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.   You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.   You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake.   And not a hair of your head will perish.  “By your endurance you will win your lives.  “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.   Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the middle of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.   For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.   Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.   They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.   There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves;   men fainting for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.   Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.   But when these things begin to happen, look up, and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.” He told them a parable. “See the fig tree, and all the trees.   When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.   Even so you also, when you see these things happening, know that God’s Kingdom is near.   Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all things are accomplished.   Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.  “So be careful, or your hearts will be loaded down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day will come on you suddenly.   For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.   Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.” Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet. All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.

verses.text: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
verses.source_translation: Takal sinok onu-e yaꞌ Paskah,

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death, for they feared the people.
verses.source_translation: pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi kalik watki wat gaya-e yaꞌ ngabos Yesus pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu jaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: Satan entered into Judas, who was also called Iscariot, who was counted with the twelve.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Muot moꞌ molot kaang Yudas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh Iskariot.  Iyoh niꞌ soꞌ ke simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He went away, and talked with the chief priests and captains about how he might deliver him to them.
verses.source_translation: Yoh odi bidapod duoh pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin-pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Boli Topaꞌ ngan-e tanon watki wat gaya-e yaꞌ ngin Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: They were glad, and agreed to give him money.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ sonang manah kila-e yomoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bijanyi yaꞌ ngin duit tuduꞌ Yudas.

verses.text: He consented, and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them in the absence of the multitude.
verses.source_translation: Yudas moꞌ situju duoh kalik oni wat-e baya onu deꞌ pas kaꞌan-e ngin Yesus tuduꞌ musoh-e takal nyaꞌa bogoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan-e.

verses.text: The day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu keꞌ niꞌ Paskah moꞌ nog suaꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ halus simoliah domba Paskah.

verses.text: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus sina odaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes, “Odileh sidia pinguman Paskah kaꞌan otoꞌ.”

verses.text: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e duwoh inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Daki ingan odaꞌ koꞌih nyidia-e?”

verses.text: He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Takal ingan molot daang kota Yerusalem danih ingan yaꞌ bidapod duoh dali deꞌ toban piꞌin daang bona.  Nunaꞌ negeh iyoh keꞌ boli soꞌ-e molot,

verses.text: Tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.source_translation: nyeꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli daki soꞌ topat kaꞌan Gulu duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e yaꞌ man Paskah.

verses.text: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ boli inoh deꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan kamal deꞌ somu deꞌ muaꞌ motiꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ bilasa sidia, danoꞌ leh ingan nyidia pinguman Paskah toꞌ.”

verses.text: They went, found things as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes odi keꞌ Yerusalem yoh moꞌ tapod samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e noh ti-e yomoꞌ nyidia pinguman Paskah-e.

verses.text: When the hour had come, he sat down with the twelve apostles.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moh yaꞌ ngalom, Yesus moꞌ man duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.

verses.text: He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer,
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e munoꞌ, “Jobong nyam Kuꞌ yaꞌ man pinguman paskah itih duoh ingan ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ obuah jolaꞌ.

verses.text: for I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in God’s Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh, Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiaꞌ man itih lagiꞌ nog loti paskah itih jadi takal Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

verses.text: He received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said, “Take this, and share it among yourselves,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ mit gelas deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin angul daang-e, Yoh moꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ sina, “Mit duoh kutungleh itih.

verses.text: for I tell you, I will not drink at all again from the fruit of the vine, until God’s Kingdom comes.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Soꞌ adin Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ nuak angul itih nog Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

verses.text: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke, and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ mit kueh duoh bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, yomoꞌ nyipiek kueh inoh yomoꞌ kutung tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh sina, “Itihleh gonan Kuꞌ deꞌ ngin Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.  Naileh wat itih Saꞌ ingan natong Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ man kueh inoh Yesus moꞌ mit gelas deꞌ ogiꞌ piꞌin angul inoh duoh ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e Yoh moꞌ sina, “Piꞌin angul daang gelas itih iyohleh janyi Topaꞌ deꞌ baꞌuh, janyi-bipokat deꞌ obuah nogap pakai doyaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ soyang kaꞌan ingan.

verses.text: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e maꞌ ingan gogoh takal Kuꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Okuꞌ deꞌ musoh Kuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ,

verses.text: The Son of Man indeed goes, as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!”
verses.source_translation: Onak Manusia totap yaꞌ kobos samah kodaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ notap Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Okuꞌ inoh, tok-tok yaꞌ obuah ngukum.”

verses.text: They began to question among themselves, which of them it was who would do this thing.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikian sitipan odop-e osi nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nai hal inoh.

verses.text: There arose also a contention among them, which of them was considered to be greatest.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ bikalah osi deꞌ paling penting soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: He said to them, “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Laja-laja bangsa deꞌ diꞌ-e piluh Topaꞌ siwat-simun-e tuduꞌ rakyat-e, pak-e sungu-e watnoh rakyat-e silalu sobot laja inoh pinulung-e.

verses.text: But not so with you. But one who is the greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan diꞌ ngan soꞌon watinoh! Soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling penting halus jadi kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paling hina-e duoh pimipin halus leh kodaꞌ jadin pelayan.

verses.text: For who is greater, one who sits at the table, or one who serves? Isn’t it he who sits at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
verses.source_translation: Osi leh deꞌ lobih penting, nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ man deꞌ mija keh nyaꞌa deꞌ layan inoh keh? Totu nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ! Pak-e Okuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ sinok ingan jadi pelayan.

verses.text: But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.
verses.source_translation: Daang suaꞌ susahkuꞌ ingan totap ogiꞌ bisamah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I confer on you a kingdom, even as my Father conferred on me,
verses.source_translation: Sobab inohleh Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ingan hak kaꞌan militah keꞌ tun suaꞌ nyaꞌa, kodaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Okuꞌ hak kaꞌan militah.

verses.text: that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e watinoh ingan dapod suaꞌ sonang-doon duoh Okuꞌ takal Okuꞌ jadin Laja duoh ingan guluꞌ militah keꞌ tun ke simoong duwoh suku bangsa Israel.”

verses.text: The Lord said, “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have all of you, that he might sift you as wheat,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Simon Petrus, “Simon, Simon, ngojit nyeꞌ! Muot moꞌ obuah ngin ijin odaꞌ nguji ingan samah kodaꞌ podi deꞌ obuah napan saꞌ-e pisah isin-e soꞌ oping-e.

verses.text: but I prayed for you, that your faith wouldn’t fail. You, when once you have turned again, establish your brothers.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ moh bidoa kaꞌan muꞌu Simon, saꞌ bisayaꞌ muꞌ togap duoh takal muꞌu moꞌ paliꞌ bitobat muꞌu ponai ngin simangat tuduꞌ madih ayuamuꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
verses.source_translation: Petrus nyawot-e, “Gulu okuꞌ sangup molot jel duoh kobos duoh Ingan!”

verses.text: He said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e: “Petrus, Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Aluaꞌ diꞌ siuak babang bitadu sipagi itih muꞌu moꞌ taluh sidoh diꞌ muꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to them, “When I sent you out without purse, and wallet, and shoes, did you lack anything?” They said, “Nothing.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Noꞌuh-e takal Okuꞌ odaꞌ ingan odi dusah toban lopet beg duoh kasut podo ingan ogiꞌ kulang oni-oni-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot, “Doiꞌ.”

verses.text: Then he said to them, “But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ: “Pak-e adin osi deꞌ ogiꞌ lopet duoh beg halus yoh toban-e, duoh osi deꞌ doiꞌ podang-e yoh halus jua jubah-e kai-e milih podang.

verses.text: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ For that which concerns me has an end.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Ayat Kitab deꞌ nang in-e, ‘Iyoh obuah sobot nyaꞌa nang yoh inoh ulang jaꞌat,’ halus jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Sobab oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang Kitab moh jadi tuduꞌ Okuꞌ adin.”

verses.text: They said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu ningaꞌ katiꞌ ogiꞌ duoh podang.” “Mohleh,” in Yesus.

verses.text: He came out, and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ togan kota duoh odi keꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun kodaꞌ deꞌ biasa-e duoh pinunaꞌ-e suaꞌ geh odi.

verses.text: When he was at the place, he said to them, “Pray that you don’t enter into temptation.”
verses.source_translation: Takal yoh nog danih Yesus sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e, “Bidoa leh saꞌ ingan diꞌ ngan labuꞌ daang dosa takal ngan obuah pingisuba.”

verses.text: He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s throw, and he knelt down and prayed,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ buꞌu muaꞌ juꞌan-e.  Kila-e taluh puluꞌ meter soꞌ pinunaꞌ-e, Iyoh moꞌ bikunyug duoh bidoa

verses.text: saying, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”
verses.source_translation: in-e, “Samaꞌ daang sulga nyam ponai maꞌleh odaꞌ Okuꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ itih.  Pak-e maꞌleh nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan okuꞌ pak-e jadileh kodaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Ingan.”

verses.text: An angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan malaikat nog tuduꞌ Yesus duoh nguat simangat Yesus.

verses.text: Being in agony he prayed more earnestly. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sukup nyam jolaꞌ daang otin-e inoh ngan yoh bidoa bonal-bonal nog das-e kodaꞌ doyaꞌ natiag deꞌ tanaꞌ.

verses.text: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples, and found them sleeping because of grief,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ bidoa Yesus paliꞌ lagi tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, Yoh ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E boꞌos sobab odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kowok duoh susah otin-e.

verses.text: and said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Oni ngan ingan boꞌos? Mokatleh duoh bidoa saꞌ ingan diꞌ ngan obuah pingisuba.”

verses.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a multitude, and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus aluaꞌ sina, nogleh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ obuah mipin odaꞌ Yudas, pinunaꞌ odop Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yudas moꞌ odi sinoꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ sium-E.

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Yudas, Podo pakai salam sium muꞌu yaꞌ ngin Okuꞌ Onak Manusia?”

verses.text: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
verses.source_translation: Takal pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus ningaꞌ oniꞌ jadi inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Gulu, podo ingan odaꞌ koꞌih nyelang negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ pakai podang?”

verses.text: A certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ nyopaꞌ kojit toꞌuh kuli pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh noh nog-e potod.

verses.text: But Jesus answered, “Let me at least do this”—and he touched his ear, and healed him.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Moh tiaꞌ!” Daang-e lasuꞌ tomaꞌ kojit nyaꞌa inoh ngan-e daꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and elders, who had come against him, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ noh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, sidadu-sidadu deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ duoh pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ suaꞌ odi kanoꞌ yaꞌ takap Odop-e, “Ulang jaꞌat keh Okuꞌ tih ngan ingan nog toban podang duoh pakung saꞌan takap Okuꞌ?

verses.text: When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn’t stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”
verses.source_translation: Bilang konu okuꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ, doiꞌ ingan odi takap Okuꞌ.  Pak-e moꞌ nog onu-e saꞌan ingan yaꞌ takap okuꞌ, onu Laja Muot kiloja.”

verses.text: They seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed from a distance.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap Yesus yomoꞌ toban keꞌ boli pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh-e, Petrus moꞌ nunaꞌ-e soꞌ juuaꞌ.

verses.text: When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and had sat down together, Peter sat among them.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ uun limang boli pimipin agama inoh, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa nai opui daꞌ-e yomoꞌ Petrus moꞌ suaꞌ geh guluꞌ sinok nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuluk ngan-e ngunuh.

verses.text: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said, “This man also was with him.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kuli dayung kilin Petrus guluꞌ deꞌ bingon opui inoh, yoh moꞌ nakit-e ningaꞌ Petrus daang-e lasuꞌ nang in-e, “Nyaꞌa itih tuong ogiꞌ geh duoh Yesus ti-e neh!”

verses.text: He denied Jesus, saying, “Woman, I don’t know him.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus lasuꞌ nang, “Doiꞌ leh! Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ piluh nyaꞌa inoh neh!”

verses.text: After a little while someone else saw him, and said, “You also are one of them!” But Peter answered, “Man, I am not!”
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ-e tui mokuaꞌ inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon lagiꞌ ningaꞌ Petrus yomoꞌ nang, “Muꞌu tuang lika bitunaꞌ-tunaꞌ geh duoh Nyaꞌa inoh!” Pak-e petrus nyawot nang, “Doiꞌ leh, idoh diꞌ-e okuꞌ neh!”

verses.text: After about one hour passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Truly this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!”
verses.source_translation: Kila-e niꞌ jam mokuaꞌ inoh, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon lagi nokan sina-e, “Nyaꞌa inoh bih bonal pinunaꞌ Yesus, sobab yoh tuong nyaꞌa soꞌ Galilea geh!”

verses.text: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus moꞌ nyawot nang, “Oni bih deꞌ nang muꞌ neh, doiꞌ kuꞌ ngiloti-e!” Daang Petrus aluaꞌ sina siuak moꞌ bitadu.

verses.text: The Lord turned, and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord’s word, how he said to him, “Before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ kumiat ningaꞌ Petrus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ natong sina Topaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e, “Aluaꞌ diꞌ siuak bitadu onu tih, ogiꞌ taluh sidoh muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ ngakuꞌ Okuꞌ neh.”

verses.text: He went out, and wept bitterly.
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ lasuꞌ luah soꞌ kanoꞌ daang-e siꞌien ngilasod.

verses.text: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Yesus moꞌ ngatiaꞌ kaso Yesus simadi nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ biposud bipupuꞌ duoh-E.

verses.text: Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nutu boton-e pakai kain yomoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-E, “Suba tanon, puꞌan Muꞌ kedoh keh nyaꞌa deꞌ mupuꞌ mosut Muꞌu?”

verses.text: They spoke many other things against him, insulting him.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ masam-masam geh in-e nguyat Yesus.

verses.text: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people were gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying,
verses.source_translation: Sipagi-e, pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi bikuluk, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus keꞌ Pengadilan Agama-e.

verses.text: “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you won’t believe,
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih, podo muꞌu tih Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Daang kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan tuang idoh geh ingan bisayaꞌ-e.

verses.text: and if I ask, you will in no way answer me or let me go.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ nyam Kuꞌ sikian tuduꞌ ingan tuang idoh geh diꞌ ingan laꞌan nyawot-e.

verses.text: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e soꞌ adin, Onak Manusia yaꞌ guluꞌ nuwaꞌ toꞌuh sinok Topaꞌ deꞌ Paling Bikuasa-E.”

verses.text: They all said, “Are you then the Son of God?” He said to them, “You say it, because I am.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Moꞌ nyam-e in noh, muꞌu itih Onak Topaꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Odop ingan deꞌ nang in inoh neh.”

verses.text: They said, “Why do we need any more witness? For we ourselves have heard from his own mouth!”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang, “Idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ otoꞌ pilelu bukti, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ ngojit lasuꞌ soꞌ bobaꞌ Odop-E.”

chapters.text: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching. The chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death, for they feared the people. Satan entered into Judas, who was also called Iscariot, who was counted with the twelve. He went away, and talked with the chief priests and captains about how he might deliver him to them. They were glad, and agreed to give him money. He consented, and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them in the absence of the multitude. The day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed. Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.” They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare?” He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.   Tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’   He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.” They went, found things as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover. When the hour had come, he sat down with the twelve apostles. He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer,   for I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in God’s Kingdom.” He received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said, “Take this, and share it among yourselves,   for I tell you, I will not drink at all again from the fruit of the vine, until God’s Kingdom comes.” He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke, and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.” Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.   But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.   The Son of Man indeed goes, as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!” They began to question among themselves, which of them it was who would do this thing. There arose also a contention among them, which of them was considered to be greatest. He said to them, “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’   But not so with you. But one who is the greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.   For who is greater, one who sits at the table, or one who serves? Isn’t it he who sits at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.   But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.   I confer on you a kingdom, even as my Father conferred on me,   that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.” The Lord said, “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have all of you, that he might sift you as wheat,   but I prayed for you, that your faith wouldn’t fail. You, when once you have turned again, establish your brothers.” He said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!” He said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.” He said to them, “When I sent you out without purse, and wallet, and shoes, did you lack anything?” They said, “Nothing.” Then he said to them, “But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.   For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ For that which concerns me has an end.” They said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.” He came out, and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him. When he was at the place, he said to them, “Pray that you don’t enter into temptation.” He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s throw, and he knelt down and prayed, saying, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.” An angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him. Being in agony he prayed more earnestly. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground. When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples, and found them sleeping because of grief, and said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.” While he was still speaking, behold, a multitude, and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him. But Jesus said to him, “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?” When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?” A certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear. But Jesus answered, “Let me at least do this”—and he touched his ear, and healed him. Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and elders, who had come against him, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?   When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn’t stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”  They seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed from a distance. When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and had sat down together, Peter sat among them. A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said, “This man also was with him.” He denied Jesus, saying, “Woman, I don’t know him.” After a little while someone else saw him, and said, “You also are one of them!” But Peter answered, “Man, I am not!” After about one hour passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Truly this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!” But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed. The Lord turned, and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord’s word, how he said to him, “Before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.” He went out, and wept bitterly. The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him. Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?” They spoke many other things against him, insulting him. As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people were gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying, “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you won’t believe,   and if I ask, you will in no way answer me or let me go.   From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.” They all said, “Are you then the Son of God?” He said to them, “You say it, because I am.” They said, “Why do we need any more witness? For we ourselves have heard from his own mouth!”

verses.text: The whole company of them rose up and brought him before Pilate.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Pengadilan Agama inoh mokat mujuag, yoh moꞌ toban Yesus tuduꞌ Pilatus.

verses.text: They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ susuaꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ napo Yesus, odop deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Koꞌih dapod Nyaꞌa tih lawan kerajaan Roma, Iyoh tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bangsa koꞌih, saꞌ-e jaman bayal suke tuduꞌ Kaisar duoh Yoh nang odop-e Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ, Laja ulang Yahudi.”

verses.text: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered him, “So you say.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Podo bonal muꞌu Laja ulang Yahudi?” Yesus nyawot-e, “Odop ingan deꞌ nang in noh.”

verses.text: Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duoh suaꞌ odop deꞌ munoꞌ, “Doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod oni salah nyaꞌa tih ngan kuꞌ ponai yaꞌ ngukum-e.”

verses.text: But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitokan paksa Pilatus lagiꞌ, “Pak-e soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e, yoh ngasut susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Yudea; sibungas-e deꞌ Galilea, yoh moꞌ adin moꞌ nog katiꞌ.”

verses.text: But when Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked if the man was a Galilean.
verses.source_translation: Takal Pilatus ngojit-e, yoh moꞌ sikian-e, “Podo nyaꞌa itih ulang Galilea?”

verses.text: When he found out that he was in Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.
verses.source_translation: Takal yoh puꞌan nang Yesus soꞌ pulow deꞌ mipin Herodes, Pilatus moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ toban tuduꞌ Herodes, deꞌ takal noh boot-boot-e Herodes ogiꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem.

verses.text: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad, for he had wanted to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle done by him.
verses.source_translation: Herodes sonang otin-e takal-e kilin Yesus, sobab yoh moꞌ tui ngojit gah Yesus duoh yaꞌ ningaꞌ mun-e.  Yoh bialap yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus nai mukjizat.

verses.text: He questioned him with many words, but he gave no answers.
verses.source_translation: Sobab inoh Herodes sikian bogoꞌ tuduꞌ-E, pak-e Yesus doiꞌ manah nyawot sina-e.

verses.text: The chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh gulu-gulu agama Yahudi masam-masam in-e napo Yesus.

verses.text: Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate.
verses.source_translation: Herodes duoh sidadu-sidadu-e moꞌ ngunyak duoh nguyat Yesus, yomoꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-e sok jubah-e tuduꞌ Yesus, jubah deꞌ tok-tok mun sangon-e, mokuaꞌ inoh Herodes moꞌ daꞌ sidadu-e paliꞌ toban Yesus tuduꞌ Pilatus.

verses.text: Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before that they were enemies with each other.
verses.source_translation: Daang onu inoh geh Herodes duoh Pilatus paliꞌ bidingan, deꞌ dioꞌ-e odop-e duwoh bitomi.

verses.text: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ nguluk pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh, pimipin-pimipin Yahudi, duoh nyaꞌa bogoꞌ.

verses.text: and said to them, “You brought this man to me as one that perverts the people, and behold, having examined him before you, I found no basis for a charge against this man concerning those things of which you accuse him.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan toban nyaꞌa itih tuduꞌ okuꞌ duoh napo nyaꞌa tih nang yoh ngasut rakyat.  Adin deꞌ sulung jowin ingan, okuꞌ moꞌ sikian Iyoh, pak-e doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod salah-e kodaꞌ deꞌ napo ingan tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and see, nothing worthy of death has been done by him.
verses.source_translation: Herodes tuong doiꞌ geh dapod salah nyaꞌa itih, sobab inoh iyoh paliꞌ Yesus tuduꞌ otoꞌ datiꞌ.  Niꞌ doiꞌ geh soꞌ salah deꞌ nai Yesus deꞌ patut odaꞌ Yoh obuah ukum kobos.

verses.text: I will therefore chastise him and release him.”
verses.source_translation: Sobab inohleh okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mosut pijolaꞌ-e mokuaꞌ inoh pilopas-e.”

verses.text: Now he had to release one prisoner to them at the feast.
verses.source_translation: Sobab bilang Onu Paskah, Pilatus halus pilopas niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ,

verses.text: But they all cried out together, saying, “Away with this man! Release to us Barabbas!”—
verses.source_translation: pak-e susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bikuluk danoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Ngabos nyaꞌa inoh! Pilopas Barabas kaꞌan koꞌih!”

verses.text: one who was thrown into prison for a certain revolt in the city, and for murder.
verses.source_translation: (Barabas obuah jel luban-e yoh ngijaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Yerusalem lawan plitah Roma duoh ngabos nyaꞌa.)

verses.text: Then Pilate spoke to them again, wanting to release Jesus,
verses.source_translation: Pilatus yaꞌ pilopas Yesus, sobab inoh iyoh sina lagiꞌ dolas-dolas-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: but they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify him!”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e makin dolas geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ nang bogan-e, “Nyalip yoh noh! Nyalip yoh Noh!”

verses.text: He said to them the third time, “Why? What evil has this man done? I have found no capital crime in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ saꞌan ketaluh sidoh-e Pilatus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pak-e oni salah deꞌ nai nyaꞌa itih? Doiꞌ kuꞌ dapod oni-oni salah deꞌ yaꞌ patut nyeꞌ odaꞌ Yoh obuah ukum ngabos! Sobab inohleh okuꞌ yaꞌ mosut pijolaꞌ-E, yoh moꞌ pilopas-e.”

verses.text: But they were urgent with loud voices, asking that he might be crucified. Their voices and the voices of the chief priests prevailed.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ makin dolas nang bogan-e odaꞌ Yesus obuah nyalip.  Nyuang-nyuang Pilatus nunaꞌ sijaꞌ sina nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Pilate decreed that what they asked for should be done.
verses.source_translation: Lasuꞌ Pilatus ngin hukum ngabos deꞌ Yesus nunaꞌ oni in deꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: He released him who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, for whom they asked, but he delivered Jesus up to their will.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ pilopas Barabas kodaꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, deꞌ obuah jel sobab bogoꞌ salah-e duoh ngabos nyaꞌa.  Pilatus moꞌ ngin Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daꞌ nai siwat-simun deꞌ laꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: When they led him away, they grabbed one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to carry it after Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban Yesus.  Daang pimonu-e, bidapod duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Simon soꞌ Kirene, deꞌ tuong-e yaꞌ molot keꞌ kota.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ gan salip noh deꞌ tun papi-e, odaꞌ yoh golong-e salip inoh gati Yesus.

verses.text: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ponu nunaꞌ Yesus, soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan dayung deꞌ siꞌien masiꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: But Jesus, turning to them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, don’t weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ kumiat Yoh moꞌ sina, “Ingan dayung-dayung Yerusalem! Maꞌ ngan siꞌien saꞌan Okuꞌ.  Siꞌien leh saꞌan odop ingan duoh onak opot ingan.

verses.text: For behold, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’
verses.source_translation: Sobab yaꞌ nog onu-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ nang, ‘Utung manah dayung deꞌ manang deꞌ doiꞌ onu-e ogiꞌ onak-e duoh siduaꞌ onak-e!’

verses.text: Then they will begin to tell the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and tell the hills, ‘Cover us.’
verses.source_translation: Sobab susah jolaꞌ deꞌ sikiya mun-e deꞌ pulow inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ dolod duoh punguꞌ, ‘Patuab mey nyonug leh koꞌih!’

verses.text: For if they do these things in the green tree, what will be done in the dry?”
verses.source_translation: Sobab nyam adin nyaꞌa ponai nai wat itih tuduꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ idip, nyaꞌa yaꞌ nai lobih lagiꞌ soꞌ itih tuduꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ kobos.”

verses.text: There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh duwoh naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ toban odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah ukum ngabos bibaya duoh Yesus.

verses.text: When they came to the place that is called The Skull, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ nog tanaꞌ deꞌ adon-e Tikuluok, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyalip Yesus bisamah duoh ulang jaꞌat deꞌ duwoh noh, niꞌ naꞌan nuwaꞌ boit-E, deꞌ niꞌ naꞌan kawa toꞌuh-e.

verses.text: Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.” Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ lasuꞌ bidoa, “Samaꞌ, ngapunleh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ! Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ diꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e.” Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ ngundi ngan-e yaꞌ kutung bojuh Yesus.

verses.text: The people stood watching. The rulers with them also scoffed at him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadin danoꞌ.  Pak-e ayua pimipin agama Yahudi sina ngine Yesus in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon Yoh nyilamat-e: tanah saꞌ-e nyilamat odop-e, nyam yoh inoh tok Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,
verses.source_translation: Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ ngatiaꞌ ngine Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog ngin angul deꞌ masuam tuduꞌ-E

verses.text: and saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.source_translation: simadi-e sina, “Moꞌ nyam Ingan tok Laja ulang Yahudi, nyilamat leh odop Ingan!”

verses.text: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ bung bak Yesus, ogiꞌ tulis deꞌ in-e: “Itihleh Laja ulang Yahudi.”

verses.text: One of the criminals who was hanged insulted him, saying, “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ obuah salip bisamah duoh Yesus, ngine Yesus.  Yoh sina in-e, “Nyam Muꞌu Laja Pinyilamat, nyilamat leh odop Muꞌ duoh koꞌih!”

verses.text: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, “Don’t you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?
verses.source_translation: Pak-e niꞌ naꞌan ulang jaꞌat deꞌ nuwaꞌ kawa-e ngalah dingan-e, in-e, “Maꞌ nang inoh! Sipatut-e muꞌu tolu tuduꞌ Topaꞌ sobab muꞌu ulang jaꞌat tilimaꞌ ukum deꞌ samah duoh Iyoh.

verses.text: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward for our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.source_translation: Otoꞌ duwoh tih deꞌ patut obuah ngukum odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai toꞌ, pak-e Yoh diꞌ-e patut obuah ukum sobab Yoh doiꞌ salah-E.”

verses.text: He said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ nyamung sina-e, “Yesus, natongleh okuꞌ, takal Ingan nog jadin Laja!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Assuredly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu: Soꞌ onu itih muꞌu moꞌ bisamah-samah duoh Okuꞌ deꞌ sulga.”

verses.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.
verses.source_translation: Kila-kila pukul simoong duwoh uun onu, susuaꞌ pulow inoh bilubah jadi mopung kodaꞌ onu ngalom nog pukul taluh ngumi.

verses.text: The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two.
verses.source_translation: Duoh tabial deꞌ daang Boli Topaꞌ totak tipiliaꞌ duwoh.

verses.text: Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” Having said this, he breathed his last.
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ Yesus nang sina deꞌ dolas-E, “Samaꞌ! Keꞌ daang tongan Ingan, Kuꞌ ngin asongKuꞌ!” Mokuaꞌ Yoh nang sina inoh, Yoh lasuꞌ kobos.

verses.text: When the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, “Certainly this was a righteous man.”
verses.source_translation: Takal pimipin sidadu noh ningaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ, jadi iyoh moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.  Yoh moꞌ sina, “Bonal, nyaꞌa itih tok doiꞌ salah-e!”

verses.text: All the multitudes that came together to see this, when they saw the things that were done, returned home beating their breasts.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ deꞌ nog ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ jadi.  Susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ daang otin deꞌ sukup masiꞌ-e.

verses.text: All his acquaintances, and the women who followed with him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
verses.source_translation: Duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ piluh Yesus, baya dayung-dayung deꞌ nunaꞌ Yoh soꞌ Galilea, ningaꞌ soꞌ juuaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moh jadi.

verses.text: Behold, a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man
(he had not consented to their counsel and deed), from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was also waiting for God’s Kingdom:
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yusuf deꞌ soꞌ kota Arimatea deꞌ propinsi Yudea, iyoh inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh duoh deꞌ aluaꞌ kajon nog onu-e Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja deꞌ dunia.
