Iyoh inoh anggota daang Pengadilan Agama Yahudi, pak-e yoh diꞌ-e situju duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa munoꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: this man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.source_translation: Jadi takal Yesus moꞌ kobos, Yusuf moꞌ bigaut-biguaꞌ odi tuduꞌ Pilatus saꞌan-e mitiaꞌ todang Yesus.

verses.text: He took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was cut in stone, where no one had ever been laid.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh moꞌ pimuun todang Yesus soꞌ koyuh salip, yoh moꞌ molut todang-e kai kain mopuꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh piguling todang Yesus deꞌ kubul deꞌ obuah nai daang dolod batuh.  Kubul inoh aluaꞌ tiboon duoh aluaꞌ doiꞌ manah obuah pakai.

verses.text: It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi daang onu limoh.  Takal gituang-e yaꞌ Onu Sabat.

verses.text: The women, who had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and saw the tomb, and how his body was laid.
verses.source_translation: Dayung-dayung deꞌ nunaꞌ duoh Yesus soꞌ Galilea nunaꞌ Yusuf soꞌ juuaꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ kubul Yesus duoh oniwat Yusuf posan todang Yesus daang kubul.

verses.text: They returned, and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem kaꞌan-e nyidia inyuaꞌ lona kaꞌan nginyuaꞌ todang Yesus.  Daang Onu Sabat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo soꞌ kiloja-e saꞌan-e taat tuduꞌ ukum agama-e.

chapters.text: The whole company of them rose up and brought him before Pilate. They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.” Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered him, “So you say.” Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.” But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.” But when Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked if the man was a Galilean. When he found out that he was in Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days. Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad, for he had wanted to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle done by him. He questioned him with many words, but he gave no answers. The chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him. Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate. Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before that they were enemies with each other. Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people, and said to them, “You brought this man to me as one that perverts the people, and behold, having examined him before you, I found no basis for a charge against this man concerning those things of which you accuse him. Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and see, nothing worthy of death has been done by him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.” Now he had to release one prisoner to them at the feast. But they all cried out together, saying, “Away with this man! Release to us Barabbas!”— one who was thrown into prison for a certain revolt in the city, and for murder. Then Pilate spoke to them again, wanting to release Jesus, but they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify him!” He said to them the third time, “Why? What evil has this man done? I have found no capital crime in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.” But they were urgent with loud voices, asking that he might be crucified. Their voices and the voices of the chief priests prevailed. Pilate decreed that what they asked for should be done. He released him who had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder, for whom they asked, but he delivered Jesus up to their will. When they led him away, they grabbed one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to carry it after Jesus. A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him. But Jesus, turning to them, said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, don’t weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.   For behold, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’   Then they will begin to tell the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and tell the hills, ‘Cover us.’  For if they do these things in the green tree, what will be done in the dry?” There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death. When they came to the place that is called The Skull, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left. Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they don’t know what they are doing.” Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots. The people stood watching. The rulers with them also scoffed at him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen one!” The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar, and saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!” An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.” One of the criminals who was hanged insulted him, saying, “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!” But the other answered, and rebuking him said, “Don’t you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation? And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward for our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.” He said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.” Jesus said to him, “Assuredly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.” It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour. The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two. Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” Having said this, he breathed his last. When the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, “Certainly this was a righteous man.” All the multitudes that came together to see this, when they saw the things that were done, returned home beating their breasts. All his acquaintances, and the women who followed with him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things. Behold, a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man (he had not consented to their counsel and deed), from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who was also waiting for God’s Kingdom: this man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body. He took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was cut in stone, where no one had ever been laid. It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near. The women, who had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and saw the tomb, and how his body was laid. They returned, and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.

verses.text: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.
verses.source_translation: Daang onu Minggu, suom-suom pagi-e dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban inyuaꞌ lona deꞌ moꞌ sidia-e.

verses.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e nog keꞌ kubul inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ batuh deꞌ pakai-e kuab kubul inoh moꞌ tiligian soꞌ lubang kubul.

verses.text: They entered in, and didn’t find the Lord Jesus’ body.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ molot kaang kubul inoh pak-e todang Yesus moꞌ doiꞌ daang-e.

verses.text: While they were greatly perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ mujuag daang-e ilan ningaꞌ oni deꞌ jadi danoꞌ, tang-tang sijaꞌ-e duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bikilap jaꞌ-e pimakai-e mujuag sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Becoming terrified, they bowed their faces down to the earth. They said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ tolu daang-e bikunyug keꞌ tanaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Dusah negeh ingan kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos!

verses.text: He isn’t here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee,
verses.source_translation: Yesus doiꞌ datiꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip! Natong ingan kedoh oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e deꞌ ingan takal-e aluaꞌ deꞌ Galilea?

verses.text: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus nang, ‘Okuꞌ Onak Manusia halus yaꞌ obuah nyelah keꞌ tongan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa duoh Okuꞌ halus obuah nyalip, pak-e Okuꞌ paliꞌ idip baꞌuh lagiꞌ daang onu ke taluh-e.’”

verses.text: They remembered his words,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ natong sina Yesus inoh.

verses.text: returned from the tomb, and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ soꞌ kubul inoh, dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ ke simoong niꞌ naꞌan rasul duoh pinunaꞌ deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles.
verses.source_translation: Dayung-dayung deꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moh ningaꞌ-e inoh iohleh Maria Magdalena, Yohana duoh Maria sinoꞌ Yakobus, baya dayung-dayung deꞌ bokon deꞌ suaꞌ odi duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: These words seemed to them to be nonsense, and they didn’t believe them.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ silita dayung deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pikil nang dayung deꞌ munoꞌ madas nang koyuh adoh.

verses.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus mokat mujuag yoh moꞌ bikoduh keꞌ kubul inoh.  Iyoh ningaꞌ keꞌ daang lubang kubul inoh, jok-e kilin kain deꞌ pakai nyaꞌa molut Yesus deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ.  Petrus moꞌ buꞌu paliꞌ daang-e bipikil, ilan oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Daang onu inoh geh, duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus ponu keꞌ kupuaꞌ Emaus deꞌ sikital simoong niꞌ kilometer soꞌ Yerusalem.

verses.text: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.
verses.source_translation: Daang-e ponu odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh kilakal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi.

verses.text: While they talked and questioned together, Jesus himself came near, and went with them.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh kilakal, Yesus moꞌ nog ponu bibaya duoh-e.

verses.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e kilin Yesus pak-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ daꞌ odop-e duwoh inoh diꞌ-e piluh-e.

verses.text: He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk, and are sad?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e duwoh, “Oni leh deꞌ kilakal ingan neh?” Yomoꞌ soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ tog mun-e loꞌo daang susah otin-e.

verses.text: One of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things which have happened there in these days?”
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh noh adon-e Kleopas, sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Podo jok-e Ingan binua deꞌ Yerusalem, deꞌ diꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi datiꞌ baꞌuh-baꞌuh tih?”

verses.text: He said to them, “What things?” They said to him, “The things concerning Jesus, the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people;
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian, “Oni deꞌ jadi neh?” Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Yesus nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ Nazaret inoh.  Iyoh inoh nabi.  Sina duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e suaꞌ-e bikuasa, paguh duoh bonal deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin bangsa toꞌ nyelah yoh saꞌ-e obuah ngukum ngabos, yomoꞌ nyalip-E.

verses.text: But we were hoping that it was he who would redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e koꞌih bialap nang Iyoh deꞌ yaꞌ pilopas bangsa Israel.  Duoh onu tih iyohleh onu ke taluh-e soꞌ takal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi.

verses.text: Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e kudu-kudu naꞌan-e soꞌ dayung uluk koꞌih ngoꞌgoh koꞌih, Pagia-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul,

verses.text: and when they didn’t find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.
verses.source_translation: pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e dapod todang Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nog yoh moꞌ kilakal oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e tuduꞌ koꞌih nog odop-e bitapod duoh malaikat.  Malaikat inoh tanon nang Yesus idip.

verses.text: Some of us went to the tomb, and found it just like the women had said, but they didn’t see him.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh kudu-kudu naꞌan dingan koꞌih moꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ nang suaꞌ oniꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon dayung deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e Yesus doiꞌ yoh kilin-e neh.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tok budua ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ neh! Sikiya lamat ingan yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon nabi-nabi!

verses.text: Didn’t the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter into his glory?”
verses.source_translation: Laja Pinyilamat halus susah jolaꞌ dioꞌ ke Yoh obuah pakat jadin Laja deꞌ tun suaꞌ oniꞌ.”

verses.text: Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang susuaꞌ Kitab tentang odop-E, soꞌ takal buk-buk Musa duoh buk nabi-nabi.

verses.text: They came near to the village, where they were going, and he acted like he would go further.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog keꞌ kupuaꞌ Emaus.  Yesus singaji-e mun nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ pilasuꞌ pimonu-e.

verses.text: They urged him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.” He went in to stay with them.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh odaꞌ Yesus loꞌo duoh odop-e, in-e, “Loꞌo negeh duoh koꞌih sobab onu tuong moꞌ ngalom geh.” Yomoꞌ Yesus moꞌ molot nglumon duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: When he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave it to them.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ guluꞌ man, Yesus moꞌ mit kueh deꞌ ayuh kiping-e yomoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh Yoh piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ kueh inoh kaꞌan-e ngin tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngoon-e nang inoh Yesus, pak-e Yesus moꞌ musuap soꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: They said to one another, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us, while he spoke to us along the way, and while he opened the Scriptures to us?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ duwoh noh moꞌ lasuꞌ nang, “Takal Iyoh sina simadi-e tanon isiꞌ Kitab tuduꞌ koꞌih deꞌ olan, otin koꞌih kan-e sukup nyam sonang-e.”

verses.text: They rose up that very hour, returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them,
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh lasuꞌ mokat piet odop-e paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem.  Danoꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh dapod pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ simoong niꞌ naꞌan inoh moꞌ tikuluꞌ duoh dingan-dingan-e deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”
verses.source_translation: Yomoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus tanon tuduꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa inoh ti-e, “Yesus tok moꞌ paliꞌ idip.  Iyoh bitanga odop-e tuduꞌ Simon.”

verses.text: They related the things that happened along the way, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ tuang-e nog noh moꞌ lasuꞌ silita oni deꞌ jadi deꞌ odop-e daang olan-e takal yaꞌ odi keꞌ kota Emaus duoh watki wat-e paliꞌ piluh Yesus, takal Yesus piliaꞌ kueh.

verses.text: As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them, “Peace be to you.”
verses.source_translation: Daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ kilakal, tang-tang jaꞌ-e Yesus mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ simadi-e nang, “Sonangleh ingan!”

verses.text: But they were terrified and filled with fear, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ gogoh duoh tolu, baꞌ-e nang inoh munua.

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni ingan diꞌ bisayaꞌ daang otin ingan? Oni deꞌ soꞌ ingan tolu?

verses.text: See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn’t have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.”
verses.source_translation: Ningaꞌ tongan duoh poꞌon Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ leh itih! Tomaꞌ duoh ningaꞌ nyeꞌ, munua doiꞌ tulang duoh isin-e kodaꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan deꞌ Okuꞌ tih.”

verses.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina inoh simadi-E bitanga tongan duoh poꞌon-E tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: While they still didn’t believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ, sobab sikiya munuas duoh ilan, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod bisayaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Podo ogiꞌ pinguman ingan?”

verses.text: They gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin niꞌ polong ikian deꞌ moꞌ masak-e tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: He took them, and ate in front of them.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mit ikian inoh yomoꞌ lasuꞌ man-e deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: He said to them, “This is what I told you, while I was still with you, that all things which are written in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me must be fulfilled.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Itihleh deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ deꞌ ingan takal Kuꞌ aluaꞌ duoh ingan.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis tentang Okuꞌ daang buk-buk deꞌ nulis Musa duoh buk nabi-nabi, duoh Mazmur halus jadi.”

verses.text: Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ tulung odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e ngiloti Kitab.

verses.text: He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,
verses.source_translation: Iyoh sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Daang Kitab moꞌ obuaꞌ nulis nang, Laja deꞌ janyi Topaꞌ inoh halus susah jolaꞌ duoh yaꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-e daang onu ke taluh.

verses.text: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Duoh deꞌ daang adon Laja Pinyilamat inoh, ingan yaꞌ tanon gah silamat tuduꞌ susuaꞌ bangsa mulai soꞌ Yerusalem nang nyam basa nyaꞌa bitobat Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e.

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.source_translation: Ingan deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi deꞌ munoꞌ, ingan geh deꞌ halus tanon gah inoh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: Behold, I send out the promise of my Father on you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ geh yaꞌ pait tuduꞌ ingan oni deꞌ moꞌ janyi Topaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Pak-e ingan halus kajon deꞌ kota itih nog kuasa deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ muun tun ingan.”

verses.text: He led them out as far as Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus toban odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ keꞌ sopaꞌ kota Yerusalem keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania.  Danoꞌ iyoh moꞌ kakat tongan-e yomoꞌ bilokat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: While he blessed them, he withdrew from them, and was carried up into heaven.
verses.source_translation: Daang-E aluaꞌ bilokat odop-e munoꞌ, Yoh moꞌ tipakat-tilununk keꞌ sulga yomoꞌ bipisah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: They worshiped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy,
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikunyug nyomah Yoh, yomoꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem daang otin deꞌ sonang manah-manah-e,

verses.text: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.source_translation: duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ silalu mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.     GAH DEꞌ PAGUH DEꞌ TANON YOHANES

chapters.text: But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared. They found the stone rolled away from the tomb. They entered in, and didn’t find the Lord Jesus’ body. While they were greatly perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing. Becoming terrified, they bowed their faces down to the earth. They said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead? He isn’t here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee, saying that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?” They remembered his words, returned from the tomb, and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest. Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles. These words seemed to them to be nonsense, and they didn’t believe them. But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened. Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem. They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened. While they talked and questioned together, Jesus himself came near, and went with them. But their eyes were kept from recognizing him. He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk, and are sad?” One of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things which have happened there in these days?” He said to them, “What things?” They said to him, “The things concerning Jesus, the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people; and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him. But we were hoping that it was he who would redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened. Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb; and when they didn’t find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive. Some of us went to the tomb, and found it just like the women had said, but they didn’t see him.” He said to them, “Foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!   Didn’t the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter into his glory?” Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself. They came near to the village, where they were going, and he acted like he would go further. They urged him, saying, “Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.” He went in to stay with them. When he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave it to them. Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight. They said to one another, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us, while he spoke to us along the way, and while he opened the Scriptures to us?” They rose up that very hour, returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them, saying, “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!” They related the things that happened along the way, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread. As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them, “Peace be to you.” But they were terrified and filled with fear, and supposed that they had seen a spirit. He said to them, “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?   See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn’t have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.” When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet. While they still didn’t believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?” They gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb. He took them, and ate in front of them. He said to them, “This is what I told you, while I was still with you, that all things which are written in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me must be fulfilled.” Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures. He said to them, “Thus it is written, and thus it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day,   and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.   You are witnesses of these things.   Behold, I send out the promise of my Father on you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”  He led them out as far as Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them. While he blessed them, he withdrew from them, and was carried up into heaven. They worshiped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy, and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.

verses.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.source_translation: Takal dunia aluaꞌ doiꞌ, Pingunang Topaꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ ogiꞌ.  Pingunang Topaꞌ samah-samah duoh Topaꞌ, Pingunang inoh odop Topaꞌ.

verses.text: The same was in the beginning with God.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ sibungas-e Pingunang inoh samah-samah duoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: All things were made through him. Without him was not anything made that has been made.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang inoh leh deꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ odaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh moꞌ-e doiꞌ Pingunang inoh, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dunia itih deꞌ obuah nai.

verses.text: In him was life, and the life was the light of men.
verses.source_translation: Daang Pingunang inoh ogiꞌ idip, idip inoh leh deꞌ ngin jawaꞌ tuduꞌ manusia.

verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn’t overcome  it.
verses.source_translation: Telang inoh jawaꞌ daang mopung, oniꞌ deꞌ mopung diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai mulaꞌ jawaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait Topaꞌ deꞌ adon-e Yohanes, iyoh inoh tukang baptis nyaꞌa.

verses.text: The same came as a witness, that he might testify about the light, that all might believe through him.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nog jadin tukang tanon, iyoh tanon tentang jawaꞌ inoh, saꞌ soꞌ iyoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa jadin bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ jawaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: He was not the light, but was sent that he might testify about the light.
verses.source_translation: Odop iyoh inoh idoh diꞌ-e jawaꞌ inoh, iyoh jok-e tukang magah tentang jawaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: The true light that enlightens everyone was coming into the world.
verses.source_translation: Jawaꞌ deꞌ sibonal-e deꞌ ngin jawaꞌ tuduꞌ manusia, adin nog kaang dunia.

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn’t recognize him.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang inoh moꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia duoh Iyoh deꞌ nai dunia, pak-e dunia diꞌ-e piluh-E.

verses.text: He came to his own, and those who were his own didn’t receive him.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nog tuduꞌ bangsa odop-E, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ niꞌ bangsa duoh-E doliaꞌ-e tilimaꞌ-E.

verses.text: But as many as received him, to them he gave the right to become God’s children, to those who believe in his name:
verses.source_translation: Pak-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ Iyoh, Iyoh ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-e, saꞌ-e jadin onak-onak Topaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin onak-onak Topaꞌ iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ daang adon-E.

verses.text: who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa dapod jadin onak-onak Topaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e ngan iyoh obuah bilanak soꞌ sinoꞌ-e, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop manusia, idoh geh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ daang pikil manusia, pak-e odop Topaꞌ sadiꞌ-E deꞌ odaꞌ yoh jadin onak-onak-E.

verses.text: The Word became flesh, and lived among us. We saw his glory, such glory as of the one and only Son of the Father, full of grace and truth.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang inoh moꞌ obuah milaꞌ jadin manusia duoh moꞌ loꞌo daang uluk otoꞌ.  Otoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ kuasa-E deꞌ ayuh.  Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ ngin kuasa-E deꞌ ayuh inoh tuduꞌ-E dop-e Iyoh inoh Onak Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ Jok-e Niꞌ.  Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ Paguh duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ ogiꞌ daang idip Iyoh.

verses.text: John testified about him. He cried out, saying, “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me, for he was before me.’”
verses.source_translation: Yohanes Pembaptis moꞌ silita tentang Iyoh, in-e daang-e luꞌow-luꞌow-e, “Itih leh odop-E deꞌ nang kuꞌ: Mokuaꞌ okuꞌ, ke Iyoh nog, pak-e Iyoh lobih penting soꞌ okuꞌ, dop-e takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ bilasa ogiꞌ.”

verses.text: From his fullness we all received grace upon grace.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Otin-E deꞌ sukup Paguh, Iyoh diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ bilokat otoꞌ.

verses.text: For the law was given through Moses. Grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ ngin atulan-atulan-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ pakai nabi Musa.  Pak-e Topaꞌ ngin bilokat duoh oniꞌ deꞌ bonal pakai Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: No one has seen God at any time. The one and only Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared him.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e kilin Topaꞌ.  Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e niꞌ, odop-E inoh sadiꞌ-E Topaꞌ duoh silalu ogiꞌ deꞌ otin Topaꞌ Samaꞌ.  Jok-e Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ bitanga Topaꞌ Samaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ.

verses.text: This is John’s testimony, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
verses.source_translation: Itih leh in silita Yohanes pembaptis takal ulang Yahudi soꞌ Yerusalem pait kudu-kudu naꞌan pimipin agama duoh ulang-ulang Lewi nog sikian tuduꞌ odop-e, “Osi sibonal-e ingan itih?”

verses.text: He declared, and didn’t deny, but he declared, “I am not the Christ.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh ngakuꞌ-e duoh diꞌ-e pibulaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ idoh diꞌ-e Laja Pinyilamat.”

verses.text: They asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the prophet?” He answered, “No.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Moꞌ-e wat inoh, osi mey ingan tih neh? Podo ingan tih Elia?” Yohanes moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Idoh!” “Podo ingan Nabi deꞌ kajon koꞌih inoh?” Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Idoh!”

verses.text: They said therefore to him, “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yohanes, “Osi mey ingan itih neh? Dop-e koꞌih halus tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait koꞌih, oni in sawot deꞌ tanon ingan.  Oni mey in ingan nang odop ingan?”

verses.text: He said, “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.”
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon Nabi Yesaya deꞌ nang-e: ‘Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ luꞌow-luꞌow sina deꞌ padang pasil: Nongon leh olan saꞌan Topaꞌ!’ ”

verses.text: The ones who had been sent were from the Pharisees.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ obuah pait inoh ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi.

verses.text: They asked him, “Why then do you baptize, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Oni nai ingan baptis nyaꞌa, moꞌ diꞌ ingan Laja Pinyilamat, diꞌ-e Elia, duoh diꞌ-e Nabi deꞌ yaꞌ nog?”

verses.text: John answered them, “I baptize in water, but among you stands one whom you don’t know.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ baptis nyaꞌa pakai piꞌin; pak-e deꞌ uun ingan, ogiꞌ Iyoh deꞌ mujuag deꞌ diꞌ ingan piluh osi Iyoh sibonal-e,

verses.text: He is the one who comes after me, who is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I’m not worthy to loosen.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nog mokuaꞌ okuꞌ.  Bukaꞌ tolin kasut-E tuang doiꞌ geh nyam kuꞌ patut.”

verses.text: These things were done in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi deꞌ kota Betania, deꞌ polad sungi Yordan, topat soꞌ Yohanes baptis nyaꞌa.

verses.text: The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ pagi-e, Yohanes Pembaptis ningaꞌ Yesus nog tuduꞌ odop-e.  Yohanes moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ leh Onak Domba Topaꞌ deꞌ ngisuꞌ dosa dunia.

verses.text: This is he of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is preferred before me, for he was before me.’
verses.source_translation: Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ nang kuꞌ: Mokuaꞌ soꞌ okuꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ lobih penting soꞌ okuꞌ, dop-e Iyoh moꞌ bilasa ogiꞌ takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ.

verses.text: I didn’t know him, but for this reason I came baptizing in water: that he would be revealed to Israel.”
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan tentang Iyoh inoh, pak-e adin okuꞌ moꞌ puꞌan-e.  Yoh leh ngan okuꞌ nog duoh baptis nyaꞌa pakai piꞌin, saꞌ bangsa Israel piluh Iyoh.”

verses.text: John testified, saying, “I have seen the Spirit descending like a dove out of heaven, and it remained on him.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ silita nang in-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ muun soꞌ longit kodaꞌ manuk asang, yohmoꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ inoh loꞌo daꞌ-E.

verses.text: I didn’t recognize him, but he who sent me to baptize in water, he said to me, ‘On whomever you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh okuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan tentang osi odop-E, pak-e Topaꞌ deꞌ pait okuꞌ odaꞌ baptis pakai piꞌin, in-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ: ‘Moꞌ muꞌ ningaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ muun deꞌ tun Nyaꞌa inoh, Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ baptis nyaꞌa pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.’

verses.text: I have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.”
verses.source_translation: Odop kuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh, okuꞌ moꞌ tanon nang: Iyoh itih leh Onak Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Again, the next day, John was standing with two of his disciples,
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ pagi-e Yohanes Pembaptis odi lagiꞌ keꞌ topat inoh samah-samah duoh pinunaꞌ-e duwoh naꞌan.

verses.text: and he looked at Jesus as he walked, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yohanes ningaꞌ Yesus ngilusuꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ! Inoh leh Onak Domba Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yohanes ngojit oni deꞌ nang-e inoh, yoh moꞌ odi nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus turned, and saw them following, and said to them, “What are you looking for?” They said to him, “Rabbi” (which is to say, being interpreted, Teacher), “where are you staying?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ kumiat keꞌ dug-E.  Iyoh ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Oni nai ingan nunaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Rabi (loti-e: Gulu), daki soꞌ Ingan loꞌo?”

verses.text: He said to them, “Come, and see.” They came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. It was about the tenth hour.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, saꞌ ingan ningaꞌ-e.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus duoh ningaꞌ daki soꞌ-E loꞌo.  Takal inoh kila-kila aluaꞌ pukul pat ngumi.  Onu inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo duoh Yesus.

verses.text: One of the two who heard John, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ ngojit sina Yohanes yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus yoh inoh Andreas, sudiꞌ Simon Petrus.

verses.text: He first found his own brother, Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is, being interpreted, Christ).
verses.source_translation: Likas-likas Andreas kalik Simon, sikiaꞌ-e inoh, iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Simon, “Koꞌih moꞌ bitapod duoh Mesias!” (Mesias deꞌ nang-e geh Kristus, loti-e Laja Pinyilamat.)

verses.text: He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him, and said, “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas” (which is by interpretation, Peter).
verses.source_translation: Andreas moꞌ toban Simon tuduꞌ Yesus.  Yesus moꞌ ngiduang-e, Iyoh moꞌ sina, “Muꞌu Simon, onak Yohanes (Idoh diꞌ-e Yohanes Pembaptis), muꞌu yaꞌ adon Kefas.” (Kefas deꞌ nang-e geh Petrus, loti-e ‘dolod batuh’.)

verses.text: On the next day, he was determined to go out into Galilee, and he found Philip. Jesus said to him, “Follow me.”
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, Yesus motod nang odop-E odi keꞌ Galilea.  Iyoh bitapod duoh Filipus yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ!”

verses.text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.
verses.source_translation: Filipus, nyaꞌa soꞌ Betsaida, kota soꞌ Andreas duoh Petrus loꞌo.

verses.text: Philip found Nathanael, and said to him, “We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
verses.source_translation: Filipus bitapod duoh Natanael, iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Koꞌih moꞌ bitapod duoh Iyoh deꞌ sobot Musa daang Buk-e deꞌ nulis-e duoh deꞌ tanon bala nabi.  Iyoh inoh Yesus soꞌ Nazaret, onak Yusuf.”

verses.text: Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Natanael moꞌ in-e, “Diꞌ patut ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh nog soꞌ Nazaret!”

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said about him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!”
verses.source_translation: “Jaꞌ leh toꞌ ningaꞌ-E.” In Filipus.  Takal Yesus ningaꞌ Natanael nog tuduꞌ odop-E.  Yesus moꞌ sobot tentang Natanael in-E, “Ningaꞌ itih leh nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal-bonal ulang Israel, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ palsu daꞌ-e.”

verses.text: Nathanael said to him, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
verses.source_translation: Natanael moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Wat ki Ingan ponai puꞌan okuꞌ?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Takal Filipus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e mogan muꞌu, Okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ muꞌu deꞌ libuaꞌ tongon ara.”

verses.text: Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are King of Israel!”
verses.source_translation: Natanael moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Gulu, Ingan Onak Topaꞌ, Ingan Laja ulang Israel!”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Because I told you, ‘I saw you underneath the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these!”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Dop-e Okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ muꞌu, Okuꞌ ningaꞌ muꞌu deꞌ libuaꞌ tongon ara, podo inoh deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu bisayaꞌ? Muꞌu yaꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ inoh.”

verses.text: He said to him, “Most certainly, I tell you all, hereafter you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu bonal-bonal, muꞌu yaꞌ ningaꞌ longit tibukaꞌ duoh malaikat-malaikat Topaꞌ maꞌad muun tuduꞌ Onak Manusia.”

chapters.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. The same was in the beginning with God. All things were made through him. Without him was not anything made that has been made. In him was life, and the life was the light of men. The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness hasn’t overcome  it. There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John. The same came as a witness, that he might testify about the light, that all might believe through him. He was not the light, but was sent that he might testify about the light. The true light that enlightens everyone was coming into the world. He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn’t recognize him. He came to his own, and those who were his own didn’t receive him. But as many as received him, to them he gave the right to become God’s children, to those who believe in his name: who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God. The Word became flesh, and lived among us. We saw his glory, such glory as of the one and only Son of the Father, full of grace and truth. John testified about him. He cried out, saying, “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me, for he was before me.’” From his fullness we all received grace upon grace. For the law was given through Moses. Grace and truth were realized through Jesus Christ. No one has seen God at any time. The one and only Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared him. This is John’s testimony, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?” He declared, and didn’t deny, but he declared, “I am not the Christ.” They asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the prophet?” He answered, “No.” They said therefore to him, “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?” He said, “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as Isaiah the prophet said.” The ones who had been sent were from the Pharisees. They asked him, “Why then do you baptize, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?” John answered them, “I baptize in water, but among you stands one whom you don’t know. He is the one who comes after me, who is preferred before me, whose sandal strap I’m not worthy to loosen.” These things were done in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing. The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world! This is he of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is preferred before me, for he was before me.’ I didn’t know him, but for this reason I came baptizing in water: that he would be revealed to Israel.” John testified, saying, “I have seen the Spirit descending like a dove out of heaven, and it remained on him. I didn’t recognize him, but he who sent me to baptize in water, he said to me, ‘On whomever you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’ I have seen, and have testified that this is the Son of God.” Again, the next day, John was standing with two of his disciples, and he looked at Jesus as he walked, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!” The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus. Jesus turned, and saw them following, and said to them, “What are you looking for?” They said to him, “Rabbi” (which is to say, being interpreted, Teacher), “where are you staying?” He said to them, “Come, and see.” They came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. It was about the tenth hour. One of the two who heard John, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother. He first found his own brother, Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is, being interpreted, Christ). He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him, and said, “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Cephas” (which is by interpretation, Peter). On the next day, he was determined to go out into Galilee, and he found Philip. Jesus said to him, “Follow me.” Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter. Philip found Nathanael, and said to him, “We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.” Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.” Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said about him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no deceit!” Nathanael said to him, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.” Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are King of Israel!” Jesus answered him, “Because I told you, ‘I saw you underneath the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these!” He said to him, “Most certainly, I tell you all, hereafter you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”

verses.text: The third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there.
verses.source_translation: Duwoh onu mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ biluman kawin daang kota Kana deꞌ propinsi Galilea, sinoꞌ Yesus ogiꞌ danoꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus also was invited, with his disciples, to the marriage.
verses.source_translation: Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E obuah ngunang deꞌ biluman kawin inoh.

verses.text: When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no wine.”
verses.source_translation: Takal tuak anggul ngan nyaꞌa biluman inoh moꞌ obuaꞌ nuak nyaꞌa, sinoꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ obuaꞌ tuak anggul-e.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My hour has not yet come.”
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-E, “Noꞌ, oni nai ingan tanon hal inoh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ? Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ tanon osi odop Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: His mother said to the servants, “Whatever he says to you, do it.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e sinoꞌ Yesus moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ kuli-kuli deꞌ topat biluman inoh in-e, “Nai negeh oni deꞌ tanon-E tuduꞌ ingan.”

verses.text: Now there were six water pots of stone set there after the Jews’ way of purifying, containing two or three metretes apiece.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ nuam bona topat piꞌin ngan nyaꞌa mamiaꞌ odop-e nunaꞌ adat ulang Yahudi.  Isiꞌ masim-masim bona inoh moih puluꞌ nog silatus litel.

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Fill the water pots with water.” They filled them up to the brim.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina tuduꞌ kuli-kuli deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ngisiꞌ piꞌin daang bona-bona deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ punuaꞌ.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngisiꞌ bona deꞌ munoꞌ nog-e punuaꞌ.

verses.text: He said to them, “Now draw some out, and take it to the ruler of the feast.” So they took it.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh, Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ kuli-kuli deꞌ munoꞌ, “Adin, ingan nyaꞌuak-e nyeꞌ moꞌ toban tuduꞌ pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ biluman.” Yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Yesus yoh nai-e.

verses.text: When the ruler of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and didn’t know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the ruler of the feast called the bridegroom,
verses.source_translation: Pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ biluman inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mit tuak anggul inoh, pak-e kuli-kuli deꞌ duwan piꞌin inoh jaꞌ-e deꞌ puꞌan.  Jadin, takal iyoh kiꞌan piꞌin deꞌ moꞌ bilubah jadin tuak anggul inoh, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ odi sinok pinganten deꞌ dali,

verses.text: and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and when the guests have drunk freely, then that which is worse. You have kept the good wine until now!”
verses.source_translation: iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Biasa-e nyaꞌa nguliaꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ paling paguh deꞌ dioꞌ, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nog moꞌ puas nuak, ke yoh moꞌ nguliaꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ kulang paguh.  Pak-e muꞌu nyikon tuak anggul deꞌ paling paguh-e nog adin.”

verses.text: This beginning of his signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh tanda deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ sibungas-e deꞌ nai Yesus daang kota Kana deꞌ propinsi Galilea.  Pakai tanda inoh leh Iyoh moꞌ bitanga kuasa-E deꞌ sukup ayuh-e.  Yoh ngan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: After this, he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, his brothers, and his disciples; and they stayed there a few days.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi keꞌ kota Kapernaum samah-samah duoh sinoꞌ-E, suaꞌ sudiꞌ-E baya pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ loꞌo kudu-kudu onu-e danoꞌ.

verses.text: The Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ sinok onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi, Yesus odi keꞌ Yerusalem.

verses.text: He found in the temple those who sold oxen, sheep, and doves, and the changers of money sitting.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh ningaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bijua sapi, domba baya manuk asang, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang nukal duit deꞌ guluꞌ danoꞌ.

verses.text: He made a whip of cords, and threw all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nai posut soꞌ tolin yohmoꞌ kasig suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ baya binatang-binatang-e, bait domba, bait sapi soꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ.  Mija-mija nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang nukal duit obuaꞌ ngibolui-E sape duit-e posik polai katiꞌ-kanih.

verses.text: To those who sold the doves, he said, “Take these things out of here! Don’t make my Father’s house a marketplace!”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jua manuk asang, in-E, “Tunuk suaꞌ-e soꞌ itih, maꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ Boli Samaꞌ Kuꞌ jadin topat nyaꞌa bijua.”

verses.text: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will eat me up.”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E natong nang ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Nyayang Boli Muꞌ, odaꞌ odop Kuꞌ souh.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore answered him, “What sign do you show us, seeing that you do these things?”
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ tiwas tuduꞌ Yesus, in-e, “Osi deꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ Muꞌu odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih? Suba bitanga tuduꞌ koꞌih tanda deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pilubuh Boli Topaꞌ itih, daang taluh onu paliꞌ mujuag odaꞌ kuꞌ.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple! Will you raise it up in three days?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Pat puluꞌ nuam sowaꞌ nyaꞌa kajuag Boli Topaꞌ itih, pak-e Muꞌu nang yaꞌ kajuag daang taluh onu?”

verses.text: But he spoke of the temple of his body.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e deꞌ nang-E Boli Topaꞌ inoh iyohleh polong odop-E.

verses.text: When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this, and they believed the Scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E natong oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E, yoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab duoh oni deꞌ nang Yesus.

verses.text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in his name, observing his signs which he did.
verses.source_translation: Takal aluaꞌ onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi, Yesus aluaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai-E.

verses.text: But Jesus didn’t entrust himself to them, because he knew everyone,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e Iyoh moꞌ piluh otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: and because he didn’t need for anyone to testify concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.
verses.source_translation: Dusah nyaꞌa tanon tuduꞌ-E tentang osi odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ puꞌan isiꞌ otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

chapters.text: The third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there. Jesus also was invited, with his disciples, to the marriage. When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no wine.” Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does that have to do with you and me? My hour has not yet come.” His mother said to the servants, “Whatever he says to you, do it.” Now there were six water pots of stone set there after the Jews’ way of purifying, containing two or three metretes apiece. Jesus said to them, “Fill the water pots with water.” They filled them up to the brim. He said to them, “Now draw some out, and take it to the ruler of the feast.” So they took it. When the ruler of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and didn’t know where it came from (but the servants who had drawn the water knew), the ruler of the feast called the bridegroom, and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and when the guests have drunk freely, then that which is worse. You have kept the good wine until now!” This beginning of his signs Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him. After this, he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, his brothers, and his disciples; and they stayed there a few days. The Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem. He found in the temple those who sold oxen, sheep, and doves, and the changers of money sitting. He made a whip of cords, and threw all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables. To those who sold the doves, he said, “Take these things out of here! Don’t make my Father’s house a marketplace!” His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will eat me up.” The Jews therefore answered him, “What sign do you show us, seeing that you do these things?” Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.” The Jews therefore said, “It took forty-six years to build this temple! Will you raise it up in three days?” But he spoke of the temple of his body. When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he said this, and they believed the Scripture, and the word which Jesus had said. Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in his name, observing his signs which he did. But Jesus didn’t entrust himself to them, because he knew everyone, and because he didn’t need for anyone to testify concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.

verses.text: Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pimipin agama soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi deꞌ adon Nikodemus.

verses.text: The same came to him by night, and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do, unless God is with him.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nog tuduꞌ Yesus takal onu ngalom, yoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, koꞌih puꞌan nang Ingan obuah pait odaꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod nai tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, kodaꞌ deꞌ nai Ingan, simoꞌ-e doiꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ duoh-E.”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Most certainly, I tell you, unless one is born anew,  he can’t see God’s Kingdom.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e in-E, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, moꞌ diꞌ ingan obuah bilanak baꞌuh, idoh diꞌ ingan tapod ningaꞌ Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja.”

verses.text: Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?”
verses.source_translation: Nikodemus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Wat ki wat nyaꞌa yaꞌ obuah bilanak baꞌuh moꞌ-e yoh moꞌ nyoma? Podo ponai keh yoh paliꞌ molot kaang toꞌin sinoꞌ-e yoh moꞌ paliꞌ obuah bilanak baꞌuh?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Most certainly I tell you, unless one is born of water and spirit, he can’t enter into God’s Kingdom.
verses.source_translation: Yesus nyawot in-E, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, moꞌ ingan diꞌ-e paliꞌ obuah bilanak baꞌuh soꞌ piꞌin duoh soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ ingan tapod jadin umat Topaꞌ deꞌ militah jadin Laja.

verses.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh. That which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.source_translation: Oni deꞌ bilanak nyaꞌa soꞌ gonan manusia iyoh leh manusia, oni deꞌ bilanak soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ iyoh leh iyang.

verses.text: Don’t marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ ilan moꞌ Kuꞌ sina tuduꞌ ingan nang ingan halus obuah bilanak baꞌuh.

verses.text: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don’t know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
verses.source_translation: Sobak yup kaki sijaꞌ-e soꞌ-e yaꞌ odi, otoꞌ ngojit sidoong-e, pak-e diꞌ nyeꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-e nog duoh kaki soꞌ-e odi.  Wat noh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah bilanak soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Nicodemus answered him, “How can these things be?”
verses.source_translation: “Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh ponai jadi?” In Nikodemus.

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and don’t understand these things?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Muꞌu jadin gulu deꞌ Israel masaꞌ diꞌ muꞌ puꞌan-e?

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, we speak that which we know, and testify of that which we have seen, and you don’t receive our witness.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, koꞌih tanon oniꞌ deꞌ puꞌan koꞌih duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ koꞌih, pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon koꞌih.

verses.text: If I told you earthly things and you don’t believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
verses.source_translation: Ingan diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ, takal Okuꞌ sina duoh ingan tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dunia, wat ki ingan yaꞌ bisayaꞌ simoꞌ Okuꞌ sina duoh ingan tentang oniꞌ deꞌ siluga?

verses.text: No one has ascended into heaven, but he who descended out of heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ siluga, simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ muun soꞌ siluga, Iyoh inoh Onak Manusia.

verses.text: As Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ Musa najul deꞌ tun koyuh tipaduaꞌ dipoh deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ tibaga, wat inoh geh Onak Manusia yaꞌ obuah najul deꞌ tun koyuh,

verses.text: that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
verses.source_translation: saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.”

verses.text: For God so loved the world, that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ sukup ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daang dunia, noh leh ngan Iyoh moꞌ ngin Onak-E deꞌ Jok-e Niꞌ, saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E diꞌ-e kobos nah-nah, pak-e soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: For God didn’t send his Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world should be saved through him.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ pait Onak-E kaang dunia idoh diꞌ-e ngan-e ngukum nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia, pak-e ngan-e nyilamat nyaꞌa pakai Onak-E.

verses.text: He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn’t believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, iyoh diꞌ-e obuah ngukum.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ moꞌ obuah ngukum odaꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e iyoh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak Topaꞌ deꞌ Jok-e Niꞌ.

verses.text: This is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ obuah ukum luban itih: Jawaꞌ inoh moꞌ nog kaang dunia, pak-e manusia lobih suka daang mopung soꞌ daang jawaꞌ, dop-e manusia suka nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: For everyone who does evil hates the light, and doesn’t come to the light, lest his works would be exposed.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ suka nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat buꞌui deꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jawaꞌ, iyoh doliaꞌ-e odi keꞌ topat deꞌ jawaꞌ, dop-e jak-e oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai-e tonga.

verses.text: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his works may be revealed, that they have been done in God.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, iyoh nog kaang topat deꞌ jawaꞌ, saꞌ-e suaꞌ pingunai-e deꞌ paguh tonga, dop-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e, yoh nai nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: After these things, Jesus came with his disciples into the land of Judea. He stayed there with them, and baptized.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi keꞌ tanaꞌ Yudea duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.  Iyoh loꞌo danoꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ baptis nyaꞌa danoꞌ.

verses.text: John also was baptizing in Enon near Salim, because there was much water there. They came, and were baptized.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes tuang baptis-e geh nyaꞌa deꞌ Ainon, diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ Salim, dop-e danoꞌ bogoꞌ piꞌin.  Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog tuduꞌ-e, yohmoꞌ baptis odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: For John was not yet thrown into prison.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Yohanes aluaꞌ diꞌ-e molot jel.

verses.text: There arose therefore a questioning on the part of John’s disciples with some Jews about purification.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yohanes mulai bikalah duoh ulang Yahudi tentang atulan kibisig odop-e.

verses.text: They came to John, and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, the same baptizes, and everyone is coming to him.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog tuduꞌ Yohanes yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan takal deꞌ polad sungi Yordan duoh deꞌ silita ingan inoh, adin Iyoh tuang baptis-e geh nyaꞌa, yohmoꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ-E.”

verses.text: John answered, “A man can receive nothing, unless it has been given him from heaven.
verses.source_translation: Yohanes moꞌ nyawot-e, “Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod mit oniꞌ saꞌan odop-e simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e obuah ngin tuduꞌ-e soꞌ siluga.

verses.text: You yourselves testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before him.’
verses.source_translation: Ingan tuang ponai geh tanon nang okuꞌ moꞌ sina nang: okuꞌ idoh diꞌ-e Laja Pinyilamat, pak-e okuꞌ obuah pait dioꞌ soꞌ Iyoh.

verses.text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. This, my joy, therefore is made full.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ kakuꞌ pinganten dayung iyohleh pinganten dali.  Dingan pinganten dali mujuag sinok-e duoh ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang-e.  Dingan pinganten dali inoh sukup doon ngojit sina pinganten dali inoh.  Wat inoh leh okuꞌ doon, adin otin kuꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ doon.

verses.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh halus makin penting, yohmoꞌ okuꞌ halus makin diꞌ-e penting.”

verses.text: He who comes from above is above all. He who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ nog soꞌ somu, Iyoh deꞌ lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ suaꞌ manusia.  Osi deꞌ nog soꞌ dunia, iyoh ulang dunia duoh sina tentang oniꞌ deꞌ dunia.  Pak-e Iyoh deꞌ nog soꞌ siluga, Iyoh deꞌ lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ suaꞌ manusia.

verses.text: What he has seen and heard, of that he testifies; and no one receives his witness.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh tanon tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-E duoh deꞌ ngojit-E, pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E.

verses.text: He who has received his witness has set his seal to this, that God is true.
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E inoh, iyoh moꞌ ngakuꞌ nang Topaꞌ inoh bonal.

verses.text: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e osi deꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Topaꞌ, Iyoh noh leh deꞌ tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ, dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin sipunuaꞌ-e Iyang-E tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into his hand.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Onak-E, duoh moꞌ nyelah suaꞌ oniꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: One who believes in the Son has eternal life, but one who disobeys  the Son won’t see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.”
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak, iyoh soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak inoh, iyoh diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ idip, pak-e ukum Topaꞌ totap ogiꞌ deꞌ polong odop-e.

chapters.text: Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews. The same came to him by night, and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do, unless God is with him.” Jesus answered him, “Most certainly, I tell you, unless one is born anew,  he can’t see God’s Kingdom.” Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?” Jesus answered, “Most certainly I tell you, unless one is born of water and spirit, he can’t enter into God’s Kingdom.  That which is born of the flesh is flesh. That which is born of the Spirit is spirit.   Don’t marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’   The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don’t know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.” Nicodemus answered him, “How can these things be?” Jesus answered him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and don’t understand these things?   Most certainly I tell you, we speak that which we know, and testify of that which we have seen, and you don’t receive our witness.   If I told you earthly things and you don’t believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?   No one has ascended into heaven, but he who descended out of heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.   As Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,   that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.   For God so loved the world, that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.   For God didn’t send his Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world should be saved through him.   He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn’t believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.   This is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.   For everyone who does evil hates the light, and doesn’t come to the light, lest his works would be exposed.   But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his works may be revealed, that they have been done in God.” After these things, Jesus came with his disciples into the land of Judea. He stayed there with them, and baptized. John also was baptizing in Enon near Salim, because there was much water there. They came, and were baptized. For John was not yet thrown into prison. There arose therefore a questioning on the part of John’s disciples with some Jews about purification. They came to John, and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, the same baptizes, and everyone is coming to him.” John answered, “A man can receive nothing, unless it has been given him from heaven. You yourselves testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before him.’ He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. This, my joy, therefore is made full. He must increase, but I must decrease. He who comes from above is above all. He who is from the earth belongs to the earth, and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all. What he has seen and heard, of that he testifies; and no one receives his witness. He who has received his witness has set his seal to this, that God is true. For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure. The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into his hand. One who believes in the Son has eternal life, but one who disobeys  the Son won’t see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.”

verses.text: Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
verses.source_translation: Ayua ulang Farisi ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ duoh deꞌ obuah baptis odaꞌ Yesus lobih bogoꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah baptis odaꞌ Yohanes.

verses.text: (although Jesus himself didn’t baptize, but his disciples),
verses.source_translation: Pak-e sibonal-e idoh diꞌ-e Yesus deꞌ baptis nyaꞌa, pak-e jok-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.

verses.text: he left Judea, and departed into Galilee.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus puꞌan nang ayua ulang Farisi moꞌ ngojit tentang hal inoh, Iyoh moꞌ buu soꞌ propinsi Yudea paliꞌ keꞌ propinsi Galilea.

verses.text: He needed to pass through Samaria.
verses.source_translation: Daang pimonu-e Iyoh halus ponu ngilusuꞌ propinsi Samaria.

verses.text: So he came to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son, Joseph.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Iyoh moꞌ nog keꞌ kota deꞌ adon-e Sikhar deꞌ Samaria, diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ ngin Yakub noꞌuh-e tuduꞌ Yusuf, onak-e.

verses.text: Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being tired from his journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ lubang piꞌin deꞌ kaliah Yakub noꞌuh-e.  Yesus sukup kowok odaꞌ pimonu-E.  Noh leh ngan-E guluꞌ deꞌ bingon lubang piꞌin inoh.  Takal inoh kila-kila pukul simoong duwoh uun onu,

verses.text: A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink.”
For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.
verses.source_translation: pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ odi milih pinguman keꞌ kota.  Mokuaꞌ inoh niꞌ naꞌan dayung Samaria odi nyaꞌuak piꞌin deꞌ lubang piꞌin inoh.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Soꞌon yeh Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ piꞌin ngan Kuꞌ yaꞌ nuak neh?”

verses.text: The Samaritan woman therefore said to him, “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
verses.source_translation: Dayung Samaria inoh moꞌ nyawot-E, “Ingan ulang Yahudi, oni nai Ingan mitiaꞌ nuak tuduꞌ okuꞌ, ulang Samaria?” (Dop-e ulang Yahudi sisiꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Samaria.)

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ muꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Topaꞌ duoh osi deꞌ mitiaꞌ nuak tuduꞌ muꞌu, pasti muꞌu deꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ nuak tuduꞌ-E, Iyoh moꞌ ngin piꞌin deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip tuduꞌ muꞌu.”

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. So where do you get that living water?
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ in-e, “Ingan doiꞌ saꞌuak Ingan, lubang piꞌin itih sukup tuluap-e.  Soꞌ ki Ingan yaꞌ soꞌon piꞌin deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip?

verses.text: Are you greater than our father, Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, as did his children, and his livestock?”
verses.source_translation: Yakub sumuk babai koꞌih ngin lubang piꞌin itih.  Odop-e tuang nuak soꞌ itih geh, wat inoh geh onak-onak-e baya binatang deꞌ piala-e.  Podo Ingan nyaꞌa deꞌ lobih penting soꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih Yakub?”

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,
verses.source_translation: Yesus nyawot in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ nuak piꞌin itih, asong-e yaꞌ paliꞌ bodoh.

verses.text: but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst again; but the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nuak piꞌin deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ noman asong-e bodoh.  Dop-e piꞌin deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ yaꞌ jadin boton piꞌin daang odop-e deꞌ soyuak-soyuak-e duoh ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.”

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I don’t get thirsty, neither come all the way here to draw.”
verses.source_translation: In dayung inoh, “Ingan ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ piꞌin inoh, saꞌ asong kuꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bodoh duoh diꞌ kuꞌ tiyaꞌ paliꞌ mit piꞌin katiꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Paliꞌ mogan bonon muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ katiꞌ.”

verses.text: The woman answered, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You said well, ‘I have no husband,’
verses.source_translation: In dayung inoh, “Okuꞌ doiꞌ bonon kuꞌ.” Yohmoꞌ in Yesus, “Tok bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang muꞌ inoh.

verses.text: for you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truly.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e muꞌu moꞌ limoh sidoh bibonon, dali deꞌ idip samah-samah duoh muꞌu adin idoh diꞌ-e bonon muꞌ.”

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ in-e, “Adin okuꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang Ingan nabi.

verses.text: Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.”
verses.source_translation: Sumuk babai koꞌih nyomah Topaꞌ deꞌ tun punguꞌ itih, pak-e bangsa Ingan nang jok-e deꞌ Yerusalem topat nyaꞌa nyomah Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe me, the hour comes, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, will you worship the Father.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ-e, “Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih, ogiꞌ onu-e nyaꞌa yaꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ deꞌ punguꞌ itih, duoh idoh geh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem.

verses.text: You worship that which you don’t know. We worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.
verses.source_translation: Ingan ulang Samaria nyomah oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e, pak-e koꞌih ulang Yahudi nyomah Iyoh deꞌ puꞌan koꞌih, dop-e deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa silamat nog soꞌ ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such to be his worshipers.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e onu-e yaꞌ nog, duoh adin geh onu inoh moꞌ nog, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal-bonal nyomah yaꞌ nyomah Samaꞌ pakai obuah mipin odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ duoh nunaꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.  Dop-e oni deꞌ laꞌan Samaꞌ iyoh leh saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nyomah odop-E nunaꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ inoh Iyang, osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nyomah Iyoh, halus obuah mipin odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ duoh nunaꞌ olan deꞌ bonal ngan-e nyomah-E.”

verses.text: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah comes, he who is called Christ. When he has come, he will declare to us all things.”
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Okuꞌ puꞌan nang Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nang Kristus yaꞌ nog.  Moꞌ nyam Iyoh nog, Iyoh yaꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am he, the one who speaks to you.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Okuꞌ leh odop-E, deꞌ sina duoh muꞌu adin.”

verses.text: At this, his disciples came. They marveled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no one said, “What are you looking for?” or, “Why do you speak with her?”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ nog, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ gogoh ningaꞌ Yesus sina duoh dayung inoh.  Pak-e doiꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puus sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, ‘Oni deꞌ pilelu Ingan soꞌ dayung itih?’ atou ‘Oni ngan Ingan sina duoh-e?’

verses.text: So the woman left her water pot, and went away into the city, and said to the people,
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ supiah bona-e, iyoh moꞌ buu soꞌ kanoꞌ yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ kota, iyoh tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ in-e,

verses.text: “Come, see a man who told me everything that I did. Can this be the Christ?”
verses.source_translation: “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ okuꞌ, odi ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ onu kuꞌ nai-e.  Laꞌan-e tok kedin-e Iyoh inoh Laja Pinyilamat.”

verses.text: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ dayung inoh odi keꞌ sopaꞌ kota ngan-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: In the meanwhile, the disciples urged him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E ngijaꞌ Yesus man in-e, “Gulu, jaꞌ mey man.”

verses.text: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you don’t know about.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus nyawot-e, “Ogiꞌ pinguman deꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e.”

verses.text: The disciples therefore said to one another, “Has anyone brought him something to eat?”
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ sitipan odop-e, “Podo ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ toban pinguman tuduꞌ-E?”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of him who sent me, and to accomplish his work.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina, “Pinguman Kuꞌ yohleh nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, duoh pijadi suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ nyelah-E tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: Don’t you say, ‘There are yet four months until the harvest?’ Behold, I tell you, lift up your eyes, and look at the fields, that they are white for harvest already.
verses.source_translation: Ingan puꞌan nang pat bulan mokuaꞌ bipuluah nyaꞌa ngutuam.  Pak-e Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Suba ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ nog deꞌ munoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ gandum deꞌ umoh deꞌ moꞌ obuaꞌ siaꞌ duoh moꞌ masak, moꞌ sodang ngan nyaꞌa yaꞌ ngutuam-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: He who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit to eternal life; that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.
