verses.source_translation: Adin geh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam tilimaꞌ pah-e duoh nguluk asil-e, iyoh leh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ ngan-e soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.  Yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bipuluah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam samah-samah doon.

verses.text: For in this the saying is true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’
verses.source_translation: Tok bonal ogiꞌ sina deꞌ in-e, ‘Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puluah, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngutuam.’

verses.text: I sent you to reap that for which you haven’t labored. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ pait ingan odaꞌ ngutuam oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ ingan puluah-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon moꞌ kiloja, ingan moꞌ ngutuam soꞌ kiloja nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.”

verses.text: From that city many of the Samaritans believed in him because of the word of the woman, who testified, “He told me everything that I did.”
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ ulang Samaria soꞌ kota bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus odaꞌ sina deꞌ tanon dayung inoh, “Iyoh tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ onu kuꞌ nai-e.”

verses.text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them. He stayed there two days.
verses.source_translation: Takal ulang-ulang Samaria deꞌ munoꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ulih-ulih mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus loꞌo duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ duwoh onu.

verses.text: Many more believed because of his word.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh lobih bogoꞌ lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E odaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ ngajal-E.

verses.text: They said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of your speaking; for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina tuduꞌ dayung inoh in-e, “ Adin koꞌih bisayaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon muꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih, pak-e odop koꞌih moꞌ ngojit Iyoh duoh puꞌan nang Iyoh bonal-bonal Pinyilamat dunia.”

verses.text: After the two days he went out from there and went into Galilee.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ duwoh onu loꞌo deꞌ Sikhar, Yesus paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ propinsi Galilea.

verses.text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e sina in-e, “Doiꞌ nabi deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-e deꞌ kupuaꞌ odop-e.”

verses.text: So when he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast, for they also went to the feast.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal-E nog Galilea ulang-ulang danoꞌ sonang otin nyamut-E, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-E deꞌ Yerusalem takal onu ayuh Paskah.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ-e ogiꞌ danoꞌ takal onu inoh.

verses.text: Jesus came therefore again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water into wine. There was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus paliꞌ lagi keꞌ kota Kana, deꞌ Galilea, topat soꞌ Iyoh ngubah piꞌin jadin tuak anggul.  Deꞌ Kapernaum ogiꞌ pegawai deꞌ kiloja deꞌ istana, onak-e deꞌ dali monam.

verses.text: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to him, and begged him that he would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
verses.source_translation: Takal pegawai istana inoh ngojit nang Yesus moꞌ nog soꞌ Yudea odi keꞌ Galilea, iyoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus nog duoh odaꞌ onak-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e, dop-e onak-e inoh moꞌ yaꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will in no way believe.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Moꞌ diꞌ ingan ningaꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai Kuꞌ, idoh diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ.”

verses.text: The nobleman said to him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”
verses.source_translation: Pegawai istana inoh moꞌ in-e, “Tulung leh nog takal onak kuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e kobos.”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son lives.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Paliꞌ negeh, onak muꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam.” Pegawai istana inoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ sina deꞌ nang Yesus tuduꞌ-e, iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ.

verses.text: As he was now going down, his servants met him and reported, saying “Your child lives!”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e aluaꞌ deꞌ lopot olan, bala kuli-e moꞌ nog nusud-e tanon nang onak-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam.

verses.text: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. They said therefore to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour, the fever left him.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Pukul kudu onak kuꞌ mulai mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Sumia-e kila-kila pukul niꞌ uun onu, bongoh-e moꞌ muun.”

verses.text: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” He believed, as did his whole house.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ onak opot inoh moꞌ natong nang jam inoh leh Yesus in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Onak muꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam.” Iyoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus baya suaꞌ odop-e daang boli-e.

verses.text: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judea into Galilee.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e deꞌ nai Yesus takal Iyoh paliꞌ soꞌ Yudea odi keꞌ Galilea.

chapters.text: Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John (although Jesus himself didn’t baptize, but his disciples), he left Judea, and departed into Galilee. He needed to pass through Samaria. So he came to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son, Joseph. Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being tired from his journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour. A woman of Samaria came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink.” For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food. The Samaritan woman therefore said to him, “How is it that you, being a Jew, ask for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman?” (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.) Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.” The woman said to him, “Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. So where do you get that living water? Are you greater than our father, Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, as did his children, and his livestock?” Jesus answered her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,   but whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will never thirst again; but the water that I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up to eternal life.” The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I don’t get thirsty, neither come all the way here to draw.” Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”  The woman answered, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You said well, ‘I have no husband,’   for you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truly.” The woman said to him, “Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet. Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.” Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe me, the hour comes, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, will you worship the Father.   You worship that which you don’t know. We worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.   But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such to be his worshipers.   God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.” The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah comes, he who is called Christ. When he has come, he will declare to us all things.” Jesus said to her, “I am he, the one who speaks to you.” At this, his disciples came. They marveled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no one said, “What are you looking for?” or, “Why do you speak with her?” So the woman left her water pot, and went away into the city, and said to the people, “Come, see a man who told me everything that I did. Can this be the Christ?” They went out of the city, and were coming to him. In the meanwhile, the disciples urged him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.” But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you don’t know about.” The disciples therefore said to one another, “Has anyone brought him something to eat?” Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of him who sent me, and to accomplish his work.   Don’t you say, ‘There are yet four months until the harvest?’ Behold, I tell you, lift up your eyes, and look at the fields, that they are white for harvest already.   He who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit to eternal life; that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.   For in this the saying is true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’   I sent you to reap that for which you haven’t labored. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.” From that city many of the Samaritans believed in him because of the word of the woman, who testified, “He told me everything that I did.” So when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them. He stayed there two days. Many more believed because of his word. They said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of your speaking; for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.” After the two days he went out from there and went into Galilee. For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country. So when he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast, for they also went to the feast. Jesus came therefore again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water into wine. There was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum. When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to him, and begged him that he would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death. Jesus therefore said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will in no way believe.” The nobleman said to him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.” Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son lives.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way. As he was now going down, his servants met him and reported, saying “Your child lives!” So he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. They said therefore to him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour, the fever left him.” So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” He believed, as did his whole house. This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judea into Galilee.

verses.text: After these things, there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ onu ayuh ulang Yahudi, Yesus odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyamut onu ayuh inoh.

verses.text: Now in Jerusalem by the sheep gate, there is a pool, which is called in Hebrew, “Bethesda”, having five porches.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ Yerusalem ogiꞌ pagung deꞌ adon Betesda daang sina Ibrani.  Pagung inoh sinok Tiban ayuh Domba, deꞌ bingon pagung inoh ogiꞌ limoh awah-e.

verses.text: In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, or paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water;
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ awah-awah deꞌ munoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam guling, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ, ogiꞌ deꞌ bojang, ogiꞌ deꞌ kobos gonan-e.  (Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon piꞌin deꞌ pagung inoh bilayaꞌ.

verses.text: for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was healed of whatever disease he had.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ogiꞌ onu-e malaikat Topaꞌ muun kaang pagung inoh odaꞌ piꞌin-e bilayaꞌ.  Yohmoꞌ osi deꞌ monam deꞌ dioꞌ muun kaang pagung takal piꞌin-e bilayaꞌ, yoh yaꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ noman-e.)

verses.text: A certain man was there, who had been sick for thirty-eight years.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ topat inoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ monam moꞌ taluh puluꞌ moih sowaꞌ.

verses.text: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been sick for a long time, he asked him, “Do you want to be made well?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ yoh guling, Yesus moꞌ puꞌan nang iyoh moꞌ tuui monam.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Laꞌan muꞌ yeh yaꞌ mokuaꞌ neh?”

verses.text: The sick man answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I’m coming, another steps down before me.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pimuun okuꞌ kaang pagung inoh takal piꞌin-e bilayaꞌ, takal okuꞌ yaꞌ muun kaang pagung inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon moꞌ dioꞌ muun soꞌ okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Arise, take up your mat, and walk.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Mokat leh, tunuk tilam muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu.”

verses.text: Immediately, the man was made well, and took up his mat and walked. Now it was the Sabbath on that day.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh nyaꞌa inoh lasuꞌ mokuaꞌ yohmoꞌ tunuk tilam-e yohmoꞌ mokat ponu.  Takal inoh Onu Sabat, onu ulang Yahudi loꞌo diꞌ-e nai oni-oni-e.

verses.text: So the Jews said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry the mat.”
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e inoh in-e, “Onu itih onu Simayang agama Yahudi, idoh diꞌ muꞌ soꞌon golong tilam muꞌ.”

verses.text: He answered them, “He who made me well, the same said to me, ‘Take up your mat, and walk.’”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e iyoh in-e nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam kuꞌ, Iyoh deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ, ‘Tunuk tilam muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ ponu.’ ”

verses.text: Then they asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Take up your mat, and walk’?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa inoh, “Osi odop-E deꞌ sina tuduꞌ muꞌu odaꞌ muꞌu tunuk tilam muꞌ duoh odaꞌ muꞌu ponu?”

verses.text: But he who was healed didn’t know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in the place.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang-e mokuaꞌ monam inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan osi nyaꞌa inoh, dop-e Yesus moꞌ molot daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Iyoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tonga.

verses.text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “Behold, you are made well. Sin no more, so that nothing worse happens to you.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ bitapod duoh-e lagiꞌ deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina duoh-e in-e, “Ningaꞌ, muꞌu moꞌ mokuaꞌ monam, maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai dosa muꞌ, saꞌ diꞌ muꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ deꞌ lobih soꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngoon muꞌ.”

verses.text: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa inoh luah, yoh moꞌ silita tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi nang Yesus leh deꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ odop-e mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.

verses.text: For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi kagaꞌ odop-e yaꞌ pijolaꞌ Yesus, dop-e Yesus nai oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ daang Onu Sabat.

verses.text: But Jesus answered them, “My Father is still working, so I am working, too.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Samaꞌ Kuꞌ diꞌ loꞌo-loꞌo nai kiloja-E nog adin, Okuꞌ tuang kiloja geh.”

verses.text: For this cause therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.
verses.source_translation: Sina deꞌ nang Yesus inoh deꞌ odaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi makin malah, yoh moꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai deꞌ wat inoh, dop-e Yesus idoh diꞌ-e jok-e ngilangal atulan onu Simayang agama Yahudi, pak-e Iyoh nang Topaꞌ inoh Samaꞌ-E, loti-e Iyoh moꞌ nyamah odop-E duoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus therefore answered them, “Most certainly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father doing. For whatever things he does, these the Son also does likewise.
verses.source_translation: Yesus nyawot pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ in-E, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, tok Onak diꞌ-e ponai nai oni-oni-e soꞌ odop-E sadiꞌ-e.  Iyoh jok-e ponai nai oniꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ-e Samaꞌ-E nai-e.  Dop-e oni deꞌ nai Samaꞌ, inoh geh deꞌ nai Onak.

verses.text: For the Father has affection for the Son, and shows him all things that he himself does. He will show him greater works than these, that you may marvel.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Onak duoh bitanga suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai odop-E tuduꞌ Onak-E.  Lobih soꞌ inoh Samaꞌ yaꞌ bitanga kiloja-kiloja deꞌ lobih ayuh ngan-e odaꞌ Onak-E nai-e, sape ingan moꞌ ilan-e.

verses.text: For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son also gives life to whom he desires.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ kidip nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos duoh odaꞌ idip, wat inoh geh Onak odaꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop-E.

verses.text: For the Father judges no one, but he has given all judgment to the Son,
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ ngadel osi-osi-e, pak-e Iyoh nyelah suaꞌ kuasa-E tuduꞌ Onak-E ngan-e ngadel nyaꞌa,

verses.text: that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn’t honor the Son doesn’t honor the Father who sent him.
verses.source_translation: saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ Onak samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ Samaꞌ.  Osi deꞌ diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ Onak, iyoh diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Iyoh.

verses.text: “Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn’t come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi deꞌ ngojit pingunang Kuꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, iyoh yaꞌ kakuꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah baya diꞌ-e suwaꞌ obuah ukum, dop-e iyoh moꞌ lopas soꞌ kuasa deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa kobos yohmoꞌ molot kaang idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: Most certainly, I tell you, the hour comes, and now is, when the dead will hear the Son of God’s voice; and those who hear will live.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ sina tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, yaꞌ nog onu-e, kan-e adin geh moꞌ nog onu-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos yaꞌ ngojit sina Okuꞌ, Onak Topaꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon idip.

verses.text: For as the Father has life in himself, even so he gave to the Son also to have life in himself.
verses.source_translation: Idip tok nog soꞌ Odop Samaꞌ.  Wat noh geh Samaꞌ ngin kuasa tuduꞌ Onak ngan-e ngin idip.

verses.text: He also gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Onak-E kuasa ngan-e pilabuꞌ ukum, dop-e Iyoh Onak Manusia.

verses.text: Don’t marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ ilan, dop-e yaꞌ nog onu-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang kubul yaꞌ klingah Iyoh mogan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,

verses.text: and will come out; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of judgment.
verses.source_translation: yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh yaꞌ luah soꞌ kubul duoh paliꞌ idip, ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat yaꞌ paliꞌ idip saꞌ-e obuah ukum.

verses.text: I can of myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is righteous; because I don’t seek my own will, but the will of my Father who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ ponai nai oni-oni soꞌ odop Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ pilabuꞌ ukum samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Ukum deꞌ pilabuꞌ Kuꞌ moꞌ bitotok duoh salah deꞌ nai-e, dop-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ, pak-e nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: “If I testify about myself, my witness is not valid.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ odop Kuꞌ deꞌ tanon tentang odop Kuꞌ, doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod yaꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e.

verses.text: It is another who testifies about me. I know that the testimony which he testifies about me is true.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ deꞌ bokon, Iyoh inoh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, deꞌ sobot tentang Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E tentang Okuꞌ tok bonal.”

verses.text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan moꞌ pait nyaꞌa tuduꞌ Yohanes, iyoh moꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Okuꞌ.

verses.text: But the testimony which I receive is not from man. However, I say these things that you may be saved.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ sibonal-e idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ pilelu oni deꞌ tanon manusia tentang Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ jok Kuꞌ tanon oni deꞌ nang Yohanes saꞌ ingan obuah nyilamat.

verses.text: He was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang Yohanes kodaꞌ lapu kadis deꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ ingan ngoon sonang, pak-e jawaꞌ-e inoh jok-e niꞌ tiliaꞌ.

verses.text: But the testimony which I have is greater than that of John, for the works which the Father gave me to accomplish, the very works that I do, testify about me, that the Father has sent me.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ lobih penting soꞌ oni deꞌ tanon Yohanes, oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih yohleh suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Samaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e.  Kiloja inoh leh deꞌ nai Kuꞌ adin duoh deꞌ jadin bukti nang Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: The Father himself, who sent me, has testified about me. You have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his form.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ tanon tentang Okuꞌ.  Aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu ingan ngojit sina-E, jowin-E tuang aluaꞌ doiꞌ geh ingan ningaꞌ-E.

verses.text: You don’t have his word living in you; because you don’t believe him whom he sent.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang-E doiꞌ daang otin ingan, dop-e ingan diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ deꞌ pait-E.

verses.text: “You search the Scriptures, because you think that in them you have eternal life; and these are they which testify about me.
verses.source_translation: Ingan bilajal buk Kitab, dop-e ingan sakaꞌ nang ingan yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah soꞌ buk Kitab inoh.  Sibonal-e buk Kitab inoh moꞌ tanon tentang Okuꞌ,

verses.text: Yet you will not come to me, that you may have life.
verses.source_translation: pak-e doliaꞌ ingan nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ ngan ingan yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: I don’t receive glory from men.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ kalik pudi soꞌ manusia.

verses.text: But I know you, that you don’t have God’s love in yourselves.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ piluh ingan.  Okuꞌ puꞌan nang idoh diꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ daang otin ingan.

verses.text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you don’t receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ nog pakai kuasa Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Pak-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nog pakai kuasa odop-e ingan tilimaꞌ-e.

verses.text: How can you believe, who receive glory from one another, and you don’t seek the glory that comes from the only God?
verses.source_translation: Wat ki wat ingan dapod yaꞌ bisayaꞌ, moꞌ jok ingan kalik pudi soꞌ tipan odop ingan duoh doliaꞌ ingan kagaꞌ kalik mudi soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e niꞌ?

verses.text: “Don’t think that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you, even Moses, on whom you have set your hope.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ pikil nang Okuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nyalah ingan deꞌ sulung jowin Samaꞌ.  Deꞌ yaꞌ nyalah ingan iyoh leh Musa, tiap iyoh leh deꞌ alap ingan nang yaꞌ nuaꞌ odop ingan.

verses.text: For if you believed Moses, you would believe me; for he wrote about me.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e moꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Musa, totu ingan bisayaꞌ geh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Musa moꞌ nulis tentang Okuꞌ.

verses.text: But if you don’t believe his writings, how will you believe my words?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, wat ki wat ingan dapod yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang Kuꞌ?”

chapters.text: After these things, there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem. Now in Jerusalem by the sheep gate, there is a pool, which is called in Hebrew, “Bethesda”, having five porches. In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, or paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water; for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was healed of whatever disease he had. A certain man was there, who had been sick for thirty-eight years. When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been sick for a long time, he asked him, “Do you want to be made well?” The sick man answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I’m coming, another steps down before me.” Jesus said to him, “Arise, take up your mat, and walk.” Immediately, the man was made well, and took up his mat and walked. Now it was the Sabbath on that day. So the Jews said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry the mat.” He answered them, “He who made me well, the same said to me, ‘Take up your mat, and walk.’” Then they asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Take up your mat, and walk’?” But he who was healed didn’t know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, a crowd being in the place. Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “Behold, you are made well. Sin no more, so that nothing worse happens to you.”  The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well. For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath. But Jesus answered them, “My Father is still working, so I am working, too.” For this cause therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God. Jesus therefore answered them, “Most certainly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father doing. For whatever things he does, these the Son also does likewise.   For the Father has affection for the Son, and shows him all things that he himself does. He will show him greater works than these, that you may marvel.   For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son also gives life to whom he desires.   For the Father judges no one, but he has given all judgment to the Son,   that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn’t honor the Son doesn’t honor the Father who sent him.  “Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn’t come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life.   Most certainly, I tell you, the hour comes, and now is, when the dead will hear the Son of God’s voice; and those who hear will live.   For as the Father has life in himself, even so he gave to the Son also to have life in himself.   He also gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man.   Don’t marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,   and will come out; those who have done good, to the resurrection of life; and those who have done evil, to the resurrection of judgment.   I can of myself do nothing. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is righteous; because I don’t seek my own will, but the will of my Father who sent me.  “If I testify about myself, my witness is not valid.   It is another who testifies about me. I know that the testimony which he testifies about me is true.   You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.   But the testimony which I receive is not from man. However, I say these things that you may be saved.   He was the burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.   But the testimony which I have is greater than that of John, for the works which the Father gave me to accomplish, the very works that I do, testify about me, that the Father has sent me.   The Father himself, who sent me, has testified about me. You have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his form.   You don’t have his word living in you; because you don’t believe him whom he sent.  “You search the Scriptures, because you think that in them you have eternal life; and these are they which testify about me.   Yet you will not come to me, that you may have life.   I don’t receive glory from men.   But I know you, that you don’t have God’s love in yourselves.   I have come in my Father’s name, and you don’t receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.   How can you believe, who receive glory from one another, and you don’t seek the glory that comes from the only God?  “Don’t think that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you, even Moses, on whom you have set your hope.   For if you believed Moses, you would believe me; for he wrote about me.   But if you don’t believe his writings, how will you believe my words?”

verses.text: After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ motas keꞌ polad donu Galilea deꞌ nang nyaꞌa geh donu Tiberias.

verses.text: A great multitude followed him, because they saw his signs which he did on those who were sick.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa bogoꞌ moꞌ siuah-siuah nunaꞌ-E, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam, takal-E odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus went up into the mountain, and he sat there with his disciples.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ maꞌad ke dolod yohmoꞌ guluꞌ duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E danoꞌ.

verses.text: Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was at hand.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi moꞌ sinok.

verses.text: Jesus therefore lifting up his eyes, and seeing that a great multitude was coming to him, said to Philip, “Where are we to buy bread, that these may eat?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ siuah-siuah-e nog tuduꞌ odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Filipus in-E, “Daki toꞌ yaꞌ milih kueh saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ itih dapod man?”

verses.text: This he said to test him, for he himself knew what he would do.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sikian in inoh ngan-e yaꞌ nguji Filipus, dop-e odop Yesus moꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E.

verses.text: Philip answered him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that everyone of them may receive a little.”
verses.source_translation: Filipus moꞌ nyawot-E, “Bial nyeꞌ milih kueh pakai duit duwoh latus kiping pilak tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e sukup saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ, bial nyeꞌ bikutung pakai nyipiak kueh-e ngaꞌ sit ngaꞌ sit.”

verses.text: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, deꞌ adon-e Andreas, sudiꞌ Simon Petrus, iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus,

verses.text: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these among so many?”
verses.source_translation: “Datiꞌ ogiꞌ niꞌ onak opot dali deꞌ kakuꞌ limoh kiping kueh gandum baya duwoh polong ikian, pak-e doiꞌ-e sukup saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kiang kiang itih.”

verses.text: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in that place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ guluꞌ.” Topat inoh sida duh-e.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ totaꞌ duh.  Odop-e deꞌ dali sijaꞌ-a ogiꞌ kulang lobih limoh libu naꞌan.

verses.text: Jesus took the loaves; and having given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; likewise also of the fish as much as they desired.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mit kueh inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bidoa bisukul.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bikutung kueh inoh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ guluꞌ inoh, wat noh geh Iyoh nai duoh ikian-e.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa man nog-e busuah.

verses.text: When they were filled, he said to his disciples, “Gather up the broken pieces which are left over, that nothing be lost.”
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ busuah, Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Nguluk suaꞌ lobih-e saꞌ-a doiꞌ deꞌ saꞌat nyaꞌa.”

verses.text: So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which were left over by those who had eaten.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nguluk-e.  Soꞌ deꞌ limoh kiping kueh gandum deꞌ man nyaꞌa, aluaꞌ ogiꞌ lobih-e simoong duwoh bakul deꞌ bagaꞌ.

verses.text: When therefore the people saw the sign which Jesus did, they said, “This is truly the prophet who comes into the world.”
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai Yesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina, “Iyoh itih bonal-bonal Nabi deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang yaꞌ nog kaang dunia.”

verses.text: Jesus therefore, perceiving that they were about to come and take him by force, to make him king, withdrew again to the mountain by himself.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Yesus puꞌan nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ paksa odop-E odaꞌ jadin laja.  Yoh ngan Yesus moꞌ buu keꞌ dolod sadiꞌ-E.

verses.text: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ odi keꞌ donu, yoh moꞌ muat kaang olud,

verses.text: and they entered into the boat, and were going over the sea to Capernaum. It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
verses.source_translation: yohmoꞌ motas keꞌ kota Kapernaum.  Nog onu moꞌ mopung, Yesus aluaꞌ geh diꞌ-e nog tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: The sea was tossed by a great wind blowing.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh sobak libut moꞌ nog, gilumang ayuh moꞌ mokat deꞌ donu.

verses.text: When therefore they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia,  they saw Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing near to the boat; and they were afraid.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikayuh olud-e daang limoh nog nuam kilo, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ   odi sinok olud odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolu.

verses.text: But he said to them, “It is I. Don’t be afraid.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Itih Okuꞌ, maꞌ tolu!”

verses.text: They were willing therefore to receive him into the boat. Immediately the boat was at the land where they were going.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit Yesus sina in noh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ doon otin-e ngijaꞌ Yesus maꞌad kaang olud-e.  Takal inoh geh tang-tang olud-e moꞌ lasuꞌ nog keꞌ polad donu.

verses.text: On the next day, the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except the one in which his disciples had embarked, and that Jesus hadn’t entered with his disciples into the boat, but his disciples had gone away alone.
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ pagi-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ polad donu moꞌ ningaꞌ olud deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ sumia-e moꞌ doiꞌ, dop-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ ponu pakai olud inoh, pak-e deꞌ puꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Yesus diꞌ-e suwaꞌ duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.

verses.text: However boats from Tiberias came near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh nog kudu-kudu olud soꞌ Tiberias.  Olud-olud deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo sinok topat soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ man kueh, takal Yesus mokuaꞌ bidoa bisukul.

verses.text: When the multitude therefore saw that Jesus wasn’t there, nor his disciples, they themselves got into the boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E doiꞌ danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ muat kaang olud-olud deꞌ tuang-e nog deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi kalik Yesus keꞌ Kapernaum.

verses.text: When they found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you come here?”
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus deꞌ polad donu inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Gulu, siniaꞌ Ingan nog katiꞌ?”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, you seek me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves, and were filled.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, ingan kalik Okuꞌ, dop-e ingan moꞌ man kueh nog ingan busuah, idoh diꞌ-e ngan ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ tanda-tanda deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Don’t work for the food which perishes, but for the food which remains to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has sealed him.”
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ kiloja saꞌan pinguman deꞌ ponai obuaꞌ duoh moduaꞌ, pak-e kiloja leh saꞌan pinguman deꞌ taan nah-nah deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Onak Manusia tuduꞌ ingan.  Topaꞌ Samaꞌ moꞌ ngin tanda situju jok-e tuduꞌ Iyoh.”

verses.text: They said therefore to him, “What must we do, that we may work the works of God?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Oni deꞌ halus koꞌih nai-e ngan koꞌih nai oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ?”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he has sent.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Topaꞌ, inohleh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: They said therefore to him, “What then do you do for a sign, that we may see, and believe you? What work do you do?
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Tanda oni deꞌ nai Ingan, saꞌ koꞌih ningaꞌ-e duoh saꞌ koꞌih bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Ingan? Oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai Ingan?

verses.text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.’”
verses.source_translation: Sumuk babai koꞌih moꞌ man kueh manna deꞌ soꞌ siluga takal-e deꞌ padang pasil, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis, ‘Iyoh ngin man tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, kueh deꞌ soꞌ siluga.’ ”

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them, “Most certainly, I tell you, it wasn’t Moses who gave you the bread out of heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread out of heaven.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Idoh diꞌ-e Musa deꞌ ngin man kueh soꞌ siluga deꞌ ingan, pak-e Samaꞌ Kuꞌ leh deꞌ ngin man kueh deꞌ bonal-bonal soꞌ siluga deꞌ ingan.

verses.text: For the bread of God is that which comes down out of heaven, and gives life to the world.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e kueh deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ iyoh leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga duoh ngin idip saꞌan manusia deꞌ dunia.”

verses.text: They said therefore to him, “Lord, always give us this bread.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, ngin leh telus-telus kueh inoh tuduꞌ koꞌih.”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, nah-nah diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ pilai, duoh osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ iyoh nah-nah diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ asong-e bodoh.

verses.text: But I told you that you have seen me, and yet you don’t believe.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e samah kodaꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, bial ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: All those whom the Father gives me will come to me. He who comes to me I will in no way throw out.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ ngin Samaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, yaꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nulak osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Okuꞌ muun soꞌ siluga, idoh diꞌ-e ngan Okuꞌ yaꞌ nai oni deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ, pak-e ngan Okuꞌ nai oni deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: This is the will of my Father who sent me, that of all he has given to me I should lose nothing, but should raise him up at the last day.
verses.source_translation: Itih leh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ: saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, doiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ moyap, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.

verses.text: This is the will of the one who sent me, that everyone who sees the Son, and believes in him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e itih leh deꞌ laꞌan Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Onak duoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, duoh saꞌ Okuꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said, “I am the bread which came down out of heaven.”
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ bikutuk-bigonom, dop-e Yesus nang, “Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ Siluga.”

verses.text: They said, “Isn’t this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How then does he say, ‘I have come down out of heaven?’”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e Iyoh itih Yesus, onak Yusuf, sinoꞌ samaꞌ-e otoꞌ puꞌan-e? Oni nai-e adin Iyoh nang odop-e muun soꞌ siluga?”

verses.text: Therefore Jesus answered them, “Don’t murmur among yourselves.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Maꞌ ingan bikutuk-bigonom deꞌ in inoh.

verses.text: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up in the last day.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ deꞌ toban nyaꞌa inoh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ iyoh paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.

verses.text: It is written in the prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’   Therefore everyone who hears from the Father, and has learned, comes to me.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis deꞌ buk nabi-nabi in-e: ‘Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngajal odaꞌ Topaꞌ.’ Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngojit duoh bilajal soꞌ Samaꞌ nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is from God. He has seen the Father.
verses.source_translation: Idoh diꞌ-e loti-e moꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Samaꞌ.  Jok-e Okuꞌ sijaꞌ-e, dop-e Okuꞌ deꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Most certainly, I tell you, he who believes in me has eternal life.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ, iyoh kakuꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: I am the bread of life.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.

verses.text: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.
verses.source_translation: sumuk babai ingan moꞌ man kueh manna takal-e aluaꞌ deꞌ padang pasil, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ obuaꞌ kobos.

verses.text: This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga adin ogiꞌ datiꞌ; Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man, iyoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ kobos.

verses.text: I am the living bread which came down out of heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. Yes, the bread which I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga, kueh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ man kueh itih yaꞌ nah-nah idip.  Kueh deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ manusia daang dunia idip iyoh leh dagin odop Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore contended with one another, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ bikaꞌi bikalah tipan odop-e, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Oni wat Iyoh yaꞌ ngin dagin-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ man-e?”

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you don’t have life in yourselves.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, simoꞌ diꞌ ingan man dagin Onak Manusia duoh nuak doyaꞌ-E, idoh diꞌ ingan yaꞌ bonal-bonal idip.

verses.text: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man dagin Kuꞌ duoh nuak doyaꞌ Kuꞌ, iyoh kakuꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, duoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ iyoh paliꞌ idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia.

verses.text: For my flesh is food indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e dagin Kuꞌ pinguman deꞌ sibonal-e duoh doyaꞌ Kuꞌ pingunuak deꞌ sibonal-e.

verses.text: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood lives in me, and I in him.
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man dagin Kuꞌ duoh nuak doyaꞌ Kuꞌ, iyoh idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ duoh iyoh.

verses.text: As the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father; so he who feeds on me, he will also live because of me.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ deꞌ ngin idip inoh, moꞌ pait Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ moꞌ idip odaꞌ Samaꞌ.  Wat inoh geh nyaꞌa deꞌ man dagin Kuꞌ yaꞌ idip odaꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: This is the bread which came down out of heaven—not as our fathers ate the manna, and died. He who eats this bread will live forever.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ itih leh kueh deꞌ muun soꞌ siluga: idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ kueh deꞌ man sumuk babai ingan, dop-e odop-e deꞌ man kueh inoh tuang kobos geh.  Pak-e osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ man kueh itih, iyoh yaꞌ idip nah-nah.”

verses.text: He said these things in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ pingunang itih Yesus tanon-e takal-e ngajal deꞌ topat simayang agama Yahudi deꞌ Kapernaum.

verses.text: Therefore many of his disciples, when they heard this, said, “This is a hard saying! Who can listen to it?”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e mokuaꞌ ngojit pingajal Yesus inoh, bogoꞌ soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Pingajal itih sikiya baat.  Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod tilimaꞌ.”

verses.text: But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said to them, “Does this cause you to stumble?
verses.source_translation: Daang otin-E Yesus puꞌan nang pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E bikutuk-bigonom deꞌ in inoh.  Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Pingajal kuꞌ itih kaso pikil ingan keh?

verses.text: Then what if you would see the Son of Man ascending to where he was before?
verses.source_translation: Oni jadin-e simoꞌ ingan ningaꞌ Onak Manusia paliꞌ maꞌad keꞌ topat-E soꞌ-e nog?

verses.text: It is the spirit who gives life. The flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit, and are life.
verses.source_translation: Iyang Topaꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ manusia idip.  Odop manusia diꞌ-e tapod odaꞌ manusia idip.  Pingunang deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan inoh soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, pingunang deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.

verses.text: But there are some of you who don’t believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who didn’t believe, and who it was who would betray him.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.” (Dop-e Yesus moꞌ dioꞌ puꞌan osi deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh osi deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E.)

verses.text: He said, “For this cause I have said to you that no one can come to me, unless it is given to him by my Father.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ, “Inoh leh ngan Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod nog tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, simoꞌ Samaꞌ diꞌ-e ngin tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: At this, many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.
verses.source_translation: Mulai takal inoh bogoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ buu togan Yesus, diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nunaꞌ-E.

verses.text: Jesus said therefore to the twelve, “You don’t also want to go away, do you?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan inoh, “Podo ingan yaꞌ togan Okuꞌ geh?”

verses.text: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Tuduꞌ osi koꞌih yaꞌ odi? Pingunang Ingan yohleh pingunang deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: We have come to believe and know that you are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih moꞌ bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ duoh puꞌan nang Ingan leh deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ, deꞌ pait-E.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Didn’t I choose you, the twelve, and one of you is a devil?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ pilih ingan deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan itih, pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan itih Laja Muat munua.”

verses.text: Now he spoke of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, for it was he who would betray him, being one of the twelve.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nang Yesus inoh yohleh Yudas, onak Simon Iskariot, dop-e iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E, tiap iyoh inoh niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ simoong duwoh naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus.

chapters.text: After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias. A great multitude followed him, because they saw his signs which he did on those who were sick. Jesus went up into the mountain, and he sat there with his disciples. Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was at hand. Jesus therefore lifting up his eyes, and seeing that a great multitude was coming to him, said to Philip, “Where are we to buy bread, that these may eat?” This he said to test him, for he himself knew what he would do. Philip answered him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for them, that everyone of them may receive a little.” One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him, “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these among so many?” Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in that place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand. Jesus took the loaves; and having given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; likewise also of the fish as much as they desired. When they were filled, he said to his disciples, “Gather up the broken pieces which are left over, that nothing be lost.” So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which were left over by those who had eaten. When therefore the people saw the sign which Jesus did, they said, “This is truly the prophet who comes into the world.” Jesus therefore, perceiving that they were about to come and take him by force, to make him king, withdrew again to the mountain by himself. When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea, and they entered into the boat, and were going over the sea to Capernaum. It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them. The sea was tossed by a great wind blowing. When therefore they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia,  they saw Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing near to the boat; and they were afraid. But he said to them, “It is I. Don’t be afraid.” They were willing therefore to receive him into the boat. Immediately the boat was at the land where they were going. On the next day, the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except the one in which his disciples had embarked, and that Jesus hadn’t entered with his disciples into the boat, but his disciples had gone away alone. However boats from Tiberias came near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks. When the multitude therefore saw that Jesus wasn’t there, nor his disciples, they themselves got into the boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus. When they found him on the other side of the sea, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you come here?” Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, you seek me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves, and were filled.   Don’t work for the food which perishes, but for the food which remains to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has sealed him.” They said therefore to him, “What must we do, that we may work the works of God?” Jesus answered them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he has sent.” They said therefore to him, “What then do you do for a sign, that we may see, and believe you? What work do you do? Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread out of heaven to eat.’” Jesus therefore said to them, “Most certainly, I tell you, it wasn’t Moses who gave you the bread out of heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread out of heaven.   For the bread of God is that which comes down out of heaven, and gives life to the world.” They said therefore to him, “Lord, always give us this bread.” Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.   But I told you that you have seen me, and yet you don’t believe.   All those whom the Father gives me will come to me. He who comes to me I will in no way throw out.   For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.   This is the will of my Father who sent me, that of all he has given to me I should lose nothing, but should raise him up at the last day.   This is the will of the one who sent me, that everyone who sees the Son, and believes in him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.” The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said, “I am the bread which came down out of heaven.” They said, “Isn’t this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How then does he say, ‘I have come down out of heaven?’”  Therefore Jesus answered them, “Don’t murmur among yourselves.   No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up in the last day.   It is written in the prophets, ‘They will all be taught by God.’   Therefore everyone who hears from the Father, and has learned, comes to me.   Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is from God. He has seen the Father.   Most certainly, I tell you, he who believes in me has eternal life.   I am the bread of life.   Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.   This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.   I am the living bread which came down out of heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. Yes, the bread which I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.” The Jews therefore contended with one another, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?” Jesus therefore said to them, “Most certainly I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you don’t have life in yourselves.   He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.   For my flesh is food indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.   He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood lives in me, and I in him.   As the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father; so he who feeds on me, he will also live because of me.   This is the bread which came down out of heaven—not as our fathers ate the manna, and died. He who eats this bread will live forever.” He said these things in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum. Therefore many of his disciples, when they heard this, said, “This is a hard saying! Who can listen to it?” But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said to them, “Does this cause you to stumble?   Then what if you would see the Son of Man ascending to where he was before?   It is the spirit who gives life. The flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit, and are life.   But there are some of you who don’t believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who didn’t believe, and who it was who would betray him. He said, “For this cause I have said to you that no one can come to me, unless it is given to him by my Father.” At this, many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him. Jesus said therefore to the twelve, “You don’t also want to go away, do you?” Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life. We have come to believe and know that you are the Christ, the Son of the living God.” Jesus answered them, “Didn’t I choose you, the twelve, and one of you is a devil?” Now he spoke of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, for it was he who would betray him, being one of the twelve.

verses.text: After these things, Jesus was walking in Galilee, for he wouldn’t walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ ponu keꞌ kota-kota deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Galilea.  Iyoh doliaꞌ-e ponu keꞌ kota-kota deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Yudea, dop-e deꞌ Yudea ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Iyoh.

verses.text: Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was at hand.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh moꞌ sinok onu ayuh ulang Yahudi deꞌ sobot-e nang Onu Ayuh Pondok Daun.

verses.text: His brothers therefore said to him, “Depart from here, and go into Judea, that your disciples also may see your works which you do.
verses.source_translation: Sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Lobih paguh muꞌu togan topat itih nyeꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Yudea, saꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Muꞌ tapod ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Muꞌ.

verses.text: For no one does anything in secret, and himself seeks to be known openly. If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world.”
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam Muꞌ laꞌan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ timogah, maꞌ yaꞌ suwan oniꞌ deꞌ nai Muꞌ, bitanga odop Muꞌ saꞌ suaꞌ manusia deꞌ dunia puꞌan-e.”

verses.text: For even his brothers didn’t believe in him.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Iyoh.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ, “Aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Kuꞌ, pak-e ingan siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e ponai odi.

verses.text: The world can’t hate you, but it hates me, because I testify about it, that its works are evil.
verses.source_translation: Manusia deꞌ dunia diꞌ-e tapod buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan.  Pak-e yoh buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ mala tanon tentang oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: You go up to the feast. I am not yet going up to this feast, because my time is not yet fulfilled.”
verses.source_translation: Odi negeh ingan daang onu ayuh inoh.  Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ odi dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: Having said these things to them, he stayed in Galilee.
verses.source_translation: In inoh leh Yesus sina tuduꞌ sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh sadiꞌ-E totap loꞌo deꞌ Galilea.

verses.text: But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he also went up, not publicly, but as it were in secret.
verses.source_translation: Takal sudiꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Onu Ayuh Pondok Daun, kudu-kudu onu-e mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus tuang odi geh, pak-e diꞌ-e tanon deꞌ osi-osi-e duoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan.

verses.text: The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, “Where is he?”
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ kalik Iyoh daang onu ayuh inoh, yohmoꞌ sina in-e, “Daki soꞌ Iyoh?”

verses.text: There was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others said, “Not so, but he leads the multitude astray.”
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bikayas-kayas tentang Iyoh.  Ogiꞌ deꞌ sina in-e, “Iyoh ulang deꞌ paguh.” Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ In-e, “Idoh! Iyoh tukang odaꞌ nyaꞌa bogoꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.”

verses.text: Yet no one spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ puus sina suang-suang in-e tentang Yesus, dop-e tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: But when it was now the middle of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
verses.source_translation: Takal lopot nyaꞌa nyamut Onu Ayuh, Yesus molot kaang limang Boli Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ ngajal nyaꞌa.

verses.text: The Jews therefore marveled, saying, “How does this man know letters, having never been educated?”
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ sukup ilan-e, yohmoꞌ sitipan odop-e in-e, “Oni nai nyaꞌa itih bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ puꞌan-e, tiap doiꞌ-e nak ogiꞌ sidoh-E bilajal kodaꞌ otoꞌ?”

verses.text: Jesus therefore answered them, “My teaching is not mine, but his who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop Kuꞌ, pak-e soꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: If anyone desires to do his will, he will know about the teaching, whether it is from God, or if I am speaking from myself.
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nai oni deꞌ laꞌan Iyoh, nyaꞌa inoh yaꞌ puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop Kuꞌ.

verses.text: He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory, but he who seeks the glory of him who sent him is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngajal oniꞌ soꞌ odop-e sadiꞌ-e, iyoh kalik odaꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ odop-e.  Pak-e simoꞌ Okuꞌ kalik saꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ, nyaꞌa dapod bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ duoh diꞌ Kuꞌ pibulaꞌ.

verses.text: Didn’t Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill me?”
verses.source_translation: Musa moꞌ ngin atulan Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh soꞌ ingan deꞌ nunaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ inoh.  Oni nai ingan kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Okuꞌ?”

verses.text: The multitude answered, “You have a demon! Who seeks to kill you?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E, “Ingan obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat! Osi deꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Ingan?”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I did one work, and you all marvel because of it.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Jok-e niꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ daang onu Sabat, pak-e ingan moꞌ ilan-e.

verses.text: Moses has given you circumcision (not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers), and on the Sabbath you circumcise a boy.
verses.source_translation: Musa ngin atulan odaꞌ ingan bisunat, inoh leh ngan-e ogiꞌ geh onu ingan bisunat nyaꞌa daang onu Sabat.  (Sibonal-e atulan bisunat inoh idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ Musa, pak-e soꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ Musa.)

verses.text: If a boy receives circumcision on the Sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with me, because I made a man completely healthy on the Sabbath?
verses.source_translation: Ingan bisunat nyaꞌa daang onu Sabat, saꞌ diꞌ ingan lawan atulan bisunat deꞌ soꞌ Musa.  Moꞌ-e wat inoh maꞌ ingan malah tuduꞌ Okuꞌ dop-e Okuꞌ odaꞌ gonan nyaꞌa deꞌ monam mokuaꞌ suaꞌ-e daang onu Sabat.

verses.text: Don’t judge according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.”
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tonga, pak-e motod leh pakai olan deꞌ bonal.”

verses.text: Therefore some of them of Jerusalem said, “Isn’t this he whom they seek to kill?
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yerusalem sina, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e Iyoh itih deꞌ obuah kalik odaꞌ ayua pimipin otoꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos-E?

verses.text: Behold, he speaks openly, and they say nothing to him. Can it be that the rulers indeed know that this is truly the Christ?
verses.source_translation: Suba ningaꞌ Iyoh sina suang-suang in-e, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ deꞌ nang oni-oni-e tuduꞌ-E.  Podo tok keh pimipin otoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang Iyoh inoh Laja Pinyilamat?

verses.text: However we know where this man comes from, but when the Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Nyaꞌa itih otoꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-E nog, pak-e moꞌ Laja Pinyilamat nog, doiꞌ osi-osi deꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki Iyoh nog.”

verses.text: Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching and saying, “You both know me, and know where I am from. I have not come of myself, but he who sent me is true, whom you don’t know.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ngajal deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh sina luꞌow-luꞌow-E in-e, “Tok ingan puꞌan osi Okuꞌ duoh soꞌ ki soꞌ Kuꞌ nog; pak-e Okuꞌ nog idoh diꞌ-e odop Kuꞌ deꞌ laꞌan.  Pak-e Okuꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Iyoh deꞌ dapod nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ daꞌ-E, deꞌ diꞌ ingan puꞌan-E.

verses.text: I know him, because I am from him, and he sent me.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ piluh Iyoh, dop-e Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Iyoh, duoh Iyoh leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: They sought therefore to take him; but no one laid a hand on him, because his hour had not yet come.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ takap Yesus, pak-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ supot yaꞌ nyonguam Iyoh, dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu-e.

verses.text: But of the multitude, many believed in him. They said, “When the Christ comes, he won’t do more signs than those which this man has done, will he?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Simoꞌ Laja Pinyilamat nog, dapod keh Iyoh nai lobih bogoꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ, soꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus itih?”

verses.text: The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest him.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ bikayas-kayas tentang Yesus.  Inoh leh ngan ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh ulang-ulang Farisi odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga Boli Topaꞌ takap Iyoh.

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “I will be with you a little while longer, then I go to him who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ tuui ogiꞌ duoh ingan.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: You will seek me, and won’t find me; and where I am, you can’t come.”
verses.source_translation: Ingan yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan tungang dapod Okuꞌ, dop-e diꞌ ingan tungang nog keꞌ topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi inoh.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore said among themselves, “Where will this man go that we won’t find him? Will he go to the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ sina sitipan odop-e, “Kaki soꞌ Iyoh yaꞌ odi, ngan-e nang otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tungang yaꞌ tapod odop-E? Oni keh Iyoh odi tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ sopaꞌ Israel, deꞌ kota-kota ulang Yunani, duoh ngajal ulang Yunani?

verses.text: What is this word that he said, ‘You will seek me, and won’t find me; and where I am, you can’t come’?”
verses.source_translation: Oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E in tih: ‘Ingan yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan tungang dapod Okuꞌ,’ duoh: ‘Diꞌ ingan tungang nog topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi inoh?’ ”

verses.text: Now on the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!
verses.source_translation: Daang onu piobuaꞌ Onu Ayuh Pondok Daun, yohleh onu deꞌ paling penting-e, Yesus moꞌ mokat mujuag deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina luꞌow-luꞌow-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ asong-e bodoh, nog leh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ saꞌ-e nuak!

verses.text: He who believes in me, as the Scripture has said, from within him will flow rivers of living water.”
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab, ‘Soꞌ aang otin-e paman piꞌin deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.’ ”

verses.text: But he said this about the Spirit, which those believing in him were to receive. For the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus wasn’t yet glorified.
verses.source_translation: Loti oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus inoh iyoh leh Iyang Topaꞌ, deꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.  Dop-e Iyang Topaꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah ngin, dop-e Yesus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah pakat ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo.

verses.text: Many of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said, “This is truly the prophet.”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Yesus moꞌ sina in-e, “Iyoh tih pasti Nabi deꞌ kajon toꞌ.”

verses.text: Others said, “This is the Christ.” But some said, “What, does the Christ come out of Galilee?
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ in-e, “Iyoh itih leh Laja Pinyilamat.” Pak-e in nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, “Idoh! Laja Pinyilamat doiꞌ-e nog soꞌ Galilea!

verses.text: Hasn’t the Scripture said that the Christ comes of the offspring of David,  and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”
verses.source_translation: Daang buk Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis nang Laja Pinyilamat inoh soꞌ onak sukun Laja Daud, duoh yaꞌ nog soꞌ Betlehem, kupuaꞌ topat Laja Daud obuah bilanak.”

verses.text: So there arose a division in the multitude because of him.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh moꞌ bikalah tentang Yesus.

verses.text: Some of them would have arrested him, but no one laid hands on him.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ takap Yesus, pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ puus kagian-E.

verses.text: The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, “Why didn’t you bring him?”
verses.source_translation: Takal ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ-e takap Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ, ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh ulang-ulang Farisi moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oni nai diꞌ ingan takap Iyoh toban katiꞌ?”

verses.text: The officers answered, “No man ever spoke like this man!”
verses.source_translation: Ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh koꞌih ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ sina in Iyoh inoh!”

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore answered them, “You aren’t also led astray, are you?
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang Farisi moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Podo ingan moꞌ suwaꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal odaꞌ Iyoh?

verses.text: Have any of the rulers believed in him, or of the Pharisees?
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ keh nyaꞌa deꞌ soꞌ pimipin-pimipin otoꞌ keh ulang-ulang Farisi keh deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E?

verses.text: But this multitude that doesn’t know the law is accursed.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh diꞌ-e puꞌan atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tulah!”

verses.text: Nicodemus (he who came to him by night, being one of them) said to them,
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ adon Nikodemus soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi, deꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e nog tuduꞌ Yesus.  Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,

verses.text: “Does our law judge a man, unless it first hears from him personally and knows what he does?”
verses.source_translation: “Podo atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa tanah odaꞌ otoꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa, simoꞌ-e aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ ngojit iyoh sina duoh aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ puꞌan oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e?”

verses.text: They answered him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search, and see that no prophet has arisen out of Galilee.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyinel Nikodemus in-e, “Podo muꞌu itih tuang ulang Galilea geh? Bilajal dioꞌ buk Kitab, saꞌ muꞌ puꞌan nang doiꞌ nabi deꞌ nog soꞌ Galilea!”

verses.text: Everyone went to his own house,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ motas keꞌ boli-e masim-masim.

chapters.text: After these things, Jesus was walking in Galilee, for he wouldn’t walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him. Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was at hand. His brothers therefore said to him, “Depart from here, and go into Judea, that your disciples also may see your works which you do. For no one does anything in secret, and himself seeks to be known openly. If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world.” For even his brothers didn’t believe in him. Jesus therefore said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always ready.   The world can’t hate you, but it hates me, because I testify about it, that its works are evil.   You go up to the feast. I am not yet going up to this feast, because my time is not yet fulfilled.” Having said these things to them, he stayed in Galilee. But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he also went up, not publicly, but as it were in secret. The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, “Where is he?” There was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him. Some said, “He is a good man.” Others said, “Not so, but he leads the multitude astray.” Yet no one spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews. But when it was now the middle of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple and taught. The Jews therefore marveled, saying, “How does this man know letters, having never been educated?” Jesus therefore answered them, “My teaching is not mine, but his who sent me.   If anyone desires to do his will, he will know about the teaching, whether it is from God, or if I am speaking from myself.   He who speaks from himself seeks his own glory, but he who seeks the glory of him who sent him is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.   Didn’t Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill me?” The multitude answered, “You have a demon! Who seeks to kill you?” Jesus answered them, “I did one work, and you all marvel because of it.   Moses has given you circumcision (not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers), and on the Sabbath you circumcise a boy.   If a boy receives circumcision on the Sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with me, because I made a man completely healthy on the Sabbath?   Don’t judge according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.”  Therefore some of them of Jerusalem said, “Isn’t this he whom they seek to kill? Behold, he speaks openly, and they say nothing to him. Can it be that the rulers indeed know that this is truly the Christ? However we know where this man comes from, but when the Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.” Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching and saying, “You both know me, and know where I am from. I have not come of myself, but he who sent me is true, whom you don’t know.   I know him, because I am from him, and he sent me.” They sought therefore to take him; but no one laid a hand on him, because his hour had not yet come. But of the multitude, many believed in him. They said, “When the Christ comes, he won’t do more signs than those which this man has done, will he?” The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him, and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest him. Then Jesus said, “I will be with you a little while longer, then I go to him who sent me.   You will seek me, and won’t find me; and where I am, you can’t come.” The Jews therefore said among themselves, “Where will this man go that we won’t find him? Will he go to the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks? What is this word that he said, ‘You will seek me, and won’t find me; and where I am, you can’t come’?” Now on the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me and drink!   He who believes in me, as the Scripture has said, from within him will flow rivers of living water.” But he said this about the Spirit, which those believing in him were to receive. For the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus wasn’t yet glorified. Many of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said, “This is truly the prophet.” Others said, “This is the Christ.” But some said, “What, does the Christ come out of Galilee? Hasn’t the Scripture said that the Christ comes of the offspring of David,  and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?” So there arose a division in the multitude because of him. Some of them would have arrested him, but no one laid hands on him. The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, “Why didn’t you bring him?” The officers answered, “No man ever spoke like this man!” The Pharisees therefore answered them, “You aren’t also led astray, are you? Have any of the rulers believed in him, or of the Pharisees? But this multitude that doesn’t know the law is accursed.” Nicodemus (he who came to him by night, being one of them) said to them, “Does our law judge a man, unless it first hears from him personally and knows what he does?” They answered him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search, and see that no prophet has arisen out of Galilee.” Everyone went to his own house,

verses.text: but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus odi keꞌ punguꞌ Zaitun.

verses.text: Now very early in the morning, he came again into the temple, and all the people came to him. He sat down, and taught them.
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e, suam-suam pagi Iyoh paliꞌ odi keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog tuduꞌ-E.  Yesus moꞌ guluꞌ, yohmoꞌ mulai ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: The scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman taken in adultery. Having set her in the middle,
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ toban dayung deꞌ obuah nisog biamai.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ dayung inoh mujuag deꞌ uun uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: they told him, “Teacher, we found this woman in adultery, in the very act.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ in odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, dayung itih obuah nisog biamai.

verses.text: Now in our law, Moses commanded us to stone such women. What then do you say about her?”
verses.source_translation: Atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa militah odaꞌ otoꞌ nyokad pakai batuh dayung-dayung deꞌ wat inoh nog-e kobos.  Oni wat-e moꞌ-e nunaꞌ pikil Ingan?”

verses.text: They said this testing him, that they might have something to accuse him of. But Jesus stooped down, and wrote on the ground with his finger.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian oniꞌ deꞌ in inoh madas ngan-e yaꞌ kalik sina Yesus deꞌ salah ngan-e nyalah-E.  Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyuduk yohmoꞌ nulis deꞌ tanaꞌ pakai tilinyuꞌ-E.

verses.text: But when they continued asking him, he looked up and said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him throw the first stone at her.”
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, Iyoh moꞌ mokat mujuag yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bidosa, iyoh leh deꞌ paling pidioꞌ-e nyokad dayung itih pakai batuh.”

verses.text: Again he stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ lagiꞌ nyuduk yohmoꞌ nulis deꞌ tanaꞌ.
