verses.text: They, when they heard it, being convicted by their conscience, went out one by one, beginning from the oldest, even to the last. Jesus was left alone with the woman where she was, in the middle.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit sina Yesus inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu ngaꞌ niꞌ ngaꞌ niꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ, mulai soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sukup nyoma.  Nyuang-nyuang-e duam Yesus sadiꞌ-e duoh dayung inoh deꞌ aluaꞌ deꞌ topat inoh.

verses.text: Jesus, standing up, saw her and said, “Woman, where are your accusers? Did no one condemn you?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mokat mujuag yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ dayung inoh in-E, “Oi dayung, ki mey soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tiꞌ-e neh? Doiꞌ yeh odop-e deꞌ ngukum muꞌu neh?”

verses.text: She said, “No one, Lord.” Jesus said, “Neither do I condemn you. Go your way. From now on, sin no more.”
verses.source_translation: Dayung inoh moꞌ nyawot Yesus in-e, “Doiꞌ.” Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ Kuꞌ ngukum muꞌu.  Paliꞌ negeh, mulai soꞌ adin maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai dosa.”

verses.text: Again, therefore, Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. He who follows me will not walk in the darkness, but will have the light of life.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina lagiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ in-E, “Okuꞌ leh jawaꞌ saꞌan manusia deꞌ dunia.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponu daang mopung, pak-e iyoh moꞌ ogiꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip.”

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore said to him, “You testify about yourself. Your testimony is not valid.”
verses.source_translation: Ulang Yahudi soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Ingan jadin tukang tanon tentang odop Ingan, jadin diꞌ koꞌih tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Ingan inoh.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Even if I testify about myself, my testimony is true, for I know where I came from, and where I am going; but you don’t know where I came from, or where I am going.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bial Okuꞌ jadin tukang tanon tentang odop Kuꞌ, pak-e oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ bonal, dop-e Okuꞌ puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ Kuꞌ nog duoh kaki soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi.  Pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan Okuꞌ nog soꞌ kaki duoh kaki soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi.

verses.text: You judge according to the flesh. I judge no one.
verses.source_translation: Ingan motod nang nyaꞌa salah duoh bonal nunaꞌ pikil odop ingan, pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah duoh bonal.

verses.text: Even if I do judge, my judgment is true, for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e simoꞌ Kuꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah duoh bonal, oniꞌ deꞌ motod Kuꞌ inoh bonal, dop-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ, Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.

verses.text: It’s also written in your law that the testimony of two people is valid.
verses.source_translation: Daang buk atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, ogiꞌ deꞌ in-e: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin tukang tanon tentang oni sijaꞌ-e, oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh tapod obuah tilimaꞌ.

verses.text: I am one who testifies about myself, and the Father who sent me testifies about me.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ duwoh deꞌ tukang tanon tentang Okuꞌ, keꞌ niꞌ-e odop Kuꞌ, deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: They said therefore to him, “Where is your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither me, nor my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father also.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Daki soꞌ Samaꞌ Ingan?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Ingan diꞌ ingan piluh bait Okuꞌ bait Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Simoꞌ ingan piluh Okuꞌ, totu ingan piluh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as he taught in the temple. Yet no one arrested him, because his hour had not yet come.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ sina deꞌ munoꞌ Yesus tanon-e takal-E ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ sinok kutak-kutak soꞌ nyaꞌa suad duit persembahan.  Pak-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ takap Iyoh, dop-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu-E.

verses.text: Jesus said therefore again to them, “I am going away, and you will seek me, and you will die in your sins. Where I go, you can’t come.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ buu yohmoꞌ ingan moꞌ yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e ingan yaꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh dosa ingan.  Doiꞌ ingan tungang nog topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore said, “Will he kill himself, because he says, ‘Where I am going, you can’t come’?”
verses.source_translation: Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina, “Oni keh Iyoh yaꞌ ngabos odop-E ngan-e nang sina deꞌ in-e, ‘Ingan diꞌ ingan tungang nog topat soꞌ Okuꞌ odi?’ ”

verses.text: He said to them, “You are from beneath. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan nog soꞌ douꞌ, Okuꞌ nog soꞌ somu; ingan nog soꞌ dunia itih, Okuꞌ idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ nog soꞌ dunia itih.

verses.text: I said therefore to you that you will die in your sins; for unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh leh ngan tiꞌ-e Okuꞌ tanon nang ingan yaꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh dosa ingan.  Dop-e simoꞌ diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ inoh leh odop-E, tok ingan yaꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh dosa ingan.”

verses.text: They said therefore to him, “Who are you?” Jesus said to them, “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Osi Ingan itih sibonal-e?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ silalu tanon tuduꞌ ingan tentang osi Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I have many things to speak and to judge concerning you. However he who sent me is true; and the things which I heard from him, these I say to the world.”
verses.source_translation: Aluaꞌ bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dapod Kuꞌ tanon-e ngan Kuꞌ nang ingan salah.  Pak-e Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ tapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-E.  Okuꞌ jok Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ manusia daang dunia oni deꞌ moꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Iyoh.”

verses.text: They didn’t understand that he spoke to them about the Father.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti nang Yesus tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tentang Samaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing of myself, but as my Father taught me, I say these things.
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan moꞌ paꞌad Onak Manusia deꞌ tun koyuh salip, ke ingan yaꞌ puꞌan nang Okuꞌ leh odop-E.  Ingan tuang yaꞌ puꞌan ingan geh nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ, idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ nai nunaꞌ soꞌ odop Kuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ, pak-e Okuꞌ jok Kuꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Samaꞌ Kuꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: He who sent me is with me. The Father hasn’t left me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to him.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.  Iyoh diꞌ-e tanah odaꞌ Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ silalu nai oniꞌ deꞌ nyonang otin-E.”

verses.text: As he spoke these things, many believed in him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to those Jews who had believed him, “If you remain in my word, then you are truly my disciples.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-E, “Simoꞌ ingan idip nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ, ingan bonal-bonal pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: You will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”
verses.source_translation: Ingan yaꞌ puꞌan pingajal deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ, duoh pingajal deꞌ bonal inoh yaꞌ odaꞌ ingan obuah pilopas.”

verses.text: They answered him, “We are Abraham’s offspring, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How do you say, ‘You will be made free’?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ onak sukun Abraham, doiꞌ sidoh koꞌih bikuli saꞌan osi-osi-e.  Oni loti sina deꞌ nang Ingan: ‘Ingan yaꞌ obuah pilopas?’ ”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, everyone who commits sin is the bondservant of sin.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, nyaꞌa deꞌ nai dosa-e obuah nguasa odaꞌ dosa-e, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin kuli deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai lopas soꞌ toke-e.

verses.text: A bondservant doesn’t live in the house forever. A son remains forever.
verses.source_translation: Kuli doiꞌ topat-e deꞌ totap daang lomin boli nyaꞌa soꞌ-e kiloja, pak-e onak silalu ogiꞌ topat-e daang lomin boli odop-e.

verses.text: If therefore the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, simoꞌ Onak inoh moꞌ pilopas ingan, ingan moꞌ bonal-bonal lopas.”

verses.text: I know that you are Abraham’s offspring, yet you seek to kill me, because my word finds no place in you.
verses.source_translation: “Okuꞌ puꞌan nang ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ onak sukun Abraham, pak-e ingan kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos Okuꞌ, dop-e ingan doliaꞌ ingan tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I say the things which I have seen with my Father; and you also do the things which you have seen with your father.”
verses.source_translation: Oni deꞌ ningaꞌ Kuꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, inoh leh oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ.  Wat inoh geh ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal samaꞌ ingan.”

verses.text: They answered him, “Our father is Abraham.” Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot Yesus in-e, “Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ onak-sukun Abraham.” In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ ingan bonal-bonal onak sukun Abraham, totu leh ingan nai oni deꞌ nai Abraham.

verses.text: But now you seek to kill me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham didn’t do this.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, pak-e ingan yaꞌ ngabos Okuꞌ.  Abraham doiꞌ yoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: You do the works of your father.” They said to him, “We were not born of sexual immorality. We have one Father, God.”
verses.source_translation: Ingan nai oniꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ nai odop samaꞌ ingan.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E in-e, “Idoh diꞌ koꞌih onak opang.  Samaꞌ koꞌih jok-e niꞌ, yohleh Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Therefore Jesus said to them, “If God were your father, you would love me, for I came out and have come from God. For I haven’t come of myself, but he sent me.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Simoꞌ Topaꞌ inoh Samaꞌ ingan, totu leh ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, adin Okuꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ.  Okuꞌ nog idoh diꞌ-e odop Kuꞌ deꞌ laꞌan, pak-e Iyoh leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: Why don’t you understand my speech? Because you can’t hear my word.
verses.source_translation: Oni nai ingan diꞌ ingan ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ? Dop-e diꞌ ingan ponai tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.

verses.text: You are of your father, the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and doesn’t stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks on his own; for he is a liar, and the father of lies.
verses.source_translation: Laja Muat inoh leh samaꞌ ingan, ingan yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan samaꞌ ingan inoh.  Soꞌ sibungas-e iyoh tukang ngabos manusia.  Iyoh diꞌ-e suka ajal deꞌ bonal, dop-e daang iyoh doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Moꞌ iyoh pibulaꞌ, inoh kan-e moꞌ gaya-e, dop-e iyoh inoh pibulaꞌ, samaꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pibulaꞌ.

verses.text: But because I tell the truth, you don’t believe me.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tuduꞌ ingan, yohleh ngan diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: Which of you convicts me of sin? If I tell the truth, why do you not believe me?
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ dapod ngin bukti nang Okuꞌ nai dosa? Moꞌ Okuꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, oni nai diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ?

verses.text: He who is of God hears the words of God. For this cause you don’t hear, because you are not of God.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, iyoh ngojit pingunang Topaꞌ, pak ingan diꞌ ingan nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, inoh leh ngan ingan doliaꞌ ingan ngojit-E.”

verses.text: Then the Jews answered him, “Don’t we say well that you are a Samaritan, and have a demon?”
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ nyawot Yesus, “Kan-e bonal oniꞌ deꞌ nang koꞌih, Muꞌu ulang Samaria deꞌ obuah nguasa muat.”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I don’t have a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat, pak-e Okuꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, pak-e ingan diꞌ ingan pimodo tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: But I don’t seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ kalik odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi odop Kuꞌ, pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ deꞌ kagaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi Okuꞌ, Iyoh geh deꞌ motod nang nyaꞌa salah atou bonal.

verses.text: Most certainly, I tell you, if a person keeps my word, he will never see death.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nunaꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ kobos.”

verses.text: Then the Jews said to him, “Now we know that you have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets; and you say, ‘If a man keeps my word, he will never taste of death.’
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi in-e duoh Yesus, “Adin koꞌih moꞌ puꞌan nang Muꞌu obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat.  Abraham moꞌ kobos, wat inoh geh ayua nabi.  Pak-e in Muꞌ: ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ kobos.’

verses.text: Are you greater than our father, Abraham, who died? The prophets died. Who do you make yourself out to be?”
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ Abraham sadiꞌ-e moꞌ kobos, nabi-nabi suaꞌ-e moꞌ kobos, Muꞌu odaꞌ odop Muꞌ samah kodaꞌ osi? Podo Muꞌu lobih penting soꞌ samaꞌ koꞌih Abraham?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me, of whom you say that he is our God.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ kalik odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi odop Kuꞌ, pudi inoh doiꞌ loti-e.  Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ mudi Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ nang ingan Topaꞌ odop ingan,

verses.text: You have not known him, but I know him. If I said, ‘I don’t know him,’ I would be like you, a liar. But I know him, and keep his word.
verses.source_translation: doiꞌ ingan nak puꞌan-E.  Pak-e Okuꞌ puꞌan Iyoh.  Simoꞌ Okuꞌ nang odop Kuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ puꞌan Iyoh, loti-e Okuꞌ tukang pibulaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ ingan.  Pak-e Okuꞌ puꞌan Iyoh duoh nunaꞌ pingunang-E.

verses.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day. He saw it, and was glad.”
verses.source_translation: Sumuk babai ingan Abraham sukup doon-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ nog.  Iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ-e, iyoh moꞌ doon otin-e.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore said to him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have you seen Abraham?”
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ in-e duoh Yesus, “Umul Muꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e limoh puluꞌ sowaꞌ, pak-e Muꞌu nang odop Muꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Abraham?”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Most certainly, I tell you, before Abraham came into existence, I AM.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, takal Abraham aluaꞌ doiꞌ, Okuꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ.”

verses.text: Therefore they took up stones to throw at him, but Jesus was hidden, and went out of the temple, having gone through the middle of them, and so passed by.
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit batuh yaꞌ nyokad Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos-E, pak-e Yesus moꞌ bisukan yohmoꞌ buu soꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.

chapters.text: but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives. Now very early in the morning, he came again into the temple, and all the people came to him. He sat down, and taught them. The scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman taken in adultery. Having set her in the middle, they told him, “Teacher, we found this woman in adultery, in the very act. Now in our law, Moses commanded us to stone such women. What then do you say about her?” They said this testing him, that they might have something to accuse him of. But Jesus stooped down, and wrote on the ground with his finger. But when they continued asking him, he looked up and said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him throw the first stone at her.”  Again he stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground. They, when they heard it, being convicted by their conscience, went out one by one, beginning from the oldest, even to the last. Jesus was left alone with the woman where she was, in the middle. Jesus, standing up, saw her and said, “Woman, where are your accusers? Did no one condemn you?” She said, “No one, Lord.” Jesus said, “Neither do I condemn you. Go your way. From now on, sin no more.” Again, therefore, Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. He who follows me will not walk in the darkness, but will have the light of life.” The Pharisees therefore said to him, “You testify about yourself. Your testimony is not valid.” Jesus answered them, “Even if I testify about myself, my testimony is true, for I know where I came from, and where I am going; but you don’t know where I came from, or where I am going.   You judge according to the flesh. I judge no one.   Even if I do judge, my judgment is true, for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent me.   It’s also written in your law that the testimony of two people is valid.  I am one who testifies about myself, and the Father who sent me testifies about me.” They said therefore to him, “Where is your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither me, nor my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father also.” Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as he taught in the temple. Yet no one arrested him, because his hour had not yet come. Jesus said therefore again to them, “I am going away, and you will seek me, and you will die in your sins. Where I go, you can’t come.”  The Jews therefore said, “Will he kill himself, because he says, ‘Where I am going, you can’t come’?” He said to them, “You are from beneath. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.   I said therefore to you that you will die in your sins; for unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”  They said therefore to him, “Who are you?” Jesus said to them, “Just what I have been saying to you from the beginning.   I have many things to speak and to judge concerning you. However he who sent me is true; and the things which I heard from him, these I say to the world.” They didn’t understand that he spoke to them about the Father. Jesus therefore said to them, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing of myself, but as my Father taught me, I say these things.   He who sent me is with me. The Father hasn’t left me alone, for I always do the things that are pleasing to him.” As he spoke these things, many believed in him. Jesus therefore said to those Jews who had believed him, “If you remain in my word, then you are truly my disciples.   You will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”  They answered him, “We are Abraham’s offspring, and have never been in bondage to anyone. How do you say, ‘You will be made free’?” Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, everyone who commits sin is the bondservant of sin.   A bondservant doesn’t live in the house forever. A son remains forever.   If therefore the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed.   I know that you are Abraham’s offspring, yet you seek to kill me, because my word finds no place in you.   I say the things which I have seen with my Father; and you also do the things which you have seen with your father.” They answered him, “Our father is Abraham.” Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham.   But now you seek to kill me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham didn’t do this.   You do the works of your father.” They said to him, “We were not born of sexual immorality. We have one Father, God.” Therefore Jesus said to them, “If God were your father, you would love me, for I came out and have come from God. For I haven’t come of myself, but he sent me.   Why don’t you understand my speech? Because you can’t hear my word.   You are of your father, the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and doesn’t stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks on his own; for he is a liar, and the father of lies.   But because I tell the truth, you don’t believe me.   Which of you convicts me of sin? If I tell the truth, why do you not believe me?   He who is of God hears the words of God. For this cause you don’t hear, because you are not of God.” Then the Jews answered him, “Don’t we say well that you are a Samaritan, and have a demon?” Jesus answered, “I don’t have a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.   But I don’t seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges.   Most certainly, I tell you, if a person keeps my word, he will never see death.” Then the Jews said to him, “Now we know that you have a demon. Abraham died, and the prophets; and you say, ‘If a man keeps my word, he will never taste of death.’ Are you greater than our father, Abraham, who died? The prophets died. Who do you make yourself out to be?” Jesus answered, “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me, of whom you say that he is our God.   You have not known him, but I know him. If I said, ‘I don’t know him,’ I would be like you, a liar. But I know him, and keep his word.   Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day. He saw it, and was glad.” The Jews therefore said to him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have you seen Abraham?” Jesus said to them, “Most certainly, I tell you, before Abraham came into existence, I AM.” Therefore they took up stones to throw at him, but Jesus was hidden, and went out of the temple, having gone through the middle of them, and so passed by.

verses.text: As he passed by, he saw a man blind from birth.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ponu, Iyoh ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ soꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e bitiiaꞌ-a.

verses.text: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, osi deꞌ nai dosa-e, odop nyaꞌa itih keh, pingoma-e keh, ngan yoh butaꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e bitiiaꞌ-a?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Neither did this man sin, nor his parents; but, that the works of God might be revealed in him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Iyoh butaꞌ idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ dosa odop-e, idoh geh diꞌ-e odaꞌ dosa pingoma-e, pak-e saꞌ nyaꞌa dapod ningaꞌ kiloja Topaꞌ kiloja daang polong-e.

verses.text: I must work the works of him who sent me, while it is day. The night is coming, when no one can work.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu aluaꞌ jawaꞌ otoꞌ halus nai kiloja Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.  Onu ngalom yaꞌ nog, takal inoh niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai kiloja.

verses.text: While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Okuꞌ aluaꞌ daang dunia, Okuꞌ leh jawaꞌ saꞌan manusia deꞌ dunia.”

verses.text: When he had said this, he spat on the ground, made mud with the saliva, anointed the blind man’s eyes with the mud,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Iyoh moꞌ ngujaꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ nai tanaꞌ lunyak pakai loyang-E.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ gasak deꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which means “Sent”). So he went away, washed, and came back seeing.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Odi mamiaꞌ jowin muꞌ deꞌ pagung Siloam.” Siloam loti-e, ‘Deꞌ obuah pait’.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ odi mamiaꞌ jowin-e.  Takal iyoh paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e, iyoh moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.

verses.text: The neighbors therefore, and those who saw that he was blind before, said, “Isn’t this he who sat and begged?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bilinok boli-e duoh boli iyoh baya suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh tukang mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ sina in-e si odop-e , “Idoh keh diꞌ-e iyoh itih nyaꞌa deꞌ lika guluꞌ mitiaꞌ-mitiaꞌ duit soꞌ nyaꞌa?”

verses.text: Others were saying, “It is he.” Still others were saying, “He looks like him.” He said, “I am he.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sina nang, “Iyoh itih leh odop-e.” Pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nang, “Idoh, iyoh jok-e niꞌ mun duoh nyaꞌa inoh.” Pak-e odop nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Okuꞌ leh odop-e.”

verses.text: They therefore were asking him, “How were your eyes opened?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Oni wat-e ngan muꞌ ponai ningaꞌ?”

verses.text: He answered, “A man called Jesus made mud, anointed my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash.’ So I went away and washed, and I received sight.”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yesus inoh nai tanaꞌ lunyak, Iyoh moꞌ gasak deꞌ boton kuꞌ, yohmoꞌ in-e, ‘Odi mamiaꞌ jowin muꞌ keꞌ pagung Siloam.’ Yohmoꞌ okuꞌ moꞌ odi, takal okuꞌ mokuaꞌ mamiaꞌ jowin kuꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”

verses.text: Then they asked him, “Where is he?” He said, “I don’t know.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Daki soꞌ odop-E?” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan-e.”

verses.text: They brought him who had been blind to the Pharisees.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ butaꞌ boton-e inoh tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Farisi.

verses.text: It was a Sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.
verses.source_translation: Onu takal Yesus nai tanaꞌ lunyak duoh odaꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ inoh ponai ningaꞌ yohleh daang onu Sabat, onu Simayang ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received his sight. He said to them, “He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and I see.”
verses.source_translation: Yohleh ngan ulang-ulang Farisi sikian-e geh tuduꞌ-e, oni wat-e ngan iyoh ponai ningaꞌ.  Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Iyoh gasak tanaꞌ lunyak deꞌ boton kuꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh okuꞌ moꞌ mamiaꞌ jowin kuꞌ, yohmoꞌ okuꞌ moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”

verses.text: Some therefore of the Pharisees said, “This man is not from God, because he doesn’t keep the Sabbath.” Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” There was division among them.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ ulang Farisi inoh moꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih diꞌ-e nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e Iyoh moꞌ lawan atulan onu Sabat.” Pak-e ogiꞌ geh ulang Farisi deꞌ bokon deꞌ in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa diꞌ-e tapod nai tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa kodaꞌ deꞌ wat tih!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikalah siodop-e.

verses.text: Therefore they asked the blind man again, “What do you say about him, because he opened your eyes?” He said, “He is a prophet.”
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang Farisi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, “Oni in pikil muꞌ tentang Iyoh? Dop-e muꞌu moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ odaꞌ Iyoh.” Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Iyoh inoh nabi.”

verses.text: The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and had received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang deꞌ dioꞌ nyaꞌa inoh tok butaꞌ yohmoꞌ adin iyoh ponai ningaꞌ.  Yohleh ngan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mogan pingoma nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: and asked them, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh in-e, “Podo tok iyoh tih onak ingan? Tok bonal keh iyoh butaꞌ soꞌ takal iyoh obuah bilanak? Oni wat-e ngan-e adin iyoh ponai ningaꞌ?”

verses.text: His parents answered them, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;
verses.source_translation: Sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot in-e, “Tok iyoh onak koꞌih, iyoh tok butaꞌ soꞌ takal iyoh obuah bilanak.

verses.text: but how he now sees, we don’t know; or who opened his eyes, we don’t know. He is of age. Ask him. He will speak for himself.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e oni wat-e iyoh tapod ningaꞌ adin, diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e.  Osi deꞌ odaꞌ iyoh tapod ningaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan-e.  Iyoh moꞌ ayuh, sikian negeh tuduꞌ odop-e.  Odop-e sadiꞌ-e tapod nyawot ingan.”

verses.text: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if any man would confess him as Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.
verses.source_translation: Sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh ngan-e nang sina in inoh, dop-e yoh tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.  Dop-e pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi moꞌ bipokat, nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang Yesus inoh Laja Pinyilamat diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ soꞌon molot kaang boli topat simayang.

verses.text: Therefore his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan sinoꞌ samaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh sina nang, “Iyoh moꞌ ayuh, sikian negeh tuduꞌ odop-e.”

verses.text: So they called the man who was blind a second time, and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner.”
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ mogan baꞌuh keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Bijanyi leh muꞌu yaꞌ sina bonal.  Koꞌih puꞌan nang Nyaꞌa inoh ulang bidosa.”

verses.text: He therefore answered, “I don’t know if he is a sinner. One thing I do know: that though I was blind, now I see.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni keh Iyoh ulang bidosa keh idoh, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan-e.  Pak-e niꞌ deꞌ puꞌan kuꞌ, deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ butaꞌ, adin moꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.”

verses.text: They said to him again, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Oni deꞌ nai-E tuduꞌ muꞌu? Wat ki wat-E odaꞌ muꞌu ponai ningaꞌ?”

verses.text: He answered them, “I told you already, and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You don’t also want to become his disciples, do you?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh nyawot-e, “Moꞌ mokuaꞌ kuꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan, pak-e doliaꞌ ingan ngojit-e.  Oni nai ingan yaꞌ ngojit-e lagiꞌ? Kodaꞌ oni' deꞌ ingan yaꞌ jadin pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.”

verses.text: They insulted him and said, “You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nguyat nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh in-e, “Muꞌu leh pinunaꞌ-E, pak-e koꞌih idoh! Koꞌih pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Musa.

verses.text: We know that God has spoken to Moses. But as for this man, we don’t know where he comes from.”
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih puꞌan nang deꞌ dioꞌ Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Musa, pak-e tentang nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yesus inoh, diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-E nog.”

verses.text: The man answered them, “How amazing! You don’t know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ilan kuꞌ manah ingan, diꞌ ingan puꞌan soꞌ ki soꞌ-E nog, pak-e Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ ponai ningaꞌ.

verses.text: We know that God doesn’t listen to sinners, but if anyone is a worshiper of God, and does his will, he listens to him.
verses.source_translation: Otoꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌ doliaꞌ-e ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa, pak-e Topaꞌ jok-e ngojit nyaꞌa deꞌ tunuak tuduꞌ-E duoh nai oni deꞌ laꞌan-E.

verses.text: Since the world began it has never been heard of that anyone opened the eyes of someone born blind.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ sibungas-e ogiꞌ dunia aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyeꞌ ngojit ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ soꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e bitiiaꞌ-a ponai ningaꞌ.

verses.text: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ nyaꞌa inoh diꞌ-e soꞌ Topaꞌ, Iyoh diꞌ-e tapod nai oni-oni-e.”

verses.text: They answered him, “You were altogether born in sins, and do you teach us?” They threw him out.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Muꞌu itih moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ dosa soꞌ takal muꞌ obuah bilanak geh! Bilani manah muꞌu yaꞌ ngajal koꞌih!” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kasig odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh luah.

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and finding him, he said, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus ngojit nang nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh obuah kasig soꞌ boli simayang.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ kalik nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, yohmoꞌ dapod-e daang-e sikian tuduꞌ-e in-E, “Podo muꞌu bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Onak Manusia?”

verses.text: He answered, “Who is he, Lord, that I may believe in him?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ nyawot-E, “Podo Ingan puꞌan osi odop-E? Tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have both seen him, and it is he who speaks with you.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mokuaꞌ butaꞌ inoh, “Muꞌu moꞌ ningaꞌ odop-E.  Iyoh leh deꞌ sina duoh muꞌu adin.”

verses.text: He said, “Lord, I believe!” and he worshiped him.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ, Topaꞌ.” Iyoh moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin Yesus ngan-e nyomah Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment, that those who don’t see may see; and that those who see may become blind.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ nog kaang dunia saꞌ-e tonga nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal duoh deꞌ salah.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai ningaꞌ jadin butaꞌ.”

verses.text: Those of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things, and said to him, “Are we also blind?”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Farisi danoꞌ ngojit Yesus sina in inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Podo Ingan nang koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ butaꞌ geh?”

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ nyam ingan butaꞌ idoh diꞌ ingan bidosa.  Pak-e ngan ingan nang, ‘Koꞌih ponai ningaꞌ,’ inoh loti-e ingan aluaꞌ bidosa.”

chapters.text: As he passed by, he saw a man blind from birth. His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?” Jesus answered, “Neither did this man sin, nor his parents; but, that the works of God might be revealed in him.   I must work the works of him who sent me, while it is day. The night is coming, when no one can work.   While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.” When he had said this, he spat on the ground, made mud with the saliva, anointed the blind man’s eyes with the mud, and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which means “Sent”). So he went away, washed, and came back seeing. The neighbors therefore, and those who saw that he was blind before, said, “Isn’t this he who sat and begged?” Others were saying, “It is he.” Still others were saying, “He looks like him.” He said, “I am he.” They therefore were asking him, “How were your eyes opened?” He answered, “A man called Jesus made mud, anointed my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash.’ So I went away and washed, and I received sight.” Then they asked him, “Where is he?” He said, “I don’t know.” They brought him who had been blind to the Pharisees. It was a Sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes. Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received his sight. He said to them, “He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and I see.” Some therefore of the Pharisees said, “This man is not from God, because he doesn’t keep the Sabbath.” Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” There was division among them. Therefore they asked the blind man again, “What do you say about him, because he opened your eyes?” He said, “He is a prophet.” The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and had received his sight, until they called the parents of him who had received his sight, and asked them, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?” His parents answered them, “We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind; but how he now sees, we don’t know; or who opened his eyes, we don’t know. He is of age. Ask him. He will speak for himself.” His parents said these things because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if any man would confess him as Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue. Therefore his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.” So they called the man who was blind a second time, and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner.” He therefore answered, “I don’t know if he is a sinner. One thing I do know: that though I was blind, now I see.” They said to him again, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?” He answered them, “I told you already, and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You don’t also want to become his disciples, do you?” They insulted him and said, “You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses. We know that God has spoken to Moses. But as for this man, we don’t know where he comes from.” The man answered them, “How amazing! You don’t know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes. We know that God doesn’t listen to sinners, but if anyone is a worshiper of God, and does his will, he listens to him. Since the world began it has never been heard of that anyone opened the eyes of someone born blind. If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.” They answered him, “You were altogether born in sins, and do you teach us?” They threw him out. Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and finding him, he said, “Do you believe in the Son of God?” He answered, “Who is he, Lord, that I may believe in him?” Jesus said to him, “You have both seen him, and it is he who speaks with you.” He said, “Lord, I believe!” and he worshiped him. Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment, that those who don’t see may see; and that those who see may become blind.” Those of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things, and said to him, “Are we also blind?” Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.

verses.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, one who doesn’t enter by the door into the sheep fold, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
verses.source_translation: “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, osi sijaꞌ deꞌ molot daang topat domba loꞌo diꞌ-e molot soꞌ tiban-e, pak-e nyikoh soꞌ topat deꞌ bokon, iyoh inoh pinoku duoh pilapok.

verses.text: But one who enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ molot soꞌ aluang tiban, iyoh inoh gembala domba.

verses.text: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.
verses.source_translation: Jok-e saꞌan gembala inoh leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang jaga topat domba loꞌo bukaꞌ tiban.  Suaꞌ domba-e ngojit bogan gembala-e yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ-e takal iyoh mogan adon domba-e masim-masim duoh nutuan toban domba-e luah.

verses.text: Whenever he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.
verses.source_translation: Takal suaꞌ domba deꞌ kakuꞌ-e moꞌ luah, gembala inoh ponu dioꞌ nuaꞌ jowin, yohmoꞌ suaꞌ domba-e bitunaꞌ duoh-e, dop-e suaꞌ domba-e piluh sina-e.

verses.text: They will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him; for they don’t know the voice of strangers.”
verses.source_translation: Domba-domba-e doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.  Domba-domba-e makin tilajak buu dop-e diꞌ-e piluh sina nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon inoh.”

verses.text: Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they didn’t understand what he was telling them.
verses.source_translation: Yesus ngajal pakai nang silita itih, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ silita-E.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Most certainly, I tell you, I am the sheep’s door.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal, Okuꞌ leh tiban saꞌan suaꞌ domba deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: All who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn’t listen to them.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nog dioꞌ soꞌ Okuꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh pinoku duoh pilapok, domba-domba tuang doliaꞌ-e geh nunaꞌ sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: I am the door. If anyone enters in by me, he will be saved, and will go in and go out, and will find pasture.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ leh tiban; suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ silamat.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ molot duoh luah baya tapod padang duh deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.
verses.source_translation: Pinoku nog jok-e ngan-e yaꞌ noku, ngabos, duoh katuab.  Okuꞌ nog saꞌ domba-domba kuꞌ dapod idip.  Idip deꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai kulang oni-oni-e.

verses.text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ leh gembala deꞌ paguh.  Gembala deꞌ paguh sangup kobos ngan-e nyilamat domba-domba-e.

verses.text: He who is a hired hand, and not a shepherd, who doesn’t own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and flees. The wolf snatches the sheep, and scatters them.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah ngupah deꞌ diꞌ-e gembala domba yaꞌ bikoduh buu takal kosuang tolun nog, dop-e domba-domba inoh diꞌ-e tung odop-e.  Kosuang tolun moꞌ bitakap duoh domba-domba deꞌ munoꞌ ngilajak odaꞌ sobak sobul buu.

verses.text: The hired hand flees because he is a hired hand, and doesn’t care for the sheep.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh bikoduh buu dop-e iyoh jok-e kiloja ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon pah-e, yoh diꞌ-e piduli domba-domba deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and I’m known by my own;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ leh gembala deꞌ paguh.  Okuꞌ piluh domba-domba Kuꞌ, wat noh geh domba-domba Kuꞌ piluh Okuꞌ.

verses.text: even as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I lay down my life for the sheep.
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ piluh Okuꞌ duoh Okuꞌ tuang piluh Kuꞌ geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ sangup kobos ngan Kuꞌ nyilamat domba-domba Kuꞌ.

verses.text: I have other sheep, which are not of this fold. I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. They will become one flock with one shepherd.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tuang ogiꞌ geh domba-domba Kuꞌ deꞌ bokon deꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌ kaban domba itih.  Domba-domba deꞌ bokon deꞌ munoꞌ halus Okuꞌ nutuan-e geh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ngojit sina Kuꞌ.  Soꞌ duwoh kaban domba inoh moꞌ tikuluk jadin niꞌ kaban duoh niꞌ gembala-e.

verses.text: Therefore the Father loves me, because I lay down my life,  that I may take it again.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ dop-e Okuꞌ sangup ngin idip Kuꞌ, ngan Kuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ soꞌon idip Kuꞌ.

verses.text: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down by myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father.”
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ nyaꞌa dapod mit asong Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ ngin asong Kuꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa Kuꞌ ngin asong duoh ogiꞌ kuasa Kuꞌ paliꞌ mit-e.  Inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e.”

verses.text: Therefore a division arose again among the Jews because of these words.
verses.source_translation: Sina Yesus deꞌ in inoh moꞌ odaꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi bikaꞌi bikalah lagiꞌ si odop-e.

verses.text: Many of them said, “He has a demon, and is insane! Why do you listen to him?”
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in-e, “Iyoh obuah nguasa odaꞌ muat munua duoh moꞌ bakoꞌ, oni nai ingan ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E?”

verses.text: Others said, “These are not the sayings of one possessed by a demon. It isn’t possible for a demon to open the eyes of the blind, is it?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nang in-e, “Idoh diꞌ-e in inoh sina nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah nguasa muat neh.  Dapod yeh bih muat odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai ningaꞌ?”

verses.text: It was the Feast of the Dedication at Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ Yerusalem nyaꞌa julah-e nyamut Onu Ayuh Lesmi Boli Topaꞌ.  Takal inoh musim modud.

verses.text: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.
verses.source_translation: Yesus ponu-ponu deꞌ topat deꞌ nang-e Awah Salomo, deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: The Jews therefore came around him and said to him, “How long will you hold us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi nog mujuag kilulung Yesus duoh sina tuduꞌ-E in-e, “Oni tian-e lagiꞌ Ingan odaꞌ koꞌih pikajon-kajon? Tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih osi sibonal-e Ingan itih.  Suang-suang negeh in nyeꞌ tanon-e simoꞌ-e Ingan inoh tok Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ moꞌ obuah janyi Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you don’t believe. The works that I do in my Father’s name, these testify about me.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan pak-e diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ.  Kiloja-kiloja deꞌ nai Kuꞌ pakai kuasa soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, inoh leh deꞌ jadin bukti osi Okuꞌ itih.

verses.text: But you don’t believe, because you are not of my sheep, as I told you.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ dop-e ingan diꞌ-e domba-domba Kuꞌ.

verses.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.
verses.source_translation: Domba-domba Kuꞌ ngojit sina Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ piluh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, duoh yoh nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I give eternal life to them. They will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ mutuab duoh doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ ponai ngilatak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ tongan Kuꞌ.

verses.text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father’s hand.
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ Kuꞌ leh deꞌ moꞌ ngin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, Iyoh inoh lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e, duoh niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ tapod ngilatak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ tongan Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.

verses.text: I and the Father are one.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ duoh Samaꞌ yohleh niꞌ geh.”

verses.text: Therefore Jews took up stones again to stone him.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ mit lagiꞌ batuh ngan-e yaꞌ nyokad Yesus ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos-E.

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ bogoꞌ kiloja deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai Kuꞌ deꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Soꞌ suaꞌ kiloja deꞌ munoꞌ, ki kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ ingan yaꞌ nyokad Okuꞌ pakai batuh?”

verses.text: The Jews answered him, “We don’t stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy: because you, being a man, make yourself God.”
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang Yahudi inoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ kiloja deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai Ingan koꞌih yaꞌ nyokad Ingan pakai batuh, pak-e Ingan moꞌ nguyat Topaꞌ.  Ingan manusia, pak-e Ingan moꞌ tanon nang odop Ingan samah duoh Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Isn’t it written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods?’
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Daang buk Kitab ingan, ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis in-e: In Topaꞌ, ‘Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ kodaꞌ Topaꞌ.’

verses.text: If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture can’t be broken),
verses.source_translation: Otoꞌ puꞌan nang oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab idoh diꞌ-e ponai bilubah.  Daang buk Kitab inoh Topaꞌ nang ‘Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ kodaꞌ Topaꞌ’ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ pingunang-E.

verses.text: do you say of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God?’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ moꞌ obuah pilih duoh moꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Moꞌ-e wat inoh, oni nai ingan nang Okuꞌ nguyat Topaꞌ ngan Kuꞌ nang Okuꞌ Onak Topaꞌ?

verses.text: If I don’t do the works of my Father, don’t believe me.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ Kuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nai kiloja-kiloja deꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: But if I do them, though you don’t believe me, believe the works; that you may know and believe that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ Okuꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, ingan halus bisayaꞌ deꞌ kiloja deꞌ munoꞌ.  Bial diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, ingan halus bisayaꞌ deꞌ kiloja deꞌ munoꞌ.  Saꞌ ingan puꞌan duoh ngiloti, nang Samaꞌ ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, wat noh geh Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang Samaꞌ.”

verses.text: They sought again to seize him, and he went out of their hand.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suba takap Yesus, pak-e diꞌ-e soꞌon-E.

verses.text: He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and there he stayed.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus odi lagiꞌ keꞌ polad sungi Yordan, keꞌ topat deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ soꞌ Yohanes baptis nyaꞌa, Yesus moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ.

verses.text: Many came to him. They said, “John indeed did no sign, but everything that John said about this man is true.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ-E.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sina siodop-e in-e , “Sungu Yohanes diꞌ-e nai tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa, pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e tentang nyaꞌa itih tok bonal.”

verses.text: Many believed in him there.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

chapters.text: “Most certainly, I tell you, one who doesn’t enter by the door into the sheep fold, but climbs up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.   But one who enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.   The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out.   Whenever he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.   They will by no means follow a stranger, but will flee from him; for they don’t know the voice of strangers.” Jesus spoke this parable to them, but they didn’t understand what he was telling them. Jesus therefore said to them again, “Most certainly, I tell you, I am the sheep’s door.   All who came before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep didn’t listen to them.   I am the door. If anyone enters in by me, he will be saved, and will go in and go out, and will find pasture.   The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.   I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.   He who is a hired hand, and not a shepherd, who doesn’t own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and flees. The wolf snatches the sheep, and scatters them.   The hired hand flees because he is a hired hand, and doesn’t care for the sheep.   I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and I’m known by my own;   even as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. I lay down my life for the sheep.   I have other sheep, which are not of this fold. I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. They will become one flock with one shepherd.   Therefore the Father loves me, because I lay down my life,  that I may take it again.   No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down by myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father.” Therefore a division arose again among the Jews because of these words. Many of them said, “He has a demon, and is insane! Why do you listen to him?” Others said, “These are not the sayings of one possessed by a demon. It isn’t possible for a demon to open the eyes of the blind, is it?” It was the Feast of the Dedication at Jerusalem. It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon’s porch. The Jews therefore came around him and said to him, “How long will you hold us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.” Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you don’t believe. The works that I do in my Father’s name, these testify about me.   But you don’t believe, because you are not of my sheep, as I told you.   My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.   I give eternal life to them. They will never perish, and no one will snatch them out of my hand.   My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them out of my Father’s hand.   I and the Father are one.” Therefore Jews took up stones again to stone him. Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?” The Jews answered him, “We don’t stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy: because you, being a man, make yourself God.” Jesus answered them, “Isn’t it written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods?’  If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came (and the Scripture can’t be broken),   do you say of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God?’   If I don’t do the works of my Father, don’t believe me.   But if I do them, though you don’t believe me, believe the works; that you may know and believe that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.”  They sought again to seize him, and he went out of their hand. He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and there he stayed. Many came to him. They said, “John indeed did no sign, but everything that John said about this man is true.” Many believed in him there.

verses.text: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister, Martha.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ dali deꞌ adon Lazarus, iyoh monam.  Iyoh loꞌo samah-samah duoh madih-e deꞌ dayung, deꞌ adon   , deꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania.

verses.text: It was that Mary who had anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother, Lazarus, was sick.
The sisters therefore sent to him, saying, “Lord, behold, he for whom you have great affection is sick.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ soꞌ duwoh madih-e pait gah tuduꞌ Yesus nang in-e, “Gulu, iyoh deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Ingan, monam.”

verses.text: But when Jesus heard it, he said, “This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that God’s Son may be glorified by it.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ngojit gah inoh, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Onam inoh idoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ odaꞌ yoh kobos, pak-e onam inoh ogiꞌ saꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ ayuh, saꞌ nyaꞌa mudi duoh pimodo tuduꞌ Onak Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.
verses.source_translation: Tok bonal Yesus ngibalaꞌ Marta, Maria, duoh Lazarus,

verses.text: When therefore he heard that he was sick, he stayed two days in the place where he was.
verses.source_translation: pak-e takal Yesus ngojit gah nang Lazarus monam, Iyoh saji-e loꞌo duwoh onu lagiꞌ deꞌ topat inoh.

verses.text: Then after this he said to the disciples, “Let’s go into Judea again.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ke Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Jaꞌ mey otoꞌ paliꞌ odi lagiꞌ keꞌ Yudea.”

verses.text: The disciples told him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just trying to stone you, and are you going there again?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyawot, “Gulu, baꞌuh geh ulang-ulang Yahudi yaꞌ nyokad Ingan pakai batuh ngan-e yaꞌ ngabos Ingan, adin Ingan yaꞌ paliꞌ lagiꞌ kanih?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Aren’t there twelve hours of daylight? If a man walks in the day, he doesn’t stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e pakai nang silita, “Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ tolu.  Idoh keh diꞌ-e onu jawaꞌ simoong duwoh jam daang niꞌ onu? Nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu daang onu jawaꞌ iyoh diꞌ-e simikiak dop-e iyoh kilin jawaꞌ deꞌ dunia itih.

verses.text: But if a man walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light isn’t in him.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu daang onu ngalom, iyoh simikiak dop-e doiꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ kilin-e.”

verses.text: He said these things, and after that, he said to them, “Our friend, Lazarus, has fallen asleep, but I am going so that I may awake him out of sleep.”
verses.source_translation: In inoh leh in Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Dingan otoꞌ Lazarus moꞌ boꞌos, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi kanoꞌ ngan Kuꞌ odaꞌ iyoh ngooh.”

verses.text: The disciples therefore said, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will recover.”
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, moꞌ Lazarus boꞌos, iyoh yaꞌ mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e.”

verses.text: Now Jesus had spoken of his death, but they thought that he spoke of taking rest in sleep.
verses.source_translation: Sibonal-e Yesus tanon nang Lazarus moꞌ kobos, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ baꞌ-e nang Yesus nang Lazarus boꞌos biasa.

verses.text: So Jesus said to them plainly then, “Lazarus is dead.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan Yesus moꞌ sina tanon deꞌ sibonal-e, in-E, “Lazarus moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. Nevertheless, let’s go to him.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌ sonang dop-e Okuꞌ doiꞌ danoꞌ takal inoh.  Dop-e ogiꞌ paguh-e saꞌan ingan, saꞌ ingan dapod bisayaꞌ.  Adin, jaꞌ otoꞌ odi tuduꞌ Lazarus.”

verses.text: Thomas therefore, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, “Let’s go also, that we may die with him.”
verses.source_translation: Tomas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nang Didimus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ dingan-dingan-e deꞌ samah-samah jadin pinunaꞌ Yesus, “Jaꞌ otoꞌ suwaꞌ odi duoh Gulu, saꞌ otoꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh-E!”

verses.text: So when Jesus came, he found that he had been in the tomb four days already.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus nog sinok kupuaꞌ Betania, Iyoh moꞌ ngojit soꞌ nyaꞌa nang todang Lazarus moꞌ pat onu daang kubul.

verses.text: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away.
verses.source_translation: Betania diꞌ-e sikiya juuaꞌ soꞌ Yerusalem, kulang lobih taluh kilometel geh.

verses.text: Many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to console them concerning their brother.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌ Marta duoh Maria ngan-e yaꞌ ngilibul odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ susah otin-e odaꞌ madih-e deꞌ dali deꞌ moꞌ doiꞌ.

verses.text: Then when Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met him, but Mary stayed in the house.
verses.source_translation: Takal Marta ngojit nang Yesus moꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ nog, iyoh lasuꞌ odi bitapod duoh Yesus, pak-e Maria loꞌo deꞌ boli.

verses.text: Therefore Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.
verses.source_translation: Marta moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, simoꞌ ingan ogiꞌ datiꞌ takal inoh, pasti madih kuꞌ deꞌ dali itih diꞌ-e kobos.

verses.text: Even now I know that, whatever you ask of God, God will give you.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin tuang puꞌan kuꞌ geh nang Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Ingan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ Ingan tuduꞌ-E.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Marta, “Madih muꞌ deꞌ dali yaꞌ paliꞌ mokat idip.”

verses.text: Martha said to him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”
verses.source_translation: In Marta tuduꞌ-E, “Puꞌan kuꞌ nang iyoh yaꞌ paliꞌ mokat idip takal piobuaꞌ dunia takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa paliꞌ mokat idip.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will still live, even if he dies.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos paliꞌ mokat idip duoh deꞌ ngin idip tuduꞌ nyaꞌa.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh yaꞌ idip bial-e moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ idip duoh deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e yaꞌ kobos.  Bisayaꞌ yeh muꞌu duoh sina deꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih?”

verses.text: She said to him, “Yes, Lord. I have come to believe that you are the Christ, God’s Son, he who comes into the world.”
verses.source_translation: Marta moꞌ nyawot-E, “Gulu, okuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Ingan Onak Topaꞌ, Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ nog kaang dunia.”

verses.text: When she had said this, she went away, and called Mary, her sister, secretly, saying, “The Teacher is here, and is calling you.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh Marta moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e yohmoꞌ mogan Maria, madih-e deꞌ dayung.  Marta moꞌ bikayas tuduꞌ-e in-e, “Gulu ogiꞌ danih, Iyoh mitiaꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu odi kanih.”

verses.text: When she heard this, she arose quickly, and went to him.
verses.source_translation: Maria ngojit deꞌ in inoh iyoh lasuꞌ mokat yohmoꞌ odi bitapod duoh Yesus.

verses.text: Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was in the place where Martha met him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Yesus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog kupuaꞌ inoh, Iyoh aluaꞌ deꞌ topat soꞌ Marta bitapod duoh-E.

verses.text: Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and were consoling her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog keꞌ boli Maria ngan-e yaꞌ ngilibul-e.  Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ Maria mokat yohmoꞌ likas-likas luah soꞌ boli-e, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh-e, dop-e baꞌ-e nang Maria odi siꞌian keꞌ kubul.

verses.text: Therefore when Mary came to where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying to him, “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Maria nog deꞌ topat Yesus duoh ningaꞌ-E, iyoh moꞌ bikunyug deꞌ sulung jowin-E daang-e in-e, “Gulu, simoꞌ Ingan ogiꞌ datiꞌ takal inoh, pasti madih kuꞌ deꞌ dali diꞌ-e kobos.”

verses.text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews weeping who came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ Maria siꞌian, ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ suwaꞌ nog duoh Maria suwaꞌ geh siꞌian, otin Yesus moꞌ sukup nyam susah-E duoh ngilobuꞌ.

verses.text: and said, “Where have you laid him?” They told him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-E, “Daki soꞌ ingan ngubul-e?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Gulu, jaꞌ otoꞌ odi ningaꞌ kubul-e.”

verses.text: Jesus wept.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ duwan siꞌian-E.

verses.text: The Jews therefore said, “See how much affection he had for him!”
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Ningaꞌ, Iyoh sukup ngibalaꞌ Lazarus.”

verses.text: Some of them said, “Couldn’t this man, who opened the eyes of him who was blind, have also kept this man from dying?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ in-e, “Iyoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ butaꞌ ponai kilin.  Sipatut-e Iyoh tuang ponai geh odaꞌ Lazarus mokuaꞌ soꞌ onam-e saꞌ-e diꞌ-e kobos.”

verses.text: Jesus therefore, again groaning in himself, came to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone lay against it.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ ngilobuꞌ otin-E, yohmoꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.  Kubul inoh lubang gua deꞌ kuab nyaꞌa pakai batuh deꞌ ayuh.

verses.text: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Sigian batuh inoh.” Marta madih nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos inoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, iyoh moꞌ pat onu daang kubul, iyoh moꞌ buꞌun moduaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believed, you would see God’s glory?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Moꞌ mokuaꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu nang moꞌ muꞌu bisayaꞌ, muꞌu yaꞌ ningaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh-e!”

verses.text: So they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, “Father, I thank you that you listened to me.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sigian batuh inoh.  Yesus moꞌ bigalong keꞌ longit simadi-E sina, “Samaꞌ, Okuꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Ingan dop-e Ingan moꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I know that you always listen to me, but because of the multitude standing around I said this, that they may believe that you sent me.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ puꞌan nang Ingan silalu ngojit Okuꞌ, pak-e Okuꞌ nang in itih saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ saꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Ingan leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: When he had said this, he cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Iyoh moꞌ mogan Lazarus dolas-dolas-e in-e, “Lazarus luah mey!”

verses.text: He who was dead came out, bound hand and foot with wrappings, and his face was wrapped around with a cloth. Jesus said to them, “Free him, and let him go.”
verses.source_translation: Dali deꞌ kobos inoh moꞌ luah soꞌ aang lubang gua deꞌ jadin kubul-e.  Soꞌ duwoh tongan poꞌon-e aluaꞌ bibolut kain todang duoh jowin-e obuah nutu pakai sapu tongan.  Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bukaꞌ leh kain-kain deꞌ molut gonan-e, nyeꞌ moꞌ tanah saꞌ-e buu.”

verses.text: Therefore many of the Jews, who came to Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ soꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog tuduꞌ Maria moꞌ ningaꞌ oni deꞌ nai Yesus.  Bogoꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: But some of them went away to the Pharisees, and told them the things which Jesus had done.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi tuduꞌ uluk ulang Farisi ngan-e tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus inoh.

verses.text: The chief priests therefore and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said, “What are we doing? For this man does many signs.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh uluk ulang Farisi ngijaꞌ Pengadilan Agama tikuluk.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Oni mey wat toꞌ neh? Nyaꞌa itih bogoꞌ nai tanda-tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa!

verses.text: If we leave him alone like this, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ toꞌ tanah Iyoh deꞌ wat itih, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ pimipin ulang Roma yaꞌ nog ngasul Boli Topaꞌ duoh bangsa otoꞌ!”

verses.text: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all,
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ adon Kayafas deꞌ jadin Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh takal sowaꞌ inoh.  Iyoh sina in-e, “Ingan diꞌ ingan puꞌan oni-oni-e!

verses.text: nor do you consider that it is advantageous for us that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation not perish.”
verses.source_translation: Ingan diꞌ ingan bingoon nang paguh dooꞌ kaꞌan ingan, niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa kobos saꞌan bangsa otoꞌ, saꞌ suaꞌ bangsa otoꞌ diꞌ-e mutuab.”

verses.text: Now he didn’t say this of himself, but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,
verses.source_translation: Sibonal-e sina deꞌ nang-e inoh, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop-e sadiꞌ-e.  Pak-e ngan iyoh deꞌ jadin Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sowaꞌ inoh, iyoh moꞌ tanon sibaya soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nang-e Yesus yaꞌ kobos saꞌan bangsa Yahudi.

verses.text: and not for the nation only, but that he might also gather together into one the children of God who are scattered abroad.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ kobos idoh diꞌ-e jok-e saꞌan bangsa Yahudi sijaꞌ-e, pak-e ngan-e nguluk onak-onak Topaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daki-daki sijaꞌ-a saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tikuluk.

verses.text: So from that day forward they took counsel that they might put him to death.
verses.source_translation: Mulai soꞌ onu inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabos Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews, but departed from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim. He stayed there with his disciples.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan Yesus diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bitanga odop-E deꞌ jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ soꞌ bangsa Yahudi.  Iyoh buu soꞌ kanoꞌ keꞌ kota deꞌ adon Efraim, deꞌ sinok padang pasil.  Iyoh moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ samah-samah duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E.

verses.text: Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand. Many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Onu Ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi moꞌ sinok, yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa soꞌ kupuaꞌ-kupuaꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem.  Dop-e nunaꞌ adat ulang Yahudi, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ halus kibisig odop-e takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Paskah.

verses.text: Then they sought for Jesus and spoke one with another, as they stood in the temple, “What do you think—that he isn’t coming to the feast at all?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kalik Yesus duoh simadi-e mujuag deꞌ limang Boli Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina tipan si odop-e in-e, “Oni nyam nunaꞌ pikil ingan, oni keh Iyoh yaꞌ nog keh idoh daang onu ayuh itih?”

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had commanded that if anyone knew where he was, he should report it, that they might seize him.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang in inoh dop-e pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ ngin pilitah, nang osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ puꞌan daki soꞌ Yesus, halus lapol saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod takap-E.

chapters.text: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister, Martha. It was that Mary who had anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother, Lazarus, was sick. The sisters therefore sent to him, saying, “Lord, behold, he for whom you have great affection is sick.” But when Jesus heard it, he said, “This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that God’s Son may be glorified by it.” Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus. When therefore he heard that he was sick, he stayed two days in the place where he was. Then after this he said to the disciples, “Let’s go into Judea again.” The disciples told him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just trying to stone you, and are you going there again?” Jesus answered, “Aren’t there twelve hours of daylight? If a man walks in the day, he doesn’t stumble, because he sees the light of this world.   But if a man walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light isn’t in him.” He said these things, and after that, he said to them, “Our friend, Lazarus, has fallen asleep, but I am going so that I may awake him out of sleep.” The disciples therefore said, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will recover.” Now Jesus had spoken of his death, but they thought that he spoke of taking rest in sleep. So Jesus said to them plainly then, “Lazarus is dead.   I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. Nevertheless, let’s go to him.” Thomas therefore, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, “Let’s go also, that we may die with him.” So when Jesus came, he found that he had been in the tomb four days already. Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away. Many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to console them concerning their brother. Then when Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met him, but Mary stayed in the house. Therefore Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn’t have died. Even now I know that, whatever you ask of God, God will give you.” Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.” Martha said to him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.” Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in me will still live, even if he dies.   Whoever lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?” She said to him, “Yes, Lord. I have come to believe that you are the Christ, God’s Son, he who comes into the world.” When she had said this, she went away, and called Mary, her sister, secretly, saying, “The Teacher is here, and is calling you.” When she heard this, she arose quickly, and went to him. Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was in the place where Martha met him. Then the Jews who were with her in the house, and were consoling her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.” Therefore when Mary came to where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying to him, “Lord, if you would have been here, my brother wouldn’t have died.” When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews weeping who came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled, and said, “Where have you laid him?” They told him, “Lord, come and see.” Jesus wept. The Jews therefore said, “See how much affection he had for him!” Some of them said, “Couldn’t this man, who opened the eyes of him who was blind, have also kept this man from dying?” Jesus therefore, again groaning in himself, came to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone lay against it. Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.” Jesus said to her, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believed, you would see God’s glory?” So they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, “Father, I thank you that you listened to me.   I know that you always listen to me, but because of the multitude standing around I said this, that they may believe that you sent me.”  When he had said this, he cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!” He who was dead came out, bound hand and foot with wrappings, and his face was wrapped around with a cloth. Jesus said to them, “Free him, and let him go.” Therefore many of the Jews, who came to Mary and saw what Jesus did, believed in him. But some of them went away to the Pharisees, and told them the things which Jesus had done. The chief priests therefore and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said, “What are we doing? For this man does many signs. If we leave him alone like this, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.” But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all, nor do you consider that it is advantageous for us that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation not perish.” Now he didn’t say this of himself, but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation, and not for the nation only, but that he might also gather together into one the children of God who are scattered abroad. So from that day forward they took counsel that they might put him to death. Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews, but departed from there into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim. He stayed there with his disciples. Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand. Many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves. Then they sought for Jesus and spoke one with another, as they stood in the temple, “What do you think—that he isn’t coming to the feast at all?” Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had commanded that if anyone knew where he was, he should report it, that they might seize him.

verses.text: Then six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, who had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.
verses.source_translation: Nuam onu takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e Onu Ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi, Yesus nog keꞌ kupuaꞌ Betania, topat Lazarus loꞌo.  Danoꞌ leh topat soꞌ Yesus odaꞌ Lazarus paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.

verses.text: So they made him a supper there. Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with him.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biluman ngan-e nyamut Yesus.  Marta suwaꞌ tulung katod pinguman.  Lazarus suwaꞌ man duoh Yesus baya nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: Mary, therefore, took a pound of ointment of pure nard, very precious, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.
verses.source_translation: Maria moꞌ mit sitengah litel inyuaꞌ wangi deꞌ maal loga-e deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ aat Narwastu.  Iyoh moꞌ duwan inyuaꞌ inoh deꞌ poꞌon Yesus, yohmoꞌ ngisuꞌ pakai buak-e saꞌ-e bodoh.  Aang boli inoh moꞌ suaꞌ-e wangi odaꞌ inyuaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: Then Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, one of his disciples, who would betray him, said,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yudas Iskariot, niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus, deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E moꞌ sina,

verses.text: “Why wasn’t this ointment sold for three hundred denarii, and given to the poor?”
verses.source_translation: “Oni nai diꞌ-e jua negeh inyuaꞌ wangi inoh taluh latus kiping pilak, duit-e tapod nyeꞌ ngin tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak?”

verses.text: Now he said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money box, used to steal what was put into it.
verses.source_translation: Yudas sina in inoh nak-e tok masiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak, pak-e saai odop-e pinoku.  Iyoh mala lika noku duit kas odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ kagian-e.

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of my burial.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus moꞌ sina, “Tanah negeh! Maria moꞌ dioꞌ nginyuaꞌ gonan Kuꞌ saꞌan onu takal Okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngubul.

verses.text: For you always have the poor with you, but you don’t always have me.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ botak mala ogiꞌ sinok ingan, jadin ingan ponai tulung-e siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e.  Pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ silalu ogiꞌ duoh ingan.”

verses.text: A large crowd therefore of the Jews learned that he was there, and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi ngojit nang Yesus ogiꞌ deꞌ Betania, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi kanoꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi idoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus sijaꞌ-e, pak-e yaꞌ ningaꞌ-e geh Lazarus deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ Yesus kidip-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.

verses.text: But the chief priests conspired to put Lazarus to death also,
verses.source_translation: Yoh leh ngan ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh yaꞌ ngabos-e geh Lazarus.

verses.text: because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi duoh Lazarus odaꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa togan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: On the next day a great multitude had come to the feast. When they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ nog yaꞌ nyamut onu ayuh Paskah moꞌ ngojit nang Yesus aluaꞌ deꞌ lopot olan nuju Yerusalem.

verses.text: they took the branches of the palm trees, and went out to meet him, and cried out, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of Israel!”
