verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kopog-kopog dowon-dowon koyuh deꞌ kodaꞌ dowon uwi yohmoꞌ odi nyamut Yesus simadi-e luꞌow-luꞌow sina, “Mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ siluga! Obuah bilokat Iyoh, Laja Israel deꞌ obuah pait daang adon Topaꞌ!

verses.text: Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written,
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mit keledai deꞌ mudaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ muat deꞌ tun-e.  Moꞌ jadi leh nunaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab:

verses.text: “Don’t be afraid, daughter of Zion. Behold, your King comes, sitting on a donkey’s colt.”
verses.source_translation: “Maꞌ tolu oi layat Yerusalem! Ningaꞌ Laja muꞌ nog, guluꞌ deꞌ tun keledai deꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ.”

verses.text: His disciples didn’t understand these things at first, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him, and that they had done these things to him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pak-e takal Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip yohmoꞌ maꞌad keꞌ Siluga, ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo, ke odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ natong nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadi tuduꞌ Yesus samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab.

verses.text: The multitude therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from the dead, was testifying about it.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ suwaꞌ duoh Yesus takal Iyoh mogan Lazarus odaꞌ luah soꞌ aang kubul duoh odaꞌ yoh paliꞌ idip, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ telus-telus silita oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: For this cause also the multitude went and met him, because they heard that he had done this sign.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odi nyamut Yesus, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngojit nang Yesus leh deꞌ moꞌ nai tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, “See how you accomplish nothing. Behold, the world has gone after him.”
verses.source_translation: Uluk ulang Farisi moꞌ sina tipan odop-e, “Suba ingan ningaꞌ-e! Sukup bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odi nunaꞌ Iyoh.  Otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tapod nai oni-oni-e!”

verses.text: Now there were certain Greeks among those that went up to worship at the feast.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ odi simayang keꞌ Yerusalem yaꞌ nyamut onu ayuh inoh, ogiꞌ geh kudu-kudu naan ulang Yunani.

verses.text: These, therefore, came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Filipus, ulang Betsaida deꞌ Galilea.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Koꞌih yaꞌ bitapod duoh Yesus.”

verses.text: Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn, Andrew came with Philip, and they told Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Filipus moꞌ odi tanon hal inoh tuduꞌ Andreas, odop-e deꞌ duwoh moꞌ odi tanon tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Moꞌ nog takal-e Onak Manusia yaꞌ obuah pakat ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Simoꞌ luang gandum diꞌ nyeꞌ puluah kaang tanaꞌ duoh kobos, iyoh totap jok-e niꞌ kiluang.  Pak-e simoꞌ kiluang gandum inoh kobos, ke yoh bogoꞌ buaꞌ-e.

verses.text: He who loves his life will lose it. He who hates his life in this world will keep it to eternal life.
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ nyayang asong-e daang dunia itih, iyoh yaꞌ mutuab, pak-e osi deꞌ diꞌ-e nyayang asong-e daang dunia itih, iyoh yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: If anyone serves me, let him follow me. Where I am, there will my servant also be. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ yaꞌ jadin pilayan Kuꞌ, yoh mesti nunaꞌ Okuꞌ saꞌ-e daki soꞌ Okuꞌ ogiꞌ yoh tuang ogiꞌ geh danoꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin pilayan Kuꞌ yaꞌ obuah pimodo odaꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.

verses.text: “Now my soul is troubled. What shall I say? ‘Father, save me from this time?’ But for this cause I came to this time.
verses.source_translation: Adin kila Kuꞌ susah.  Oni in oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nang Kuꞌ? Podo kuꞌ halus nang, ‘Samaꞌ pilopas leh Okuꞌ soꞌ susah jolaꞌ itih’? Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ ponai nang inoh, dop-e ngan Okuꞌ nog kaang dunia itih yaꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ itih.

verses.text: Father, glorify your name!” Then there came a voice out of the sky, saying, “I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.”
verses.source_translation: Samaꞌ bitanga leh kuasa Ingan deꞌ sukup ayuh-e!” Yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ sina Topaꞌ soꞌ siluga in-e, “Okuꞌ moꞌ bitanga kuasa Kuꞌ deꞌ ayuh yohmoꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ nai-e lagiꞌ.”

verses.text: The multitude therefore, who stood by and heard it, said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to him.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ suaꞌ-e klingah sowoꞌ inoh.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Inoh sowoꞌ dudu!” Pak-e ogiꞌ geh deꞌ sina, “Inoh sina malaikat soꞌ siluga sina tuduꞌ Iyoh!”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “This voice hasn’t come for my sake, but for your sakes.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Sowoꞌ inoh ingan kilingah-e idoh diꞌ-e saꞌan Okuꞌ, pak-e saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: Now is the judgment of this world. Now the prince of this world will be cast out.
verses.source_translation: Adin moꞌ nog takal-e Topaꞌ yaꞌ motod salah manusia deꞌ dunia itih.  Adin geh Iyoh odaꞌ Laja Muat Munua deꞌ nguasa dunia itih doiꞌ kuasa-e tiyaꞌ.

verses.text: And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e simoꞌ Okuꞌ obuah najul tun dunia itih, Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa nog tuduꞌ odop Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: But he said this, signifying by what kind of death he should die.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh sina in inoh ngan-e tanon oni wat Iyoh yaꞌ kobos.

verses.text: The multitude answered him, “We have heard out of the law that the Christ remains forever. How do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up?’ Who is this Son of Man?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-E, “Moꞌ-e nunaꞌ daang buk Kitab, Laja Pinyilamat yaꞌ idip nah-nah.  Koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih ngiloti-e oni nai Ingan ponai nang Onak Manusia halus obuah najul tun dunia itih saꞌ-a kobos? Osi Onak Manusia inoh?”

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them, “Yet a little while the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, that darkness doesn’t overtake you. He who walks in the darkness doesn’t know where he is going.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Duam jok-e niꞌ tiliaꞌ jawaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh ingan.  Ponuleh takal jawaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ ogiꞌ, saꞌ mopung diꞌ-e tang-tang nyokuab olan ingan.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ ponu daang mopung, diꞌ-e puꞌan kaki soꞌ-e yaꞌ odi.

verses.text: While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may become children of light.” Jesus said these things, and he departed and hid himself from them.
verses.source_translation: Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ jawaꞌ inoh, takal jawaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ ogiꞌ duoh ingan, saꞌ ingan jadin onak-onak deꞌ idip-e kodaꞌ jawaꞌ.” Mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Yesus moꞌ odi bisukan soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: But though he had done so many signs before them, yet they didn’t believe in him,
verses.source_translation: Bial-e bogoꞌ tanda deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ nai Yesus deꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke, “Lord, who has believed our report? To whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, moꞌ jadi leh deꞌ tanon nabi Yesaya, “Topaꞌ, osi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ gah deꞌ tanon koꞌih? Ingan moꞌ bitanga kuasa Ingan, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ totap doliaꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.”

verses.text: For this cause they couldn’t believe, for Isaiah said again,
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai bisayaꞌ, dop-e Yesaya tuang moꞌ sina geh in-e, “ In itih leh in Pingunang Topaꞌ,

verses.text: “He has blinded their eyes and he hardened their heart, lest they should see with their eyes, and perceive with their heart, and would turn, and I would heal them.”
verses.source_translation: ‘Okuꞌ odaꞌ boton odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ butaꞌ, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e tapod ningaꞌ, Okuꞌ ngolas otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e ponai ngiloti.  Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ponai ngiloti, totu diꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Wat noh leh Okuꞌ paliꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ paguh.’ ”

verses.text: Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory, and spoke of him.
verses.source_translation: Yesaya sina in inoh dop-e yoh moꞌ dioꞌ ningaꞌ kuasa Yesus deꞌ sukup ayuh-e, yoh ngan Yesaya sina tanon tentang Iyoh.

verses.text: Nevertheless even of the rulers many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they didn’t confess it, so that they wouldn’t be put out of the synagogue,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e bial-e wat inoh, bogoꞌ geh soꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e bilani suang-suang in-e ngakuꞌ-e, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu jak ulang-ulang Farisi jaman yoh molot kaang boli simayang.

verses.text: for they loved men’s praise more than God’s praise.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi lobih suka obuah mudi odaꞌ manusia.  Odop deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kalik pudi soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Jesus cried out and said, “Whoever believes in me, believes not in me, but in him who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina biluꞌow, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e jok-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: He who sees me sees him who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Osi deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ  Okuꞌ, moꞌ ningaꞌ-e geh Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes in me may not remain in the darkness.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ nog kaang dunia itih jadin jawaꞌ, saꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ loꞌo daang mopung.

verses.text: If anyone listens to my sayings, and doesn’t believe, I don’t judge him. For I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunang Kuꞌ, pak-e yoh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ-e, idoh diꞌ-e Okuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ motod nang iyoh salah.  Dop-e Okuꞌ nog idoh diꞌ-e ngan Kuꞌ yaꞌ motod nang manusia deꞌ dunia itih salah, pak-e ngan Kuꞌ nyilamat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: He who rejects me, and doesn’t receive my sayings, has one who judges him. The word that I spoke, the same will judge him in the last day.
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nulak Okuꞌ duoh diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ, moꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ motod nang yoh salah.  Pingunang deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ inoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ motod nang yoh salah.

verses.text: For I spoke not from myself, but the Father who sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Okuꞌ sina idoh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop Kuꞌ.  Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ tanon oni deꞌ halus Okuꞌ tanon-e.

verses.text: I know that his commandment is eternal life. The things therefore which I speak, even as the Father has said to me, so I speak.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ puꞌan pilitah-E inoh ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.  Yohleh ngan-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ, samah kodaꞌ deꞌ ngajal Samaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”

chapters.text: Then six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, who had been dead, whom he raised from the dead. So they made him a supper there. Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with him. Mary, therefore, took a pound of ointment of pure nard, very precious, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment. Then Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, one of his disciples, who would betray him, said, “Why wasn’t this ointment sold for three hundred denarii, and given to the poor?” Now he said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the money box, used to steal what was put into it. But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of my burial.   For you always have the poor with you, but you don’t always have me.” A large crowd therefore of the Jews learned that he was there, and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead. But the chief priests conspired to put Lazarus to death also, because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus. On the next day a great multitude had come to the feast. When they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem, they took the branches of the palm trees, and went out to meet him, and cried out, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of Israel!” Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written, “Don’t be afraid, daughter of Zion. Behold, your King comes, sitting on a donkey’s colt.” His disciples didn’t understand these things at first, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him, and that they had done these things to him. The multitude therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from the dead, was testifying about it. For this cause also the multitude went and met him, because they heard that he had done this sign. The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, “See how you accomplish nothing. Behold, the world has gone after him.” Now there were certain Greeks among those that went up to worship at the feast. These, therefore, came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.” Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn, Andrew came with Philip, and they told Jesus. Jesus answered them, “The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.   Most certainly I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.   He who loves his life will lose it. He who hates his life in this world will keep it to eternal life.   If anyone serves me, let him follow me. Where I am, there will my servant also be. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.  “Now my soul is troubled. What shall I say? ‘Father, save me from this time?’ But for this cause I came to this time.   Father, glorify your name!” Then there came a voice out of the sky, saying, “I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.” The multitude therefore, who stood by and heard it, said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to him.” Jesus answered, “This voice hasn’t come for my sake, but for your sakes.   Now is the judgment of this world. Now the prince of this world will be cast out.   And I, if I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.” But he said this, signifying by what kind of death he should die. The multitude answered him, “We have heard out of the law that the Christ remains forever. How do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up?’ Who is this Son of Man?” Jesus therefore said to them, “Yet a little while the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, that darkness doesn’t overtake you. He who walks in the darkness doesn’t know where he is going.   While you have the light, believe in the light, that you may become children of light.” Jesus said these things, and he departed and hid himself from them. But though he had done so many signs before them, yet they didn’t believe in him, that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke, “Lord, who has believed our report? To whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?” For this cause they couldn’t believe, for Isaiah said again, “He has blinded their eyes and he hardened their heart, lest they should see with their eyes, and perceive with their heart, and would turn, and I would heal them.” Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory, and spoke of him.  Nevertheless even of the rulers many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they didn’t confess it, so that they wouldn’t be put out of the synagogue, for they loved men’s praise more than God’s praise. Jesus cried out and said, “Whoever believes in me, believes not in me, but in him who sent me.   He who sees me sees him who sent me.   I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes in me may not remain in the darkness.   If anyone listens to my sayings, and doesn’t believe, I don’t judge him. For I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.   He who rejects me, and doesn’t receive my sayings, has one who judges him. The word that I spoke, the same will judge him in the last day.   For I spoke not from myself, but the Father who sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.   I know that his commandment is eternal life. The things therefore which I speak, even as the Father has said to me, so I speak.”

verses.text: Now before the feast of the Passover, Jesus, knowing that his time had come that he would depart from this world to the Father, having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ onu takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e Onu Ayuh Paskah Ulang Yahudi, Yesus puꞌan nang moꞌ sinok onu-e Iyoh yaꞌ buu soꞌ dunia itih tuduꞌ Samaꞌ-E.  Iyoh silalu ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ-E deꞌ dunia, Iyoh totap ngibalaꞌ-e nog piobuaꞌ idip-E.

verses.text: During supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray him,
verses.source_translation: Takal onu ngalom Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E man samah-samah, Laja Muat Munua moꞌ dioꞌ bikayas daang otin Yudas, onak Simon Iskariot, saꞌ-e jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E.

verses.text: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he came from God, and was going to God,
verses.source_translation: Yesus puꞌan nang Samaꞌ-E moꞌ ngin suaꞌ kuasa tuduꞌ odop-E.  Iyoh tuang puꞌan geh nang odop-E nog soꞌ Topaꞌ duoh yaꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: arose from supper, and laid aside his outer garments. He took a towel, and wrapped a towel around his waist.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ mokat mujuag, yohmoꞌ bukaꞌ jubah-E.  Yesus moꞌ mokos kain deꞌ kupuang-E.

verses.text: Then he poured water into the basin, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel that was wrapped around him.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ duwan piꞌin daang mepun, yohmoꞌ mulai mamiaꞌ poꞌon pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ kibadoh-e pakai kain deꞌ mokos-e deꞌ kupuang-E.

verses.text: Then he came to Simon Peter. He said to him, “Lord, do you wash my feet?”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ nog Petrus, Petrus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, idoh diꞌ-e patut Ingan deꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “You don’t know what I am doing now, but you will understand later.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Adin muꞌu aluaꞌ diꞌ muꞌ ngiloti oni deꞌ nai Kuꞌ itih, pak-e sunih onu-e ke muꞌu yaꞌ ngiloti-e.”

verses.text: Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet!” Jesus answered him, “If I don’t wash you, you have no part with me.”
verses.source_translation: In Petrus lagiꞌ, “Maꞌ, Gulu-e.  Diꞌ soꞌon Ingan yaꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon okuꞌ!” Pak-e Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon muꞌ, muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ bitolin duoh Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus sina lagiꞌ, “Simoꞌ-e wat inoh, Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e poꞌon kuꞌ sijaꞌ-e, pak-e tongan duoh bak kuꞌ geh!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Someone who has bathed only needs to have his feet washed, but is completely clean. You are clean, but not all of you.”
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ-e, “Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ mamuh, iyoh diꞌ-e pilelu mamiaꞌ gonan-e, jok-e poꞌon-e sijaꞌ-e, dop-e gonan-e moꞌ suaꞌ-e bisig.  Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ bisig, pak-e diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: For he knew him who would betray him, therefore he said, “You are not all clean.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus puꞌan osi pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ yaꞌ jua odop Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E.  Yohleh ngan Yesus nang in-e, “Ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ bisig, pak-e diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: So when he had washed their feet, put his outer garment back on, and sat down again, he said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ mamiaꞌ poꞌon odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ pakai jubah-E yohmoꞌ paliꞌ guluꞌ.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-E, “Puꞌan ingan keh idoh oniꞌ deꞌ gituang Kuꞌ mokuaꞌ nai-e tuduꞌ ingan?

verses.text: You call me, ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord.’ You say so correctly, for so I am.
verses.source_translation: Ingan sobot nang Okuꞌ Gulu duoh Pimipin deꞌ Ayuh, inoh suaꞌ-e bonal.

verses.text: If I then, the Lord and the Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ Okuꞌ, deꞌ jadin Pimipin deꞌ Ayuh duoh Gulu saꞌan ingan, mamiaꞌ poꞌon ingan, wat inoh geh ingan halus bigati-gati mamiaꞌ poꞌon siodop ingan.

verses.text: For I have given you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ ngin niꞌ tilodan tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan nai nunaꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, a servant is not greater than his lord, neither one who is sent greater than he who sent him.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Bala kuli diꞌ-e lobih penting soꞌ toke-e, wat inoh geh ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ toban sibaya diꞌ-e lobih penting soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait sibaya.

verses.text: If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih.  Simoꞌ ingan nai-e, ingan moꞌ yaꞌ doon.

verses.text: I don’t speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen. But that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with me has lifted up his heel against me.’
verses.source_translation: Oni deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih idoh diꞌ-e tentang suaꞌ ingan.  Okuꞌ puꞌan osi-osi deꞌ moꞌ pilih Kuꞌ.  Pak-e oni deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab halus jadi, ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ man samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ, yaꞌ lawan Okuꞌ.’

verses.text: From now on, I tell you before it happens, that when it happens, you may believe that I am he.
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ in inoh dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan adin, takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi, saꞌ-e takal oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi, ingan bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ inoh leh Odop-E deꞌ ogiꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, he who receives whomever I send, receives me; and he who receives me, receives him who sent me.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pait Kuꞌ, tilimaꞌ-e geh Okuꞌ.  Wat inoh geh osi sijaꞌ deꞌ tilimaꞌ Okuꞌ, tilimaꞌ-e geh Iyoh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: When Jesus had said this, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, “Most certainly I tell you that one of you will betray me.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, Yesus moꞌ sukup nyam kila-E susah.  Yesus moꞌ sina tanon in-E, “Tok bonal deꞌ nang Kuꞌ itih: Ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ jua Okuꞌ tuduꞌ musuh-musuh Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: The disciples looked at one another, perplexed about whom he spoke.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikiduang si odop-e daang-e sukup ilan-e, dop-e diꞌ-e puꞌan osi deꞌ nang Yesus inoh.

verses.text: One of his disciples, whom Jesus loved, was at the table, leaning against Jesus’ breast.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus guluꞌ sinok Yesus nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E.

verses.text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, and said to him, “Tell us who it is of whom he speaks.”
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus moꞌ ngin kode tuduꞌ-e, saꞌ-e sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, osi deꞌ nang Yesus inoh.

verses.text: He, leaning back, as he was, on Jesus’ breast, asked him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-E inoh moꞌ kos odop-e tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ sikian-e, “Gulu, osi bih odop-e neh?”

verses.text: Jesus therefore answered, “It is he to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it.” So when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ ngin Kuꞌ kueh deꞌ mokuaꞌ Kuꞌ suad daang makup, inoh leh odop-e.” Yesus moꞌ mit niꞌ sipiak kueh, yohmoꞌ suad daang makup, Iyoh moꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Yudas onak Simon Iskariot.

verses.text: After the piece of bread, then Satan entered into him. Then Jesus said to him, “What you do, do quickly.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yudas mokuaꞌ man kueh inoh, Laja Muat Munua moꞌ molot daang otin-e.  Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Nai likas-e oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai muꞌ.”

verses.text: Now no man at the table knew why he said this to him.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh soꞌ odop-e deꞌ guluꞌ man duoh Yesus deꞌ puꞌan oni nai Yesus sina in inoh tuduꞌ Yudas.

verses.text: For some thought, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus said to him, “Buy what things we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ odop-e deꞌ sakaꞌ nang Yesus odaꞌ Yudas odi milih oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu-e daang biluman onu ayuh inoh, atou Iyoh odaꞌ Yudas ngin oniꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak, dop-e Yudas deꞌ tukang kagian duit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore having received that morsel, he went out immediately. It was night.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ man kueh inoh, Yudas moꞌ lasuꞌ buu.  Takal inoh onu moꞌ ngalom.

verses.text: When he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man has been glorified, and God has been glorified in him.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yudas moꞌ buu, Yesus moꞌ sina, “Adin moꞌ nog onu-e nyaꞌa ningaꞌ nang Onak Manusia inoh sukup ayuh kuasa-E, duoh soꞌ Iyoh inoh leh nyaꞌa ningaꞌ nang sukup ayuh kuasa Topaꞌ.

verses.text: If God has been glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him immediately.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ nang sukup ayuh kuasa Topaꞌ daang Iyoh, odop Topaꞌ tuang yaꞌ bitanga-e geh tuduꞌ manusia nang sukup ayuh kuasa Onak Manusia inoh.  Diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tuui Topaꞌ yaꞌ bitanga nang kuasa Onak Manusia inoh sukup ayuh-e.

verses.text: Little children, I will be with you a little while longer. You will seek me, and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you can’t come,’ so now I tell you.
verses.source_translation: Onak-onak Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ tuui duoh ingan.  Ingan moꞌ yaꞌ kalik Okuꞌ, pak-e adin Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi, ‘Keꞌ topat Okuꞌ odi, ingan diꞌ ingan tapod odi.’

verses.text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also love one another.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ ngin pilitah deꞌ baꞌuh tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ tipan siodop ingan.  Samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan, wat inoh geh ingan halus ngibalaꞌ tipan siodop ingan.

verses.text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan samah-samah ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ puꞌan nang ingan pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered, “Where I am going, you can’t follow now, but you will follow afterwards.”
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, kaki Ingan yaꞌ odi?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Kaki soꞌ Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi, adin diꞌ muꞌ tapod suwaꞌ.  Pak-e tiaꞌ ijoꞌ muꞌu tuang kanoꞌ geh.”

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Gulu, oni nai okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod nunaꞌ Ingan adin? Okuꞌ siap kobos saꞌan Ingan.”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Will you lay down your life for me? Most certainly I tell you, the rooster won’t crow until you have denied me three times.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Tok bonal keh muꞌu siap yaꞌ kobos saꞌan Okuꞌ? Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu bonal-bonal, takal siuak aluaꞌ diꞌ-e bitadu, muꞌu moꞌ dioꞌ taluh sidoh nang odop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ!”

chapters.text: Now before the feast of the Passover, Jesus, knowing that his time had come that he would depart from this world to the Father, having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end. During supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray him, Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he came from God, and was going to God, arose from supper, and laid aside his outer garments. He took a towel, and wrapped a towel around his waist. Then he poured water into the basin, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel that was wrapped around him. Then he came to Simon Peter. He said to him, “Lord, do you wash my feet?” Jesus answered him, “You don’t know what I am doing now, but you will understand later.” Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet!” Jesus answered him, “If I don’t wash you, you have no part with me.”  Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!” Jesus said to him, “Someone who has bathed only needs to have his feet washed, but is completely clean. You are clean, but not all of you.”  For he knew him who would betray him, therefore he said, “You are not all clean.” So when he had washed their feet, put his outer garment back on, and sat down again, he said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?   You call me, ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord.’ You say so correctly, for so I am.   If I then, the Lord and the Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.   For I have given you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.   Most certainly I tell you, a servant is not greater than his lord, neither one who is sent greater than he who sent him.   If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.   I don’t speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen. But that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with me has lifted up his heel against me.’  From now on, I tell you before it happens, that when it happens, you may believe that I am he.   Most certainly I tell you, he who receives whomever I send, receives me; and he who receives me, receives him who sent me.” When Jesus had said this, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, “Most certainly I tell you that one of you will betray me.” The disciples looked at one another, perplexed about whom he spoke. One of his disciples, whom Jesus loved, was at the table, leaning against Jesus’ breast. Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, and said to him, “Tell us who it is of whom he speaks.” He, leaning back, as he was, on Jesus’ breast, asked him, “Lord, who is it?” Jesus therefore answered, “It is he to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it.” So when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot. After the piece of bread, then Satan entered into him. Then Jesus said to him, “What you do, do quickly.” Now no man at the table knew why he said this to him. For some thought, because Judas had the money box, that Jesus said to him, “Buy what things we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor. Therefore having received that morsel, he went out immediately. It was night. When he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man has been glorified, and God has been glorified in him.   If God has been glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him immediately.   Little children, I will be with you a little while longer. You will seek me, and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you can’t come,’ so now I tell you.   A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also love one another.   By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.” Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered, “Where I am going, you can’t follow now, but you will follow afterwards.” Peter said to him, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.” Jesus answered him, “Will you lay down your life for me? Most certainly I tell you, the rooster won’t crow until you have denied me three times.

verses.text: “Don’t let your heart be troubled. Believe in God. Believe also in me.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, “Maꞌ yaꞌ bigaduh kila muꞌ.  Bisayaꞌ leh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, bisayaꞌ geh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: In my Father’s house are many homes. If it weren’t so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.
verses.source_translation: Daang boli Samaꞌ Kuꞌ bogoꞌ topat soꞌ nyeꞌ loꞌo.  Okuꞌ paliꞌ kanih nyidia topat saꞌan ingan.  Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ sina in inoh tuduꞌ ingan simoꞌ-e doiꞌ topat.

verses.text: If I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and will receive you to myself; that where I am, you may be there also.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ Okuꞌ moꞌ odi kanoꞌ duoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ nyidia topat saꞌan ingan, Okuꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ nog mit ingan, saꞌ-e daki soꞌ Okuꞌ loꞌo ingan tuang danoꞌ geh.

verses.text: Where I go, you know, and you know the way.”
verses.source_translation: Keꞌ topat Kuꞌ odi, ingan moꞌ puꞌan olan-e.”

verses.text: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?”
verses.source_translation: Tomas moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Gulu, koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan kaki soꞌ Ingan odi, oni wat koꞌih yaꞌ puꞌan olan-e?”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus nyawot Tomas, “Okuꞌ leh olan ngan ingan odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ leh deꞌ tanon ajal deꞌ bonal.  Okuꞌ geh deꞌ ngin idip.  Jok-e soꞌ Okuꞌ nyaꞌa ponai odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, doiꞌ olan deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on, you know him, and have seen him.”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan piluh Okuꞌ, ingan tuang piluh geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Adin ingan moꞌ piluh Iyoh, duoh moꞌ ningaꞌ-E.”

verses.text: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us.”
verses.source_translation: Filipus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Gulu, bitanga Samaꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih, saꞌ koꞌih munuas.”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you such a long time, and do you not know me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father. How do you say, ‘Show us the Father?’
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e, “Filipus, idoh keh diꞌ muꞌ piluh Okuꞌ? Tiap moꞌ sukup tuui-e Okuꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan.  Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ, moꞌ ningaꞌ-e geh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Oni nai muꞌu nang, ‘Bitanga leh Samaꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih’?

verses.text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? The words that I tell you, I speak not from myself; but the Father who lives in me does his works.
verses.source_translation: Idoh keh diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang Samaꞌ, Samaꞌ ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ? Pingunang deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ odop Kuꞌ.  Pak-e Samaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ nai kiloja-E.

verses.text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me; or else believe me for the very works’ sake.
verses.source_translation: Bisayaꞌ negeh tuduꞌ Okuꞌ moꞌ Kuꞌ tanon nang Okuꞌ duoh Samaꞌ niꞌ geh.  Samaꞌ duoh Okuꞌ tuang niꞌ geh.  Atou simoꞌ diꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ inoh, bisayaꞌ leh dop-e ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nai Kuꞌ.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, he will do also; and he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, yoh tuang yaꞌ nai-e geh oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Kuꞌ.  Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh, pak-e ngan Okuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ lobih ayuh-e.

verses.text: Whatever you will ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
verses.source_translation: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan deꞌ odaꞌ ingan Okuꞌ nai-e pakai adon Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ nai saꞌan ingan, saꞌ Okuꞌ bitanga tuduꞌ ingan nang kuasa Samaꞌ sukup ayuh-e.

verses.text: If you will ask anything in my name, I will do it.
verses.source_translation: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan pakai adon Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ yaꞌ ngin-e.”

verses.text: If you love me, keep my commandments.
verses.source_translation: “Simoꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, ingan yaꞌ nai suaꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ.

verses.text: I will pray to the Father, and he will give you another Counselor,  that he may be with you forever,—
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ, saꞌ Iyoh pait Pinulung deꞌ bokon tuduꞌ ingan, deꞌ mala ogiꞌ duoh ingan.

verses.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world can’t receive; for it doesn’t see him, neither knows him. You know him, for he lives with you, and will be in you.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh inoh Iyang Topaꞌ, deꞌ yaꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ.  Manusia daang dunia diꞌ-e tapod tilimaꞌ Iyoh, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e kilin-E duoh diꞌ-e puꞌan-E.  Pak-e ingan puꞌan Iyoh, dop-e Yoh loꞌo duoh ingan, yohmoꞌ loꞌo daang ingan.

verses.text: I will not leave you orphans. I will come to you.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ yaꞌ togan ingan kodaꞌ tumang patu.  Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.
verses.source_translation: Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ manusia daang dunia itih diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ Okuꞌ.  Dop-e Okuꞌ idip, ingan tuang yaꞌ idip geh.

verses.text: In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ke ingan yaꞌ puꞌan-e nang Okuꞌ idip niꞌ daang Samaꞌ, ingan idip niꞌ daang Okuꞌ, duoh Okuꞌ idip niꞌ daang ingan.

verses.text: One who has my commandments, and keeps them, that person is one who loves me. One who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him, and will reveal myself to him.”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ suaꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ-e, iyoh leh deꞌ ngibala' Okuꞌ.  Simoꞌ nyaꞌa ngibala' Okuꞌ, Samaꞌ Kuꞌ yaꞌ ngibala' iyoh.  Okuꞌ tuang yaꞌ ngibalaꞌ geh iyoh duoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ bitanga odop Kuꞌ tuduꞌ-e.”

verses.text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, what has happened that you are about to reveal yourself to us, and not to the world?”
verses.source_translation: Yudas deꞌ bokon (idoh diꞌ-e Yudas Iskariot) moꞌ in-e, “Topaꞌ, oni nai Ingan yaꞌ bitanga odop Ingan tuduꞌ koꞌih, diꞌ Ingan bitanga tuduꞌ suaꞌ manusia daang dunia?”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If a man loves me, he will keep my word. My Father will love him, and we will come to him, and make our home with him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, yoh yaꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.  Samaꞌ Kuꞌ yaꞌ ngibalaꞌ iyoh.  Samaꞌ duoh Okuꞌ yaꞌ nog tuduꞌ-e yohmoꞌ loꞌo duoh iyoh.

verses.text: He who doesn’t love me doesn’t keep my words. The word which you hear isn’t mine, but the Father’s who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, iyoh diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.  Pingajal deꞌ ngojit ingan inoh, idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ Okuꞌ, pak-e soꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I have said these things to you, while still living with you.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan takal Kuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan.

verses.text: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things, and will remind you of all that I said to you.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Iyang Topaꞌ, Pinulung deꞌ yaꞌ pait Samaꞌ daang kuasa Okuꞌ, Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ ngajal ingan tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ duoh odaꞌ ingan natong suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, give I to you. Don’t let your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.
verses.source_translation: Idip bidanah Okuꞌ supiah tuduꞌ ingan, idip bidanah deꞌ nog soꞌ Okuꞌ inoh leh deꞌ ngin Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.  Deꞌ ngin Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ deꞌ ngin manusia daang dunia itih.  Maꞌ bigaduh, maꞌ tolu.

verses.text: You heard how I told you, ‘I go away, and I come to you.’ If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I said ‘I am going to my Father;’ for the Father is greater than I.
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ sina tanon nang, ‘Okuꞌ yaꞌ buu, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan.’ Simoꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, totu ingan sonang Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ, dop-e Samaꞌ lobih penting soꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: Now I have told you before it happens so that, when it happens, you may believe.
verses.source_translation: Adin geh Okuꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, takal oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e jadi', saꞌ-e takal-e jadi ingan puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tok bonal.

verses.text: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world comes, and he has nothing in me.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ sina bogoꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, dop-e Laja Muat Munua deꞌ nguasa dunia itih nog.  Iyoh sit tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ponai nguasa Okuꞌ.

verses.text: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi, saꞌ manusia daang dunia puꞌan nang Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Samaꞌ Okuꞌ nai-e.  Jaꞌ otoꞌ buu soꞌ katiꞌ adin.”

chapters.text: “Don’t let your heart be troubled. Believe in God. Believe also in me.   In my Father’s house are many homes. If it weren’t so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.   If I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and will receive you to myself; that where I am, you may be there also.   Where I go, you know, and you know the way.” Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?” Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.   If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on, you know him, and have seen him.” Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us.” Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you such a long time, and do you not know me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father. How do you say, ‘Show us the Father?’   Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? The words that I tell you, I speak not from myself; but the Father who lives in me does his works.   Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me; or else believe me for the very works’ sake.   Most certainly I tell you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, he will do also; and he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.   Whatever you will ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.   If you will ask anything in my name, I will do it.   If you love me, keep my commandments.   I will pray to the Father, and he will give you another Counselor,  that he may be with you forever,—  the Spirit of truth, whom the world can’t receive; for it doesn’t see him, neither knows him. You know him, for he lives with you, and will be in you.   I will not leave you orphans. I will come to you.   Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.   In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.   One who has my commandments, and keeps them, that person is one who loves me. One who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him, and will reveal myself to him.” Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, what has happened that you are about to reveal yourself to us, and not to the world?” Jesus answered him, “If a man loves me, he will keep my word. My Father will love him, and we will come to him, and make our home with him.   He who doesn’t love me doesn’t keep my words. The word which you hear isn’t mine, but the Father’s who sent me.   I have said these things to you, while still living with you.   But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things, and will remind you of all that I said to you.   Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, give I to you. Don’t let your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.   You heard how I told you, ‘I go away, and I come to you.’ If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I said ‘I am going to my Father;’ for the Father is greater than I.   Now I have told you before it happens so that, when it happens, you may believe.   I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world comes, and he has nothing in me.   But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.

verses.text: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.
verses.source_translation: Yesus sina lagiꞌ, “Okuꞌ leh tongon anggul deꞌ sibonal-e, duoh Samaꞌ Kuꞌ leh tukang kobon-e.

verses.text: Every branch in me that doesn’t bear fruit, he takes away. Every branch that bears fruit, he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ daꞌan Kuꞌ deꞌ jowoh, Samaꞌ Kuꞌ kopog-e, duoh suaꞌ daꞌan Kuꞌ deꞌ bibuaꞌ Iyoh sayan-e saꞌ buaꞌ-e pisong.

verses.text: You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ tawas odaꞌ pingajal deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can’t bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.
verses.source_translation: Totap leh idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Ingan.  Doiꞌ daꞌan deꞌ tapod bibuaꞌ simoꞌ-e sokiag soꞌ tongon-e, pak-e jok-e daꞌan deꞌ lokat duoh tongon-e deꞌ bibuaꞌ.  Wat inoh geh diꞌ ingan tapod bibuaꞌ simoꞌ diꞌ ingan totap idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I am the vine. You are the branches. He who remains in me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ leh tongon anggul, ingan daꞌan-daꞌan-e.  Simoꞌ nyaꞌa totap idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ idip niꞌ duoh iyoh, yoh yaꞌ pisong buaꞌ-e.  Simoꞌ-e diꞌ ingan idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, ingan diꞌ ingan ponai nai oni-oni-e.

verses.text: If a man doesn’t remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, throw them into the fire, and they are burned.
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ diꞌ-e idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, iyoh obuah tolan kodaꞌ daꞌan deꞌ obuah kopog yohmoꞌ jadin pisok, mokuaꞌ inoh nyaꞌa moꞌ nguluk-e ngan-e tolan kaang opui yohmoꞌ souh.

verses.text: If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, you will ask whatever you desire, and it will be done for you.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, yohmoꞌ pingunang Kuꞌ totap ogiꞌ daang otin ingan, mitiaꞌ oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ laꞌan ingan, ingan yaꞌ soꞌon-e.

verses.text: “In this is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit; and so you will be my disciples.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan bibuaꞌ pisong, Samaꞌ obuah pakat ngan-e yaꞌ obuah pimodo.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh ingan tok-tok pinunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Even as the Father has loved me, I also have loved you. Remain in my love.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, wat inoh geh Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.  Totap leh idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ, saꞌ ingan puꞌan nang Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.

verses.text: If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and remain in his love.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan nunaꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ totap ngibalaꞌ ingan, samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ totap ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ nunaꞌ pilitah-pilitah-E.

verses.text: I have spoken these things to you, that my joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be made full.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ Kuꞌ dioꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan suwaꞌ ngoon oni nyam kila Kuꞌ deꞌ doon, yohmoꞌ kila ingan deꞌ doon inoh moꞌ jadin punuaꞌ.

verses.text: “This is my commandment, that you love one another, even as I have loved you.
verses.source_translation: Itih leh pilitah Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan samah-samah ngibalaꞌ tipan odop ingan, samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ lobih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin asong-e saꞌan dingan-dingan-e.

verses.text: You are my friends, if you do whatever I command you.
verses.source_translation: Ingan leh dingan-dingan Kuꞌ, simoꞌ ingan nai oni deꞌ pilitah Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: No longer do I call you servants, for the servant doesn’t know what his lord does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I heard from my Father, I have made known to you.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ sobot ingan kuli, dop-e kuli diꞌ-e puꞌan oni deꞌ nai toke-e.  Okuꞌ sobot nang ingan dingan, dop-e Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngojit Kuꞌ soꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: You didn’t choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain; that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name, he may give it to you.
verses.source_translation: Idoh diꞌ-e ingan deꞌ pilih Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ deꞌ pilih ingan, duoh odaꞌ ingan odi saꞌ-e bibuaꞌ, buaꞌ-e inoh totap taan nah-nah.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh Samaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ingan oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ-E daang adon Okuꞌ.

verses.text: “I command these things to you, that you may love one another.
verses.source_translation: Itih leh pilitah Kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan: Saꞌ ingan samah-samah ngibalaꞌ sitipan odop ingan.”

verses.text: If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me before it hated you.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Simoꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan, natong negeh nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ dioꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam ingan niꞌ pikil duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ daang dunia, ingan yaꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dop-e ingan samah kodaꞌ onak odop-e.  Pak-e Okuꞌ moꞌ pilih ingan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia itih, ingan moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ niꞌ pikil duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.  Yoh ngan nyaꞌa daang dunia buꞌui tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A servant is not greater than his lord.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will also keep yours.
verses.source_translation: Natong negeh oniꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, ‘Bala kuli diꞌ-e lobih penting soꞌ toke-e.’ Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pijolaꞌ Okuꞌ, wat inoh geh yoh yaꞌ pijolaꞌ ingan.  Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ, yoh tuang yaꞌ nunaꞌ-e geh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal ingan.

verses.text: But all these things will they do to you for my name’s sake, because they don’t know him who sent me.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa daang dunia yaꞌ pijolaꞌ ingan, dop-e ingan moꞌ jadin pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ.  Dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e piluh Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nog tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, doiꞌ deꞌ tapod nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ salah odaꞌ dosa-e.  Pak-e adin Okuꞌ moꞌ nog duoh tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai nang, ‘Koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih puꞌan nang oni deꞌ nai koꞌih inoh dosa’.

verses.text: He who hates me, hates my Father also.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ buꞌui geh tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.

verses.text: If I hadn’t done among them the works which no one else did, they wouldn’t have had sin. But now have they seen and also hated both me and my Father.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, Okuꞌ moꞌ nai oni' deꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nai-e.  Moꞌ nyam Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e salah odaꞌ dosa-e.  Pak-e adin nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kilin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ, pak-e aluaꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, buꞌui geh tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ.

verses.text: But this happened so that the word may be fulfilled which was written in their law, ‘They hated me without a cause.’
verses.source_translation: Tok bonal halus wat inoh, saꞌ-e jadi kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab: ‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, tiap doiꞌ nak ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Kuꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ yoh yaꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.’

verses.text: “When the Counselor has come, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will testify about me.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ pait tuduꞌ ingan Pinulung deꞌ nog soꞌ Samaꞌ.  Iyoh leh Iyang deꞌ yaꞌ tanon deꞌ bonal tentang  Topaꞌ.  Takal Iyoh nog, Iyoh yaꞌ sobot oni deꞌ puꞌan-E tentang Okuꞌ.

verses.text: You will also testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh ingan halus sobot oni deꞌ puꞌan ingan tentang Okuꞌ, dop-e soꞌ sibungas-e Okuꞌ mulai nai kiloja Kuꞌ, ingan moꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.”

chapters.text: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.   Every branch in me that doesn’t bear fruit, he takes away. Every branch that bears fruit, he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.   You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.   Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can’t bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.   I am the vine. You are the branches. He who remains in me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.   If a man doesn’t remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, throw them into the fire, and they are burned.   If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, you will ask whatever you desire, and it will be done for you.  “In this is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit; and so you will be my disciples.   Even as the Father has loved me, I also have loved you. Remain in my love.   If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and remain in his love.   I have spoken these things to you, that my joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be made full.  “This is my commandment, that you love one another, even as I have loved you.   Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.   You are my friends, if you do whatever I command you.   No longer do I call you servants, for the servant doesn’t know what his lord does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I heard from my Father, I have made known to you.   You didn’t choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain; that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name, he may give it to you.  “I command these things to you, that you may love one another.   If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me before it hated you.   If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.   Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A servant is not greater than his lord.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will also keep yours.   But all these things will they do to you for my name’s sake, because they don’t know him who sent me.   If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.   He who hates me, hates my Father also.   If I hadn’t done among them the works which no one else did, they wouldn’t have had sin. But now have they seen and also hated both me and my Father.   But this happened so that the word may be fulfilled which was written in their law, ‘They hated me without a cause.’  “When the Counselor has come, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will testify about me.   You will also testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.

verses.text: “I have said these things to you so that you wouldn’t be caused to stumble.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ-e itih Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ diꞌ ingan togan bisayaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time comes that whoever kills you will think that he offers service to God.
verses.source_translation: Ingan yaꞌ obuah piluah soꞌ boli-boli simayang.  Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh, pak-e yaꞌ ogiꞌ takal-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ngabos ingan, yoh sakaꞌ nang odop-e moꞌ layan Topaꞌ ngan-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor me.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh, dop-e yoh diꞌ-e piluh bait Samaꞌ, bait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn’t tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e suaꞌ-e itih Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ-e moꞌ-e moꞌ nog onu-e, ingan natong nang Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan.”    Yesus in-e lagiꞌ, “Tentang oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan soꞌ sibungas-e, dop-e Okuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan.

verses.text: But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.  Yohmoꞌ niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ deꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Okuꞌ: ‘Kaki soꞌ Ingan yaꞌ odi?’

verses.text: But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ngan Kuꞌ moꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, otin ingan moꞌ susah.

verses.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I don’t go away, the Counselor won’t come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e bonal deꞌ tanon Kuꞌ itih tuduꞌ ingan: Lobih biguna saꞌan ingan moꞌ Kuꞌ buu.  Dop-e moꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ buu, Pinulung inoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan.  Pak-e moꞌ Kuꞌ buu, Okuꞌ yaꞌ pait Iyoh tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: When he has come, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment;
verses.source_translation: Takal Iyoh nog, Iyoh bitanga tuduꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia nang nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ salah tentang dosa, tentang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, duoh tentang ukum.

verses.text: about sin, because they don’t believe in me;
verses.source_translation: Tentang dosa: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ bidosa dop-e doliaꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won’t see me any more;
verses.source_translation: Tentang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal: Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon nang Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ yohmoꞌ diꞌ ingan tiyaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ;

verses.text: about judgment, because the prince of this world has been judged.
verses.source_translation: Tentang ukum: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌ tok yaꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa deꞌ salah daang dunia, dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ ngukum Laja Muat deꞌ nguasa dunia itih.

verses.text: “I have yet many things to tell you, but you can’t bear them now.
verses.source_translation: Aluaꞌ bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ halus Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, pak-e adin aluaꞌ diꞌ ingan sangup tilimaꞌ-e.

verses.text: However when he, the Spirit of truth, has come, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he hears, he will speak. He will declare to you things that are coming.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e yaꞌ nog Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ.  Takal Iyoh nog, Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ kayak ingan, saꞌ ingan ponai ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Iyoh diꞌ-e yaꞌ sina soꞌ odop-E sadiꞌ-E, pak-e Iyoh tanon oni deꞌ moꞌ ngojit-E.  Iyoh tuang yaꞌ tanon-e geh tuduꞌ ingan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog tiaꞌ ijoꞌ.

verses.text: He will glorify me, for he will take from what is mine, and will declare it to you.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ obuah mudi duoh obuah pimodo, dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E tuduꞌ ingan, Iyoh tilimaꞌ soꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: All things whatever the Father has are mine; therefore I said that he takes of mine, and will declare it to you.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Samaꞌ, inoh Okuꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ.  Inoh ngan Kuꞌ nang, oni deꞌ tanon Iyang tuduꞌ ingan, Iyoh tilimaꞌ soꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: A little while, and you will not see me. Again a little while, and you will see me.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus in-e lagiꞌ, “Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin Okuꞌ, duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ ingan yaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, “What is this that he says to us, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;’ and, ‘Because I go to the Father’?”
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E sina tipan si odop-e, “Oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E: ‘Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin Okuꞌ, duoh niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ ingan yaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ?’ Yohmoꞌ oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E: ‘Okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ Samaꞌ?’ ”

verses.text: They said therefore, “What is this that he says, ‘A little while’? We don’t know what he is saying.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Oni loti sina deꞌ nang-E: ‘Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ?’ Otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ puꞌan oni loti-e.”

verses.text: Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, “Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?’
verses.source_translation: Yesus puꞌan nang ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ sikian odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Tiꞌ-e Okuꞌ sina nang ‘Duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ ingan kilin Okuꞌ, duoh niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ ingan yaꞌ kilin Okuꞌ.’ Podo-e inoh oniꞌ deꞌ sikian ingan tipan siodop ingan?

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan bonal-bonal: Ingan yaꞌ siꞌian duoh muꞌas, pak-e nyaꞌa daang dunia deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ yaꞌ doon.  Ingan yaꞌ susah otin pak-e ingan deꞌ susah yaꞌ bilubah jadin doon.

verses.text: A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn’t remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e dayung deꞌ bitiiaꞌ sinok-e yaꞌ bilanak, iyoh susah otin-e, dop-e moꞌ nog onu-e iyoh yaꞌ jolaꞌ.  Pak-e takal onak-e moꞌ obuah bilanak, dayung inoh moꞌ komut susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon-e, dop-e iyoh moꞌ doon saꞌan onak-e moꞌ obuah bilanak kaang dunia.

verses.text: Therefore you now have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh duoh ingan: Adin otin ingan susah, pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ bitapod lagiꞌ duoh ingan.  Takal inoh leh otin ingan yaꞌ doon, doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai kayap doon inoh soꞌ otin ingan.

verses.text: “In that day you will ask me no questions. Most certainly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu inoh, ingan diꞌ ingan sikian oni-oni-e tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ tanon bonal-bonal tuduꞌ ingan: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ Samaꞌ daang adon Okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Until now, you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be made full.
verses.source_translation: Sape nog adin ingan diꞌ ingan mitiaꞌ oni-oni daang adon Okuꞌ.  Mitiaꞌ leh daang adon Okuꞌ, ingan moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e saꞌ ingan sukup doon-e.”

verses.text: I have spoken these things to you in figures of speech. But the time is coming when I will no more speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly about the Father.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e lagiꞌ, “Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan pakai nang silita, pak-e yaꞌ ogiꞌ takal-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ pakai nang silita, Okuꞌ yaꞌ lasuꞌ sina suang-suang in Kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan tentang Samaꞌ.

verses.text: In that day you will ask in my name; and I don’t say to you, that I will pray to the Father for you,
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh leh ingan yaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ daang adon Okuꞌ.  Ingan halus puꞌan nang Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ tiyaꞌ jolaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came from God.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e odop Samaꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan.  Iyoh ngibalaꞌ ingan dop-e ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ nang Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: I came from the Father, and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.”
verses.source_translation: Tok Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Samaꞌ, duoh moꞌ nog kaang dunia.  Pak-e adin Okuꞌ buu soꞌ dunia ngan Kuꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ Samaꞌ.”

verses.text: His disciples said to him, “Behold, now you are speaking plainly, and using no figures of speech.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ-E, “Adin suang-suang in Ingan sina, diꞌ Ingan pakai nang silita.

verses.text: Now we know that you know all things, and don’t need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came from God.”
verses.source_translation: Adin koꞌih puꞌan nang Ingan puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ, dusah nyaꞌa sikian tuduꞌ Ingan.  Inoh leh ngan koꞌih bisayaꞌ nang Ingan nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bisayaꞌ keh idoh ingan adin?

verses.text: Behold, the time is coming, yes, and has now come, that you will be scattered, everyone to his own place, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ningaꞌ onu-e moꞌ yaꞌ nog, adin geh moꞌ onu inoh moꞌ nog! Ingan yaꞌ sobak sobul buu, ingan yaꞌ masim-masim paliꞌ keꞌ boli, duoh togan Okuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ.  Pak-e Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ sadiꞌ Kuꞌ dop-e Samaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I have told you these things, that in me you may have peace. In the world you have oppression; but cheer up! I have overcome the world.”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan idip bidanah dop-e ingan idip niꞌ duoh Okuꞌ.  Daang dunia, ingan yaꞌ idip jolaꞌ, pak-e maꞌ tolu dop-e Okuꞌ moꞌ monang lawan dunia itih.”

chapters.text: “I have said these things to you so that you wouldn’t be caused to stumble.   They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time comes that whoever kills you will think that he offers service to God.   They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor me.   But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn’t tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.   But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’   But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.   Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I don’t go away, the Counselor won’t come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.   When he has come, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment;   about sin, because they don’t believe in me;   about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won’t see me any more;   about judgment, because the prince of this world has been judged.   “I have yet many things to tell you, but you can’t bear them now.   However when he, the Spirit of truth, has come, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he hears, he will speak. He will declare to you things that are coming.   He will glorify me, for he will take from what is mine, and will declare it to you.   All things whatever the Father has are mine; therefore I said that he takes of mine, and will declare it to you.   A little while, and you will not see me. Again a little while, and you will see me.” Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, “What is this that he says to us, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;’ and, ‘Because I go to the Father’?” They said therefore, “What is this that he says, ‘A little while’? We don’t know what he is saying.” Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them, “Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?’   Most certainly I tell you, that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.   A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn’t remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.   Therefore you now have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.  “In that day you will ask me no questions. Most certainly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.   Until now, you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be made full.   I have spoken these things to you in figures of speech. But the time is coming when I will no more speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly about the Father.   In that day you will ask in my name; and I don’t say to you, that I will pray to the Father for you,   for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came from God.   I came from the Father, and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.” His disciples said to him, “Behold, now you are speaking plainly, and using no figures of speech. Now we know that you know all things, and don’t need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came from God.” Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?   Behold, the time is coming, yes, and has now come, that you will be scattered, everyone to his own place, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.   I have told you these things, that in me you may have peace. In the world you have oppression; but cheer up! I have overcome the world.”

verses.text: Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may also glorify you;
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, Yesus moꞌ bigalong keꞌ longit yohmoꞌ in-e, “Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, adin moꞌ nog onu-e.  Bitanga leh nang Onak Muꞌ itih ayuh kuasa-E, saꞌ Onak Muꞌ bitanga Ingan deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E.

verses.text: even as you gave him authority over all flesh, so he will give eternal life to all whom you have given him.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Ingan moꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ Onak odaꞌ nguasa suaꞌ manusia, saꞌ Iyoh dapod ngin idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: This is eternal life, that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you sent, Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Itih leh idip nah-nah duoh Topaꞌ: Nyaꞌa piluh Ingan inoh, Topaꞌ deꞌ bonal, duoh piluh Okuꞌ, Yesus Kristus, deꞌ moꞌ obuah pait odaꞌ Ingan kaang dunia.

verses.text: I glorified you on the earth. I have accomplished the work which you have given me to do.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ bitanga kuasa Ingan deꞌ ayuh deꞌ dunia takal Okuꞌ mokuaꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan Okuꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: Now, Father, glorify me with your own self with the glory which I had with you before the world existed.
verses.source_translation: Adin, oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, odaꞌ leh Okuꞌ obuah pimodo deꞌ sulung jowin Ingan samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ obuah pimodo takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.

verses.text: I revealed your name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me. They have kept your word.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ magah tentang Ingan tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ soꞌ dunia.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ duoh Ingan moꞌ ngin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuang moꞌ nunaꞌ-e geh pingunang Ingan.

verses.text: Now they have known that all things whatever you have given me are from you,
verses.source_translation: Adin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang suaꞌ-e deꞌ kakuꞌ Okuꞌ, Ingan deꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Okuꞌ,

verses.text: for the words which you have given me I have given to them, and they received them, and knew for sure that I came from you, and they have believed that you sent me.
verses.source_translation: dop-e suaꞌ pingunang deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, moꞌ tanon Kuꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal puꞌan nang Okuꞌ nog soꞌ Ingan.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Ingan leh deꞌ pait Okuꞌ kaang dunia.

verses.text: I pray for them. I don’t pray for the world, but for those whom you have given me, for they are yours.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Idoh diꞌ-e saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia pak-e Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌan odop-e deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ.

verses.text: All things that are mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Kuꞌ, Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ.  Wat inoh geh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Ingan, kakuꞌ Kuꞌ geh.  Okuꞌ moꞌ obuah mudi odaꞌ idip odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your name which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ doiꞌ tiyaꞌ daang dunia, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ daang dunia.  Okuꞌ nog tuduꞌ Ingan.  Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ bisig, jaga leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai kuasa adon Ingan, adon deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin niꞌ samah kodaꞌ Otoꞌ.

verses.text: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
verses.source_translation: Takal Okuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Okuꞌ jaga odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang adon Ingan deꞌ moꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.  Okuꞌ moꞌ jaga odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, pak-e jok-e niꞌ deꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.  Saꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab.

verses.text: But now I come to you, and I say these things in the world, that they may have my joy made full in themselves.
verses.source_translation: Adin Okuꞌ nog tuduꞌ Ingan duoh mitiaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ takal Okuꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal ngoon doon samah kodaꞌ doon deꞌ ngoon Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ magah pingunang deꞌ soꞌ Ingan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Nyaꞌa daang dunia moꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ, samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ.

verses.text: I pray not that you would take them from the world, but that you would keep them from the evil one.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Ingan mit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ dunia itih, pak-e Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Ingan jaga odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e silamat soꞌ Laja Muat Munua.

verses.text: They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ, samah kodaꞌ Okuꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e dunia deꞌ kakuꞌ.

verses.text: Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.
verses.source_translation: Odaꞌ leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Ingan deꞌ kakuꞌ daang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Pingunang Ingan inoh leh oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ Ingan pait Okuꞌ kaang dunia, wat inoh geh Okuꞌ pait odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kaang dunia.

verses.text: For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ ngin odop kuꞌ jok-e saꞌan Ingan.  Okuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ saꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e saꞌan Ingan pakai ajal Ingan deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who will believe in me through their word,
verses.source_translation: Idoh diꞌ Kuꞌ bidoa jok-e saꞌan odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, pak-e saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ ngan-e ngojit gah deꞌ tanon odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ.

verses.text: that they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be one in us; that the world may believe that you sent me.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa tuduꞌ Ingan saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin niꞌ.  Samah kodaꞌ Ingan, oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, Ingan ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang Ingan, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ geh daang Otoꞌ.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi saꞌ dunia bisayaꞌ nang Ingan leh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: The glory which you have given me, I have given to them; that they may be one, even as we are one;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ idip odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuah mudi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin niꞌ, samah kodaꞌ Otoꞌ itih niꞌ.

verses.text: I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that you sent me, and loved them, even as you loved me.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Ingan ogiꞌ daang Okuꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal jadin niꞌ.  Ngan-e wat inoh dunia yaꞌ puꞌan nang Ingan leh deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ, duoh Ingan ngibalaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kodaꞌ Ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ.

verses.text: Father, I desire that they also whom you have given me be with me where I am, that they may see my glory, which you have given me, for you loved me before the foundation of the world.
verses.source_translation: Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, Okuꞌ laꞌan odaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Okuꞌ deꞌ topat daki soꞌ Okuꞌ ogiꞌ.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod ningaꞌ kuasa deꞌ ayuh deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Ingan ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ soꞌ takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.

verses.text: Righteous Father, the world hasn’t known you, but I knew you; and these knew that you sent me.
