verses.source_translation: Oi Samaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ adil, dunia diꞌ-e piluh Ingan, pak-e Okuꞌ piluh Ingan, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ tuang puꞌan-e geh nang Ingan deꞌ moꞌ pait Okuꞌ.

verses.text: I made known to them your name, and will make it known; that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ magah tentang Ingan tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, duoh Okuꞌ moꞌ jokowat Kuꞌ yaꞌ magah tentang Ingan, saꞌ-e samah kodaꞌ Ingan deꞌ moꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuang ngibalaꞌ geh Okuꞌ duoh Okuꞌ idip niꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

chapters.text: Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may also glorify you;   even as you gave him authority over all flesh, so he will give eternal life to all whom you have given him.   This is eternal life, that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you sent, Jesus Christ.   I glorified you on the earth. I have accomplished the work which you have given me to do.   Now, Father, glorify me with your own self with the glory which I had with you before the world existed.   I revealed your name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me. They have kept your word.   Now they have known that all things whatever you have given me are from you,   for the words which you have given me I have given to them, and they received them, and knew for sure that I came from you, and they have believed that you sent me.   I pray for them. I don’t pray for the world, but for those whom you have given me, for they are yours.   All things that are mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them.   I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your name which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are.   While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.   But now I come to you, and I say these things in the world, that they may have my joy made full in themselves.   I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.   I pray not that you would take them from the world, but that you would keep them from the evil one.   They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.   Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.  As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.   For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.   Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who will believe in me through their word,   that they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be one in us; that the world may believe that you sent me.   The glory which you have given me, I have given to them; that they may be one, even as we are one;   I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that you sent me, and loved them, even as you loved me.   Father, I desire that they also whom you have given me be with me where I am, that they may see my glory, which you have given me, for you loved me before the foundation of the world.   Righteous Father, the world hasn’t known you, but I knew you; and these knew that you sent me.   I made known to them your name, and will make it known; that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.”

verses.text: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where there was a garden, into which he and his disciples entered.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus mokuaꞌ bidoa in inoh, Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E odi keꞌ polad sungi Kidron.  Deꞌ danoꞌ ogiꞌ taman, Iyoh duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E moꞌ molot kanoꞌ.

verses.text: Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, for Jesus often met there with his disciples.
verses.source_translation: Yudas, nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E, tuang puꞌan-e geh topat inoh, dop-e Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E lika tikuluk danoꞌ.

verses.text: Judas then, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
verses.source_translation: Yudas moꞌ odi keꞌ topat inoh toban baya bala sidadu Romawi.  Iyoh toban-e geh ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh uluk ulang Farisi.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ toban podang, asual, baya lapu kadis duoh obol.

verses.text: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were happening to him, went out, and said to them, “Who are you looking for?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ obuah odop-E, Iyoh moꞌ maju sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ in-e, “Osi leh deꞌ kalik ingan neh?”

verses.text: They answered him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said to them, “I am he.” Judas also, who betrayed him, was standing with them.
verses.source_translation: In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyawot-E, “Yesus soꞌ kota Nazaret.” Yohmoꞌ in Yesus nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ itih leh odop-E.” Yudas deꞌ jua Yesus tuduꞌ musuh-musuh-E mujuag danoꞌ duoh ayua deꞌ toban-e kanoꞌ.

verses.text: When therefore he said to them, “I am he,” they went backward, and fell to the ground.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus sina nang, “Okuꞌ itih leh odop-E,” odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suaꞌ-e munul yohmoꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ.

verses.text: Again therefore he asked them, “Who are you looking for?” They said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sikian lagiꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ingan kalik osi?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E in-e, “Yesus soꞌ Nazaret.”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I told you that I am he. If therefore you seek me, let these go their way,”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina in-E, “Tuang Kuꞌ mokuaꞌ tanon-e, Okuꞌ itih leh odop-E.  Simoꞌ-o tok ingan kalik Okuꞌ, tanah saꞌ ayua pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ buu.” (

verses.text: that the word might be fulfilled which he spoke, “Of those whom you have given me, I have lost none.”
verses.source_translation: Sina Yesus inoh jadi kodaꞌ deꞌ nang-E daang doa-E, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin Ingan tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.”)

verses.text: Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it, and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus deꞌ toban podang deꞌ kodit moꞌ nyitak podang-e yohmoꞌ nyopaꞌ kojit toꞌuh kuli Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh odaꞌ sopial.  Adon kuli-e inoh Malkus.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to Peter, “Put the sword into its sheath. The cup which the Father has given me, shall I not surely drink it?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Petrus, “Sok podang muꞌ kaang duuang-e! Dop-e Okuꞌ halus nuak soꞌ sakil susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngin Samaꞌ Kuꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: So the detachment, the commanding officer, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him,
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu Romawi duoh sidadu-sidadu-e baya nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ takap Yesus yohmoꞌ pasung-E.

verses.text: and led him to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
verses.source_translation: Sibungas-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ toban tuduꞌ Hanas, tua Kayafas deꞌ dali.  Kayafas inoh Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sowaꞌ inoh.

verses.text: Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should perish for the people.
verses.source_translation: Kayafas inoh leh deꞌ moꞌ ngin sibaya deꞌ in-e tuduꞌ ayua pimipin Yahudi, “Paguh dooꞌ niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa kobos saꞌan suaꞌ bangsa.”

verses.text: Simon Peter followed Jesus, as did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest;
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus duoh niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon bitunaꞌ duoh Yesus.  Pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ naꞌan itih moꞌ piluh Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh, iyoh moꞌ suwaꞌ molot samah-samah duoh Yesus keꞌ limang boli Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh.

verses.text: but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought in Peter.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus kajon deꞌ sopaꞌ sinok tiban ijuam.  Pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ tiꞌ-e luah sina tuduꞌ kuli deꞌ dayung deꞌ jaga tiban, yohmoꞌ toban Petrus molot.

verses.text: Then the maid who kept the door said to Peter, “Are you also one of this man’s disciples?” He said, “I am not.”
verses.source_translation: Kuli deꞌ dayung deꞌ jaga tiban inoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Petrus, “Bah, idoh keh diꞌ-e muꞌu itih pinunaꞌ Iyoh deꞌ obuah takap inoh neh?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e in-e, “Idoh!”

verses.text: Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. They were warming themselves. Peter was with them, standing and warming himself.
verses.source_translation: Ngalom inoh modud, yoh leh ngan ayua kuli baya ayua deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ moꞌ bilasa nai opui yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngunuh.  Petrus suwaꞌ odi ngunuh duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sikian tuduꞌ Yesus

verses.text: The high priest therefore asked Jesus about his disciples, and about his teaching.
verses.source_translation: Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh sikian tuduꞌ Yesus tentang pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-E.

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where the Jews always meet. I said nothing in secret.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ mala sina suang-suang in Kuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, Okuꞌ mala ngajal deꞌ boli-boli topat simayang agama Yahudi duoh deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, topat soꞌ ulang Yahudi tikuluk.  Doiꞌ sidoh Kuꞌ suwan-suwan tanon oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Kuꞌ.

verses.text: Why do you ask me? Ask those who have heard me what I said to them. Behold, these know the things which I said.”
verses.source_translation: Adin oni nai ingan sikian tuduꞌ Okuꞌ? Sikian leh tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngojit Okuꞌ ngajal, totu ayua deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: When he had said this, one of the officers standing by slapped Jesus with his hand, saying, “Do you answer the high priest like that?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus sina deꞌ in inoh, niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga deꞌ mujuag danoꞌ moꞌ napal jowin-E simadi-e sina, “Bilani manah muꞌu nyawot in inoh tuduꞌ Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh!”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why do you beat me?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot in-E, “Simoꞌ sina Okuꞌ inoh salah, tanon leh daki salah-e, pak-e moꞌ sina Kuꞌ inoh bonal, oni nai ingan napal Okuꞌ?”

verses.text: Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the high priest.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Hanas moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa toban Yesus deꞌ aluaꞌ obuah pasung tuduꞌ Kayafas, Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh.

verses.text: Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him, “You aren’t also one of his disciples, are you?” He denied it, and said, “I am not.”
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus aluaꞌ mujuag ngunuh, in nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ tuduꞌ-e, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e muꞌu itih pinunaꞌ-E?” Petrus moꞌ diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ-e, in-e, “Idoh.”

verses.text: One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Didn’t I see you in the garden with him?”
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan kuli Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh, iyoh inoh aluaꞌ madih nyaꞌa deꞌ nyopaꞌ Petrus kojit-e, in-e tuduꞌ Petrus “Idoh keh diꞌ-e muꞌu deꞌ kilin kuꞌ deꞌ taman inoh samah-samah duoh Iyoh?”

verses.text: Peter therefore denied it again, and immediately the rooster crowed.
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ-e lagiꞌ, takal inoh geh, babang siuak bitadu.

verses.text: They led Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Praetorium. It was early, and they themselves didn’t enter into the Praetorium, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.
verses.source_translation: Suam-suam pagi ayua pimipin agama Yahudi toban Yesus soꞌ boli Kayafas odi keꞌ istana Pilatus deꞌ jadin gubelnul Roma.  Ulang-ulang Yahudi diꞌ-e suwaꞌ molot kaang istana saꞌ-e diꞌ-e kaꞌis odop-e nunaꞌ atulan agama Yahudi dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ man pinguman Paskah.

verses.text: Pilate therefore went out to them, and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan Pilatus luah bitapod duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh moꞌ sikian in-e, “Oni deꞌ nuduh ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa itih?”

verses.text: They answered him, “If this man weren’t an evildoer, we wouldn’t have delivered him up to you.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ Iyoh itih diꞌ-e ulang jaꞌat, idoh diꞌ koꞌih toban Iyoh tuduꞌ ingan!”

verses.text: Pilate therefore said to them, “Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law.” Therefore the Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”
verses.source_translation: In Pilatus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Mit negeh Iyoh itih, motod negeh salah-E nunaꞌ ukum odop ingan!” In ayua ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ, “Koꞌih diꞌ soꞌon ngukum ngabos nyaꞌa.” (

verses.text: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke, signifying by what kind of death he should die.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh leh wat-e saꞌ-e jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon Yesus tentang wat ki wat Iyoh yaꞌ kobos.)

verses.text: Pilate therefore entered again into the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ paliꞌ molot kaang istana gubelnul, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ sidadu-e toban Yesus molot, yohmoꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Podo Muꞌu Laja ulang Yahudi?”

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Do you say this by yourself, or did others tell you about me?”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Podo pinyikian ingan itih soꞌ odop ingan keh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan tentang Okuꞌ?”

verses.text: Pilate answered, “I’m not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me. What have you done?”
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ nyawot-E, “Podo okuꞌ itih ulang Yahudi? Deꞌ nyelah Muꞌu tuduꞌ okuꞌ, bangsa odop Muꞌ duoh ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh.  Oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Muꞌ?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn’t be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina, “ Okuꞌ militah idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ dunia itih.  Simoꞌ Okuꞌ militah soꞌ dunia itih, totu nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ moꞌ lawan saꞌ Okuꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nyelah tuduꞌ ayua pimipin Yahudi, pak-e Okuꞌ militah tok idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ dunia itih.”

verses.text: Pilate therefore said to him, “Are you a king then?” Jesus answered, “You say that I am a king. For this reason I have been born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh leh ngan Pilatus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ-E, “Podo loti-e Muꞌu nang odop Muꞌ Laja?” Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan deꞌ sobot nang Okuꞌ Laja.  Saꞌan inoh leh Okuꞌ obuah bilanak duoh nog kaang dunia itih, saꞌ Okuꞌ tanon tentang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal ngojit sina Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: Pilate said to him, “What is truth?” When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, “I find no basis for a charge against him.
verses.source_translation: In Pilatus tuduꞌ-E, “Oni oniꞌ deꞌ bonal inoh?”   Takal-e mokuaꞌ nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Pilatus moꞌ luah lagiꞌ tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi, yohmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, in-e, “Okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod oni-oni salah-E.

verses.text: But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Therefore, do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nunaꞌ deꞌ konyat ingan nai daang onu ayuh Paskah, okuꞌ pilopas niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan saꞌan ingan.  Laꞌan ingan yeh okuꞌ pilopas Laja ulang Yahudi saꞌan ingan?”

verses.text: Then they all shouted again, saying, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Maꞌ! Idoh diꞌ-e Iyoh neh, pak-e Barabas!” Barabas inoh yohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan pilitah.

chapters.text: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where there was a garden, into which he and his disciples entered. Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, for Jesus often met there with his disciples. Judas then, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons. Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were happening to him, went out, and said to them, “Who are you looking for?” They answered him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said to them, “I am he.” Judas also, who betrayed him, was standing with them. When therefore he said to them, “I am he,” they went backward, and fell to the ground. Again therefore he asked them, “Who are you looking for?” They said, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus answered, “I told you that I am he. If therefore you seek me, let these go their way,” that the word might be fulfilled which he spoke, “Of those whom you have given me, I have lost none.” Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it, and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus. Jesus therefore said to Peter, “Put the sword into its sheath. The cup which the Father has given me, shall I not surely drink it?” So the detachment, the commanding officer, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him, and led him to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year. Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should perish for the people. Simon Peter followed Jesus, as did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest; but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought in Peter. Then the maid who kept the door said to Peter, “Are you also one of this man’s disciples?” He said, “I am not.” Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. They were warming themselves. Peter was with them, standing and warming himself. The high priest therefore asked Jesus about his disciples, and about his teaching. Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where the Jews always meet. I said nothing in secret.   Why do you ask me? Ask those who have heard me what I said to them. Behold, these know the things which I said.” When he had said this, one of the officers standing by slapped Jesus with his hand, saying, “Do you answer the high priest like that?” Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why do you beat me?” Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the high priest. Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him, “You aren’t also one of his disciples, are you?” He denied it, and said, “I am not.” One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Didn’t I see you in the garden with him?” Peter therefore denied it again, and immediately the rooster crowed. They led Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Praetorium. It was early, and they themselves didn’t enter into the Praetorium, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover. Pilate therefore went out to them, and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?” They answered him, “If this man weren’t an evildoer, we wouldn’t have delivered him up to you.” Pilate therefore said to them, “Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law.” Therefore the Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,” that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke, signifying by what kind of death he should die. Pilate therefore entered again into the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” Jesus answered him, “Do you say this by yourself, or did others tell you about me?” Pilate answered, “I’m not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me. What have you done?” Jesus answered, “My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn’t be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here.” Pilate therefore said to him, “Are you a king then?” Jesus answered, “You say that I am a king. For this reason I have been born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.” Pilate said to him, “What is truth?” When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them, “I find no basis for a charge against him. But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Therefore, do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?” Then they all shouted again, saying, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.

verses.text: So Pilate then took Jesus, and flogged him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Pilatus moꞌ odaꞌ ayua sidadu bipodos duoh Yesus.

verses.text: The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown, and put it on his head, and dressed him in a purple garment.
verses.source_translation: Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngolung daꞌan koyuh deꞌ ogiꞌ lojaꞌ-a nai kodaꞌ mahkota yohmoꞌ naꞌ deꞌ bak Yesus.  Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sok jubah ungu tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: They kept saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and they kept slapping him.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ  odi keꞌ sulung jowin Yesus daang-e nguyat-E, in-e, “Tabiꞌ laja ulang Yahudi!” Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ napal jowin-E.

verses.text: Then Pilate went out again, and said to them, “Behold, I bring him out to you, that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Pilatus moꞌ luah lagiꞌ yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inoh, “Ningaꞌ, okuꞌ toban Iyoh luah tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod oni-oni salah-E.”

verses.text: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. Pilate said to them, “Behold, the man!”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ luah, Iyoh aluaꞌ pakai mahkota deꞌ soꞌ daꞌan koyuh deꞌ bilojaꞌ duoh pakai jubah ungu.  Pilatus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ningaꞌ mey nyaꞌa itih!”

verses.text: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify!” Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves, and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him.”
verses.source_translation: Takal ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga inoh ningaꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Masak Iyoh tun salip, masak Iyoh tun salip!” Pilatus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, “Odop ingan mit Iyoh masak Iyoh deꞌ salip, dop-e okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ tapod oni oni salah-E.”

verses.text: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.”
verses.source_translation: Ayua ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e, “Iyoh nang odop-E Onak Topaꞌ! Yoh leh ngan-e nunaꞌ atulan koꞌih, Iyoh halus obuah ukum ngabos”

verses.text: When therefore Pilate heard this saying, he was more afraid.
verses.source_translation: Takal Pilatus ngojit sina ayua deꞌ munoꞌ iyoh moꞌ makin tolu.

verses.text: He entered into the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ molot kaang istana gubelnul duoh sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Soꞌ ki soꞌ Muꞌ nog?” Pak-e Yesus diꞌ-e nyawot-e.

verses.text: Pilate therefore said to him, “Aren’t you speaking to me? Don’t you know that I have power to release you, and have power to crucify you?”
verses.source_translation: Yoh leh ngan Pilatus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Idoh keh diꞌ Muꞌu yaꞌ sina duoh okuꞌ? Idoh diꞌ Muꞌu puꞌan nang okuꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa kuꞌ pilopas Muꞌu duoh ogiꞌ kuasa kuꞌ odaꞌ Muꞌu obuah masak deꞌ tun salip?”

verses.text: Jesus answered, “You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you has greater sin.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan doiꞌ kuasa oni-oni tuduꞌ Okuꞌ, simoꞌ kuasa inoh diꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Inoh leh ngan iyoh deꞌ nyelah Okuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, lobih ayuh dosa-e soꞌ ingan.”

verses.text: At this, Pilate was seeking to release him, but the Jews cried out, saying, “If you release this man, you aren’t Caesar’s friend! Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!”
verses.source_translation: Takal Pilatus ngojit sina deꞌ nang Yesus inoh, iyoh kagaꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ pilopas-E.  Pak-e ulang-ulang Yahudi nang bogan-e, “Simoꞌ ingan pilopas Iyoh, idoh diꞌ ingan dingan laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.  Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang odop-e laja, iyoh musuh laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”

verses.text: When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called “The Pavement”, but in Hebrew, “Gabbatha.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Pilatus ngojit sina deꞌ in inoh, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ toban Yesus luah.  Pilatus moꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ topat soꞌ-e ngadel nyaꞌa.  Topat guluꞌ inoh adon-e Topas Batuh.  Daang sina Ibrani adon-e Gabata.

verses.text: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, at about the sixth hour. He said to the Jews, “Behold, your King!”
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh kila-kila pukul simoong duwoh uun onu, takal inoh geh ulang-ulang Yahudi yaꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ nyamut onu ayuh paskah.  Pilatus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi, “Ningaꞌ mey laja ingan!”

verses.text: They cried out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Ngabos Iyoh! Ngabos Iyoh! Masak Iyoh deꞌ tun salip!” Pilatus moꞌ sikian, “Podo ingan odaꞌ okuꞌ masak laja ingan deꞌ tun salip?” Ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh nyawot-e, “Jok-e laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh sijaꞌ-e laja koꞌih!”

verses.text: So then he delivered him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led him away.
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ sidadu-sidadu-e saꞌ-e masak Iyoh deꞌ tun salip.   Ayua sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit Yesus.

verses.text: He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called “The Place of a Skull”, which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha”,
verses.source_translation: Yesus golong salip-e yohmoꞌ luah soꞌ kota, Iyoh odi keꞌ topat deꞌ adon ‘Topat Tikuluak’, daang sina Ibrani nyaꞌa sobot nang Golgota.

verses.text: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on either side one, and Jesus in the middle.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ leh soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ masak Yesus deꞌ tun salip.  Ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bibaya obuah masak deꞌ tun salip deꞌ kajuag nyaꞌa deꞌ bingon salip Yesus, niꞌ nuaꞌ boit, niꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E, Yesus deꞌ uun.

verses.text: Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. There was written, “JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ tun salip Yesus, Pilatus odaꞌ nyaꞌa nopia papan deꞌ ogiꞌ tulis deꞌ in-e, “Yesus soꞌ Nazaret, Laja ulang Yahudi.”

verses.text: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ basa tulis inoh dop-e topat soꞌ Yesus obuah masak deꞌ tun salip diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ kota.  Sina inoh obuah nulis daang sina Ibrani, sina Latin, duoh sina Yunani.

verses.text: The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘he said, “I am King of the Jews.”’”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ ayua pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh in-e tuduꞌ Pilatus, “Maꞌ ingan nulis nang ‘Laja ulang Yahudi’ pak-e nulis negeh nang, ‘Iyoh nang in-e: Okuꞌ leh Laja ulang Yahudi.’ ”

verses.text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
verses.source_translation: Pilatus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oni deꞌ nulis kuꞌ, diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ yaꞌ bilubah.”

verses.text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
verses.source_translation: Takal sidadu-sidadu mokuaꞌ masak Yesus deꞌ tun salip, ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit pimakai Yesus.  Yohmoꞌ bikutung odop-e pat, masim-masim sidadu soꞌon niꞌ duman.  Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ mit baya jubah-E.  Jubah inoh doiꞌ samung-e dop-e soꞌ somu nog douꞌ doiꞌ jiꞌit-e.

verses.text: Then they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it will be,” that the Scripture might be fulfilled, which says, “They parted my garments among them. For my cloak they cast lots.” Therefore the soldiers did these things.
verses.source_translation: Yoh leh ngan ayua sidadu inoh sina tipan si odop-e, “Jubah-E itih dusah toꞌ notak-e.  Jaꞌ otoꞌ pilabuꞌ undi saꞌ otoꞌ ningaꞌ osi deꞌ soꞌon.” Oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi saꞌ-e samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bikutung-kutung pimakai Kuꞌ, duoh pilabuꞌ undi ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon jubah Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ sinok salip Yesus, mujuag sinoꞌ-E, madih sinoꞌ-E deꞌ dayung, Maria sowon Klopas, duoh Maria Magdalena.

verses.text: Therefore when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, behold, your son!”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus ningaꞌ pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E ogiꞌ duoh sinoꞌ-E mujuag danoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ sinoꞌ-E, “Noꞌ, itih onak ingan!”

verses.text: Then he said to the disciple, “Behold, your mother!” From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ niꞌ naꞌan pinunaꞌ-E inoh tiꞌ-e, “Itih leh sinoꞌ muꞌ!” Mulai soꞌ takal inoh pinunaꞌ-E inoh tilimaꞌ sinoꞌ Yesus loꞌo deꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: After this, Jesus, seeing that all things were now finished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I am thirsty.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus puꞌan nang suaꞌ kiloja-E deꞌ dunia moꞌ obuaꞌ jadi, Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Asong Kuꞌ bodoh.” Iyoh nang in inoh saꞌ-e jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab.

verses.text: Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ ogiꞌ kobuk deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ masuam.  Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mit lumut deꞌ nyolap piꞌin yohmoꞌ suad deꞌ tuak anggul deꞌ masuam yohmoꞌ mokos deꞌ tisuk deꞌ nai-e soꞌ tongon koyuh deꞌ adon hisop yohmoꞌ nyog nog-e obuah bobaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, “It is finished.” He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ Yesus kiꞌan tuak anggul inoh, Iyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Moh, suaꞌ-e moꞌ jadi!” Iyoh moꞌ nyuduk daang-e lasuꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn’t remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special one), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
verses.source_translation: Onu inoh nyaꞌa moꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ nyamut onu Sabat ulang Yahudi, deꞌ bibaya duoh onu ayuh Paskah ulang Yahudi.  Ayua pimipin ulang Yahudi mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Pilatus saꞌ ayua sidadu mugat poꞌon nyaꞌa deꞌ taluh deꞌ tun salip inoh saꞌ-e laju kobos, yohmoꞌ pimuun todang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Sabat, saꞌ todang deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e boli-tamong deꞌ tun salip daang onu Sabat inoh.

verses.text: Therefore the soldiers came, and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him;
verses.source_translation: Sidadu-sidadu moꞌ odi mugat poꞌon odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ samah-samah obuah masak deꞌ tun salip.

verses.text: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was already dead, they didn’t break his legs.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal nog Yesus, yoh moꞌ ningaꞌ Yesus moꞌ kobos, inoh leh ngan sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e jadi mugat poꞌon-E.

verses.text: However one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngamuk kubuan Yesus pakai asual, doyaꞌ duoh piꞌin moꞌ luah soꞌ kubuan-E.

verses.text: He who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, that you may believe.
verses.source_translation: Odop nyaꞌa deꞌ nulis buk itih, moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh leh deꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh tok bonal.  Odop-e puꞌan nang oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh bonal, saꞌ ingan tuang bisayaꞌ geh.

verses.text: For these things happened, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, “A bone of him will not be broken.”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi saꞌ-e samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh tulang-E deꞌ yaꞌ obuah mugat.”

verses.text: Again another Scripture says, “They will look on him whom they pierced.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ geh deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ ngamuk-e.”

verses.text: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked of Pilate that he might take away Jesus’ body. Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yusuf soꞌ Arimatea odi tuduꞌ Pilatus ngan-e yaꞌ mitiaꞌ todang Yesus.  Pilatus moꞌ odaꞌ-e, Yusuf moꞌ odi mit todang Yesus.  Yusuf inoh pinunaꞌ Yesus, pak-e iyoh doliaꞌ-e odaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan, dop-e iyoh tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds.
verses.source_translation: Nikodemus deꞌ ogiꞌ sidoh-e nog tuduꞌ Yesus daang onu ngalom, suwaꞌ odi duoh Yusuf.  Nikodemus toban inyuaꞌ deꞌ sapul-e duoh mur baya inyuaꞌ koyuh gaharu deꞌ baat-e kulang lobih taluh puluh kilo gram, ngan-e yaꞌ nginyuaꞌ todang Yesus.

verses.text: So they took Jesus’ body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mit todang Yesus, yohmoꞌ molut pakai kain todang, simadi-e gan inyuaꞌ inoh tiꞌ-e daang kain todang inoh, nunaꞌ adat ulang Yahudi takal-e ngubul nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid.
verses.source_translation: Sinok topat Yesus obuah masak deꞌ tun salip ogiꞌ taman.  Daang taman inoh ogiꞌ kubul gua deꞌ aluaꞌ baꞌuh, deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa pakai ngan-e ngubul todang nyaꞌa.

verses.text: Then because of the Jews’ Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e kubul inoh sinok, onu Sabat tuang moꞌ yaꞌ mulai geh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ posan todang Yesus danih.

chapters.text: So Pilate then took Jesus, and flogged him. The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown, and put it on his head, and dressed him in a purple garment. They kept saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and they kept slapping him. Then Pilate went out again, and said to them, “Behold, I bring him out to you, that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him.” Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. Pilate said to them, “Behold, the man!” When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they shouted, saying, “Crucify! Crucify!” Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves, and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him.” The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.” When therefore Pilate heard this saying, he was more afraid. He entered into the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus gave him no answer. Pilate therefore said to him, “Aren’t you speaking to me? Don’t you know that I have power to release you, and have power to crucify you?” Jesus answered, “You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you has greater sin.” At this, Pilate was seeking to release him, but the Jews cried out, saying, “If you release this man, you aren’t Caesar’s friend! Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!” When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called “The Pavement”, but in Hebrew, “Gabbatha.” Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, at about the sixth hour. He said to the Jews, “Behold, your King!” They cried out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!” So then he delivered him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led him away. He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called “The Place of a Skull”, which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha”, where they crucified him, and with him two others, on either side one, and Jesus in the middle. Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. There was written, “JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.” Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek. The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘he said, “I am King of the Jews.”’” Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.” Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout. Then they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it will be,” that the Scripture might be fulfilled, which says, “They parted my garments among them. For my cloak they cast lots.” Therefore the soldiers did these things. But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene. Therefore when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, behold, your son!”  Then he said to the disciple, “Behold, your mother!” From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home. After this, Jesus, seeing that all things were now finished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I am thirsty.” Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth. When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, “It is finished.” He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit. Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn’t remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special one), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away. Therefore the soldiers came, and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him; but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was already dead, they didn’t break his legs. However one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out. He who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, that you may believe. For these things happened, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, “A bone of him will not be broken.” Again another Scripture says, “They will look on him whom they pierced.” After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked of Pilate that he might take away Jesus’ body. Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body. Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds. So they took Jesus’ body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury. Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid. Then because of the Jews’ Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.

verses.text: Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went early, while it was still dark, to the tomb, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.
verses.source_translation: Takal sipagi onu Mingu, takal onu aluaꞌ mopung, Maria Magdalena odi keꞌ kubul, iyoh ningaꞌ batuh deꞌ ngan nyaꞌa nutu kubul inoh moꞌ obuah sigian soꞌ lubang kubul inoh.

verses.text: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have laid him!”
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ bikoduh kalik Simon Petrus duoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E, yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh in-e, “Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mit todang Topaꞌ soꞌ kubul-E, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan daki soꞌ todang-E adin.”

verses.text: Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb.
verses.source_translation: Petrus duoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ inoh moꞌ odi keꞌ kubul.

verses.text: They both ran together. The other disciple outran Peter, and came to the tomb first.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ duwoh odop-e bikoduh, pak-e pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ inoh bikoduh lobih laju soꞌ Petrus, yoh ngan-e dioꞌ nog deꞌ kubul.

verses.text: Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he didn’t enter in.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ nyiguaꞌ kaang kubul, iyoh kilin kain ngan-e molut todang polong-polong danoꞌ, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e molot kaang kubul.

verses.text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying,
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh ke Simon Petrus nog, iyoh moꞌ lasuꞌ molot kaang kubul inoh.  Iyoh kilin kain todang polong-polong danoꞌ.

verses.text: and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e kain ngan-e nutu jowin Yesus doiꞌ sinok kain ngan-e molut todang-E, pak-e tikupiat deꞌ topat deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ niꞌ tiꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ nog suwaꞌ molot kaang kubul inoh yohmoꞌ kilin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, iyoh moꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: For as yet they didn’t know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e deꞌ dioꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngiloti oni deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab nang Yesus yaꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: So the disciples went away again to their own homes.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh soꞌ duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus inoh paliꞌ keꞌ topat-e soꞌ-e ngilumon.

verses.text: But Mary was standing outside at the tomb weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Maria aluaꞌ mujuag siꞌian deꞌ sopaꞌ kubul inoh.  Iyoh siꞌian simadi-e nyiguaꞌ ningaꞌ kaang kubul,

verses.text: and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
verses.source_translation: iyoh moꞌ ningaꞌ duwoh malaikat pakai pimakai deꞌ mopuꞌ guluꞌ deꞌ topat soꞌ nyaꞌa posan todang Yesus deꞌ dioꞌ, niꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ bak-E, deꞌ nikan guluꞌ nuaꞌ poꞌon-E.

verses.text: They told her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don’t know where they have laid him.”
verses.source_translation: In malaikat-malaikat inoh tuduꞌ-e, “Oni nai ingan siꞌian neh?” Maria moꞌ nyawot-e, “Nyaꞌa moꞌ mit todang Topaꞌ kuꞌ, adin okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan daki soꞌ nyaꞌa naꞌ todang-E.”

verses.text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn’t know that it was Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, yoh moꞌ kumiat keꞌ dug duoh ningaꞌ Yesus mujuag danoꞌ, pak-e iyoh diꞌ-e piluh nang inoh Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Oni nai ingan siꞌian neh? Ingan kalik osi?” Maria sakaꞌ nang nyaꞌa inoh tukang kobon, iyoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-E, “Simoꞌ-e ingan deꞌ mit Iyoh soꞌ itih, tulung tanon deꞌ okuꞌ daki soꞌ ingan gan-E, saꞌ okuꞌ dapod mit-E.”

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him, “Rabboni!” which is to say, “Teacher!”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Maria!” Maria moꞌ kumiat tuduꞌ Yesus yoh moꞌ sina daang sina Ibrani, “Rabuni!” (Loti-e ‘Gulu’)

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Don’t hold me, for I haven’t yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers, and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e in-e, “Maꞌ tomaꞌ Okuꞌ, dop-e Okuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ Kuꞌ maꞌad tuduꞌ Samaꞌ.  Pak-e odi leh tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Kuꞌ, duoh tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang adin Okuꞌ yaꞌ maꞌad tuduꞌ Samaꞌ Kuꞌ duoh Samaꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ Kuꞌ duoh Topaꞌ ingan.”

verses.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had said these things to her.
verses.source_translation: Maria Magdalena moꞌ odi tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ moꞌ kilin Topaꞌ!” Maria tuang tanon-e geh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e.

verses.text: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the middle, and said to them, “Peace be to you.”
verses.source_translation: Daang onu Mingu inoh geh, takal onu moꞌ ngalom, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus tikuluk daang boli deꞌ suaꞌ tiban-e bilobot, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu tuduꞌ pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi.  Tang-tang Yesus nog yohmoꞌ mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ sina, “Salam bidanah saꞌan ingan!”

verses.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Takal-E mokuaꞌ sina in inoh, Iyoh moꞌ bitanga tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dian kinaman deꞌ soꞌ duwoh tongan-E duoh dian kinaman deꞌ toꞌin-E.  Takal-e moꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup doon-e.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them again, “Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ in-E, “Salam bidanah saꞌan ingan.  Samah kodaꞌ Samaꞌ pait Okuꞌ, wat inoh geh adin Okuꞌ pait ingan.”

verses.text: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit!
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ puuah asong-E tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duoh in-e, “Tilimaꞌ leh Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: If you forgive anyone’s sins, they have been forgiven them. If you retain anyone’s sins, they have been retained.”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan ngapun dosa nyaꞌa, Topaꞌ tuang ngapun-e geh ingan.  Simoꞌ ingan diꞌ ingan ngapun dosa nyaꞌa, Topaꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ngapun-e.”

verses.text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn’t with them when Jesus came.
verses.source_translation: Niꞌ naꞌan soꞌ simoong duwoh pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ adon Tomas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa geh nang Didimus doiꞌ duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon takal Yesus nog.

verses.text: The other disciples therefore said to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bokon moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ Tomas in-e, “Koꞌih moꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ.” Pak-e in Tomas nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ okuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ ningaꞌ dian pasak deꞌ soꞌ duwoh tongan-E duoh kibalot tilinyuꞌ kuꞌ daang lubang pasak inoh, baya tomaꞌ dian kinaman deꞌ toꞌin-E, idoh diꞌ kuꞌ bisayaꞌ.”

verses.text: After eight days again his disciples were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being locked, and stood in the middle, and said, “Peace be to you.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ niꞌ mingu, pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ lagiꞌ tikuluk daang boli inoh, adin Tomas moꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ danoꞌ.  Suaꞌ tiban-e boli obuaꞌ ngobot, tang-tang Yesus nog, mujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yohmoꞌ in-E, “Salam bidanah saꞌan ingan!”

verses.text: Then he said to Thomas, “Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don’t be unbelieving, but believing.”
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tomas, “Ningaꞌ dian pasak deꞌ soꞌ duwoh tongan Kuꞌ, kibalot tilinyuꞌ muꞌ daang lubang pasak inoh, nyeꞌ moꞌ tomaꞌ dian kinaman deꞌ toꞌin Kuꞌ.  Maꞌ tiyaꞌ diꞌ muꞌ bisayaꞌ, pak-e bisayaꞌ leh bonal-bonal.”

verses.text: Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.source_translation: Tomas moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Yesus, “Tuan deꞌ nguasa idip kuꞌ duoh Topaꞌ kuꞌ!”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Tomas muꞌu bisayaꞌ dop-e muꞌu kilin Okuꞌ.  Obuah bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e kilin Okuꞌ pak-e bisayaꞌ.”

verses.text: Therefore Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;
verses.source_translation: Tok aluaꞌ bogoꞌ lagiꞌ tanda soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nai Yesus deꞌ jowin pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, pak-e idoh diꞌ-e suaꞌ-e obuah nulis daang buk Kitab itih.

verses.text: but these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab itih saꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ nang Yesus leh Laja Pinyilamat, Onak Topaꞌ, duoh saꞌ ingan soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

chapters.text: Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went early, while it was still dark, to the tomb, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb. Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have laid him!” Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb. They both ran together. The other disciple outran Peter, and came to the tomb first. Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he didn’t enter in. Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying, and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself. So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed. For as yet they didn’t know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead. So the disciples went away again to their own homes. But Mary was standing outside at the tomb weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb, and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain. They told her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don’t know where they have laid him.” When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn’t know that it was Jesus. Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.” Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him, “Rabboni!” which is to say, “Teacher!” Jesus said to her, “Don’t hold me, for I haven’t yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers, and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’” Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had said these things to her. When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the middle, and said to them, “Peace be to you.” When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord. Jesus therefore said to them again, “Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you.” When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit!   If you forgive anyone’s sins, they have been forgiven them. If you retain anyone’s sins, they have been retained.” But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn’t with them when Jesus came. The other disciples therefore said to him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.” After eight days again his disciples were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being locked, and stood in the middle, and said, “Peace be to you.” Then he said to Thomas, “Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don’t be unbelieving, but believing.” Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!” Jesus said to him, “Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.” Therefore Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book; but these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.

verses.text: After these things, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. He revealed himself this way.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus bitanga odop-E lagiꞌ tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ pang donu Tiberias, wat itih wat Iyoh bitanga odop-E.

verses.text: Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were together.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh Simon Petrus, Tomas deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa Onak Opid, Natanael soꞌ Kana deꞌ Galilea, soꞌ duwoh naꞌan onak Zebedeus baya duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon soꞌ pinunaꞌ Yesus tikuluk deꞌ pang donu.

verses.text: Simon Peter said to them, “I’m going fishing.” They told him, “We are also coming with you.” They immediately went out, and entered into the boat. That night, they caught nothing.
verses.source_translation: In Simon Petrus tuduꞌ dingan-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ odi ngijaling ikian.” In odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Koꞌih yaꞌ suwaꞌ duoh muꞌu.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ muat deꞌ olud odi samah-samah, pak-e ngalom inoh doiꞌ manah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌon ikian.

verses.text: But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn’t know that it was Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Suam-suam pagi Yesus mujuag deꞌ pang donu, pak-e pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E diꞌ-e puꞌan nang inoh Yesus.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them, “Children, have you anything to eat?”  They answered him, “No.”
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oi dingan, ogiꞌ yeh ikian deꞌ soꞌon ingan neh?” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-E, “Doiꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” They cast it therefore, and now they weren’t able to draw it in for the multitude of fish.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Tolan jaling ingan nuaꞌ toꞌuh olud ingan, saꞌ ingan soꞌon ikian.” Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tolan jaling-e, mokuaꞌ inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nalik jaling-e pak-e diꞌ-e taan, dop-e ikian daang jaling inoh sikiya bogoꞌ.

verses.text: That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It’s the Lord!” So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he wrapped his coat around him (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus sina tuduꞌ Simon Petrus in-e, “Inoh Topaꞌ.” Takal Simon Petrus ngojit nang inoh Topaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ sok bojuh-e, dop-e yoh diꞌ-e pakai bojuh, yohmoꞌ bitabum kaang piꞌin.

verses.text: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ Yesus deꞌ bokon bikayuh olud-e ngan-e keꞌ doyoh simadi-e bitalik duoh jaling deꞌ bogoꞌ ikian daang-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e sikiya juuaꞌ soꞌ doyoh, kulang lobih silatus metel.

verses.text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ maꞌad soꞌ aang olud keꞌ doyoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ningaꞌ ogiꞌ kueh, ogiꞌ ikian deꞌ madang-e deꞌ tun tuluah opui.

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”
verses.source_translation: In Yesus tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Toban katiꞌ kudu-kudu polong ikian deꞌ tuang ingan soꞌon-e.”

verses.text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn’t torn.
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus moꞌ muun kaang olud yohmoꞌ nalik jaling inoh toban keꞌ doyoh.  Jaling inoh bogoꞌ ikian deꞌ bagaꞌ daꞌ-e, suaꞌ-e ogiꞌ silatus limoh puluh taluh polong.  Sungu-e bogoꞌ ikian daang jaling inoh, jaling inoh idoh geh diꞌ-e totak.

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” None of the disciples dared inquire of him, “Who are you?” knowing that it was the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Got toꞌ man.” Pak-e doiꞌ soꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ bilani sikian tuduꞌ Yesus in-e, “Osi Ingan tih?” dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang Iyoh inoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ odi sinok odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ mit kueh ngin tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, wat inoh geh Iyoh ngin ikian-e.

verses.text: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh keꞌ taluh sidoh-e Yesus bitanga odop-E tuduꞌ pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E, takal Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E.

verses.text: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you.” He said to him, “Feed my lambs.”
verses.source_translation: Takal Yesus duoh pinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-E deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ mokuaꞌ man, Yesus sina tuduꞌ Simon Petrus, “Simon, onak Yohanes, podo muꞌu ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ lobih soꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot-E, “Tok bonal Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Ingan.” In Yesus tuduꞌ-e, “Jaga leh onak-onak domba Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you.” He said to him, “Tend my sheep.”
verses.source_translation: In Yesus keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e, “Simon, onak Yohanes, podo muꞌu ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Tok bonal Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Ingan.” Yesus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ-e, “Jaga leh suaꞌ domba Kuꞌ.”

verses.text: He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?” Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, “Do you have affection for me?” He said to him, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I have affection for you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my sheep.
verses.source_translation: In Yesus keꞌ taluh sidoh-e, “Simon, onak Yohanes, podo muꞌu ngibalaꞌ Okuꞌ?” Petrus moꞌ susah otin-e dop-e Yesus moꞌ sikian nog taluh sidoh-e.  Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e lagiꞌ in-e, “Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ.  Ingan puꞌan nang okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ Ingan.” In Yesus lagiꞌ, “Jaga leh suaꞌ domba Kuꞌ.

verses.text: Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don’t want to go.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ muꞌu bonal-bonal, takal muꞌu aluaꞌ mudaꞌ, odop muꞌ dapod sok soot kupuang muꞌ ngan muꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ ponu kaki sijaꞌ-e soꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ odi.  Pak-e takal muꞌu moꞌ nyoma, muꞌu yaꞌ suual tongan muꞌ, nyaꞌa moꞌ yaꞌ mokos muꞌu duoh toban keꞌ topat deꞌ doliaꞌ muꞌ yaꞌ odi daꞌ-e.”

verses.text: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him, “Follow me.”
verses.source_translation: Ngan Yesus in inoh, Iyoh yaꞌ tanon wat ki wat Petrus yaꞌ kobos duoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi adon Topaꞌ.  Mokuaꞌ inoh Yesus sina tuduꞌ Petrus in-E, “Jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus’ breast at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray You?”
verses.source_translation: Simon Petrus kumiat yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ ogiꞌ pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus bitunaꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.  (Iyoh inoh leh deꞌ guluꞌ sinok Yesus takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ man samah-samah pingobuaꞌ sidoh-e duoh Yesus.  Iyoh inoh geh deꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Topaꞌ, osi odop-e deꞌ yaꞌ jua Ingan?”)

verses.text: Peter seeing him, said to Jesus, “Lord, what about this man?”
verses.source_translation: Takal Petrus ningaꞌ iyoh inoh, Petrus moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Yesus, “Topaꞌ, oni wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah iyoh itih?”

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.”
verses.source_translation: Yesus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ laꞌan odaꞌ iyoh totap idip nog Okuꞌ paliꞌ baꞌuh, muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ jolaꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan-e, pak-e muꞌu, jaꞌ nunaꞌ Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn’t die. Yet Jesus didn’t say to him that he wouldn’t die, but, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e sina Yesus inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ timul gah deꞌ uluk ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ nunaꞌ Yesus, nang pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus diꞌ-e yaꞌ kobos.  Tiap idoh diꞌ Yesus tanon in inoh, pak-e jok Yesus nang, “Simoꞌ Okuꞌ laꞌan odaꞌ iyoh totap idip nog Okuꞌ paliꞌ baꞌuh, muꞌu diꞌ muꞌ jolaꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan-e.”

verses.text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.
verses.source_translation: Pinunaꞌ deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus inoh leh deꞌ moꞌ tanon tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi.  Iyoh geh deꞌ moꞌ nulis suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Otoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nang oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e inoh tok bonal.

verses.text: There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn’t have room for the books that would be written.
verses.source_translation: Aluaꞌ bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bokon deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus.  Moꞌ nyam suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ obuah nulis ngaꞌ niꞌ ngaꞌ niꞌ, nunaꞌ pikil kuꞌ diꞌ-e sukup topat deꞌ dunia itih soꞌ nyeꞌ nyikon suaꞌ kitab deꞌ obuah nulis inoh.    Silita Rasul-Rasul

chapters.text: After these things, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. He revealed himself this way. Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were together. Simon Peter said to them, “I’m going fishing.” They told him, “We are also coming with you.” They immediately went out, and entered into the boat. That night, they caught nothing. But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn’t know that it was Jesus. Jesus therefore said to them, “Children, have you anything to eat?”  They answered him, “No.” He said to them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” They cast it therefore, and now they weren’t able to draw it in for the multitude of fish. That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It’s the Lord!” So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he wrapped his coat around him (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea. But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish. So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread. Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.” Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn’t torn. Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” None of the disciples dared inquire of him, “Who are you?” knowing that it was the Lord. Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise. This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead. So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you.” He said to him, “Feed my lambs.” He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you.” He said to him, “Tend my sheep.” He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?” Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, “Do you have affection for me?” He said to him, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I have affection for you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my sheep.   Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don’t want to go.” Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him, “Follow me.” Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus’ breast at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray You?” Peter seeing him, said to Jesus, “Lord, what about this man?” Jesus said to him, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.” This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn’t die. Yet Jesus didn’t say to him that he wouldn’t die, but, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?” This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true. There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn’t have room for the books that would be written.

verses.text: The first book I wrote, Theophilus, concerned all that Jesus began both to do and to teach,
verses.source_translation: Tuduꞌ ingan Teofilus, daang buk okuꞌ deꞌ sibungas-e okuꞌ moꞌ nulis susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-e duoh deꞌ moꞌ ngajal Yesus.

verses.text: until the day in which he was received up, after he had given commandment through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen.
verses.source_translation: Nog Iyoh tipaꞌad keꞌ siluga.  Takal Iyoh aluaꞌ diꞌ-e tipaꞌad ke siluga, Iyoh moꞌ ngin pilitah pakai kuasa Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih yohmoꞌ pait-e deꞌ nang-e rasul-rasul.

verses.text: To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God’s Kingdom.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e jolaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ kobos deꞌ tun salip, mokuaꞌ inoh Iyoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ bitanga odop-e bonal-bonal tuduꞌ rasul-rasul inoh, daang pat puluꞌ onu moꞌ bogoꞌ oni deꞌ nai-E ngan-e yaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang Odop-e moꞌ tok-tok paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh, Iyoh sina duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, watki wat Topaꞌ militah jadin Laja saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ Odop-E.

verses.text: Being assembled together with them, he commanded them, “Don’t depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ niꞌ onu takal Iyoh man bisamah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ pilitah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ dioꞌ buu soꞌ Yerusalem, pak-e kajon dioꞌ datiꞌ nog Topaꞌ, Samaꞌ Kuꞌ, pait Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.  Iyoh moꞌ bijanyi in inoh.  Okuꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: For John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
verses.source_translation: Dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ Yohanes baptis pakai piꞌin, pak-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tuui ingan yaꞌ obuah baptis pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Therefore when they had come together, they asked him, “Lord, are you now restoring the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.source_translation: Takal iyoh aluaꞌ tikuluk duoh Yesus, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisikian duoh Yesus, “Topaꞌ, laꞌan Ingan yeh adin paliꞌ kajuag kerajaan kaꞌan Israel?”

verses.text: He said to them, “It isn’t for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within his own authority.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ingan diꞌ pilelu puꞌan siniaꞌ takal-e, deꞌ moꞌ notap-e, Samaꞌ sadiꞌ-e deꞌ moꞌ notu nunaꞌ kuasa-E.

verses.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. You will be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the uttermost parts of the earth.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan yaꞌ soꞌon kuasa, takal Topaꞌ pait Iyang-E tuduꞌ ingan.  Takal inoh ingan yaꞌ jadin tukang tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa wat pingidip Okuꞌ, mulai soꞌ kota Yerusalem, daang suaꞌ tanaꞌ Yudea, daang suaꞌ tanaꞌ Samaria nog tubon longit.”

verses.text: When he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up, and a cloud received him out of their sight.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ Iyoh nang sina deꞌ in inoh, Iyoh lasuꞌ tipaꞌad keꞌ siluga deꞌ jowin rasul-rasul nog abun moꞌ maput-e.

verses.text: While they were looking steadfastly into the sky as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing,
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ ningaꞌ Iyoh tipaꞌad keꞌ longit, tang-tang ogiꞌ duwoh naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ pakai pimakai deꞌ mopuꞌ mujuag deꞌ umiah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: who also said, “You men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who was received up from you into the sky, will come back in the same way as you saw him going into the sky.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmo' sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oi ulang Galilea, oni ngan ingan mujuag bigalong ke longit? Yesus itih deꞌ tipaꞌad ke' siluga togan ingan, Iyoh yaꞌ paliꞌ muun samah kodaꞌ ngan-e Iyoh maꞌad keꞌ siluga.”

verses.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ buu soꞌ Punguꞌ Zaitun paliꞌ keꞌ kota Yerusalem deꞌ juuaꞌ-e kila-kila niꞌ kilometel soꞌ kota inoh.

verses.text: When they had come in, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying; that is Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.
verses.source_translation: Takal moꞌ nog keꞌ kota, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ maꞌad keꞌ longah topat odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngilumon.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ Petrus, Yohanes, Yakobus, Andreas, Filipus, Tomas, Bartolomeus, Matius, Yakobus onak Alfeus, Simon soꞌ golongan ulang Yahudi deꞌ bijuang odaꞌ Israel lopas soꞌ kerajaan Romawi, Yudas onak Yakobus.

verses.text: All these with one accord continued steadfastly in prayer and supplication, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ niꞌ otin daang-e bidoa samah-samah yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ kudu-kudu dayung baya Maria sinoꞌ Yesus duoh madih ayua odop Yesus.

verses.text: In these days, Peter stood up in the middle of the disciples (and the number of names was about one hundred twenty), and said,
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ onu takal inoh, kila-kila silatus duwoh puluꞌ naꞌan deꞌ jadin pinunaꞌ Yesus bikuluk danoꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ bidoa.  Petrus mujuag yohmoꞌ sina,

verses.text: “Brothers, it was necessary that this Scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to those who took Jesus.
verses.source_translation: “Oi madih ayua, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ Daud deꞌ moꞌ nulis-e daang Kitab tentang Yudas pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ takap Yesus halus jadi.

verses.text: For he was counted with us, and received his portion in this ministry.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ inoh, iyoh samah kodaꞌ koꞌih geh tukang toban Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Yesus.

verses.text: Now this man obtained a field with the reward for his wickedness, and falling headlong, his body burst open, and all his intestines gushed out.
verses.source_translation: Yudas itih moꞌ milih niꞌ ongan tanaꞌ pakai upah jaꞌat-e takal-e jua Yesus.  Danoꞌ geh iyoh labuꞌ tipuꞌuab toꞌin-e moꞌ lutuap daang suaꞌ isiꞌ toꞌin-e luah.

verses.text: It became known to everyone who lived in Jerusalem that in their language that field was called ‘Akeldama,’ that is, ‘The field of blood.’
verses.source_translation: Gah inoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang Yerusalem tuang puꞌan-e geh, yoh ngan nyaꞌa moꞌ biladon daang sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ Hakaldama loti-e: ‘Tanaꞌ Doyaꞌ.’

verses.text: For it is written in the book of Psalms, ‘Let his habitation be made desolate. Let no one dwell therein;’ and, ‘Let another take his office.’
verses.source_translation: Noꞌuh-e laja Daud moꞌ nulis daang buk Mazmur wat silita pingidip Yudas: ‘Tanah leh sa' topat-e loꞌo itih doiꞌ liuak daluag-e, yohmoꞌ tanah leh sa' doiꞌ' nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo daang-e, duoh: Tanah saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon mit topat-e.’

verses.text: “Of the men therefore who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
beginning from the baptism of John, to the day that he was received up from us, of these one must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan-e pilelu pilih nyaꞌa deꞌ gati Yudas saꞌ-e suwaꞌ tanon nang Yesus paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ obuah pilih halus leh nyaꞌa deꞌ silalu ogiꞌ bisamah duoh otoꞌ takal Topaꞌ Yesus aluaꞌ ogiꞌ daang uluk otoꞌ, mulai soꞌ takal Yohanes baptis-E nog Iyoh tipaꞌad ke siluga togan uluk otoꞌ.”

verses.text: They put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was also called Justus, and Matthias.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyok duoh naꞌan deꞌ yaꞌ gati Yudas: Keꞌ niꞌ-e Yusuf (ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sobot iyoh Barsabas, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa sobot nang Yustus), deꞌ keꞌ duwoh-e Matias.

verses.text: They prayed, and said, “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen
to take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place.”
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bidoa daang-e sina, “Oi Topaꞌ, Ingan puꞌan otin suaꞌ nyaꞌa.  Yudas moꞌ togan kiloja deꞌ ngin Ingan daꞌ-e yoh moꞌ kobos.  Nyok leh sa'an koꞌih mun ki soꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh deꞌ yaꞌ pilih Topaꞌ deꞌ ngin-e kiloja deꞌ yaꞌ gati Yudas.”

verses.text: They drew lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was counted with the eleven apostles.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ pilabuꞌ uni-e saꞌan odop-e deꞌ duwoh, uni-e moꞌ labuꞌ tuduꞌ Matias, iyohleh deꞌ tamah bilang deꞌ simoong niꞌ naꞌan rasul saꞌa paliꞌ simoong duoh naꞌan.

chapters.text: The first book I wrote, Theophilus, concerned all that Jesus began both to do and to teach, until the day in which he was received up, after he had given commandment through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen. To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God’s Kingdom. Being assembled together with them, he commanded them, “Don’t depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.   For John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days from now.” Therefore when they had come together, they asked him, “Lord, are you now restoring the kingdom to Israel?” He said to them, “It isn’t for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within his own authority.   But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. You will be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the uttermost parts of the earth.” When he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up, and a cloud received him out of their sight. While they were looking steadfastly into the sky as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing, who also said, “You men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who was received up from you into the sky, will come back in the same way as you saw him going into the sky.” Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away. When they had come in, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying; that is Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James. All these with one accord continued steadfastly in prayer and supplication, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers. In these days, Peter stood up in the middle of the disciples (and the number of names was about one hundred twenty), and said, “Brothers, it was necessary that this Scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to those who took Jesus. For he was counted with us, and received his portion in this ministry.
