Now this man obtained a field with the reward for his wickedness, and falling headlong, his body burst open, and all his intestines gushed out. It became known to everyone who lived in Jerusalem that in their language that field was called ‘Akeldama,’ that is, ‘The field of blood.’ For it is written in the book of Psalms, ‘Let his habitation be made desolate. Let no one dwell therein;’ and, ‘Let another take his office.’ “Of the men therefore who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us, beginning from the baptism of John, to the day that he was received up from us, of these one must become a witness with us of his resurrection.” They put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was also called Justus, and Matthias. They prayed, and said, “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen to take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place.” They drew lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was counted with the eleven apostles.

verses.text: Now when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all with one accord in one place.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu ayuh ulang Yahudi mokuaꞌ ngutuam deꞌ sobot-e nang Onu Ayuh Pentakosta, susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus tikuluk niꞌ boli.

verses.text: Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
verses.source_translation: Tang-tang susuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ klingah sowoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ sowoꞌ sobak deꞌ dolas soꞌ longit.   Suaꞌ aang boli topat-e tikuluk moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ sowoꞌ inoh.

verses.text: Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ siduduꞌ opui deꞌ bijiliab deꞌ timilib katiꞌ kanih yohmoꞌ map tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ponai sina daang sina deꞌ bokon kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngin Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-e odaꞌ iyoh nang-e.

verses.text: Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under the sky.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Agama Yahudi soꞌ susuaꞌ pulou deꞌ daang dunia moꞌ nog keꞌ kota Yerusalem.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ.

verses.text: When this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were bewildered, because everyone heard them speaking in his own language.
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nog deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ klingah sowoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kodaꞌ sobak, yohmoꞌ tikuluk kaang boli inoh yohmoꞌ ilan takal-e ngojit rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ sina pakai sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, “Behold, aren’t all these who speak Galileans?
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bolidongo daang-e ilan nyam-e, yohmoꞌ sina, “Idoh keh diꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ sina sowoꞌ inoh nyaꞌa soꞌ Galilea?

verses.text: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?
verses.source_translation: Oni wat-e otoꞌ ponai masim-masim ngojit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina pakai sina basa otoꞌ?

verses.text: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,
verses.source_translation: Otoꞌ ulang Partia, Media, Elam; nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Mesopotamia, Yudea duoh Kapadokia; Pontus duoh Asia,

verses.text: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
verses.source_translation: Frigia duoh Pamfilia, Mesir duoh pulou-pulou Libia deꞌ bilinok duoh Kirene; nyaꞌa deꞌ nog soꞌ Roma,

verses.text: Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!”
verses.source_translation: ogiꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh basa deꞌ bokon deꞌ molot agama Yahudi; ulang Kreta duoh ulang Arab.   Otoꞌ ngojit odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sina sowoꞌ daang sina otoꞌ silita pingunai kiloja deꞌ ayuh deꞌ moꞌ nai Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: They were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying to one another, “What does this mean?”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ akoꞌ-akoꞌ ilan-e, daang-e bisikian in-e, “Oni loti oniꞌ deꞌ wat itih?”

verses.text: Others, mocking, said, “They are filled with new wine.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nyinel, “Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ mabuk tuak anggul!”

verses.text: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them, “You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.
verses.source_translation: Petrus duoh simoong niꞌ naꞌan Rasul inoh moꞌ mokat mujuag, iyoh moꞌ sina pakai sina deꞌ dolas tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Madih ayua kuꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh suaꞌ ingan deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Yerusalem! Ngojit bonal-bonal-e oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon kuꞌ itih, saꞌ ingan puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ sibonal-e.

verses.text: For these aren’t drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ idoh diꞌ-e mabuk kodaꞌ deꞌ kila ingan, sobab adin aluaꞌ pukul pliꞌi pagi.

verses.text: But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel:
verses.source_translation: Pak-e inohleh kodaꞌ deꞌ nang nabi Yoel deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-e,

verses.text: ‘It will be in the last days, says God, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh. Your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams.
verses.source_translation: ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon: Sinok onu kiamat Okuꞌ yaꞌ pimuun Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ manusia.   Onak opot ingan deꞌ dali duoh deꞌ dayung ponai bitutaꞌ.   Onak-onak bujang ponai kilin oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ bitanga Topaꞌ.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ nyomaꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon pimoh soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Yes, and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy.
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang deꞌ kiloja saꞌan Okuꞌ, bait deꞌ dali duoh deꞌ dayung, daang onu-onu inoh geh Okuꞌ pimuun Iyang kuꞌ tuduꞌ-e.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tuang-e ponai bitutaꞌ.

verses.text: I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and billows of smoke.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ bitanga kuasa Kuꞌ deꞌ ayuh deꞌ somu deꞌ longit, Okuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa kilin-e deꞌ douꞌ deꞌ tanaꞌ; ogiꞌ doyaꞌ duoh opui duoh tibokol asuh.

verses.text: The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.
verses.source_translation: Boton onu yaꞌ bilubah jadin mopung pipiat duoh bulan yaꞌ jadin biliah kodaꞌ doyaꞌ ngan-e aluaꞌ' diꞌ-e nog Onu Topaꞌ, onu deꞌ ayuh, onu deꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa kilin-e.

verses.text: It will be that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.source_translation: Osi sijaꞌ-a deꞌ mogan adon Topaꞌ yoh yaꞌ obuah nyilamat.’”

verses.text: “Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him among you, even as you yourselves know,
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ, “Oi madih ayua kuꞌ, ulang-ulang Israel! Ngojit leh dioꞌ sina kuꞌ itih: Deꞌ nang okuꞌ inoh iyohleh Yesus soꞌ kota Nazaret, nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ notu Topaꞌ duoh deꞌ moꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan pakai kuasa soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Inoh moꞌ tonga daang pingunai-E deꞌ nai-E pakai kuasa Topaꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ puꞌan ingan.

verses.text: him, being delivered up by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, you have taken by the hand of lawless men, crucified and killed;
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ notu duoh puꞌan soꞌ puꞌun-e, Iyoh yaꞌ nyelah Yesus tuduꞌ ingan.   Ingan moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat ngabos Iyoh pakai masak tongan poꞌon-E deꞌ tun salip.

verses.text: whom God raised up, having freed him from the agony of death, because it was not possible that he should be held by it.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Topaꞌ odaꞌ Iyoh paliꞌ mokat idip lagiꞌ, sa' Iyoh lopas soꞌ idip jolaꞌ kobos, dop-e Iyoh diꞌ-e patut yaꞌ nah-nah kobos.

verses.text: For David says concerning him, ‘I saw the Lord always before my face, For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Iyoh moꞌ obuah sobot odaꞌ laja Daud: ‘Okuꞌ silalu ningaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin kuꞌ; doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tapod kaso okuꞌ, dop-e Iyoh silalu sinok okuꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced. Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope;
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan otinkuꞌ sonang, okuꞌ mudi Topaꞌ daang otin kuꞌ doon.   Okuꞌ yaꞌ idip lagiꞌ, dop-e kuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: because you will not leave my soul in Hades, neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Ingan diꞌ Ingan tanah odaꞌ okuꞌ loꞌo deꞌ topat nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.   Duoh diꞌ-e tanah nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Ingan odaꞌ yaꞌ obuaꞌ asul.

verses.text: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.’
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ olan deꞌ nuju odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip, sinok duoh Ingan otinkuꞌ sukup doon-e.’

verses.text: “Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, okuꞌ yaꞌ lasuꞌ sina, tanon silita Daud deꞌ jadin sumuk babai otoꞌ.   Iyoh moꞌ kobos iyoh moꞌ obuah ngubul, kubul-e aluaꞌ ogiꞌ nog adin.

verses.text: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Daud inoh nabi.   Yoh moꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌ moꞌ nai supah janyi-E, Daud moꞌ dioꞌ puꞌan ogiꞌ onak sukun-e deꞌ yaꞌ pakat Topaꞌ odaꞌ yaꞌ jadin laja.

verses.text: he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that his soul wasn’t left in Hades, and his flesh didn’t see decay.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ bitutaꞌ, Laja Pinyilamat paliꞌ idip soꞌ pingobos-e, Daud tanon nang: ‘Iyoh diꞌ-e tanah odaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ topat nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos; duoh gonan-e diꞌ-e obuaꞌ asul.’ ”

verses.text: This Jesus God raised up, to which we all are witnesses.
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ silita Daud noꞌuh-e, Yesus itih leh Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ tanon koꞌih sobab Iyohleh deꞌ kidip Topaꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.   Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ bonal-bonal kilin Iyoh paliꞌ idip.

verses.text: Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this, which you now see and hear.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ Samaꞌ moꞌ pakat Iyoh keꞌ topat deꞌ paling bigatung nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E, duoh ngin kuasa tuduꞌ-E, yohmoꞌ tilimaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah janyi odop Topaꞌ Samaꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ.   Adin Yesus moꞌ pait Iyang-E, inohleh deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan adin duoh deꞌ ngojit Ingan deꞌ soꞌ koꞌih.

verses.text: For David didn’t ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by my right hand,
verses.source_translation: Idoh diꞌ-e Daud deꞌ yaꞌ maꞌad ke siluga neh, ogiꞌ yoh tanon-e: ‘Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ Tuan deꞌ nguasa idipkuꞌ:

verses.text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’
verses.source_translation: Gulu' leh deꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh Okuꞌ, nog Kuꞌ odaꞌ musoh-musoh muꞌ tunuak tuduꞌ muꞌu.’

verses.text: “Let all the house of Israel therefore know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.”
verses.source_translation: Jadin suaꞌ ulang Israel moꞌ puꞌan dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat Yesus deꞌ masak ingan tun salip, inohleh deꞌ moꞌ jadin Topaꞌ deꞌ nguasa idip otoꞌ duoh Laja Pinyilamat.”

verses.text: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit silita inoh, otin-e moꞌ ngilobuꞌ yohmoꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ Petrus duoh rasul-rasul deꞌ bokon, “Oni mey wat oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai koꞌih neh?”

verses.text: Peter said to them, “Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Paliꞌ leh keꞌ olan Topaꞌ, masim-masim ingan nog tuduꞌ-E, nyeꞌ moꞌ baptis daang adon Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus saꞌ dosa ingan obuah ngapun, duoh tilimaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.”
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh janyi Topaꞌ saꞌan ingan duoh kaꞌan onak-onak sukun ingan, kaꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ topat-topat deꞌ juuaꞌ duoh sikiang-kiang nyaꞌa deꞌ mogan-e nog tuduꞌ odop Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, “Save yourselves from this crooked generation!”
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ lagiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e takal-e sibaya odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai jaꞌat kodaꞌ nyaꞌa joman deꞌ adin neh, nyeꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ ingan silamat duoh diꞌ-e obuah ukum.”

verses.text: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized. There were added that day about three thousand souls.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ pingunang Petrus yohmoꞌ baptis.   Daang onu inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus moꞌ bitamah kila-kila taluh libu naꞌan.

verses.text: They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ lajin tikuluk, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal ayua rasul.   Yoh moꞌ man samah-samah duoh man kueh ngan-e natong Topaꞌ Yesus duoh bidoa.

verses.text: Fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ tolu ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai rasul-rasul pakai kuasa Topaꞌ, duoh oni' deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ onu nyaꞌa kilin-e.

verses.text: All who believed were together, and had all things in common.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ inoh moꞌ samah kila-e, balang deꞌ kakuꞌ-e deꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah yoh kakuꞌ-e.

verses.text: They sold their possessions and goods, and distributed them to all, according as anyone had need.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ sijaꞌ-a odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ jua balang deꞌ kakuꞌ-e yohmoꞌ bikutung-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ odop-e, nunaꞌ deꞌ pilelu-e.

verses.text: Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart,
verses.source_translation: Bilang konu odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tikuluk deꞌ lobuh Boli Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ man samah-samah deꞌ boli odop-e daang kila doon duoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ samuh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ man kueh natong Topaꞌ Yesus,

verses.text: praising God, and having favor with all the people. The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ telus mudi adon Topaꞌ, suaꞌ nyaꞌa suka tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, yohmoꞌ bilang konu Topaꞌ namah bilang odop-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

chapters.text: Now when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all with one accord in one place. Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting. Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak. Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under the sky. When this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were bewildered, because everyone heard them speaking in his own language. They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, “Behold, aren’t all these who speak Galileans? How do we hear, everyone in our own native language? Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia, Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes, Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!” They were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying to one another, “What does this mean?” Others, mocking, said, “They are filled with new wine.” But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them, “You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words. For these aren’t drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day. But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel: ‘It will be in the last days, says God, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh. Your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams. Yes, and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy. I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and billows of smoke. The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes. It will be that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.’ “Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him among you, even as you yourselves know, him, being delivered up by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, you have taken by the hand of lawless men, crucified and killed; whom God raised up, having freed him from the agony of death, because it was not possible that he should be held by it. For David says concerning him, ‘I saw the Lord always before my face, For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved. Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced. Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope; because you will not leave my soul in Hades, neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay. You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.’ “Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day. Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne, he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that his soul wasn’t left in Hades, and his flesh didn’t see decay. This Jesus God raised up, to which we all are witnesses. Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this, which you now see and hear. For David didn’t ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by my right hand, until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’ “Let all the house of Israel therefore know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.” Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?” Peter said to them, “Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit. For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.” With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying, “Save yourselves from this crooked generation!” Then those who gladly received his word were baptized. There were added that day about three thousand souls. They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer. Fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles. All who believed were together, and had all things in common. They sold their possessions and goods, and distributed them to all, according as anyone had need. Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart, praising God, and having favor with all the people. The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved.

verses.text: Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.
verses.source_translation: Kila-kila pukul taluh ngumi sinok jam nyaꞌa yaꞌ simayang, Petrus duoh Yohanes odi keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: A certain man who was lame from his mother’s womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ boꞌon tiban awah Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ adon “Pintu Indah”, ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan dali deꞌ kobos gonan-e soꞌ takal sinoꞌ-e milaꞌ-a.   Bilang konu nyaꞌa tawiak iyoh naꞌ danoꞌ saꞌ-e mitiaꞌ pilasiꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ molot simayang.

verses.text: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy.
verses.source_translation: Takal iyoh ningaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes yaꞌ molot kaang awah Boli Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ mitiaꞌ pilasiꞌ.

verses.text: Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said, “Look at us.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngiduang daang-e sina, “Ningaꞌ tuduꞌ koꞌih”.

verses.text: He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, baꞌ-e nang ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngin-e tuduꞌ odop-e.

verses.text: But Peter said, “I have no silver or gold, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus moꞌ sina, “Duit doiꞌ deꞌ okuꞌ neh, pak-e oni deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ okuꞌ, kuꞌ ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu: Daang adon Yesus Kristus, soꞌ Nazaret, ponuleh!”

verses.text: He took him by the right hand, and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength.
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ kagian tongan toꞌuh-e yohmoꞌ tulung odaꞌ mujuag, takal inoh geh yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ taan mujuag.

verses.text: Leaping up, he stood, and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ lasuꞌ bitatol daang-e lasuꞌ ponu katiꞌ kanih, yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot kaang awah Boli Topaꞌ simadi-e ponu daang-e ngilokid, simadi-e mudi adon Topaꞌ.

verses.text: All the people saw him walking and praising God.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh ponu daang-e mudi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: They recognized him, that it was he who used to sit begging for gifts for the needy at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. They were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ puꞌan nyaꞌa, iyoh noh deꞌ silalu guluꞌ mitiaꞌ pilasiꞌ deꞌ “Pintu Indah” deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ sukup ilan oni deꞌ moꞌ jadi tuduꞌ-e.

verses.text: As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa inoh telus sijaꞌ-a nunaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ ilan duoh ngubun iyoh deꞌ awah Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang Awah Salomo.

verses.text: When Peter saw it, he responded to the people, “You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?
verses.source_translation: Petrus ningaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yohmoꞌ in-e, “Oi madih ayua kuꞌ ulang Israel! Oni nai ingan ilan oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi? Oni nai ingan ngiduang koꞌih telus.   Baꞌ ingan nang nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai ponu itih odaꞌ kuasa koꞌih? Baꞌ ingan nang koꞌih taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ ngan koꞌih tapod nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ?

verses.text: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah Abraham, Ishak, Yakub, Topaꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ, Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ pakat Yesus odaꞌ timogah dop-e Iyoh moꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ.   Iyoh leh deꞌ nyelah ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa danoꞌ, ingan moꞌ nulak Iyoh deꞌ jowin Pilatus, takal Pilatus yaꞌ pilopas-E.

verses.text: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan nulak Iyoh deꞌ kudus duoh bonal, ingan moꞌ paksa Pilatus odaꞌ pilopas nyaꞌa deꞌ pingabos saꞌan odop ingan.

verses.text: and killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip, ingan moꞌ ngabos-E, pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ kidip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.   Koꞌih deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ suwaꞌ kilin.

verses.text: By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos gonan-e inoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus leh, nyaꞌa inoh moꞌ taan ponu.   Adin ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: “Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua! Okuꞌ ngiloti nang ingan ngabos Yesus, dop-e ingan samah kodaꞌ pimipin-pimipin ingan diꞌ-e puꞌan nang Iyoh noh Laja Pinyilamat.

verses.text: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.
verses.source_translation: Noꞌuh-e Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon pakai bobaꞌ nabi-nabi, nang Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ yaꞌ pait-E, halus yaꞌ jolaꞌ idip-E.   Adin moꞌ jadi samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ notap Topaꞌ.

verses.text: “Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord,
verses.source_translation: Nyeꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ olan Topaꞌ, saꞌ Iyoh ngapun suaꞌ dosa ingan.

verses.text: and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ yaꞌ pilopas oniꞌ deꞌ nokan idip ingan, duoh Iyoh yaꞌ pait Yesus tuduꞌ ingan.   Iyoh noh leh deꞌ moꞌ notu Topaꞌ deꞌ jadin Laja Pinyilamat saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets.
verses.source_translation: Laja Pinyilamat inoh yaꞌ totap loꞌo daang siluga nog onu Topaꞌ ngubah odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ jadin baꞌuh, samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon-e pakai sina nabi-nabi noꞌuh-e.

verses.text: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him in all things whatever he says to you.
verses.source_translation: Samah kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon nabi Musa, ‘Topaꞌ yaꞌ pait tuduꞌ ingan niꞌ naꞌan nabi soꞌ basa odop ingan, samah kodaꞌ Iyoh pait okuꞌ.   Ingan halus ngojit suaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon nabi inoh tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: It will be that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.’
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon nabi inoh, obuah tolan soꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ duoh obuah katuab.’

verses.text: Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nabi deꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ onu-e tanon sibaya deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ mulai soꞌ nabi Samuel nog nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon, suaꞌ-e tanon oniꞌ joman deꞌ adin.

verses.text: You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘In your offspring will all the families of the earth be blessed.’
verses.source_translation: Noꞌuh-e janyi-janyi inoh soꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ tanon-e pakai bobaꞌ nabi-nabi ngan-e bijanyi duoh sumuk babai ingan.   Topaꞌ moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Abraham sumuk babai otoꞌ, ‘Soꞌ onak sukun muꞌ leh, suaꞌ basa deꞌ bumi soꞌon bilokat.’

verses.text: God, having raised up his servant Jesus, sent him to you first to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your wickedness.”
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan Topaꞌ dioꞌ pait Kuli-E saꞌan otoꞌ ulang Israel.   Iyoh moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh saꞌan ingan, odaꞌ ingan paliꞌ kaang olan Topaꞌ, duoh togan pingidip ingan deꞌ jaꞌat.”

chapters.text: Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour. A certain man who was lame from his mother’s womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple. Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy. Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said, “Look at us.” He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them. But Peter said, “I have no silver or gold, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!” He took him by the right hand, and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength. Leaping up, he stood, and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God. All the people saw him walking and praising God. They recognized him, that it was he who used to sit begging for gifts for the needy at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. They were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him. As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering. When Peter saw it, he responded to the people, “You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk? The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him. But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you, and killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses. By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all. “Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers. But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled. “Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord, and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before, whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets. For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him in all things whatever he says to you. It will be that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.’ Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days. You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘In your offspring will all the families of the earth be blessed.’ God, having raised up his servant Jesus, sent him to you first to bless you, in turning away every one of you from your wickedness.”

verses.text: As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them,
verses.source_translation: Takal Petrus duoh Yohanes aluaꞌ sina duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, tang-tangpimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi, duoh piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ,baya nyaꞌa Yahudi soꞌ golongan Saduki nog nisog odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: being upset because they taught the people and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tiwas tuduꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes, dop-e iyoh moꞌngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ yoh nang Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.Odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh ngajal geh nang Yesus moꞌ jadin bukti nang nyaꞌadeꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus yaꞌ paliꞌ idip lagi'

verses.text: They laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, for it was now evening.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa moꞌ takap odop-e deꞌduwoh  Dop-e onu moꞌ yaꞌ ngalom, yoh moꞌ naan daang jel nog sipagi.

verses.text: But many of those who heard the word believed, and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ, bogoꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesusbitamah nog kila-kila limoh libu naꞌan.

verses.text: In the morning, their rulers, elders, and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ pagi-e nyam-e pimipin-pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Ayuh,pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon duoh gulu-gulu Agama Yahudi moꞌtikuluk deꞌ Yerusalem

verses.text: Annas the high priest was there, with Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and as many as were relatives of the high priest.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bitapod duoh Pimipin AgamaYahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh Hanas, Kayafas, Yohanes, Alexsander, duoh susuaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ molot daang madih ayua Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuhinoh

verses.text: When they had stood Peter and John in the middle of them, they inquired, “By what power, or in what name, have you done this?”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ toban Petrus duoh Yohanes, deꞌ sulung jowin-e, yohmoꞌmulai pilisa pakai bisikian, “Kuasa oni deꞌ pakai ingan, daang adon osiingan moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ?”

verses.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “You rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,
verses.source_translation: Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nguasa Petrus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oi ingan deꞌ mipinPengadilan Agama duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon!

verses.text: if we are examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man, by what means this man has been healed,
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ inganbilituang duoh koꞌih simoꞌ-o koꞌih nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobosgonan-e  Ingan moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih tanon pakai kuasa oni ngan odaꞌ nyaꞌa inohmokuaꞌ monam

verses.text: be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, in him does this man stand here before you whole.
verses.source_translation: Saꞌ ingan pimipin duoh suaꞌ ulang Israel puꞌan nangdaang adon Yesus Kristus soꞌ Nazaret deꞌ tak ingan nyalip-E, pak-e Iyohmoꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ  Daang adon Yesus Kristus inoh leh, nyaꞌa inoh ponaimujuag daang-e sehat

verses.text: He is ‘the stone which was regarded as worthless by you, the builders, which has become the head of the corner.’
verses.source_translation: Yesus inoh leh deꞌ nang-e daang Kitab deꞌ in-e,‘Batuh deꞌ saꞌat tukang nai boli deꞌ diꞌ-e biguna,’ tukang-tukanginoh leh ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ odop-e,‘pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ batuh inoh paling biguna.’

verses.text: There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!”
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon dapod nyilamat otoꞌ moꞌ nyam diꞌ-e Yesus, dop-edeꞌ daang dunia itih doiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ-ekaꞌan nyilamat otoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ.”

verses.text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled. They recognized that they had been with Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Pimipin-pimipin deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ilan ngan-e ningaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanesbilani nyawot sina odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Deꞌ puꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Petrusduoh Yohanes nyaꞌa biasa duoh deꞌ doiꞌ sikolah-e, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌpuꞌan-e geh nang odop-e deꞌ duwoh noh nyaꞌa deꞌ silalu nunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai nang oni-oni-e, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌmokuaꞌ inoh ogiꞌ mujuag sinok rasul deꞌ munoꞌ

verses.text: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ odaꞌ odop-edeꞌ duwoh inoh buu luah soꞌ topat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ biloneng.

verses.text: saying, “What shall we do to these men? Because indeed a notable miracle has been done through them, as can be plainly seen by all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we can’t deny it.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ sina, “Oni wat toꞌ yaꞌ duoh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ? Sobab susuaꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ puꞌan nang tok odop-e deꞌ duwoh inoh moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌpakai kuasa Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ ponai yaꞌ nyakal-e

verses.text: But so that this spreads no further among the people, let’s threaten them, that from now on they don’t speak to anyone in this name.”
verses.source_translation: Saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌdiꞌ-e sikiya puꞌan-e yohmoꞌ nalu odop-e deꞌ duwoh daang-e jaman odop-edeꞌ duwoh, kilakal adon Yesus tuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a.”

verses.text: They called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ mogan odop-e deꞌ duwoh odaꞌ paliꞌ molot, yohmoꞌ jamansobot adon Yesus duoh maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ ngajal daang adon Yesus.

verses.text: But Peter and John answered them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God, judge for yourselves,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus duoh Yohanes moꞌ nyawot-e, “Suba ingan pikil-e, ki deꞌbonal deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ: nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan keh nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nangTopaꞌ

verses.text: for we can’t help telling the things which we saw and heard.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e koꞌih diꞌ ponai dusah yaꞌ sobot-e duoh yaꞌ silita oni deꞌmoꞌ ningaꞌ koꞌih duoh oni deꞌ moꞌ ngojit koꞌih.”

verses.text: When they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people; for everyone glorified God for that which was done.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌulih-ulih ngegap odop-e deꞌ duwoh, pak-e nyuang-nyuang-e tuang pilopas-egeh dop-e doiꞌ yoh tapod alasan ngan-e yaꞌ ngukum odop-e deꞌ duwoh,dop-e yoh tolu tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ takal-e ningaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nai-e pakai kuasa Topaꞌ

verses.text: For the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was more than forty years old.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ odaꞌ kuasa Topaꞌinoh moꞌ pat puluꞌ lobih sowaꞌ gonan-e kobos.

verses.text: Being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ Petrus duoh Yohanes obuah pilopas soꞌ jel, odop-e deꞌ duwohinoh moꞌ paliꞌ tuduꞌ dingan-dingan-e, yohmoꞌ kilakal susuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌnang pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh, duoh pimipin-pimipin ulangYahudi deꞌ bokon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ duwoh

verses.text: When they heard it, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, “O Lord, you are God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all that is in them;
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ dingan-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ ngojit gah inoh, iyoh moꞌ samah-samah bidoa tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, in sinaodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Oi Topaꞌ, Inganleh deꞌ moꞌ nai longit duoh bumi, lautduoh susuaꞌ isiꞌ-e

verses.text: who by the mouth of your servant, David, said, ‘Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot a vain thing?
verses.source_translation: Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ pakai bobaꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih lajaDaud deꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan  Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ sina tuduꞌ laja Daud,in-e,‘Oni nai nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ malah;oni nai suaꞌ basa deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia itih nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e biguna?

verses.text: The kings of the earth take a stand, and the rulers take council together, against the Lord, and against his Christ.’
verses.source_translation: Laja-laja deꞌ dunia moꞌ siap-siap yaꞌ bipolang,ayua pimipin moꞌ bipokatlawan Topaꞌ duoh Laja Pinyilamat deꞌ moꞌ notu-E.’

verses.text: “For truly, in this city against your holy servant, Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were gathered together
verses.source_translation: Tok Herodes duoh Pontius Pilatus moꞌ bitapod duoh ulang-ulang deꞌdiꞌ-e Yahudi duoh ulang-ulang Israel daang kota itih  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌbipokat yaꞌ lawan Yesus, Kuli Ingan deꞌ kudus, deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan jadin LajaPinyilamat

verses.text: to do whatever your hand and your council foreordained to happen.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bipokat ngan-e yaꞌ pijadi susuaꞌ oniꞌdeꞌ moꞌ notu Topaꞌ soꞌ sibungas-e

verses.text: Now, Lord, look at their threats, and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ, ningaꞌ leh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ ngegap koꞌih deꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan, nginleh odaꞌ koꞌih bilanimagah Gah deꞌ Paguh

verses.text: while you stretch out your hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of your holy Servant Jesus.”
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ, bitanga leh kuasa Ingan deꞌ ayuh saꞌ nyaꞌaningaꞌ nang Ingan tok ogiꞌ kuasa, nai geh oniꞌ pakai kuasa Ingan saꞌ nyaꞌamonam mokuaꞌ daang adon Yesus, Kuli Ingan deꞌ kudus.”

verses.text: When they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were gathered together. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spoke the word of God with boldness.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mokuaꞌ bidoa, topat soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌtikuluk moꞌ biguyut  Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nguasa odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌbilani magah Pingunang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: The multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul. Not one of them claimed that anything of the things which he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus idip samah otin, samah kila-e.Doiꞌ tiyaꞌ deꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ nang tung odop-esadiꞌ-e  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai samah-samah.

verses.text: With great power, the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. Great grace was on them all.
verses.source_translation: Pakai kuasa deꞌ ayuh, rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tanon nang Yesus moꞌpaliꞌ idip lagiꞌ  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ soꞌon bilokat deꞌ ayuh soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For neither was there among them any who lacked, for as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them, and brought the proceeds of the things that were sold,
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngoon nang odop-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kulang  Dop-eogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jua tanaꞌ, ogiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ jua boli-e,

verses.text: and laid them at the apostles’ feet, and distribution was made to each, according as anyone had need.
verses.source_translation: yohmoꞌ ngin loga-etuduꞌ rasul-rasul  Rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bikutung tuduꞌ nyaꞌa nunaꞌkiang deꞌ pilelu-e.

verses.text: Joses, who by the apostles was also called Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, Son of Encouragement), a Levite, a man of Cyprus by race,
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh wat Yusuf, deꞌ mogan rasul-rasul geh nang Barnabas,loti-e nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai ngin simangat tuduꞌ nyaꞌa  Yusuf inoh soꞌ pulouSiprus, onak sukun Lewi

verses.text: having a field, sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ jua umoh-o, loga-e yoh toban tuduꞌrasul-rasul.

chapters.text: As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them, being upset because they taught the people and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead. They laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, for it was now evening. But many of those who heard the word believed, and the number of the men came to be about five thousand. In the morning, their rulers, elders, and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem. Annas the high priest was there, with Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and as many as were relatives of the high priest. When they had stood Peter and John in the middle of them, they inquired, “By what power, or in what name, have you done this?” Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “You rulers of the people, and elders of Israel, if we are examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man, by what means this man has been healed, be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, in him does this man stand here before you whole. He is ‘the stone which was regarded as worthless by you, the builders, which has become the head of the corner.’ There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!” Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled. They recognized that they had been with Jesus. Seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it. But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves, saying, “What shall we do to these men? Because indeed a notable miracle has been done through them, as can be plainly seen by all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we can’t deny it. But so that this spreads no further among the people, let’s threaten them, that from now on they don’t speak to anyone in this name.” They called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus. But Peter and John answered them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God, judge for yourselves, for we can’t help telling the things which we saw and heard.” When they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people; for everyone glorified God for that which was done. For the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was more than forty years old. Being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them. When they heard it, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, “O Lord, you are God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all that is in them; who by the mouth of your servant, David, said, ‘Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot a vain thing? The kings of the earth take a stand, and the rulers take council together, against the Lord, and against his Christ.’ “For truly, in this city against your holy servant, Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were gathered together to do whatever your hand and your council foreordained to happen. Now, Lord, look at their threats, and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness, while you stretch out your hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of your holy Servant Jesus.” When they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were gathered together. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spoke the word of God with boldness. The multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul. Not one of them claimed that anything of the things which he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common. With great power, the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. Great grace was on them all. For neither was there among them any who lacked, for as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them, and brought the proceeds of the things that were sold, and laid them at the apostles’ feet, and distribution was made to each, according as anyone had need. Joses, who by the apostles was also called Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, Son of Encouragement), a Levite, a man of Cyprus by race, having a field, sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

verses.text: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession,
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Ananias, duoh sowon-e deꞌ adon Safira moꞌ juaniꞌ ongan tanaꞌ

verses.text: and kept back part of the price, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ bipokat duoh sowon-e duit loga tanaꞌ inohyoh mit kodaꞌ-e saꞌan odop-e, kuban-e yoh moꞌ nyelah tuduꞌ rasul-rasul.

verses.text: But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land?
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Ananias, oni nai muꞌ tanah odaꞌ Laja Muatmunua nguasa otin muꞌ, sape muꞌu bilani mogo Iyang Topaꞌ, muꞌu moꞌmit loga tanaꞌ inoh kodaꞌ-a saꞌan odop muꞌ

verses.text: While you kept it, didn’t it remain your own? After it was sold, wasn’t it in your power? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart? You haven’t lied to men, but to God.”
verses.source_translation: Takal tanaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ diꞌmuꞌ jua-e, tanaꞌ inoh aluaꞌ kakuꞌ odop muꞌ, takal muꞌ moꞌ jua-e loga-ealuaꞌ tung odop muꞌ geh  Oni muꞌ nai niat jaꞌat daang otin muꞌ? Idoh diꞌmuꞌ mogo manusia pak-e muꞌu mogo Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and died. Great fear came on all who heard these things.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e ngojit sina inohgeh, Ananias moꞌ lasuꞌ tumang daang-e lasuꞌ kobos  Takal suaꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌngojit gah inoh, nyaꞌa moꞌ tolu

verses.text: The young men arose and wrapped him up, and they carried him out and buried him.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh nog kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌadeꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ moꞌ molot molut todang-e yohmoꞌ tawiak toban keꞌ sopaꞌyohmoꞌ ngubul-e.

verses.text: About three hours later, his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.
verses.source_translation: Kila-kila taluh jam takal nyaꞌa moꞌ mokuaꞌ ngubul Ananias, sowon-emoꞌ molot, pak-e diꞌ-e puꞌan nang bonon-e moꞌ kobos

verses.text: Peter answered her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much.” She said, “Yes, for so much.”
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ sikiantuduꞌ-e, “Tok kiang inoh keh loga tanaꞌ deꞌ jua ingan?” Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e,“Tok kiang inoh”.

verses.text: But Peter asked her, “How is it that you have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”
verses.source_translation: Petrus moꞌ sina, “Oni nai ingan duwoh bipokat yaꞌ mogo Iyang Topaꞌ?Ningaꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang paliꞌ ngubul bonon muꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ bolot tiban,ngan-e yaꞌ molot tawiak todang muꞌu”

verses.text: She fell down immediately at his feet, and died. The young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh geh sowon Ananiasmoꞌ lasuꞌ tumang daang-e lasuꞌ kobos, deꞌ sulung jowin Petrus  Takal nyaꞌadeꞌ aluaꞌ bujang deꞌ munoꞌ molot yohmoꞌ ningaꞌ yoh moꞌ doiꞌ asong-e, yohmoꞌ tawiak toban keꞌ sopaꞌ yoh moꞌ odi ngubul deꞌ bingon kubul bonon-e.

verses.text: Great fear came on the whole assembly, and on all who heard these things.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ ngojitgah inoh moꞌ jadin tolu.

verses.text: By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. They were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
verses.source_translation: Rasul-rasul deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ nai pingunai kiloja deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai nai-eduoh deꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌa kilin-e, deꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ  Odop-e deꞌbisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bimadih, yoh moꞌ lajintikuluk deꞌ Awah Salomo deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ

verses.text: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌdiꞌ-e puus tikuluk duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ pimodotuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ

verses.text: More believers were added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women.
verses.source_translation: Tibilang konu, nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ bitamah bogoꞌ,bait dali bait dayung

verses.text: They even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on cots and mattresses, so that as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ monam keꞌ sopaꞌ,keꞌ pang olan yohmoꞌ piguling tun topat nyaꞌa boꞌos duoh amuak, saꞌ-atakal Petrus ngilusuꞌ-e, sibamia-e obuah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: The multitude also came together from the cities around Jerusalem, bringing sick people, and those who were tormented by unclean spirits: and they were all healed.
verses.source_translation: Siuah-siuah nyaꞌa nog soꞌ kota-kota deꞌ ogiꞌ sinok Yerusalem, nyaꞌa deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ monam duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bikalui muat munua,suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ iyoh odaꞌ mokuaꞌ.

verses.text: But the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy,
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ nuaꞌiyoh kodaꞌ ulang Saduki moꞌ mulai nai ulah-e tuduꞌ rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ siniaꞌ

verses.text: and laid hands on the apostles, and put them in public custody.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ takap rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ yohmoꞌkibalot daang jel deꞌ ogiꞌ daang kota inoh

verses.text: But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors by night, and brought them out, and said,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal onu ngalom,malaikat Topaꞌ moꞌ nog bukaꞌ tiban jel, yohmoꞌ toban luah, yoh moꞌ in-e,

verses.text: “Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.”
verses.source_translation: “Odi leh mujuag deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.Tanon leh olan idip deꞌ baꞌuh tuduꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ bogoꞌ.”

verses.text: When they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak, and taught. But the high priest came, and those who were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
verses.source_translation: Rasul-rasul moꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tanon malaikat  Suam-suam pagi odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ mulai ngajal.Takal inoh Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh-e duohpinunaꞌ-pinunaꞌ-e baya pimipin-pimipin Yahudi deꞌ bokon moꞌ bilituangdeꞌ Pengadilan Agama, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa odi mit rasul-rasul soꞌ aang jel,odaꞌ toban ngaduap odop-e.

verses.text: But the officers who came didn’t find them in the prison. They returned and reported,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ-e odi keꞌ jel moꞌ nog, yohmoꞌ ningaꞌrasul-rasul inoh doiꞌ daang jel  Yoh moꞌ paliꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: “We found the prison shut and locked, and the guards standing before the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ in-e, “Koꞌih ningaꞌ tiban jel aluaꞌ bonal-bonal obuah ngusi, nyaꞌadeꞌ jaga tiban jel suaꞌ aluaꞌ ogiꞌ  Takal koꞌih moꞌ bukaꞌ tiban jel koꞌih ningaꞌmoꞌ osan.”

verses.text: Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these words, they were very perplexed about them and what might become of this.
verses.source_translation: Takal piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ duoh pimipin-pimipinAgama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh moꞌ ngojit gah inoh, yohmoꞌ bigaduh daang-ebisikian, “Oni deꞌ moꞌ obuah rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ?”

verses.text: One came and told them, “Behold, the men whom you put in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌannyaꞌa deꞌ nog tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, “Ningaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ ngejel inganadin moꞌ ogiꞌ daang Boli Topaꞌ, yoh julah-e ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ”.

verses.text: Then the captain went with the officers, and brought them without violence, for they were afraid that the people might stone them.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ piayuh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga Boli Topaꞌ duoh onak buah-a moꞌ odimit rasul-rasul inoh lagiꞌ, pak-e idoh diꞌ-e pakai pijolaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e mokos-e,dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tolu, jak nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ nyokad pakai batuh.

verses.text: When they had brought them, they set them before the council. The high priest questioned them,
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌtoban rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ molot ngaduap pengadilan.Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh moꞌ mulai bisikian tuduꞌ odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ

verses.text: saying, “Didn’t we strictly command you not to teach in this name? Behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man’s blood on us.”
verses.source_translation: In sina-e, “Moꞌ bonal-bonal koꞌih jaman ingan yaꞌ ngajalnyaꞌa tentang Nyaꞌa inoh  Pak-e adin ningaꞌ wat oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan! Inganmoꞌ kapah pingunang ingan deꞌ suaꞌ Yerusalem, ingan moꞌ yaꞌ nuduh nangkoꞌih leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh kobos.”

verses.text: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Petrus duoh rasul-rasul deꞌ bokon moꞌ nyawot-e, “Lobih paguhkoꞌih nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ soꞌ koꞌih nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang manusia

verses.text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, hanging him on a tree.
verses.source_translation: Yesus deꞌnyalib ingan moꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah sumuk babai otoꞌ.

verses.text: God exalted him with his right hand to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat Iyoh, Yoh moꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ ayuh, odaꞌ jadin Pimipinduoh Pinyilamat saꞌ basa Israel tapod paliꞌ ke olan Topaꞌ saꞌ-e soꞌon apun.

verses.text: We are His witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih moꞌ ningaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, koꞌih moꞌ tukang tanon susuaꞌ oniꞌdeꞌ moꞌ nai-E  Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ suwaꞌ tanon  Iyang Topaꞌ inoh Topaꞌ ngintuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and were determined to kill them.
verses.source_translation: Takal ayua deꞌ ogiꞌ daang Pengadilan Agama moꞌ ngojit pingunangodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, otin-e moꞌ nginyas  Yohmoꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabos rasul-rasuldeꞌ munoꞌ

verses.text: But one stood up in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, honored by all the people, and commanded to put the apostles out for a little while.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan ulang Farisi deꞌ suwaꞌ jadin ulang deꞌpingadel deꞌ adon Gamaliel, gulu agama Yahudi deꞌ sukup ulang Israeltunuak deꞌ pingunang-e  Iyoh moꞌ mujuag, odaꞌ rasul-rasul inoh luah niꞌtiliaꞌ keꞌ sopaꞌ

verses.text: He said to them, “You men of Israel, be careful concerning these men, what you are about to do.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh iyoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daangPengadilan Agama, “Oi ulang Israel, pikil dioꞌ bonal-bonal-e oni deꞌ yaꞌ naiingan duoh odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ!

verses.text: For before these days Theudas rose up, making himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nothing.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e noꞌuh-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Teudas,deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e ulang deꞌ bonal, yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ kulang lobih-e patlatus naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ iyoh  Takal yoh moꞌ obuah ngabos, nyaꞌa deꞌnunaꞌ iyoh moꞌ sobak-sobul buu, yohmoꞌ obuaꞌ silita-e

verses.text: After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment, and drew away some people after him. He also perished, and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh,takal nyaꞌa ngituang bilang layat-e, timul lagiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yudas soꞌGalilea  Iyoh moꞌ ngaluh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odaꞌ nunaꞌ odop-e' pak-e yohtuang kobos geh, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ yoh moꞌ sobak-sobul buu

verses.text: Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown.
verses.source_translation: Noh lehngan okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan: Maꞌ kaso odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, tanah! Simoꞌ-eoniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e soꞌ manusia, yoh totap ponai obuaꞌ.

verses.text: But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow it, and you would be found even to be fighting against God!”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ pingunai-e soꞌ Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ toꞌ ponai yaꞌ lawan-e  Simoꞌ toꞌlawan-e samah duoh otoꞌ lawan Topaꞌ.” Nasehat inoh nyaꞌa tilimaꞌ-e.

verses.text: They agreed with him. Summoning the apostles, they beat them and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ mogan rasul-rasul deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ mosut-e, yoh moꞌ jamanngajal nyaꞌa tentang Yesus, mokuaꞌ inoh yoh pilopas-e

verses.text: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus’ name.
verses.source_translation: Rasul-rasul deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ buu togan Pengadilan Agama, daang otin-e deꞌ sonang, dop-eTopaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ yoh jolaꞌ odaꞌ adon Yesus

verses.text: Every day, in the temple and at home, they never stopped teaching and preaching Jesus, the Christ.
verses.source_translation: Bilang konu yoh telus ngajalnyaꞌa deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ duoh deꞌ boli-boli nyaꞌa, yoh tanon Gah deꞌ Paguhtentang Yesus, Yesus inoh leh Laja deꞌ nyilamat nyaꞌa, deꞌ moꞌ tanon-edaang janyi-E.

chapters.text: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession, and kept back part of the price, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet. But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land? While you kept it, didn’t it remain your own? After it was sold, wasn’t it in your power? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart? You haven’t lied to men, but to God.” Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and died. Great fear came on all who heard these things. The young men arose and wrapped him up, and they carried him out and buried him. About three hours later, his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in. Peter answered her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much.” She said, “Yes, for so much.” But Peter asked her, “How is it that you have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.” She fell down immediately at his feet, and died. The young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband. Great fear came on the whole assembly, and on all who heard these things. By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. They were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch. None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them. More believers were added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women. They even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on cots and mattresses, so that as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them. The multitude also came together from the cities around Jerusalem, bringing sick people, and those who were tormented by unclean spirits: and they were all healed. But the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy, and laid hands on the apostles, and put them in public custody. But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors by night, and brought them out, and said, “Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.” When they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak, and taught. But the high priest came, and those who were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought. But the officers who came didn’t find them in the prison. They returned and reported, “We found the prison shut and locked, and the guards standing before the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!” Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these words, they were very perplexed about them and what might become of this. One came and told them, “Behold, the men whom you put in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.” Then the captain went with the officers, and brought them without violence, for they were afraid that the people might stone them. When they had brought them, they set them before the council. The high priest questioned them, saying, “Didn’t we strictly command you not to teach in this name? Behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man’s blood on us.” But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men. The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, hanging him on a tree. God exalted him with his right hand to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins. We are His witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.” But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and were determined to kill them. But one stood up in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, honored by all the people, and commanded to put the apostles out for a little while. He said to them, “You men of Israel, be careful concerning these men, what you are about to do. For before these days Theudas rose up, making himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nothing. After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment, and drew away some people after him. He also perished, and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad. Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown. But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow it, and you would be found even to be fighting against God!” They agreed with him. Summoning the apostles, they beat them and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go. They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus’ name. Every day, in the temple and at home, they never stopped teaching and preaching Jesus, the Christ.

verses.text: Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, a complaint arose from the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily service.
verses.source_translation: Makin tuui nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus bitamah bogoꞌ  Takal inohulang Yahudi deꞌ pakai sina Yunani diꞌ puas tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌpakai sina Ibrani  Dop-e sinoꞌ-sinoꞌ janda deꞌ pakai sina Yunani diꞌ-e soꞌonduman-e deꞌ kutung nyaꞌa bilang konu

verses.text: The twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said, “It is not appropriate for us to forsake the word of God and serve tables.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh sobab soꞌ simoong duohnaꞌan rasul moꞌ nguluk suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, yohmoꞌ in-e,“Diꞌ-e paguh simoꞌ-o jok koꞌih ngulus soal pinguman, pak-e koꞌih diꞌ koꞌihpoyaꞌ yaꞌ tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ

verses.text: Therefore select from among you, brothers, seven men of good report, full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.
verses.source_translation: Wat itih negeh otoꞌ pilih juꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌadeꞌ ogiꞌ daang uluk otoꞌ itih, nyaꞌa deꞌ puꞌan otoꞌ nang paguh, deꞌ nguasaIyang Topaꞌ, deꞌ bijak saꞌ koꞌih ngin odaꞌ yoh ngulus oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ,

verses.text: But we will continue steadfastly in prayer and in the ministry of the word.”
verses.source_translation: saꞌjok koꞌih tukang bidoa duoh tanon Pingunang Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: These words pleased the whole multitude. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch;
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ situju deꞌ pingunang rasul-rasul, yohmoꞌ pilihStefanus nyaꞌa deꞌ sukup bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus duoh Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌnguasa idip-e, yohmoꞌ Filipus, Prokhorus, Nikanor, Timon, Parmenas duohNikolaus  Nikolaus inoh ulang Antiokhia; yoh diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi pak-eyoh moꞌ molot Agama Yahudi

verses.text: whom they set before the apostles. When they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.
verses.source_translation: Juꞌ naꞌan itih yohmoꞌ toban ngaduaprasul-rasul  Rasul-rasul moꞌ naꞌ tongan-e deꞌ tun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang-ebidoa saꞌ-a odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai kiloja inoh.

verses.text: The word of God increased and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly. A great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
verses.source_translation: Watnoh leh Pingunang Topaꞌ moꞌ popah, yohmoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌtuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ bitamah bogoꞌ  Daang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ,bogoꞌ geh pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ suwaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: Stephen, full of faith and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.
verses.source_translation: Stefanus moꞌ soꞌon bilokat soꞌ Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌsukup nyaꞌa ilan-e duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ jok nyaꞌa ponai nai pakai kuasaTopaꞌ deꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ

verses.text: But some of those who were of the synagogue called “The Libertines”, and of the Cyrenians, of the Alexandrians, and of those of Cilicia and Asia arose, disputing with Stephen.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa bikalahduoh Stefanus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ silalu bikuluk daang boli topatsimayang deꞌ adon Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ Bebas  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ soꞌ Kireneduoh Aleksandria  Ogiꞌ geh ulang Yahudi deꞌ soꞌ Kilikia duoh deꞌ soꞌ Asia.

verses.text: They weren’t able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapod yaꞌ lawan oniꞌ deꞌ nang Stefanus,dop-e Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin kuasa odaꞌ iyoh ponai sina

verses.text: Then they secretly induced men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ nyogok kudu-kudu naꞌan nyaꞌa pakai duit saꞌ-e nang sina pibulaꞌ-a,“Koꞌih ngojit yoh itih pijaꞌat adon Musa duoh Topaꞌ”

verses.text: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes, and came against him and seized him, and brought him in to the council,
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh leh watodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngaluh nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ duoh pimipin-pimipin Yahudideꞌ bokon, tamah lagiꞌ gulu-gulu agama Yahudi, mokuaꞌ inoh odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ takap Stefanus, yohmoꞌ toban keꞌ Pengadilan Agama

verses.text: and set up false witnesses who said, “This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌinoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin tukang tanon deꞌ sina pibulaꞌngan-e pijaꞌat Stefanus inoh, sina in-e, “Nyaꞌa itih silalu pijaꞌat Boli Topaꞌduoh yaꞌ ngubah ukum-ukum deꞌ nulis nabi Musa deꞌ saꞌan otoꞌ

verses.text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-ekoꞌih moꞌ ngojit iyoh moꞌ nang sina: ‘Yesus soꞌ Nazaret inoh yaꞌ pilubuhBoli Topaꞌ tih duoh yoh yaꞌ ngubah ukum-ukum deꞌ nulis nabi Musa deꞌsaꞌan otoꞌ’.”

verses.text: All who sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face like it was the face of an angel.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ guluꞌ daang Pengadilan Agama moꞌ ngiduangStefanus, yohmo ningaꞌ jowin Stefanus samah kodaꞌ jowin malaikat.

chapters.text: Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, a complaint arose from the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily service. The twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said, “It is not appropriate for us to forsake the word of God and serve tables. Therefore select from among you, brothers, seven men of good report, full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business. But we will continue steadfastly in prayer and in the ministry of the word.” These words pleased the whole multitude. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch; whom they set before the apostles. When they had prayed, they laid their hands on them. The word of God increased and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly. A great company of the priests were obedient to the faith. Stephen, full of faith and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people. But some of those who were of the synagogue called “The Libertines”, and of the Cyrenians, of the Alexandrians, and of those of Cilicia and Asia arose, disputing with Stephen. They weren’t able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke. Then they secretly induced men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.” They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes, and came against him and seized him, and brought him in to the council, and set up false witnesses who said, “This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law. For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us.” All who sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face like it was the face of an angel.

verses.text: The high priest said, “Are these things so?”
verses.source_translation: In Pimipin agama deꞌ paling ayuh inoh, “Tok yeh in inoh?”

verses.text: He said, “Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,
verses.source_translation: Stefanusmoꞌ nyawot-e, “Oi madih ayua duoh bala samaꞌ  Ngojit dioꞌ! Topaꞌ deꞌdoiꞌ baning-e inoh, moꞌ bitanga odop-E tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ Abraham,takal yoh aluaꞌ deꞌ Mesopotamia, ngan-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e loꞌo deꞌ Haran

verses.text: and said to him, ‘Get out of your land, and from your relatives, and come into a land which I will show you.’
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌmoꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, ‘Buu leh soꞌ negeli muꞌ, soꞌ uluk madih muꞌ, ponu lehnuju negeli deꞌ yaꞌ tanon kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.’

verses.text: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and lived in Haran. From there, when his father was dead, God moved him into this land, where you are now living.
verses.source_translation: Abraham bilakat buu soꞌ negeliulang Kasdim, yohmoꞌ odi loꞌo deꞌ Haran.Takal samaꞌ-a moꞌ kobos, Topaꞌmoꞌ odaꞌ Abraham pinah keꞌ tanaꞌ itih, topat otoꞌ loꞌo adin

verses.text: He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on. He promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his offspring after him, when he still had no child.
verses.source_translation: Takal inohsit tuang doiꞌ geh tanaꞌ deꞌ topat otoꞌ adin deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ Abrahamdeꞌ jadin bisaka, pak-e Topaꞌ bijanyi yaꞌ ngin tuduꞌ Abraham duoh onaksukun-e nang Odop-e yaꞌ ngin tanaꞌ daꞌ-a.Takal inoh Abraham aluaꞌ doiꞌonak-e

verses.text: God spoke in this way: that his offspring would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon in-e, ‘Onak sukun muꞌ yaꞌ jadin ulang nog deꞌnupang deꞌ topat basa deꞌ bokon  Nyaꞌa danoꞌ yaꞌ paksa odaꞌ kiloja pak-edoiꞌ pah-a, yohmoꞌ obuah nyiksa sape nog pat latus sowaꞌ

verses.text: ‘I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,’ said God, ‘and after that will they come out, and serve me in this place.’
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Okuꞌyaꞌ ngukum basa nyaꞌa deꞌ paksa onak sukun Abraham odaꞌ kiloja, mokuaꞌinoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ buu togan negeli inoh yohmoꞌ paliꞌ nyomah Okuꞌdatiꞌ.’

verses.text: He gave him the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ Topaꞌ bijanyi, Yoh moꞌ mokos janyi-e noh pakai bisunat.Takal onak Abraham deꞌ adon Ishak sinoꞌ-o milaꞌ-e yohmoꞌ bisunat-e takal umul-e aluaꞌ moih onu  Mokuaꞌ inoh, Ishak moꞌ bisunat onak-e deꞌ adonYakub  Wat noh geh Yakub moꞌ bisunat soꞌ simoong duoh onak-e deꞌ jadinsumuk babai otoꞌ ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: “The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him,
verses.source_translation: Sumuk babai otoꞌ siniaꞌ deꞌ Yusuf yohmoꞌ jua Yusuf odaꞌ jadin kuli deꞌdiꞌ nyaꞌa bayal gaji-e tuduꞌ ulang Mesir, pak-e Topaꞌ silalu tulung Yusuf.

verses.text: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. He made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ pilopas yoh soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jolaꞌ yohmoꞌ ngin otin deꞌ paguhduoh bijak, takal yoh ngaduap laja ulang Mesir  Laja ulang Mesir moꞌ pakatyoh odaꞌ jadin gubelnul deꞌ moꞌ nguasa tanaꞌ Mesir duoh nguasa istana laja.

verses.text: Now a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction. Our fathers found no food.
verses.source_translation: Takal nog musim nyaꞌa sotok, mulai soꞌ tanaꞌ Mesir nog tanaꞌ Kanaan,nyaꞌa moꞌ sukup susah idip-e  Sumuk babai otoꞌ moꞌ doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ man-e.

verses.text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time.
verses.source_translation: Takal Yakub moꞌ ngojit nang deꞌ Mesir ogiꞌ ganum, yohmoꞌ odaꞌ onak deꞌjadin sumuk babai otoꞌ odi kanoꞌ  Takal inoh leh sibungas-e yoh odi kanoꞌ.

verses.text: On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph’s race was revealed to Pharaoh.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odi keꞌ duwoh sidoh-e, Yusuf moꞌ tanon odop-etuduꞌ madih ayua-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang odop-e leh Yusuf  Takal inoh leh lajaMesir moꞌ puꞌan madih ayua Yusuf

verses.text: Joseph sent, and summoned Jacob, his father, and all his relatives, seventy-five souls.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh Yusuf moꞌ sibaya odaꞌsamaꞌ-a baya suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ ogiꞌ juꞌ puluꞌ limoh naꞌan pinah ke Mesir.

verses.text: Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died, himself and our fathers,
verses.source_translation: Yakub moꞌ pinah keꞌ Mesir, yoh moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ nog odop-e baya suaꞌonak sukun-e deꞌ jadin sumuk babai otoꞌ kobos

verses.text: and they were brought back to Shechem, and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the children of Hamor of Shechem.
