verses.text: Having found disciples, we stayed there seven days. These said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ Tirus koꞌih moꞌ odinomi ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo duoh-e niꞌ mingu.Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e jaman Paulus odikeꞌ Yerusalem

verses.text: When those days were over, we departed and went on our journey. They all, with wives and children, brought us on our way until we were out of the city. Kneeling down on the beach, we prayed.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ sukup onu-e koꞌih yaꞌ buu, koꞌih moꞌ lanyutpimonu koꞌih  Ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus danoꞌ moꞌ polog manak-ekatod koꞌih nog sopaꞌ kota  Nog bingon laut koꞌih moꞌ guluꞌ bikunyugbidoa

verses.text: After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh koꞌih moꞌ bisejut duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, koꞌih moꞌmuat deꞌ kapal  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu paliꞌ keꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: When we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais. We greeted the brothers, and stayed with them one day.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ Tirus koꞌih bilayal nog keꞌ kota Ptolemais, koꞌih bilayal nog inohgeh  Koꞌih moꞌ odi bitapod duoh ulang Kristen, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo niꞌ onu duohodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ

verses.text: On the next day, we, who were Paul’s companions, departed, and came to Caesarea. We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e koꞌih moꞌ bilayal soꞌ kanoꞌ koꞌih moꞌnog kota Kaisarea  Danoꞌ koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli Filipus nyaꞌa deꞌ tukangmagah Gah deꞌ Paguh  Iyoh Niꞌ soꞌ ayua deꞌ juꞌ naꞌan deꞌ obuah pilih takal-edeꞌ Yerusalem dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ odaꞌ tulung ayua rasul tukang bikutung bigiansaꞌan ulang janda

verses.text: Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.
verses.source_translation: Filipus ogiꞌ pat naꞌan onak dayung-e deꞌ ngin Topaꞌkuasa daꞌ-e, odaꞌ ponai bitutaꞌ

verses.text: As we stayed there some days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu onu-e takal koꞌih loꞌo danoꞌ,nabi deꞌ adon Agabus deꞌ soꞌ Yudea deꞌ ponai geh bitutaꞌ moꞌ nog tuduꞌkoꞌih

verses.text: Coming to us, and taking Paul’s belt, he bound his own feet and hands, and said, “Thus says the Holy Spirit: ‘So will the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt, and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ koꞌih, yoh moꞌ mit soot kupuang Paulus, yohmoꞌ mokos tongan poꞌon odop-e, yoh moꞌ sina, “In itih in Iyang Topaꞌ:‘Nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ soot kupuang itih yaꞌ obuah mokos wat itih geh odaꞌulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ Yerusalem, yoh moꞌ nyelah tuduꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌdiꞌ-e Yahudi.’ ”

verses.text: When we heard these things, both we and they of that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh, suaꞌ koꞌih ulang Kristendanoꞌ moꞌ jaman Paulus odi keꞌ Yerusalem

verses.text: Then Paul answered, “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e,“Oni nai ingan siꞌian nusah otin kuꞌ? Simoꞌ-e ngan kuꞌ magah adon TopaꞌYesus, idoh diꞌ-e jok kuꞌ obuah jel, pak-e kobos tuang doh geh diꞌ kuꞌ tolu.”

verses.text: When he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, “The Lord’s will be done.”
verses.source_translation: Paulus doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang koꞌih, koꞌih moꞌ tanah-e, “Mana-manawat Topaꞌ duoh-e.” In koꞌih.

verses.text: After these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ kudu-kudu onu-e loꞌo deꞌ Kaisarea koꞌih moꞌ biponyap, koꞌihmoꞌ bilakat keꞌ Yerusalem

verses.text: Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us, bringing one Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we would stay.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Kristen soꞌKaisarea suwaꞌ nunaꞌ koꞌih  Yoh moꞌ toban koꞌih keꞌ boli Manason, topatsoꞌ koꞌih yaꞌ ngilumon  Iyoh soꞌ Siprus deꞌ moꞌ tuui jadin pinunaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: When we had come to Jerusalem, the brothers received us gladly.
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih nog keꞌ Yerusalem ulang Kristen danoꞌ sukup sonang-enyamut koꞌih

verses.text: The day following, Paul went in with us to James; and all the elders were present.
verses.source_translation: Onu deꞌ nikan-e koꞌih duoh Paulus moꞌ odi bitapodduoh Yakobus, suaꞌ pimipin uluk ulang Kristen deꞌ Yerusalem ogiꞌ danoꞌ.

verses.text: When he had greeted them, he reported one by one the things which God had worked among the Gentiles through his ministry.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ sikian kabal nyaꞌa danoꞌ, Paulus moꞌ silita tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌnang Topaꞌ tulung basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi pakai odop-e.

verses.text: They, when they heard it, glorified God. They said to him, “You see, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed, and they are all zealous for the law.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ silita Paulus, odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ moꞌ mudi Topaꞌ, yoh moꞌ in-e duoh Paulus, “Madih ayua, ingan moꞌningaꞌ ogiꞌ bilibu-libu ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ aluaꞌ lajin nunaꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa

verses.text: They have been informed about you, that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs.
verses.source_translation: Pak-eogiꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang ingan ngajal ulang-ulangYahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ topat nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi, odaꞌ posan Atulan-atulandeꞌ nulis Musa, ingan moꞌ ngajal ulang Yahudi saꞌ-a diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisunatonak-onak-e duoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nunaꞌ adat otoꞌ ulang Yahudi

verses.text: What then? The assembly must certainly meet, for they will hear that you have come.
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulangYahudi deꞌ bisayaꞌ, pasti puꞌan nang ingan ogiꞌ datiꞌ  Wat ki tiyaꞌ?

verses.text: Therefore do what we tell you. We have four men who have taken a vow.
verses.source_translation: Watihsijaꞌ-e nunaꞌ negeh nasehat koꞌih, ogiꞌ pat naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bijanyi tuduꞌTopaꞌ

verses.text: Take them, and purify yourself with them, and pay their expenses for them, that they may shave their heads. Then all will know that there is no truth in the things that they have been informed about you, but that you yourself also walk keeping the law.
verses.source_translation: Odi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pat inoh keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e ogiꞌ deꞌYerusalem, nyeꞌ moꞌ samah-samah nai adat pilopas polih duoh kibisig odopingan, nyeꞌ moꞌ tangung biaya adat inoh, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bigumolbak-e  Ingan nai wat itih saꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngojit nyaꞌatentang ingan diꞌ-e bonal, dop-e ingan tuang aluaꞌ nunaꞌ Atulan-atulanTopaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa geh

verses.text: But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have written our decision that they should observe no such thing, except that they should keep themselves from food offered to idols, from blood, from strangled things, and from sexual immorality.”
verses.source_translation: Saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ moꞌmolot Kristen, moꞌ ogiꞌ koꞌih pait sulat tuduꞌ-e, tanon tuduꞌ-e jaman manpinguman deꞌ moꞌ nyelah nyaꞌa tuduꞌ tipaduaꞌ, jaman man doyaꞌ binatang,jaman man dagin binatang deꞌ kobos nyikak, duoh diꞌ-e soꞌon ngaso nyaꞌadeꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop nyeꞌ.”

verses.text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purified himself and went with them into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them.
verses.source_translation: Onu deꞌ nikan-e, Paulus moꞌ odi duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ pat na'an inoh, ngan-esamah-samah nai adat kibisig odop-e, mokuaꞌ inoh Paulus moꞌ molot keꞌBoli Topaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ pimipin agama Yahudi siniaꞌ onu pilopas polih yaꞌobuaꞌ, onu ngan nyaꞌa yaꞌ simoliah binatang deꞌ ngin nyaꞌa deꞌ pat inoh.

verses.text: When the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him,
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ yaꞌ sukup juꞌ onu, ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog soꞌ propinsiAsia, moꞌ ningaꞌ Paulus daang Boli Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngaluhnyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ odaꞌ takap Paulus

verses.text: crying out, “Men of Israel, help! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place. Moreover, he also brought Greeks into the temple, and has defiled this holy place!”
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang bogan-e, “Oiulang Israel yoh itih leh ulang deꞌ ponu katiꞌ-kanih ngajal nyaꞌa odaꞌ lawanbasa otoꞌ, yoh moꞌ jaman nyaꞌa nunaꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabiMusa duoh adin iyoh kaꞌis Boli Topaꞌ pakai toban nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudidaang Boli Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: For they had seen Trophimus, the Ephesian, with him in the city, and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ ningaꞌ Trofimusulang deꞌ soꞌ Efesus ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Paulus deꞌ kota Yerusalem,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ sakaꞌ nang Paulus toban keꞌ Boli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: All the city was moved, and the people ran together. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. Immediately the doors were shut.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kota Yerusalem inoh moꞌ manas, yoh moꞌodi tikuluk deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ takap Paulus, yoh moꞌmatak toban keꞌ sopaꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh nyaꞌa moꞌ kuab tiban ijuam BoliTopaꞌ

verses.text: As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.
verses.source_translation: Takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ kila-e yaꞌ ngabos Paulus, gahinoh moꞌ tomus tuduꞌ komandan sidadu Roma, nang kota Yerusalem moꞌkalang-kabut

verses.text: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. They, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, stopped beating Paul.
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ likas-likas mogan onak buah-e,duoh komandan legu-e, yoh moꞌ bikoduh odi keꞌ uun nyaꞌa deꞌ kalang-kabutinoh  Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ komandan sidadu duoh onak buah-enog, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kangan odop-e pijolaꞌ Paulus

verses.text: Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains, and inquired who he was and what he had done.
verses.source_translation: Komandansidadu inoh moꞌ odi sinok Paulus, yoh moꞌ takap-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ pasungpakai duwoh late, yoh moꞌ bisikian tuduꞌ nyaꞌa danoꞌ, “Osi iyoh, oni deꞌmoꞌ nai-e?”

verses.text: Some shouted one thing, and some another, among the crowd. When he couldn’t find out the truth because of the noise, he commanded him to be brought into the barracks.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu naꞌan soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang intih ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang in inoh, sawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuaꞌ okon-okon.Dop-e liyuak daluag nyaꞌa sikiya dolas, komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ diꞌ-epuꞌan oni-oni deꞌ nang-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ onak buah-e toban Paulus keꞌ posayuh-e

verses.text: When he came to the stairs, he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd;
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa toban Paulus nog tunguah pos, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ moꞌmongas, noh leh ngan sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tawiak Paulus

verses.text: for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out, “Away with him!”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌadeꞌ bogoꞌ deꞌ bitunaꞌ duoh-e moꞌ nang bogan-e, “Ngabos nyeꞌ iyoh neh!”

verses.text: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he asked the commanding officer, “May I speak to you?” He said, “Do you know Greek?
verses.source_translation: Takal-e yaꞌ toban Paulus molot keꞌ pos, Paulus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ komandansidadu Roma inoh pakai sina Yunani, “Tapod yeh kuꞌ sina duoh ingan nehkomandan?”Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ gogoh ngojit-e, “Ponai keh muꞌ sina Yunani?

verses.text: Aren’t you then the Egyptian, who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?”
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e wat noh, idoh diꞌ-e muꞌu ulang Mesir deꞌ toban nyaꞌa mokatlawan pilitah deꞌ sodiꞌ-e, deꞌ toban nyaꞌa deꞌ lika ngabos nyaꞌa buu keꞌpadang pasil, pat libu naꞌan odop-e.”

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city. I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ ulang Yahudi, okuꞌ obuah milaꞌ deꞌ Tarsuskota deꞌ timogah deꞌ propinsi Kilikia, tulung odaꞌ okuꞌ sina duoh nyaꞌa deꞌbogoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ.”

verses.text: When he had given him permission, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with his hand to the people. When there was a great silence, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying,
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ odaꞌ-e, Paulus moꞌ mujuag deꞌ bangtunguah, yoh moꞌ pakat tongan-e jaman nyaꞌa bidaluag, takal nyaꞌa moꞌloꞌo' Paulus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ pakai sina ulang Yahudi.

chapters.text: When we had departed from them and had set sail, we came with a straight course to Cos, and the next day to Rhodes, and from there to Patara. Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail. When we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed to Syria, and landed at Tyre, for there the ship was to unload her cargo. Having found disciples, we stayed there seven days. These said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem. When those days were over, we departed and went on our journey. They all, with wives and children, brought us on our way until we were out of the city. Kneeling down on the beach, we prayed. After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again. When we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais. We greeted the brothers, and stayed with them one day. On the next day, we, who were Paul’s companions, departed, and came to Caesarea. We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him. Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied. As we stayed there some days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea. Coming to us, and taking Paul’s belt, he bound his own feet and hands, and said, “Thus says the Holy Spirit: ‘So will the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt, and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’” When we heard these things, both we and they of that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem. Then Paul answered, “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.” When he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, “The Lord’s will be done.” After these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem. Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us, bringing one Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we would stay. When we had come to Jerusalem, the brothers received us gladly. The day following, Paul went in with us to James; and all the elders were present. When he had greeted them, he reported one by one the things which God had worked among the Gentiles through his ministry. They, when they heard it, glorified God. They said to him, “You see, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed, and they are all zealous for the law. They have been informed about you, that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs. What then? The assembly must certainly meet, for they will hear that you have come. Therefore do what we tell you. We have four men who have taken a vow. Take them, and purify yourself with them, and pay their expenses for them, that they may shave their heads. Then all will know that there is no truth in the things that they have been informed about you, but that you yourself also walk keeping the law. But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have written our decision that they should observe no such thing, except that they should keep themselves from food offered to idols, from blood, from strangled things, and from sexual immorality.” Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purified himself and went with them into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them. When the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him, crying out, “Men of Israel, help! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place. Moreover, he also brought Greeks into the temple, and has defiled this holy place!” For they had seen Trophimus, the Ephesian, with him in the city, and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple. All the city was moved, and the people ran together. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. Immediately the doors were shut. As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar. Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. They, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, stopped beating Paul. Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains, and inquired who he was and what he had done. Some shouted one thing, and some another, among the crowd. When he couldn’t find out the truth because of the noise, he commanded him to be brought into the barracks. When he came to the stairs, he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd; for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out, “Away with him!” As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he asked the commanding officer, “May I speak to you?” He said, “Do you know Greek? Aren’t you then the Egyptian, who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?” But Paul said, “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city. I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.” When he had given him permission, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with his hand to the people. When there was a great silence, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying,

verses.text: “Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense which I now make to you.”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Madih ayua duoh bala samaꞌ ngojit dioꞌ sina kuꞌ,kuꞌ tanon nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ salah.”

verses.text: When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. He said,
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ inohngojit Paulus sina pakai sina Ibrani sina odop nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ loꞌongojit-e

verses.text: “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, instructed according to the strict tradition of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are today.
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Okuꞌ itih ulang Yahudi, obuah milaꞌ deꞌ kotaTarsus deꞌ propinsi Kilikia, pak-e okuꞌ ayuh datiꞌ  Okuꞌ bilajal datiꞌ duohgulu Gamaliel  Iyoh ngajal okuꞌ odaꞌ bonal-bonal taat nunaꞌ suaꞌ atulan deꞌtanon nabi Musa tuduꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ  Okuꞌ sukup taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, suaꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nai kuꞌ samah kodaꞌ deꞌ nai ingan deꞌ mutiꞌ geh

verses.text: I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ deꞌtukang pijolaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ olan Topaꞌ sape ogiꞌ deꞌ kobos; bait dali baitdayung okuꞌ takap biyon kaang jel

verses.text: As also the high priest and all the council of the elders testify, from whom also I received letters to the brothers, and traveled to Damascus to bring them also who were there to Jerusalem in bonds to be punished.
verses.source_translation: Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ PalingAyuh duoh suaꞌ pimipin ulang Yahudi dapod tanon tuduꞌ ingan nang okuꞌdiꞌ kuꞌ mogo  Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ okuꞌ soꞌon sulat saꞌan ulang Yahudi deꞌDamsyik  Pakai sulat inoh, okuꞌ soꞌon takap nyaꞌa danoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ daangolan Topaꞌ toban paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem saꞌ-e obuah ukum.”

verses.text: As I made my journey, and came close to Damascus, about noon, suddenly a great light shone around me from the sky.
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ sina lagiꞌ in-e, “Pak-e daang olan takal kuꞌ sinok yaꞌ nogDamsyik, uun onu tang-tang jawaꞌ deꞌ soꞌ longit deꞌ sukup telang-e nyokuabokuꞌ

verses.text: I fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ labuꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ngojit sina in-e, ‘Saulus, Saulus!  Oni nai muꞌu pijolaꞌ Okuꞌ?’

verses.text: I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, ‘Osi Ingan?’ Yoh moꞌ in-e,‘Okuꞌ leh Yesus deꞌ soꞌ Nazaret deꞌ pijolaꞌ muꞌ.’

verses.text: “Those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid, but they didn’t understand the voice of him who spoke to me.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ suwaꞌ duohokuꞌ suwaꞌ kilin jawaꞌ inoh, pak-e sina-E jok-e okuꞌ deꞌ klingah

verses.text: I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Arise, and go into Damascus. There you will be told about all things which are appointed for you to do.’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌmoꞌ sikian in kuꞌ, ‘Oni mey deꞌ odaꞌ Ingan okuꞌ nai-e Topaꞌ?’ Topaꞌ moꞌin-e duoh okuꞌ, ‘Mokat nyeꞌ moꞌ odi keꞌ Damsyik, danoꞌ tiaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌtanon tuduꞌ muꞌu suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Okuꞌ muꞌu yaꞌ nai-e, in Topaꞌ.’

verses.text: When I couldn’t see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus.
verses.source_translation: Botonkuꞌ moꞌ butaꞌ odaꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ sape mun silua-e inoh, yohmoꞌ dingan kuꞌ moꞌkayak okuꞌ toban keꞌ Damsyik.

verses.text: One Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews who lived in Damascus,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ Damsyik ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Ananias, yoh itih ulang deꞌ taat nunaꞌAtulan-atulan deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, suaꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ sukuppimodo tuduꞌ-e

verses.text: came to me, and standing by me said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ In that very hour I looked up at him.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nog mujuag sinok okuꞌ yoh moꞌ sina, ‘Madih kuꞌSaulus, bukaꞌ boton muꞌ ningaꞌ mey!’ Takal inoh geh okuꞌ lasuꞌ ponai kilinbaꞌuh, okuꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ iyoh

verses.text: He said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ in-e, ‘Topaꞌ sumuk babai otoꞌ moꞌpilih muꞌu, odaꞌ muꞌu puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Iyoh muꞌu nai-e  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌmuꞌu ningaꞌ duoh ngojit sina Yesus deꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e muꞌu leh deꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa oni deꞌ moꞌkilin muꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngojit muꞌ

verses.text: Now why do you wait? Arise, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’
verses.source_translation: Adin oni tiyaꞌ deꞌ kajon muꞌ? Mokatmey, tanon odaꞌ nyaꞌa baptis odop muꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ-engapun dosa muꞌ.’ ”

verses.text: “When I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance,
verses.source_translation: Takal kuꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ Yerusalem okuꞌ bidoa deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e deꞌogiꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, tang-tang Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nguasa okuꞌ

verses.text: and saw him saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you.’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ ningaꞌTopaꞌ Yesus, Yoh moꞌ sina duoh okuꞌ in-e, “Buu likas-e soꞌ Yerusalemdop-e nyaꞌa datiꞌ idoh diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang muꞌu tentang Okuꞌ.”

verses.text: I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in you.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot, “Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang okuꞌ deꞌ odi keꞌboli-boli simayang, okuꞌ takap nyaꞌa, okuꞌ bipupuꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌtuduꞌ Ingan

verses.text: When the blood of Stephen, your witness, was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting to his death, and guarding the cloaks of those who killed him.’
verses.source_translation: Watnoh geh takal nyaꞌa ngabos Stefanus deꞌ tukang magahtentang Ingan, okuꞌ ogiꞌ geh danoꞌ suwaꞌ situju sape okuꞌ deꞌ jaga pimakainyaꞌa deꞌ nyokad Stefanus.”

verses.text: “He said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you out far from here to the Gentiles.’”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Topaꞌ in-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ, “Buu negehdop-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ pait muꞌu juuaꞌ tuduꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi.”

verses.text: They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and said, “Rid the earth of this fellow, for he isn’t fit to live!”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ danoꞌ aluaꞌ ngojit Paulus sina, pak-e takal-e sina nangodop-e halus buu tuduꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tiwasnang bogan-e, “Ngabos negeh nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ itih neh' yoh diꞌ-e patut idip!”

verses.text: As they cried out, and threw off their cloaks, and threw dust into the air,
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nang bogan-e yoh moꞌ paan jubah-e deꞌ tanaꞌyoh moꞌ odaꞌ lopu tanaꞌ mokat tigamul

verses.text: the commanding officer commanded him to be brought into the barracks, ordering him to be examined by scourging, that he might know for what crime they shouted against him like that.
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu Roma tanonodaꞌ sidadu-e toban Paulus keꞌ pos-e ngan-e yaꞌ pilisa-e, danoꞌ yoh odaꞌsidadu mosut-e saꞌ-e tanon oni nai ulang-ulang Yahudi nang bogan-e deꞌ ininoh tuduꞌ iyoh

verses.text: When they had tied him up with thongs, Paul asked the centurion who stood by, “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and not found guilty?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ pasung Paulus ngan-eyaꞌ mosut-e, Paulus moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ sidadu deꞌ mujuag danoꞌ, “Soꞌon kehnyeꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ mosut nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin layat Roma deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ bilituangduoh-e?”

verses.text: When the centurion heard it, he went to the commanding officer and told him, “Watch what you are about to do, for this man is a Roman!”
verses.source_translation: Takal-e ngojit Paulus sina in inoh sidadu inoh odi tuduꞌ komandan-eyoh moꞌ sina in-e, “Tadoꞌ koꞌih yaꞌ ngilangal hukum! Nyaꞌa itih layatRoma.”

verses.text: The commanding officer came and asked him, “Tell me, are you a Roman?” He said, “Yes.”
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Paulus yoh moꞌ in-e, “Tok yehmuꞌu layat Roma neh?” Paulus moꞌ nyawot, “Tok okuꞌ itih layat Roma.”

verses.text: The commanding officer answered, “I bought my citizenship for a great price.” Paul said, “But I was born a Roman.”
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Paulus, “Okuꞌ bayal pakai duitsukup maal-e ngan kuꞌ jadin layat Roma.” Pak-e Paulus in-e, “Pingoma kuꞌkan-e layat Roma, Yoh ngan Okuꞌ tuang layat Roma geh.”

verses.text: Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him, and the commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman, because he had bound him.
verses.source_translation: Ngojit nang Paulus layat Roma, sidadu deꞌ julah-e yaꞌ mosut moꞌdiꞌ-e jadi mosut-e, komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ jadin tolu takal-e moꞌ puꞌanPaulus inoh layat Roma, dop-e yoh moꞌ pasung Paulus.

verses.text: But on the next day, desiring to know the truth about why he was accused by the Jews, he freed him from the bonds, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together, and brought Paul down and set him before them.
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ kalik oni sibonal-e deꞌ nai Paulus nganulang Yahudi nuduh iyoh  Noh leh ngan onu deꞌ nikan-e yoh moganpimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌbokon odaꞌ tikuluk, yohmoꞌ toban ngaduap odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e pilisa-e.

chapters.text: “Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense which I now make to you.” When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. He said, “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, instructed according to the strict tradition of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are today. I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women. As also the high priest and all the council of the elders testify, from whom also I received letters to the brothers, and traveled to Damascus to bring them also who were there to Jerusalem in bonds to be punished. As I made my journey, and came close to Damascus, about noon, suddenly a great light shone around me from the sky. I fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’ I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.’ “Those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid, but they didn’t understand the voice of him who spoke to me. I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Arise, and go into Damascus. There you will be told about all things which are appointed for you to do.’ When I couldn’t see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus. One Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews who lived in Damascus, came to me, and standing by me said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ In that very hour I looked up at him. He said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth. For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard. Now why do you wait? Arise, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’ “When I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance, and saw him saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you.’ I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in you. When the blood of Stephen, your witness, was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting to his death, and guarding the cloaks of those who killed him.’ “He said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you out far from here to the Gentiles.’” They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and said, “Rid the earth of this fellow, for he isn’t fit to live!” As they cried out, and threw off their cloaks, and threw dust into the air, the commanding officer commanded him to be brought into the barracks, ordering him to be examined by scourging, that he might know for what crime they shouted against him like that. When they had tied him up with thongs, Paul asked the centurion who stood by, “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and not found guilty?” When the centurion heard it, he went to the commanding officer and told him, “Watch what you are about to do, for this man is a Roman!” The commanding officer came and asked him, “Tell me, are you a Roman?” He said, “Yes.” The commanding officer answered, “I bought my citizenship for a great price.” Paul said, “But I was born a Roman.” Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him, and the commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman, because he had bound him. But on the next day, desiring to know the truth about why he was accused by the Jews, he freed him from the bonds, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together, and brought Paul down and set him before them.

verses.text: Paul, looking steadfastly at the council, said, “Brothers, I have lived before God in all good conscience until today.”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ ngiduang nyaꞌa deꞌ bilituang duoh odop-e, yoh moꞌin-e, “Madih ayua, sape nog onu itih doiꞌ nyam kuꞌ nang odopkuꞌ salah tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ idip nunaꞌ otin osuap kuꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌjowin Topaꞌ.”

verses.text: The high priest, Ananias, commanded those who stood by him to strike him on the mouth.
verses.source_translation: Takal Paulus sina in inoh, Ananias, pimipin Agama Yahudideꞌ Paling Ayuh, odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ mujuag sinok odop Paulus napalbobaꞌ-e

verses.text: Then Paul said to him, “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit to judge me according to the law, and command me to be struck contrary to the law?”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ in-e duoh Ananias, “Topaꞌ yaꞌ napal ingan, ingankodaꞌ sinung deꞌ koꞌis, deꞌ ngisat nyaꞌa odaꞌ mopuꞌ, ingan pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ sijaꞌ-e!Guluꞌ ngituang okuꞌ nunaꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, pak-eodop ingan lawan atulan inoh odaꞌ nyaꞌa tauꞌ-tauꞌ napal okuꞌ.”

verses.text: Those who stood by said, “Do you malign God’s high priest?”
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ mujuag nuaꞌ umiah Paulus in-e, “Muꞌu doiꞌ pimodomuꞌ tuduꞌ Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh deꞌ tukang layan Topaꞌ?”

verses.text: Paul said, “I didn’t know, brothers, that he was high priest. For it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Oi madih ayua, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan nang iyohPimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh  Tok ogiꞌ deꞌ nulis daang ayat Kitabdeꞌ in-e: ‘Maꞌ muꞌu yaꞌ sina pijaꞌat nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin pimipin muꞌu!’ ”

verses.text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, “Men and brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. Concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged!”
verses.source_translation: Paulus puꞌan nang nyaꞌa deꞌ tikuluk deꞌ yaꞌ ngituang odop-e inohogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ uluk ulang soꞌ golongan Saduki, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌ uluk ulangsoꞌ golongan Farisi, Paulus moꞌ in-e dolas-dolas-e, “Madih ayua, okuꞌ itihulang soꞌ golongan Farisi, pingoma kuꞌ ulang soꞌ golongan Farisi geh  Okuꞌobuah ngituang wat itih luban kuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Topaꞌ yaꞌ pakat nyaꞌa deꞌmoꞌ kobos odaꞌ paliꞌ idip lagiꞌ.”

verses.text: When he had said this, an argument arose between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the crowd was divided.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ ngojit sina deꞌ tanon Paulus,odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mulai bikalah, odop-e deꞌ bilituang inoh moꞌ botahjadin duwoh uluk, uluk soꞌ golongan Farisi duoh uluk soꞌ golongan Saduki.

verses.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, nor angel, nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess all of these.
verses.source_translation: Uluk ulang soꞌ golongan Saduki diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos yaꞌpaliꞌ idip baꞌuh, diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ nang ogiꞌ malaikat, ogiꞌ iyang, pak-e ulang soꞌgolongan Farisi bisayaꞌ nang oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ

verses.text: A great clamor arose, and some of the scribes of the Pharisees’ part stood up, and contended, saying, “We find no evil in this man. But if a spirit or angel has spoken to him, let’s not fight against God!”
verses.source_translation: Ulang soꞌ golongan Farisideꞌ jadin gulu agama Yahudi duoh ulang soꞌ golongan Saduki moꞌ bikalahpakai bisingak, makin tuui makin dolas  Yohmoꞌ in ulang soꞌ golonganFarisi, “Doiꞌ koꞌih tapod oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai nyaꞌa itih, podo ogiꞌ iyangkeh, malaikat keh deꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e.”

verses.text: When a great argument arose, the commanding officer, fearing that Paul would be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ isin-isin bikalah, komandan sidadu inoh moꞌtolu jak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pijolaꞌ Paulus odaꞌ kobos  Pimipin sidadu inohmoꞌ odaꞌ onak buah-e odi mit Paulus soꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ tobankeꞌ pos-e.

verses.text: The following night, the Lord stood by him, and said, “Cheer up, Paul, for as you have testified about me at Jerusalem, so you must testify also at Rome.”
verses.source_translation: Takal ngalom deꞌ nikan-e, Topaꞌ nog mujuag sinok Paulus, Yoh moꞌsina, “Maꞌ yaꞌ tolu  Oni wat muꞌu bilani magah Okuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, watnohgeh muꞌu halus magah Okuꞌ deꞌ Roma.”

verses.text: When it was day, some of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul.
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang Yahudi moꞌ nai pokat jaꞌat-e.Yohmoꞌ bisupah simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngabos Paulus, odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e man diꞌ-e nuak

verses.text: There were more than forty people who had made this conspiracy.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ bipokat inoh ogiꞌ lobih soꞌ patpuluꞌ naꞌan

verses.text: They came to the chief priests and the elders, and said, “We have bound ourselves under a great curse, to taste nothing until we have killed Paul.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odi ngaduap pimipin-pimipin agamaYahudi deꞌ ayuh duoh pimipin-pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon daang-enang sina, “Koꞌih moꞌ bisupah diꞌ koꞌih yaꞌ man duoh yaꞌ nuak simoꞌ Paulusaluaꞌ diꞌ koꞌih ngabos-e

verses.text: Now therefore, you with the council inform the commanding officer that he should bring him down to you tomorrow, as though you were going to judge his case more exactly. We are ready to kill him before he comes near.”
verses.source_translation: Adin, madih ayua duoh ulang soꞌ PengadilanAgama Yahudi, ingan pait sulat tuduꞌ komandan sidadu Roma inoh, odaꞌiyoh toban Paulus paliꞌ ngaduap ingan pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ yaꞌ pilisa-e bonal-bonalsalah deꞌ nai-e  Koꞌih moꞌ siap yaꞌ ngabos yoh takal-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog katiꞌ.”

verses.text: But Paul’s sister’s son heard they were lying in wait, and he came and entered into the barracks and told Paul.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e pokat nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tomus deꞌ kojit pinanak Paulus,yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ pos tanon tuduꞌ Paulus

verses.text: Paul summoned one of the centurions, and said, “Bring this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to tell him.”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ mogan niꞌ naꞌansoꞌ sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ yoh moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e, “Toban onak mudaꞌ itih tuduꞌkomandan ingan dop-e ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon-e.”

verses.text: So he took him, and brought him to the commanding officer, and said, “Paul, the prisoner, summoned me and asked me to bring this young man to you, who has something to tell you.”
verses.source_translation: Sidadu inoh moꞌ tobanpinanak Paulus inoh tuduꞌ komandan-e, yoh moꞌ sina, “Paulus deꞌ daangjel inoh mogan okuꞌ, mitiaꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ toban pinanak-e itih tuduꞌ ingan, ogiꞌoniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ ingan.”

verses.text: The commanding officer took him by the hand, and going aside, asked him privately, “What is it that you have to tell me?”
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ kagian tongan-e yoh moꞌ toban keꞌ tuakpos-e daang-e sikian tuduꞌ-e, “Oni deꞌ yaꞌ tanon muꞌ tuduꞌ okuꞌ?”

verses.text: He said, “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as though intending to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ nyawot-e, “Ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌingan odaꞌ toban Paulus ngaduap Pengadilan Agama Yahudi deꞌ palingayuh Tiaꞌ pagi  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ yaꞌ pilisa Paulus bonal-bonal.

verses.text: Therefore don’t yield to them, for more than forty men lie in wait for him, who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him. Now they are ready, looking for the promise from you.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e maꞌ ingan yaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e ogiꞌlobih soꞌ pat puluꞌ naꞌan deꞌ bisukan tuman deꞌ olan, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌbisupah diꞌ-e man diꞌ-e nuak moꞌ-e aluaꞌ diꞌ-e ngabos Paulus  Adin odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ siap, duam-e kajon ingan nang ‘yoh’ sijaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: So the commanding officer let the young man go, charging him, “Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me.”
verses.source_translation: Komandansidadu inoh moꞌ odaꞌ pinanak Paulus inoh paliꞌ, yoh moꞌ in-e, “Maꞌ tanontuduꞌ osi sijaꞌ-a nang odop muꞌ moꞌ tanon hal inoh tuduꞌ okuꞌ.”

verses.text: He called to himself two of the centurions, and said, “Prepare two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea, with seventy horsemen, and two hundred men armed with spears, at the third hour of the night.”
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ mogan duwoh naꞌan komandan kompiyoh moꞌ tanon daꞌ-e, “Sidia sidadu pat latus juꞌ puluꞌ naꞌan odaꞌ bilakatpukul pliꞌi ngalom keꞌ Kaisarea: Duwoh latus naꞌan deꞌ pakai podang, juꞌpuluꞌ naꞌan pakai kuda, duwoh latus naꞌan lagiꞌ pakai asual

verses.text: He asked them to provide animals, that they might set Paul on one, and bring him safely to Felix the governor.
verses.source_translation: Nyeꞌ moꞌsidia geh kuda saꞌan Paulus, toban iyoh odaꞌ odi tuduꞌ gubelnul Feliks.”

verses.text: He wrote a letter like this:
verses.source_translation: Komandan sidadu inoh moꞌ nulis sulat tuduꞌ gubelnul Feliks  Deꞌ in-e,

verses.text: “Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor Felix: Greetings.
verses.source_translation: “Tuduꞌ ingan gubernur Feliks ulang deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-a, Salamsoꞌ okuꞌ Klaudius Lisias!

verses.text: “This man was seized by the Jews, and was about to be killed by them, when I came with the soldiers and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.
verses.source_translation: Samah-samah duoh sulat itih okuꞌ pait niꞌ naꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah takapodaꞌ ulang Yahudi   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kagaꞌ yaꞌ ngabos-e, pak-e okuꞌ nogtoban onak buah kuꞌ odi nyilamat iyoh  Dop-e koꞌih moꞌ ngojit yoh tuanglayat Roma geh

verses.text: Desiring to know the cause why they accused him, I brought him down to their council.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e okuꞌ yaꞌ puꞌan oni salah deꞌ nuduh nyaꞌa tuduꞌ-e,okuꞌ moꞌ toban keꞌ Pengadilan Agama Yahudi

verses.text: I found him to be accused about questions of their law, but not to be charged with anything worthy of death or of imprisonment.
verses.source_translation: Lupa-e Paulus doiꞌ naisalah deꞌ bitotok duoh ukum ngabos duoh obuah jel  Oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌPaulus jok-e soal agama odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, pak-e moꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan Romayoh diꞌ-e salah

verses.text: When I was told that the Jews lay in wait for the man, I sent him to you immediately, charging his accusers also to bring their accusations against him before you. Farewell.”
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tanon nang ogiꞌ pokat jaꞌat ulang-ulangYahudi tuduꞌ yoh  Okuꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ pait iyoh tuduꞌ ingan, okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ ayuadeꞌ nuduh Paulus odi saꞌ-a tanon oni salah Paulus deꞌ jowin ingan.”

verses.text: So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris.
verses.source_translation: Sidadu-sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai kodaꞌ deꞌ sibaya-e, yoh moꞌ tobanPaulus takal onu ngalom nog keꞌ kota Antipatris

verses.text: But on the next day they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the barracks.
verses.source_translation: Tiaꞌ pagi ayua sidadudeꞌ ponu poꞌon paliꞌ keꞌ pos-e, ayua sidadu deꞌ pakai kuda lanyut pimonu-esamah-samah duoh Paulus

verses.text: When they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ nog Kaisarea, sidadu deꞌ pakaikuda inoh moꞌ ngin sulat deꞌ soꞌ komandan-e tuduꞌ gubelnul Feliks simadi-enyelah baya Paulus

verses.text: When the governor had read it, he asked what province he was from. When he understood that he was from Cilicia, he said,
verses.source_translation: Takal gubelnul moꞌ basa sulat inoh yoh moꞌ sikiantuduꞌ Paulus in-e, “Muꞌu soꞌ propinsi ki?” Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Okuꞌ soꞌpropinsi Kilikia.”

verses.text: “I will hear you fully when your accusers also arrive.” He commanded that he be kept in Herod’s palace.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ sina, “Okuꞌ ngituang oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh nyaꞌatuduꞌ muꞌu, takal nyaꞌa deꞌ nuduh muꞌu moꞌ nog katiꞌ.” Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ naanPaulus deꞌ istana Herodes.

chapters.text: Paul, looking steadfastly at the council, said, “Brothers, I have lived before God in all good conscience until today.” The high priest, Ananias, commanded those who stood by him to strike him on the mouth. Then Paul said to him, “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit to judge me according to the law, and command me to be struck contrary to the law?” Those who stood by said, “Do you malign God’s high priest?” Paul said, “I didn’t know, brothers, that he was high priest. For it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’” But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, “Men and brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. Concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged!” When he had said this, an argument arose between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the crowd was divided. For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, nor angel, nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess all of these. A great clamor arose, and some of the scribes of the Pharisees’ part stood up, and contended, saying, “We find no evil in this man. But if a spirit or angel has spoken to him, let’s not fight against God!” When a great argument arose, the commanding officer, fearing that Paul would be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks. The following night, the Lord stood by him, and said, “Cheer up, Paul, for as you have testified about me at Jerusalem, so you must testify also at Rome.” When it was day, some of the Jews banded together, and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul. There were more than forty people who had made this conspiracy. They came to the chief priests and the elders, and said, “We have bound ourselves under a great curse, to taste nothing until we have killed Paul. Now therefore, you with the council inform the commanding officer that he should bring him down to you tomorrow, as though you were going to judge his case more exactly. We are ready to kill him before he comes near.” But Paul’s sister’s son heard they were lying in wait, and he came and entered into the barracks and told Paul. Paul summoned one of the centurions, and said, “Bring this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to tell him.” So he took him, and brought him to the commanding officer, and said, “Paul, the prisoner, summoned me and asked me to bring this young man to you, who has something to tell you.” The commanding officer took him by the hand, and going aside, asked him privately, “What is it that you have to tell me?” He said, “The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as though intending to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him. Therefore don’t yield to them, for more than forty men lie in wait for him, who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him. Now they are ready, looking for the promise from you.” So the commanding officer let the young man go, charging him, “Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me.” He called to himself two of the centurions, and said, “Prepare two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea, with seventy horsemen, and two hundred men armed with spears, at the third hour of the night.” He asked them to provide animals, that they might set Paul on one, and bring him safely to Felix the governor. He wrote a letter like this: “Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor Felix: Greetings. “This man was seized by the Jews, and was about to be killed by them, when I came with the soldiers and rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman. Desiring to know the cause why they accused him, I brought him down to their council. I found him to be accused about questions of their law, but not to be charged with anything worthy of death or of imprisonment. When I was told that the Jews lay in wait for the man, I sent him to you immediately, charging his accusers also to bring their accusations against him before you. Farewell.” So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris. But on the next day they left the horsemen to go with him, and returned to the barracks. When they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him. When the governor had read it, he asked what province he was from. When he understood that he was from Cilicia, he said, “I will hear you fully when your accusers also arrive.” He commanded that he be kept in Herod’s palace.

verses.text: After five days, the high priest, Ananias, came down with certain elders and an orator, one Tertullus. They informed the governor against Paul.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ limoh onu Pimipin Agama Yahudi deꞌ Paling Ayuh Ananiasduoh kudu-kudu pimipin ulang Yahudi deꞌ bokon nog toban tukangbela, deꞌ adon-e Tertulus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngaduap gubelnul Feliks, ngan-eyaꞌ ngadu salah Paulus tuduꞌ-e

verses.text: When he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, “Seeing that by you we enjoy much peace, and that prosperity is coming to this nation by your foresight,
verses.source_translation: Gubelnul moꞌ mogan Paulus odaꞌ ngaduapodop-e, Tertulus mulai nuduh Paulus in-e,“Gubelnul Feliks, moꞌ tuui takal-e ingan deꞌ mipin, koꞌih moꞌ mulai kiꞌansonang, dop-e bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ maju daang basa koꞌih odaꞌ bijak ingan.

verses.text: we accept it in all ways and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thankfulness.
verses.source_translation: Daki sijaꞌ-e koꞌih silalu tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan, koꞌih bisukul tuduꞌingan

verses.text: But, that I don’t delay you, I entreat you to bear with us and hear a few words.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e saꞌ-e diꞌ-e tuui saꞌat masa ingan, sabal dioꞌ niꞌ tiliaꞌ ngojitdioꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngadu koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan

verses.text: For we have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih moꞌ ningaꞌ nyaꞌa itih ulangpingaso deꞌ bahaya  Daki-daki sijaꞌ-e yoh odaꞌ ulang Yahudi bikaꞌi si odop-e.Iyoh leh deꞌ jadin pimipin soꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal Yesussoꞌ Nazaret

verses.text: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.
verses.source_translation: Yoh lika suba kaꞌis Boli Topaꞌ, pak-e koꞌih moꞌ takap-e  Koꞌihyaꞌ bilituang duoh-e nunaꞌ atulan agama odop-e koꞌih

verses.text: By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.”
verses.source_translation: Lisias moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌihodi tuduꞌ ingan, moꞌ odop ingan deꞌ sikian totap ingan puꞌan nang onideꞌ ngadu koꞌih itih tok.”

verses.text: The Jews also joined in the attack, affirming that these things were so.
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ ogiꞌ danoꞌ tuang suwaꞌnyalah Paulus, yoh nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ sobot Tertulus inoh akan-e tok.

verses.text: When the governor had beckoned to him to speak, Paul answered, “Because I know that you have been a judge of this nation for many years, I cheerfully make my defense,
verses.source_translation: Gubelnul Feliks moꞌ tanon odaꞌ Paulus sina, Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Moꞌpuꞌan kuꞌ nang ingan moꞌ bisowaꞌ-sowaꞌ moꞌ jadin hakim basa koꞌih, nohleh ngan kuꞌ sonang tapod sina tanon nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ-e salah deꞌ jowiningan

verses.text: seeing that you can verify that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem.
verses.source_translation: Ingan soꞌon kalik nyaꞌa soꞌ ingan sikian-e dop-e simoong duwohonu deꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem nyomah Topaꞌ

verses.text: In the temple they didn’t find me disputing with anyone or stirring up a crowd, either in the synagogues, or in the city.
verses.source_translation: Aluaꞌ doiꞌ sidoh nyaꞌadeꞌ mutiꞌ tapod okuꞌ bikalah duoh osi-osi-e, aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa tapod okuꞌnguluk nyaꞌa odaꞌ bikaꞌi bait deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ bait deꞌ boli topat simayangduoh topat-topat deꞌ bokon daang kota

verses.text: Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapodtanon bukti oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngadu-e inoh tuduꞌ ingan

verses.text: But this I confess to you, that after the Way, which they call a sect, so I serve the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e okuꞌ ngadutuduꞌ ingan nang okuꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih nunaꞌ Olan deꞌtanon Topaꞌ Yesus  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nang okuꞌ salah, pak-e okuꞌ bisayaꞌsuaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, duoh buk deꞌ nulisnabi-nabi deꞌ bokon

verses.text: having hope toward God, which these also themselves look for, that there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ samah kodaꞌ yoh deꞌ mutiꞌ geh, okuꞌ bisayaꞌnang Topaꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ pakat nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos odaꞌ paliꞌ idip, bait nyaꞌa deꞌpaguh bait nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat!

verses.text: Herein I also practice always having a conscience void of offense toward God and men.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan kuꞌ silalu nai oniꞌ bonal-bonalnunaꞌ otin osuap kuꞌ, saꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ baya manusia.

verses.text: Now after some years, I came to bring gifts for the needy to my nation, and offerings;
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu sowaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ okuꞌ moꞌ buꞌu togan Yerusalem, okuꞌmoꞌ paliꞌ toban duit deꞌ moꞌ masia koꞌih saꞌan basa odop koꞌih, duohsimoliah binatang saꞌan Topaꞌ

verses.text: amid which certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil.
verses.source_translation: Takal okuꞌ mokuaꞌ nai adat kibisig odopkuꞌ, okuꞌ aluaꞌ simoliah binatang saꞌan Topaꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ  Kudu-kudunaꞌan ulang Yahudi soꞌ Asia kilin okuꞌ danoꞌ, doiꞌ-e nak ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌdeꞌ bikaꞌi

verses.text: They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ patut nog ngadu okuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan,moꞌ nyam-e tok ogiꞌ salah kuꞌ

verses.text: Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council,
unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, ‘Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!’”
But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying, “When Lysias, the commanding officer, comes down, I will decide your case.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Feliks moꞌ bogoꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal Topaꞌ Yesus, moꞌkangan odop-e bilituang yoh moꞌ in-e, “Kajon Lisias komandan sidadu inohnog katiꞌ, ke okuꞌ motod ituang-e itih.”

verses.text: He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody, and should have some privileges, and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him.
verses.source_translation: Feliks moꞌ odaꞌ komandan pasukan sidadu inoh totap naan Paulus,pak-e diꞌ-e jolaꞌ ngilate-e, simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ dingan-dingan-e nog ngin oniꞌ deꞌpilelu-e diꞌ-e jaman-e.

verses.text: But after some days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess, and sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu onu mokuaꞌ inoh Feliks duoh sowon-e deꞌ adon Drusila,ulang Yahudi, odi keꞌ topat Paulus obuah naan, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa tobanPaulus tuduꞌ odop-e, yoh moꞌ ngojit Paulus tanon loti bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ YesusKristus

verses.text: As he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, “Go your way for this time, and when it is convenient for me, I will summon you.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal Paulus sina oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ boton Topaꞌ, nijonasong, duoh onu takal Topaꞌ bilituang duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa, Feliks moꞌ tolu.Yoh moꞌ in-e, “Moh dioꞌ! Buu negeh adin, lopas tih okuꞌ mogan muꞌulagiꞌ.”

verses.text: Meanwhile, he also hoped that money would be given to him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore also he sent for him more often, and talked with him.
verses.source_translation: Yoh alap-alap nang Paulus ngin duit deꞌ odop-e, noh leh ngan-epaliꞌ-paliꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa mogan Paulus, odaꞌ odi sina duoh odop-e.

verses.text: But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus, and desiring to gain favor with the Jews, Felix left Paul in bonds.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal sukup duwoh sowaꞌ, Perkius Festus moꞌ gati Feliks jadingubelnul  Saꞌ ulang Yahudi diꞌ-e buꞌui deꞌ odop-e, yoh moꞌ tanah Paulusodaꞌ totap daang jel.

chapters.text: After five days, the high priest, Ananias, came down with certain elders and an orator, one Tertullus. They informed the governor against Paul. When he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, “Seeing that by you we enjoy much peace, and that prosperity is coming to this nation by your foresight, we accept it in all ways and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thankfulness. But, that I don’t delay you, I entreat you to bear with us and hear a few words. For we have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes. He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.    By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.” The Jews also joined in the attack, affirming that these things were so. When the governor had beckoned to him to speak, Paul answered, “Because I know that you have been a judge of this nation for many years, I cheerfully make my defense, seeing that you can verify that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem. In the temple they didn’t find me disputing with anyone or stirring up a crowd, either in the synagogues, or in the city. Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me. But this I confess to you, that after the Way, which they call a sect, so I serve the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets; having hope toward God, which these also themselves look for, that there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust. Herein I also practice always having a conscience void of offense toward God and men. Now after some years, I came to bring gifts for the needy to my nation, and offerings; amid which certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil. They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me. Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council, unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, ‘Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!’” But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying, “When Lysias, the commanding officer, comes down, I will decide your case.” He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody, and should have some privileges, and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him. But after some days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess, and sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus. As he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, “Go your way for this time, and when it is convenient for me, I will summon you.” Meanwhile, he also hoped that money would be given to him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore also he sent for him more often, and talked with him. But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus, and desiring to gain favor with the Jews, Felix left Paul in bonds.

verses.text: Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ taluh onu takal Festus moꞌ nog keꞌ Kaisarea, yoh moꞌ bilakatsoꞌ kanoꞌ odi keꞌ Yerusalem

verses.text: Then the high priest and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul, and they begged him,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ Yerusalem pimipin-pimipin agamadeꞌ ayuh duoh ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ timogah nog ngaduap Festus, yohmoꞌ tanon oni deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌ Paulus

verses.text: asking a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem; plotting to kill him on the way.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ mitiaꞌ soꞌ Festus odaꞌtulung pait Paulus keꞌ Yerusalem  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ wat inoh, dop-eodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bipokat yaꞌ ngabos Paulus deꞌ lopot olan.

verses.text: However Festus answered that Paul should be kept in custody at Caesarea, and that he himself was about to depart shortly.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Festus moꞌ in-e, “Paulus totap obuah naan deꞌ Kaisarea, diꞌ-e tuilagiꞌ okuꞌ tuang yaꞌ paliꞌ kanih geh

verses.text: “Let them therefore”, said he, “that are in power among you go down with me, and if there is anything wrong in the man, let them accuse him.”
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e wat inoh, odaꞌ leh kudu-kudunaꞌan pimipin ingan suwaꞌ odi samah-samah duoh okuꞌ keꞌ Kaisarea, ingansoꞌon nutut iyoh danih kan-e ogiꞌ salah-e.”

verses.text: When he had stayed among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea, and on the next day he sat on the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought.
verses.source_translation: Festus loꞌo deꞌ Yerusalem kulang lobih moih nog simoong onu  Mokuaꞌinoh yoh paliꞌ keꞌ Kaisarea  Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e yoh moꞌ odaꞌ onak buah-etoban Paulus, odi ngaduap odop-e

verses.text: When he had come, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove,
verses.source_translation: Takal Paulus moꞌ nog, suaꞌ ulang-ulangYahudi deꞌ nog soꞌ Yerusalem moꞌ mujuag kulung Paulus  Yoh moꞌ nuduhPaulus nai bogoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tok-tok jaꞌat  Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tapodtanon bukti oni deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌ Paulus

verses.text: while he said in his defense, “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ bela odop-e, in-e,“Sit tuang doiꞌ geh kuꞌ salah, bait tuduꞌ Atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabiMusa, tuduꞌ boli Topaꞌ, bait tuduꞌ laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”

verses.text: But Festus, desiring to gain favor with the Jews, answered Paul and said, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem, and be judged by me there concerning these things?”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Festus yaꞌ odaꞌ otin ulang Yahudi sonang, yohmoꞌ sikian tuduꞌPaulus, in-e, “Laꞌan muꞌ yeh odi keꞌ Yerusalem, saꞌ kuꞌ ngituang oniꞌ deꞌnuduh nyaꞌa tuduꞌ muꞌu danih?”

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am standing before Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be tried. I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Adin okuꞌ ogiꞌ mujuag deꞌ jowinpengadilan Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh, datiꞌ leh topat ingan ngituangokuꞌ  Ingan tuang puꞌan nang okuꞌ doiꞌ salah kuꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: For if I have done wrong, and have committed anything worthy of death, I don’t refuse to die; but if none of those things is true that they accuse me of, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!”
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e tok ogiꞌ okuꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ bitotok duoh ukum ngabos,okuꞌ siap tilimaꞌ-e, pak-e simoꞌ-e oniꞌ deꞌ napo-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ diꞌ-e bonal,osi sijaꞌ-e doiꞌ hak-e yaꞌ nyelah okuꞌ tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ  Okuꞌ mitiaꞌbilituang deꞌ jowin laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh.”

verses.text: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you shall go.”
verses.source_translation: Festus moꞌ biloneng duoh penasehat-e, mokuaꞌ inoh Festus moꞌ sina,“Muꞌu halus odi ngaduap Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh, muꞌu mitiaꞌ bilituangdeꞌ jowin Laja inoh.”

verses.text: Now when some days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea, and greeted Festus.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ kudu-kudu onu-e, Laja Agripa duoh sudiꞌ-e deꞌ dayung deꞌadon Bernike nog keꞌ Kaisarea, ngan-e odi nomi Festus

verses.text: As he stayed there many days, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying, “There is a certain man left a prisoner by Felix;
verses.source_translation: Kudu-kudu onu-eLaja Agripa duoh Bernike loꞌo danoꞌ, Festus moꞌ tanon suaꞌ masalah Paulustuduꞌ laja Agripa  Festus moꞌ sina,“Datiꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan, takal Feliks aluaꞌ jadin gubelnul.

verses.text: about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, asking for a sentence against him.
verses.source_translation: Takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem pimipin-pimipin agama deꞌ ayuh duohulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ timogah moꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ nuduh-e tuduꞌ Paulusduoh odaꞌ ngukum iyoh

verses.text: To whom I answered that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man to destruction, before the accused has met the accusers face to face, and has had opportunity to make his defense concerning the matter laid against him.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, ‘Idoh diꞌ-etapod moꞌ-e nunaꞌ adat Roma, nyeꞌ nyelah nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah napo odaꞌ obuahukum, simoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang-e salah inoh aluaꞌ diꞌ-e odaꞌ ngaduap nyaꞌadeꞌ napo iyoh, duoh odaꞌ bela odop-e

verses.text: When therefore they had come together here, I didn’t delay, but on the next day sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought.
verses.source_translation: Jadin takal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌsamah-samah duoh okuꞌ nog katiꞌ, tiaꞌ pagi-e okuꞌ moꞌ lasuꞌ guluꞌ bilituang,kuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ Paulus molot ngaduap okuꞌ.’

verses.text: Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such things as I supposed;
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mokatmujuag tanon oniꞌ deꞌ napo-e tuduꞌ Paulus, pak-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌjaꞌat deꞌ nai-e kodaꞌ deꞌ sakaꞌ kuꞌ

verses.text: but had certain questions against him about their own religion, and about one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bikalah duohPaulus jok-e hal agama odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ adon Yesus deꞌmoꞌ kobos, pak-e Paulus tanon nang Iyoh moꞌ tok-tok mokat idip baꞌuh.

verses.text: Being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these matters.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tuang moꞌ idoh geh diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan oni wat kuꞌ yaꞌ ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌbikalah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ sikian tuduꞌ Paulus, ‘Oni keh muꞌu laꞌanodi keꞌ Yerusalem, otoꞌ ngituang oniꞌ deꞌ napo-e tuduꞌ muꞌu itih danih?’

verses.text: But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept until I could send him to Caesar.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Paulus doliaꞌ-a, yoh mitiaꞌ odaꞌ odop-e totap obuah naan, okuꞌmoꞌ naan-e, nog okuꞌ tapod pait iyoh tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh, saꞌyoh bilituang deꞌ jowin Laja Roma,” in Festus.

verses.text: Agrippa said to Festus, “I also would like to hear the man myself.” “Tomorrow,” he said, “you shall hear him.”
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ in Agripa tuduꞌ Festus, “Okuꞌ yaꞌ lasuꞌ ngojit soꞌ odop-e.”Festus moꞌ in-e, “Tiaꞌ pagi ingan bitapod lasuꞌ ngojit soꞌ odop-e.”

verses.text: So on the next day, when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and they had entered into the place of hearing with the commanding officers and the principal men of the city, at the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e Agripa duoh Bernike moꞌ nog keꞌ topat bilituang, nyaꞌamoꞌ lami nyamut-e  Yoh moꞌ molot kaang topat bilituang samah-samahduoh ayua komandan sidadu, baya ulang-ulang timogah soꞌ kota inoh.Festus moꞌ pilitah odaꞌ sidadu-e toban Paulus molot

verses.text: Festus said, “King Agrippa, and all men who are here present with us, you see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews petitioned me, both at Jerusalem and here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.
verses.source_translation: Festus moꞌ sina,“Laja Agripa duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ datiꞌ! Nyaꞌa itih, moꞌ ogiꞌ ulangYahudi lepot tuduꞌ okuꞌ, bait takal kuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem, watnoh geh takalkuꞌ deꞌ Kaisarea  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nutut Paulus pakai nang bogan-e,yoh diꞌ soꞌon otoꞌ tanah odaꞌ idip tuui

verses.text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e deꞌ puꞌan okuꞌ, doiꞌ salahdeꞌ nai-e deꞌ bitotok duoh ukum ngabos  Takal yoh mitiaꞌ odaꞌ Laja Romadeꞌ paling ayuh ngituang odop-e, okuꞌ moꞌ motod yaꞌ pait iyoh tuduꞌ LajaRoma

verses.text: of whom I have no certain thing to write to my lord. Therefore I have brought him out before you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, that, after examination, I may have something to write.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e doiꞌ deꞌ pasti deꞌ yaꞌ nulis kuꞌ tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ palingayuh masalah yoh itih  Iyoh leh ngan kuꞌ toban yoh odaꞌ ngaduap suaꞌingan, lobih lagiꞌ tuduꞌ ingan Laja Agripa, saꞌ-e mokuaꞌ ingan pilisa-e, ogiꞌoniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nulis kuꞌ

verses.text: For it seems to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not to also specify the charges against him.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e moꞌ-e nunaꞌ kila kuꞌ, diꞌ-e patut nyeꞌ paitnyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan, pak-e doiꞌ nyeꞌ tanon oni deꞌ napo nyaꞌa tuduꞌ-e.”

chapters.text: Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea. Then the high priest and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul, and they begged him, asking a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem; plotting to kill him on the way. However Festus answered that Paul should be kept in custody at Caesarea, and that he himself was about to depart shortly. “Let them therefore”, said he, “that are in power among you go down with me, and if there is anything wrong in the man, let them accuse him.” When he had stayed among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea, and on the next day he sat on the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought. When he had come, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove, while he said in his defense, “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.” But Festus, desiring to gain favor with the Jews, answered Paul and said, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem, and be judged by me there concerning these things?” But Paul said, “I am standing before Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be tried. I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well. For if I have done wrong, and have committed anything worthy of death, I don’t refuse to die; but if none of those things is true that they accuse me of, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!” Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you shall go.” Now when some days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea, and greeted Festus. As he stayed there many days, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying, “There is a certain man left a prisoner by Felix; about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, asking for a sentence against him. To whom I answered that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man to destruction, before the accused has met the accusers face to face, and has had opportunity to make his defense concerning the matter laid against him. When therefore they had come together here, I didn’t delay, but on the next day sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought. Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such things as I supposed; but had certain questions against him about their own religion, and about one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive. Being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these matters. But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept until I could send him to Caesar.” Agrippa said to Festus, “I also would like to hear the man myself.” “Tomorrow,” he said, “you shall hear him.” So on the next day, when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and they had entered into the place of hearing with the commanding officers and the principal men of the city, at the command of Festus, Paul was brought in. Festus said, “King Agrippa, and all men who are here present with us, you see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews petitioned me, both at Jerusalem and here, crying that he ought not to live any longer. But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him, of whom I have no certain thing to write to my lord. Therefore I have brought him out before you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, that, after examination, I may have something to write. For it seems to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not to also specify the charges against him.”

verses.text: Agrippa said to Paul, “You may speak for yourself.” Then Paul stretched out his hand, and made his defense.
verses.source_translation: Laja Agripa moꞌ in-e tuduꞌ Paulus, “Muꞌu soꞌon sina tanon nangodop muꞌ diꞌ muꞌ salah.” Paulus moꞌ pakat tongan-e yoh moꞌ silitanang odop-e diꞌ-e salah, yoh moꞌ in-e,

verses.text: “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, that I am to make my defense before you today concerning all the things that I am accused by the Jews,
verses.source_translation: “Laja Agripa, onu itih okuꞌ nang odop kuꞌ tok bituah dop-e okuꞌ tapodsina tuduꞌ ingan nang odop kuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ salah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nuduh ulangYahudi tuduꞌ okuꞌ

verses.text: especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews. Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently.
verses.source_translation: Amot-e ingan deꞌ tok puꞌan adat duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ daangbangsa koꞌih Yahudi, okuꞌ mitiaꞌ ingan sabal ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ tanon kuꞌ.

verses.text: “Indeed, all the Jews know my way of life from my youth up, which was from the beginning among my own nation and at Jerusalem;
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ ulang Yahudi puꞌan oni wat idip kuꞌ soꞌ takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ,okuꞌ idip samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem

verses.text: having known me from the first, if they are willing to testify, that after the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ laꞌan tanon-e, moꞌ tuui odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ puꞌan nangokuꞌ soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi  Ulang deꞌ paling tutug nunaꞌ atulan deꞌ ogiꞌdaang agama Yahudi

verses.text: Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers,
verses.source_translation: Adin okuꞌ mujuag datiꞌ obuah ngituang deꞌ jowiningan luban okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ janyi deꞌ nai Topaꞌ tuduꞌ sumuk babai koꞌih.

verses.text: which our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hope to attain. Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa!
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ ulang Yahudi tuang suwaꞌ geh kajon janyi inoh, noh leh ngan odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ buwon-buwon singonu-singalom nyomah Topaꞌ  Luban okuꞌbisayaꞌ deꞌ janyi inoh leh okuꞌ obuah nuduh odaꞌ ulang Yahudi

verses.text: Why is it judged incredible with you, if God does raise the dead?
verses.source_translation: Oni naidiꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ nang Topaꞌ tapod pakat nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos odaꞌ mokat idipbaꞌuh?

verses.text: “I myself most certainly thought that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
verses.source_translation: Sibonal-e dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ okuꞌ tuang suwaꞌ geh nai oni sijaꞌ-e ngan kuꞌlawan pinunaꞌ Yesus, nyaꞌa soꞌ Nazaret inoh

verses.text: This I also did in Jerusalem. I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests, and when they were put to death I gave my vote against them.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh leh oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌnai okuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem takal okuꞌ moꞌ soꞌon sulat kuasa soꞌ pimipin-pimipinagama Yahudi, okuꞌ moꞌ takap ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus biyon daangjel  Okuꞌ tuang suwaꞌ situju geh ulang Kristen obuah ngabos

verses.text: Punishing them often in all the synagogues, I tried to make them blaspheme. Being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities.
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ sidohokuꞌ pijolaꞌ ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus deꞌ boli topat simayang,duoh paksa saꞌ-e diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus  Nyam oniꞌ deꞌ nyouh kila kuꞌ,okuꞌ ngajah kalik ulang Kristen sape nog kota deꞌ bokon.”

verses.text: “Whereupon as I traveled to Damascus with the authority and commission from the chief priests,
verses.source_translation: Paulus lanyut silita-e in-e, “Wat inoh geh okuꞌ odi keꞌ Damsyik tobansulat kuasa deꞌ soꞌ pimipin-pimipin agama Yahudi deꞌ ayuh.”

verses.text: at noon, O king, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me.
verses.source_translation: Oi lajaAgripa, takal inoh okuꞌ deꞌ lopot olan aluaꞌ uun onu, tang-tang jawaꞌ soꞌlongit lobih soꞌ jawaꞌ boton onu nyokuab okuꞌ duoh dingan-dingan kuꞌ.

verses.text: When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ odop koꞌih labuꞌ keꞌ tanaꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ ngojit sina deꞌ pakai sina Ibrani,‘Saulus, Saulus! Oni nai muꞌu pijolaꞌ Okuꞌ? Doiꞌ guna muꞌ lawan niat Topaꞌ,madas kanam odop muꞌ sijaꞌ-e.’

verses.text: “I said, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ “He said, ‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ nyawot, ‘Osi Ingan?’Yoh moꞌ in-e nyawot okuꞌ, ‘Okuꞌ leh Yesus deꞌ bigaꞌan muꞌu pijolaꞌ-e.

verses.text: But arise, and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this purpose: to appoint you a servant and a witness both of the things which you have seen, and of the things which I will reveal to you;
verses.source_translation: Mokat mujuag! Okuꞌ bitanga odop Kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu, saꞌ muꞌu kiloja saꞌanOkuꞌ  Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu magah suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kilin muꞌ onu itih tuduꞌ suaꞌnyaꞌa, duoh tanon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ bitanga Kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu sunih onu-e.

verses.text: delivering you from the people, and from the Gentiles, to whom I send you,
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu odi tuduꞌ basa Yahudi duoh basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi  Nyaꞌadeꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ lawan muꞌu pak-e Okuꞌ yaꞌ nyilamat muꞌu
