verses.text: to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌubukaꞌ boton nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌ-e kos soꞌ mopung odi keꞌ jawaꞌ, saꞌ-e lopassoꞌ kuasa Laja muat munua yoh moꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, saꞌ-e takal-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌOkuꞌ, Topaꞌ ngapun dosa-e, Topaꞌ odaꞌ yoh soꞌon topat deꞌ moꞌ jok-e saꞌannyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih-e,’ inoh in Yesus.

verses.text: “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision,
verses.source_translation: “Oi laja Agripa, noh leh ngan okuꞌ silalu nai oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon-Etakal-E sina soꞌ siluga

verses.text: but declared first to them of Damascus, at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.
verses.source_translation: Sibungas-e okuꞌ odi tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌDamsyik, deꞌ kota Yerusalem duoh suaꞌ propinsi Yudea, mokuaꞌ inoh tuduꞌbasa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi okuꞌ tanon odaꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ togan olandeꞌ jaꞌat, paliꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ paguh saꞌ-e puꞌan nangodop-e moꞌ togan olan deꞌ jaꞌat

verses.text: For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple, and tried to kill me.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon okuꞌ lubanulang Yahudi takap okuꞌ deꞌ Boli Topaꞌ, iyoh moꞌ yaꞌ ngabos okuꞌ

verses.text: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen,
verses.source_translation: Pak-enog adin Topaꞌ aluaꞌ tulung okuꞌ, adin okuꞌ tapod mujuag datiꞌ tanon tuduꞌsuaꞌ nyaꞌa, bait ulang deꞌ sotok, bait ulang deꞌ kaya  Oniꞌ deꞌ tanon kuꞌ itihdoiꞌ deꞌ bokon, oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nutaꞌ nabi Musa duoh nabi-nabi deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: how the Christ must suffer, and how, by the resurrection of the dead, he would be first to proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh nang Laja pinyilamat totap jolaꞌ, Iyoh yaꞌ kobos  Iyoh inoh leh deꞌpidioꞌ-o mokat idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos  Iyoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ tanon olandeꞌ jawaꞌ tuduꞌ ulang Yahudi duoh ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi saꞌ-a silamat.”

verses.text: As he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice, “Paul, you are crazy! Your great learning is driving you insane!”
verses.source_translation: Takal Paulus aluaꞌ sina tanon oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-e, tang-tang gubelnulFestus mokat nyingak Paulus, “Gila muꞌu neh! Muꞌu sikiya bogoꞌ bilajal,muꞌu moꞌ gila odaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: But he said, “I am not crazy, most excellent Festus, but boldly declare words of truth and reasonableness.
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ nyawot-e, “Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ gila nehgubelnul Festus deꞌ pimodo okuꞌ daꞌ-e, sina deꞌ nang kuꞌ itih akan-e tokbonal duoh molot akal!

verses.text: For the king knows of these things, to whom also I speak freely. For I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him, for this has not been done in a corner.
verses.source_translation: Laja Agripa tuang puꞌan-e geh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌmutiꞌ  Yoh ngan kuꞌ bilani sina deꞌ sulung jowin-e  Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang iyohpuꞌan-e, dop-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa tuang puꞌan-e geh dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi deꞌjowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ

verses.text: King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you believe.”
verses.source_translation: Bisayaꞌ kedoh keh ingan laja Agripa oniꞌ deꞌ tanonnabi? Okuꞌ puꞌan nang ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ nabi.”

verses.text: Agrippa said to Paul, “With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian?”
verses.source_translation: Laja Agripa moꞌ nyawot-e, “Likas manah muꞌu odaꞌ okuꞌ jadin ulangKristen!”

verses.text: Paul said, “I pray to God, that whether with little or with much, not only you, but also all that hear me today, might become such as I am, except for these bonds.”
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Likas bait tuui bait, okuꞌ yaꞌ bidoa mitiaꞌtuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ ingan duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunang kuꞌ datiꞌ samahkodaꞌ okuꞌ  Jok-e ingan diꞌ-e obuah pasung kodaꞌ okuꞌ.”

verses.text: The king rose up with the governor, and Bernice, and those who sat with them.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh laja Agripa, Gubelnul Festus, Bernike, duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌguluꞌ samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mokat mujuag

verses.text: When they had withdrawn, they spoke to one another, saying, “This man does nothing worthy of death or of bonds.”
verses.source_translation: Daang-eluah odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ in-e si odop-e, “Nyaꞌa itih doiꞌ nyam salah-ediꞌ-e patut nyeꞌ yaꞌ ngabos-e duoh ngejel-e.”

verses.text: Agrippa said to Festus, “This man might have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”
verses.source_translation: Laja Agripa moꞌ in-e duoh Gubelnul Festus, “Simoꞌ yoh diꞌ-e mitiaꞌbilituang tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh yoh itih moꞌ tapod nyeꞌ pilopas-e.”

chapters.text: Agrippa said to Paul, “You may speak for yourself.” Then Paul stretched out his hand, and made his defense. “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, that I am to make my defense before you today concerning all the things that I am accused by the Jews, especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews. Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently. “Indeed, all the Jews know my way of life from my youth up, which was from the beginning among my own nation and at Jerusalem; having known me from the first, if they are willing to testify, that after the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee. Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers, which our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hope to attain. Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa! Why is it judged incredible with you, if God does raise the dead? “I myself most certainly thought that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth. This I also did in Jerusalem. I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests, and when they were put to death I gave my vote against them. Punishing them often in all the synagogues, I tried to make them blaspheme. Being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities. “Whereupon as I traveled to Damascus with the authority and commission from the chief priests, at noon, O king, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me. When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’ “I said, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ “He said, ‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.   But arise, and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this purpose: to appoint you a servant and a witness both of the things which you have seen, and of the things which I will reveal to you;   delivering you from the people, and from the Gentiles, to whom I send you,   to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’ “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision, but declared first to them of Damascus, at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance. For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple, and tried to kill me. Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen, how the Christ must suffer, and how, by the resurrection of the dead, he would be first to proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles.” As he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice, “Paul, you are crazy! Your great learning is driving you insane!” But he said, “I am not crazy, most excellent Festus, but boldly declare words of truth and reasonableness. For the king knows of these things, to whom also I speak freely. For I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him, for this has not been done in a corner. King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you believe.” Agrippa said to Paul, “With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian?” Paul said, “I pray to God, that whether with little or with much, not only you, but also all that hear me today, might become such as I am, except for these bonds.” The king rose up with the governor, and Bernice, and those who sat with them. When they had withdrawn, they spoke to one another, saying, “This man does nothing worthy of death or of bonds.” Agrippa said to Festus, “This man might have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.”

verses.text: When it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ nog onu deꞌ notap-e, koꞌih yaꞌ bilayal keꞌ kota Romadeꞌ negeli Italia, Paulus duoh kudu-kudu naꞌan ulang deꞌ obuahnaan, yohmoꞌ nyelah tuduꞌ piayuh pasukan sidadu Roma deꞌ adon Yulius.Pasukan inoh deꞌ kakuꞌ odop Laja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh

verses.text: Embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail to places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea; Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih muat deꞌkapal deꞌ nog soꞌ kota Adramitium, deꞌ yaꞌ bilakat keꞌ pelabuhan-pelabuhandeꞌ propinsi Asia  Aristarkhus, ulang Makedonia deꞌ nog soꞌ Tesalonika,samah-samah suwaꞌ bilayal duoh koꞌih

verses.text: The next day, we touched at Sidon. Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him permission to go to his friends and refresh himself.
verses.source_translation: Onu tiaꞌ pagi-e koꞌih moꞌ nogkeꞌ Sidon  Yulius sukup paguh duoh Paulus, iyoh diꞌ-e jaman Paulus odibitapod duoh dingan-dingan-e, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngin oniꞌ deꞌ pileluPaulus

verses.text: Putting to sea from there, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih moꞌ bilayal soꞌ Sidon, sobak dolas moꞌ nog soꞌ jowinkapal, koꞌih moꞌ bilayal nunaꞌ bingon laut pulou Siprus ngan koꞌih nonansobak inoh

verses.text: When we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh kapal koꞌih moꞌ motas laut deꞌ biladuap duohKilikia duoh Pamfilia, koꞌih moꞌ nog keꞌ kota Mira deꞌ propinsi Likia.

verses.text: There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ piayuh pasukan sidadu inoh moꞌ tapod niꞌ kapal deꞌ nog soꞌ kotaAleksandria deꞌ yaꞌ bilayal keꞌ Italia  Yoh moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih pinah deꞌ kapalinoh.

verses.text: When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.
verses.source_translation: Kapal koꞌih bilayal lamat posah, kudu-kudu onu-e ke koꞌih nog kotaKnidus  Dop-e sobak dolas aluaꞌ nog soꞌ jowin kapal, koꞌih moꞌ diꞌ tapodlanyut bilayal  Saꞌ diꞌ koꞌih obuah sobak deꞌ dolas, koꞌih moꞌ ponu nuaꞌtoꞌuh boton onu tumuꞌ, ngilusuꞌ nyuang pulou Kreta, deꞌ adon tonyungSalmone

verses.text: With difficulty sailing along it we came to a certain place called Fair Havens, near the city of Lasea.
verses.source_translation: Daang susah payah koꞌih motas tonyung inoh, koꞌih moꞌ nogtopat deꞌ adon Pelabuhan Sangon, sinok kota Lasea.

verses.text: When much time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast had now already gone by, Paul admonished them,
verses.source_translation: Bogoꞌ onu deꞌ moꞌ tibuang, onu ayuh puasa ulang Yahudi moꞌ mokuaꞌ,moꞌ diꞌ-e aman otoꞌ yaꞌ lanyut bilayal dop-e moꞌ musim ijan  Noh leh nganPaulus in-e,

verses.text: and said to them, “Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.”
verses.source_translation: “Madih ayua, moꞌ-e nunaꞌ kila okuꞌ, sikiya bahaya simoꞌotoꞌ totap bilayal  Doh diꞌ-e jok-e kapal duoh balang-balang deꞌ tobantoꞌ, pak-e asong otoꞌ tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e yaꞌ silamat.”

verses.text: But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul.
verses.source_translation: Piayuh pasukansidadu diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ deꞌ pingunang Paulus, pak-e yoh lobih bisayaꞌ tuduꞌdileba kapal, duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ mipin kapal

verses.text: Because the haven was not suitable to winter in, the majority advised going to sea from there, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there, which is a port of Crete, looking northeast and southeast.
verses.source_translation: Pelabuhan inoh diꞌ-e paguhtopat kapal-kapal loꞌo daang musim modud, yoh ngan-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kilojadeꞌ kapal bogoꞌ deꞌ situju lasuꞌ bilayal nog kota Feniks duoh loꞌo danoꞌsilamaꞌ musim modud  Feniks iyoh leh kota pelabuhan deꞌ pulou Kreta deꞌngaduap nuaꞌ boit boton onu timutuam.

verses.text: When the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, they weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close to shore.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh sobak goyuang-goyuang-e nog soꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh boton onutumuꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal moꞌ sakaꞌ nang tapod lanyut bilayal  Odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paꞌad ganung kapal yoh moꞌ bilayal nunaꞌ bingon laut pulouKreta

verses.text: But before long, a stormy wind beat down from shore, which is called Euroclydon.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e diꞌ-e tian ki-ki-e, sobak libut deꞌ nang nyaꞌa, ‘Sobak Nuaꞌ BoitJowin Boton Onu Tumuꞌ,’ moꞌ nog

verses.text: When the ship was caught, and couldn’t face the wind, we gave way to it, and were driven along.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ guyang-gusuak kapal koꞌih.Kapal moꞌ diꞌ-e taan yaꞌ lawan sobak, koꞌih moꞌ tanah odaꞌ kapal koꞌihpaman nunaꞌ sobak

verses.text: Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat.
verses.source_translation: Kapal koꞌih paman nog pulou isit deꞌ adon Kauda,danoꞌ daang lolah posah koꞌih moꞌ tapod paꞌad onak olud keꞌ tun kapal.

verses.text: After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship. Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along.
verses.source_translation: Takal onak olud moꞌ maꞌad tun kapal, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal moꞌngilaling kapal pakai tolin  Dop-e yoh tolu jak kapal nyangag deꞌ pasil deꞌogiꞌ deꞌ lasan laut, deꞌ adon beting Sirtis  Yohmoꞌ pimuun layal kapal, yohmoꞌ tanah odaꞌ kapal paman nunaꞌ kaki sobak toban-e

verses.text: As we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw things overboard.
verses.source_translation: Sobak libut sukupdolas-e guyang-gusuak kapal, yohmoꞌ onu tiaꞌ pagi-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌmoꞌ mulai tolan balang-balang daang kapal keꞌ laut

verses.text: On the third day, they threw out the ship’s tackle with their own hands.
verses.source_translation: Onu deꞌ nikan-e,nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal mulai bitolan duoh alat-alat kapal pakai tonganodop-e sadiꞌ-e

verses.text: When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days, and no small storm pressed on us, all hope that we would be saved was now taken away.
verses.source_translation: Silamaꞌ kudu-kudu onu-e, boton onu duoh bitang-bitangdiꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tonga, sobak libut tuang diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ  Koꞌih moꞌ diꞌ koꞌihalap nang odop koꞌih tapod yaꞌ silamat.

verses.text: When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said, “Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ kudu-kudu onu odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e man  Paulus moꞌ mokatmujuag deꞌ uun odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ sina, “Madih ayua, simoꞌ inganngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang okuꞌ, saꞌ diꞌ otoꞌ bilayal soꞌ Kreta, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ lusakduoh diꞌ otoꞌ lugi kodaꞌ itih

verses.text: Now I exhort you to cheer up, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ suaꞌ ingan, bialotoꞌ susah pak-e notod negeh kila ingan, dop-e niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh deꞌ soꞌotoꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ kobos, jok-e kapal itih yaꞌ asul

verses.text: For there stood by me this night an angel, belonging to the God whose I am and whom I serve,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e singalom-e ogiꞌ niꞌnaꞌan malaikat soꞌ Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ deꞌ nyomah kuꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ idip kuꞌ, nogtuduꞌ okuꞌ

verses.text: saying, ‘Don’t be afraid, Paul. You must stand before Caesar. Behold, God has granted you all those who sail with you.’
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌ sina in-E, ‘Maꞌ tolu Paulus! Muꞌu halus odi ngaduapLaja Roma deꞌ paling ayuh  Dop-e Topaꞌ paguh tuduꞌ muꞌu, yoh ngan-eyaꞌ nyilamat suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bilayal pakai kapal itih deꞌ samah-samah duohmuꞌu.’

verses.text: Therefore, sirs, cheer up! For I believe God, that it will be just as it has been spoken to me.
verses.source_translation: Yohleh ngan otoꞌ totap notod kila toꞌ, dop-e okuꞌ bisayaꞌ Topaꞌpasti yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-E tuduꞌ okuꞌ

verses.text: But we must run aground on a certain island.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e sobak yaꞌ toban kapalotoꞌ itih, ogiꞌ pulou soꞌ-o yaꞌ supiah.”

verses.text: But when the fourteenth night had come, as we were driven back and forth in the Adriatic Sea, about midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some land.
verses.source_translation: Nog ngalom keꞌ simoong pat-e, koꞌih aluaꞌ tiguyang-tigusuak odaꞌgilumang deꞌ laut Adria, pak-e takal tuluap ngalom nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌkapal moꞌ sakaꞌ nang odop-e moꞌ sinok doyoh

verses.text: They took soundings, and found twenty fathoms. After a little while, they took soundings again, and found fifteen fathoms.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapalmoꞌ pimuun tolin ngan-e nojok lasan laut, kila-kila tuluap-e duwoh puluꞌdopoh  Mokuaꞌ inoh yoh nojok lagiꞌ, kila-kila tuluap-e simoong limohdopoh

verses.text: Fearing that we would run aground on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for daylight.
verses.source_translation: Tolu jak kapal nyangag tun batuh kalang, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌkapal moꞌ pimuun ganung kapal nuaꞌ lubat kapal saꞌ kapal diꞌ-e tiligian,koꞌih moꞌ ngatiꞌ-ngatiꞌ onu jawaꞌ

verses.text: As the sailors were trying to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, pretending that they would lay out anchors from the bow,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal yaꞌ subabuu soꞌ kapal inoh  Yoh moꞌ pimuun onak olud, pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ yaꞌ pimuunganung kapal nuaꞌ jowin kapal

verses.text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, “Unless these stay in the ship, you can’t be saved.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Paulus moꞌ sina tuduꞌ piayuhpasukan sidadu duoh onak buah-e, “Simoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e loꞌodaang kapal, ingan diꞌ dapod silamat.”

verses.text: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let it fall off.
verses.source_translation: Sidadu deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kopog tolinonak olud deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌ tanah odaꞌ paman.

verses.text: While the day was coming on, Paul begged them all to take some food, saying, “Today is the fourteenth day that you wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ yaꞌ jawaꞌ, Paulus moꞌ ngijaꞌ suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daangkapal odaꞌ man, Paulus moꞌ sina, “Moꞌ simoong pat onu jok ingan loꞌosijaꞌ-a, naan pilai duoh diꞌ ingan man

verses.text: Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety; for not a hair will perish from any of your heads.”
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, man lehkadu-e soꞌ, saꞌ toꞌ bitaan idip, dop-e suaꞌ ingan pasti yaꞌ silamat.”

verses.text: When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e mokuaꞌ sina, Paulus moꞌ mit kuweh, yohmoꞌ bisukul tuduꞌTopaꞌ deꞌ jowin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ piliaꞌ-piliaꞌ-a bikutung odaꞌodop-e deꞌ munoꞌ man-e

verses.text: Then they all cheered up, and they also took food.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ simangat, yoh moꞌsuwaꞌ man

verses.text: In all, we were two hundred seventy-six souls on the ship.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ odop-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daang kapal inoh ogiꞌ duwoh latus juꞌpuluꞌ nuam naꞌan

verses.text: When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e mokuaꞌ man nog busuah-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ kilojadeꞌ kapal moꞌ tolan ganum kaang laut saꞌ kapal-e jangan.

verses.text: When it was day, they didn’t recognize the land, but they noticed a certain bay with a beach, and they decided to try to drive the ship onto it.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu moꞌ jawaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja deꞌ kapal moꞌ ningaꞌ ogiꞌ doyoh,pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan pulou oni inoh  Pak-e takal-e ningaꞌbonal-bonal, danoꞌ ogiꞌ laut deꞌ ngasuak keꞌ doyoh deꞌ lata tobing-e  Odop-edeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mutus sijaꞌ-a, suba bikayuh kapal keꞌ bingon laut saꞌ kapal-enyatuak tun pasil deꞌ bingon laut inoh

verses.text: Casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time untying the rudder ropes. Hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kopogtolin-tolin ganung kapal yoh moꞌ supiah-e deꞌ lasan laut  Yoh moꞌ bukaꞌtolin-tolin bokos kimudi-e duoh paꞌad layal-e odaꞌ nutuan jowin kapal inohnuju keꞌ bingon laut

verses.text: But coming to a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground. The bow struck and remained immovable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e kapal koꞌih moꞌ ngilangal pasil deꞌ lasanlaut, yoh supiah diꞌ-e ponai bigolak, lubat-e obuaꞌ asul obuah ngilangalgilumang deꞌ dolas.

verses.text: The soldiers’ counsel was to kill the prisoners, so that none of them would swim out and escape.
verses.source_translation: Sidadu-sidadu daang kapal inoh moꞌ yaꞌ ngabos suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuahnaan deꞌ ogiꞌ daang kapal inoh, tolu jak odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bilonang bikoduhbuu

verses.text: But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stopped them from their purpose, and commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go toward the land;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e piayuh pasukan sidadu inoh yaꞌ nyilamat Paulus  Yoh ngan-ejaman onak buah-e ngabos ayua deꞌ obuah naan, yoh moꞌ pilitah, saꞌ nyaꞌadeꞌ ponai bilonang dioꞌ bitabum keꞌ laut bilonang nuju doyoh

verses.text: and the rest should follow, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship. So they all escaped safely to the land.
verses.source_translation: Yoh moꞌodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nunaꞌ-e muat tun opog papan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ tunkapal.Wat inoh leh ngan-e suaꞌ koꞌih silamat.

chapters.text: When it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band. Embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail to places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea; Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us. The next day, we touched at Sidon. Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him permission to go to his friends and refresh himself. Putting to sea from there, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary. When we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia. There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board. When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone. With difficulty sailing along it we came to a certain place called Fair Havens, near the city of Lasea. When much time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast had now already gone by, Paul admonished them, and said to them, “Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.” But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul. Because the haven was not suitable to winter in, the majority advised going to sea from there, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there, which is a port of Crete, looking northeast and southeast. When the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, they weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close to shore. But before long, a stormy wind beat down from shore, which is called Euroclydon.  When the ship was caught, and couldn’t face the wind, we gave way to it, and were driven along. Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat. After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship. Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along. As we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw things overboard. On the third day, they threw out the ship’s tackle with their own hands. When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days, and no small storm pressed on us, all hope that we would be saved was now taken away. When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said, “Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss. Now I exhort you to cheer up, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship. For there stood by me this night an angel, belonging to the God whose I am and whom I serve, saying, ‘Don’t be afraid, Paul. You must stand before Caesar. Behold, God has granted you all those who sail with you.’ Therefore, sirs, cheer up! For I believe God, that it will be just as it has been spoken to me. But we must run aground on a certain island.” But when the fourteenth night had come, as we were driven back and forth in the Adriatic Sea, about midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some land. They took soundings, and found twenty fathoms. After a little while, they took soundings again, and found fifteen fathoms. Fearing that we would run aground on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for daylight. As the sailors were trying to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, pretending that they would lay out anchors from the bow, Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers, “Unless these stay in the ship, you can’t be saved.” Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let it fall off. While the day was coming on, Paul begged them all to take some food, saying, “Today is the fourteenth day that you wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing. Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety; for not a hair will perish from any of your heads.” When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat. Then they all cheered up, and they also took food. In all, we were two hundred seventy-six souls on the ship. When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea. When it was day, they didn’t recognize the land, but they noticed a certain bay with a beach, and they decided to try to drive the ship onto it. Casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time untying the rudder ropes. Hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach. But coming to a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground. The bow struck and remained immovable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves. The soldiers’ counsel was to kill the prisoners, so that none of them would swim out and escape. But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stopped them from their purpose, and commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go toward the land; and the rest should follow, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship. So they all escaped safely to the land.

verses.text: When we had escaped, then they learned that the island was called Malta.
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih silamat nog doyoh ke koꞌih puꞌan inoh pulou Malta.

verses.text: The natives showed us uncommon kindness; for they kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ pulou inoh sukup paguh duoh koꞌih, yoh naiopui tabun saꞌan koꞌih soꞌ koꞌih ngunuh, dop-e onu ijan daang-e modudputuah.

verses.text: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat, and fastened on his hand.
verses.source_translation: Takal Paulus nguluk langas koyuh naꞌ daang opui, tang-tang dipohdeꞌ bisa luah noman bongoh opui yoh moꞌ nukuk tongan Paulus

verses.text: When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said to one another, “No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped from the sea, yet Justice has not allowed to live.”
verses.source_translation: Takalnyaꞌa deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ pulou inoh ningaꞌ dipoh bitaliang deꞌ tongan-e yoh moꞌin-e tipan odop-e, “Nyaꞌa itih pasti ogiꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa dop-e takal-e yohdiꞌ-e longod deꞌ laut, pak-e dewi deꞌ adon-e Tukang Ngadel diꞌ-e tanahodaꞌ idip.”

verses.text: However he shook off the creature into the fire, and wasn’t harmed.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Paulus tapi dipoh inoh daang opui, doiꞌ-e nak nomanoni-oni-e

verses.text: But they expected that he would have swollen or fallen down dead suddenly, but when they watched for a long time and saw nothing bad happen to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.
verses.source_translation: Daang pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duam niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ tongan-ebokak yoh moꞌ polong wat-e kobos  Pak-e tuui-tuui doiꞌ geh wat-e, nyaꞌadeꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ bilubah pikil-e yoh moꞌ nang Paulus itih pasti dewa.

verses.text: Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius, who received us, and courteously entertained us for three days.
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ-e juuaꞌ soꞌ topat koꞌih maꞌad, ogiꞌ tanaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ Publius deꞌ jadingubelnul deꞌ pulou inoh  Yoh sukup paguh, yoh nyamut, maꞌan koꞌihodaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ boli-e taluh onu

verses.text: The father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery. Paul entered in to him, prayed, and laying his hands on him, healed him.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh samaꞌ Publius polong-polongmonam modud duoh mokiꞌ ngibawos, Paulus molot keꞌ bilit-e yoh moꞌbidoa daang-e posan tongan-e tun bak-e, yoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ

verses.text: Then when this was done, the rest also who had diseases in the island came, and were cured.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inohsuaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ monam deꞌ pulou inoh moꞌ odi tuduꞌ Paulus, suaꞌ odop-e deꞌmunoꞌ tuang mokuaꞌ geh

verses.text: They also honored us with many honors, and when we sailed, they put on board the things that we needed.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ngin buaꞌ tongan tuduꞌkoꞌih, takal-e moꞌ nog onu koꞌih yaꞌ bilayal, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nginonyad saꞌan pimonu koꞌih.

verses.text: After three months, we set sail in a ship of Alexandria which had wintered in the island, whose sign was “The Twin Brothers.”
verses.source_translation: Taluh bulan koꞌih tigalon deꞌ pulou Malta, mokuaꞌ inoh koꞌih bilayalpakai kapal deꞌ soꞌ Aleksandria, kapal inoh bilabuh kajon musim modudmokuaꞌ  Kapal itih ogiꞌ tipaduaꞌ Dewa deꞌ Bilopid daꞌ-a, deꞌ adon Kastorduoh Poluks

verses.text: Touching at Syracuse, we stayed there three days.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih moꞌ nog deꞌ Sirakusa, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ taluh onu.

verses.text: From there we circled around and arrived at Rhegium. After one day, a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli,
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ Sirakusa koꞌih bilayal lagiꞌ nunaꞌ bingon laut, koꞌih moꞌ nog kotaRegium  Tiaꞌ pagi-e sobak moꞌ mulai goyuang-goyuang soꞌ nuaꞌ boit botononu nusak yup kapal koꞌih  Yoh ngan-e onu deꞌ nikan-e koꞌih moꞌ nog deꞌkota Putioli

verses.text: where we found brothers, and were entreated to stay with them for seven days. So we came to Rome.
verses.source_translation: Danoꞌ koꞌih bitapod duoh ulang Kristen  Yoh moꞌ ngunangkoꞌih, koꞌih moꞌ loꞌo juꞌ onu duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, mokuaꞌ inoh koꞌihmoꞌ odi keꞌ Roma

verses.text: From there the brothers, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns. When Paul saw them, he thanked God, and took courage.
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ kota Roma moꞌngojit gah tentang koꞌih, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nog bitapod duoh koꞌih keꞌPasal Apius  Ogiꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kajon deꞌ topat deꞌ adon-e TaluhBoli Topat Nosaꞌ  Takal Paulus bitapod duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yoh moꞌbisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ otin-e moꞌ paliꞌ doon.

verses.text: When we entered into Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard, but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who guarded him.
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih nog deꞌ Roma, pilitah Roma ngibonal Paulus odaꞌ loꞌosadiꞌ-e, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ niꞌ naꞌan sidadu deꞌ jaga.

verses.text: After three days Paul called together those who were the leaders of the Jews. When they had come together, he said to them, “I, brothers, though I had done nothing against the people, or the customs of our fathers, still was delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans,
verses.source_translation: Takal-e moꞌ taluh onu daang Roma, Paulus moꞌ mogan piayuh-piayuhulang Yahudi deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Roma odaꞌ tikuluk, Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Madihayua, doiꞌ kuꞌ nai salah oni-oni-e tuduꞌ bangsa otoꞌ  Doiꞌ kuꞌ nak lawanadat sumuk babai otoꞌ, pak-e ulang Yahudi takap okuꞌ deꞌ Yerusalem yohmoꞌ nyelah okuꞌ tuduꞌ pilitah Roma

verses.text: who, when they had examined me, desired to set me free, because there was no cause of death in me.
verses.source_translation: Takal pilitah Roma moꞌ pilisa salahkuꞌ, yoh moꞌ yaꞌ pilopas okuꞌ dop-e doiꞌ-e nak ogiꞌ salah kuꞌ deꞌ bitotokduoh ukum ngabos

verses.text: But when the Jews spoke against it, I was constrained to appeal to Caesar, not that I had anything about which to accuse my nation.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ Yerusalem diꞌ-e situju,yoh ngan okuꞌ tipaksa mitiaꞌ bilituang baꞌuh tuduꞌ Laja Roma deꞌ palingayuh, okuꞌ nai deꞌ wat noh idoh diꞌ ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ ngadu basa odop toꞌ.

verses.text: For this cause therefore I asked to see you and to speak with you. For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.”
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan kuꞌ mogan ingan katiꞌ neh, ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ sina duoh ingan nangodop kuꞌ obuah pasung deꞌ watih, luban kuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Pinyilamat deꞌkajon-kajon basa Yahudi.”

verses.text: They said to him, “We neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor did any of the brothers come here and report or speak any evil of you.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nyawot-e, “Aluaꞌ doiꞌ koꞌih tilimaꞌ sulat soꞌYudea tentang ingan, niꞌ naꞌan aluaꞌ doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ nog tanon oniꞌ deꞌjaꞌat deꞌ moꞌ nai ingan

verses.text: But we desire to hear from you what you think. For, as concerning this sect, it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e koꞌih laꞌan yaꞌ ngojit soꞌ odop muꞌ, onideꞌ bisayaꞌ muꞌ daꞌ-a, dop-e koꞌih ngojit katiꞌ kanih nyaꞌa netang oniꞌ deꞌbisayaꞌ muꞌu daꞌ-e.”

verses.text: When they had appointed him a day, many people came to him at his lodging. He explained to them, testifying about God’s Kingdom, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning until evening.
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ duoh Paulus moꞌ notap onu-e yaꞌ bitapod baꞌuh.Yohmoꞌ daang onu deꞌ notap-e, bogoꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ nog keꞌ boli soꞌPaulus loꞌo  Soꞌ sipagi sape nog onu ngumi, Paulus tanon gah Topaꞌ deꞌnog militah jadin Laja  Pakai sina deꞌ moꞌ nulis Musa duoh nabi-nabi deꞌbokon daang buk, yoh tanon loti-e ngan-e suba nolik otin ayua deꞌ munoꞌodaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus

verses.text: Some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ odop-e deꞌ bisayaꞌ, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ idoh tuduꞌoniꞌ deꞌ nang Paulus

verses.text: When they didn’t agree among themselves, they departed after Paul had spoken one word, “The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah, the prophet, to our fathers,
verses.source_translation: Ayua deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ buu masim-masim nunaꞌ pikilodop-e sadiꞌ-e, pak-e Paulus in-e tuduꞌ ayua deꞌ munoꞌ, “Bonal oniꞌ deꞌnang Iyang Topaꞌ pakai bobaꞌ nabi Yesaya tuduꞌ sumuk-babai otoꞌ deꞌ in-e,

verses.text: saying, ‘Go to this people, and say, in hearing, you will hear, but will in no way understand. In seeing, you will see, but will in no way perceive.
verses.source_translation: ‘Odileh tuduꞌ bangsa itih, in nyeꞌ tuduꞌ-e:Ingan yaꞌ ngojit paliꞌ-paliꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e;Ingan yaꞌ ningaꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan puꞌan-e.

verses.text: For this people’s heart has grown callous. Their ears are dull of hearing. Their eyes they have closed. Lest they should see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and would turn again, and I would heal them.’
verses.source_translation: Dop-e bangsa itih otin-e madod.Kojit-e yoh maput-e,duoh boton-e moꞌ kuab-eYoh ngan-e diꞌ-e ponai kilin,kojit-e diꞌ-e ponai ngojit,otin-e diꞌ-e ponai ngiloti,simoꞌ yoh ponai ngiloti, totu diꞌ yoh paliꞌ tuduꞌ Okuꞌ.Wat noh leh Okuꞌ paliꞌ odaꞌ yoh paguh.’ ”

verses.text: “Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations, and they will listen.”
verses.source_translation: Nyuang sina-e, Paulus moꞌ in-e, “Noh leh ngan kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan saꞌingan puꞌan nang gah deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa silamat nog soꞌ Topaꞌ, adin moꞌ obuahmagah tuduꞌ basa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ-e.”

verses.text: When he had said these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves.
verses.source_translation: TakalPaulus mokuaꞌ sina deꞌ in inoh ulang-ulang Yahudi moꞌ buꞌu daang-ebikalah si odop-e.

verses.text: Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who were coming to him,
verses.source_translation: Paulus moꞌ loꞌo duwoh sowaꞌ deꞌ boli deꞌ nyewa-e, yoh tilimaꞌ suaꞌnyaꞌa deꞌ nog tuduꞌ-e

verses.text: preaching God’s Kingdom, and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness, without hindrance.

chapters.text: When we had escaped, then they learned that the island was called Malta. The natives showed us uncommon kindness; for they kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold. But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat, and fastened on his hand. When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said to one another, “No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped from the sea, yet Justice has not allowed to live.” However he shook off the creature into the fire, and wasn’t harmed. But they expected that he would have swollen or fallen down dead suddenly, but when they watched for a long time and saw nothing bad happen to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god. Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius, who received us, and courteously entertained us for three days. The father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery. Paul entered in to him, prayed, and laying his hands on him, healed him. Then when this was done, the rest also who had diseases in the island came, and were cured. They also honored us with many honors, and when we sailed, they put on board the things that we needed. After three months, we set sail in a ship of Alexandria which had wintered in the island, whose sign was “The Twin Brothers.” Touching at Syracuse, we stayed there three days. From there we circled around and arrived at Rhegium. After one day, a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli, where we found brothers, and were entreated to stay with them for seven days. So we came to Rome. From there the brothers, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns. When Paul saw them, he thanked God, and took courage. When we entered into Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard, but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who guarded him. After three days Paul called together those who were the leaders of the Jews. When they had come together, he said to them, “I, brothers, though I had done nothing against the people, or the customs of our fathers, still was delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans, who, when they had examined me, desired to set me free, because there was no cause of death in me. But when the Jews spoke against it, I was constrained to appeal to Caesar, not that I had anything about which to accuse my nation. For this cause therefore I asked to see you and to speak with you. For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.” They said to him, “We neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor did any of the brothers come here and report or speak any evil of you. But we desire to hear from you what you think. For, as concerning this sect, it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against.” When they had appointed him a day, many people came to him at his lodging. He explained to them, testifying about God’s Kingdom, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning until evening. Some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved. When they didn’t agree among themselves, they departed after Paul had spoken one word, “The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah, the prophet, to our fathers, saying, ‘Go to this people, and say, in hearing, you will hear, but will in no way understand. In seeing, you will see, but will in no way perceive. For this people’s heart has grown callous. Their ears are dull of hearing. Their eyes they have closed. Lest they should see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and would turn again, and I would heal them.’ “Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations, and they will listen.” When he had said these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves. Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who were coming to him, preaching God’s Kingdom, and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness, without hindrance.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, to the saints who are at Ephesus, and the faithful in Christ Jesus:
verses.source_translation: Sulat soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus, deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ jadin rasul Kristus Yesus kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.   Okuꞌ pait sulat itih tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ deꞌ Efesus, nyaꞌa deꞌ totap bisayaꞌ daang Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ duoh Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ ingan

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ;
verses.source_translation: Obuah mudileh Topaꞌ! Samaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus! Iyoh moꞌ ngin suaꞌ bilokat soꞌ siluga tuduꞌ otoꞌ, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.

verses.text: even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we would be holy and without defect before him in love;
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih otoꞌ takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ nai-e, saꞌ otoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ duoh diꞌ-e salah deꞌ sulung jowin-E, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.

verses.text: having predestined us for adoption as children through Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his desire,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ ngibalaꞌ otoꞌ, noh leh ngan Iyoh moꞌ dioꞌ notap otoꞌ ngan-e pakat otoꞌ odaꞌ jadin onak-onak-E, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi odaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus Kristus.   Inoh leh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, deꞌ munuas-E daꞌ-a.

verses.text: to the praise of the glory of his grace, by which he freely gave us favor in the Beloved,
verses.source_translation: Obuah mudileh Topaꞌ dop-e Iyoh moꞌ bitanga otin-E deꞌ sukup-sukup paguh-e tuduꞌ otoꞌ pakai Onak-E deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E.

verses.text: in whom we have our redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ nubuas otoꞌ soꞌ dosa pakai doyaꞌ Kristus deꞌ moꞌ kobos saꞌan otoꞌ.   Loti-e, Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun dosa-dosa otoꞌ nunaꞌ otin-E deꞌ paguh deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ.

verses.text: which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ deꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ inoh geh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ ponai bijak duoh ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ.

verses.text: making known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he purposed in him
verses.source_translation: Nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop-E, Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ otoꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ otoꞌ puꞌan-e.   Iyoh moꞌ notap Kristus Yesus ngan-e pijadi oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E inoh.

verses.text: to an administration of the fullness of the times, to sum up all things in Christ, the things in the heavens, and the things on the earth, in him;
verses.source_translation: Itih leh oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E moꞌ-e moꞌ nog onu-e: Yesus yaꞌ jadin pimipin duoh odaꞌ jadin niꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ siluga duoh deꞌ dunia.

verses.text: in whom also we were assigned an inheritance, having been foreordained according to the purpose of him who does all things after the counsel of his will;
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan-E duoh deꞌ moꞌ notap-E sadiꞌ-E.   Soꞌ sibungas-e Iyoh moꞌ pilih otoꞌ ngan-e odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin umat-E, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.

verses.text: to the end that we should be to the praise of his glory, we who had before hoped in Christ.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh koꞌih deꞌ dioꞌ bialap tuduꞌ Kristus, koꞌih dapod mudi Topaꞌ deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E.

verses.text: In him you also, having heard the word of the truth, the Good News of your salvation—in whom, having also believed, you were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit,
verses.source_translation: Ingan tuang moꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ takal ingan moꞌ ngojit sibaya Topaꞌ.   Sibaya inoh Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan silamat.   Ingan moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus, noh leh ngan Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin tanda tuduꞌ ingan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kakuꞌ-E.   Tanda inoh yohleh Iyang-E deꞌ tanon-E daang janyi-E.

verses.text: who is a pledge of our inheritance, to the redemption of God’s own possession, to the praise of his glory.
verses.source_translation: Iyang Topaꞌ inoh leh deꞌ jamen nang otoꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ janyi Topaꞌ tuduꞌ umat-E.   Itih leh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ puꞌan nang Iyoh moꞌ nubuas otoꞌ duoh odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin umat-E.   Obuah mudileh Topaꞌ dop-e ayuh kuasa-E.

verses.text: For this cause I also, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you, and the love which you have toward all the saints,
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan takal okuꞌ ngojit nang ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus duoh ingan ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ umat Topaꞌ,

verses.text: don’t cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers,
verses.source_translation: okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ tentang ingan.   Okuꞌ silalu sobot adon ingan takal kuꞌ bidoa.

verses.text: that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Topaꞌ-E Yesus Kristus, Samaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E, saꞌ Iyoh ngin Iyang-E tuduꞌ ingan.   Iyang inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan bijak ponai duoh bitanga Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan piluh Iyoh.

verses.text: having the eyes of your hearts enlightened, that you may know what is the hope of his calling, and what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ saꞌ Topaꞌ bukaꞌ pikil ingan odaꞌ telang saꞌ-e ngiloti oni deꞌ dapod ingan alap soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ mogan ingan.   Watnoh geh saꞌ ingan puꞌan nang sukup-sukup bogoꞌ bilokat deꞌ konaꞌ deꞌ sidia Topaꞌ saꞌan umat-E,

verses.text: and what is the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe, according to that working of the strength of his might
verses.source_translation: duoh puꞌan nang doiꞌ tiyaꞌ kuasa deꞌ lobih ayuh soꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ kiloja daang otoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ, kuasa inoh sukup-sukup ayuh-e.

verses.text: which he worked in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places,
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh kuasa deꞌ pakai Topaꞌ takal-E paliꞌ kidip Kristus soꞌ kobos-E duoh odaꞌ guluꞌ nuaꞌ toꞌuh-E deꞌ topat deꞌ punuaꞌ kuasa deꞌ siluga.

verses.text: far above all rule, and authority, and power, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age, but also in that which is to come.
verses.source_translation: Kristus juuaꞌ lobih ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ suaꞌ iyang deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e, soꞌ suaꞌ iyang deꞌ militah duoh mipin dunia, duoh soꞌ suaꞌ adon oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e, bait deꞌ joman deꞌ adin, bait deꞌ joman deꞌ yaꞌ nog.

verses.text: He put all things in subjection under his feet, and gave him to be head over all things for the assembly,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ naꞌ suaꞌ kuasa deꞌ libuaꞌ kuasa Kristus duoh ngin Kristus tuduꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, saꞌ Iyoh jadin bak saꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ.

verses.text: which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.

chapters.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, to the saints who are at Ephesus, and the faithful in Christ Jesus: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ; even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we would be holy and without defect before him in love; having predestined us for adoption as children through Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his desire, to the praise of the glory of his grace, by which he freely gave us favor in the Beloved, in whom we have our redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace, which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence, making known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he purposed in him to an administration of the fullness of the times, to sum up all things in Christ, the things in the heavens, and the things on the earth, in him; in whom also we were assigned an inheritance, having been foreordained according to the purpose of him who does all things after the counsel of his will; to the end that we should be to the praise of his glory, we who had before hoped in Christ. In him you also, having heard the word of the truth, the Good News of your salvation—in whom, having also believed, you were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit, who is a pledge of our inheritance, to the redemption of God’s own possession, to the praise of his glory. For this cause I also, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you, and the love which you have toward all the saints, don’t cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers, that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him; having the eyes of your hearts enlightened, that you may know what is the hope of his calling, and what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints, and what is the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe, according to that working of the strength of his might which he worked in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places, far above all rule, and authority, and power, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age, but also in that which is to come. He put all things in subjection under his feet, and gave him to be head over all things for the assembly, which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.

verses.text: You were made alive when you were dead in transgressions and sins,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ ingan moꞌ kobos luban ingan lawan pilitah-pilitah Topaꞌ duoh nai dosa-dosa.

verses.text: in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit who now works in the children of disobedience;
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ingan idip nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mala nyaꞌa daang dunia nai-e; loti-e ingan tunuak tuduꞌ Laja Muat Munua deꞌ militah deꞌ tun longit, deꞌ adin nguasa otin nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e tunuak tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: among whom we also all once lived in the lusts of our flesh, doing the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, even as the rest.
verses.source_translation: Dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ suaꞌ otoꞌ idip samah kodaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ; otoꞌ idip nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mala manusia nai-e deꞌ nyonang polong baya pikil otoꞌ.   Takal inoh otoꞌ yohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ suwaꞌ obuah ukum Topaꞌ geh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: But God, being rich in mercy, for his great love with which he loved us,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e pilasiꞌ Topaꞌ sukup ayuh-e, yoh ngan-E ngibalaꞌ otoꞌ.

verses.text: even when we were dead through our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved),
verses.source_translation: Bial-e deꞌ dioꞌ otoꞌ moꞌ kobos luban otoꞌ lawan pilitah-E, Topaꞌ moꞌ ngin idip tuduꞌ otoꞌ samah-samah duoh Kristus.   Topaꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ silamat, dop-e Iyoh sukup paguh.

verses.text: and raised us up with him, and made us to sit with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus, Topaꞌ paliꞌ kidip otoꞌ samah-samah duoh Iyoh, saꞌ otoꞌ suwaꞌ militah samah-samah duoh-E daang siluga.

verses.text: that in the ages to come he might show the exceeding riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus;
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ nai deꞌ wat inoh saꞌ takal joman deꞌ yaꞌ nog, manusia ningaꞌ nang Topaꞌ sukup-sukup-e ngibalaꞌ otoꞌ.   Iyoh moꞌ bitanga otin-E deꞌ sukup-sukup paguh-e tuduꞌ otoꞌ pakai Onak-E.

verses.text: for by grace you have been saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ sukup paguh, Iyoh odaꞌ ingan silamat dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus, inoh idoh diꞌ-e asil oniꞌ deꞌ nai odop ingan, pak-e inoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ.

verses.text: not of works, that no one would boast.
verses.source_translation: Inoh idoh diꞌ-e asil kiloja deꞌ nai ingan.   Maꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ bilagah tentang oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared before that we would walk in them.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e otoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ nai.   Iyoh moꞌ nai otoꞌ odaꞌ baꞌuh daang Yesus Kristus saꞌ otoꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ moꞌ nyidia-E saꞌan otoꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore remember that once you, the Gentiles in the flesh, who are called “uncircumcision” by that which is called “circumcision”, (in the flesh, made by hands);
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, madih ayua natong nyeꞌ oni wat odop ingan deꞌ dioꞌ, ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi, ingan deꞌ nang-e “Ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e bisunat” in ulang Yahudi deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e bisunat.   Sunat inoh tanda deꞌ nai manusia deꞌ gonan nyaꞌa.

verses.text: that you were at that time separate from Christ, alienated from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of the promise, having no hope and without God in the world.
verses.source_translation: Takal inoh ingan aluaꞌ diꞌ-e idip niꞌ duoh Kristus, ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Israel, ingan diꞌ-e molot daang janyi deꞌ mokos Topaꞌ duoh umat-E.   Ingan idip daang dunia itih doiꞌ oni-oni deꞌ dapod ingan alap-e duoh diꞌ ingan piluh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off are made near in the blood of Christ.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.   Noꞌuh-e ingan juuaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, pak-e adin ingan moꞌ obuah toban sinok duoh Topaꞌ odaꞌ doyaꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: For he is our peace, who made both one, and broke down the middle wall of partition,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Kristus leh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bidamai, Iyoh moꞌ nguluk otoꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi duoh ulang-ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi jadin niꞌ, yohmoꞌ pilubuh sinung deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bilosah.   Sinung inoh deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bitomi.

verses.text: having abolished in his flesh the hostility, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, that he might create in himself one new man of the two, making peace;
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ukum ulang Yahudi duoh suaꞌ pilitah-pilitah-e baya atulan-atulan-e moꞌ obuah ngisuꞌ odaꞌ Kristus takal Iyoh kobos, saꞌ-e duwoh bangsa jadin niꞌ bangsa manusia baꞌuh, deꞌ idip niꞌ duoh odop-E.   Wat inoh leh wat Kristus odaꞌ ogiꞌ idip bidanah.

verses.text: and might reconcile them both in one body to God through the cross, having killed the hostility thereby.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-E kobos deꞌ salip, Kristus nguluk duwoh bangsa inoh odaꞌ niꞌ, odaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bidamai duoh Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ duwoh bangsa inoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bitomi.

verses.text: He came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan Kristus nog ngan-e magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang damai inoh tuduꞌ ingan, bait ulang deꞌ juuaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, bait ulang Yahudi deꞌ sinok tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For through him we both have our access in one Spirit to the Father.
verses.source_translation: Luban Kristus, suaꞌ otoꞌ, bait ulang Yahudi, bait ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi moꞌ dapod sinok duoh Samaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: So then you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but you are fellow citizens with the saints, and of the household of God,
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan ingan idoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ saluh-saluh duoh ulang nog.   Pak-e adin ingan jadin umat Topaꞌ duoh molot daang lawang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone;
verses.source_translation: Ingan kodaꞌ boli deꞌ kajuag nyaꞌa, ingan mujuag soꞌ oni deꞌ ngajal bala rasul duoh bala nabi, yohmoꞌ Yesus deꞌ jadin batuh pinogap-e.

verses.text: in whom the whole building, fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord;
verses.source_translation: Ngan ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngan nyaꞌa nai boli inoh bisusun bijamit jadin Boli Topaꞌ deꞌ jok-e Iyoh deꞌ kakuꞌ soꞌ-E loꞌo.

verses.text: in whom you also are built together for a habitation of God in the Spirit.

chapters.text: You were made alive when you were dead in transgressions and sins, in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit who now works in the children of disobedience; among whom we also all once lived in the lusts of our flesh, doing the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, even as the rest. But God, being rich in mercy, for his great love with which he loved us, even when we were dead through our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved), and raised us up with him, and made us to sit with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus, that in the ages to come he might show the exceeding riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus; for by grace you have been saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God, not of works, that no one would boast. For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared before that we would walk in them. Therefore remember that once you, the Gentiles in the flesh, who are called “uncircumcision” by that which is called “circumcision”, (in the flesh, made by hands); that you were at that time separate from Christ, alienated from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of the promise, having no hope and without God in the world. But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off are made near in the blood of Christ. For he is our peace, who made both one, and broke down the middle wall of partition, having abolished in his flesh the hostility, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, that he might create in himself one new man of the two, making peace; and might reconcile them both in one body to God through the cross, having killed the hostility thereby. He came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near. For through him we both have our access in one Spirit to the Father. So then you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but you are fellow citizens with the saints, and of the household of God, being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone; in whom the whole building, fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord; in whom you also are built together for a habitation of God in the Spirit.

verses.text: For this cause I, Paul, am the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you Gentiles,
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan okuꞌ, Paulus, obuah jel, luban kuꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Kristus Yesus ngan kuꞌ tulung ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: if it is so that you have heard of the administration of that grace of God which was given me toward you;
verses.source_translation: Totu ingan moꞌ ngojit tentang Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh, Iyoh ngin tuduꞌ okuꞌ kiloja itih ngan kuꞌ tulung ingan.

verses.text: how that by revelation the mystery was made known to me, as I wrote before in few words,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ, oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E, oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e.   (Tentang hal inoh moꞌ ogiꞌ kuꞌ nulis-e kodoꞌ-e geh deꞌ puꞌun sulat itih,

verses.text: by which, when you read, you can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ;
verses.source_translation: moꞌ ingan basa-e, ingan yaꞌ ngiloti samah kodaꞌ okuꞌ tuang ngiloti kuꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e, deꞌ yaꞌ nai Kristus.)

verses.text: which in other generations was not made known to the children of men, as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit;
verses.source_translation: Noꞌuh-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ Topaꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, pak-e adin Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ rasul-rasul duoh nabi-nabi-E.

verses.text: that the Gentiles are fellow heirs, and fellow members of the body, and fellow partakers of his promise in Christ Jesus through the Good News,
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e inoh yohleh takal nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tilimaꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ suwaꞌ kiꞌan bilokat-bilokat Topaꞌ, deꞌ noꞌuh-e jok-e saꞌan ulang Yahudi.   Wat inoh geh ulang-ulang deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi inoh moꞌ suwaꞌ samah-samah duoh ulang Yahudi jadin niꞌ gonan.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah-samah suwaꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ janyi-E daang Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: of which I was made a servant, according to the gift of that grace of God which was given me according to the working of his power.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ jadin kuli Topaꞌ ngan kuꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh, takal Topaꞌ pakai otin-E deꞌ paguh ngan-e ngin kuasa-E tuduꞌ okuꞌ.

verses.text: To me, the very least of all saints, was this grace given, to preach to the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ,
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, okuꞌ deꞌ paling diꞌ-e biguna.   Bial-e wat inoh, Topaꞌ ngin otin-E deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ okuꞌ, odaꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ulang Yahudi tentang bilokat-bilokat deꞌ soꞌ Kristus deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ.

verses.text: and to make all men see what is the administration of the mystery which for ages has been hidden in God, who created all things through Jesus Christ;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ magah geh Gah deꞌ paguh inoh saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan bonal-bonal tentang oniꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e, deꞌ yaꞌ nai Topaꞌ deꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ.   Oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai Topaꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ daang otin-E soꞌ sibungas-e.

verses.text: to the intent that now through the assembly the manifold wisdom of God might be made known to the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places,
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ yohleh saꞌa adin iyang-iyang deꞌ militah duoh deꞌ nguasa deꞌ siluga ningaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, yohmoꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ dapod puꞌan bijak ponai Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh-e.

verses.text: according to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord;
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nai-E deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ-E notap-e soꞌ takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.   Topaꞌ pakai Kristus Yesus ngan-e odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi.

verses.text: in whom we have boldness and access in confidence through our faith in him.
verses.source_translation: Idip niꞌ duoh Kristus odaꞌ otoꞌ bilani duoh ponai nog deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ daang kila deꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tolu dop-e otoꞌ bisayaꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: Therefore I ask that you may not lose heart at my troubles for you, which are your glory.
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan maꞌ yaꞌ bigaduh takal ingan ngojit susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah okuꞌ luban ingan.   Dop-e susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon kuꞌ inoh saꞌ ingan obuah pimodo.

verses.text: For this cause, I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan kuꞌ bikunyug bidoa deꞌ sulung jowin Samaꞌ.

verses.text: from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named,
verses.source_translation: Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ ogiꞌ tibilang lawang deꞌ siluga duoh deꞌ bumi itih.

verses.text: that he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, that you may be strengthened with power through his Spirit in the inward man;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh-e duoh deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ deꞌ ngin-E ngan-E nogap otin ingan, pakai kuasa Iyang-E deꞌ ogiꞌ daang otin ingan.

verses.text: that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; to the end that you, being rooted and grounded in love,
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh ingan deꞌ bisayaꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e tuduꞌ Kristus, Kristus loꞌo daang otin ingan yohmoꞌ ingan biꞌaat duoh ogiꞌ puꞌun-e daang ngibalaꞌ.

verses.text: may be strengthened to comprehend with all the saints what is the width and length and height and depth,
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ-e samah-samah duoh suaꞌ umat Topaꞌ, ingan dapod ngiloti nang sukup-sukup ayuh-E, sukup-sukup omu-E, duoh sukup-sukup bigatung-E, baya sukup-sukup tuluap-E Kristus ngibala ingan,

verses.text: and to know Christ’s love which surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.
verses.source_translation: yohmoꞌ ingan dapod ngoon nang Kristus sukup-sukup ngibalaꞌ ingan bial oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh diꞌ ingan tapod yaꞌ ngiloti pakai pikil ingan, saꞌ idip Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh daang suaꞌ oniꞌ, bonal-bonal ogiꞌ daang idip ingan.

verses.text: Now to him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ dapod nai lobih bogoꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mitiaꞌ toꞌ duoh deꞌ pikil toꞌ, pakai kuasa-E deꞌ silalu kiloja deꞌ daang odop otoꞌ.

verses.text: to him be the glory in the assembly and in Christ Jesus to all generations forever and ever. Amen.

chapters.text: For this cause I, Paul, am the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you Gentiles, if it is so that you have heard of the administration of that grace of God which was given me toward you; how that by revelation the mystery was made known to me, as I wrote before in few words, by which, when you read, you can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ; which in other generations was not made known to the children of men, as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit; that the Gentiles are fellow heirs, and fellow members of the body, and fellow partakers of his promise in Christ Jesus through the Good News, of which I was made a servant, according to the gift of that grace of God which was given me according to the working of his power. To me, the very least of all saints, was this grace given, to preach to the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ, and to make all men see what is the administration of the mystery which for ages has been hidden in God, who created all things through Jesus Christ; to the intent that now through the assembly the manifold wisdom of God might be made known to the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places, according to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord; in whom we have boldness and access in confidence through our faith in him. Therefore I ask that you may not lose heart at my troubles for you, which are your glory. For this cause, I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named, that he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, that you may be strengthened with power through his Spirit in the inward man; that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; to the end that you, being rooted and grounded in love, may be strengthened to comprehend with all the saints what is the width and length and height and depth, and to know Christ’s love which surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled with all the fullness of God. Now to him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us, to him be the glory in the assembly and in Christ Jesus to all generations forever and ever. Amen.

verses.text: I therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beg you to walk worthily of the calling with which you were called,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ mogan ingan odaꞌ jadin umat-E.   Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ, Paulus, deꞌ obuah naan dop-e okuꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ, okuꞌ bonal-bonal mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan idip nunaꞌ bogan-E.

verses.text: with all lowliness and humility, with patience, bearing with one another in love;
verses.source_translation: Daang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan, maꞌ yaꞌ samuh, pak-e ingan halus binulut, duoh sabal.   Bitanga leh nang ingan ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan, ngan ingan tulung siodop ingan.

verses.text: being eager to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
verses.source_translation: Ingan kagaꞌ ulih-ulih-e idip bidamai duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, saꞌ idip niꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngin Iyang Topaꞌ totap obuah jaga.

verses.text: There is one body, and one Spirit, even as you also were called in one hope of your calling;
verses.source_translation: Jok-e ogiꞌ niꞌ gonan, duoh niꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.   Wat inoh geh ingan obuah mogan saꞌ ingan bialap deꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ samah.

verses.text: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
verses.source_translation: Jok-e ogiꞌ niꞌ Topaꞌ, jok-e niꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ, niꞌ baptisan,

verses.text: one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in us all.
verses.source_translation: niꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ jadin Samaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.   Iyoh leh Topaꞌ deꞌ nguasa longit duoh bumi, Iyoh nai kiloja-E pakai suaꞌ otoꞌ duoh daang suaꞌ odop toꞌ.

verses.text: But to each one of us was the grace given according to the measure of the gift of Christ.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e otoꞌ masim-masim tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngin-E nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Kristus.

verses.text: Therefore he says, “When he ascended on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts to men.”
verses.source_translation: Daang buk Kitab ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis in-e, “Takal Iyoh maꞌad keꞌ topat deꞌ bigatung, Iyoh toban bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah naan, Iyoh moꞌ ngin oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ manusia.”

verses.text: Now this, “He ascended”, what is it but that he also first descended into the lower parts of the earth?
verses.source_translation: Asal daang buk Kitab moꞌ obuah nulis nang, “Takal Iyoh maꞌad,” inoh loti-e Iyoh moꞌ mokuaꞌ muun ke topat deꞌ paling douꞌ-e daang bumi itih.

verses.text: He who descended is the one who also ascended far above all the heavens, that he might fill all things.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh deꞌ mokuaꞌ muun inoh, Iyoh geh deꞌ moꞌ maꞌad juuaꞌ lobih bigatung soꞌ suaꞌ longit ngan-e kanuaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ.

verses.text: He gave some to be apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, shepherds and teachers;
verses.source_translation: “Iyoh moꞌ ngin oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ manusia,” kodaꞌ-e ogiꞌ deꞌ kakat-E jadin rasul-rasul, nabi-nabi, ogiꞌ deꞌ jadin tukang magah Gah deꞌ Paguh, ogiꞌ geh deꞌ kakat-E jadin gulu-gulu duoh gembala-gembala uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: for the perfecting of the saints, to the work of serving, to the building up of the body of Christ;
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nai deꞌ wat itih saꞌ umat Topaꞌ taan nai kiloja ngan-e layan Topaꞌ duoh nogap uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadin gonan Kristus.

verses.text: until we all attain to the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to a full grown man, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ;
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadi nah-nah nog otoꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ niꞌ, otoꞌ moꞌ samah-samah ngiloti pikil toꞌ tentang Onak Topaꞌ.   Yohmoꞌ otoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ tuꞌuh daang bisayaꞌ, makin tuui otoꞌ makin punuaꞌ samah kodaꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: that we may no longer be children, tossed back and forth and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, in craftiness, after the wiles of error;
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tiyaꞌ jadin onak opot deꞌ tipuang katiꞌ kanih odaꞌ masam-masam pingajal soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pingunang-e tok in oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa pogo.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mogo nyaꞌa iniꞌ iniꞌ in sina-e ngan-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: but speaking truth in love, we may grow up in all things into him, who is the head, Christ;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e, ngibalik-e otoꞌ halus tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal ngan otin otoꞌ deꞌ sape nyam-e ngibalaꞌ, saꞌ-e makin tuui otoꞌ makin punuaꞌ samah kodaꞌ Kristus deꞌ jadin bak saꞌan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, deꞌ moꞌ jadin gonan-E.

verses.text: from whom all the body, being fitted and knit together through that which every joint supplies, according to the working in measure of each individual part, makes the body increase to the building up of itself in love.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ Iyoh leh suaꞌ bigian gonan-E obuah nyusun bijamit duoh obuah nyamung odaꞌ bukun-bukun tulang-e masim-masim.   Takal suaꞌ bigian gonan inoh kiloja nunaꞌ tugas-e masim-masim, ke suaꞌ gonan inoh yaꞌ ponai jadin polong deꞌ ayuh yohmoꞌ dolas daang ngibalaꞌ tipan si odop-e.

verses.text: This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles also walk, in the futility of their mind,
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan daang adon Topaꞌ, isin-isin okuꞌ sibaya deꞌ ingan: maꞌ tiyaꞌ idip kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e piluh Topaꞌ duoh pikil oniꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e.

verses.text: being darkened in their understanding, alienated from the life of God, because of the ignorance that is in them, because of the hardening of their hearts;
verses.source_translation: Pikil-e tikukuab diꞌ-e ponai ngiloti.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ juuaꞌ soꞌ idip deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan idip deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ pikil-e madod duoh otin-e kolas.

verses.text: who having become callous gave themselves up to lust, to work all uncleanness with greediness.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ doiꞌ dasaꞌ-a, pikil kila-e moꞌ madod, yoh moꞌ idip suka nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e sinunuh ngan-e kanuas kila odop-e.

verses.text: But you did not learn Christ that way;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan idoh diꞌ-e wat inoh! Ingan moꞌ bilajal piluh Kristus.

verses.text: if indeed you heard him, and were taught in him, even as truth is in Jesus:
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ ngojit tentang Iyoh! Duoh ingan moꞌ bilajal oniꞌ deꞌ bonal daang Yesus!

verses.text: that you put away, as concerning your former way of life, the old man, that grows corrupt after the lusts of deceit;
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan nyeꞌ pilopas tiyaꞌ gaya idip ingan deꞌ oma, deꞌ obuah pilusak odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop ingan ngan ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, deꞌ kayap ingan,

verses.text: and that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
verses.source_translation: saꞌ otin duoh pikil ingan suaꞌ-e obuah nai odaꞌ jadin baꞌuh.

verses.text: and put on the new man, who in the likeness of God has been created in righteousness and holiness of truth.
verses.source_translation: Ingan mesti pakai gaya idip deꞌ baꞌuh, jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ baꞌuh deꞌ nai Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ-a niꞌ mun duoh odop-E, daang oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, deꞌ tongon, duoh deꞌ bisig.

verses.text: Therefore putting away falsehood, speak truth each one with his neighbor. For we are members of one another.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e wat inoh, maꞌ tiyaꞌ pibulaꞌ, pak-e samah-samah nyeꞌ sina jujul, dop-e otoꞌ suaꞌ-e bigian gonan Kristus.

verses.text: “Be angry, and don’t sin.” Don’t let the sun go down on your wrath,
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ingan malah, maꞌ ingan yaꞌ tanah malah ingan odaꞌ ingan nai dosa.   Maꞌ yaꞌ malah sape niꞌ onu-onu,

verses.text: and don’t give place to the devil.
verses.source_translation: saꞌ Laja Muat Munua diꞌ-e soꞌon piluang odaꞌ ingan nai dosa.

verses.text: Let him who stole steal no more; but rather let him labor, producing with his hands something that is good, that he may have something to give to him who has need.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ pinoku, maꞌ tiyaꞌ noku.   Pak-e paguh yoh ulih-ulih kiloja nai kiloja deꞌ paguh pakai tongan odop-e, saꞌ iyoh tapod kutung oniꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sotok.

verses.text: Let no corrupt speech proceed out of your mouth, but only what is good for building others up as the need may be, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ ingan sina, maꞌ nang sina deꞌ diꞌ-e paguh.   Pak-e nang negeh sina-sina deꞌ paguh ngan nyeꞌ kakat nyaꞌa deꞌ pilelu, saꞌ-a jadin bilokat saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit.

verses.text: Don’t grieve the Holy Spirit of God, in whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ otin Iyang Topaꞌ ngilobuꞌ, dop-e Iyang inoh leh deꞌ jadin tanda nang ingan moꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, nog onu Topaꞌ nubuas ingan.

verses.text: Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, outcry, and slander, be put away from you, with all malice.
