verses.source_translation: Kadi tiyaꞌ soꞌ kila ingan otin deꞌ monam, deꞌ kilangas, deꞌ tiwas.   Maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ bisingak bikalah, maꞌ tiyaꞌ yaꞌ nang sina deꞌ pijaꞌat nyaꞌa, duoh maꞌ tiyaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: And be kind to one another, tender hearted, forgiving each other, just as God also in Christ forgave you.

chapters.text: I therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beg you to walk worthily of the calling with which you were called, with all lowliness and humility, with patience, bearing with one another in love; being eager to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. There is one body, and one Spirit, even as you also were called in one hope of your calling; one Lord, one faith, one baptism, one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in us all. But to each one of us was the grace given according to the measure of the gift of Christ. Therefore he says, “When he ascended on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts to men.” Now this, “He ascended”, what is it but that he also first descended into the lower parts of the earth? He who descended is the one who also ascended far above all the heavens, that he might fill all things. He gave some to be apostles; and some, prophets; and some, evangelists; and some, shepherds and teachers; for the perfecting of the saints, to the work of serving, to the building up of the body of Christ; until we all attain to the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to a full grown man, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ; that we may no longer be children, tossed back and forth and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, in craftiness, after the wiles of error; but speaking truth in love, we may grow up in all things into him, who is the head, Christ; from whom all the body, being fitted and knit together through that which every joint supplies, according to the working in measure of each individual part, makes the body increase to the building up of itself in love. This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles also walk, in the futility of their mind, being darkened in their understanding, alienated from the life of God, because of the ignorance that is in them, because of the hardening of their hearts; who having become callous gave themselves up to lust, to work all uncleanness with greediness. But you did not learn Christ that way; if indeed you heard him, and were taught in him, even as truth is in Jesus: that you put away, as concerning your former way of life, the old man, that grows corrupt after the lusts of deceit; and that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind, and put on the new man, who in the likeness of God has been created in righteousness and holiness of truth. Therefore putting away falsehood, speak truth each one with his neighbor. For we are members of one another. “Be angry, and don’t sin.” Don’t let the sun go down on your wrath, and don’t give place to the devil. Let him who stole steal no more; but rather let him labor, producing with his hands something that is good, that he may have something to give to him who has need. Let no corrupt speech proceed out of your mouth, but only what is good for building others up as the need may be, that it may give grace to those who hear. Don’t grieve the Holy Spirit of God, in whom you were sealed for the day of redemption. Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, outcry, and slander, be put away from you, with all malice. And be kind to one another, tender hearted, forgiving each other, just as God also in Christ forgave you.

verses.text: Be therefore imitators of God, as beloved children.
verses.source_translation: Ingan inoh onak Topaꞌ deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E, noh leh ngan nyeꞌ kagaꞌ nunaꞌ tilodan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Walk in love, even as Christ also loved you, and gave himself up for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling fragrance.
verses.source_translation: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nai ingan tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, ngibalaꞌ inoh leh deꞌ jadin puꞌun suaꞌ pingunai ingan, samah kodaꞌ Yesus ngibalaꞌ ingan, Iyoh nyelah asong-E kobos saꞌan otoꞌ ngan-e jadin persembahan korban deꞌ paguh puat-e saꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But sexual immorality, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be mentioned among you, as becomes saints;
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ, noh leh ngan nyeꞌ maꞌ ngaso nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop nyeꞌ duoh maꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e sinunuh, maꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pinganguak daang uluk ingan, saꞌ-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa sobot nang ingan nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: nor filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not appropriate; but rather giving of thanks.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh sina deꞌ koꞌis, sina deꞌ budua, sina deꞌ diꞌ-e sinunuh, dop-e suaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e patut ingan yaꞌ nang.   Ngibalik-e ingan nang sina bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Know this for sure, that no sexually immoral person, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the Kingdom of Christ and God.
verses.source_translation: Pilati nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nyonal, nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e sinunuh, nyaꞌa deꞌ pinganguak, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nyomah tipaduaꞌ.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ponai jadin bigian soꞌ umat deꞌ obuah pilitah Kristus duoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Let no one deceive you with empty words. For because of these things, the wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ pogo odaꞌ sina deꞌ pibulaꞌ, dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oni deꞌ nang-E.

verses.text: Therefore don’t be partakers with them.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan-e maꞌ ingan bidingan duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: For you were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord. Walk as children of light,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ ingan idip daang mopung, pak-e adin ingan moꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ deꞌ idip daang jawaꞌ.   Noh leh ngan ingan halus idip daang jawaꞌ,

verses.text: for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth,
verses.source_translation: dop-e soꞌ jawaꞌ inohleh timul suaꞌ pingunai deꞌ paguh, deꞌ jujul duoh deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: proving what is well pleasing to the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Kagaꞌ leh bonal-bonal oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ otin Topaꞌ sonang.

verses.text: Have no fellowship with the unfruitful deeds of darkness, but rather even reprove them.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ suwaꞌ nai pingunai deꞌ diꞌ-e biguna deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang mopung.   Ngibalik-e bitanga leh nang pingunai deꞌ munoꞌ salah.

verses.text: For the things which are done by them in secret, it is a shame even to speak of.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ nai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ suwan-suwan-e inoh, yaꞌ sobot-e tuang dasaꞌ geh.

verses.text: But all things, when they are reproved, are revealed by the light, for everything that reveals is light.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e suaꞌ oni deꞌ moꞌ bitanga daang jawaꞌ yaꞌ tonga.

verses.text: Therefore he says, “Awake, you who sleep, and arise from the dead, and Christ will shine on you.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e jawaꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ jadin tonga.   Yoh ngan ogiꞌ pingunang deꞌ in-e, “Mokat mey ingan deꞌ boꞌos.   Mokat soꞌ kobos ingan, Kristus yaꞌ jadin jawaꞌ saꞌan ingan.”

verses.text: Therefore watch carefully how you walk, not as unwise, but as wise;
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan nyeꞌ pilati bonal-bonal-e, wat ki nyeꞌ halus idip, maꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ budua, pak-e idip leh kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bijak.

verses.text: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
verses.source_translation: Pakai leh suaꞌ onu deꞌ ogiꞌ ngan nyeꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, dop-e adin suaꞌ nyaꞌa nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: Therefore don’t be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan ingan maꞌ yaꞌ budua, pak-e kagaꞌ leh sa ingan ngiloti oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Don’t be drunken with wine, in which is dissipation, but be filled with the Spirit,
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ mabuk odaꞌ tuak angul, dop-e dapod pilusak idip ingan.   Pak-e idip ingan halus punuaꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: speaking to one another in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs; singing, and making melody in your heart to the Lord;
verses.source_translation: Ngin leh simangat tuduꞌ dingan-dingan ingan pakai sina-sina lagu: Soꞌ Mazmur, soꞌ buk lagu, duoh pakai lagu soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.   Ngilagu leh daang otin deꞌ sonang ngan nyeꞌ mudi Topaꞌ.

verses.text: giving thanks always concerning all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God, even the Father;
verses.source_translation: Silalu bisukul saꞌan oni sijaꞌ-e tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ daang adon Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: subjecting yourselves to one another in the fear of Christ.
verses.source_translation: Tunuak leh tuduꞌ siodop ingan, dop-e wat inoh leh wat-e ngan nyeꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: Wives, be subject to your own husbands, as to the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Ingan bala sowon tunuak leh tuduꞌ bonon ingan masim-masim samah kodaꞌ ingan tunuak tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ also is the head of the assembly, being himself the savior of the body.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e bonon leh deꞌ jadin bak saꞌan sowon-e, samah kodaꞌ Kristus deꞌ jadin bak saꞌan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh Iyoh leh deꞌ jadin Laja Pinyilamat saꞌan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, deꞌ jadin gonan-E.

verses.text: But as the assembly is subject to Christ, so let the wives also be to their own husbands in everything.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tunuak tuduꞌ Kristus, watnoh geh daang suaꞌ oni, sowon tunuak tuduꞌ bonon.

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the assembly, and gave himself up for it;
verses.source_translation: Ingan bala bonon, ngibalaꞌ leh sowon ingan samah kodaꞌ Kristus ngibalaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh nyelah asong-E saꞌan odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: that he might sanctify it, having cleansed it by the washing of water with the word,
verses.source_translation: Kristus nai deꞌ wat inoh, sa uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Iyoh deꞌ kakuꞌ.   Kristus kibisig uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ pakai piꞌin baptis duoh Pingunang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: that he might present the assembly to himself gloriously, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without defect.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, Kristus odaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ inoh jadin sukup sangon-e deꞌ sulung jowin-E, pakai idip deꞌ bonal, doiꞌ nyaꞌa sobot nang iyoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ salah, duoh doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kulang daꞌ-e.

verses.text: Even so husbands also ought to love their own wives as their own bodies. He who loves his own wife loves himself.
verses.source_translation: Wat noh geh bonon halus ngibalaꞌ sowon-e samah kodaꞌ yoh ngibalaꞌ polong odop-e.   Osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ ngibalaꞌ sowon-e yoh ngibalaꞌ polong odop-e.

verses.text: For no man ever hated his own flesh; but nourishes and cherishes it, even as the Lord also does the assembly;
verses.source_translation: Dop-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ buꞌui deꞌ polong odop-e.   Pak-e iyoh ngilaan polong-e duoh jaga-e, samah kodaꞌ Kristus jaga duoh ngilaan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: because we are members of his body, of his flesh and bones.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e otoꞌ bigian gonan-E.

verses.text: “For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will be joined to his wife. The two will become one flesh.”
verses.source_translation: Daang buk Kitab obuah nulis in-e, “Noh leh ngan nyaꞌa deꞌ dali buꞌu soꞌ samaꞌ sinoꞌ-e, yohmoꞌ tikuluk jadin niꞌ duoh sowon-e, yohmoꞌ soꞌ duwoh-e moꞌ jadin niꞌ.”

verses.text: This mystery is great, but I speak concerning Christ and of the assembly.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab inoh tuluap loti-e.   Pak-e okuꞌ sobot-e ngan kuꞌ tanon tentang Kristus duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: Nevertheless each of you must also love his own wife even as himself; and let the wife see that she respects her husband.

chapters.text: Be therefore imitators of God, as beloved children. Walk in love, even as Christ also loved you, and gave himself up for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling fragrance. But sexual immorality, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be mentioned among you, as becomes saints; nor filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not appropriate; but rather giving of thanks. Know this for sure, that no sexually immoral person, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the Kingdom of Christ and God. Let no one deceive you with empty words. For because of these things, the wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience. Therefore don’t be partakers with them. For you were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord. Walk as children of light, for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth, proving what is well pleasing to the Lord. Have no fellowship with the unfruitful deeds of darkness, but rather even reprove them. For the things which are done by them in secret, it is a shame even to speak of. But all things, when they are reproved, are revealed by the light, for everything that reveals is light. Therefore he says, “Awake, you who sleep, and arise from the dead, and Christ will shine on you.” Therefore watch carefully how you walk, not as unwise, but as wise; redeeming the time, because the days are evil. Therefore don’t be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is. Don’t be drunken with wine, in which is dissipation, but be filled with the Spirit, speaking to one another in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs; singing, and making melody in your heart to the Lord; giving thanks always concerning all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God, even the Father; subjecting yourselves to one another in the fear of Christ. Wives, be subject to your own husbands, as to the Lord. For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ also is the head of the assembly, being himself the savior of the body. But as the assembly is subject to Christ, so let the wives also be to their own husbands in everything. Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the assembly, and gave himself up for it; that he might sanctify it, having cleansed it by the washing of water with the word, that he might present the assembly to himself gloriously, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without defect. Even so husbands also ought to love their own wives as their own bodies. He who loves his own wife loves himself. For no man ever hated his own flesh; but nourishes and cherishes it, even as the Lord also does the assembly; because we are members of his body, of his flesh and bones. “For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will be joined to his wife. The two will become one flesh.” This mystery is great, but I speak concerning Christ and of the assembly. Nevertheless each of you must also love his own wife even as himself; and let the wife see that she respects her husband.

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.
verses.source_translation: Ingan deꞌ jadin onak, taat leh duoh oni deꞌ tanon pingoma ingan kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, dop-e inoh leh oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ patut nyeꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: “Honor your father and mother,” which is the first commandment with a promise:
verses.source_translation: Daang buk Kitab ogiꞌ pilitah deꞌ obuah nulis in-e, “Pimodo leh tuduꞌ samaꞌ sinoꞌ muꞌ.” Daang pilitah inoh leh Topaꞌ ngin janyi-e deꞌ sibungas-e daang-e deꞌ in-e:

verses.text: “that it may be well with you, and you may live long on the earth.”
verses.source_translation: “Sa ingan doon duoh umul ingan tuui deꞌ dunia.”

verses.text: You fathers, don’t provoke your children to wrath, but nurture them in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Ingan bala samaꞌ maꞌ yaꞌ kanam kila onak-onak ingan odaꞌ tiwas.   Pak-e piala leh pakai pingajal duoh nasehat deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Servants, be obedient to those who according to the flesh are your masters, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as to Christ;
verses.source_translation: Ingan bala kuli, taat leh duoh oni deꞌ tanon toke ingan deꞌ dunia, pakai kila deꞌ paguh, daang nyeꞌ pimodo duoh diꞌ nyeꞌ lawan oni deꞌ tanon-e, samah kodaꞌ ingan taat tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: not in the way of service only when eyes are on you, as men pleasers; but as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart;
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ nai oniꞌ jok-e takal ogiꞌ toke ingan deꞌ sinok ingan, madas ngan ingan yaꞌ nyonang otin-e.   Pak-e ingan deꞌ jadi kuli-kuli Kristus, nai leh oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ ingan sipunuaꞌ otin ingan.

verses.text: with good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men;
verses.source_translation: Kiloja leh saꞌan toke ingan daang otin deꞌ doon, samah kodaꞌ ingan nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e saꞌan manusia.

verses.text: knowing that whatever good thing each one does, he will receive the same again from the Lord, whether he is bound or free.
verses.source_translation: Ingan puꞌan nang tibilang nyaꞌa, bait kuli, bait nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e kuli, moꞌ iyoh moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, iyoh yaꞌ soꞌon pah-e soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: You masters, do the same things to them, and give up threatening, knowing that he who is both their Master and yours is in heaven, and there is no partiality with him.
verses.source_translation: Ingan bala toke, nai leh wat inoh tuduꞌ kuli-kuli ingan, maꞌ yaꞌ ngegap ngangam-e.   Natong nyeꞌ, Topaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin kuli duoh Topaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin toke jok-e ogiꞌ niꞌ, yohleh Topaꞌ deꞌ siluga.   Iyoh diꞌ-e ningaꞌ ulah nyaꞌa.

verses.text: Finally, be strong in the Lord, and in the strength of his might.
verses.source_translation: Piobuaꞌ-e okuꞌ sibaya-e, ingan halus dolas ngan kuasa deꞌ soꞌon soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
verses.source_translation: Pakai leh suaꞌ bikokas polang deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan taan lawan Laja Muat Munua deꞌ yaꞌ ngakal, nipu ingan.

verses.text: For our wrestling is not against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, against the powers, against the world’s rulers of the darkness of this age, and against the spiritual forces of wickedness in the heavenly places.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ bijuang lawan musuh deꞌ ogiꞌ toding doyaꞌ-e, pak-e otoꞌ lawan suaꞌ kuasa muat munua deꞌ nguasa joman deꞌ jaꞌat adin.   Otoꞌ lawan suaꞌ gamut deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nguasa auu longit.

verses.text: Therefore put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and, having done all, to stand.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan ingan pakai bikokas polang deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ ngan ingan bipolang, saꞌ-e takal onu deꞌ jaꞌat nog, ingan taan lawan musuh.   Takal ingan moꞌ bijuang nog obuaꞌ-e, ingan aluaꞌ totap mujuag togap wat-wat-e.

verses.text: Stand therefore, having the utility belt of truth buckled around your waist, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness,
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan ingan halus mujuag togap-togap-e odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ jadin kodaꞌ soot kupuang deꞌ pakai ingan, duoh oniꞌ deꞌ adil deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ jadin kodaꞌ bojuh bosi deꞌ pakai ingan.

verses.text: and having fitted your feet with the preparation of the Good News of peace;
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh silalu siap magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ tentang idip bidanah, samah kodaꞌ kasut deꞌ pakai ingan.

verses.text: above all, taking up the shield of faith, with which you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one.
verses.source_translation: Tibilang konu, pakai bisayaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, saꞌ-e jadin utap ngan nyeꞌ mulaꞌ siduduꞌ panah opui Laja Muat Munua.

verses.text: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God;
verses.source_translation: Natong nyeꞌ nang Topaꞌ moꞌ nyilamat ingan soꞌ dosa.   Inoh deꞌ yaꞌ jadin kodaꞌ topi bosi deꞌ pakai ingan.   Wat inoh geh ingan pakai Pingunang Topaꞌ ngan ingan tulung odop ingan.   Inoh yaꞌ jadin kodaꞌ podang deꞌ naꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ tongan ingan.

verses.text: with all prayer and requests, praying at all times in the Spirit, and being watchful to this end in all perseverance and requests for all the saints:
verses.source_translation: Daang suaꞌ oniꞌ nyeꞌ silalu bidoa mitiaꞌ tulung deꞌ Topaꞌ.   Pakai tibilang konu ngan nyeꞌ bidoa odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ mipin ingan.   Ingan halus silalu siap, maꞌ yaꞌ buwon-buwon bidoa saꞌan suaꞌ umat Topaꞌ.

verses.text: on my behalf, that utterance may be given to me in opening my mouth, to make known with boldness the mystery of the Good News,
verses.source_translation: Bidoa geh saꞌan okuꞌ, sa takal okuꞌ sina, Topaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ sina-sina deꞌ bonal deꞌ patut kuꞌ nang-e.   Saꞌ okuꞌ bilani sina tentang Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e.

verses.text: for which I am an ambassador in chains; that in it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.
verses.source_translation: Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ okuꞌ ponu magah-e, luban inoh leh adin okuꞌ moꞌ obuah jel.   Bidoa saꞌan okuꞌ saꞌ kuꞌ bilani sina tentang Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh, wat inoh leh deꞌ patut okuꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: But that you also may know my affairs, how I am doing, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful servant in the Lord, will make known to you all things;
verses.source_translation: Sa ingan puꞌan suaꞌ-e tentang okuꞌ, okuꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ Tikhikus madih deꞌ ngibalaꞌ toꞌ deꞌ jadin kuli Topaꞌ deꞌ taat daang kiloja-e, tanon tuduꞌ ingan tentang okuꞌ, oni wat kuꞌ, oni deꞌ nai kuꞌ.

verses.text: whom I have sent to you for this very purpose, that you may know our state, and that he may comfort your hearts.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan kuꞌ pait iyoh tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ-e tanon gah koꞌih, saꞌ ingan diꞌ-e bigaduh natong koꞌih.

verses.text: Peace be to the brothers, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa sa Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus tulung ingan, madih ayua, saꞌ ingan idip bidanah, samah-samah ngibalaꞌ tipan siodop ingan, duoh totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ with incorruptible love. Amen.

chapters.text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right. “Honor your father and mother,” which is the first commandment with a promise: “that it may be well with you, and you may live long on the earth.”  You fathers, don’t provoke your children to wrath, but nurture them in the discipline and instruction of the Lord. Servants, be obedient to those who according to the flesh are your masters, with fear and trembling, in singleness of your heart, as to Christ; not in the way of service only when eyes are on you, as men pleasers; but as servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart; with good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men; knowing that whatever good thing each one does, he will receive the same again from the Lord, whether he is bound or free. You masters, do the same things to them, and give up threatening, knowing that he who is both their Master and yours is in heaven, and there is no partiality with him. Finally, be strong in the Lord, and in the strength of his might. Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil. For our wrestling is not against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, against the powers, against the world’s rulers of the darkness of this age, and against the spiritual forces of wickedness in the heavenly places. Therefore put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and, having done all, to stand. Stand therefore, having the utility belt of truth buckled around your waist, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness, and having fitted your feet with the preparation of the Good News of peace; above all, taking up the shield of faith, with which you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one. And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God; with all prayer and requests, praying at all times in the Spirit, and being watchful to this end in all perseverance and requests for all the saints: on my behalf, that utterance may be given to me in opening my mouth, to make known with boldness the mystery of the Good News, for which I am an ambassador in chains; that in it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak. But that you also may know my affairs, how I am doing, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful servant in the Lord, will make known to you all things; whom I have sent to you for this very purpose, that you may know our state, and that he may comfort your hearts. Peace be to the brothers, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ with incorruptible love. Amen.

verses.text: Paul and Timothy, servants of Jesus Christ; To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers  and servants:
verses.source_translation: Sulat soꞌ koꞌih duwoh, Paulus duoh Timotius, kuli Kristus Yesus.  Koꞌih pait sulat itih tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ, deꞌ loꞌo deꞌ kota Filipi, dop-e moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.  Wat inoh geh tuduꞌ pimipin duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang tulung pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: Grace to you, and peace from God, our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ duoh Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: I thank my God whenever I remember you,
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ silalu bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ kuꞌ, tibilang kuꞌ natong ingan.

verses.text: always in every request of mine on behalf of you all, making my requests with joy,
verses.source_translation: Tibilang kuꞌ bidoa saꞌan ingan tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, okuꞌ bidoa daang otin deꞌ doon.

verses.text: for your partnership in furtherance of the Good News from the first day until now;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e soꞌ sibungas ingan bisayaꞌ nog adin ingan suwaꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Yesus.

verses.text: being confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Sukup kuꞌ bisayaꞌ: Odop Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ dioꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ paguh deꞌ uun ingan, Iyoh geh deꞌ yaꞌ nah-nah nai kiloja inoh nog-e jadi takal Kristus Yesus paliꞌ nog.

verses.text: It is even right for me to think this way on behalf of all of you, because I have you in my heart, because, both in my bonds and in the defense and confirmation of the Good News, you all are partakers with me of grace.
verses.source_translation: Kan-e moꞌ patut okuꞌ bipikil deꞌ in inoh tentang ingan, dop-e ingan silalu ogiꞌ daang otin kuꞌ, dop-e ingan suwaꞌ nai kiloja deꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ okuꞌ nai-e, bait takal okuꞌ nuaꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh duoh bitanga oniꞌ deꞌ bonal soꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh, bait takal okuꞌ obuah jel deꞌ wat itih adin.

verses.text: For God is my witness, how I long after all of you in the tender mercies of Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ puꞌan nang okuꞌ sukup-sukup jobong tuduꞌ suaꞌ ingan pakai kila ngibalaꞌ deꞌ soꞌ Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: This I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all discernment;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ ingan makin ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ duoh ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan.  Okuꞌ bidoa geh saꞌ ingan puꞌan oni deꞌ bonal duoh makin bijak.

verses.text: so that you may approve the things that are excellent; that you may be sincere and without offense to the day of Christ;
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, ingan ponai pilih oni deꞌ paguh, saꞌ ingan idip bisig duoh doiꞌ deꞌ salah takal Kristus paliꞌ nog.

verses.text: being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are through Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ idip ingan punuaꞌ odaꞌ pingunai deꞌ bonal deꞌ obuah nai odaꞌ kuasa Yesus Kristus deꞌ ogiꞌ daang ingan.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, nyaꞌa yaꞌ pimodo duoh mudi Topaꞌ takal-e ningaꞌ idip ingan.

verses.text: Now I desire to have you know, brothers, that the things which happened to me have turned out rather to the progress of the Good News;
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua kuꞌ, saꞌ ingan puꞌan-e, oni deꞌ obuah okuꞌ datiꞌ, makin odaꞌ bitamah bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: so that it became evident to the whole palace guard, and to all the rest, that my bonds are in Christ;
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaga istana, baya nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kota itih, puꞌan nang okuꞌ obuah jel dop-e okuꞌ magah gah tentang Kristus.

verses.text: and that most of the brothers in the Lord, being confident through my bonds, are more abundantly bold to speak the word of God without fear.
verses.source_translation: Adin ngan okuꞌ obuah jel, bogoꞌ pinunaꞌ Kristus deꞌ makin bitamah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadin makin bilani duoh diꞌ-e tolu magah Pingunang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Some indeed preach Christ even out of envy and strife, and some also out of good will.
verses.source_translation: Tok ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ magah tentang Kristus dop-e yoh siniaꞌ tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai kuꞌ yohmoꞌ yaꞌ bikaꞌi bikalah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, pak-e ogiꞌ geh odop-e deꞌ bokon deꞌ magah tentang Kristus daang niat deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: The former insincerely preach Christ from selfish ambition, thinking that they add affliction to my chains;
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ paguh otin-e magah tentang Kristus dop-e yoh ngibalaꞌ okuꞌ.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang okuꞌ ogiꞌ daang jel itih ngan kuꞌ nuaꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh.

verses.text: but the latter out of love, knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the Good News.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ magah tentang Kristus daang niat deꞌ diꞌ-e paguh; Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nai wat inoh, saꞌ okuꞌ bitamah susah daang jel.

verses.text: What does it matter? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is proclaimed. I rejoice in this, yes, and will rejoice.
verses.source_translation: Saꞌan okuꞌ idoh diꞌ-e wat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ magah tentang Kristus daang niat deꞌ jaꞌat keh, daang niat deꞌ paguh keh, okuꞌ doon, deꞌ penting Kristus obuah magah.  Yohmoꞌ okuꞌ totap yaꞌ doon,

verses.text: For I know that this will turn out to my salvation, through your prayers and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
verses.source_translation: dop-e okuꞌ puꞌan nang odaꞌ doa-doa ingan duoh ngan kuꞌ obuah tulung odaꞌ Iyang Yesus Kristus, okuꞌ yaꞌ obuah pilopas soꞌ jel.

verses.text: according to my earnest expectation and hope, that I will in no way be disappointed, but with all boldness, as always, now also Christ will be magnified in my body, whether by life, or by death.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ laꞌan kuꞌ duoh deꞌ alap kuꞌ, maꞌ sape okuꞌ yaꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ nai tugas kuꞌ, saꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ jadin dasaꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ.  Pak-e deꞌ laꞌan kuꞌ saꞌ-a adin nog siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e okuꞌ totap telus bilani kodaꞌ dioꞌ.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, soꞌ pingidip okuꞌ, nyaꞌa dapod yaꞌ mudi adon Kristus, bait takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ idip, atou takal okuꞌ moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e saꞌan okuꞌ, simoꞌ okuꞌ idip, idip kuꞌ saꞌan Kristus, duoh simoꞌ okuꞌ kobos, okuꞌ utung.

verses.text: But if I live on in the flesh, this will bring fruit from my work; yet I don’t know what I will choose.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ kuꞌ aluaꞌ idip daang dunia itih, okuꞌ yaꞌ nah-nah nai kiloja deꞌ ogiꞌ guna-e.  Yoh ngan diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan ki deꞌ halus okuꞌ pilih-e, lobih paguh kuꞌ idip atou lobih paguh okuꞌ kobos.

verses.text: But I am in a dilemma between the two, having the desire to depart and be with Christ, which is far better.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ obuah nalik soꞌ duwoh kawa.  Okuꞌ yaꞌ buu soꞌ dunia itih ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ loꞌo duoh Kristus, dop-e inoh leh deꞌ sukup paguh-e.

verses.text: Yet, to remain in the flesh is more needful for your sake.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e saꞌ okuꞌ dapod tulung ingan, okuꞌ aluaꞌ pilelu totap loꞌo daang dunia itih.

verses.text: Having this confidence, I know that I will remain, yes, and remain with you all, for your progress and joy in the faith,
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ bisayaꞌ, okuꞌ puꞌan nang Topaꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ totap idip.  Iyoh odaꞌ okuꞌ loꞌo samah-samah duoh ingan, ngan kuꞌ tulung odaꞌ ingan makin bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ duoh sonang dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: that your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my presence with you again.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh takal kuꞌ nog lagiꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, ingan deꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus, yaꞌ mudi-E takal ingan ningaꞌ oni deꞌ nai-E daang idip okuꞌ.

verses.text: Only let your way of life be worthy of the Good News of Christ, that, whether I come and see you or am absent, I may hear of your state, that you stand firm in one spirit, with one soul striving for the faith of the Good News;
verses.source_translation: Adin, deꞌ penting saꞌan ingan nai-e, idip leh nunaꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Kristus.  Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, moꞌ nyam diꞌ kuꞌ tapod yaꞌ odi tuduꞌ ingan, okuꞌ dapod ngojit nang ingan totap togap idip daang niꞌ tujuan deꞌ samah.  Wat inoh geh ingan bijuang samah-samah sa' bisayaꞌ ingan deꞌ nog soꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh totap togap.

verses.text: and in nothing frightened by the adversaries, which is for them a proof of destruction, but to you of salvation, and that from God.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ tolu deꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan ingan.  Ingan halus bilani, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ lawan ingan deꞌ munoꞌ puꞌan nang odop-e yaꞌ alah.  Dop-e odop Topaꞌ leh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan monang.

verses.text: Because it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in him, but also to suffer on his behalf,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ sukup paguh-e duoh ingan, Iyoh odaꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, pak-e idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh, Iyoh odaꞌ-e geh ingan susah jolaꞌ ngan-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: having the same conflict which you saw in me, and now hear is in me.

chapters.text: Paul and Timothy, servants of Jesus Christ; To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers  and servants: Grace to you, and peace from God, our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ. I thank my God whenever I remember you, always in every request of mine on behalf of you all, making my requests with joy, for your partnership in furtherance of the Good News from the first day until now; being confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ. It is even right for me to think this way on behalf of all of you, because I have you in my heart, because, both in my bonds and in the defense and confirmation of the Good News, you all are partakers with me of grace. For God is my witness, how I long after all of you in the tender mercies of Christ Jesus. This I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all discernment; so that you may approve the things that are excellent; that you may be sincere and without offense to the day of Christ; being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are through Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God. Now I desire to have you know, brothers, that the things which happened to me have turned out rather to the progress of the Good News; so that it became evident to the whole palace guard, and to all the rest, that my bonds are in Christ; and that most of the brothers in the Lord, being confident through my bonds, are more abundantly bold to speak the word of God without fear. Some indeed preach Christ even out of envy and strife, and some also out of good will. The former insincerely preach Christ from selfish ambition, thinking that they add affliction to my chains; but the latter out of love, knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the Good News. What does it matter? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is proclaimed. I rejoice in this, yes, and will rejoice. For I know that this will turn out to my salvation, through your prayers and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ, according to my earnest expectation and hope, that I will in no way be disappointed, but with all boldness, as always, now also Christ will be magnified in my body, whether by life, or by death. For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain. But if I live on in the flesh, this will bring fruit from my work; yet I don’t know what I will choose. But I am in a dilemma between the two, having the desire to depart and be with Christ, which is far better. Yet, to remain in the flesh is more needful for your sake. Having this confidence, I know that I will remain, yes, and remain with you all, for your progress and joy in the faith, that your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my presence with you again. Only let your way of life be worthy of the Good News of Christ, that, whether I come and see you or am absent, I may hear of your state, that you stand firm in one spirit, with one soul striving for the faith of the Good News; and in nothing frightened by the adversaries, which is for them a proof of destruction, but to you of salvation, and that from God. Because it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in him, but also to suffer on his behalf, having the same conflict which you saw in me, and now hear is in me.

verses.text: If therefore there is any exhortation in Christ, if any consolation of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassion,
verses.source_translation: Otin kila ingan moꞌ jadin togap dop-e ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.  Ingan obuah ngilibul dop-e Kristus ngibalaꞌ ingan.  Ingan moꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh Iyang Topaꞌ.  Ingan moꞌ tilimaꞌ pilasiꞌ soꞌ Kristus dop-e Iyoh paguh.  Inoh leh ngan,

verses.text: make my joy full, by being like-minded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind;
verses.source_translation: nai leh odaꞌ otin kuꞌ bonal-bonal doon pakai wat itih: Pikil leh oniꞌ deꞌ samah.  Ngibalaꞌ leh siodop ingan.  Idip leh niꞌ kila duoh niꞌ tujuan deꞌ samah.

verses.text: doing nothing through rivalry or through conceit, but in humility, each counting others better than himself;
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ odop nyeꞌ utung sadiꞌ nyeꞌ atou madas ngan nyeꞌ yaꞌ bilagah odop nyeꞌ.  Pak-e pakai otin deꞌ diꞌ-e samuh, angap leh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon lobih penting soꞌ odop nyeꞌ.

verses.text: each of you not just looking to his own things, but each of you also to the things of others.
verses.source_translation: Pikil nyeꞌ oni deꞌ penting saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, idoh diꞌ-e jok-e deꞌ penting saꞌan odop nyeꞌ sadiꞌ nyeꞌ.

verses.text: Have this in your mind, which was also in Christ Jesus,
verses.source_translation: Oni deꞌ nai ingan halus samah duoh oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Kristus:

verses.text: who, existing in the form of God, didn’t consider equality with God a thing to be grasped,
verses.source_translation: Iyoh sibonal-e samah duoh Topaꞌ, pak-e nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop-E, Iyoh diꞌ-e pakai kuasa-E deꞌ samah duoh Topaꞌ sibalang saꞌan odop-E sadiꞌ-E.

verses.text: but emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, being made in the likeness of men.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Yesus posan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ-E, Iyoh moꞌ jadin samah kodaꞌ kuli.  Iyoh obuah bilanak jadin manusia kodaꞌ manusia deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: And being found in human form, he humbled himself, becoming obedient to death, yes, the death of the cross.
verses.source_translation: Takal Iyoh idip samah kodaꞌ manusia, Iyoh odaꞌ odop-e jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e penting, Iyoh taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ sape Iyoh sangup kobos, kobos obuah masak deꞌ tun salip.

verses.text: Therefore God also highly exalted him, and gave to him the name which is above every name;
verses.source_translation: Yohleh ngan Topaꞌ odaꞌ Iyoh obuah pimodo lobih soꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ bokon, duoh odaꞌ adon-E paling ayuh kuasa-E soꞌ suaꞌ adon oniꞌ deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, those on earth, and those under the earth,
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, Topaꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ Yesus obuah pimodo odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ siluga, duoh deꞌ tun tana', baya deꞌ libuaꞌ tana'.

verses.text: and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa tuang yaꞌ ngakuꞌ-e geh nang Yesus Kristus inoh Topaꞌ.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh nyaꞌa mudi Topaꞌ Samaꞌ.

verses.text: So then, my beloved, even as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua deꞌ sukup kuꞌ ngibalaꞌ-e, soꞌ noꞌuh-e nog adin ingan silalu taat.  Wat inoh geh ingan halus totap bijuang ngan ingan idip nunaꞌ wat-e deꞌ patut saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ obuah nyilamat.  Ingan halus nai deꞌ wat inoh daang kila deꞌ sukup pimodo-e tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ nai deꞌ wat inoh jok-e takal okuꞌ ogiꞌ duoh ingan, pak-e adin takal okuꞌ doiꞌ duoh ingan, ingan halus nai oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ lobih bonal-bonal-e lagi.

verses.text: For it is God who works in you both to will and to work, for his good pleasure.
verses.source_translation: Odop Topaꞌ deꞌ kiloja daang otin ingan odaꞌ ingan laꞌan duoh taan nai oniꞌ deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Do all things without murmurings and disputes,
verses.source_translation: Nai leh suaꞌ oniꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ bikutuk-bigonom duoh diꞌ nyeꞌ bikalah,

verses.text: that you may become blameless and harmless, children of God without defect in the middle of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you are seen as lights in the world,
verses.source_translation: saꞌ-a idip ingan bonal duoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ponai yaꞌ nyalah ingan.  Ingan, onak-onak Topaꞌ deꞌ idip doiꞌ salah-e deꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat duoh bidosa, yohleh ngan ingan halus idip bonal deꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ kodaꞌ bitang-bitang deꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ dunia deꞌ mopung jadin jawaꞌ.

verses.text: holding up the word of life; that I may have something to boast in the day of Christ, that I didn’t run in vain nor labor in vain.
verses.source_translation: Kagong togap-togap-e pingunang deꞌ ngin idip sibonal-e, saꞌ-a takal tiaꞌ ijoꞌ Kristus paliꞌ nog, okuꞌ dapod bilagah tentang ingan dop-e kiloja' deꞌ ulih-ulih kuꞌ nai-e ogiꞌ guna-e duoh biasil.

verses.text: Yes, and if I am poured out on the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice, and rejoice with you all.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ nyam okuꞌ halus kobos obuah ngabos ngan kuꞌ jadin korban, duoh doyaꞌ kuꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ duwan deꞌ tun persembahan deꞌ ngin ingan tuduꞌ Topaꞌ dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E, okuꞌ bisukul duoh doon samah-samah duoh ingan.

verses.text: In the same way, you also rejoice, and rejoice with me.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh ingan halus bisukul duoh doon samah-samah duoh okuꞌ.

verses.text: But I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, that I also may be cheered up when I know how you are doing.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ alap kuꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tuui Topaꞌ Yesus bukaꞌ olan saꞌ okuꞌ dapod pait Timotius odaꞌ odi tuduꞌ ingan.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, moꞌ nyam Timotius paliꞌ lagiꞌ katiꞌ, okuꞌ dapod ngojit gah tentang ingan soꞌ iyoh deꞌ odaꞌ kila kuꞌ sonang.

verses.text: For I have no one else like-minded, who will truly care about you.
verses.source_translation: Jok-e Timotius leh deꞌ niꞌ nyam kila-e duoh okuꞌ, deꞌ bonal-bonal pilati oni deꞌ pilelu ingan.

verses.text: For they all seek their own, not the things of Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon jok-e ngulus hal odop-e sijaꞌ-e, yoh diꞌ-e piduli oni deꞌ penting saꞌan Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: But you know the proof of him, that, as a child serves a father, so he served with me in furtherance of the Good News.
verses.source_translation: Ingan tuang moꞌ puꞌan ingan geh nang moꞌ ogiꞌ bukti-e Timotius tapod toꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e.  Iyoh moꞌ ulih-ulih kiloja samah-samah duoh okuꞌ ngan-e magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.  Iyoh tulung okuꞌ kodaꞌ onak deꞌ tulung samaꞌ-a.

verses.text: Therefore I hope to send him at once, as soon as I see how it will go with me.
verses.source_translation: Yohleh ngan okuꞌ alap okuꞌ dapod pait iyoh likas-likas-e odi tuduꞌ ingan, takal okuꞌ moꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ motod pingadel tentang okuꞌ.

verses.text: But I trust in the Lord that I myself also will come shortly.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e okuꞌ bisayaꞌ Topaꞌ yaꞌ tulung okuꞌ saꞌ okuꞌ dapod likas-likas odi nomi ingan.

verses.text: But I counted it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, fellow soldier, and your apostle and servant of my need;
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ pait Epafroditus madih toꞌ deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ ngan-e tulung okuꞌ.  Iyoh moꞌ nai kiloja duoh bijuang samah-samah duoh okuꞌ.  Adin, okuꞌ odaꞌ iyoh paliꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: since he longed for you all, and was very troubled, because you had heard that he was sick.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ sikiya nyam-e jobong tuduꞌ suaꞌ ingan.  Iyoh tuang susah geh nyam kila-e dop-e ingan moꞌ ngojit gah nang iyoh monam.

verses.text: For indeed he was sick, nearly to death, but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, that I might not have sorrow on sorrow.
verses.source_translation: Tok bonal iyoh ogiꞌ sidoh-e monam tadoꞌ-e yaꞌ doiꞌ asong-e.  Pak-e Topaꞌ masiꞌ idoh diꞌ-e tuduꞌ iyoh sijaꞌ-e, pak-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ geh, saꞌ kila kuꞌ diꞌ-e bitamah ngilobuꞌ.

verses.text: I have sent him therefore the more diligently, that, when you see him again, you may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.
verses.source_translation: Yoh leh ngan okuꞌ odaꞌ yoh likas-likas paliꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ-e takal ingan ningaꞌ iyoh, kila ingan munuas duoh otin okuꞌ tuang bidanah geh.

verses.text: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all joy, and hold such in honor,
verses.source_translation: Tilimaꞌ leh iyoh daang kila deꞌ sonang, dop-e iyoh madih otoꞌ deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Pimodo leh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ iyoh inoh.

verses.text: because for the work of Christ he came near to death, risking his life to supply that which was lacking in your service toward me.

chapters.text: If therefore there is any exhortation in Christ, if any consolation of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassion, make my joy full, by being like-minded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind; doing nothing through rivalry or through conceit, but in humility, each counting others better than himself; each of you not just looking to his own things, but each of you also to the things of others. Have this in your mind, which was also in Christ Jesus, who, existing in the form of God, didn’t consider equality with God a thing to be grasped, but emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, being made in the likeness of men. And being found in human form, he humbled himself, becoming obedient to death, yes, the death of the cross. Therefore God also highly exalted him, and gave to him the name which is above every name; that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those in heaven, those on earth, and those under the earth, and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father. So then, my beloved, even as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling. For it is God who works in you both to will and to work, for his good pleasure. Do all things without murmurings and disputes, that you may become blameless and harmless, children of God without defect in the middle of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you are seen as lights in the world, holding up the word of life; that I may have something to boast in the day of Christ, that I didn’t run in vain nor labor in vain. Yes, and if I am poured out on the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice, and rejoice with you all. In the same way, you also rejoice, and rejoice with me. But I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, that I also may be cheered up when I know how you are doing. For I have no one else like-minded, who will truly care about you. For they all seek their own, not the things of Jesus Christ. But you know the proof of him, that, as a child serves a father, so he served with me in furtherance of the Good News. Therefore I hope to send him at once, as soon as I see how it will go with me. But I trust in the Lord that I myself also will come shortly. But I counted it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, fellow soldier, and your apostle and servant of my need; since he longed for you all, and was very troubled, because you had heard that he was sick. For indeed he was sick, nearly to death, but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, that I might not have sorrow on sorrow. I have sent him therefore the more diligently, that, when you see him again, you may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful. Receive him therefore in the Lord with all joy, and hold such in honor, because for the work of Christ he came near to death, risking his life to supply that which was lacking in your service toward me.

verses.text: Finally, my brothers, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you, to me indeed is not tiresome, but for you it is safe.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua kuꞌ deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ, doon leh dop-e ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Topaꞌ.  Daang sonang otin okuꞌ nulis lagiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dioꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ ingan obuah jaga soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: Beware of the dogs, beware of the evil workers, beware of the false circumcision.
verses.source_translation: Ati-ati nyeꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, idip-e samah kodaꞌ kosuang.  Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ paksa nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus saꞌ-e bisunat.

verses.text: For we are the circumcision, who worship God in the Spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh;
verses.source_translation: Tiap otoꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ leh nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ tilimaꞌ bisunat deꞌ tok, dop-e otoꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ.  Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ nutuan otoꞌ ngan-e odaꞌ otoꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ.  Otoꞌ doon odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai Kristus Yesus saꞌan otoꞌ.  Otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ bilagah atulan-atulan deꞌ nai manusia.

verses.text: though I myself might have confidence even in the flesh. If any other man thinks that he has confidence in the flesh, I yet more:
verses.source_translation: Sibonal-e okuꞌ lobih bogoꞌ alasan ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ bialap deꞌ atulan-atulan deꞌ nai manusia, lobih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ pikil nang odop-e ponai bialap deꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews; concerning the law, a Pharisee;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ obuah bisunat takal umul kuꞌ moih onu.  Okuꞌ obuah bilanak soꞌ bangsa Israel, soꞌ suku Benyamin, okuꞌ ulang Ibrani asli.  Okuꞌ sukup taat tuduꞌ atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa.  Okuꞌ soꞌ uluk ulang Farisi.

verses.text: concerning zeal, persecuting the assembly; concerning the righteousness which is in the law, found blameless.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ simangat pijolaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.  Daang hal nunaꞌ atulan agama Yahudi, susuaꞌ-a kuꞌ nunaꞌ-e.

verses.text: However, I consider those things that were gain to me as a loss for Christ.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e takal okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai kuꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, deꞌ dioꞌ kuꞌ angap nang utung, adin kuꞌ angap nang lugi.

verses.text: Yes most certainly, and I count all things to be a loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus, my Lord, for whom I suffered the loss of all things, and count them nothing but refuse, that I may gain Christ
verses.source_translation: Adin suaꞌ oniꞌ okuꞌ angap lugi, ngan kuꞌ moꞌ piluh Kristus Yesus, Topaꞌ kuꞌ deꞌ lobih biloga-e soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Luban kuꞌ piluh Kristus, okuꞌ pilopas suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ kuꞌ duoh angap inoh umang, saꞌ kuꞌ kakuꞌ Kristus,

verses.text: and be found in him, not having a righteousness of my own, that which is of the law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith;
verses.source_translation: duoh okuꞌ bonal-bonal idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.  Oni' deꞌ munoꞌ jadi, idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ nai kuꞌ ngan okuꞌ taat nunaꞌ atulan-atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis nabi Musa, pak-e ngan okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.  Topaꞌ moꞌ ngibonal okuꞌ, takal okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: that I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, becoming conformed to his death;
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ kalik kuꞌ adin, saꞌ okuꞌ piluh Kristus duoh ngoon kuasa deꞌ odaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ idip.  Okuꞌ tuang laꞌan kuꞌ geh ngoon susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon-E.  Okuꞌ moꞌ jadin samah kodaꞌ Iyoh, deꞌ siap susah jolaꞌ nog-e kobos.

verses.text: if by any means I may attain to the resurrection from the dead.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, okuꞌ alap Topaꞌ tuang yaꞌ odaꞌ-e geh okuꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Not that I have already obtained, or am already made perfect; but I press on, that I may take hold of that for which also I was taken hold of by Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ nang odop kuꞌ moꞌ biasil nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, atou nang odop kuꞌ moꞌ sukup doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kulang.  Pak-e okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ bijuang ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon oni deꞌ moꞌ nyidia Kristus Yesus.  Inoh leh tujuan Iyoh moꞌ pilih okuꞌ saꞌan odop-E.

verses.text: Brothers, I don’t regard myself as yet having taken hold, but one thing I do. Forgetting the things which are behind, and stretching forward to the things which are before,
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, idoh diꞌ kuꞌ nang odop kuꞌ moꞌ soꞌon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.  Pak-e ogiꞌ niꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai kuꞌ, okuꞌ togan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ oma, okuꞌ moꞌ ngajah suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog.

verses.text: I press on toward the goal for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ulih-ulih bikoduh nog galis piobuaꞌ-e ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon oni deꞌ moꞌ nyidia Topaꞌ sa'an Okuꞌ.  Oni' deꞌ nyidia-E inoh yohleh idip deꞌ siluga.  Inoh leh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ takal Iyoh mogan otoꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: Let us therefore, as many as are perfect, think this way. If in anything you think otherwise, God will also reveal that to you.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ tuꞌuh daang bisayaꞌ, otoꞌ halus bipikil wat inoh.  Pak-e simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ okon in pikil-e, odop Topaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nelang tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Nevertheless, to the extent that we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule. Let us be of the same mind.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ penting otoꞌ halus silalu idip nunaꞌ pingajal Topaꞌ, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai otoꞌ nog adin.

verses.text: Brothers, be imitators together of me, and note those who walk this way, even as you have us for an example.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, nunaꞌ negeh soto idip deꞌ bonal deꞌ bitanga kuꞌ.  Nunaꞌ nyeꞌ geh wat idip nyaꞌa deꞌ idip nunaꞌ soto idip koꞌih.

verses.text: For many walk, of whom I told you often, and now tell you even weeping, as the enemies of the cross of Christ,
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ paliꞌ-paliꞌ kuꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan, nang bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip nai oniꞌ deꞌ lawan Kristus.  Adin daang kuꞌ siꞌian, okuꞌ tanon lagiꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: whose end is destruction, whose god is the belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who think about earthly things.
verses.source_translation: Piobuaꞌ idip nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ mutuab, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ gati Topaꞌ pakai oniꞌ deꞌ kanuas odop-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bilagah oniꞌ deꞌ pidasaꞌ odop-e.  Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jok-e pikil oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia itih.

verses.text: For our citizenship is in heaven, from where we also wait for a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e otoꞌ moꞌ jadin umat siluga.  Soꞌ kanoꞌ geh otoꞌ kajon Laja Pinyilamat otoꞌ, Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus yaꞌ nog.

verses.text: who will change the body of our humiliation to be conformed to the body of his glory, according to the working by which he is able even to subject all things to himself.

chapters.text: Finally, my brothers, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you, to me indeed is not tiresome, but for you it is safe. Beware of the dogs, beware of the evil workers, beware of the false circumcision. For we are the circumcision, who worship God in the Spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh; though I myself might have confidence even in the flesh. If any other man thinks that he has confidence in the flesh, I yet more: circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews; concerning the law, a Pharisee; concerning zeal, persecuting the assembly; concerning the righteousness which is in the law, found blameless. However, I consider those things that were gain to me as a loss for Christ. Yes most certainly, and I count all things to be a loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus, my Lord, for whom I suffered the loss of all things, and count them nothing but refuse, that I may gain Christ and be found in him, not having a righteousness of my own, that which is of the law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith; that I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, becoming conformed to his death; if by any means I may attain to the resurrection from the dead. Not that I have already obtained, or am already made perfect; but I press on, that I may take hold of that for which also I was taken hold of by Christ Jesus. Brothers, I don’t regard myself as yet having taken hold, but one thing I do. Forgetting the things which are behind, and stretching forward to the things which are before, I press on toward the goal for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus. Let us therefore, as many as are perfect, think this way. If in anything you think otherwise, God will also reveal that to you. Nevertheless, to the extent that we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule. Let us be of the same mind. Brothers, be imitators together of me, and note those who walk this way, even as you have us for an example. For many walk, of whom I told you often, and now tell you even weeping, as the enemies of the cross of Christ, whose end is destruction, whose god is the belly, and whose glory is in their shame, who think about earthly things. For our citizenship is in heaven, from where we also wait for a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ; who will change the body of our humiliation to be conformed to the body of his glory, according to the working by which he is able even to subject all things to himself.

verses.text: Therefore, my brothers, beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand firm in the Lord, my beloved.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ duoh deꞌ jobong kuꞌ soꞌ-e, ingan leh deꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ doon duoh bilagah tentang ingan.  Ingan halus telus idip bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: I exhort Euodia, and I exhort Syntyche, to think the same way in the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Euodia duoh Sintike, tok-tok kuꞌ mitiaꞌ-e saꞌ ingan niꞌ kila ingan dop-e ingan moꞌ samah-samah idip niꞌ duoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Yes, I beg you also, true partner, help these women, for they labored with me in the Good News, with Clement also, and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the book of life.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu, Sunsugos, dingan deꞌ dapod kuꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-e, saꞌ muꞌ tulung dayung deꞌ duwoh inoh.  Odop-e duwoh moꞌ ulih-ulih kiloja samah-samah duoh okuꞌ ngan-e magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ; samah kodaꞌ Klemen duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ moꞌ samah-samah kiloja duoh okuꞌ.  Adon odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ ogiꞌ daang buk tentang nyaꞌa deꞌ idip nah-nah, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: Rejoice in the Lord always! Again I will say, “Rejoice!”
verses.source_translation: Ingan halus silalu doon dop-e ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Topaꞌ.  Niꞌ sidoh lagiꞌ kuꞌ tanon-e doon leh!

verses.text: Let your gentleness be known to all men. The Lord is at hand.
verses.source_translation: Bitanga leh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, otin ingan deꞌ paguh soꞌ pingunai ingan deꞌ paguh.  Diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tuui Topaꞌ moꞌ yaꞌ nog.

verses.text: In nothing be anxious, but in everything, by prayer and petition with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ bigaduh tentang hal oni sijaꞌ-e, pak-e daang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jadi daang idip ingan, ingan halus bidoa duoh mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ oni deꞌ pilelu ingan.  Tibilang ingan bidoa, maꞌ komut bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin kila deꞌ bidanah deꞌ diꞌ toꞌ tapod ngiloti-e pakai pikil manusia.  Kila deꞌ bidanah inoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ jaga kila duoh pikil ingan deꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: Finally, brothers, whatever things are true, whatever things are honorable, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report; if there is any virtue, and if there is any praise, think about these things.
verses.source_translation: Piobuaꞌ-e, madih ayua kuꞌ, ingan halus pikil suaꞌ ajal deꞌ bonal, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ adil, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai yaꞌ nyalah-a, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa suka, suaꞌ sina deꞌ paguh in nyeꞌ ngojit-e, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ guna-e duoh deꞌ patut nyaꞌa mudi-e.

verses.text: The things which you learned, received, heard, and saw in me: do these things, and the God of peace will be with you.
verses.source_translation: Nai leh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan duoh deꞌ moꞌ tilimaꞌ ingan soꞌ okuꞌ, bait deꞌ pakai sina deꞌ tanon kuꞌ, bait soꞌ pingunai kuꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ ingan.  Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, Topaꞌ deꞌ ngin idip bidanah silalu ogiꞌ duoh ingan.

verses.text: But I rejoice in the Lord greatly, that now at length you have revived your thought for me; in which you did indeed take thought, but you lacked opportunity.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ doon, dop-e sungu otoꞌ moꞌ tuui bitogan, pak-e adin ingan moꞌ paliꞌ pikil oni wat idip okuꞌ.  Ingan tok silalu piduli duoh okuꞌ, pak-e diꞌ ingan silalu poyaꞌ tulung okuꞌ.

verses.text: Not that I speak because of lack, for I have learned in whatever state I am, to be content in it.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ sina deꞌ in itih idoh diꞌ-e ngan kuꞌ idip sotok, dop-e okuꞌ moꞌ bilajal puas duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ.

verses.text: I know how to be humbled, and I know also how to abound. In everything and in all things I have learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in need.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ kiꞌan oni nyam idip sotok, okuꞌ moꞌ kiꞌan oni nyam idip suaꞌ oniꞌ ogiꞌ lobih soꞌ deꞌ pilelu kuꞌ.  Okuꞌ moꞌ bilajal puas siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e, bait takal okuꞌ pilai bait busuah, bait takal okuꞌ sotok bait takal suaꞌ oniꞌ ogiꞌ lobih soꞌ deꞌ pilelu kuꞌ.

verses.text: I can do all things through Christ, who strengthens me.
verses.source_translation: Kristus leh deꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ taan lopus soꞌ oni sijaꞌ deꞌ obuah idip kuꞌ.

verses.text: However you did well that you shared in my affliction.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan sukup paguh, dop-e ingan moꞌ tulung okuꞌ takal okuꞌ susah.

verses.text: You yourselves also know, you Philippians, that in the beginning of the Good News, when I departed from Macedonia, no assembly shared with me in the matter of giving and receiving but you only.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua kuꞌ, uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Filipi, ingan tuang moꞌ puꞌan ingan geh takal okuꞌ bilakat soꞌ Makedonia ngan sibungas kuꞌ odi magah Gah deꞌ Paguh.  Takal inoh jok-e ingan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ tulung ngin duit ngan kuꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For even in Thessalonica you sent once and again to my need.
verses.source_translation: Takal okuꞌ deꞌ Tesalonika, moꞌ lobih soꞌ niꞌ sidoh ingan pait duit tuduꞌ okuꞌ ngan ingan tulung okuꞌ.

verses.text: Not that I seek for the gift, but I seek for the fruit that increases to your account.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ in inoh, idoh diꞌ-e ngan kuꞌ odaꞌ ingan ngin duit deꞌ okuꞌ.  Pak-e deꞌ laꞌan kuꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ ningaꞌ Topaꞌ ngin bilokat tuduꞌ ingan dop-e ingan moꞌ tulung okuꞌ.

verses.text: But I have all things, and abound. I am filled, having received from Epaphroditus the things that came from you, a sweet-smelling fragrance, an acceptable and well-pleasing sacrifice to God.
verses.source_translation: Adin okuꞌ moꞌ tilimaꞌ oni deꞌ ngin ingan, makin lobih soꞌ deꞌ pilelu kuꞌ.  Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu kuꞌ moꞌ toban Epafroditus.  Oniꞌ deꞌ ngin ingan inoh, samah kodaꞌ persembahan korban deꞌ masog puat-e tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.  Topaꞌ moꞌ suka-e duoh Iyoh sonang ngan-e tilimaꞌ-e.

verses.text: My God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, Topaꞌ kuꞌ deꞌ kaya laya duoh deꞌ ayuh kuasa-E yaꞌ ngin suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu ingan pakai Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: Now to our God and Father be the glory forever and ever! Amen.
verses.source_translation: Obuah mudi leh Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ nah-nah! Amin.

verses.text: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me greet you.
verses.source_translation: Ngin salam kuꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.  Ogiꞌ geh salam soꞌ madih ayua deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ, deꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh okuꞌ datiꞌ.

verses.text: All the saints greet you, especially those who are of Caesar’s household.
verses.source_translation: Salam saꞌan ingan soꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, amot-e soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ istana laja Roma.

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

chapters.text: Therefore, my brothers, beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand firm in the Lord, my beloved. I exhort Euodia, and I exhort Syntyche, to think the same way in the Lord. Yes, I beg you also, true partner, help these women, for they labored with me in the Good News, with Clement also, and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the book of life. Rejoice in the Lord always! Again I will say, “Rejoice!” Let your gentleness be known to all men. The Lord is at hand. In nothing be anxious, but in everything, by prayer and petition with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus. Finally, brothers, whatever things are true, whatever things are honorable, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report; if there is any virtue, and if there is any praise, think about these things. The things which you learned, received, heard, and saw in me: do these things, and the God of peace will be with you. But I rejoice in the Lord greatly, that now at length you have revived your thought for me; in which you did indeed take thought, but you lacked opportunity. Not that I speak because of lack, for I have learned in whatever state I am, to be content in it. I know how to be humbled, and I know also how to abound. In everything and in all things I have learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in need. I can do all things through Christ, who strengthens me. However you did well that you shared in my affliction. You yourselves also know, you Philippians, that in the beginning of the Good News, when I departed from Macedonia, no assembly shared with me in the matter of giving and receiving but you only. For even in Thessalonica you sent once and again to my need. Not that I seek for the gift, but I seek for the fruit that increases to your account. But I have all things, and abound. I am filled, having received from Epaphroditus the things that came from you, a sweet-smelling fragrance, an acceptable and well-pleasing sacrifice to God. My God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus. Now to our God and Father be the glory forever and ever! Amen. Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me greet you. All the saints greet you, especially those who are of Caesar’s household. The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus, nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ obuah pilih jadin rasul Kristus Yesus, nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.   Salam geh soꞌ Timotius deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus samah kodaꞌ otoꞌ.

verses.text: to the saints and faithful brothers in Christ at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih nulis sulat itih tuduꞌ ingan madih ayua deꞌ Kolose, deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ duoh deꞌ totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.   Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: We give thanks to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,  having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which you have toward all the saints,
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih moꞌ ngojit nang ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus duoh ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, noh leh ngan takal koꞌih bidoa saꞌan ingan, koꞌih mala bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Samaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the Good News,
verses.source_translation: Ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus duoh ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e ingan bialap tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nyidia Topaꞌ saꞌan ingan daang siluga.   Ingan moꞌ ngojit tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ alap ingan inoh takal Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ bonal obuah tanon tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: which has come to you; even as it is in all the world and is bearing fruit and growing, as it does in you also, since the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth;
verses.source_translation: Gah deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ inoh moꞌ popah tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daang dunia, yohmoꞌ idip nyaꞌa obuah bilokat odaꞌ gah inoh.   Samah kodaꞌ ingan obuah bilokat soꞌ takal ingan ngojit tentang pilasiꞌ Topaꞌ, ingan moꞌ bonal-bonal nunaꞌ-e.

verses.text: even as you learned of Epaphras our beloved fellow servant, who is a faithful servant of Christ on our behalf,
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ ingan puꞌan soꞌ Epafras.   Iyoh inoh dingan koꞌih, deꞌ sukup koꞌih ngibalaꞌ-e, deꞌ samah-samah jadin ulun duoh koꞌih.   Iyoh pilayan Kristus deꞌ totap telus nai kiloja Topaꞌ saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: who also declared to us your love in the Spirit.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ iyoh leh koꞌih ngojit nang pakai kuasa deꞌ soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, ingan tapod samah oni ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For this cause, we also, since the day we heard this, don’t cease praying and making requests for you, that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ takal koꞌih ngojit gah tentang ingan inoh leh koꞌih mala bidoa saꞌan ingan.   Koꞌih mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ ngin bijak ponai tuduꞌ ingan duoh odaꞌ ingan puꞌan sipunuaꞌ-e oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: that you may walk worthily of the Lord, to please him in all respects, bearing fruit in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, ingan dapod idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, duoh silalu nyonang otin-E, saꞌ-e daang suaꞌ pingunai ingan ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh nog soꞌ-o.   Ingan moꞌ makin bitamah-tamah piluh tentang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: strengthened with all power, according to the might of his glory, for all endurance and perseverance with joy;
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin kuasa deꞌ ayuh odaꞌ ingan dolas saꞌ ingan taan naan susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah ingan pakai kila deꞌ sabal duoh diꞌ nyeꞌ mulah yaꞌ nyelah,

verses.text: giving thanks to the Father, who made us fit to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light;
verses.source_translation: duoh bisukul daang kila deꞌ doon tuduꞌ Samaꞌ, dop-e Iyoh inoh leh Samaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ ingan patut soꞌon oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nyidia Topaꞌ saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ-E daang pilitah-E deꞌ jawaꞌ.

verses.text: who delivered us out of the power of darkness, and translated us into the Kingdom of the Son of his love;
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ kuasa deꞌ jaꞌat yohmoꞌ alih otoꞌ odaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Onak-E deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E, Laja otoꞌ.

verses.text: in whom we have our redemption, the forgiveness of our sins;
verses.source_translation: Onak-E inoh leh deꞌ moꞌ nubuas pilopas otoꞌ, loti-e dosa-dosa otoꞌ moꞌ obuah ngapun.

verses.text: who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ idoh diꞌ toꞌ kilin-E, pak-e otoꞌ kilin Onak-E deꞌ pinuan, asal otoꞌ kilin Onak pinuan-E, loti-e otoꞌ moꞌ kilin Topaꞌ.   Onak pinuan-E inohleh deꞌ militah suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For by him all things were created, in the heavens and on the earth, things visible and things invisible, whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers; all things have been created through him, and for him.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e pakai Iyoh leh Topaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ siluga duoh deꞌ dunia, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tonga duoh deꞌ diꞌ-e tonga, wat inoh geh suaꞌ gamut deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa duoh deꞌ militah.   Topaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ pakai Kristus saꞌan Kristus.

verses.text: He is before all things, and in him all things are held together.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh moꞌ dioꞌ ogiꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ, duoh Iyoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ masim-masim ogiꞌ deꞌ topat-e.

verses.text: He is the head of the body, the assembly, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence.
verses.source_translation: Kristus leh deꞌ jadin bak saꞌan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, deꞌ jadin gonan-E.   Iyoh leh deꞌ sibungas-e jadin puꞌun, deꞌ pinuan, deꞌ sibungas-e paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kobos, saꞌ Iyoh sadiꞌ-E deꞌ jadin paling penting soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ.

verses.text: For all the fullness was pleased to dwell in him;
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ sonang otin-E odaꞌ odop-E bonal-bonal ogiꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e daang Kristus.

verses.text: and through him to reconcile all things to himself, by him, whether things on the earth, or things in the heavens, having made peace through the blood of his cross.
verses.source_translation: Ngan Onak-E inoh leh Topaꞌ moꞌ notap odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ bidamai duoh odop-E, bait duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ dunia, bait duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ siluga pakai doyaꞌ Kristus deꞌ salip.

verses.text: You, being in past times alienated and enemies in your mind in your evil deeds,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ ingan idip juuaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Ingan bitomi duoh-E, dop-e pikil duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan jaꞌat.

verses.text: yet now he has reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and without defect and blameless before him,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin ngan pingobos Onak-E deꞌ moꞌ jadin manusia, Topaꞌ paliꞌ bidamai duoh ingan.   Wat inoh leh wat-e ngan-E odaꞌ ingan bisig soꞌ dosa duoh doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dapod yaꞌ nyalah ingan deꞌ sulung jowin-E.

verses.text: if it is so that you continue in the faith, grounded and steadfast, and not moved away from the hope of the Good News which you heard, which is being proclaimed in all creation under heaven; of which I, Paul, was made a servant.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan halus totap bisayaꞌ, togap daang bisayaꞌ-e, diꞌ-e tiligian soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ alap ingan, deꞌ ngin-E takal ingan tilimaꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Gah inoh moꞌ obuah magah tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa daang dunia.   Okuꞌ, Paulus, moꞌ jadin kuli tukang magah Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh.

verses.text: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and fill up on my part that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body’s sake, which is the assembly;
verses.source_translation: Adin okuꞌ sonang ngan kuꞌ susah jolaꞌ, dop-e susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah okuꞌ ngan kuꞌ tulung ingan.   Susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon gonan kuꞌ ngan okuꞌ nyukup susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon Kristus saꞌan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ jadin gonan Kristus.

verses.text: of which I was made a servant, according to the stewardship of God which was given me toward you, to fulfill the word of God,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ nai kiloja jadin pilayan saꞌan uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.   Okuꞌ halus tanon suaꞌ Pingunang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: the mystery which has been hidden for ages and generations. But now it has been revealed to his saints,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ tian-tian itih soꞌ joman keꞌ joman, soꞌ sumuk babai nog onak sukun aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e, pak-e adin Iyoh moꞌ bitanga tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ-E.

verses.text: to whom God was pleased to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory;
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ bitanga oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-a puꞌan nang bilokat duoh kuasa soꞌ Kristus deꞌ sukup-sukup ayuh-e obuah ngin geh tuduꞌ ingan deꞌ soꞌ bangsa-bangsa deꞌ bokon.   Oniꞌ deꞌ tanon Topaꞌ inoh yohleh tentang Kristus ogiꞌ daang ingan, loti-e Kristus deꞌ jamen saꞌ ingan suwaꞌ ngoon kuasa-E deꞌ ayuh.

verses.text: whom we proclaim, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus;
verses.source_translation: Kristus inoh leh deꞌ magah koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan, suaꞌ nyaꞌa koꞌih sibaya-e, koꞌih ngajal-e pakai bijak ponai, saꞌ koꞌih dapod toban nyaꞌa keꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ tuꞌuh daang bisayaꞌ-e, dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus.

verses.text: for which I also labor, striving according to his working, which works in me mightily.

chapters.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the saints and faithful brothers in Christ at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
