We give thanks to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you, having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which you have toward all the saints, because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the Good News, which has come to you; even as it is in all the world and is bearing fruit and growing, as it does in you also, since the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth; even as you learned of Epaphras our beloved fellow servant, who is a faithful servant of Christ on our behalf, who also declared to us your love in the Spirit. For this cause, we also, since the day we heard this, don’t cease praying and making requests for you, that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding, that you may walk worthily of the Lord, to please him in all respects, bearing fruit in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God; strengthened with all power, according to the might of his glory, for all endurance and perseverance with joy; giving thanks to the Father, who made us fit to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light; who delivered us out of the power of darkness, and translated us into the Kingdom of the Son of his love; in whom we have our redemption, the forgiveness of our sins; who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation. For by him all things were created, in the heavens and on the earth, things visible and things invisible, whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers; all things have been created through him, and for him. He is before all things, and in him all things are held together. He is the head of the body, the assembly, who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence. For all the fullness was pleased to dwell in him; and through him to reconcile all things to himself, by him, whether things on the earth, or things in the heavens, having made peace through the blood of his cross. You, being in past times alienated and enemies in your mind in your evil deeds, yet now he has reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and without defect and blameless before him, if it is so that you continue in the faith, grounded and steadfast, and not moved away from the hope of the Good News which you heard, which is being proclaimed in all creation under heaven; of which I, Paul, was made a servant. Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and fill up on my part that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body’s sake, which is the assembly; of which I was made a servant, according to the stewardship of God which was given me toward you, to fulfill the word of God, the mystery which has been hidden for ages and generations. But now it has been revealed to his saints, to whom God was pleased to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory; whom we proclaim, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus; for which I also labor, striving according to his working, which works in me mightily.

verses.text: For I desire to have you know how greatly I struggle for you, and for those at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ odaꞌ ingan puꞌan-e, okuꞌ kiloja ulih-ulih saꞌan ingan duoh saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ Laodikia, baya suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e bitapod duoh okuꞌ.

verses.text: that their hearts may be comforted, they being knit together in love, and gaining all riches of the full assurance of understanding, that they may know the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ,
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ nai deꞌ wat inoh saꞌ otin odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ obuah ngilibul duoh samah-samah ngibalaꞌ, saꞌ-e idip tikuluk jadin niꞌ.   Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal ngiloti duoh bisayaꞌ baya puꞌan oni deꞌ yaꞌ nai Topaꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e, yohleh tentang Kristus.

verses.text: in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ nyikon suaꞌ halta bijak ponai jok-e daang Kristus, saꞌ otoꞌ dapod puꞌan tentang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Now this I say that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tiꞌ-e tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ diꞌ ingan obuah nipu odaꞌ osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ maꞌ in-e ponai nang oniꞌ odaꞌ in deꞌ bonal in-e.

verses.text: For though I am absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, rejoicing and seeing your order, and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e bial-e okuꞌ doiꞌ deꞌ uluk ingan, pak-e kila kuꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan.   Okuꞌ doon ningaꞌ idip ingan deꞌ tiatul duoh totap togap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: As therefore you received Christ Jesus, the Lord, walk in him,
verses.source_translation: Adin ingan moꞌ tilimaꞌ Kristus Yesus jadin Topaꞌ ingan, ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh ingan halus totap idip niꞌ duoh Iyoh.

verses.text: rooted and built up in him, and established in the faith, even as you were taught, abounding in it in thanksgiving.
verses.source_translation: Ingan halus bisayaꞌ togap tuduꞌ Iyoh, samah kodaꞌ aat tongon koyuh deꞌ tumuꞌ tuluap kaang tanaꞌ.   Ingan halus bialap jok-e tuduꞌ Iyoh, kodaꞌ boli deꞌ kajuag nyaꞌa deꞌ tun tuguꞌ deꞌ togap.   Yohmoꞌ ingan halus bisayaꞌ lobih togap lagiꞌ tuduꞌ Iyoh, nunaꞌ suaꞌ ajal deꞌ moꞌ tilimaꞌ ingan.   Ingan halus telus bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Be careful that you don’t let anyone rob you through his philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the elements of the world, and not after Christ.
verses.source_translation: Ati-ati duoh sina pibulaꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa, maꞌ yaꞌ pogo tuduꞌ sina deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e duoh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal.   Pingunang deꞌ munoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ Kristus pak-e soꞌ buaꞌ pikil manusia soꞌ joman keꞌ joman duoh soꞌ gamut-gamut deꞌ nguasa dunia.

verses.text: For in him all the fullness of the Deity dwells bodily,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Kristus inoh sipunuaꞌ-E Topaꞌ, deꞌ moꞌ jadin manusia.

verses.text: and in him you are made full, who is the head of all principality and power;
verses.source_translation: Ngan ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus, ingan soꞌon idip sipunuaꞌ-e.   Kristus deꞌ jadin bak soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e duoh soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ militah.

verses.text: in whom you were also circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands, in the putting off of the body of the sins of the flesh, in the circumcision of Christ;
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ingan moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus, ingan moꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ obuah bisunat, idoh diꞌ-e bisunat deꞌ nai manusia, pak-e bisunat deꞌ nai Kristus.   Bisunat deꞌ nai Kristus inoh loti-e Kristus pilopas otoꞌ soꞌ idip deꞌ dioꞌ deꞌ bidosa.

verses.text: having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e takal ingan obuah baptis, idip ingan deꞌ dioꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ dosa moꞌ obuah ngubul samah-samah duoh Kristus.   Takal Kristus paliꞌ idip, ingan tuang suwaꞌ geh samah-samah paliꞌ obuah kidip duoh Kristus, idip ingan moꞌ jadin baꞌuh.   Oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jadin wat inoh dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ deꞌ kuasa Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ idip soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: You were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh. He made you alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses,
verses.source_translation: Wat noh geh duoh ingan, noꞌuh-e ingan moꞌ juuaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ dop-e ingan moꞌ bidosa duoh diꞌ ingan bisunat gonan ingan.   Pak-e adin Topaꞌ paliꞌ kidip ingan samah-samah duoh Kristus.   Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun suaꞌ dosa otoꞌ,

verses.text: wiping out the handwriting in ordinances which was against us; and he has taken it out of the way, nailing it to the cross;
verses.source_translation: kodaꞌ nyaꞌa ngisuꞌ tang deꞌ nulis-e, deꞌ ponai odaꞌ nyaꞌa inoh yaꞌ obuah ukum deꞌ baat.   Yesus moꞌ kobos deꞌ tun salip, ngan-e ngisuꞌ tang dosa otoꞌ.

verses.text: having stripped the principalities and the powers, he made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ tun salip inoh, Kristus odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ militah jadin doiꞌ kuasa-e.   Kristus odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ obuah pidasaꞌ takal Kristus monang.

verses.text: Let no one therefore judge you in eating, or in drinking, or with respect to a feast day or a new moon or a Sabbath day,
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan nyeꞌ maꞌ yaꞌ tanah odaꞌ nyaꞌa nyalah tentang oniꞌ deꞌ man, deꞌ nuak ingan.   Maꞌ yaꞌ tanah odaꞌ nyaꞌa nyalah ingan tentang onu-onu ayuh, onu ayuh puꞌun bulan, atou onu Sabat agama Yahudi.

verses.text: which are a shadow of the things to come; but the body is Christ’s.
verses.source_translation: Atulan deꞌ munoꞌ madas kodaꞌ sibamia soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ tok deꞌ halus jadi.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi daang odop Kristus.

verses.text: Let no one rob you of your prize by a voluntary humility and worshiping of the angels, dwelling in the things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ ingan yaꞌ tanah odaꞌ nyaꞌa pilugi ingan pakai pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ pidouꞌ odop-e duoh nyomah malaikat-malaikat.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ samuh jok-e pikil oniꞌ deꞌ dunia.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ bilagah odop-e ponai kilin oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon ponai kilin-e.

verses.text: and not holding firmly to the Head, from whom all the body, being supplied and knit together through the joints and ligaments, grows with God’s growth.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ-e bikagong tuduꞌ Kristus deꞌ jadin bak.   Kodaꞌ bak deꞌ mipin gonan-e deꞌ obuah piala duoh bijamit odaꞌ aat-aat-e baya bukun-bukun tulang-e jadin makin ayuh, wat inoh geh Kristus mipin suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ jadin gonan-E makin ayuh nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: If you died with Christ from the elements of the world, why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to ordinances,
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ kobos samah-samah duoh Kristus, ingan moꞌ obuah pilopas soꞌ suaꞌ gamut deꞌ nguasa dunia itih.   Adin oni nai ingan idip kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ tunuak duoh atulan-atulan dunia deꞌ in-e:

verses.text: “Don’t handle, nor taste, nor touch”
verses.source_translation: “Maꞌ kagong itih inoh”, “Maꞌ kiꞌan itih inoh”, “Maꞌ tomaꞌ itih inoh.   ”?

verses.text: (all of which perish with use), according to the precepts and doctrines of men?
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ atulan deꞌ munoꞌ tentang oniꞌ deꞌ mokuaꞌ nyeꞌ pakai-e, diꞌ nyeꞌ tiyaꞌ ponai yaꞌ pakai-e.   Inoh jok-e atulan-atulan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal manusia.

verses.text: Which things indeed appear like wisdom in self-imposed worship, and humility, and severity to the body; but aren’t of any value against the indulgence of the flesh.

chapters.text: For I desire to have you know how greatly I struggle for you, and for those at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh; that their hearts may be comforted, they being knit together in love, and gaining all riches of the full assurance of understanding, that they may know the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ, in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden. Now this I say that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech. For though I am absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, rejoicing and seeing your order, and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ. As therefore you received Christ Jesus, the Lord, walk in him, rooted and built up in him, and established in the faith, even as you were taught, abounding in it in thanksgiving. Be careful that you don’t let anyone rob you through his philosophy and vain deceit, after the tradition of men, after the elements of the world, and not after Christ. For in him all the fullness of the Deity dwells bodily, and in him you are made full, who is the head of all principality and power; in whom you were also circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands, in the putting off of the body of the sins of the flesh, in the circumcision of Christ; having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead. You were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh. He made you alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses, wiping out the handwriting in ordinances which was against us; and he has taken it out of the way, nailing it to the cross; having stripped the principalities and the powers, he made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it. Let no one therefore judge you in eating, or in drinking, or with respect to a feast day or a new moon or a Sabbath day, which are a shadow of the things to come; but the body is Christ’s. Let no one rob you of your prize by a voluntary humility and worshiping of the angels, dwelling in the things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind, and not holding firmly to the Head, from whom all the body, being supplied and knit together through the joints and ligaments, grows with God’s growth. If you died with Christ from the elements of the world, why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to ordinances, “Don’t handle, nor taste, nor touch” (all of which perish with use), according to the precepts and doctrines of men? Which things indeed appear like wisdom in self-imposed worship, and humility, and severity to the body; but aren’t of any value against the indulgence of the flesh.

verses.text: If then you were raised together with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated on the right hand of God.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ ingan paliꞌ idip samah-samah duoh Kristus.   Inohleh ngan ingan halus kagaꞌ yaꞌ soꞌon suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ siluga, topat soꞌ Kristus militah samah-samah duoh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Set your mind on the things that are above, not on the things that are on the earth.
verses.source_translation: Ingan sipatut-e pikil suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daang siluga, maꞌ yaꞌ jok nyeꞌ pikil oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia.

verses.text: For you died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e idip ingan deꞌ oma moꞌ kobos, yohmoꞌ idip ingan deꞌ baꞌuh duoh Kristus moꞌ obuah nyikon odaꞌ Topaꞌ sa'an ingan.

verses.text: When Christ, our life, is revealed, then you will also be revealed with him in glory.
verses.source_translation: Takal Kristus deꞌ jadin puꞌun pingidip otoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ nog, ingan tuang suwaꞌ geh samah-samah duoh Iyoh daang jawaꞌ deꞌ telang.

verses.text: Put to death therefore your members which are on the earth: sexual immorality, uncleanness, depraved passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry;
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, ngabos leh suaꞌ niat dunia deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ ogiꞌ daang kila ingan, kodaꞌ ngaso nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop-e, nai oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e sinunuh, oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e kodaꞌ binatang, niat deꞌ jaꞌat, duoh pinganguak samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nyomah tipaduaꞌ.

verses.text: for which things’ sake the wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience.
verses.source_translation: Luban oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh leh Topaꞌ yaꞌ ulih-ulih tiwas tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e nunaꞌ pingunang-E.

verses.text: You also once walked in those, when you lived in them;
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ ingan tuang nai ingan geh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ, takal idip ingan obuah nguasa odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: but now you also put them all away: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and shameful speaking out of your mouth.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin ingan halus tolan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat itih: malah, tiwas deꞌ nyaꞌa, buꞌui deꞌ nyaꞌa, pijaꞌat nyaꞌa duoh nang sina bigunyak.

verses.text: Don’t lie to one another, seeing that you have put off the old man with his doings,
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ tiyaꞌ ingan yaꞌ mogo siodop ingan, dop-e idip ingan deꞌ oma duoh pingunai ingan deꞌ oma, ingan moꞌ kadi-e duoh tolan-e.

verses.text: and have put on the new man, who is being renewed in knowledge after the image of his Creator,
verses.source_translation: Adin ingan moꞌ pakai idip deꞌ baꞌuh.   Idip ingan deꞌ baꞌuh inoh telus sijaꞌ-a obuah ngubah jadin samah kodaꞌ Topaꞌ.   Topaꞌ nai wat inoh saꞌ ingan ponai piluh Topaꞌ sipunuaꞌ-e.

verses.text: where there can’t be Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondservant, freeman; but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.source_translation: Daang idip deꞌ baꞌuh itih, doiꞌ tiyaꞌ deꞌ nang nyeꞌ ulang Yunani atou ulang Yahudi, nyaꞌa deꞌ bisunat atou nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisunat, nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ adat-e atou nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ adat-e, ulun atou diꞌ-e ulun, dop-e Kristus leh deꞌ paling penting-e soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ.   Iyoh moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ!

verses.text: Put on therefore, as God’s chosen ones, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, humility, and perseverance;
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, ingan moꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Topaꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E.   Inoh leh ngan ingan halus bitanga pilasiꞌ, paguh otin, pidouꞌ odop nyeꞌ, piduli duoh kila nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, duoh taan naan idip jolaꞌ.

verses.text: bearing with one another, and forgiving each other, if any man has a complaint against any; even as Christ forgave you, so you also do.
verses.source_translation: Ingan halus sabal duoh siodop ingan.   Ingan halus ngapun nyaꞌa deꞌ nai salah duoh ingan.   Samah kodaꞌ Topaꞌ moꞌ ngapun ingan, ingan halus wat noh geh.

verses.text: Above all these things, walk in love, which is the bond of perfection.
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ deꞌ paling penting soꞌ suaꞌ-e deꞌ mutiꞌ, ingan halus bitanga nang ingan ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan deꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ ingan bonal-bonal idip tikuluk jadin niꞌ.

verses.text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which also you were called in one body; and be thankful.
verses.source_translation: Tanah saꞌ idip bidanah deꞌ soꞌ Kristus militah daang otin ingan.   Dop-e Topaꞌ mogan ingan odaꞌ niꞌ gonan saꞌ ingan idip bidanah.   Wat inoh geh Ingan halus bisukul tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly; in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your heart to the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Odaꞌ leh pingunang Kristus totap ogiꞌ sipunuaꞌ daang kila ingan, saꞌ ingan pakai suaꞌ bijak ponai ngan ingan ngajal duoh ngalah siodop ingan.   Nai leh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ simadi nyeꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ daang otin ingan pakai ngilagu lagu soꞌ Mazmur, soꞌ buk lagu, duoh pakai lagu soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Whatever you do, in word or in deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father, through him.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai duoh deꞌ nang ingan, nai leh suaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ pakai adon Topaꞌ Yesus.   Bisukul leh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, Samaꞌ otoꞌ saꞌan oni deꞌ moꞌ nai Yesus saꞌan otoꞌ.

verses.text: Wives, be in subjection to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Oi ingan bala sowon, tunuak leh tuduꞌ bonon ingan, nunaꞌ wat deꞌ patut ingan deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives, and don’t be bitter against them.
verses.source_translation: Oi ingan bala bonon, ngibalaꞌ leh sowon ingan, maꞌ yaꞌ gaus duoh-e.

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this pleases the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Oi ingan deꞌ jadin onak, daang suaꞌ oniꞌ, nunaꞌ leh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal pingoma ingan tuduꞌ ingan, dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ otin Topaꞌ sonang.

verses.text: Fathers, don’t provoke your children, so that they won’t be discouraged.
verses.source_translation: Oi ingan bala samaꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ kanam kila onak opot ingan odaꞌ yoh bonguak, jak-e pikil nang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e salah.

verses.text: Servants, obey in all things those who are your masters according to the flesh, not just when they are looking, as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing God.
verses.source_translation: Oi ingan deꞌ bala ulun, daang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan, taat leh tuduꞌ tuan ingan daang dunia itih, maꞌ yaꞌ jok-e deꞌ sulung jowin-e sijaꞌ-e ngan nyeꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ kila-e sonang, pak-e nai negeh suaꞌ oniꞌ pakai otin deꞌ bisig dop-e ingan pimodo deꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: And whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord, and not for men,
verses.source_translation: Oni sijaꞌ-e deꞌ nai ingan, nai negeh ngan suaꞌ otin ingan kodaꞌ ingan nai saꞌan Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e saꞌan manusia.

verses.text: knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; for you serve the Lord Christ.
verses.source_translation: Natong nyeꞌ, ingan yaꞌ soꞌon upah soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Oni deꞌ moꞌ sidia Topaꞌ saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, inoh leh deꞌ yaꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ ingan.   Dop-e toke deꞌ sibonal-e deꞌ obuah layan odaꞌ ingan, yohleh Kristus.

verses.text: But he who does wrong will receive again for the wrong that he has done, and there is no partiality.

chapters.text: If then you were raised together with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated on the right hand of God. Set your mind on the things that are above, not on the things that are on the earth. For you died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God. When Christ, our life, is revealed, then you will also be revealed with him in glory. Put to death therefore your members which are on the earth: sexual immorality, uncleanness, depraved passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry; for which things’ sake the wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience. You also once walked in those, when you lived in them; but now you also put them all away: anger, wrath, malice, slander, and shameful speaking out of your mouth. Don’t lie to one another, seeing that you have put off the old man with his doings, and have put on the new man, who is being renewed in knowledge after the image of his Creator, where there can’t be Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondservant, freeman; but Christ is all, and in all. Put on therefore, as God’s chosen ones, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, humility, and perseverance; bearing with one another, and forgiving each other, if any man has a complaint against any; even as Christ forgave you, so you also do. Above all these things, walk in love, which is the bond of perfection. And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which also you were called in one body; and be thankful. Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly; in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your heart to the Lord. Whatever you do, in word or in deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father, through him. Wives, be in subjection to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord. Husbands, love your wives, and don’t be bitter against them. Children, obey your parents in all things, for this pleases the Lord. Fathers, don’t provoke your children, so that they won’t be discouraged. Servants, obey in all things those who are your masters according to the flesh, not just when they are looking, as men pleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing God. And whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord, and not for men, knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; for you serve the Lord Christ. But he who does wrong will receive again for the wrong that he has done, and there is no partiality.

verses.text: Masters, give to your servants that which is just and equal, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.
verses.source_translation: Oi ingan bala toke, maꞌ yaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ adil duoh diꞌ nyeꞌ jujul tuduꞌ kuli ingan.   Natong nyeꞌ ingan tuang ogiꞌ geh toke ingan deꞌ siluga.

verses.text: Continue steadfastly in prayer, watching therein with thanksgiving;
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ buwon-buwon bidoa duoh silalu jaga-jaga, simadi nyeꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: praying together for us also, that God may open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds;
verses.source_translation: Bidoa geh saꞌan koꞌih, saꞌ Topaꞌ bukaꞌ olan ngan koꞌih magah gah deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa puꞌan-e soꞌ Topaꞌ tentang Kristus.   Inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ obuah jel adin.

verses.text: that I may reveal it as I ought to speak.
verses.source_translation: Bidoa leh saꞌ okuꞌ dapod nelang gah inoh saꞌ nyaꞌa dapod ngiloti-e, kodaꞌ deꞌ halus okuꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time.
verses.source_translation: Idip nyeꞌ halus bijak tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ.   Pakai leh suaꞌ onu deꞌ ogiꞌ ngan nyeꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each one.
verses.source_translation: Nang leh pingunang deꞌ silalu punuaꞌ pilasiꞌ duoh deꞌ paguh in nyaꞌa ngojit-e, saꞌ nyaꞌa dapod tilimaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan.   Ingan halus puꞌan oni in ingan yaꞌ nyawot tibilang oniꞌ deꞌ sikian nyaꞌa.

verses.text: All my affairs will be made known to you by Tychicus, the beloved brother, faithful servant, and fellow bondservant in the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Tikhikus, madih deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan suaꞌ oniꞌ tentang okuꞌ.   Tikhikus itih nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ sidoh-e loꞌo ngan-e nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ samah-samah duoh koꞌih.

verses.text: I am sending him to you for this very purpose, that he may know your circumstances and comfort your hearts,
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ pait iyoh tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ ingan puꞌan geh gah soꞌ koꞌih, oni deꞌ moꞌ ngoon koꞌih duoh saꞌ iyoh ngilibul kila ingan.

verses.text: together with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you everything that is going on here.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ odaꞌ odop-e duwoh Onesimus, deꞌ soꞌ uluk odop ingan, madih otoꞌ deꞌ totap ngibalaꞌ koꞌih duoh deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih.   Odop-e deꞌ duwoh yaꞌ tanon tuduꞌ ingan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi datiꞌ.

verses.text: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, greets you, and Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (concerning whom you received commandments, “if he comes to you, receive him”),
verses.source_translation: Aristarkhus deꞌ ogiꞌ daang jel samah-samah duoh okuꞌ, pait salam tuduꞌ ingan, wat noh geh Markus, madih sepupu Barnabas.   Ingan moꞌ obuah sibaya sodiꞌ-e, simoꞌ Markus nog tuduꞌ ingan, ingan nyamut-e.

verses.text: and Jesus who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for God’s Kingdom who are of the circumcision, men who have been a comfort to me.
verses.source_translation: Salam geh soꞌ Yesus deꞌ adon-e geh Yustus.   Jok-e odop-e deꞌ taluh inoh deꞌ ulang Yahudi deꞌ jadin dingan kuꞌ deꞌ nai kiloja samah-samah duoh okuꞌ ngan-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ tulung ngilibul kila kuꞌ.

verses.text: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, salutes you, always striving for you in his prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ Epafras.   Iyoh itih soꞌ uluk odop ingan, iyoh kuli Kristus Yesus deꞌ silalu tutug bidoa saꞌan ingan.   Iyoh ulih-ulih mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ ingan bonal-bonal togap bisayaꞌ, jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ tuꞌuh, saꞌ ingan bisayaꞌ punuaꞌ ngan ingan nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For I testify about him, that he has great zeal for you, and for those in Laodicea, and for those in Hierapolis.
verses.source_translation: Odop kuꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ningaꞌ nang iyoh moꞌ ulih-ulih kiloja saꞌan ingan, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ Laodikia duoh Hierapolis.

verses.text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas greet you.
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ Dokter Lukas deꞌ obuah ngibalaꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ duoh salam soꞌ Demas saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: Greet the brothers who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the assembly that is in his house.
verses.source_translation: Tanon salam soꞌ koꞌih tuduꞌ madih ayua deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus deꞌ Laodikia, tanon geh salam koꞌih tuduꞌ Nimfa duoh uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus deꞌ mala tikuluk simayang deꞌ boli-e.

verses.text: When this letter has been read among you, cause it to be read also in the assembly of the Laodiceans; and that you also read the letter from Laodicea.
verses.source_translation: Takal sulat itih moꞌ obuah basa daang uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Kolose, ingan halus pait sulat itih tuduꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Laodikia saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ basa-e.   Wat inoh geh ingan halus basa sulat soꞌ okuꞌ deꞌ obuah pait tuduꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Laodikia deꞌ pait-e tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: Tell Archippus, “Take heed to the ministry which you have received in the Lord, that you fulfill it.”
verses.source_translation: Nyeꞌ moꞌ tanon geh tuduꞌ Arkhipus, “Pijadi leh tugas deꞌ moꞌ obuah ngin tuduꞌ muꞌu ngan nyeꞌ layan Topaꞌ.   ”

verses.text: The salutation of me, Paul, with my own hand: remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus.   Tongan odop kuꞌ deꞌ nulis salam itih.   Maꞌ komut nang okuꞌ daang jel.   Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus ngin bilokat tuduꞌ ingan.   Salam soꞌ koꞌih, Paulus duoh Timotius      TESALONIKA

chapters.text: Masters, give to your servants that which is just and equal, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven. Continue steadfastly in prayer, watching therein with thanksgiving; praying together for us also, that God may open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds; that I may reveal it as I ought to speak. Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, redeeming the time. Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each one. All my affairs will be made known to you by Tychicus, the beloved brother, faithful servant, and fellow bondservant in the Lord. I am sending him to you for this very purpose, that he may know your circumstances and comfort your hearts, together with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you everything that is going on here. Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, greets you, and Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (concerning whom you received commandments, “if he comes to you, receive him”), and Jesus who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for God’s Kingdom who are of the circumcision, men who have been a comfort to me. Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, salutes you, always striving for you in his prayers, that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God. For I testify about him, that he has great zeal for you, and for those in Laodicea, and for those in Hierapolis. Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas greet you. Greet the brothers who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the assembly that is in his house. When this letter has been read among you, cause it to be read also in the assembly of the Laodiceans; and that you also read the letter from Laodicea. Tell Archippus, “Take heed to the ministry which you have received in the Lord, that you fulfill it.” The salutation of me, Paul, with my own hand: remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.

verses.text: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the assembly of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ koꞌih taluh, Paulus, Timotius duoh Silas, tuduꞌ uluk ulang bisayaꞌ deꞌ Tesalonika deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh deꞌ kakuꞌ Yesus Kristus Topaꞌ.   Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ duoh Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: We always give thanks to God for all of you, mentioning you in our prayers,
remembering without ceasing your work of faith and labor of love and perseverance of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ, before our God and Father.
We know, brothers loved by God, that you are chosen,
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, koꞌih puꞌan nang Topaꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan, Iyoh moꞌ pilih ingan odaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ jok-e Yoh deꞌ kakuꞌ.

verses.text: and that our Good News came to you not in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Spirit, and with much assurance. You know what kind of men we showed ourselves to be among you for your sake.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih tanon Gah deꞌ Paguh tuduꞌ ingan idoh diꞌ-e jok-e pakai sina sijaꞌ-e, pak-e pakai kuasa duoh pakai Iyang Topaꞌ.   Koꞌih sukup bisayaꞌ nang Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ inoh pasti bonal.   Ingan moꞌ puꞌan watki wat pingidip koꞌih, takal koꞌih samah-samah duoh ingan.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai koꞌih, koꞌih nai saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: You became imitators of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Spirit,
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ nunaꞌ tilodan koꞌih duoh tilodan Topaꞌ.   Bial-e jolaꞌ, ingan tilimaꞌ gah deꞌ tanon koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan daang ingan doon.   Dop-e deꞌ odaꞌ ingan doon inoh Iyang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: so that you became an example to all who believe in Macedonia and in Achaia.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, ingan moꞌ jadin soto saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus deꞌ Makedonia duoh deꞌ Akhaya.

verses.text: For from you the word of the Lord has been declared, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith toward God has gone out; so that we need not to say anything.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e mulai soꞌ ingan gah tentang Topaꞌ moꞌ popah nog Makedonia duoh Akhaya, idoh diꞌ-e jok-e inoh, pak-e gah oni wat pingidip ingan deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ tuang moꞌ nog katiꞌ kanih geh, yoh ngan diꞌ koꞌih tiyaꞌ pilelu tanon-e.

verses.text: For they themselves report concerning us what kind of a reception we had from you; and how you turned to God from idols, to serve a living and true God,
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ kilakal-e nang ingan deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ tilimaꞌ koꞌih, takal koꞌih dioꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kilakal watki wat ingan diꞌ ingan tiyaꞌ nyomah tipaduaꞌ, ingan moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ idip, deꞌ jok-e niꞌ ngan ingan yaꞌ nyomah-E.

verses.text: and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead—Jesus, who delivers us from the wrath to come.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ kilakal gah watki wat ingan bialap kajon Onak Topaꞌ nog soꞌ siluga.   Iyoh inoh Yesus Kristus deꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E.   Yesus inoh geh deꞌ nyilamat otoꞌ soꞌ ukum Topaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog.

chapters.text: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the assembly of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. We always give thanks to God for all of you, mentioning you in our prayers, remembering without ceasing your work of faith and labor of love and perseverance of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ, before our God and Father. We know, brothers loved by God, that you are chosen, and that our Good News came to you not in word only, but also in power, and in the Holy Spirit, and with much assurance. You know what kind of men we showed ourselves to be among you for your sake. You became imitators of us, and of the Lord, having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the Holy Spirit, so that you became an example to all who believe in Macedonia and in Achaia. For from you the word of the Lord has been declared, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but also in every place your faith toward God has gone out; so that we need not to say anything. For they themselves report concerning us what kind of a reception we had from you; and how you turned to God from idols, to serve a living and true God, and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead—Jesus, who delivers us from the wrath to come.

verses.text: For you yourselves know, brothers, our visit to you wasn’t in vain,
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, ingan moꞌ puꞌan takal koꞌih nog tuduꞌ ingan ogiꞌ guna-e.

verses.text: but having suffered before and been shamefully treated, as you know, at Philippi, we grew bold in our God to tell you the Good News of God in much conflict.
verses.source_translation: Ingan puꞌan takal koꞌih aluaꞌ diꞌ koꞌih nog tuduꞌ ingan deꞌ Tesalonika, koꞌih moꞌ obuah pijolaꞌ duoh adoh-adoh wat nyaꞌa tuduꞌ koꞌih deꞌ Filipi, pak-e bial-e bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan koꞌih, Topaꞌ otoꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih bilani magah tuduꞌ ingan Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For our exhortation is not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in deception.
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih tanon sibaya itih, idoh diꞌ-e ngan koꞌih yaꞌ odaꞌ ingan moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, doiꞌ koꞌih kalik oni-oni saꞌan odop koꞌih duoh idoh geh diꞌ-e ngan koꞌih yaꞌ ngakal ingan.

verses.text: But even as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the Good News, so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, who tests our hearts.
verses.source_translation: Idoh diꞌ koꞌih nang sina ngan koꞌih kanuas otin manusia, pak-e koꞌih yaꞌ kanuas otin Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ puꞌan isiꞌ otin koꞌih.   Odop Topaꞌ deꞌ ningaꞌ nang koꞌih patut magah Gah deꞌ Paguh itih.

verses.text: For neither were we at any time found using words of flattery, as you know, nor a cloak of covetousness (God is witness),
verses.source_translation: Kodaꞌ deꞌ puꞌan ingan, doiꞌ koꞌih nang sina deꞌ mosiaꞌ-mosiaꞌ ngan koꞌih kuab niat koꞌih kalik utung soꞌ ingan.   Topaꞌ deꞌ puꞌan.

verses.text: nor seeking glory from men (neither from you nor from others), when we might have claimed authority as apostles of Christ.
verses.source_translation: Idoh geh diꞌ koꞌih kalik pudi soꞌ manusia, bait soꞌ ingan, bait soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.   Sibonal-e koꞌih deꞌ jadin rasul Kristus soꞌon mitiaꞌ oni sijaꞌ-e soꞌ ingan.

verses.text: But we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother cherishes her own children.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e koꞌih nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh tuduꞌ ingan, samah kodaꞌ sinoꞌ somon onak-e duoh piala onak-e.

verses.text: Even so, affectionately longing for you, we were well pleased to impart to you, not the Good News of God only, but also our own souls, because you had become very dear to us.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e koꞌih ngibalaꞌ ingan, yohleh ngan koꞌih laꞌan toban Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Nak-e jok-e inoh, koꞌih tuang laꞌan koꞌih geh ngin idip koꞌih ngan koꞌih tulung ingan, dop-e koꞌih ngibalaꞌ ingan.

verses.text: For you remember, brothers, our labor and travail; for working night and day, that we might not burden any of you, we preached to you the Good News of God.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, totu ingan aluaꞌ natong wat ki wat koꞌih paan tulang ngan koꞌih kiloja singonu-singalom ngan koꞌih ngilaan idip koꞌih, saꞌ-e diꞌ-e nyusah osi sijaꞌ-e takal koꞌih magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: You are witnesses with God, how holy, righteously, and blamelessly we behaved ourselves toward you who believe.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ingan moꞌ ningaꞌ, wat inoh geh Topaꞌ, wat ki wat koꞌih idip bisig, idip tongon, duoh doiꞌ koꞌih nai salah, takal koꞌih idip samah-samah duoh ingan deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: As you know, we exhorted, comforted, and implored every one of you, as a father does his own children,
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ puꞌan nang koꞌih nai suaꞌ oniꞌ saꞌan ingan samah kodaꞌ samaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ saꞌan onak-e.

verses.text: to the end that you should walk worthily of God, who calls you into his own Kingdom and glory.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih diꞌ mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ nogap otin ingan, koꞌih moꞌ pajak ingan odaꞌ idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.   Dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ mogan ingan odaꞌ jadin umat-E duoh soꞌon pudi.

verses.text: For this cause we also thank God without ceasing, that, when you received from us the word of the message of God, you accepted it not as the word of men, but, as it is in truth, the word of God, which also works in you who believe.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan koꞌih mala bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ dop-e ingan moꞌ tilimaꞌ Pingunang Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ magah koꞌih, ingan tilimaꞌ nang gah inoh idoh diꞌ-e soꞌ manusia, pak-e gah deꞌ bonal-bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Pingunang Topaꞌ itih leh deꞌ ngubah idip ingan deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: For you, brothers, became imitators of the assemblies of God which are in Judea in Christ Jesus; for you also suffered the same things from your own countrymen, even as they did from the Jews;
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, oniꞌ deꞌ ngoon ingan, tuang moꞌ ngoon uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ Yudea deꞌ moꞌ kakuꞌ Kristus.   Ingan ngoon susah jolaꞌ odaꞌ bangsa odop ingan samah kodaꞌ deꞌ ngoon uluk nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ deꞌ Yudea, yoh susah jolaꞌ odaꞌ ulang-ulang Yahudi.

verses.text: who killed both the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and drove us out, and didn’t please God, and are contrary to all men;
verses.source_translation: Ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ ngabos Topaꞌ Yesus duoh nabi-nabi, adin yoh moꞌ pijolaꞌ koꞌih.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ buꞌui tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, Topaꞌ diꞌ-e sonang tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved; to fill up their sins always. But wrath has come on them to the uttermost.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jaman koꞌih magah tuduꞌ bangsa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi gah deꞌ tapod odaꞌ nyaꞌa silamat.   Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, ulang-ulang Yahudi deꞌ munoꞌ namah dosa-e odaꞌ lobih soꞌ deꞌ dapod Topaꞌ tilimaꞌ-e, adin Topaꞌ moꞌ ngukum-e dop-e Iyoh sikiya tiwas.

verses.text: But we, brothers, being bereaved of you for a short season, in presence, not in heart, tried even harder to see your face with great desire,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin madih ayua, bial-e niꞌ tiliaꞌ geh koꞌih juuaꞌ soꞌ ingan, juuaꞌ deꞌ boton pak-e sinok daang otin koꞌih, tok-tok nyam jobong koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan, koꞌih kagaꞌ odop koꞌih ngan koꞌih bitapod duoh ingan lagiꞌ.

verses.text: because we wanted to come to you—indeed, I, Paul, once and again—but Satan hindered us.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ kila koꞌih yaꞌ nog tuduꞌ ingan, okuꞌ, Paulus, moꞌ suba kudu-kudu sidoh-e, pak-e Laja Muat munua kuab olan koꞌih, yoh ngan koꞌih diꞌ ponai odi tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Isn’t it even you, before our Lord Jesus at his coming?
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih yaꞌ bitapod duoh ingan dop-e ingan leh soꞌ koꞌih bialap deꞌ dapod odaꞌ koꞌih doon, baya odaꞌ koꞌih bilagah odop koꞌih deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ Yesus takal Iyoh paliꞌ nog.

verses.text: For you are our glory and our joy.
verses.source_translation: Tok bonal, ingan leh deꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih munuas duoh soꞌon pimodo.

chapters.text: For you yourselves know, brothers, our visit to you wasn’t in vain, but having suffered before and been shamefully treated, as you know, at Philippi, we grew bold in our God to tell you the Good News of God in much conflict. For our exhortation is not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in deception. But even as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the Good News, so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, who tests our hearts. For neither were we at any time found using words of flattery, as you know, nor a cloak of covetousness (God is witness), nor seeking glory from men (neither from you nor from others), when we might have claimed authority as apostles of Christ. But we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother cherishes her own children. Even so, affectionately longing for you, we were well pleased to impart to you, not the Good News of God only, but also our own souls, because you had become very dear to us. For you remember, brothers, our labor and travail; for working night and day, that we might not burden any of you, we preached to you the Good News of God. You are witnesses with God, how holy, righteously, and blamelessly we behaved ourselves toward you who believe. As you know, we exhorted, comforted, and implored every one of you, as a father does his own children, to the end that you should walk worthily of God, who calls you into his own Kingdom and glory. For this cause we also thank God without ceasing, that, when you received from us the word of the message of God, you accepted it not as the word of men, but, as it is in truth, the word of God, which also works in you who believe. For you, brothers, became imitators of the assemblies of God which are in Judea in Christ Jesus; for you also suffered the same things from your own countrymen, even as they did from the Jews; who killed both the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and drove us out, and didn’t please God, and are contrary to all men; forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved; to fill up their sins always. But wrath has come on them to the uttermost. But we, brothers, being bereaved of you for a short season, in presence, not in heart, tried even harder to see your face with great desire, because we wanted to come to you—indeed, I, Paul, once and again—but Satan hindered us. For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Isn’t it even you, before our Lord Jesus at his coming? For you are our glory and our joy.

verses.text: Therefore when we couldn’t stand it any longer, we thought it good to be left behind at Athens alone,
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih taluh moꞌ diꞌ koꞌih tiyaꞌ taan naan jobong, inoh leh ngan koꞌih pikil lobih paguh koꞌih duoh Silas loꞌo deꞌ Atena,

verses.text: and sent Timothy, our brother and God’s servant in the Good News of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith;
verses.source_translation: yohmoꞌ koꞌih odaꞌ Timotius odi tuduꞌ ingan, yoh itih dingan koꞌih deꞌ kiloja duoh koꞌih nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ, magah Gah deꞌ Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Koꞌih odaꞌ Timotius odi tuduꞌ ingan saꞌ yoh nogap duoh gotak ingan saꞌ-e lobih bisayaꞌ lagiꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus,

verses.text: that no one be moved by these afflictions. For you know that we are appointed to this task.
verses.source_translation: saꞌ-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ-e tiguyang odaꞌ susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngoon-e.   Ingan tuang puꞌan ingan geh susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah otoꞌ inoh moꞌ jadin duman otoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For most certainly, when we were with you, we told you beforehand that we are to suffer affliction, even as it happened, and you know.
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih aluaꞌ samah-samah duoh ingan, koꞌih moꞌ tanon-e nang otoꞌ yaꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ.   Adin odop ingan moꞌ puꞌan-e, dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ jadi kodaꞌ deꞌ tanon koꞌih.

verses.text: For this cause I also, when I couldn’t stand it any longer, sent that I might know your faith, for fear that by any means the tempter had tempted you, and our labor would have been in vain.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ odaꞌ Timotius odi tuduꞌ ingan, saꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan soꞌ-e tentang bisayaꞌ ingan tuduꞌ Kristus, dop-e okuꞌ tolu jak ingan alah odaꞌ Laja Muat munua, yoh moꞌ odaꞌ kiloja koꞌih doiꞌ loti-e.

verses.text: But when Timothy came just now to us from you, and brought us glad news of your faith and love, and that you have good memories of us always, longing to see us, even as we also long to see you;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e adin Timotius moꞌ paliꞌ, iyoh moꞌ tanon gah deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ odaꞌ koꞌih doon, yoh nang ingan aluaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus duoh samah-oni ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan.   Yoh tanon tuduꞌ koꞌih nang ingan mala natong oniꞌ deꞌ paguh soꞌ koꞌih daang otin ingan.   Yoh nang ingan jobong yaꞌ bitapod duoh koꞌih, kodaꞌ koꞌih jobong yaꞌ bitapod duoh ingan.

verses.text: for this cause, brothers, we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, inoh leh ngan-e daang koꞌih obuah pijolaꞌ duoh ngoon suaꞌ susah, gah deꞌ ngojit koꞌih nang ingan aluaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus nogap otin koꞌih.

verses.text: For now we live, if you stand fast in the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Adin koꞌih ngoon nang idip koꞌih tok-tok biguna asal ingan totap togap daang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For what thanksgiving can we render again to God for you, for all the joy with which we rejoice for your sakes before our God;
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih sukup bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ daang kila deꞌ munuas, dop-e ingan togap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face, and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith?
verses.source_translation: Singonu singalom koꞌih bonal-bonal bidoa saꞌ otoꞌ bitapod jowin samah jowin, saꞌ koꞌih tapod tulung oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu ingan saꞌ ingan bonal-bonal togap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: Now may our God and Father himself, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way to you;
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ baya Topaꞌ Yesus bukaꞌ olan saꞌan koꞌih, saꞌ koꞌih bitapod lagiꞌ duoh ingan.

verses.text: and the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we also do toward you,
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih telus bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ odaꞌ ingan makin bitamah ngibalaꞌ sitipan odop ingan duoh ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, samah kodaꞌ koꞌih ngibalaꞌ ingan.

verses.text: to the end he may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ otin ingan togap, saꞌ-e doiꞌ tiyaꞌ salah ingan, duoh ingan bisig deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ Samaꞌ toꞌ, takal Topaꞌ Yesus nog bibaya duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ-E.

chapters.text: Therefore when we couldn’t stand it any longer, we thought it good to be left behind at Athens alone, and sent Timothy, our brother and God’s servant in the Good News of Christ, to establish you, and to comfort you concerning your faith; that no one be moved by these afflictions. For you know that we are appointed to this task. For most certainly, when we were with you, we told you beforehand that we are to suffer affliction, even as it happened, and you know. For this cause I also, when I couldn’t stand it any longer, sent that I might know your faith, for fear that by any means the tempter had tempted you, and our labor would have been in vain. But when Timothy came just now to us from you, and brought us glad news of your faith and love, and that you have good memories of us always, longing to see us, even as we also long to see you; for this cause, brothers, we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith. For now we live, if you stand fast in the Lord. For what thanksgiving can we render again to God for you, for all the joy with which we rejoice for your sakes before our God; night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face, and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith? Now may our God and Father himself, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way to you; and the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we also do toward you, to the end he may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.

verses.text: Finally then, brothers, we beg and exhort you in the Lord Jesus, that as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God, that you abound more and more.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, nyuang-nyuang-e koꞌih mitiaꞌ duoh sibaya tuduꞌ ingan daang Topaꞌ Yesus, ingan moꞌ ngojit soꞌ koꞌih watki wat ingan halus idip saꞌ Topaꞌ sonang ningaꞌ-e.   Tok ingan moꞌ idip wat inoh, pak-e koꞌih mitiaꞌ saꞌ ingan isin-isin kagaꞌ odop ingan odaꞌ lobih paguh lagiꞌ.

verses.text: For you know what instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ingan moꞌ puꞌan pingajal deꞌ mun ki deꞌ moꞌ ngajal koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan daang adon Topaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: For this is the will of God: your sanctification, that you abstain from sexual immorality,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e itih leh oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ: Saꞌ ingan idip jok-e saꞌan Iyoh, bisig, maꞌ cabul.

verses.text: that each one of you know how to control his own body in sanctification and honor,
verses.source_translation: Tibilang dali halus puꞌan watki idip duoh sowon-e pakai otin deꞌ bisig duoh pimodo tuduꞌ tipan si odop-e.

verses.text: not in the passion of lust, even as the Gentiles who don’t know God;
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ idip nunaꞌ asong deꞌ jaꞌat tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop ingan, kodaꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ,

verses.text: that no one should take advantage of and wrong a brother or sister in this matter; because the Lord is an avenger in all these things, as also we forewarned you and testified.
verses.source_translation: daang suaꞌ hal deꞌ kodaꞌ itih, saꞌ-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nai salah-e tuduꞌ madih-e duoh nipu-e.   Natong nyeꞌ koꞌih moꞌ isin-isin sibaya tuduꞌ ingan, Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa deꞌ nai salah-e deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: For God called us not for uncleanness, but in sanctification.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ mogan otoꞌ, odaꞌ otoꞌ idip jok-e saꞌan odop Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e odaꞌ otoꞌ idip duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop toꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore he who rejects this doesn’t reject man, but God, who has also given his Holy Spirit to you.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ diꞌ-e tilimaꞌ pingajal itih, idoh diꞌ-e lawan manusia pak-e lawan Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngin-e geh Iyang-E tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: But concerning brotherly love, you have no need that one write to you. For you yourselves are taught by God to love one another,
verses.source_translation: Tentang ngibalaꞌ tipan siodop nyeꞌ, idoh tiyaꞌ diꞌ-e pilelu koꞌih yaꞌ nulis-e tuduꞌ ingan, dop-e ingan moꞌ bilajal ngibalaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: for indeed you do it toward all the brothers who are in all Macedonia. But we exhort you, brothers, that you abound more and more;
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ ingan nai-e geh tuduꞌ suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Makedonia.   Pak-e madih ayua, isin-isin koꞌih sibaya-e saꞌ ingan ngibalaꞌ siodop ingan lobih paguh soꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai ingan.

verses.text: and that you make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, even as we instructed you;
verses.source_translation: Suba nyeꞌ idip bidanah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, maꞌ sapul hal nyaꞌa, kiloja ngan nyeꞌ ngilaan odop ingan, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: that you may walk properly toward those who are outside, and may have need of nothing.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ ingan moꞌ idip wat inoh, idoh diꞌ ingan idip soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngin nyaꞌa, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus tuang pimodo geh tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: But we don’t want you to be ignorant, brothers, concerning those who have fallen asleep, so that you don’t grieve like the rest, who have no hope.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, koꞌih yaꞌ odaꞌ ingan puꞌan bonal-bonal tentang nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, saꞌ otin ingan diꞌ-e susah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ doiꞌ topat-e bialap.

verses.text: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep in Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ otoꞌ bisayaꞌ nang Yesus moꞌ kobos duoh moꞌ paliꞌ idip, otoꞌ tuang bisayaꞌ geh nang Topaꞌ yaꞌ paliꞌ kidip nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus, Topaꞌ yaꞌ nguluk odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ duoh Yesus.

verses.text: For this we tell you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive, who are left until the coming of the Lord, will in no way precede those who have fallen asleep.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ tanon koꞌih itih tuduꞌ ingan yohleh pingunang deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ: takal Topaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ nog, Iyoh yaꞌ dioꞌ toban buu nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos, soꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ idip.

verses.text: For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with God’s trumpet. The dead in Christ will rise first,
verses.source_translation: Takal piayuh malaikat moꞌ nang bogan-e ngin pilitah duoh trompet Topaꞌ moꞌ sowoꞌ, inoh leh tanda-e odop Topaꞌ Yesus yaꞌ muun soꞌ siluga.   Mokuaꞌ inoh nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus deꞌ moꞌ kobos yaꞌ paliꞌ idip.

verses.text: then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air. So we will be with the Lord forever.
verses.source_translation: Mokuaꞌ inoh otoꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ idip takal inoh, yaꞌ obuah pakat samah-samah duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ daang totaꞌ abun ngan otoꞌ yaꞌ bitapod duoh Topaꞌ Yesus deꞌ longit.   Otoꞌ moꞌ loꞌo duoh Topaꞌ Yesus nah-nah.

verses.text: Therefore comfort one another with these words.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan ingan halus samah-oni nogap otin sitipan odop ingan pakai oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngajal kuꞌ inoh.

chapters.text: Finally then, brothers, we beg and exhort you in the Lord Jesus, that as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God, that you abound more and more. For you know what instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus. For this is the will of God: your sanctification, that you abstain from sexual immorality, that each one of you know how to control his own body in sanctification and honor, not in the passion of lust, even as the Gentiles who don’t know God; that no one should take advantage of and wrong a brother or sister in this matter; because the Lord is an avenger in all these things, as also we forewarned you and testified. For God called us not for uncleanness, but in sanctification. Therefore he who rejects this doesn’t reject man, but God, who has also given his Holy Spirit to you. But concerning brotherly love, you have no need that one write to you. For you yourselves are taught by God to love one another, for indeed you do it toward all the brothers who are in all Macedonia. But we exhort you, brothers, that you abound more and more; and that you make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, even as we instructed you; that you may walk properly toward those who are outside, and may have need of nothing. But we don’t want you to be ignorant, brothers, concerning those who have fallen asleep, so that you don’t grieve like the rest, who have no hope. For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep in Jesus. For this we tell you by the word of the Lord, that we who are alive, who are left until the coming of the Lord, will in no way precede those who have fallen asleep. For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with God’s trumpet. The dead in Christ will rise first, then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air. So we will be with the Lord forever. Therefore comfort one another with these words.

verses.text: But concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need that anything be written to you.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, siniaꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus yaꞌ nog diꞌ koꞌih tiyaꞌ pilelu yaꞌ nulis-e tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: For you yourselves know well that the day of the Lord comes like a thief in the night.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ingan moꞌ puꞌan-e, nang onu Topaꞌ yaꞌ nog tang-tang samah kodaꞌ pinoku nog singalom.

verses.text: For when they are saying, “Peace and safety,” then sudden destruction will come on them, like birth pains on a pregnant woman; and they will in no way escape.
verses.source_translation: Itiaꞌ takal nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ pikil nang suaꞌ-e moꞌ bidanah duoh aman, takal inoh leh iyoh obuah susah jolaꞌ deꞌ sukup baat-e, doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tapod osat soꞌ-e.   Hal inoh samah kodaꞌ dayung deꞌ bitiiaꞌ tang-tang noman toꞌin-e yaꞌ milaꞌ.

verses.text: But you, brothers, aren’t in darkness, that the day should overtake you like a thief.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan idoh diꞌ-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ daang mopung.   Jadin takal Topaꞌ paliꞌ nog, ingan diꞌ ingan gogoh kodaꞌ takal pinoku nog keꞌ boli ingan.

verses.text: You are all children of light, and children of the day. We don’t belong to the night, nor to darkness,
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, tok ingan suaꞌ-e idip daang telang duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang onu jawaꞌ.   Otoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang mopung duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ idip daang ngalom.

verses.text: so then let’s not sleep, as the rest do, but let’s watch and be sober.
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan otoꞌ maꞌ yaꞌ loloꞌ kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, otoꞌ halus ngooh, duoh pikil otoꞌ halus telang.

verses.text: For those who sleep, sleep in the night; and those who are drunk are drunk in the night.
verses.source_translation: Takal onu ngalom nyaꞌa boꞌos, takal onu ngalom geh nyaꞌa mabuk.

verses.text: But let us, since we belong to the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and, for a helmet, the hope of salvation.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e otoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip deꞌ onu jawaꞌ, inoh leh ngan pikil otoꞌ halus telang, otoꞌ totap halus bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ duoh ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon baya bialap punuaꞌ nang Topaꞌ yaꞌ nyilamat otoꞌ.   Suaꞌ-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ jadin bojuh bosi ngan nyeꞌ jaga odop nyeꞌ.

verses.text: For God didn’t appoint us to wrath, but to the obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ pilih otoꞌ ngan-e yaꞌ nyilamat otoꞌ pakai Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus, idoh diꞌ-e ngan-e yaꞌ ngukum otoꞌ.

verses.text: who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.
verses.source_translation: Yesus deꞌ moꞌ kobos saꞌan otoꞌ, saꞌ otoꞌ dapod idip samah-samah duoh odop-E takal Iyoh paliꞌ nog, an takal inoh otoꞌ aluaꞌ idip, an takal inoh otoꞌ moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Therefore exhort one another, and build each other up, even as you also do.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan ingan halus totap nogap otin siodop ingan, kodaꞌ deꞌ nai ingan adin.

verses.text: But we beg you, brothers, to know those who labor among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you,
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua isin-isin koꞌih mitiaꞌ odaꞌ ingan pimodo tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ ulih-ulih kiloja saꞌan ingan, odop-e deꞌ mutiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih Topaꞌ ngan-e mipin duoh ngajal ingan.

verses.text: and to respect and honor them in love for their work’s sake. Be at peace among yourselves.
verses.source_translation: Ingan halus bonal-bonal pimodo duoh ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ saꞌan ingan.   Silalu idip samah-samah duoh doiꞌ kaꞌi kalah nyeꞌ.

verses.text: We exhort you, brothers, admonish the disorderly, encourage the faint-hearted, support the weak, be patient toward all.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih mitiaꞌ geh madih ayua, ngalah leh nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ-e kiloja, ngilibul leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tolu, tulung leh nyaꞌa deꞌ pilelu ingan yaꞌ tulung-e, sabal leh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: See that no one returns evil for evil to anyone, but always follow after that which is good, for one another, and for all.
verses.source_translation: Pilati nyeꞌ saꞌ-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ balas jaꞌat pakai jaꞌat, pak-e kagaꞌ leh nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh siodop ingan, wat inoh geh ingan duoh suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: Rejoice always.
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ nyeꞌ mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ doon.

verses.text: Pray without ceasing.
verses.source_translation: Diꞌ nyeꞌ mosah-mosah bidoa.

verses.text: In everything give thanks, for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus toward you.
verses.source_translation: Bisukul leh daang hal oni sijaꞌ-e, dop-e inoh leh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ moꞌ idip samah-samah duoh Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: Don’t quench the Spirit.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ mokuaꞌ nai kiloja-E.

verses.text: Don’t despise prophesies.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ ngamun sibaya deꞌ soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ,

verses.text: Test all things, and hold firmly that which is good.
verses.source_translation: pak-e suaꞌ sibaya inoh halus nyeꞌ nguji-e, moꞌ-e deꞌ paguh halus nyeꞌ nunaꞌ-e,

verses.text: Abstain from every form of evil.
verses.source_translation: togan juuaꞌ-juuaꞌ-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ odop Topaꞌ deꞌ ngin tuduꞌ ingan idip bidanah, odaꞌ ingan isin-isin idip jok-e saꞌan Topaꞌ.   Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ jaga suaꞌ idip ingan, bait iyang, asong duoh polong ingan, saꞌ-e doiꞌ tiyaꞌ deꞌ salah takal Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus paliꞌ nog.

verses.text: He who calls you is faithful, who will also do it.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ deꞌ mogan otoꞌ tapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-E, Iyoh geh deꞌ yaꞌ kanuaꞌ janyi-E.

verses.text: Brothers, pray for us.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua bidoa leh saꞌan koꞌih!

verses.text: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.
verses.source_translation: Nginleh salam koꞌih tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: I solemnly command you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the holy brothers.
verses.source_translation: Daang adon Topaꞌ okuꞌ tok-tok mitiaꞌ odaꞌ ingan basa sulat itih tuduꞌ suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus ngin bilokat tuduꞌ ingan.   Soꞌ koꞌih, Paulus, Timotius duoh Silas.     TESALONIKA

chapters.text: But concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need that anything be written to you. For you yourselves know well that the day of the Lord comes like a thief in the night. For when they are saying, “Peace and safety,” then sudden destruction will come on them, like birth pains on a pregnant woman; and they will in no way escape. But you, brothers, aren’t in darkness, that the day should overtake you like a thief. You are all children of light, and children of the day. We don’t belong to the night, nor to darkness, so then let’s not sleep, as the rest do, but let’s watch and be sober. For those who sleep, sleep in the night; and those who are drunk are drunk in the night. But let us, since we belong to the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and, for a helmet, the hope of salvation. For God didn’t appoint us to wrath, but to the obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ, who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him. Therefore exhort one another, and build each other up, even as you also do. But we beg you, brothers, to know those who labor among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you, and to respect and honor them in love for their work’s sake. Be at peace among yourselves. We exhort you, brothers, admonish the disorderly, encourage the faint-hearted, support the weak, be patient toward all. See that no one returns evil for evil to anyone, but always follow after that which is good, for one another, and for all. Rejoice always. Pray without ceasing. In everything give thanks, for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus toward you. Don’t quench the Spirit. Don’t despise prophesies. Test all things, and hold firmly that which is good. Abstain from every form of evil. May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. He who calls you is faithful, who will also do it. Brothers, pray for us. Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss. I solemnly command you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the holy brothers. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

verses.text: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the assembly of the Thessalonians in God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ koꞌih taluh, Paulus, Timotius duoh Silas, tuduꞌ uluk ulang bisayaꞌ deꞌ Tesalonika deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ duoh Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: We are bound to always give thanks to God for you, brothers, even as it is appropriate, because your faith grows exceedingly, and the love of each and every one of you towards one another abounds;
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, otin koꞌih silalu bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, natong pingidip ingan.   Koꞌih halus duoh patut nai wat inoh, dop-e koꞌih ningaꞌ ingan makin togap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus duoh makin bitamah ngibalaꞌ tipan odop ingan.

verses.text: so that we ourselves boast about you in the assemblies of God for your perseverance and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions which you endure.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan koꞌih mala silita bilagah tentang ingan ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Tesalonika tibilang koꞌih odi nomi uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ topat-topat deꞌ bokon.   Koꞌih tanon nang ingan, bial ingan obuah pijolaꞌ duoh ngoon suaꞌ susah, ingan totap togap duoh totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus.

verses.text: This is an obvious sign of the righteous judgment of God, to the end that you may be counted worthy of God’s Kingdom, for which you also suffer.
verses.source_translation: Itih leh tanda-e Topaꞌ doiꞌ onu-e salah ngan-e ngadel nyaꞌa.   Ingan moꞌ susah jolaꞌ dop-e ingan silalu tunuak tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.   Inoh leh ngan Topaꞌ angap ingan patut jadin umat-E.

verses.text: Since it is a righteous thing with God to repay affliction to those who afflict you,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.   Iyoh yaꞌ balas nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ ingan susah jolaꞌ,

verses.text: and to give relief to you who are afflicted with us, when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with his mighty angels in flaming fire,
verses.source_translation: duoh yaꞌ odaꞌ ingan lopas soꞌ susah jolaꞌ, wat inoh geh duoh koꞌih, takal Topaꞌ Yesus muun soꞌ siluga yohmoꞌ bitanga odop-E bibaya duoh ayua malaikat deꞌ ayuh kuasa-e.

verses.text: punishing those who don’t know God, and to those who don’t obey the Good News of our Lord Jesus,
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ nog daang siduduꞌ opui ngan-e yaꞌ ngukum nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e piduli tentang Topaꞌ, baya nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh tentang Yesus Topaꞌ otoꞌ.

verses.text: who will pay the penalty: eternal destruction from the face of the Lord and from the glory of his might,
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ obuah katuab silamaꞌ-lamaꞌ-e, obuah kasig soꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ duoh soꞌ kuasa-E deꞌ ayuh.

verses.text: when he comes in that day to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired among all those who have believed, because our testimony to you was believed.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ jadi takal Yesus paliꞌ nog, ngan-e yaꞌ tilimaꞌ pudi soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ-E, duoh saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ yaꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ-E.   Ingan tuang yaꞌ suwaꞌ geh duoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, dop-e ingan moꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ gah deꞌ tanon koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan.

verses.text: To this end we also pray always for you, that our God may count you worthy of your calling, and fulfill every desire of goodness and work of faith, with power;
verses.source_translation: Yoh leh ngan koꞌih diꞌ mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ bidoa saꞌan ingan', saꞌ Topaꞌ otoꞌ angap ingan patut idip nunaꞌ bogan-E.   Koꞌih bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ pakai kuasa-E odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ laꞌan ingan nai-e tapod jadi, duoh pijadi suaꞌ oni' deꞌ paguh deꞌ moꞌ nai ingan dop-e ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, adon Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus obuah pakat odaꞌ ingan.   Wat inoh geh nyaꞌa moꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ ingan odaꞌ adon Yesus.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ jadi, dop-e ogiꞌ Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ otoꞌ duoh Yesus Kristus.

chapters.text: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the assembly of the Thessalonians in God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. We are bound to always give thanks to God for you, brothers, even as it is appropriate, because your faith grows exceedingly, and the love of each and every one of you towards one another abounds; so that we ourselves boast about you in the assemblies of God for your perseverance and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions which you endure. This is an obvious sign of the righteous judgment of God, to the end that you may be counted worthy of God’s Kingdom, for which you also suffer. Since it is a righteous thing with God to repay affliction to those who afflict you, and to give relief to you who are afflicted with us, when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with his mighty angels in flaming fire, punishing those who don’t know God, and to those who don’t obey the Good News of our Lord Jesus, who will pay the penalty: eternal destruction from the face of the Lord and from the glory of his might, when he comes in that day to be glorified in his saints, and to be admired among all those who have believed, because our testimony to you was believed. To this end we also pray always for you, that our God may count you worthy of your calling, and fulfill every desire of goodness and work of faith, with power; that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: Now, brothers, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and our gathering together to him, we ask you
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, adin koꞌih yaꞌ nulis tentang onu Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus yaꞌ paliꞌ nog, duoh tentang otoꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah nguluk samah-samah duoh Iyoh.   Itih leh deꞌ mitiaꞌ koꞌih bonal-bonal tuduꞌ ingan:

verses.text: not to be quickly shaken in your mind, and not be troubled, either by spirit, or by word, or by letter as if from us, saying that the day of Christ has already come.
verses.source_translation: saꞌ diꞌ ingan likas bigaduh duoh ilan-e simoꞌ ingan ngojit gah nang Topaꞌ Yesus moꞌ paliꞌ nog.   Bial ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang pingajal inoh soꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, soꞌ pingajal koꞌih duoh soꞌ sulat deꞌ pait koꞌih, maꞌ ingan yaꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: Let no one deceive you in any way. For it will not be, unless the rebellion comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of destruction,
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ sape yaꞌ tanah odaꞌ nyaꞌa nipu ingan! Dop-e takal aluaꞌ diꞌ-e nog onu Topaꞌ Yesus paliꞌ nog, halus dioꞌ jadi oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ: Bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ yaꞌ lawan Topaꞌ duoh ogiꞌ niꞌ naꞌan Manusia deꞌ Ginaka deꞌ yaꞌ bitanga odop-e.   Iyoh itih leh deꞌ moꞌ obuah notap yaꞌ obuah katuab.

verses.text: he who opposes and exalts himself against all that is called God or that is worshiped; so that he sits as God in the temple of God, setting himself up as God.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ netang Topaꞌ duoh pakat odop-e tun suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ sobot-e nang topaꞌ duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nyomah manusia.   Iyoh moꞌ yaꞌ guluꞌ daang Boli Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ magah nang odop-e inoh leh Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Don’t you remember that, when I was still with you, I told you these things?
verses.source_translation: Idoh keh diꞌ ingan natong nang suaꞌ oni deꞌ mutiꞌ moꞌ tanon kuꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, takal okuꞌ aluaꞌ loꞌo samah-samah duoh ingan?

verses.text: Now you know what is restraining him, to the end that he may be revealed in his own season.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ingan moꞌ puꞌan oni deꞌ aluaꞌ naan Manusia deꞌ Ginaka inoh bitanga odop-e.   Iyoh jok-e ponai bitanga odop-e takal onu deꞌ notap Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For the mystery of lawlessness already works. Only there is one who restrains now, until he is taken out of the way.
verses.source_translation: Adin kuasa deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa jadin ginaka moꞌ mulai kiloja otug-otug-e, pak-e aluaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ naan.   Pak-e itiaꞌ takal nyaꞌa deꞌ naan inoh moꞌ obuah kadi,

verses.text: Then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord will kill with the breath of his mouth, and destroy by the manifestation of his coming;
verses.source_translation: takal inoh ke Manusia deꞌ Ginaka inoh bitanga odop-e.   Pak-e Topaꞌ Yesus yaꞌ ngabos Manusia deꞌ Ginaka inoh pakai asong soꞌ bobaꞌ-E duoh katuab Manusia deꞌ Ginaka inoh takal Iyoh nog daang jawaꞌ-E deꞌ telang.

verses.text: even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,
verses.source_translation: Manusia deꞌ Ginaka inoh yaꞌ nog pakai kuasa Laja muat.   Iyoh nai masam-masam oniꞌ deꞌ ilan nyaꞌa duoh oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa kilin-e deꞌ ponai mogo nyaꞌa.

verses.text: and with all deception of wickedness for those who are being lost, because they didn’t receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nai oni sijaꞌ-e wat-e deꞌ jaꞌat ngan-e nipu nyaꞌa deꞌ tok yaꞌ obuah katuab.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ mutuab dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e suka duoh nulak gah deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ, deꞌ dapod odaꞌ yoh silamat.

verses.text: Because of this, God sends them a working of error, that they should believe a lie;
verses.source_translation: Yoh leh ngan Topaꞌ odaꞌ kila nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ oni deꞌ diꞌ-e tok.

verses.text: that they all might be judged who didn’t believe the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ odaꞌ wat inoh saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ gah deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ duoh nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e tok, yaꞌ obuah ukum.

verses.text: But we are bound to always give thanks to God for you, brothers loved by the Lord, because God chose you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief in the truth;
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ, koꞌih halus silalu bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ tentang ingan, dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih ingan soꞌ sibungas-e ngan-e yaꞌ odaꞌ silamat.   Ingan silamat odaꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ, deꞌ odaꞌ ingan jadin umat Topaꞌ deꞌ idip bisig, duoh ngan ingan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ gah deꞌ bonal tentang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: to which he called you through our Good News, for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.source_translation: Saꞌan inoh leh Topaꞌ mogan ingan pakai Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ tanon koꞌih.   Topaꞌ mogan ingan saꞌ ingan suwaꞌ soꞌon pudi samah-samah duoh Yesus Kristus Topaꞌ otoꞌ.

verses.text: So then, brothers, stand firm, and hold the traditions which you were taught by us, whether by word, or by letter.
verses.source_translation: Yohleh ngan ingan halus totap togap duoh kagong togap pingajal deꞌ moꞌ ngin koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan, bait deꞌ tanon koꞌih pakai bobaꞌ koꞌih, bait deꞌ tanon koꞌih pakai sulat.

verses.text: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace,
comfort your hearts and establish you in every good work and word.

chapters.text: Now, brothers, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and our gathering together to him, we ask you not to be quickly shaken in your mind, and not be troubled, either by spirit, or by word, or by letter as if from us, saying that the day of Christ has already come. Let no one deceive you in any way.
