For it will not be, unless the rebellion comes first, and the man of sin is revealed, the son of destruction, he who opposes and exalts himself against all that is called God or that is worshiped; so that he sits as God in the temple of God, setting himself up as God. Don’t you remember that, when I was still with you, I told you these things? Now you know what is restraining him, to the end that he may be revealed in his own season. For the mystery of lawlessness already works. Only there is one who restrains now, until he is taken out of the way. Then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord will kill with the breath of his mouth, and destroy by the manifestation of his coming; even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders, and with all deception of wickedness for those who are being lost, because they didn’t receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved. Because of this, God sends them a working of error, that they should believe a lie; that they all might be judged who didn’t believe the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness. But we are bound to always give thanks to God for you, brothers loved by the Lord, because God chose you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief in the truth; to which he called you through our Good News, for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ. So then, brothers, stand firm, and hold the traditions which you were taught by us, whether by word, or by letter. Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace, comfort your hearts and establish you in every good work and word.

verses.text: Finally, brothers, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may spread rapidly and be glorified, even as also with you;
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, deꞌ piobuaꞌ-e, bidoa leh saꞌan koꞌih, saꞌ gah tentang Topaꞌ Yesus likas popah duoh saꞌ nyaꞌa tilimaꞌ-e daang otin deꞌ paguh kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ jadi duoh ingan.

verses.text: and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and evil men; for not all have faith.
verses.source_translation: Bidoa geh saꞌan koꞌih saꞌ Topaꞌ jaga koꞌih soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat duoh pingaso.   Dop-e idoh diꞌ-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa laꞌan bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful, who will establish you, and guard you from the evil one.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Topaꞌ Yesus doiꞌ onu-e bilubah.   Iyoh yaꞌ odaꞌ otin ingan togap duoh jaga ingan soꞌ Laja Muat Munua.

verses.text: We have confidence in the Lord concerning you, that you both do and will do the things we command.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Yesus tulung ingan, koꞌih sukup bisayaꞌ nang ingan aluaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal koꞌih tuduꞌ ingan.   Koꞌih bisayaꞌ nang ingan adin aluaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal koꞌih inoh, duoh ingan totap telus yaꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: May the Lord direct your hearts into God’s love, and into the perseverance of Christ.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus nutuan ingan saꞌ ingan ngiloti nang Topaꞌ ngibalaꞌ ingan, duoh odaꞌ ingan totap togap takal idip ingan susah jolaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ Kristus.

verses.text: Now we command you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you withdraw yourselves from every brother who walks in rebellion, and not after the tradition which they received from us.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua, daang adon Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus koꞌih sibaya tuduꞌ ingan, maꞌ yaꞌ bidingan duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ pak-e' idip malas duoh deꞌ doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal koꞌih.

verses.text: For you know how you ought to imitate us. For we didn’t behave ourselves rebelliously among you,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ingan tuang moꞌ puꞌan wat ingan halus nunaꞌ tilodan idip koꞌih.   Koꞌih diꞌ koꞌih malas takal koꞌih ogiꞌ deꞌ uluk ingan.

verses.text: neither did we eat bread from anyone’s hand without paying for it, but in labor and travail worked night and day, that we might not burden any of you;
verses.source_translation: Doiꞌ sidoh koꞌih man pinguman nyaꞌa, deꞌ diꞌ koꞌih bayal-e, pak-e koꞌih lolah posah kiloja singonu singalom, saꞌ diꞌ koꞌih nyusah ingan.

verses.text: not because we don’t have the right, but to make ourselves an example to you, that you should imitate us.
verses.source_translation: Sibonal-e koꞌih tuang ogiꞌ geh hak koꞌih mitiaꞌ odaꞌ ingan tulung koꞌih, pak-e doliaꞌ koꞌih mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ ingan, dop-e koꞌih yaꞌ jadin tilodan saꞌan ingan.

verses.text: For even when we were with you, we commanded you this: “If anyone will not work, don’t let him eat.”
verses.source_translation: Takal koꞌih ogiꞌ deꞌ uluk ingan, koꞌih moꞌ nai atulan itih, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ-e kiloja, maꞌ yaꞌ man.   ”

verses.text: For we hear of some who walk among you in rebellion, who don’t work at all, but are busybodies.
verses.source_translation: Koꞌih tanon in itih, dop-e koꞌih ngojit nang ogiꞌ ayua nyaꞌa deꞌ malas daang uluk ingan.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e kiloja, yoh jok-e suka sapul hal nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.

verses.text: Now those who are that way, we command and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.
verses.source_translation: Daang adon Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus koꞌih mitiaꞌ bonal-bonal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ duoh koꞌih ngin pilitah tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌ yoh bidanah nai pingunai kiloja-e duoh kalik man-e sadiꞌ-e.

verses.text: But you, brothers, don’t be weary in doing what is right.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan maꞌ yaꞌ buwon nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: If any man doesn’t obey our word in this letter, note that man, that you have no company with him, to the end that he may be ashamed.
verses.source_translation: Pilati nyeꞌ bonal-bonal-e nyaꞌa deꞌ doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nulis koꞌih daang sulat itih.   Maꞌ yaꞌ bidingan duoh-e, saꞌ-e dasaꞌ.

verses.text: Don’t count him as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e maꞌ yaꞌ bitomi duoh-e, ngin nasehat tuduꞌ-e kodaꞌ madih daang Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways. The Lord be with you all.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus deꞌ jadin puꞌun idip bidanah, silalu ngin idip bidanah tuduꞌ ingan daang suaꞌ oniꞌ.   Okuꞌ bidoa geh saꞌ Topaꞌ Yesus totap ogiꞌ duoh ingan.

verses.text: The greeting of me, Paul, with my own hand, which is the sign in every letter: this is how I write.
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus.   Tongan odop kuꞌ deꞌ nulis nyuang sina daang sulat itih, wat itih leh wat okuꞌ nulis.   Wat itih leh wat tanda daang suaꞌ sulat kuꞌ.

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Yesus Kristus Topaꞌ otoꞌ ngin bilokat tuduꞌ suaꞌ ingan.   Soꞌ koꞌih, Paulus, Timotius duoh Silas.

chapters.text: Finally, brothers, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may spread rapidly and be glorified, even as also with you; and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and evil men; for not all have faith. But the Lord is faithful, who will establish you, and guard you from the evil one. We have confidence in the Lord concerning you, that you both do and will do the things we command. May the Lord direct your hearts into God’s love, and into the perseverance of Christ. Now we command you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you withdraw yourselves from every brother who walks in rebellion, and not after the tradition which they received from us. For you know how you ought to imitate us. For we didn’t behave ourselves rebelliously among you, neither did we eat bread from anyone’s hand without paying for it, but in labor and travail worked night and day, that we might not burden any of you; not because we don’t have the right, but to make ourselves an example to you, that you should imitate us. For even when we were with you, we commanded you this: “If anyone will not work, don’t let him eat.” For we hear of some who walk among you in rebellion, who don’t work at all, but are busybodies. Now those who are that way, we command and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread. But you, brothers, don’t be weary in doing what is right. If any man doesn’t obey our word in this letter, note that man, that you have no company with him, to the end that he may be ashamed. Don’t count him as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother. Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways. The Lord be with you all. The greeting of me, Paul, with my own hand, which is the sign in every letter: this is how I write. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ according to the commandment of God our Savior and the Lord Jesus Christ our hope;
to Timothy, my true child in faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.source_translation: Sulat soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus, deꞌ jadin rasul Kristus Yesus nunaꞌ deꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ, Pinyilamat otoꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus deꞌ jadin puꞌun soꞌ otoꞌ bialap.   Okuꞌ nulis sulat itih tuduꞌ muꞌu, Timotius deꞌ ngakuꞌ kuꞌ nyam onak odop kuꞌ, dop-e muꞌu moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.   Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ bilokat duoh ngin pilasiꞌ, baya ngin idip bidanah tuduꞌ muꞌu.

verses.text: As I urged you when I was going into Macedonia, stay at Ephesus that you might command certain men not to teach a different doctrine,
verses.source_translation: Takal okuꞌ yaꞌ lanyut pimonu kuꞌ ke' Makedonia, okuꞌ moꞌ pajak muꞌu odaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Efesus duoh nasehat nyaꞌa danoꞌ, dop-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal, muꞌu halus jaman iyoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: and not to pay attention to myths and endless genealogies, which cause disputes, rather than God’s stewardship, which is in faith—
verses.source_translation: Tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ saꞌ-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ngajal donan duoh silita asal usul deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jok-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa bikalah, nak-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.   Otoꞌ ponai nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ jok-e takal otoꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: but the goal of this command is love, out of a pure heart and a good conscience and sincere faith;
verses.source_translation: Ngan kuꞌ in itih saꞌ nyaꞌa ogiꞌ otin osuap-e deꞌ bisig, duoh bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ.   Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, iyoh moꞌ ponai ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: from which things some, having missed the mark, have turned away to vain talking;
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ idip wat inoh, iyoh moꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal odaꞌ sina deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e.

verses.text: desiring to be teachers of the law, though they understand neither what they say, nor about what they strongly affirm.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ sukup bilani-e sobot nang odop-e ngajal atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, pak-e doiꞌ-e nak ngiloti oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e.

verses.text: But we know that the law is good, if a person uses it lawfully,
verses.source_translation: Otoꞌ puꞌan nang atulan deꞌ nulis Musa tok paguh moꞌ nyeꞌ pakai wat deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: as knowing this, that law is not made for a righteous person, but for the lawless and insubordinate, for the ungodly and sinners, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,
verses.source_translation: Otoꞌ mesti natong atulan Topaꞌ deꞌ nulis Musa, idoh diꞌ-e saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal, pak-e saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ suka lawan atulan duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat, nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e piduli Topaꞌ duoh saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ doiꞌ agama-e, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ pingabos samaꞌ duoh sinoꞌ-e, saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pingabos,

verses.text: for the sexually immoral, for homosexuals, for slave-traders, for liars, for perjurers, and for any other thing contrary to the sound doctrine;
verses.source_translation: saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ ngaso nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e lawang odop-e, saꞌan dali deꞌ nyonal samah dali-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ takap nyaꞌa yohmoꞌ juaꞌ-e, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ pimogo, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ nang janyi pibulaꞌ-e, duoh osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ lawan pingajal deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: according to the Good News of the glory of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.
verses.source_translation: Pingajal deꞌ bonal inoh ogiꞌ daang Gah Paguh soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh kuasa-E, deꞌ patut otoꞌ mudi-E.   Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh.

verses.text: And I thank him who enabled me, Christ Jesus our Lord, because he counted me faithful, appointing me to service;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus Topaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nogap okuꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ okuꞌ odaꞌ layan odop-E, dop-e Iyoh moꞌ angap okuꞌ moꞌ bitotok nai kiloja inoh.

verses.text: although I was before a blasphemer, a persecutor, and insolent. However, I obtained mercy, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ, okuꞌ lika pijaꞌat Iyoh, lika pijolaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.   Pak-e Iyoh moꞌ masiꞌ tuduꞌ okuꞌ, dop-e okuꞌ aluaꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ bisayaꞌ, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai kuꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.

verses.text: The grace of our Lord abounded exceedingly with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ otoꞌ telus tanon tuduꞌ okuꞌ, nang odop-E ngibalaꞌ okuꞌ duoh paguh tuduꞌ okuꞌ, Iyoh geh deꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ odop-E, duoh ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.   Wat itih leh wat-e moꞌ otoꞌ moꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: The saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang itih bonal, patut nyeꞌ tilimaꞌ suaꞌ-e, “Kristus Yesus nog kaang dunia nyilamat nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa.” Yohmoꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidosa, okuꞌ leh deꞌ paling bidosa-e.

verses.text: However, for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first, Jesus Christ might display all his patience, for an example of those who were going to believe in him for eternal life.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e bial kuꞌ wat inoh, Topaꞌ masiꞌ deꞌ okuꞌ, saꞌ Kristus Yesus bitanga sabal-E tuduꞌ okuꞌ deꞌ paling bidosa, moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, okuꞌ moꞌ jadin soto saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sunih bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-E duoh soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ deꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, to God who alone is wise, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ Laja suaꞌ jaman, patut otoꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ-E duoh silalu otoꞌ mudi-E.   Iyoh diꞌ-e ponai kobos, diꞌ toꞌ ponai kilin-E, Topaꞌ deꞌ niꞌ geh! Amin.

verses.text: This instruction I commit to you, my child Timothy, according to the prophecies which were given to you before, that by them you may wage the good warfare;
verses.source_translation: Timotius deꞌ nyam onak odop kuꞌ, itih sibaya kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu, kodaꞌ sina deꞌ dioꞌ Iyang Topaꞌ tanon tentang oniꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ obuah muꞌu, sina inoh leh deꞌ nogap muꞌu saꞌ muꞌu tapod lawan nyaꞌa deꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ salah, lawan pakai pingajal deꞌ bonal daang nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ, duoh pakai otin osuap deꞌ bisig.

verses.text: holding faith and a good conscience; which some having thrust away made a shipwreck concerning the faith;
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ geh ayua deꞌ diꞌ-e nunaꞌ otin osuap-e, inoh leh ngan diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I delivered to Satan, that they might be taught not to blaspheme.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, Himeneus duoh Aleksander, soꞌ duwoh odop-e moꞌ mokuaꞌ kuꞌ ngukum-e nyelah tuduꞌ Laja Muat, saꞌ-e bilajal diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ pijaꞌat Topaꞌ.

chapters.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ according to the commandment of God our Savior and the Lord Jesus Christ our hope; to Timothy, my true child in faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Christ Jesus our Lord. As I urged you when I was going into Macedonia, stay at Ephesus that you might command certain men not to teach a different doctrine, and not to pay attention to myths and endless genealogies, which cause disputes, rather than God’s stewardship, which is in faith— but the goal of this command is love, out of a pure heart and a good conscience and sincere faith; from which things some, having missed the mark, have turned away to vain talking; desiring to be teachers of the law, though they understand neither what they say, nor about what they strongly affirm. But we know that the law is good, if a person uses it lawfully, as knowing this, that law is not made for a righteous person, but for the lawless and insubordinate, for the ungodly and sinners, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers, for the sexually immoral, for homosexuals, for slave-traders, for liars, for perjurers, and for any other thing contrary to the sound doctrine; according to the Good News of the glory of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust. And I thank him who enabled me, Christ Jesus our Lord, because he counted me faithful, appointing me to service; although I was before a blasphemer, a persecutor, and insolent. However, I obtained mercy, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief. The grace of our Lord abounded exceedingly with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus. The saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief. However, for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me first, Jesus Christ might display all his patience, for an example of those who were going to believe in him for eternal life. Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, to God who alone is wise, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen. This instruction I commit to you, my child Timothy, according to the prophecies which were given to you before, that by them you may wage the good warfare; holding faith and a good conscience; which some having thrust away made a shipwreck concerning the faith; of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I delivered to Satan, that they might be taught not to blaspheme.

verses.text: I exhort therefore, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercessions, and givings of thanks, be made for all men:
verses.source_translation: Bonal-bonal kuꞌ sibaya deꞌ ingan, odaꞌ ingan bidoa saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa, bidoa mitiaꞌ deꞌ Topaꞌ saꞌ-E tulung odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, nyeꞌ moꞌ bisukul saꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai-E tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa,

verses.text: for kings and all who are in high places; that we may lead a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and reverence.
verses.source_translation: bidoa saꞌan laja-laja duoh suaꞌ piayuh, saꞌ otoꞌ dapod idip aman duoh bidanah daang otoꞌ nyomah Topaꞌ, duoh nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal deꞌ jowin Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior;
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh deꞌ paguh duoh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, Pinyilamat otoꞌ.

verses.text: who desires all people to be saved and come to full knowledge of the truth.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh laꞌan saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa silamat duoh puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: For there is one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ jok-e niꞌ duoh jok-e niꞌ geh deꞌ dapod odaꞌ Topaꞌ duoh manusia bidamai, Iyoh inoh Kristus Yesus,

verses.text: who gave himself as a ransom for all; the testimony in its own times;
verses.source_translation: deꞌ moꞌ nyelah Odop-E ngan-e nubuas suaꞌ manusia deꞌ bidosa.   Wat inoh leh wat-e Topaꞌ tanon odop-E nyilamat manusia daang onu deꞌ moꞌ notap-E.

verses.text: to which I was appointed a preacher and an apostle (I am telling the truth in Christ, not lying), a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih okuꞌ odaꞌ jadin rasul, odi magah duoh ngajal bangsa deꞌ diꞌ-e Yahudi saꞌ-e bisayaꞌ duoh puꞌan ajal deꞌ bonal.   Oni' deꞌ nang kuꞌ tih bonal, okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ pibulaꞌ!

verses.text: I desire therefore that the men in every place pray, lifting up holy hands without anger and doubting.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ mitiaꞌ daki-daki sijaꞌ-e takal ingan tikuluk nyomah Topaꞌ, bala dali deꞌ bidoa pakat tongan-e daang otin-e halus bisig diꞌ-e tiwas duoh diꞌ-e bikalah takal-e bidoa.

verses.text: In the same way, that women also adorn themselves in decent clothing, with modesty and propriety; not just with braided hair, gold, pearls, or expensive clothing;
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh bala dayung, pakai leh pimakai deꞌ patut duoh sinunuh, buak-e maꞌ yaꞌ ngabun lobih-lobih, dusah nyeꞌ pakai mas, intan, duoh balang-balang deꞌ maal,

verses.text: but (which becomes women professing godliness) with good works.
verses.source_translation: pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ halus ngabun odop-e pakai pingunai deꞌ paguh, kodaꞌ deꞌ patut bala dayung deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: Let a woman learn in quietness with full submission.
verses.source_translation: Dayung halus loꞌo ngojit pingajal deꞌ tanon nyaꞌa yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ-e.

verses.text: But I don’t permit a woman to teach, nor to exercise authority over a man, but to be in quietness.
verses.source_translation: Idoh diꞌ kuꞌ odaꞌ bala dayung ngajal duoh militah dali, yoh halus loꞌo ngojit jaꞌ-e,

verses.text: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.
verses.source_translation: dop-e deꞌ dioꞌ Topaꞌ nai-e Adam, mokuaꞌ inoh ke Iyoh nai Hawa.

verses.text: Adam wasn’t deceived, but the woman, being deceived, has fallen into disobedience;
verses.source_translation: Yohmoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e Adam deꞌ obuah nipu, pak-e dayung leh deꞌ obuah nipu, iyoh moꞌ ngilangal sibaya Topaꞌ.

verses.text: but she will be saved through her childbearing, if they continue in faith, love, and sanctification with sobriety.
verses.source_translation: Bial-e moꞌ wat inoh, dayung yaꞌ silamat dop-e yoh milaꞌ bilanak, asal-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus duoh totap ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa daang-e idip bisig nunaꞌ sibaya Topaꞌ.

chapters.text: I exhort therefore, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercessions, and givings of thanks, be made for all men: for kings and all who are in high places; that we may lead a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and reverence. For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior; who desires all people to be saved and come to full knowledge of the truth. For there is one God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus, who gave himself as a ransom for all; the testimony in its own times; to which I was appointed a preacher and an apostle (I am telling the truth in Christ, not lying), a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth. I desire therefore that the men in every place pray, lifting up holy hands without anger and doubting. In the same way, that women also adorn themselves in decent clothing, with modesty and propriety; not just with braided hair, gold, pearls, or expensive clothing; but (which becomes women professing godliness) with good works. Let a woman learn in quietness with full submission. But I don’t permit a woman to teach, nor to exercise authority over a man, but to be in quietness. For Adam was first formed, then Eve. Adam wasn’t deceived, but the woman, being deceived, has fallen into disobedience; but she will be saved through her childbearing, if they continue in faith, love, and sanctification with sobriety.

verses.text: This is a faithful saying: if a man seeks the office of an overseer, he desires a good work.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang itih tok bonal, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ ogiꞌ niat-e yaꞌ jadin pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ, loti-e nyaꞌa deꞌ laꞌan nai kiloja deꞌ biloga.”

verses.text: The overseer therefore must be without reproach, the husband of one wife, temperate, sensible, modest, hospitable, good at teaching;
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ mipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ halus nyaꞌa deꞌ idip-e tongon, jok-e niꞌ sowon-e, taan nijon odop-e, bijak daang idip-e, paguh ulah gaya-e, suka tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa ngilumon deꞌ boli-e, duoh ponai ngajal nyaꞌa,

verses.text: not a drinker, not violent, not greedy for money, but gentle, not quarrelsome, not covetous;
verses.source_translation: diꞌ-e pimabuk, diꞌ-e pimalah, pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh otin-e duoh paguh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa, diꞌ-e odaꞌ duit nguasa idip-e,

verses.text: one who rules his own house well, having children in subjection with all reverence;
verses.source_translation: iyoh halus ponai ngatul lomin boli-e, ngajal odaꞌ onak opot-e ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang-e duoh pimodo tuduꞌ odop-e.

verses.text: (but if a man doesn’t know how to rule his own house, how will he take care of the assembly of God?)
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ iyoh diꞌ-e ponai ngatul lomin boli-e, wat ki wat iyoh yaꞌ ngatul uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ?

verses.text: not a new convert, lest being puffed up he fall into the same condemnation as the devil.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ maꞌ yaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang-e suwaꞌ bisayaꞌ, jak-e tiaꞌ iyoh moꞌ samuh, iyoh moꞌ obuah ukum kodaꞌ Laja Muat noꞌuh-e.

verses.text: Moreover he must have good testimony from those who are outside, to avoid falling into reproach and the snare of the devil.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh halus nyaꞌa deꞌ mala nyaꞌa sobot nang iyoh paguh daang uluk nyaꞌa, dop-e moꞌ-e diꞌ-e wat inoh, jak nyaꞌa ngituang sobot-e ngan nyaꞌa pilabuꞌ-e, iyoh moꞌ obuah jolat Laja Muat.

verses.text: Servants, in the same way, must be reverent, not double-tongued, not addicted to much wine, not greedy for money;
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang tulung pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ, halus nyaꞌa deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-a, pingunang-e dapod nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ daꞌ-a, diꞌ-e sikiya dolas nuak tuak anggul, diꞌ-e pinganguak.

verses.text: holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh halus bikagong togap tuduꞌ oniꞌ soꞌ-e bisayaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ, duoh idip daang otin osuap deꞌ bisig.

verses.text: Let them also first be tested; then let them serve if they are blameless.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh halus nyeꞌ nguji dioꞌ, asal idip-e tongon ke nyeꞌ pakat-e .

verses.text: Their wives in the same way must be reverent, not slanderers, temperate, faithful in all things.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh sowon-e, halus nyaꞌa deꞌ pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-a, diꞌ-e suka nyalah nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, taan nijon odop-e, tapod nyeꞌ bisayaꞌ daꞌ-a daang oni sijaꞌ-e.

verses.text: Let servants be husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang tulung pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ halus bonon deꞌ niꞌ geh sowon-e, iyoh moꞌ puꞌan wat-e ngatul onak opot-e duoh lomin boli-e odaꞌ paguh.

verses.text: For those who have served well gain for themselves a good standing, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ tukang tulung pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ, moꞌ iyoh nai kiloja deꞌ paguh, nyaꞌa yaꞌ pimodo daꞌ-a, yohmoꞌ dapod tanon Kristus Yesus deꞌ soꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: These things I write to you, hoping to come to you shortly;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ nulis sulat itih tuduꞌ muꞌu daang kuꞌ alap okuꞌ dapod likas odi tuduꞌ muꞌu.

verses.text: but if I wait long, that you may know how men ought to behave themselves in God’s house, which is the assembly of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ kuꞌ lamat odi, muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan-e soꞌ sulat itih oni wat pingidip nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin lawang Topaꞌ, nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ idip.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ samah kodaꞌ tiang deꞌ naan boli, nyaꞌa deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ jaga pingajal deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Without controversy, the mystery of godliness is great: God was revealed in the flesh, justified in the spirit, seen by angels, preached among the nations, believed on in the world, and received up in glory.
verses.source_translation: Tok-tok bonal pingajal deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ! Doiꞌ nyaꞌa dapod sukan-e: Iyoh deꞌ moꞌ tanon odop-E pakai polong manusia, Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ nang Iyoh tok bonal, malaikat-malaikat moꞌ kilin-E.   Iyoh obuah magah deꞌ uluk bangsa-bangsa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ, Iyoh deꞌ obuah bisayaꞌ daang dunia, Iyoh deꞌ obuah pakat kaang siluga.

chapters.text: This is a faithful saying: if a man seeks the office of an overseer, he desires a good work. The overseer therefore must be without reproach, the husband of one wife, temperate, sensible, modest, hospitable, good at teaching; not a drinker, not violent, not greedy for money, but gentle, not quarrelsome, not covetous; one who rules his own house well, having children in subjection with all reverence; (but if a man doesn’t know how to rule his own house, how will he take care of the assembly of God?) not a new convert, lest being puffed up he fall into the same condemnation as the devil. Moreover he must have good testimony from those who are outside, to avoid falling into reproach and the snare of the devil. Servants, in the same way, must be reverent, not double-tongued, not addicted to much wine, not greedy for money; holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience. Let them also first be tested; then let them serve if they are blameless. Their wives in the same way must be reverent, not slanderers, temperate, faithful in all things. Let servants be husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well. For those who have served well gain for themselves a good standing, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus. These things I write to you, hoping to come to you shortly; but if I wait long, that you may know how men ought to behave themselves in God’s house, which is the assembly of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth. Without controversy, the mystery of godliness is great: God was revealed in the flesh, justified in the spirit, seen by angels, preached among the nations, believed on in the world, and received up in glory.

verses.text: But the Spirit says expressly that in later times some will fall away from the faith, paying attention to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons,
verses.source_translation: Iyang Topaꞌ moꞌ telang-telang tanon nang deꞌ nyuang-nyuang joman, bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ togan Kristus Yesus, diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ, yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ pingajal deꞌ salah deꞌ nog soꞌ muat munua,

verses.text: through the hypocrisy of men who speak lies, branded in their own conscience as with a hot iron;
verses.source_translation: deꞌ tanon nyaꞌa deꞌ pulaꞌ-pulaꞌ paguh ngan-e mogo.   Otin osuap-e diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ bonal duoh deꞌ salah.

verses.text: forbidding marriage and commanding to abstain from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ pibulaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ jaman nyaꞌa kawin.   Ogiꞌ geh pinguman deꞌ jaman-e nyaꞌa man-e, tiap Topaꞌ deꞌ nai pinguman kan-e odaꞌ nyaꞌa man-e.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ puꞌan ajal deꞌ bonal, tilimaꞌ-e simadi-e bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For every creature of God is good, and nothing is to be rejected, if it is received with thanksgiving.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Topaꞌ paguh, niꞌ tuang doiꞌ geh oniꞌ deꞌ nang nyaꞌa polih asal nyeꞌ moꞌ tilimaꞌ-e simadi nyeꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For it is sanctified through the word of God and prayer.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e pingunang Topaꞌ duoh doa deꞌ odaꞌ pinguman diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ polih nyeꞌ man-e.

verses.text: If you instruct the brothers of these things, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, nourished in the words of the faith, and of the good doctrine which you have followed.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ muꞌ ngajal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ tuduꞌ madih ayua toꞌ deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ Kristus Yesus, muꞌu moꞌ jadin kuli Kristus Yesus deꞌ paguh.   Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh muꞌu moꞌ konyat tuduꞌ sina Topaꞌ deꞌ soꞌ toꞌ bisayaꞌ duoh pingajal deꞌ paguh deꞌ moꞌ nunaꞌ muꞌ tian-tian itih.

verses.text: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables. Exercise yourself toward godliness.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ suwaꞌ nunaꞌ silita deꞌ odaꞌ nyeꞌ moyap soꞌ Topaꞌ duoh donan deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e, pak-e kanyat negeh odop muꞌ nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For bodily exercise has some value, but godliness has value in all things, having the promise of the life which is now, and of that which is to come.
verses.source_translation: Latih gonan saꞌ-e sehat jok-e biguna saꞌan gonan, pak-e latih odop nyeꞌ nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ biguna saꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ, dop-e ogiꞌ janyi-E, paguh saꞌan pingidip nyeꞌ deꞌ adin duoh tiaꞌ ijoꞌ.

verses.text: This saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance.
verses.source_translation: Pingunang itih tok bonal patut nyeꞌ tilimaꞌ duoh bisayaꞌ daꞌ-a.

verses.text: For to this end we both labor and suffer reproach, because we have set our trust in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan toꞌ ulih-ulih kiloja duoh bijuang, dop-e otoꞌ bialap punuaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ idip, Iyoh Pinyilamat suaꞌ nyaꞌa, amot-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: Command and teach these things.
verses.source_translation: Ngajal leh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ nyeꞌ moꞌ tanon odaꞌ nunaꞌ-e.

verses.text: Let no man despise your youth; but be an example to those who believe, in word, in your way of life, in love, in spirit, in faith, and in purity.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ sape diꞌ nyaꞌa pimodo tuduꞌ muꞌu, ningaꞌ umul muꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ.   Muꞌu jadin leh tilodan saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, bait daang sina duoh ulah gaya muꞌ, daang muꞌ ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa duoh bisayaꞌ deꞌ Kristus Yesus daang idip muꞌ deꞌ bisig.

verses.text: Until I come, pay attention to reading, to exhortation, and to teaching.
verses.source_translation: Simadi muꞌ kajon okuꞌ nog, muꞌu halus mala basa buk Kitab tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, nyeꞌ moꞌ tanon loti-e daang nyeꞌ ngajal-e.

verses.text: Don’t neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the elders.
verses.source_translation: Telus-telus nyeꞌ pakai oni deꞌ moꞌ ngin Iyang Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.   Iyang Topaꞌ ngin-e takal pimipin-pimipin nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ posan tongan-e deꞌ tun bak muꞌu, yoh moꞌ dioꞌ tanon tentang muꞌu.

verses.text: Be diligent in these things. Give yourself wholly to them, that your progress may be revealed to all.
verses.source_translation: Nai negeh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ bonal-bonal-e saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ nang muꞌu simakin togap bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: Pay attention to yourself, and to your teaching. Continue in these things, for in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.
verses.source_translation: Jaga ulah gaya muꞌ duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal muꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ buwon nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh, dop-e moꞌ muꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh, bait odop muꞌ, bait nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit oni' deꞌ ngajal muꞌ yaꞌ silamat.

chapters.text: But the Spirit says expressly that in later times some will fall away from the faith, paying attention to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons, through the hypocrisy of men who speak lies, branded in their own conscience as with a hot iron; forbidding marriage and commanding to abstain from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth. For every creature of God is good, and nothing is to be rejected, if it is received with thanksgiving. For it is sanctified through the word of God and prayer. If you instruct the brothers of these things, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, nourished in the words of the faith, and of the good doctrine which you have followed. But refuse profane and old wives’ fables. Exercise yourself toward godliness. For bodily exercise has some value, but godliness has value in all things, having the promise of the life which is now, and of that which is to come. This saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance. For to this end we both labor and suffer reproach, because we have set our trust in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe. Command and teach these things. Let no man despise your youth; but be an example to those who believe, in word, in your way of life, in love, in spirit, in faith, and in purity. Until I come, pay attention to reading, to exhortation, and to teaching. Don’t neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the elders. Be diligent in these things. Give yourself wholly to them, that your progress may be revealed to all. Pay attention to yourself, and to your teaching. Continue in these things, for in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.

verses.text: Don’t rebuke an older man, but exhort him as a father; the younger men as brothers;
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ sikiya ulih-ulih ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ nyoma soꞌ odop muꞌ, pak-e muꞌu ngijaꞌ yoh ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ nang muꞌ, kodaꞌ muꞌu sina duoh samaꞌ odop muꞌ.   Muꞌu ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ mudaꞌ soꞌ odop muꞌ kodaꞌ muꞌ ngalah sudiꞌ muꞌ,

verses.text: the elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, in all purity.
verses.source_translation: duoh dayung-dayung deꞌ nyoma kodaꞌ sinoꞌ odop muꞌ.   Dayung-dayung deꞌ mudaꞌ muꞌ angap kodaꞌ sudiꞌ odop muꞌ, pakai otin deꞌ bisig.

verses.text: Honor widows who are widows indeed.
verses.source_translation: Pimodo duoh tulung leh janda-janda deꞌ bonal-bonal idip sadiꞌ-e.

verses.text: But if any widow has children or grandchildren, let them learn first to show piety towards their own family, and to repay their parents, for this is  acceptable in the sight of God.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ nyam ogiꞌ janda deꞌ ogiꞌ onak-e keh sukun-e keh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ leh deꞌ halus dioꞌ piduli pingoma-e, duoh balas oni deꞌ paguh deꞌ moꞌ nai pingoma-e keh sumuk-e keh tuduꞌ odop-e.   Dop-e pingunai deꞌ wat inoh leh deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Now she who is a widow indeed, and desolate, has her hope set on God, and continues in petitions and prayers night and day.
verses.source_translation: Janda deꞌ tok-tok idip sadiꞌ-e, doiꞌ osi-osi deꞌ yaꞌ ngilaan idip-e, iyoh jok-e bialap deꞌ Topaꞌ.   Singonu singalom yoh bidoa mitiaꞌ deꞌ Topaꞌ odaꞌ tulung odop-e.

verses.text: But she who gives herself to pleasure is dead while she lives.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e janda deꞌ idip jok-e kalik odaꞌ odop-e puas, bial iyoh aluaꞌ idip, pak-e idip-e doiꞌ loti-e samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kobos.

verses.text: Also command these things, that they may be without reproach.
verses.source_translation: Tanon tuduꞌ janda-janda deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ nunaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ, saꞌ pingidip-e doiꞌ nyaꞌa sobot nang jaꞌat.

verses.text: But if anyone doesn’t provide for his own, and especially his own household, he has denied the faith, and is worse than an unbeliever.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e moꞌ nyam-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ngilaan madih ayua-e, amot-e lawang odop-e, nyaꞌa deꞌ wat inoh moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus, iyoh lobih jaꞌat soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: Let no one be enrolled as a widow under sixty years old, having been the wife of one man,
verses.source_translation: Dayung deꞌ kibalot nyeꞌ adon-e daang ituang nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ janda deꞌ yaꞌ obuah tulung iyoh leh: janda deꞌ umul-e mulai soꞌ nuam puluꞌ sowaꞌ, deꞌ jok-e niꞌ sidoh geh iyoh bibonon,

verses.text: being approved by good works, if she has brought up children, if she has been hospitable to strangers, if she has washed the saints’ feet, if she has relieved the afflicted, and if she has diligently followed every good work.
verses.source_translation: deꞌ puꞌan nyaꞌa nang dayung deꞌ moꞌ nai pingunai kiloja deꞌ paguh kodaꞌ: ngilaan onak opot-e odaꞌ ayuh, sonang tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa ngilumon deꞌ boli-e takal nyaꞌa pilelu topat-e soꞌ-e yaꞌ ngilumon, suka sidia suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ susah jolaꞌ, duoh suka nai suaꞌ pingunai kiloja deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: But refuse younger widows, for when they have grown wanton against Christ, they desire to marry;
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ kibalot janda deꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ daang ituang inoh.   Dop-e jak yoh aluaꞌ suka ngilipuang dali, yoh moꞌ yaꞌ kawin baꞌuh duoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ layan Kristus, kodaꞌ janyi-e.

verses.text: having condemnation, because they have rejected their first pledge.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e wat inoh, iyoh yaꞌ obuah ngukum, dop-e moꞌ ngilangal janyi-e tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Besides, they also learn to be idle, going about from house to house. Not only idle, but also gossips and busybodies, saying things which they ought not.
verses.source_translation: Wat noh geh janda deꞌ mudaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ saꞌat masa ngan-e molot luah boli nyaꞌa.   Deꞌ lobih jaꞌat-e lagiꞌ, yoh suka kilakal nyaꞌa, suka sapul hal nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, duoh suka kilakal oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e patut nyeꞌ yaꞌ kilakal-e.

verses.text: I desire therefore that the younger widows marry, bear children, rule the household, and give no occasion to the adversary for insulting.
verses.source_translation: Noh leh ngan okuꞌ odaꞌ janda-janda deꞌ aluaꞌ mudaꞌ kawin baꞌuh, saꞌ-e ogiꞌ onak-e, duoh ngatul lomin boli-e, saꞌ nyaꞌa diꞌ-e ponai pijaꞌat adon otoꞌ ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: For already some have turned away after Satan.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e moꞌ ogiꞌ janda-janda deꞌ mudaꞌ deꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal yohmoꞌ nunaꞌ Laja Muat.

verses.text: If any man or woman who believes has widows, let them relieve them, and don’t let the assembly be burdened; that it might relieve those who are widows indeed.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ dali bait deꞌ dayung deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus, yoh ogiꞌ madih-e deꞌ moꞌ janda, yoh halus tulung madih-e deꞌ janda inoh.   Saꞌ uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ diꞌ-e ngilaan idip madih-e deꞌ janda inoh duoh tulung-e.   Tanah saꞌ ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ bokon tulung janda-janda deꞌ doiꞌ madih ayua-e deꞌ yaꞌ ngilaan idip-e.

verses.text: Let the elders who rule well be counted worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in the word and in teaching.
verses.source_translation: Pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ paguh kiloja-e, patut nyeꞌ ngin pah duwoh sidoh bogoꞌ daꞌ-a, amot-e odop-e deꞌ bonal-bonal magah pingunang Topaꞌ duoh ngajal suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: For the Scripture says, “You shall not muzzle the ox when it treads out the grain.” And, “The laborer is worthy of his wages.”
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ogiꞌ deꞌ moꞌ obuah nulis daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Sapi deꞌ julah-e ngiik gandum maꞌ yaꞌ mokos bobaꞌ-e.” Ogiꞌ geh deꞌ obuah nulis in-e, “Nyaꞌa deꞌ kiloja, iyoh patut tilimaꞌ pah-e.”

verses.text: Don’t receive an accusation against an elder, except at the word of two or three witnesses.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ bisayaꞌ simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ napo pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ, asal-e diꞌ-e duwoh taluh naꞌan deꞌ ningaꞌ, deꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ napo-e inoh tok.

verses.text: Those who sin, reprove in the sight of all, that the rest also may be in fear.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ nai dosa-e, halus nyeꞌ ngalah-e deꞌ sulung jowin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon tolu.

verses.text: I command you in the sight of God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the chosen angels, that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing by partiality.
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ, Kristus Yesus, duoh malaikat-malaikat deꞌ moꞌ pilih-E, okuꞌ ulih-ulih mitiaꞌ saꞌ muꞌu nunaꞌ sibaya deꞌ munoꞌ: maꞌ dioꞌ pikil jaꞌat tuduꞌ osi-osi-e, duoh maꞌ yaꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nuaꞌ nyeꞌ.

verses.text: Lay hands hastily on no one, neither be a participant in other men’s sins. Keep yourself pure.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ bigaut posan tongan nyeꞌ deꞌ tun bak nyaꞌa, ngan nyeꞌ yaꞌ pakat-e odaꞌ jadin pilayan Topaꞌ.   Simoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon nai dosa-e, maꞌ yaꞌ suwaꞌ duoh dosa deꞌ nai-e.   Jaga odop muꞌ saꞌ muꞌ totap bisig.

verses.text: Be no longer a drinker of water only, but use a little wine for your stomach’s sake and your frequent infirmities.
verses.source_translation: Timotius, maꞌ yaꞌ jok nyeꞌ nuak piꞌin sajaꞌ neh, nuak nyeꞌ geh ngaꞌ sit tuak anggul ngan nyeꞌ jaga aang toꞌin muꞌ, dop-e muꞌu lika monam.

verses.text: Some men’s sins are evident, preceding them to judgment, and some also follow later.
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ kudu-kudu nyaꞌa dosa-e moꞌ dioꞌ tonga, pak-e ogiꞌ geh dosa nyaꞌa deꞌ tiaꞌ ke yoh moꞌ tonga takal nyaꞌa moꞌ ngukum-e.

verses.text: In the same way also there are good works that are obvious, and those that are otherwise can’t be hidden.
verses.source_translation: Wat noh geh ogiꞌ pingunai deꞌ paguh deꞌ lasuꞌ tonga.   Deꞌ diꞌ-e mulah yaꞌ tonga, nyuang-nyuang-e tuang tonga geh.

chapters.text: Don’t rebuke an older man, but exhort him as a father; the younger men as brothers; the elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, in all purity. Honor widows who are widows indeed. But if any widow has children or grandchildren, let them learn first to show piety towards their own family, and to repay their parents, for this is  acceptable in the sight of God. Now she who is a widow indeed, and desolate, has her hope set on God, and continues in petitions and prayers night and day. But she who gives herself to pleasure is dead while she lives. Also command these things, that they may be without reproach. But if anyone doesn’t provide for his own, and especially his own household, he has denied the faith, and is worse than an unbeliever. Let no one be enrolled as a widow under sixty years old, having been the wife of one man, being approved by good works, if she has brought up children, if she has been hospitable to strangers, if she has washed the saints’ feet, if she has relieved the afflicted, and if she has diligently followed every good work. But refuse younger widows, for when they have grown wanton against Christ, they desire to marry; having condemnation, because they have rejected their first pledge. Besides, they also learn to be idle, going about from house to house. Not only idle, but also gossips and busybodies, saying things which they ought not. I desire therefore that the younger widows marry, bear children, rule the household, and give no occasion to the adversary for insulting. For already some have turned away after Satan. If any man or woman who believes has widows, let them relieve them, and don’t let the assembly be burdened; that it might relieve those who are widows indeed. Let the elders who rule well be counted worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in the word and in teaching. For the Scripture says, “You shall not muzzle the ox when it treads out the grain.” And, “The laborer is worthy of his wages.” Don’t receive an accusation against an elder, except at the word of two or three witnesses. Those who sin, reprove in the sight of all, that the rest also may be in fear. I command you in the sight of God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the chosen angels, that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing by partiality. Lay hands hastily on no one, neither be a participant in other men’s sins. Keep yourself pure. Be no longer a drinker of water only, but use a little wine for your stomach’s sake and your frequent infirmities. Some men’s sins are evident, preceding them to judgment, and some also follow later. In the same way also there are good works that are obvious, and those that are otherwise can’t be hidden.

verses.text: Let as many as are bondservants under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor, that the name of God and the doctrine not be blasphemed.
verses.source_translation: Ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ jadin kuli, halus pimodo tuduꞌ toke-e, saꞌ-a doiꞌ nyaꞌa dapod pijaꞌat adon Topaꞌ duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal toꞌ.

verses.text: Those who have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brothers, but rather let them serve them, because those who partake of the benefit are believing and beloved. Teach and exhort these things.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ toke-e nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ totu yaꞌ pimodo tuduꞌ-e, dop-e yoh samah-samah ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.   Sipatut-e kuli-e layan toke-e lobih paguh-e lagiꞌ, dop-e toke-e samah-samah ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-e.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ mutiꞌ halus muꞌ ngajal duoh sibaya-e.

verses.text: If anyone teaches a different doctrine, and doesn’t consent to sound words, the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness,
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ bokon, deꞌ diꞌ-e situju duoh ajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ otoꞌ Yesus Kristus, duoh deꞌ ngajal agama otoꞌ,

verses.text: he is conceited, knowing nothing, but obsessed with arguments, disputes, and word battles, from which come envy, strife, insulting, evil suspicions,
verses.source_translation: yoh bilagah odop-e nang odop-e puꞌan suaꞌ oniꞌ, pak-e doiꞌ-e nak puꞌan oni-oni-e! Otin-e kolas, suka bikaꞌi, bikalah, kalik oniꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ siniaꞌ, odaꞌ yoh bilawan tipan odop-e, buꞌui diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ tikuluk, pinapo, salah sakaꞌ,

verses.text: constant friction of people of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth, who suppose that godliness is a means of gain. Withdraw yourself from such.
verses.source_translation: diꞌ-e mokuaꞌ-mokuaꞌ bikalah.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ wat inoh pikil-e moꞌ lusak diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bonal.   Yoh pikil nang nyaꞌa ponai kaya odaꞌ agama.

verses.text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.
verses.source_translation: Tok utung ayuh deꞌ soꞌon nyeꞌ soꞌ agama moꞌ nyeꞌ nunaꞌ pingajal-e.   Wat noh geh nyeꞌ soꞌon utung ayuh, moꞌ nyeꞌ puas otin duoh oniꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ kakuꞌ nyeꞌ.

verses.text: For we brought nothing into the world, and we certainly can’t carry anything out.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e takal otoꞌ nog kaang dunia, doiꞌ oni-oni-e deꞌ toban toꞌ, wat inoh geh doiꞌ oni-oni-e deꞌ tapod otoꞌ toban-e takal otoꞌ togan dunia itih.

verses.text: But having food and clothing, we will be content with that.
verses.source_translation: Asal-e moꞌ ogiꞌ pinguman duoh pimakai toꞌ inoh moꞌ sukup.

verses.text: But those who are determined to be rich fall into a temptation and a snare and many foolish and harmful lusts, such as drown men in ruin and destruction.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ idip-e jok-e ngan-e yaꞌ jadin kaya lobih-lobih, yoh sonang obuah ngijaꞌ duoh obuah jolat deꞌ masam-masam soꞌ niat-e deꞌ budua duoh deꞌ kanam pijolaꞌ odop-e.   Suaꞌ niat-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ idip-e asul duoh mutuab.

verses.text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some have been led astray from the faith in their greed, and have pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e sikiya bakoꞌ duoh duit moꞌ odaꞌ timul masam-masam oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ nai nyaꞌa.   Bogoꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ sape obuaꞌ togan ajal deꞌ bonal diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ, ngan-e ngajah duit, yoh moꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ deꞌ ngasul otin kila-e.

verses.text: But you, man of God, flee these things, and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, perseverance, and gentleness.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e muꞌu nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ wat inoh, juuaꞌ-juuaꞌ nyeꞌ soꞌ-e.   Odaꞌ leh odop muꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ bonal deꞌ boton Topaꞌ, deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, ngibalaꞌ tipan odop nyeꞌ manusia, taan sabal daang susah jolaꞌ, duoh diꞌ nyeꞌ posual tuduꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: Fight the good fight of faith. Take hold of the eternal life to which you were called, and you confessed the good confession in the sight of many witnesses.
verses.source_translation: Bijuang bonal-bonal saꞌ muꞌu telus bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, saꞌ muꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.   Dop-e saꞌan inoh leh Topaꞌ mogan muꞌu takal muꞌ moꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop muꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ.

verses.text: I command you before God, who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate testified the good confession,
verses.source_translation: Deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ deꞌ ngin asong tuduꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ odaꞌ idip duoh deꞌ sulung jowin Kristus Yesus deꞌ moꞌ tanon oniꞌ deꞌ bonal tuduꞌ Pontius Pilatus, okuꞌ mitiaꞌ itih deꞌ soꞌ muꞌu:

verses.text: that you keep the commandment without spot, blameless, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ;
verses.source_translation: Nunaꞌ leh bonal-bonal-e sibaya deꞌ moꞌ tanon kuꞌ, maꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ supiah nyeꞌ sape nog Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus paliꞌ baꞌuh.

verses.text: which in its own times he will show, who is the blessed and only Ruler, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;
verses.source_translation: Iyoh yaꞌ nog daang masa deꞌ pas deꞌ moꞌ notap odop Topaꞌ.   Iyoh deꞌ nguasa suaꞌ oniꞌ duoh patut nyeꞌ mudi-E, Iyoh Laja susuaꞌ laja, Iyoh Toke susuaꞌ toke .

verses.text: who alone has immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light; whom no man has seen, nor can see: to whom be honor and eternal power. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Jok-e Iyoh sijaꞌ-e Topaꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e ponai kobos, Iyoh idip daang jawaꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa ponai odi sinok-e.   Aluaꞌ doiꞌ nyaꞌa ponai kilin Iyoh duoh diꞌ nyaꞌa tungang kilin-E.   Tuduꞌ Iyoh sijaꞌ-e suaꞌ pudi duoh jok-e Iyoh deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-E nah-nah! Amin.

verses.text: Charge those who are rich in this present world that they not be haughty, nor have their hope set on the uncertainty of riches, but on the living God, who richly provides us with everything to enjoy;
verses.source_translation: Tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya daang dunia itih, maꞌ yaꞌ samuh lawa duoh maꞌ yaꞌ bialap tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e totu kodaꞌ halta.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ halus bialap tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngin suaꞌ oniꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ, deꞌ diꞌ-e obuaꞌ-obuaꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ man pakai-e.

verses.text: that they do good, that they be rich in good works, that they be ready to distribute, willing to share;
verses.source_translation: Tanon tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, bogoꞌ nai pingunai kiloja deꞌ paguh, suka tulung duoh ngin oni sijaꞌ-a deꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold of eternal life.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ nguluk halta deꞌ jadin olan deꞌ paguh saꞌan onu deꞌ yaꞌ nog.   Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, yoh yaꞌ soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah, idip deꞌ sibonal-e.

verses.text: Timothy, guard that which is committed to you, turning away from the empty chatter and oppositions of what is falsely called knowledge;
verses.source_translation: Timotius, jaga bonal-bonal-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ Topaꞌ muꞌu nai-e, tolan juuaꞌ-juuaꞌ-e sina deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e, duoh suaꞌ sina bikalah tentang suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal deꞌ nang nyaꞌa pingajal pak-e idoh.

verses.text: which some profess, and thus have wandered from the faith. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngajal pingajal itih, yohmoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal soꞌ agama deꞌ dioꞌ soꞌ kanoꞌ geh yoh bisayaꞌ daꞌ-a.   Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ bilokat suaꞌ ingan.   Soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus.     TIMOTIUS

chapters.text: Let as many as are bondservants under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor, that the name of God and the doctrine not be blasphemed. Those who have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brothers, but rather let them serve them, because those who partake of the benefit are believing and beloved. Teach and exhort these things. If anyone teaches a different doctrine, and doesn’t consent to sound words, the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness, he is conceited, knowing nothing, but obsessed with arguments, disputes, and word battles, from which come envy, strife, insulting, evil suspicions, constant friction of people of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth, who suppose that godliness is a means of gain. Withdraw yourself from such.  But godliness with contentment is great gain. For we brought nothing into the world, and we certainly can’t carry anything out. But having food and clothing, we will be content with that. But those who are determined to be rich fall into a temptation and a snare and many foolish and harmful lusts, such as drown men in ruin and destruction. For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some have been led astray from the faith in their greed, and have pierced themselves through with many sorrows. But you, man of God, flee these things, and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, perseverance, and gentleness. Fight the good fight of faith. Take hold of the eternal life to which you were called, and you confessed the good confession in the sight of many witnesses. I command you before God, who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate testified the good confession, that you keep the commandment without spot, blameless, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ; which in its own times he will show, who is the blessed and only Ruler, the King of kings, and Lord of lords; who alone has immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light; whom no man has seen, nor can see: to whom be honor and eternal power. Amen. Charge those who are rich in this present world that they not be haughty, nor have their hope set on the uncertainty of riches, but on the living God, who richly provides us with everything to enjoy; that they do good, that they be rich in good works, that they be ready to distribute, willing to share; laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold of eternal life. Timothy, guard that which is committed to you, turning away from the empty chatter and oppositions of what is falsely called knowledge; which some profess, and thus have wandered from the faith. Grace be with you. Amen.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, according to the promise of the life which is in Christ Jesus,
to Timothy, my beloved child: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.source_translation: Sulat itih soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus, rasul Kristus Yesus, deꞌ moꞌ obuah pilih odop Topaꞌ, odaꞌ okuꞌ tukang tanon tentang idip deꞌ moꞌ janyi-E, idip deꞌ soꞌon toꞌ, moꞌ otoꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.   Okuꞌ nulis sulat itih tuduꞌ muꞌu Timotius, deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ, deꞌ ngakuꞌ kuꞌ nyam onak odop kuꞌ.   Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus Topaꞌ otoꞌ ngin bilokat, pilasiꞌ, duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ muꞌu.

verses.text: I thank God, whom I serve as my forefathers did, with a pure conscience. How unceasing is my memory of you in my petitions, night and day
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bisukul tuduꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ layan kuꞌ daang otin kila deꞌ bisig, samah kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ nai sumuk babai kuꞌ noꞌuh-e.   Singonu bait singalom tibilang kuꞌ bidoa okuꞌ silalu natong muꞌu.

verses.text: longing to see you, remembering your tears, that I may be filled with joy;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ natong piꞌin boton muꞌ obuaꞌ timatiag takal otoꞌ bitogan.   Yoh ngan kuꞌ linuꞌ yaꞌ bitapod duoh muꞌu saꞌ otin kuꞌ bonal-bonal sonang.

verses.text: having been reminded of the sincere faith that is in you; which lived first in your grandmother Lois, and your mother Eunice, and, I am persuaded, in you also.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ natong muꞌu bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, samah kodaꞌ sumuk muꞌ Lois duoh sinoꞌ muꞌ Eunike.   Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ nang muꞌu tuang wat inoh geh.

verses.text: For this cause, I remind you that you should stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu paliꞌ kidip baꞌuh oniꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu takal kuꞌ posan tongan kuꞌ tun muꞌu.

verses.text: For God didn’t give us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and self-control.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Iyang deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e Iyang deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ tolu, pak-e Iyang deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ makin togap, ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa duoh taan nijon odop toꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore don’t be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner; but endure hardship for the Good News according to the power of God,
verses.source_translation: Yoh ngan-e maꞌ yaꞌ dasaꞌ magah gah Topaꞌ otoꞌ, duoh maꞌ yaꞌ dasaꞌ ngalun okuꞌ deꞌ obuah jel luban kuꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ.   Pak-e pakai leh kuasa soꞌ odop Topaꞌ, suwaꞌ leh susah jolaꞌ ngan nyeꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh kodaꞌ okuꞌ.

verses.text: who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal,
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ nyilamat duoh mogan otoꞌ saꞌ otoꞌ idip jok-e saꞌan Iyoh.   Iyoh nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ idoh diꞌ-e ningaꞌ soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai otoꞌ, pak-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop Topaꞌ duoh Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh, deꞌ tanon-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ pakai Kristus Yesus takal dunia itih aluaꞌ doiꞌ.

verses.text: but has now been revealed by the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, who abolished death, and brought life and immortality to light through the Good News.
verses.source_translation: Adin Topaꞌ moꞌ bitanga tuduꞌ otoꞌ Otin-E deꞌ paguh inoh, takal Laja Pinyilamat Kristus Yesus nog.   Yoh moꞌ ngasul kuasa deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa kobos, pakai Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh leh Iyoh tanon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: For this, I was appointed as a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ moꞌ pilih okuꞌ odaꞌ jadin rasul-E duoh gulu deꞌ tukang magah Gah deꞌ Paguh.

verses.text: For this cause I also suffer these things. Yet I am not ashamed, for I know him whom I have believed, and I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed to him against that day.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh luban idip kuꞌ jolaꞌ wat itih neh, pak-e okuꞌ diꞌ kuꞌ dasaꞌ, dop-e okuꞌ puꞌan tuduꞌ osi soꞌ kuꞌ naꞌ kila kuꞌ.   Okuꞌ bisayaꞌ Iyoh tapod jaga suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ moꞌ ngin-E tuduꞌ okuꞌ nog takal-E yaꞌ nog baꞌuh.

verses.text: Hold the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Kagian togap-togap-e tuduꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ moꞌ tanon kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu.   Totap bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, ngibalaꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon dop-e otoꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: That good thing which was committed to you, guard through the Holy Spirit who dwells in us.
verses.source_translation: Jaga bonal-bonal-e oniꞌ deꞌ sukup paguh deꞌ moꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ, pakai Iyang-E deꞌ ogiꞌ daang idip otoꞌ.

verses.text: This you know, that all who are in Asia turned away from me; of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu tuang puꞌan geh nang suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ Asia moꞌ diꞌ-e piduli okuꞌ, kodaꞌ Figelus duoh Hermogenes.

verses.text: May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain,
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin pilasiꞌ-E tuduꞌ lawang Onesiforus, dop-e takal okuꞌ daang jel yoh diꞌ-e dasaꞌ odi ningaꞌ okuꞌ.

verses.text: but when he was in Rome, he sought me diligently, and found me
verses.source_translation: Takal yoh nog keꞌ Roma yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ kalik okuꞌ, nog-e bitapod duoh okuꞌ.

verses.text: (the Lord grant to him to find the Lord’s mercy in that day); and in how many things he served at Ephesus, you know very well.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu tuang puꞌan muꞌ geh takal deꞌ Efesus yoh bogoꞌ sidoh-e tulung okuꞌ.   Saꞌ Topaꞌ ngin pilasiꞌ-E tuduꞌ-e takal onu Topaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ nog.

chapters.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, according to the promise of the life which is in Christ Jesus, to Timothy, my beloved child: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord. I thank God, whom I serve as my forefathers did, with a pure conscience. How unceasing is my memory of you in my petitions, night and day longing to see you, remembering your tears, that I may be filled with joy; having been reminded of the sincere faith that is in you; which lived first in your grandmother Lois, and your mother Eunice, and, I am persuaded, in you also. For this cause, I remind you that you should stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands. For God didn’t give us a spirit of fear, but of power, love, and self-control. Therefore don’t be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner; but endure hardship for the Good News according to the power of God, who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal, but has now been revealed by the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, who abolished death, and brought life and immortality to light through the Good News. For this, I was appointed as a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles. For this cause I also suffer these things. Yet I am not ashamed, for I know him whom I have believed, and I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed to him against that day. Hold the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus. That good thing which was committed to you, guard through the Holy Spirit who dwells in us. This you know, that all who are in Asia turned away from me; of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes. May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain, but when he was in Rome, he sought me diligently, and found me (the Lord grant to him to find the Lord’s mercy in that day); and in how many things he served at Ephesus, you know very well.

verses.text: You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Timotius deꞌ ngakuꞌ kuꞌ nyam onak odop kuꞌ, muꞌu halus silalu nogap odop muꞌ dop-e Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ Paguh moꞌ soꞌon toꞌ takal otoꞌ idip niꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ pingajal deꞌ moꞌ ngojit muꞌ soꞌ okuꞌ deꞌ sulung jowin nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ, tanon leh tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon deꞌ tapod muꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ-e duoh deꞌ ponai ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon geh.

verses.text: You therefore must endure hardship, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu halus nunaꞌ suaꞌ susah jolaꞌ dop-e Kristus Yesus samah kodaꞌ sidadu deꞌ taan naan idip susah jolaꞌ.

verses.text: No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of life, that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier.
verses.source_translation: Sidadu deꞌ bitugas, doiꞌ yoh nai kiloja deꞌ bokon, yoh jok-e nai kiloja deꞌ nyonang otin komandan-e.

verses.text: Also, if anyone competes in athletics, he isn’t crowned unless he has competed by the rules.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bilomaꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon juala simoꞌ-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ atulan bilomaꞌ.

verses.text: The farmer who labors must be the first to get a share of the crops.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ dolas kiloja daang umoh, iyoh leh deꞌ dioꞌ man oniꞌ deꞌ soꞌon-e soꞌ kiloja deꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.
verses.source_translation: Timotius, pikil tuluap-tuluap-e suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang kuꞌ itih, Topaꞌ yaꞌ ngin odaꞌ muꞌu ngiloti suaꞌ oniꞌ.

verses.text: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the offspring of David, according to my Good News,
verses.source_translation: Natong nyeꞌ: Gah deꞌ Paguh deꞌ magah kuꞌ inoh iyoh leh Gah tentang Yesus Kristus onak sukun Laja Daud.   Iyoh leh Kristus deꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ idip soꞌ kobos-E.

verses.text: in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God’s word isn’t chained.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e luban kuꞌ magah Gah deꞌ paguh okuꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ, obuah pasung kodaꞌ ulang deꞌ jaꞌat.   Pak-e doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ponai naan Pingunang Topaꞌ yaꞌ obuah magah.

verses.text: Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones’ sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
verses.source_translation: Inoh leh ngan okuꞌ taan naan suaꞌ oni deꞌ munoꞌ, saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ obuah pilih Topaꞌ, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suwaꞌ geh silamat deꞌ soꞌon-e soꞌ Kristus Yesus, yohmoꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ deꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: This saying is trustworthy: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him.
verses.source_translation: Sina itih tok bonal, “Simoꞌ otoꞌ kobos duoh Kristus, otoꞌ tuang idip geh duoh Iyoh.

verses.text: If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ otoꞌ sabal taan naan susah jolaꞌ, otoꞌ tuang suwaꞌ geh militah duoh Iyoh.   Simoꞌ otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ ngakuꞌ nang puꞌan Iyoh, Iyoh tuang idoh geh diꞌ-e ngakuꞌ nang puꞌan otoꞌ.

verses.text: If we are faithless, he remains faithful. For he can’t deny himself.”
verses.source_translation: Bial otoꞌ diꞌ toꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E, pak-e Iyoh totap nai oniꞌ deꞌ nang-E, dop-e Iyoh diꞌ-e bilubah.”

verses.text: Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they don’t argue about words, to no profit, to the subverting of those who hear.
verses.source_translation: Paliꞌ-paliꞌ nyeꞌ tanon-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa bonal-bonal-e deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ, sibaya maꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ bikalah tentang loti bang sina.   Dop-e oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ guna-e, minaꞌ pilusak kila nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit.

verses.text: Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.
verses.source_translation: Nai kiloja muꞌ bonal-bonal-e saꞌ Topaꞌ ngakuꞌ nang muꞌu bitotok nai kiloja saꞌan odop-E.   Maꞌ yaꞌ dasaꞌ, pak-e ngajal leh isin-isin pingajal deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness,
verses.source_translation: Sina deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e duoh sina deꞌ pijaꞌat Topaꞌ tolan juuaꞌ-juuaꞌ-e.   Sina-sina kodaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ minaꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa makin jaꞌat.

verses.text: and those words will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ onam deꞌ odaꞌ gonan nyaꞌa moduaꞌ.   Soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ogiꞌ Himeneus duoh Filetus.

verses.text: men who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ moyap soꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal, duoh ngaso kudu-kudu nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ tanon nang Topaꞌ moꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ kobos paliꞌ idip.

verses.text: However God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”
verses.source_translation: Pak-e puꞌun deꞌ moꞌ kajuag Topaꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa taan guyang-e.   Deꞌ tun-e ogiꞌ deꞌ obuah nulis deꞌ in-e, “Topaꞌ piluh osi sijaꞌ-e deꞌ jadin umat-E”, duoh “Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e umat Topaꞌ, halus diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.”

verses.text: Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor.
verses.source_translation: Daang boli deꞌ ayuh ogiꞌ bipasia-pasia pingian-makup.   Ogiꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ mas, soꞌ pilak, soꞌ koyuh, ogiꞌ geh soꞌ tanaꞌ.   Deꞌ soꞌ mas duoh pilak yoh pakai takal-e biluman ayuh, deꞌ soꞌ koyuh duoh tanaꞌ pakai-e soꞌ-e man bilang konu.

verses.text: If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh otoꞌ simoꞌ otin toꞌ bisig, samah geh kodaꞌ mas duoh pilak deꞌ pakai nyaꞌa daang onu-onu ayuh.   Iyoh moꞌ jadin balang deꞌ biguna deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ, deꞌ odaꞌ-E nai kiloja deꞌ paguh saꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verses.source_translation: Timotius, maꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ kila muꞌ deꞌ mudaꞌ.   Soꞌot negeh idip nunaꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, taat tuduꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal-e duoh ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, idip bidanah samah-samah duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ mogan adon Topaꞌ daang otin deꞌ bisig.

verses.text: But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ yaꞌ suwaꞌ bikalah duoh uluk ulang-ulang budua, deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan oni-oni-e.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ minaꞌ-e nimul kaꞌi-kalah jaꞌ-e.

verses.text: The Lord’s servant must not quarrel, but be gentle towards all, able to teach, patient,
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ nai kiloja saꞌan Topaꞌ diꞌ-e soꞌon bikalah, pak-e iyoh halus paguh tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa, ponai ngajal nyaꞌa, taan kila-e.

verses.text: in gentleness correcting those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth,
verses.source_translation: Yoh mesti sabal ngajal nyaꞌa deꞌ suka bilawan; mudah-mudah Topaꞌ ngin masa tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ odaꞌ paliꞌ keꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, duoh puꞌan ajal deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: and they may recover themselves out of the devil’s snare, having been taken captive by him to his will.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e moꞌ wat inoh, nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ paliꞌ bingoon, duoh lopas soꞌ jolat Laja Muat Munua, deꞌ moꞌ pasung duoh paksa odaꞌ nunaꞌ kila odop Laja Muat Munua.

chapters.text: You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus. The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also. You therefore must endure hardship, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus. No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of life, that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier. Also, if anyone competes in athletics, he isn’t crowned unless he has competed by the rules. The farmer who labors must be the first to get a share of the crops. Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things. Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the offspring of David, according to my Good News, in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God’s word isn’t chained. Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones’ sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory. This saying is trustworthy: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him. If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us. If we are faithless, he remains faithful. For he can’t deny himself.” Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they don’t argue about words, to no profit, to the subverting of those who hear. Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth. But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness, and those words will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus; men who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some. However God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.” Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor. If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work. Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart. But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife. The Lord’s servant must not quarrel, but be gentle towards all, able to teach, patient, in gentleness correcting those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth, and they may recover themselves out of the devil’s snare, having been taken captive by him to his will.

verses.text: But know this, that in the last days, grievous times will come.
verses.source_translation: Natong nyeꞌ: Daang onu-onu piobuaꞌ-e otoꞌ ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ yaꞌ kiꞌan bogoꞌ susah jolaꞌ,

verses.text: For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
verses.source_translation: dop-e manusia jok-e piduli odop-e jaꞌ-e, bakoꞌ duit, samuh duoh suka bilagah odop-e.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suka pijaꞌat nyaꞌa, lawan pingoma-e, diꞌ-e puꞌan bisukul, diꞌ-e pimodo tuduꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: without natural affection, unforgiving, slanderers, without self-control, fierce, not lovers of good,
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e ngibalaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, doliaꞌ-e yaꞌ bidamai, suka pijaꞌat adon nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon, mulah manas, gaus duoh diꞌ-e suka oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: traitors, headstrong, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God;
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ suka nyelah dingan-e tuduꞌ musuh-e, samuh duoh diꞌ-e bipikil omu.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jok-e suka nunaꞌ kila odop-e, diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: holding a form of godliness, but having denied its power. Turn away from these, also.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ nunaꞌ atulan agama-e madas saꞌ nyaꞌa ningaꞌ-e, pak-e sibonal-e yoh diꞌ-e bonal-bonal kalik Topaꞌ.   Maꞌ yaꞌ sinok nyaꞌa deꞌ wat inoh neh.

verses.text: For some of these are people who creep into houses, and take captive gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts,
verses.source_translation: Ogiꞌ soꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ molot keꞌ boli-boli nyaꞌa, yohmoꞌ nipu dayung-dayung deꞌ budua, deꞌ bogoꞌ nai dosa duoh obuah nguasa odaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan-e deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: always learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verses.source_translation: Dayung-dayung deꞌ munoꞌ silalu yaꞌ bilajal, pak-e nyaꞌa ngajal pingajal deꞌ salah tuduꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.   Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ sidoh-e ponai yaꞌ puꞌan oniꞌ deꞌ bonal soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so do these also oppose the truth; men corrupted in mind, who concerning the faith are rejected.
verses.source_translation: Gulu-gulu agama deꞌ palsu deꞌ munoꞌ samah kodaꞌ Yanes duoh Yambres deꞌ lawan Musa.   Pikil odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bonal duoh suka lawan ajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ, yohmoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: But they will proceed no further. For their folly will be evident to all men, as theirs also came to be.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e yaꞌ soꞌon oni-oni-e, dop-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa telang-telang yaꞌ puꞌan nang odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ budua kodaꞌ Yanes duoh Yambres.

verses.text: But you did follow my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, patience, love, steadfastness,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e muꞌu moꞌ nunaꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngajal kuꞌ, muꞌu puꞌan oni wat gaya idip kuꞌ, muꞌu puꞌan oni niat kuꞌ daang idip kuꞌ.   Muꞌu ningaꞌ oni wat okuꞌ bisayaꞌ bonal-bonal tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus, taan kila kuꞌ duoh okuꞌ ngibalaꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.   Muꞌu moꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ wat kuꞌ taan idip takal kuꞌ susah jolaꞌ.

verses.text: persecutions, and sufferings: those things that happened to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. I endured those persecutions. The Lord delivered me out of them all.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu moꞌ ningaꞌ oni wat okuꞌ obuah pijolaꞌ duoh ngoon suaꞌ susah jolaꞌ takal kuꞌ deꞌ kota Antiokhia, deꞌ kota Ikonium, duoh deꞌ kota Listra.   Muꞌu puꞌan suaꞌ susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah kuꞌ, pak-e Topaꞌ nyilamat okuꞌ soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.
