verses.text: Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.
verses.source_translation: Sibonal-e, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus duoh idip nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ, yaꞌ obuah susah jolaꞌ.

verses.text: But evil men and impostors will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ jaꞌat duoh pinipu bitamah jaꞌat.   Yoh nipu nyaꞌa, yoh tuang obuah nipu geh.

verses.text: But you remain in the things which you have learned and have been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e muꞌu Timotius, kagian bonal-bonal-e suaꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ ngajal kuꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu, duoh deꞌ bisayaꞌ muꞌu tuduꞌ-e, dop-e muꞌu tuang puꞌan osi deꞌ ngajal.

verses.text: From infancy, you have known the holy Scriptures which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith, which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.source_translation: Soꞌ isoꞌ muꞌ geh muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan pingunang daang buk Kitab.   Buk Kitab deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu bijak, deꞌ odaꞌ muꞌu puꞌan nang Topaꞌ nyilamat asal nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus Yesus.

verses.text: Every Scripture is God-breathed and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness,
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ pingunang daang buk Kitab nog soꞌ Topaꞌ.   Buk inoh sukup biguna ngan nyeꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, ngan nyeꞌ tanon salah nyaꞌa, ngan nyeꞌ tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ salah odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, duoh ngan nyeꞌ ngajal oni wat idip deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ ogiꞌ buk Kitab inoh, suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ jadin siap ngan-e nai kiloja deꞌ paguh.

chapters.text: But know this, that in the last days, grievous times will come. For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy, without natural affection, unforgiving, slanderers, without self-control, fierce, not lovers of good, traitors, headstrong, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God; holding a form of godliness, but having denied its power. Turn away from these, also. For some of these are people who creep into houses, and take captive gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts, always learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth. Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so do these also oppose the truth; men corrupted in mind, who concerning the faith are rejected. But they will proceed no further. For their folly will be evident to all men, as theirs also came to be. But you did follow my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, patience, love, steadfastness, persecutions, and sufferings: those things that happened to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. I endured those persecutions. The Lord delivered me out of them all. Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution. But evil men and impostors will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived. But you remain in the things which you have learned and have been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them. From infancy, you have known the holy Scriptures which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith, which is in Christ Jesus. Every Scripture is God-breathed and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness, that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work.

verses.text: I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at his appearing and his Kingdom:
verses.source_translation: Kristus Yesus yaꞌ nog lagiꞌ kaang dunia itih ngan-e bilituang duoh manusia deꞌ idip baya manusia deꞌ kobos, Iyoh yaꞌ nog militah jadin Laja, inohleh ngan kuꞌ ulih-ulih tanon deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh Yesus Kristus.

verses.text: preach the word; be urgent in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with all patience and teaching.
verses.source_translation: Magah leh pingunang Topaꞌ siniaꞌ sijaꞌ-e, laꞌan bait idoh bait nyaꞌa ngojit-e, magah negeh.   Tanon salah deꞌ nai-e, ngalah nyaꞌa deꞌ nai salah-e, ngin nasehat tuduꞌ-e daang punuaꞌ sabal, duoh pakai pingajal deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine, but, having itching ears, will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts;
verses.source_translation: Dop-e ogiꞌ onu-e takal nyaꞌa diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ laꞌan ngojit pingajal deꞌ bonal.   Pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ yaꞌ nunaꞌ kila odop-e sadiꞌ-e, yoh moꞌ nguluk gulu-gulu deꞌ odaꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ madas paguh in-e ngojit-e.

verses.text: and will turn away their ears from the truth, and turn away to fables.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ maput kojit-e doliaꞌ ngojit oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e yoh jok-e laꞌan ngojit silita-silita donan.

verses.text: But you be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, and fulfill your ministry.
verses.source_translation: Bial-e wat inoh, muꞌu halus taan nijon odop muꞌ daang suaꞌ oniꞌ, taan naan idip susah jolaꞌ, nai negeh kiloja muꞌ tukang magah Gah deꞌ Paguh duoh nai bonal-bonal-e kiloja jadin kuli Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For I am already being offered, and the time of my departure has come.
verses.source_translation: Adin okuꞌ moꞌ sinok nyuang idip kuꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ kobos jadin kulban saꞌan Topaꞌ, niꞌ tiliaꞌ lagiꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌ buu soꞌ dunia itih.

verses.text: I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ bilomaꞌ nunaꞌ atulan, okuꞌ moꞌ nog galis piobuaꞌ-e.   Okuꞌ taat tuduꞌ Gah deꞌ Paguh nog piobuaꞌ idip kuꞌ.

verses.text: From now on, there is stored up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that day; and not to me only, but also to all those who have loved his appearing.
verses.source_translation: Adin geh moꞌ ogiꞌ hadiah deꞌ saꞌan okuꞌ, deꞌ taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, daang onu deꞌ moꞌ notap odop Topaꞌ hakim deꞌ adil.   Idoh diꞌ-e jok-e okuꞌ sadiꞌ kuꞌ deꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ hadiah inoh, pak-e suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kajon Topaꞌ nog, tuang tilimaꞌ-e geh.

verses.text: Be diligent to come to me soon,
verses.source_translation: Laju nyeꞌ nog tuduꞌ okuꞌ,

verses.text: for Demas left me, having loved this present world, and went to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
verses.source_translation: dop-e Demas moꞌ buu togan okuꞌ, yoh lobih ngibalaꞌ dunia itih, yoh moꞌ odi keꞌ Tesalonika.   Kreskes tuang moꞌ buu geh odi keꞌ Galatia, Titus keꞌ Dalmatia.

verses.text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for service.
verses.source_translation: Jok-e Lukas sijaꞌ-e deꞌ aluaꞌ loꞌo duoh okuꞌ.   Odi ngijaꞌ Markus, nyeꞌ moꞌ toban samah-samah duoh muꞌu dop-e yoh tapod tulung kiloja kuꞌ.

verses.text: But I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
verses.source_translation: Tikhikus moꞌ pait kuꞌ keꞌ Efesus.

verses.text: Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come, and the books, especially the parchments.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ muꞌu odi katiꞌ toban geh jubah kuꞌ deꞌ supiah kuꞌ deꞌ boli Karpus deꞌ Troas.   Toban nyeꞌ geh suaꞌ buk kuꞌ, amot-e buk kuꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa soꞌ kulit binatang.

verses.text: Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his deeds,
verses.source_translation: Aleksander, tukang boba inoh, bogoꞌ nai jaꞌat-e tuduꞌ okuꞌ.   Bogoꞌ kaso kiloja deꞌ nai kuꞌ, pak-e tanah negeh saꞌ Topaꞌ ngukum samah kodaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai-e.

verses.text: of whom you also must beware; for he greatly opposed our words.
verses.source_translation: Maꞌ tauꞌ-tauꞌ tuduꞌ iyoh, dop-e yoh sukup kolas netang kiloja otoꞌ.

verses.text: At my first defense, no one came to help me, but all left me. May it not be held against them.
verses.source_translation: Takal keꞌ niꞌ sidoh okuꞌ bela odop kuꞌ, niꞌ naꞌan tuang doiꞌ geh nyaꞌa deꞌ bela okuꞌ, suaꞌ-e buu togan okuꞌ.   Mudah-mudah Topaꞌ diꞌ-e nyalah oniꞌ deꞌ nai nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ deꞌ wat inoh.

verses.text: But the Lord stood by me, and strengthened me, that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and that all the Gentiles might hear; and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Topaꞌ moꞌ tulung okuꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ bilani magah Gah deꞌ Paguh, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e bangsa Yahudi tapod ngojit-e.   Topaꞌ tuang moꞌ odaꞌ okuꞌ lopas geh soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ponai odaꞌ okuꞌ yaꞌ kobos, kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lopas soꞌ bobaꞌ singa.

verses.text: And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me for his heavenly Kingdom; to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ yaꞌ pilopas okuꞌ soꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ lika kagaꞌ yaꞌ jaꞌat duoh okuꞌ.   Iyoh yaꞌ toban okuꞌ molot keꞌ topat soꞌ Iyoh militah jadin Laja deꞌ siluga.   Tanah saꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa mudi Iyoh nah-nah! Amin.

verses.text: Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus.
verses.source_translation: Salam tuduꞌ Priskila, Akwila, duoh tuduꞌ lawang Onesiforus.

verses.text: Erastus remained at Corinth, but I left Trophimus at Miletus sick.
verses.source_translation: Erastus aluaꞌ loꞌo deꞌ Korintus, Trofimus deꞌ supiah kuꞌ deꞌ Miletus dop-e yoh aluaꞌ monam.

verses.text: Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers.
verses.source_translation: Kagaꞌ leh odop muꞌ odi katiꞌ takal aluaꞌ diꞌ-e musim modud.   Salam soꞌ Ebulus, soꞌ Pudes, soꞌ Linus, soꞌ Klaudia, duoh soꞌ suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ.

verses.text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Saꞌ Topaꞌ tulung muꞌu, Sa Topaꞌ bilokat suaꞌ madih ayua deꞌ moꞌ bisayaꞌ! Salam soꞌ okuꞌ Paulus.       TITUS

chapters.text: I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at his appearing and his Kingdom: preach the word; be urgent in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with all patience and teaching. For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine, but, having itching ears, will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts; and will turn away their ears from the truth, and turn away to fables. But you be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, and fulfill your ministry. For I am already being offered, and the time of my departure has come. I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith. From now on, there is stored up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that day; and not to me only, but also to all those who have loved his appearing. Be diligent to come to me soon, for Demas left me, having loved this present world, and went to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia. Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for service. But I sent Tychicus to Ephesus. Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come, and the books, especially the parchments. Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his deeds, of whom you also must beware; for he greatly opposed our words. At my first defense, no one came to help me, but all left me. May it not be held against them. But the Lord stood by me, and strengthened me, that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and that all the Gentiles might hear; and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion. And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me for his heavenly Kingdom; to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen. Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus. Erastus remained at Corinth, but I left Trophimus at Miletus sick. Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers. The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.

verses.text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s chosen ones, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,
verses.source_translation: Sulat itih soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus, nyaꞌa deꞌ jadin kuli Topaꞌ duoh rasul Yesus Kristus.   Okuꞌ obuah pilih duoh obuah pait odaꞌ tulung nyaꞌa deꞌ moꞌ pilih Topaꞌ sa'-a bitamah bisayaꞌ duoh puꞌan pingajal deꞌ bonal deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa idip nunaꞌ oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: in hope of eternal life, which God, who can’t lie, promised before time began;
verses.source_translation: Pingajal inoh moꞌ bitotok duoh oniꞌ deꞌ alap otoꞌ, nang otoꞌ yaꞌ tilimaꞌ idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah.   Idip inoh moꞌ obuah janyi odaꞌ Topaꞌ, takal dunia aluaꞌ diꞌ-e obuah nai.   Topaꞌ diꞌ-e pibulaꞌ.

verses.text: but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior;
verses.source_translation: Takal onu deꞌ moꞌ notu-E, Topaꞌ Pinyilamat otoꞌ moꞌ tanon janyi-E inoh pakai Gah deꞌ Paguh.   Iyoh moꞌ pilih okuꞌ odaꞌ magah Gah deꞌ Paguh inoh, nunaꞌ pilitah Topaꞌ.

verses.text: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ nulis sulat itih tuduꞌ muꞌu Titus deꞌ ngakuꞌ kuꞌ nyam onak odop kuꞌ, dop-e muꞌu duoh Okuꞌ samah-samah moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus.   Okuꞌ bidoa Topaꞌ Samaꞌ duoh Kristus Yesus, Tukang Pinyilamat otoꞌ, ngin bilokat duoh idip bidanah tuduꞌ muꞌu.

verses.text: I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking, and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you;
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ moꞌ supiah muꞌu deꞌ pulou Kreta saꞌ muꞌu tapod ngulus oniꞌ deꞌ aluaꞌ pilelu nyaꞌa yaꞌ odaꞌ tiatul, duoh deꞌ tibilang kota, muꞌu pakat pimipin-pimipin uluk ulang bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ tanon kuꞌ itih tuduꞌ muꞌu:

verses.text: if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior.
verses.source_translation: Pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ halus leh nyaꞌa deꞌ tongon idip-e, sowon-e jok-e niꞌ, onak opot-e halus moꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, idoh diꞌ-e onak deꞌ sobot nyaꞌa nang onak deꞌ bilawan duoh diꞌ-e bonal.

verses.text: For the overseer must be blameless, as God’s steward; not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain;
verses.source_translation: Pimipin uluk ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ iyohleh nyaꞌa deꞌ ngulus pingunai kiloja Topaꞌ.   Inoh leh ngan-e iyoh halus nyaꞌa deꞌ tongon idip-e, diꞌ-e samuh, diꞌ-e pimalah, diꞌ-e pimabuk, diꞌ-e suka bikaꞌi, diꞌ-e pinganguak.

verses.text: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled;
verses.source_translation: Iyoh suka tilimaꞌ nyaꞌa ngilumon deꞌ boli-e, suka nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh, bijak daang idip-e, diꞌ-e ngilipiꞌ, bisig otin-e, duoh taan nijon odop-e.

verses.text: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict those who contradict him.
verses.source_translation: Iyoh halus bikagong togap tuduꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal, kodaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ mokuaꞌ iyoh bilajal-e soꞌ koꞌih, saꞌ iyoh ponai ngin nasehat pakai pingajal deꞌ bonal duoh dapod tanon salah nyaꞌa deꞌ lawan pingajal deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
verses.source_translation: Dop-e moꞌ bogoꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ idip-e diꞌ-e tiatul, amot-e ulang Yahudi deꞌ bikagong deꞌ atulan bisunat, odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ mogo nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon pakai pingunang-e deꞌ adoh-adoh deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e.

verses.text: whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for dishonest gain’s sake.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ halus nyeꞌ odaꞌ loꞌo diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ sina, dop-e pingajal deꞌ nang-e bogoꞌ kaso idip lomin boli nyaꞌa.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ munoꞌ ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e bonal deꞌ wat inoh, madas ngan-e yaꞌ soꞌon duit deꞌ diꞌ-e patut.

verses.text: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.”
verses.source_translation: Nabi odop ulang Kreta ogiꞌ sidoh-e nang in-e, “Nyaꞌa soꞌ pulou Kreta suka pibulaꞌ, samah kodaꞌ binatang deꞌ suka man dingan-e, lakaꞌ jolua, malas-masal.   ”

verses.text: This testimony is true. For this cause, reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ tanon-e inoh bonal.   Noh leh ngan muꞌu halus ulih-ulih ngalah-e, saꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ pingajal deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e wat inoh odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ silita donan ulang Yahudi duoh atulan-atulan deꞌ nai manusia deꞌ doliaꞌ-e tilimaꞌ ajal deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
verses.source_translation: Saꞌan nyaꞌa deꞌ bisig otin-e, suaꞌ oniꞌ bisig.   Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ koꞌis otin-e deꞌ diꞌ-e bisayaꞌ, doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ bisig, dop-e bait akal-e, otin osuap-e, suaꞌ-e moꞌ koꞌis geh.

verses.text: They profess that they know God, but by their deeds they deny him, being abominable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work.
verses.source_translation: Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e puꞌan Topaꞌ, pak-e pingunai kiloja-e bonal-bonal samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e puꞌan Topaꞌ.   Topaꞌ sisiꞌ ningaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ doliaꞌ-e nunaꞌ pingunang Topaꞌ duoh diꞌ-e taan nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.

chapters.text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s chosen ones, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness, in hope of eternal life, which God, who can’t lie, promised before time began; but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior; to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior. I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking, and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you; if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior. For the overseer must be blameless, as God’s steward; not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain; but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled; holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict those who contradict him. For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision, whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for dishonest gain’s sake. One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.” This testimony is true. For this cause, reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith, not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth. To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled. They profess that they know God, but by their deeds they deny him, being abominable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work.

verses.text: But say the things which fit sound doctrine,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e muꞌu, Titus, ngajal negeh oniꞌ deꞌ bonal.

verses.text: that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance:
verses.source_translation: Tanon tuduꞌ dali-dali deꞌ nyoma, saꞌ-e: taan nijon odop-e, pimodo nyaꞌa daꞌ-a, idip-e bijak, totap bisayaꞌ deꞌ ajal deꞌ bonal, ngibalaꞌ susuaꞌ nyaꞌa, tungang naꞌan idip deꞌ susah jolaꞌ.

verses.text: and that older women likewise be reverent in behavior, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good;
verses.source_translation: Wat noh geh tuduꞌ dayung-dayung deꞌ nyoma, muꞌu tanon tuduꞌ-e, saꞌ-e: idip nunaꞌ wat deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ.   Diꞌ-e soꞌon ngituang sobot nyaꞌa, diꞌ soꞌon nuak nog-e mabuk, pak-e yoh halus ngajal oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: that they may train the young wives to love their husbands, to love their children,
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ-e watnoh, yoh dapod ngajal dayung-dayung deꞌ mudaꞌ, saꞌ-e ngibalaꞌ bonon-e duoh onak opot-e.

verses.text: to be sober minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that God’s word may not be blasphemed.
verses.source_translation: Idip dayung-dayung deꞌ mudaꞌ halus: bijak idip-e, bisig otin-e, lajin ngatul lomin boli-e, paguh akal-e, duoh tunuak tuduꞌ bonon-e, saꞌ-e doiꞌ tiyaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nguyat pingunang deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Likewise, exhort the younger men to be sober minded;
verses.source_translation: Watnoh geh duoh dali deꞌ mudaꞌ nyeꞌ ngajal tuduꞌ-e saꞌ-e bijak idip-e.

verses.text: in all things showing yourself an example of good works; in your teaching showing integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility,
verses.source_translation: Daang suaꞌ oniꞌ, muꞌu, Titus, halus jadin soto nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.   Moꞌ muꞌu ngajal, muꞌu halus pakai otin deꞌ paguh duoh bonal-bonal.

verses.text: and soundness of speech that can’t be condemned; that he who opposes you may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us.
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ muꞌu ngajal pakai leh sina deꞌ bonal duoh sina deꞌ diꞌ nyaꞌa ponai nyalah-e, saꞌ musuh-musuh muꞌ dasaꞌ, dop-e moꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ ponai pijaꞌat otoꞌ.

verses.text: Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing in all things; not contradicting;
verses.source_translation: Kuli-kuli halus tunuak tuduꞌ toke-e, daang suaꞌ oniꞌ yoh nyonang otin toke-e.   Iyoh diꞌ soꞌon bisawot duoh sina deꞌ nang toke-e,

verses.text: not stealing, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God, our Savior, in all things.
verses.source_translation: maꞌ noku, pak-e odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ halus bitanga nang odop-e nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh duoh dapod toke-e bisayaꞌ daꞌ-a, saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon ningaꞌ odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ, yohmoꞌ mudi nang tok paguh pingajal Topaꞌ, Pinyilamat otoꞌ.

verses.text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men,
verses.source_translation: Moꞌ telang-telang tonga otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh deꞌ nyilamat suaꞌ manusia.

verses.text: instructing us to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we would live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present age;
verses.source_translation: Otin Topaꞌ deꞌ paguh tulung saꞌ otoꞌ posan pingunai deꞌ jaꞌat duoh diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ idip nunaꞌ asong odop toꞌ deꞌ lawan oni deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ.   Daang dunia deꞌ adin, Topaꞌ ngajal saꞌ otoꞌ taan nijon odop toꞌ, idip bonal duoh idip deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ.

verses.text: looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ;
verses.source_translation: Otoꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ simadi otoꞌ kajon onu deꞌ sukup doon-e deꞌ alap-alap otoꞌ inoh: Takal onu inoh nog, suaꞌ nyaꞌa yaꞌ ningaꞌ jawaꞌ telang Yesus Kristus, Iyoh leh Topaꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh kuasa-E duoh Pinyilamat otoꞌ.

verses.text: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works.
verses.source_translation: Yesus Kristus inoh deꞌ moꞌ nyelah odop-E ngan-e odaꞌ otoꞌ lopas soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.   Iyoh odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ bisig soꞌ dosa duoh lajin nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise you.
verses.source_translation: Titus, suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ halus muꞌu ngajal tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit pingunang muꞌ.   Ngin nasehat duoh ngalah leh nyaꞌa pakai kuasa deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ tuduꞌ muꞌu deꞌ jadin pimipin.   Maꞌ tanah nyaꞌa yaꞌ adoh-adoh in-e duoh muꞌu.

chapters.text: But say the things which fit sound doctrine, that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance: and that older women likewise be reverent in behavior, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good; that they may train the young wives to love their husbands, to love their children, to be sober minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that God’s word may not be blasphemed. Likewise, exhort the younger men to be sober minded; in all things showing yourself an example of good works; in your teaching showing integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility, and soundness of speech that can’t be condemned; that he who opposes you may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us. Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing in all things; not contradicting; not stealing, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God, our Savior, in all things. For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men, instructing us to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we would live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present age; looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ; who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works. Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise you.

verses.text: Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,
verses.source_translation: Titus, muꞌu halus tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ saꞌ-e diꞌ-e komut tunuak tuduꞌ pilitah duoh pimipin-pimipin deꞌ ogiꞌ kuasa-e, silalu nunaꞌ atulan pilitah duoh siap nai oniꞌ deꞌ paguh.

verses.text: to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all humility toward all men.
verses.source_translation: Tanon tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ maꞌ pijaꞌat nyaꞌa, maꞌ bikaꞌi, pak-e iyoh silalu paguh duoh pimodo tuduꞌ suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e noꞌuh-e idip otoꞌ tuang budua, diꞌ-e taat tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal, nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop-e, idip deꞌ punuaꞌ odaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, siniaꞌ, suka buꞌui tipan odop-e.

verses.text: But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,
verses.source_translation: Pak-e Topaꞌ Pinyilamat otoꞌ moꞌ ngibalaꞌ duoh bitanga paguh-E tuduꞌ otoꞌ.

verses.text: not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,
verses.source_translation: Iyoh nyilamat otoꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e luban otoꞌ moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal, pak-e luban Iyoh masiꞌ tuduꞌ otoꞌ.   Iyoh nyilamat otoꞌ pakai Iyang Topaꞌ deꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ bisig soꞌ dosa duoh odaꞌ idip otoꞌ jadin baꞌuh, samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ tuang-e obuah milaꞌ.

verses.text: whom he poured out on us richly, through Jesus Christ our Savior;
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ pimuun Iyang-E sipunuaꞌ-e saꞌan otoꞌ, pakai Yesus Kristus, Pinyilamat otoꞌ,

verses.text: that being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ paguh otin-e duoh otoꞌ, inohleh ngan Iyoh moꞌ tanon nang otoꞌ bonal.   Otoꞌ ponai soꞌon idip duoh Topaꞌ nah-nah kodaꞌ deꞌ alap otoꞌ.

verses.text: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;
verses.source_translation: Pingunang itih tok-tok bonal.   Okuꞌ alap odaꞌ muꞌu paliꞌ-paliꞌ tanon hal itih saꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ bonal-bonal nai kiloja deꞌ paguh dop-e inoh leh deꞌ paguh duoh deꞌ biguna saꞌan suaꞌ nyaꞌa.

verses.text: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e maꞌ suka nunaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bidu bikalah oniꞌ deꞌ doiꞌ guna-e, silita asal usul onak sukun-e, bikaꞌi bikalah soal atulan agama.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ doiꞌ guna-e duoh doiꞌ utung-e.

verses.text: Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning,
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ odaꞌ uluk nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ bipisah-pisah, muꞌu halus ngalah-e.   Asal muꞌu moꞌ ngalah nog duwoh sidoh-e, pak-e yoh doliaꞌ-e ngojit muꞌu, maꞌ tiyaꞌ bidingan duoh-e.

verses.text: knowing that such a one is perverted and sins, being self-condemned.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu moꞌ puꞌan nang nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh moꞌ moyap soꞌ olan deꞌ bonal duoh moꞌ bidosa.   Dosa-dosa deꞌ nai-e yaꞌ ngukum odop-e.

verses.text: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.
verses.source_translation: Okuꞌ yaꞌ odaꞌ Artemas keh Tikhikus keh odi tuduꞌ muꞌu, asal yoh moꞌ nog tuduꞌ muꞌu, likas-likas nyeꞌ nog tuduꞌ okuꞌ deꞌ Nikopolis dop-e okuꞌ ogiꞌ niat kuꞌ yaꞌ loꞌo danoꞌ silamaꞌ musim modud.

verses.text: Send Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them.
verses.source_translation: Muꞌu halus bonal-bonal tulung Zenas, nyaꞌa deꞌ bogoꞌ puꞌan tentang ukum, duoh tulung geh Apolos.   Sidia suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu-e daang pimonu-e.

verses.text: Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.
verses.source_translation: Tanah saꞌ otoꞌ ulang-ulang deꞌ bisayaꞌ bilajal geh nai kiloja deꞌ paguh, saꞌ-e tapod nyukup oniꞌ deꞌ pilelu nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon daang idip-e, saꞌ idip otoꞌ biguna.

verses.text: All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ deꞌ ogiꞌ samah-samah duoh okuꞌ pait salam tuduꞌ muꞌu.   Tanon geh salam soꞌ koꞌih tuduꞌ dingan-dingan otoꞌ deꞌ bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus.   Okuꞌ bidoa saꞌ Topaꞌ bilokat suaꞌ ingan.   Soꞌ okuꞌ, Paulus.     SULAT YAKOBUS

chapters.text: Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work, to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all humility toward all men. For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another. But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared, not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit, whom he poured out on us richly, through Jesus Christ our Savior; that being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life. This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men; but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain. Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning, knowing that such a one is perverted and sins, being self-condemned. When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there. Send Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them. Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful. All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.

verses.text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.
verses.source_translation: Salam soꞌ okuꞌ Yakobus, kuli Topaꞌ duoh kuli Topaꞌ Yesus Kristus, tuduꞌ suaꞌ ulang Kristen deꞌ loꞌo jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ saluh-saluh deꞌ pulou-pulou deꞌ ogiꞌ daang dunia itih.

verses.text: Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations,
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua kuꞌ, ingan halus ngoon doon jaꞌ-e takal ingan obuah masam-masam pingisuba,

verses.text: knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.
verses.source_translation: dop-e ingan moꞌ ngoon takal bisayaꞌ ingan obuah suba, ingan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ taan naan susah jolaꞌ deꞌ obuah ingan.

verses.text: Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.
verses.source_translation: Ingan yaꞌ jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ makin taan naan susah jolaꞌ, saꞌ idip ingan jadin samah kodaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan Topaꞌ duoh diꞌ ingan kulang oni-oni-e deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ.

verses.text: But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach; and it will be given to him.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ deꞌ soꞌ ingan deꞌ diꞌ-e sikiya bijak ponai, mitiaꞌ negeh tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, dop-e Topaꞌ laꞌan-e ngin bijak ponai.   Iyoh diꞌ-e tukud ngan-e yaꞌ ngin-e duoh doiꞌ sidoh-e malah deꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ-E.

verses.text: But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed.
verses.source_translation: Takal ingan mitiaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, ingan halus bonal-bonal bisayaꞌ, maꞌ muta-muta.   Dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ muta-muta, iyoh samah kodaꞌ gilumang laut deꞌ kusuak sobak katiꞌ-kanih.

verses.text: For that man shouldn’t think that he will receive anything from the Lord.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ kodaꞌ inoh, maꞌ alap yoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ oni-oni soꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways.
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ bisokap otin-e diꞌ-e bidanah idip-e.

verses.text: But let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position;
verses.source_translation: Ulang Kristen deꞌ botak halus ngoon munuas, dop-e Topaꞌ moꞌ pakat iyoh odaꞌ bigatung.

verses.text: and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away.
verses.source_translation: Wat noh geh ulang Kristen deꞌ kaya halus ngoon doon, simoꞌ Topaꞌ pidouꞌ iyoh, dop-e ulang kaya yaꞌ musuap kodaꞌ suwat duh.

verses.text: For the sun arises with the scorching wind, and withers the grass, and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes. So also will the rich man fade away in his pursuits.
verses.source_translation: Takal boton onu moꞌ tumuꞌ, onu moꞌ putiak, duh inoh moꞌ kolong, suwat-e moꞌ luluh, sangon-e moꞌ doiꞌ.   Wat inoh geh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya; iyoh yaꞌ kobos takal-e nai kiloja-e ngan-e odaꞌ odop-e kaya.

verses.text: Blessed is the man who endures temptation, for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord promised to those who love him.
verses.source_translation: Topaꞌ yaꞌ bilokat nyaꞌa deꞌ taan nijon odop-e takal-e obuah pingisuba.   Dop-e moꞌ yoh monang lawan pingisuba inoh, iyoh yaꞌ tilimaꞌ upah-e idip deꞌ moꞌ janyi Topaꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God can’t be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one.
verses.source_translation: Takal nyaꞌa obuah mujok odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, maꞌ yaꞌ nang Topaꞌ deꞌ mujok iyoh.   Dop-e odop Topaꞌ diꞌ-e tapod obuah mujok odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, duoh Iyoh doiꞌ onu-e mujok nyaꞌa odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust, and enticed.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e niat deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa obuah mujok odaꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat, dop-e niat-e deꞌ jaꞌat inoh nalik duoh nguasa odop-e.

verses.text: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin; and the sin, when it is full grown, produces death.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ nyaꞌa nunaꞌ niat-e deꞌ jaꞌat, iyoh moꞌ yaꞌ nai dosa.   Takal dosa inoh moꞌ nguasa idip-e, iyoh yaꞌ kobos duoh lopas soꞌ Topaꞌ nah-nah.

verses.text: Don’t be deceived, my beloved brothers.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ, maꞌ yaꞌ obuah nipu.

verses.text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom can be no variation, nor turning shadow.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ ngin Topaꞌ inoh paguh duoh doiꞌ deꞌ kulang.   Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ paguh inoh otoꞌ soꞌon soꞌ Topaꞌ Samaꞌ deꞌ siluga, deꞌ moꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jawaꞌ deꞌ longit.   Iyoh doiꞌ sidoh-e bilubah, idoh diꞌ-e kodaꞌ sibamia deꞌ telus jaꞌ-e bilubah.

verses.text: Of his own will he gave birth to us by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures.
verses.source_translation: Nunaꞌ deꞌ laꞌan odop Topaꞌ, Iyoh moꞌ odaꞌ otoꞌ jadin onak-onak-E pakai gah deꞌ bonal, saꞌ otoꞌ jadin deꞌ paling penting-e soꞌ suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nai Topaꞌ.

verses.text: So, then, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger;
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ, ogiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ halus ingan puꞌan-e, osi sijaꞌ-a halus ngojit bonal-bonal.   Maꞌ dioꞌ sina takal aluaꞌ diꞌ nyeꞌ bipikil.   Maꞌ yaꞌ likas malah,

verses.text: for the anger of man doesn’t produce the righteousness of God.
verses.source_translation: dop-e nyaꞌa deꞌ malah, diꞌ-e tapod nai oniꞌ deꞌ nyonang otin Topaꞌ.

verses.text: Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls.
verses.source_translation: Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, tolan negeh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat duoh suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ salah daang idip ingan.   Nyeꞌ moꞌ pidouꞌ otin nyeꞌ duoh tilimaꞌ pingajal deꞌ soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ puluah-e daang otin ingan.   Ajal inoh tapod nyilamat ingan.

verses.text: But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves.
verses.source_translation: Nai leh oni deꞌ moꞌ tanon Topaꞌ, maꞌ jok nyeꞌ ngojit-e, dop-e moꞌ nyam jok ingan ngojit-e, ingan mogo odop ingan.

verses.text: For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror;
verses.source_translation: Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngojit Pingunang Topaꞌ pak-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ-a, iyoh samah kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ningaꞌ jowin-e deꞌ silomin.

verses.text: for he sees himself, and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was.
verses.source_translation: Takal-e mokuaꞌ ningaꞌ jowin-e deꞌ silomin, yoh moꞌ buu, yoh moꞌ lasuꞌ komut mun jowin-e.

verses.text: But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom, and continues, not being a hearer who forgets, but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ bilajal duoh bonal-bonal nunaꞌ oni deꞌ tanon Ukum Topaꞌ, idoh diꞌ-e jok-e ngojit-e yohmoꞌ komut-e, Topaꞌ yaꞌ bilokat iyoh dop-e iyoh moꞌ nai suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ munoꞌ.   Ukum Topaꞌ inoh doiꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ kulang daꞌ-e duoh ogiꞌ kuasa-e deꞌ odaꞌ manusia lopas soꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn’t bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man’s religion is worthless.
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ nang odop-e taat simayang, pak-e diꞌ-e jaga oniꞌ deꞌ nang-e, iyoh mogo odop-e.   Simayang-e doiꞌ guna-e.

verses.text: Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world.
verses.source_translation: Simayang deꞌ sibonal-e duoh deꞌ doiꞌ salah-e deꞌ sulung jowin Topaꞌ iyoh leh kodaꞌ: Tulung onak tumang patu duoh janda-janda deꞌ susah, duoh jaga odop-e saꞌ-e diꞌ-e nunaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ jaꞌat deꞌ laꞌan dunia.

chapters.text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings. Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations, knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance. Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing. But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach; and it will be given to him. But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed. For that man shouldn’t think that he will receive anything from the Lord. He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways. But let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position; and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away. For the sun arises with the scorching wind, and withers the grass, and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes. So also will the rich man fade away in his pursuits. Blessed is the man who endures temptation, for when he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord promised to those who love him. Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God can’t be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one. But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust, and enticed. Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin; and the sin, when it is full grown, produces death. Don’t be deceived, my beloved brothers. Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom can be no variation, nor turning shadow. Of his own will he gave birth to us by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures. So, then, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger; for the anger of man doesn’t produce the righteousness of God. Therefore, putting away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness, receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls. But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves. For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror; for he sees himself, and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was. But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom, and continues, not being a hearer who forgets, but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does. If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn’t bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man’s religion is worthless. Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world.

verses.text: My brothers, don’t hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with partiality.
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua kuꞌ, ngan ingan jadin nyaꞌa bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Yesus Kristus, Topaꞌ otoꞌ deꞌ sukup ayuh kuasa-E, idoh diꞌ jok nyeꞌ paguh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya jaꞌ-a.

verses.text: For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue, and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in;
verses.source_translation: Nyam basa ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya pakai sisin mas duoh pimakai deꞌ sangon, nog takal ingan tikuluk simayang.   Yohmoꞌ takal inoh geh ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak nog, pakai pimakai deꞌ totak lolak,

verses.text: and you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing, and say, “Sit here in a good place”; and you tell the poor man, “Stand there,” or “Sit by my footstool”;
verses.source_translation: ingan moꞌ lobih pimodo tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ paguh pimakai-e inoh, ingan moꞌ sina tuduꞌ-e “Guluꞌ deꞌ klosi deꞌ paguh itih.   ” Pak-e duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ botak inoh, ingan sina tuduꞌ-e, “Mujuag negeh danih” atou “Guluꞌ sinok tubon poꞌon kuꞌ.   ”

verses.text: haven’t you shown partiality among yourselves, and become judges with evil thoughts?
verses.source_translation: Oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan inoh moꞌ pilih-pilih nyaꞌa.   Ingan moꞌ nilai nyaꞌa nunaꞌ pikil ingan deꞌ jaꞌat.

verses.text: Listen, my beloved brothers. Didn’t God choose those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith, and heirs of the Kingdom which he promised to those who love him?
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua deꞌ ngibalaꞌ kuꞌ! Topaꞌ pilih nyaꞌa deꞌ nang nyaꞌa botak daang dunia itih odaꞌ jadin ulang deꞌ kaya daang bisayaꞌ-e.   Odop-e deꞌ munoꞌ jadin umat Topaꞌ deꞌ tilimaꞌ bilokat-bilokat soꞌ Topaꞌ deꞌ moꞌ janyi-E tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngibalaꞌ-E.

verses.text: But you have dishonored the poor man. Don’t the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts?
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ingan moꞌ pidasaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ botak, tiap deꞌ sibonal-e nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya deꞌ adoh-adoh wat-e duoh ingan yohmoꞌ odaꞌ ingan obuah toban keꞌ sulung jowin pingadel ngan-e yaꞌ ngadel ingan.

verses.text: Don’t they blaspheme the honorable name by which you are called?
verses.source_translation: Ulang kaya deꞌ mutiꞌ leh deꞌ suka nguyat adon Yesus Kristus deꞌ mudi toꞌ.   Yesus Kristus inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ ingan jadin nyaꞌa deꞌ kakuꞌ Topaꞌ.

verses.text: However, if you fulfill the royal law, according to the Scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you do well.
verses.source_translation: Ingan moꞌ nai oniꞌ deꞌ bonal simoꞌ ingan moꞌ nai nunaꞌ atulan deꞌ paling penting-e deꞌ ogiꞌ daang buk Kitab deꞌ in-e, “Ngibalaꞌ leh siodop muꞌ manusia, samah kodaꞌ muꞌu ngibalaꞌ odop muꞌ.   ”

verses.text: But if you show partiality, you commit sin, being convicted by the law as transgressors.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e simoꞌ ingan jok ingan paguh duoh nyaꞌa deꞌ kaya, ingan moꞌ nai dosa.   Atulan Topaꞌ moꞌ tanon nang ingan moꞌ lawan hukum.

verses.text: For whoever keeps the whole law, and yet stumbles in one point, he has become guilty of all.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e simoꞌ nyaꞌa moꞌ nunaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ, pak-e yoh ngilangal niꞌ atulan Topaꞌ, inoh loti-e samah geh duoh yoh ngilangal suaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ.

verses.text: For he who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not commit murder.” Now if you do not commit adultery, but murder, you have become a transgressor of the law.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ deꞌ sina nang, “Maꞌ yaꞌ biamai,” Iyoh geh deꞌ nang, “Maꞌ yaꞌ ngabos nyaꞌa.   ” Ngan-e moꞌ wat inoh, moꞌ nyam diꞌ ingan biamai, pak-e ingan ngabos nyaꞌa, ingan tuang moꞌ ngilangal atulan geh.

verses.text: So speak, and so do, as men who are to be judged by a law of freedom.
verses.source_translation: Suaꞌ oniꞌ deꞌ nang ingan duoh oniꞌ deꞌ nai ingan halus nunaꞌ atulan Topaꞌ, dop-e otoꞌ yaꞌ obuah nguji odaꞌ Topaꞌ pakai atulan inoh.   Atulan inoh leh deꞌ odaꞌ nyaꞌa lopas soꞌ dosa.

verses.text: For judgment is without mercy to him who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment.
verses.source_translation: Dop-e Topaꞌ diꞌ-e yaꞌ ngin pilasiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ diꞌ-e ngin pilasiꞌ tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bokon.   Nyaꞌa deꞌ ngin pilasiꞌ-e diꞌ-e tolu nang odop-e yaꞌ obuah ngukum.

verses.text: What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him?
verses.source_translation: Madih ayua! Doiꞌ guna-e moꞌ nyam-e ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ ngakuꞌ nang odop-e bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Kristus, pak-e diꞌ-e nai pingunai deꞌ paguh.   Bisayaꞌ deꞌ wat inoh, diꞌ-e ponai odaꞌ yoh silamat.

verses.text: And if a brother or sister is naked and in lack of daily food,
verses.source_translation: Simoꞌ-e ogiꞌ madih nyeꞌ deꞌ samah-samah bisayaꞌ tuduꞌ Topaꞌ, bait deꞌ dali, bait deꞌ dayung, deꞌ pilelu pimakai duoh doiꞌ pinguman-e tibilang konu,

verses.text: and one of you tells them, “Go in peace, be warmed and filled”; and yet you didn’t give them the things the body needs, what good is it?
verses.source_translation: yohmoꞌ ogiꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ sina nang, “Buu negeh toban kila deꞌ sonang, Topaꞌ ngin bilokat tuduꞌ muꞌu, saꞌ muꞌ dapod man nog muꞌ busuah duoh dapod pakai pimakai deꞌ odaꞌ gonan muꞌ diꞌ-e tiyaꞌ modud.   ” Pak-e nyaꞌa deꞌ sina in inoh tiꞌ-e diꞌ-e ngin oni-oni-e tuduꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ pilelu man pakai inoh.   Suaꞌ sina deꞌ nang-e inoh doiꞌ guna-e.

verses.text: Even so faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself.
verses.source_translation: Wat inoh geh moꞌ nyam nyaꞌa nang odop-e bisayaꞌ, pak-e pingunai-e diꞌ-e kodaꞌ nyaꞌa deꞌ bisayaꞌ, bisayaꞌ deꞌ wat inoh doiꞌ guna-e.

verses.text: Yes, a man will say, “You have faith, and I have works.” Show me your faith without works, and I by my works will show you my faith.
verses.source_translation: Pak-e ogiꞌ konik-e nyaꞌa deꞌ nang: “Bisayaꞌ ogiꞌ deꞌ muꞌu, pingunai deꞌ paguh ogiꞌ deꞌ okuꞌ.   ” Yoh ngan kuꞌ yaꞌ nyawot in tih: “Bitanga tuduꞌ okuꞌ kodaꞌ oni bisayaꞌ muꞌ deꞌ diꞌ-e pakai pingunai deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai muꞌ, okuꞌ yaꞌ bitanga bisayaꞌ kuꞌ deꞌ tonga soꞌ pingunai deꞌ paguh deꞌ nai kuꞌ.   ”

verses.text: You believe that God is one. You do well. The demons also believe, and shudder.
verses.source_translation: Ingan bisayaꞌ nang Topaꞌ jok-e niꞌ, paguh leh! Pak-e gamut-gamut tuang bisayaꞌ geh duoh kimotol tolu.

verses.text: But do you want to know, vain man, that faith apart from works is dead?
verses.source_translation: Ingan manusia deꞌ budua-pilayua, aluaꞌ keh diꞌ ingan ngiloti-e? Bisayaꞌ pak-e diꞌ nyeꞌ nai pingunai deꞌ paguh, doiꞌ loti-e bisayaꞌ deꞌ wat inoh!

verses.text: Wasn’t Abraham our father justified by works, in that he offered up Isaac his son on the altar?
You see that faith worked with his works, and by works faith was perfected;
and the Scripture was fulfilled which says, “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him as righteousness”; and he was called the friend of God.
You see then that by works, a man is justified, and not only by faith.
In the same way, wasn’t Rahab the prostitute also justified by works, in that she received the messengers, and sent them out another way?
For as the body apart from the spirit is dead, even so faith apart from works is dead.

chapters.text: My brothers, don’t hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with partiality. For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue, and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in; and you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing, and say, “Sit here in a good place”; and you tell the poor man, “Stand there,” or “Sit by my footstool”; haven’t you shown partiality among yourselves, and become judges with evil thoughts? Listen, my beloved brothers. Didn’t God choose those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith, and heirs of the Kingdom which he promised to those who love him? But you have dishonored the poor man. Don’t the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts? Don’t they blaspheme the honorable name by which you are called? However, if you fulfill the royal law, according to the Scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you do well. But if you show partiality, you commit sin, being convicted by the law as transgressors. For whoever keeps the whole law, and yet stumbles in one point, he has become guilty of all. For he who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not commit murder.” Now if you do not commit adultery, but murder, you have become a transgressor of the law. So speak, and so do, as men who are to be judged by a law of freedom. For judgment is without mercy to him who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment. What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him? And if a brother or sister is naked and in lack of daily food, and one of you tells them, “Go in peace, be warmed and filled”; and yet you didn’t give them the things the body needs, what good is it? Even so faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself. Yes, a man will say, “You have faith, and I have works.” Show me your faith without works, and I by my works will show you my faith. You believe that God is one. You do well. The demons also believe, and shudder. But do you want to know, vain man, that faith apart from works is dead? Wasn’t Abraham our father justified by works, in that he offered up Isaac his son on the altar? You see that faith worked with his works, and by works faith was perfected; and the Scripture was fulfilled which says, “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him as righteousness”; and he was called the friend of God. You see then that by works, a man is justified, and not only by faith. In the same way, wasn’t Rahab the prostitute also justified by works, in that she received the messengers, and sent them out another way? For as the body apart from the spirit is dead, even so faith apart from works is dead.

verses.text: Let not many of you be teachers, my brothers, knowing that we will receive heavier judgment.
For in many things we all stumble. If anyone doesn’t stumble in word, the same is a perfect man, able to bridle the whole body also.
Indeed, we put bits into the horses’ mouths so that they may obey us, and we guide their whole body.
Behold, the ships also, though they are so big and are driven by fierce winds, are yet guided by a very small rudder, wherever the pilot desires.
So the tongue is also a little member, and boasts great things. See how a small fire can spread to a large forest!
And the tongue is a fire. The world of iniquity among our members is the tongue, which defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the course of nature, and is set on fire by Gehenna.
For every kind of animal, bird, creeping thing, and sea creature, is tamed, and has been tamed by mankind;
but nobody can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison.
With it we bless our God and Father, and with it we curse men, who are made in the image of God.
Out of the same mouth comes blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so.
Does a spring send out from the same opening fresh and bitter water?
Can a fig tree, my brothers, yield olives, or a vine figs? Thus no spring yields both salt water and fresh water.
Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show by his good conduct that his deeds are done in gentleness of wisdom.
But if you have bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your heart, don’t boast and don’t lie against the truth.
This wisdom is not that which comes down from above, but is earthly, sensual, and demonic.
For where jealousy and selfish ambition are, there is confusion and every evil deed.
But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceful, gentle, reasonable, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
Now the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.

chapters.text: Let not many of you be teachers, my brothers, knowing that we will receive heavier judgment. For in many things we all stumble. If anyone doesn’t stumble in word, the same is a perfect man, able to bridle the whole body also. Indeed, we put bits into the horses’ mouths so that they may obey us, and we guide their whole body. Behold, the ships also, though they are so big and are driven by fierce winds, are yet guided by a very small rudder, wherever the pilot desires. So the tongue is also a little member, and boasts great things. See how a small fire can spread to a large forest! And the tongue is a fire. The world of iniquity among our members is the tongue, which defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the course of nature, and is set on fire by Gehenna. For every kind of animal, bird, creeping thing, and sea creature, is tamed, and has been tamed by mankind; but nobody can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison. With it we bless our God and Father, and with it we curse men, who are made in the image of God. Out of the same mouth comes blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so. Does a spring send out from the same opening fresh and bitter water? Can a fig tree, my brothers, yield olives, or a vine figs? Thus no spring yields both salt water and fresh water. Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show by his good conduct that his deeds are done in gentleness of wisdom. But if you have bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your heart, don’t boast and don’t lie against the truth. But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceful, gentle, reasonable, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy. Now the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.

verses.text: Where do wars and fightings among you come from? Don’t they come from your pleasures that war in your members?
You lust, and don’t have. You murder and covet, and can’t obtain. You fight and make war. You don’t have, because you don’t ask.
You ask, and don’t receive, because you ask with wrong motives, so that you may spend it on your pleasures.
You adulterers and adulteresses, don’t you know that friendship with the world is hostility toward God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, “The Spirit who lives in us yearns jealously”?
But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.”
Be subject therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double-minded.
Lament, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to gloom.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you.

Don’t speak against one another, brothers. He who speaks against a brother and judges his brother, speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge.
Only one is the lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. But who are you to judge another?
Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow let’s go into this city, and spend a year there, trade, and make a profit.”
Whereas you don’t know what your life will be like tomorrow. For what is your life? For you are a vapor, that appears for a little time, and then vanishes away.
For you ought to say, “If the Lord wills, we will both live, and do this or that.”
But now you glory in your boasting. All such boasting is evil.
To him therefore who knows to do good, and doesn’t do it, to him it is sin.

chapters.text: Where do wars and fightings among you come from? Don’t they come from your pleasures that war in your members? You lust, and don’t have. You murder and covet, and can’t obtain. You fight and make war. You don’t have, because you don’t ask. You ask, and don’t receive, because you ask with wrong motives, so that you may spend it on your pleasures. You adulterers and adulteresses, don’t you know that friendship with the world is hostility toward God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God. Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, “The Spirit who lives in us yearns jealously”? But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.” Be subject therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you. Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double-minded. Lament, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to gloom. Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you. Don’t speak against one another, brothers. He who speaks against a brother and judges his brother, speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge. Only one is the lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. But who are you to judge another? Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow let’s go into this city, and spend a year there, trade, and make a profit.” Whereas you don’t know what your life will be like tomorrow. For what is your life? For you are a vapor, that appears for a little time, and then vanishes away. For you ought to say, “If the Lord wills, we will both live, and do this or that.” But now you glory in your boasting. All such boasting is evil. To him therefore who knows to do good, and doesn’t do it, to him it is sin.

verses.text: Come now, you rich, weep and howl for your miseries that are coming on you.
Your riches are corrupted and your garments are moth-eaten.
Your gold and your silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be for a testimony against you, and will eat your flesh like fire. You have laid up your treasure in the last days.
Behold, the wages of the laborers who mowed your fields, which you have kept back by fraud, cry out, and the cries of those who reaped have entered into the ears of the Lord of Armies.
You have lived in luxury on the earth, and taken your pleasure. You have nourished your hearts as in a day of slaughter.
You have condemned, you have murdered the righteous one. He doesn’t resist you.
Be patient therefore, brothers, until the coming of the Lord. Behold, the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, being patient over it, until it receives the early and late rain.
You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord is at hand.
Don’t grumble, brothers, against one another, so that you won’t be judged. Behold, the judge stands at the door.
Take, brothers, for an example of suffering and of perseverance, the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord.
Behold, we call them blessed who endured. You have heard of the perseverance of Job, and have seen the Lord in the outcome, and how the Lord is full of compassion and mercy.
But above all things, my brothers, don’t swear— not by heaven, or by the earth, or by any other oath; but let your “yes” be “yes”, and your “no”, “no”; so that you don’t fall into hypocrisy.
Is any among you suffering? Let him pray. Is any cheerful? Let him sing praises.
Is any among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord,
and the prayer of faith will heal him who is sick, and the Lord will raise him up. If he has committed sins, he will be forgiven.
Confess your offenses to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The insistent prayer of a righteous person is powerfully effective.
Elijah was a man with a nature like ours, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain, and it didn’t rain on the earth for three years and six months.
He prayed again, and the sky gave rain, and the earth produced its fruit.
Brothers, if any among you wanders from the truth and someone turns him back,
let him know that he who turns a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and will cover a multitude of sins.
